Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver.
A receives 5 shekels of silver on fC’s orders from B, slave of D.
 
A = Nabû-aha-iddin/Ilu-aqaba; B = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of D; fC = fEsagila/Marduk-aha-iddin; D = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 30902

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver. Payment of a debt. Return of the debtnote
A receives (eṭēru) the 4 minas of silver that B owes him, and the interest, according to what they agreed. He should return the promissory note pertaining to this debt to B (našû-nadānu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Kalbāya/Ahu-bani; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 30712

Paraphrase:
Receipt. Purchase price.
A receives 10 shekels of silver from B1, B2 and B3 for the boat that he sold to them. This is in addition to the 10 shekels of silver that he already received from them.
 
A = Bēl-ahhē-eriba//Rēmūtu; B1 = Bānûnu//Ṣillāya; B2 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B3 =Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Dayyān-Marduk
Title: BM 30457

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver.
C owes 1 ½ minas of silver to A and pledged two of his slaves (E1 and E2) to secure repayment. In the present document A receives the silver on D’s orders from B. The promissory note (u'iltu) recording the debt has been given back, and a copy is with D. Witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-šumu-ukin/Nādin
 
A = Nabû-šumu-ukin/Nādin; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Nabû-tultabši-līšir/Bēl-zēru-ibni//Nappāhu; D = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; E1 = Ša-pî-kalbi; E2 = Bēl-pitnanni

Receipt of silver and barley by a slave of the Egibi family. Partial payment of a debt.
A, slave of D, receives (mahāru) 1/2 mina of silver from B1 and fB2, his mother, part of a larger debt (u'iltu) of 35 kor of dates and a broken amount of marked silver that is due from them. A also (u) receives (mahāru) 3.2.3 kor of barley from them, a claim (rašûtu) that he held against C, father of B1 and husband of B2. Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of D; B1=Nergal-uballiṭ/Bēl-iddin; fB2= fQunnabi/Ahhē-iddin, wife of C; C=Bēl-iddin; D=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 67413

Paraphrase:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver and barley. Repayment according to the measure of the head of the Egibi family.
B should pay the 1/2 mina of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, and the 38 kor of barley which are due from him, to A. Payment should be at the river (ina muhhi nāri) in Til-Gula, in one instalment and according to C’s measure, but it is not specified when it should take place. The place of delivery is further specified at the very end of the obverse, before the list of witnesses: at the lower embankment (ina šapliš kāri). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-bēlšunu/Arad-Marduk//Šangû-Ea; B=Nabû-ittannu/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Nūr-Papsukkal; C=Marduk-nāṣir-apli (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 30838

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver from the head of the Egibi family.
A receives (eṭēru) 2 minas of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, from B. It is the remainder (rīhtu) of probably 4 minas 10 shekels of silver (1+x minas x shekels.) that belongs to (mala ša) C and his brothers? and “which they gave to B for 2 1/2 minas of silver” (ša ana B ana 2 1/2 mana kaspu iddinu). Granted that this refers to the brothers’ sale of a slave to B a year ago for 4 minas and 10 shekels (BM30927), we may surmise that the sale was meant to raise the cash needed to pay the sellers’ creditor (A). Accordingly, B was told by the sellers to pay directly to A, which de facto happens in three installments: a payment of 1/2 mina in BM77848, the current payment of 2 minas, and the remainder of 1 1/2 minas in Abraham2004001. The current payment covers the capital sum (rašûtu) and its interest (hubullu). Upon receipt of the silver A promptly hands over (ki utirri!* ... ittadin [târu D-nadānu]) the promissory note (u'iltu) for the 2 1/2 minas of silver to B. He already (elat) handed over the register (giṭṭu) regarding the 1 1/2 minas of silver to B (Abraham2004001). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

*L. 11: <u>-tir!(ŠAH)-ri?!(BU).

A=Nabû-šumu-ukin/Bēl-ēṭir/Šangû-Nanāya!; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Bēl-nādin-apli/...
Title: Mnb 1870

Paraphrase:
Exchange? of boats.
The document opens by referring to two boats: a boat with a width of 6 cubīts at its beam (šaburru), which has run aground? (ṭu-bu-ú [ṭabû D]) at the bank (nabalkattu), and a boat with a width of 6 1/2 cubīts at its beam, which is part of a (pontoon-) bridge (gišru). It continues by referring to a third boat, as follows: - which/of -, one boat (ša ištēt eleppu) with a width of 5 cubīts at its beam, which belongs to A. The document then states: with each "other have exchang (itti ahāmeš šupēlû)", thus referring to the exchange of the first two boats with the third one, although it is not entirely clear who is meant by "they" (probably A and B). The document concludes by stating that B assumes warranty for the uškûtu of the run aground? boat and the boat of the (pontoon)-bridge. Names of 5 witnesses. The scribe is Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi).

A=Kāṣiru/Ipria//Marduk-abušu; B=Bēl-upahhir/Bāba-ēreš//Mudammiq-Adad
Title: BM 32873

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver by a member of the Egibi family. Payment for rikis qabli.
A receives (mahāru) 1 mina of white silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, from B, paid for rikis qabli since (ultu) the 24th year. A has not yet received payment for the debt (u'iltu) of what remains (rēhu) to be paid for the rikis qabli of the 23rd year, a claim (rašûtu) still held by A against B. There exists a previous tablet (giṭṭu) regarding the rikis qabli for the 23rd year, viz. for 1 mina of silver. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe

A=Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Nabû-zēru-ibni/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 31528

Paraphrase:
Receipt of dates and silver by a royal official from the head of the Egibi family. By order of the Governor of Babylon.
A, a courtier (ša rēš šarri), receives (mahāru) 15 kor of dates from B. He acts by order of (ina qibi) C, Governor of Babylon (šākin ṭēmi). He also (adi) receives the register (giṭṭu) on 2/3 minas of silver […] of which 1/8 is alloy, which is in the hands (ina qāt) of D. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Bēl-ušallim/Ina-Nabû-ultarrah, (ša rēš šarri); B=Šišku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Gūzānu,(šākin ṭēmi of Babylon); D=Iqūpu/Nādinu//Gahul-Marduk
Title: BM 31036

Paraphrase:
List of quantities of silver and personal names. Reference to a City Governor and persons known from texts in the Egibi archive.
x+1 minas of white silver from A of the house of the Babylonian(s) (ša bīt mār bābili)
2 minas of white silver from B and C at the Upper New Canal (nāru eššu elû)
2 minas of white silver from D in Šabīlu.
1 1/2 minas of white silver from E.
x+1/2 minas of white silver: F from G in Šabīlu.
x minas 5 shekels of white silver: H [...].[...]
[...] shekels of white silver [(which ...) as proxy for (našpartu) the Governor (šākin ṭēmi), J, the Governor's servant (ardu), in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) K and L.

A=Bēl-iddin; B=Nabû-ittannu; C=Libluṭ; D=Aplaya; E=Marduk//Pahāru; F=Nidinti-Bēl-damqat; 
G=Hašdaya; H=Nidinti-Bēl-damqat; I=Zababa-šumu-iddin; J=Arad-Bunene; K=Napištu; L=Bānûnu
Title: BM 30651

Paraphrase:
Receipt of barley for rations from the head of the Egibi family. By order of the Governor of Babylon.
A, a slave of C, Governor of Babylon (šākin ṭēmi), receives (mahāru) 3 kor of barley, by order of (ina qibi) his master, from B. It is the barley which has been given (nadānu, G Stat.) for the rations (kurummatu) of the boatmen (mallāhu) who are on the boat loaded with beer that will sail (alāku) to Dur-Kurigalzu*. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.
*Wr. Dūr-galzu.

A=Nidinti-Bēl-damqat, slave of C; B=Šiški/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Ina-Esagil-lilbur, (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon)
Title: BM 30256

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver, purchase price for onions.
B1 and B2, slave of C owe 25 shekels of silver, of which 1/8 is alloy to A1, A2 and A3, the price for onions, to be paid in Nisan (I). The debtors assume warranty for each other. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-mukīn-apli/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Egibi (A3)

A1 = Nabû-ahhē-šullim/Iqīšāya//Itinnu; A2 = Bēl-iddin/Šamaš-apla-uṣur//Egibi; A3 = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Egibi;  B1 = Bēl-iddin/Balāssu//Suhāya; B2 = Ṣilli-Bēl, slave of Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 31211

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for onions. Payment for harbor costs.
B owes 5500 strings (gidlu) of onions to A, the royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri), to be delivered in Dûzu (IV) in Babylon. The onions are "of the royal harbor" (ša kāri ša šarri), meaning that they are part of a onion transport by boat and the costs related to such transports. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-aplu-iddin/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Šangû-Ninurta.

A = Gimillu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Sîn-šadûnu, royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri); B = Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Tabnēa
Title: BM 31037

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 11 1/2 shekels of silver to A, to be paid without interest in Simān (III). In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for 3 old and empty barrels. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-aplu-iddin/Zēria//Bēl-aplu-uṣur.
This tablet is probably a retroact. 

A = Šāpik-zēri/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Nādin-še'im; B = Nabû-tultabši-līšir/Bēl-zēru-ibni//Nappāhu
Title: BM 30960

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley and silver with interest.
B owes 133;2.0.0 kor of barley and 9 1/2 shekels of silver to A, to be delivered in Addar (XII). For a year now ("since Ayyār [II] of Nabonidus 7th year") this barley debt has been bearing interest (in silver) (uṭṭata u hubulla inamdin). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Mušēzib-Marduk/Marduk-ēṭir//Nappāhu.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Tallāya/Rahiannu
Title: BM 30310

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver, purchase price for land.
B owes 1 mina of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy, to A, to be paid without interest in Arahsamna (VIII). It is what remains to be paid (rīhtu) of the purchase price for arable land (zēru). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-nāṣir-apli//Egibi (debtor).

A = Nabû-ēṭir/Līšir//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 31271

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley and wheat. Impost and fixed rent.
B owes x.1.4 kor of barley, 1.2.3 kor of emmer wheat and 0.0.5 kor of barley wheat, to be delivered in Ayyār (II) at the New Canal. Delivery should be in one installment according to the creditor's measure. The agricultural products are A's half-share (ahi zittu) in the estimated income from imposts (imittu) on a field (eqlu) at the New Canal that he owes in common with his brothers (C and D). In addition (elat), there are still to be delivered a broken amount of bundles (makṣaru) of straw (tibnu) and the fixed rent (sūtu) in barley. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi.

A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Gimil-Šamaš/Līšir//Šamaš-bari; C = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; D = Nergal-ušēzib/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 30798

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver and onions. Voidance of another debt.
B owes x minas and 5 shekels of silver and x + 13000 bundles of onions to A, the slave of C. The  promissory note about 4 minas of silver that B owes to A's master (C) that may turn up in the latter's house has been annulled. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Marduk-zēru-ibni//Ibni-Adad.

A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of Iddin-Marduk(/Iqīšāya)//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nergalahu-iddin/Ahhea; C = Iddin-Marduk(/Iqīšāya)//Nūr-Sîn
Title: Rm 689

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley.
B owes 0;3.2.0 kor of barley to A, to be delivered in its full mount (gamru) in Ayyār (II). He does not have to pay interest. Delivery is due in Alu-ša-Ah-iddin. This debt comes in addition (elat) to a previous one to the same creditor (rašûtu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Ahūtu/Rahianni
Title: MNB 1137

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver and onions. Fragmentary.
B owes 22 shekels of silver and 5000 bundles of onions to A1 and A2. The rest of the tablet is broken off. The first part of the witnesses' name is broken off. Names of one witness and the scribe: Nergal-šumu-ibni/Bēl-iddin//Sagdidi.

A1 = Kāṣiru/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; A2 = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Širiktu/Nūrea//Dannea
Title: BM 31650

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. To be paid in onions.
B owes 2 shekels of silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be paid in onion bundels (pītu) in Nisan (I) according to their market value (etēqu) at the time of delivery. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Iqīšāya/Bēl-kāṣir//Šangû-parakki
Title: BM 33910

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Interest at default.
B owes 1 mina of white, medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be paid without interest in Arahsamna (VIII). He will start paying the yearly 20% interest on a monthly basis, if he fails to meet the deadline. Witnesses.

A = Bēl-ittannu/Iqīša-Marduk//Bēl-eṭēru; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 30784

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley.
B owes 40 kor of barley to A, to be delivered in Ayyār (II) at a place the details of which are lost in the broken passage at the beginning of the document. It was probably at a canal. The debtor should also pay for the transportation of the barley (from the canal?) to the (creditor's?) house. Witnesses.

A = Iqīša/PN2/Mudammiq-Adad; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 31504

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 50 kor of dates, assessed field rent (imitti eqli) on land located at (ina muhhi) the Hazuzu ditch (harru). The land is part of the dowry (bīt nudunnê) of fA1 and fA2 and shared by them (zittu) with A3 and his brothers (i.e., the women's brothers). The dates should be delivered in one payment according to the 36 liters measure to the courtyard (haṣāru). Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, (and) [a broken amount of] darīku-container(s). Witnesses.
 
fA1 = fIna-Esagil-bēlet(Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); fA2 = fNanāya-eṭerat (Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); A3 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-iddin/Kīnāya
Title: BM 31513

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 1 mina of silver to A to be delivered in Ayyār (II). The (indebted) silver is what C invested in a business partnership (with the parties mentioned above). The rest of the document is broken off, including the names of the witnesses and the scribe. 
 
A = Bēl-īpuš/Rāšil//Nappāhu; B = Bān-...; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 31418

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 1 ½ shekels of silver to A, to be delivered without interest (qaqqadu) in Ulūl (VI). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nergal-mukīn-apli/Kīnāya//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 31258

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 16.0.0.0 (kor) of barley to A, to be delivered in Simān (III) to Uruk. It concerns C's investment in the business partnersip. In addition, there is claim (u'iltu) by D (against B). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe (=debtor): Bēl-šarra-uṣur/Balāṭu.
 
A = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Bēl-šarra-uṣur/Balāṭu; C = Iddin-Marduk(/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn); D = Amēl-Nanāya
Title: BM 31260

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates from prebendary income
B owes 20 kor of dates [broken off] to A, to be delivered from (ina) the prebendary income (maššartu) of the months Tašrīt (VII) and ṭebēt (X). In addition, there is a debt owed by B's parents, - fC1, [his?] mother and [the name is broken off], his father [broken off] -, to the same creditor and still pending. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Šāpik-zēri//Ṣāhit-ginê; fC1 = fKabtāya, mother of B; C2 = [the name is broken off], father of B.
Title: BM 30710

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 2 minas and 50 shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A. The rest of the document is broken off except for the short remark on the upper edge that the  (indebted) silver is what C invested in a business partnership (with A and B) (kaspu ša harrāni ša C). Apart from the names of 3 ina uzuzzi witnesses, no place or scribe are mentioned.  
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Līšir/Etel-pî//Bēl-napšāti; C = Bunene-ibni
Title: BM 31422

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 1 mina of silver that A1 and A2 invested in a business partnership. He should put it at A1’s disposal (pāni dagālu) in agreement with the amount (akî kaspi) that he is entitled to (rašû) from the company’s assets (ina muhhi harrāni). A1 and A2 assume warranty for the amount of silver that is at B’s disposal (ina pāni). Scribe: Bēl-ušallim /Zēria//Nabāya
 
A1 = Iddin-Marduk; A2 = Širiktu; B = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti
Bibliography: Reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 14; Schiff 1987, no. 13; Lanz 1976, 169
Title: BM 31016

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver and sesame, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 2 shekels of silver and 0.0.1.3 (kor) of sesame to A, to be delivered by the end of Tašrīt (VII). The (indebted) silver is what C invested in the business partnership. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ušallim/Zēria//Nabāya.
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia; B = Nabû-rēmanni/šumu-iddin//Buraqu; C = Iddin-Marduk
Title: BM 31100

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 29 kor of dates to A and his brothers, the assessed revenue (imittu) (from land) at the Zabunu-ditch, next to C’s (plot of land). He should deliver the dates in one instalment to the courtyard (haṣāru) at the Zabunu-ditch. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give a load of spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû) from green dates (uhinnu), (and) fibers (mangaga), 2 darīku-containers, and 20 loads of firewood. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu) nor for the services of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu). Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = brother of A1; B = Nabû-iddin/ Kīnāya; C = Mušēzib-Marduk
Title: BM 30862

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver and garments. Fixation of interest at default. Very fragmentary
The first line of the document is broken off and the remainder of the text is very fragmentarily preserved. B owes 2 1/3 minas and 2 shekels of silver, one širiam-garment (širiam) "of 3 minas", and one coat (gulēnu) to A. He should deliver the silver and garments in Tašrīt (VII), and (if not) start paying 20% interest on a monthly basis from the 1st of Arahsamna (VIII) of Darius’ 11th year onwards. In addition, there is an […] Dadia […]. Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Dadia/[PN]
Title: BM 31357

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent, to be delivered in dates.
B owes 14 kor of dates, the assessed field rent (imitti eqli) on land located at the Hazuzu-ditch which belongs to C's children from the Egibi family: part of it belongs to the dowry (nudunnû) of fA1 and fA2, and another part to the inheritance shares (pūt zitti) of A3 and his brothers. The dates should be delivered in one instalment according to the 36 liters measure (pānu-measure) to the courtyard (haṣāru). Deliver is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give a load of spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangagu), and 2 darīku-containers. This is followed by the laconic statement: 60 loads (60-šu biltu) Witnesses.
 
fA1 = fIna-Esagil-bēlet(/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi), sister of A3; fA2 = fNanāya-ēṭirat(/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi), sister of A3; A3=  Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-iddin/Kīnāya; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 30538

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley.
B owes 0.1.3.0 kor of barley to A, to be delivered in Tašrīt (VII). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Napištu/Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Nagāru
Title: BM 30481

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley without interest. Fragmentary.
B owes 200(?) kor of barley to A, to be delivered without interest (qaqqadu) in Ayyār (II) at the canal in Babylon. The delivery should be in one installment according to the creditor’s measure. The document mentions the name of god Šamaš but at this point it is broken off. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Anu-ahu-uṣur/Hiṭua
Title: BM 30633

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Fixation of interest.
B owes ½ minas and 2 shekels of silver and 10 kor of sesame to A. He should deliver the sesame in Tašrīt (VII) and pay each month 20% interest on the silver. Witnesses.
 
 A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Mīnû-Bēl-dānu/Bēl-tabni-uṣur//Egibi
Title: BM 41424

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates. Payment for a debt in two instalments.
B owes 240 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in two instalments: the first instalment of 100 kor should be delivered in Addar (XII), while the second one of the remaining 140 kor should be delivered without interest in Tašrīt (VII) of the 7th year. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Iddin-Nabû/Mušēzib-Bēl
Title: BM 30460

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for onions.
B1 and B2 owe 6000 bundles of onions to A, the royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri), to be delivered in Babylon. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Nikkāya.

A = Gimillu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Sîn-šadûnu, royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri); B1 = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Marduk-zēru-ibni//Nappāhu; B2 = Nabû-iddin/Kabtia//Adad-šumu-...
Title: Liverpool unknown 21 (Strassmaier 1885)

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver.
A receives 2 shekels of silver from B. Names of 2 witnesses (introduced by ina ušuzzi). No name of the scribe.
 
A = Nergal-ušallim/Šamaš-zēra-ušabši; B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya(//Nūr-Sîn)
Title: Mnb 1830

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver within the framework of a business partnership.
Concerns the promissory note for 9 1/3 minas of silver of of medium-quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, that are due to C1, C2, C3 and C4 and in which it is provided as follows: "it is the silver that A invested in a business partnership (harrānu) with B, and hence due from the latter (ina muhhi)”. In the present document, the above-mentioned four persons receive part of this silver, namely 4 2/3 minas from B, without interest.
 
A = Bēl-iddin; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C1 = Nidintu; C2 = Iddin-Bēl; C3 = Iqūpu; C4 = Bēl-ahu-iddin
Title: BM 41436

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley.
A, on C’s orders, receives 3;2.0 kor (c. 612 l) of barley from B, which were due from C. Witnesses
 
A = Nabû-šu…/Kalbāya; B= Širku (wr. mŠìr-ku)/Iddināya//Egibi (= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Iddin-Nabû/Šarru-duri
Title: BM 33152

Paraphrase:
Receipt for assessed field rent, delivered in dates.
Concerns dates, the assessed field rent (imittu) from E’s hanšu-fields in Dūru-ša-karrabbi which D issued against B (e’ēlu). A, as proxy for C (našpartu), receives (maḫāru) the dates from B. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nummuru//Aškāpu; B = Nidintu-Bēl/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Kidin-Sîn; C = Iddin-Bēl/ ...//Ea-ibni; D = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; E = Itti-māku-Bēl/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//Miṣirāya
Title: BM 31527

Paraphrase:
Receipt of payment for interest, paid in silver.
C’s wife (fA1) and a slave (A2) receive 15 shekels of silver of which 5 shekels is of medium-quality from B. It is part of the interest on the silver that was due to them. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA1 =fIna-Esagila-ramât/Zēria//Nabāya, wife of C; A2 = Nabû-ayyalu, slave of C; B = Sūqāya/Šulāya//Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 31301

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver. House rent.
Concerns the payment of rent for C’s house located at the entrance tot the Mār-bīti-temple.  A receives 7 shekels of white silver of which one eighth is alloy and 1 shekel of medium quality silver by the landlord’s order from(!) B. It is rent for the period from Addar (XII) of Darius‘ 16th year (till now). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ubār/Ina-tēšê-eṭir//Ša-nāšīšu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-šumu-ukin//Haṭṭi-ēreš; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 31116

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver. Payment of the purchase price for a house from a deposito.
Concerns 1 1/2 mina of silver, not including a purse (that contains) 11 minas and 18 shekels of silver as price for a house belonging to A. The purse had been entrusted to B1 who died before A had taken out the silver from the deposito. This document has been written to aknowledge that A now received the 1 1/2 minas of silver from B2 (B1‘s son) and also took the purse away from him. He acted with C’s consent, whom we understand to be the original buyer’s son (see TCL 12, 120). The background to this document is the sale of a house by A (seller)  to D (buyer), who had deposited the purchase price with B1. After the death of buyer and depositee, their sons settle the transfer of the silver to the seller. Witnesses.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušēzib-Bēl//Ile‘‘i-Marduk; B1 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B2 = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi, B1‘s son; C = Marduk-balāssu-iqbi/Bēl-ahhē-iddin; D = Bēl-aḫḫē-iddin(/Marduk-zēru-ibni//Egibi), father of C
Title: BM 30890

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver.
Concerns the 10 minas of medium-quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, that B owes to A. The creditor receives them from the debtor.
 
A = Rēmut-Bēl/Šumu-iddin//...; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 30674

Paraphrase:
Receipt for assessed field rent, delivered in dates. Partial payment.
Concerns 1 kor (c. 180 l) of dates, part of the assessed field rent (imittu) for Darius’ 17th year. A, slave of C, receives (maḫāru) the dates as proxy for his master (našpartu), from B. This does not include something the details of which are lost in the broken passage at the end of the document. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Rībâta, slave of C; B = Nabû-nāṣir/Nādin//Bābūtu; C = Širik (wr. mŠi-rik)/Iddināya//Egibi (= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Title: BM 30445

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver from the head of the Egibi family. Undertaking to pay remainder upon return from Elam. By order of the Governor of Babylon.
A gave (iddin [nadānu]) by order of (ina qibi) C, Governor of Babylon (šākin ṭēmi), something to B for 1/2 mina of white silver from Nisan (I) of the xth (=broken) year of Darius till the end of Addar of the 24th year. It remains unclear what A gave to B because the relevant passage is broken. From this (ina libbi), A receives (mahāru) 10 shekels of white silver from B and the remainder (rēhu) of 1/3 mina of silver B shall pay (nadānu) to A in Babylon upon his return from Elam. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nidintu/Ardia; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Ina-Esagil-lilbur/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ša-nāšīšu, (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon)
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 30720

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver paid on behalf of the head of the Egibi family. Partial payment of a debt.
A receives (mahāru) 4 minas of white, medium quality silver from B, paid on behalf of (ana muhhi) C. It is part (ina libbi) of a larger debt (u'iltu) of 6 2/3 minas and 1 shekel of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, that C owes to A. Names of 5 witnesses and scribe.

A=Nabû-bān-ahi/Marduk-nāṣir//Adad-šammê; B=Marduk-bēlšunu/Arad-Marduk//Šangû-Ea; C=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 30309

Paraphrase:
Allotment of a share in profits. The Egibi brothers are among the shareholders.
Two brothers from the Egibi family (B1 and B2) bought the right to collect the income in onions from the šibšu-impost (šibšu ša šūmi) for the 10th and 11th years of Darius that is the prerogative (lit. “property”, makkūru) of the temple of Bēl. They paid 42 1/2 minas of marked silver for this right to A, who is the king’s governor (bēl pihāti) in the Esagil temple (of Bēl) and responsible for the bow-land (qaštu) of D. The onions are in Šahrīnu and at the disposal (ina pāni) of B2 and his brother's agricultural workers (errēšu). It is agreed that the Egibi brothers and a third person (C) will share in the profits from this deal. At this point the tablet breaks off. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Šaddinnu/Madān-ahhē-iddin//Šigûa; B1=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B2=Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C=Marduk-nāṣir/Marduk-ušallim; D=Bēl-iddin
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 30721

Paraphrase:
Receipt of wool by a weaver of Lugal-Marada who acts as proxy for a chief temple administrator.
A, the weaver (ušparu) of D!, acting as proxy for (ina našpartu) C, the bishof (šatammu) of the E'igikalama temple, receives (mahāru) 3 talents of first-rate (babbanû) wool from B. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nabû-ittannu/Tabnēa, (ušparu of D); B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Nergal-ina-tēšê!-ēṭir, (šatammu of the E'igikalama temple); D=Lugal-Marada
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 30683
BM 33962

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver by the head of the Egibi family. Partial repayment of a debt.
A receives (mahāru) 1/2 mina of white silver from the debt (u'iltu) of 50 shekels of white silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, that B owes to A. He receives it from the debtor. The transaction took place under the auspices (ina mahar) of C, a judge (dayyānu). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Nabû-kuzub-ilī/Bēl-rēmanni//Eppeš-ilī; C=Habaṣīru//Eppeš-ilī, (dayyānu)
Title: BM 32858

Paraphrase:
Receipt of an ilku-payment by the head of the Egibi family.
A receives payment (mahāru) from B1 for his entire ilku-tax from Nisan (I) of the 25th year of Darius till the end of Addar (XII) of the 26th year, and for half (mišlu) of the ilku-tax of B2. The amounts received are not specified. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-nāšir-apli/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B1=Murānu/Marduk-nāṣir//Ah-bāni; B2=PN?/Nuhšia
Title: BM 31517

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver from a slave of the Egibi family by the messenger of a deputy. For the rations of a group of workmen. On account of a bow-fief.
A, messenger (mār šipri) of E, the deputy (šanû) , receives (eṭēru) 1/3 mina of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, from B1, slave of D, and B2. They pay on behalf of (ana muhhi) C, as the silver is due from his bow-land (qaštu) in order to pay for the rations (kurummatu) of the zargaya-(work)men (lúza-ar-ga-a-a [zargaya]) in Darius’ 15th year. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe

A=Nabû-uṣuršu/Rēmūtu, the messenger of E; B1=Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of D; B2=Iddinaya/Ardia; C=Bēl-iddin/Nabû-zēru-ušabši; D=Marduk-nāṣir-apli (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); E=Amurru-šarru-uṣur!, (šanû)
Title: BM 31026

Paraphrase:
A brief reminder (tahsistu la maštu) about payments for seeds. Reminder to the head of the head of the Egibi family.
A reminds (qabû) B* about the 10 shekels of white silver for sesame seeds (šamaššammu), and the 1/3 mina of white silver for mustard-seeds (kasû). We cannot be sure that B was actually the Širku whom we know from the Egibi family under his full name of Marduk-nāṣir-apli, son of Itti-Marduk-balāṭu. It should be noted that a man named Nergal-ušallim, son of Arrabi, is mentioned in relation with onions in BM30747: he received the miksu-toll from Širku//Egibi for a boatload of onions. He may be A's son. However, no firm connection can be established between the current reminder about sesame and mustard-seeds that mentions Arrabi and BM 30747 about onions that mentions Nergal-ušallim/Arrabi.

*l. 6: Širku(?) (Ši-ir-DI)

A=Arrabi, father of Nabû-bullissu; B=Širku! (=?Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Title: BM 30641

Paraphrase:
Receipt of an ilku-payment by the head of the Egibi family. Paid on behalf of a third party.
A receives payment (mahāru) from B for the account of (ana muhhi) C1 and C2, for the ilku-tax from Nisan (I) till the end of Addar (XII) of Darius 25th year that is due from them. The amount paid is 1/3 mina and 1! shekel of white, medium-quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Šiški/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Rēmūtu/Kalbaya; C1=Bēl-ušallim/Bēl-iqīša//Šangû-Ea; C2=Bēl-ēṭir/Bēl-iqīša//Šangû-Ea
Title: BM 30243

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley.
B owes 12;1.4.0 kor of barley to A, to be delivered in one payment and according to the creditor's measure in Ayyār (II). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Mušēzib-Marduk/Marduk-ēṭir//Nappāhu.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Šulāya/Nabû-šumu-ukīn
Title: BM 41412

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Payment for harbor costs.
B owes 28 shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-fifth? is alloy, to A, the royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri), to be delivered in Addar (XII). The silver is for covering the harbor costs that are made in the course of an onion transport (kaspu ša kāri ša šūmi). A man whose name is broken received (mahāru) part of it (8 shekels) from the royal harbor master. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-šumu-līšir/Mušēzib-Nabû//Nabû-šeme.

A = Gimillu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Sîn-šadûnu, royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri); B = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia
Title: BM 31397

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates and silver. Pledge of land. Fragmentary.
The beginning of the tablet is broken off. Then we read that B owes 1 mina of silver and 24 kor of dates to A and are informed about the terms of repayment. The dates should be delivered in Arahsamna (VIII) in C's house (or: plot of land) (bītu) in Šuppatu. The silver should be paid without interest at the end of Addar (XII). The debtor's field (eqlu) located next to creditor's plot of land in Šuppatu is pledged to the creditor. No other creditor shall exercise any right over the pledged land until the debt is repaid in full. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Lâbāši-Marduk/Kabtia//Egibi. First witness is Zabdiya, courtier (ša rēši) of Cambyses he crown prince. Third witness is a son of the debtor (Nabû-uṣuršu).

A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Mukīn-Marduk/Arad-Nabû//Asu; C = Bēl-gimilanni.
Title: BM 31868

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates without interest.
B owes 22;0.0.0 (kor) of dates without interest (hubuttu) to A, to be delivered in Kislīm (IX) at the river in Babylon. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-iddin/Nabû-kēšir//Nagāru (debtor!).

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-iddin/Nabû-kēšir//Nagāru
Title: BM 31126

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with interest.
B owes 25 2/3 shekels of silver to A, to be paid with interest in Simān (III). He started paying interest (hubullu) since the beginning of the month (lit. "from the 1st of Nisan [I]). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Šumāya/Šulāya(//Itinnu).

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Bēlšunu/Iddin-Bēl/Mudammiq-Adad
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Bibliography: Reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 300; Demuth, BA 3 (1898), 393f.; Peiser, KB 4 (1896), 274f.; Shiff 1987, no. 202.
Title: BM 30588

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver without interest.
B owes 1 mina and 1 shekel of silver without interest to A, to be delivered at the end of Dûzu (IV). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Bēl-uballiṭ/Bēl-rēmanni
Title: BM 31374

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver without interest. Price for dates.
fB1 and her son (B2) owe 1 mina of silver to A, the price for dates, which they should pay without interest in Abu (V). The two debtors assume warranty for each other and the one who has silver available at the due date will pay. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nūrea/Nabû-ibni//Dayyān-....

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Iddin-Marduk//Nūr-Sîn; fB1 = fAmat-Ninlil/Zēr-Bābili//Pahāru; B2 = Balāṭu/Eṭēru/E..., son of fAmat-Ninlil/Zēr-Bābili//Pahāru
Bibliography: Reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 250; Moore, NBBAD no. 118; Shiff 1987, no. 159
Title: MNB 1818

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates.
B owes 11;0.0.0 (kor) of dates to A, to be delivered in their full amount (gamru) in Arahsamna (VIII). Delivery is due on the creditor's plot of land (bītu) along the Borsippa canal. The debtor should also deliver 0;0.3.0 (kor) of wheat. In addition, there is a debt owed by the same debtor to A and his master. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Kalbāya/Nabû-iddin//Egibi.

A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-dīnu-epuš/Kinūnāya
Title: BM 31500

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley, livestock, wool and silver
B owes 55;0.0.0 (kor) of barley, 40 pieces of small livestock (20 young, male sheep, 10 muttons, 5 male lambs and 5 goats), 1 talent of wool and 35 shekels of silver to A. The rest of the tablet is broken off. It is not excluded that the debt is related to a harrānu-business enterprise. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Balāṭu/Šamaš-iddin.

A = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B = ...-uballiṭ/...
Title: BM 31143

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Payment for harbor costs.
B owes 17 shekels of silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A,  the royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri), to be paid next week, lit. "on the 5th of Nisan (I)". The silver is for covering the royal harbor costs that are made in the course of an onion transport (kaspu ša kāri ša šarri). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-šumu-līšir/Mušēzib-Nabû/Nabû-šeme.

A = Gimillu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Sîn-šadûnu, royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri); B =  Kurbanni-Marduk/Bēl-zēri//Adad-šumu-ēreš.
Title: BM 31247

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for ploughshares.
B owes to A two bronze ploughshares (šūrû), the weight of the first one is 9 minas and the second one's  is 4 [1/3] minas, to be delivered by the end of Nisan (I) of Darius' 27th year. Should he fail to meet the deadline, he shall pay 1 mina of white silver instead of the two ploughshares on the 2nd of Ayyār of Darius' 27th year. This sum corresponds to the ploughshares' purchase price. Witnesses.

A = Šišir (aka Marduk-nāṣir-apli)/Iddināya//Egibi; B = Ina-tēšê-Nabû/Nabû-x//Šigūa
Title: BM 41452

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates. Fragmentary
B owes a broken amount of dates to fA. The details of repayment are lost in the broken passages of the tablet. The little that is preserved refers to first-quality dates and what seems to be the place of deliver (starting with "between ....").

fA =fAmat-Bāba/Kalbāya//Nabāya; B = Zababa-x/(f)?Amat-x
Title: BM 31876

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 6.1.3 kor of dates to A, the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) located in front of (ša pāni) the Giššu-Gate, next? to the field of fC, mother of D. The mayor part of the document is broken off. The only thing that is still clear is part of the clause on the delivery of the usual by-products of the date harvest: […] and 1 darīku-containter he should deliver. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = [the name of the debtor is broken off]; fC = fAmat-Ninlil/[PN]//Miṣirāya, mother of D; D= [the name of the debtor is broken off]
Title: BM 31444

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for onions, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 950 strings (gidlu) of onions to A1 and A2, to be delivered in Ayyār (II). In addition, there is an earlier promissory note about the business partnership (u’iltu ša harrāni) with C(?). The rest of the document is broken off]. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Rēmūt-Bēl/Bēl-….
 
A1 = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; A2 = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia; B = Nabû-bān-ahi/Nabû-malik; C = IM-x-x
Title: BM 30689

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Fixation of interest.
B owes 1 2/3 minas of silver to A, to be paid with interest (hubullu) in Tašrīt (VII). The interest is fixed at 20%, to be paid on a monthly basis. Witnesses
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Iddin-Nabû/Iqīša//Ea-ibni.
Title: BM 30946

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates. Payment for a debt
B owes 40 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in Kislīm (IX) at the canal in Babylon. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note […] which is for the abattu of C’s sheep (elat u’ilti mahrīti x šá a-na a-bat-tu4 ša kalūmi C). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Bēl-uballiṭ/Busu//Bānûnu; C=Bēl-iddin
Title: BM 31257

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Mutual warranty.
B1 and fB2, his wife owe 1 mina and 11 shekels of silver to A. The two debtors assume warranty for each other. A broken passage mentions C, a slave, who apparently belongs to the debtors and is pledged as debt security.  In addition, there is an earlier promissory note credited to A which is still pending. B1 and D act as guarantors for the payment. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Lâbāši/Zēria//Nabāya; fB2 =  fGula-qā'išat/Ea-ibni//Bēliyu, wife of B1; C = Bēl-rēṣūa, slave of B1; D = Nabû-zeru-līšir
Title: BM 30663

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Mutual warranty, general pledge, and third party guarantor.
B1, B2 and B3 owe 4 minas of silver of which one-eighth is alloy to A as payment for the tithes for the temples of Bēl, Nabû and Nergal. He should pay in Šabāṭ (XI). The debt is secured in three ways. The debtors assume warranty for each other. All their property in and outside the city is pledged to the creditor. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged properties until he has received the full repayment of his silver. Finally, C acts as a guarantor for the payment. Witnesses.
 
A = Neriglissar/[...]; B1 = Nā’īd-Marduk/[...]//Eppeš-ilī; B2 = Nabû-zēru-iddin/[...]; B3 = Kalbāya/[...]; C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi
Title: BM 32099

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for the delivery of bronze objects.
B owes various bronze objects to A, to be delivered in Abu (V): one bronze cooking vessel (mušahhinu) (with a capacity) of 3 seahs (ṣimdu) (?)(*), one gulgullu-container (**), and 2/3 minas in finished bronze objects with a capacity of a beer container(?) (talammu) (***), …. weighing 5 shekels (of bronze) […] and one pitcher (dālu A) weighing 5 shekels (of bronze), finished work (gamru). The promissory notes for 5 minas of bronze are to be considered invalid (lit. "broken") as they have been paid off (?). Witnesses.
(*)So CAD Ṣ, 197. Alternatively, … (weighing) 3 minas (?); (**)Or: "(in the form of a) skull" (CAD G, 128 s.v. gullatu A); (***)gamru ša(?) ta(?)-lam-mu x x x. Cf. CAD T, 92: "finished work (with the capacity) of one talammu."
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Nabû-ahhē-ušallim/Bēl-šumu-iškun//Nappāhu
Title: BM 30998

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for lambs, sheeps and cows within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 40 male and female lambs (immeru kalūmu parratu), 10 special quality (ruhhu) young sheep (immeru ṣehru), 4 talents of wool (šipātu), of which 2 talents […], 4 bred heifers (burtu šūlitu) to A1 and A2. They are part of the business partnership that was established by C as main investor. He should deliver the sheep, wool and heifers in Dûzu (IV). 3 shekels of silver from the silver that C invested in the business partnership are at B's disposal. The wool should be delivered to Babylon. Witnesses. Scribe (= debtor): Bazūzu/Šamaš-uballiṭ.
The duplicate tablet, BM30413  slightly deviates.
 
A1 = Īnia/Zēria//Nabāya; A2 = Bēl-īpuš/Rāšil//Nappāhu; B = Bazūzu/Šamaš-uballiṭ; C = Iddin-Marduk
Title: BM 30620

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates. Very fragmentary.
B owes 33 kor of dates to fA, assessed field rent (imitti eqli). It is A's 1/5th share in the rental income, the other shares are owned by [broken off]. Witnesses.
 
fA = fErištu/Širku; B = [the name is broken off]
Title: Rm 687

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates. Fragmentary.
B owes 14 kor of dates to the brothers A1 and A2, the assessed field rent (imitti eqli) on land located at (ina muhhi) the Ile''i-Bēl sluice (bitqu). The full amount of dates should be delivered in one payment according to the 36 liters measure in Tašrīt (VII). B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation to the courtyard (haṣāru): for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), offshoots (liblibbu, wr. líb-bi), fibres (mangagu), [x x x], spadices (gipû), (and) 2 darīku-containers. Payment for the habû uhinnu-tax is included (ina libbi) into the above amount of dates. C will dig a ditch (harru) and a distributary (ārittu). The document concludes by referring to the gardener's remuneration (šisinnu) and a remainder (rīhtu) but the pertinent passage is mostly broken off. Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = brother of A1; B = Tabnēa/…-ibni//Ša-nāšīšu; C = [the name is broken off]
Title: BM 31325

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 56 kor of dates, the assessed field rent (imitti eqli), to A1, his brothers and A3. 36 kor are from land located at the branch (bābu) of the old Kutha-canal, and the other 20 kor are from land located at the lower sector (of this canal?) (bābu šupālu). He has to deliver the dates in one instalment according to the 36 liters of measure to the courtyard. Deliver is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amount of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, 3 darīku-containers, and payment for the šugarrû-supplement. In addition, there is an earlier claim (rašûtu mahrītu) against him (ina pāni) that is still pending. Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = brother of A1; A3 = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bān-zeri//Bēl-eṭēru; B = Ninurta-ahu-iddin/[P]N
Title: BM 30537

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley.
B owes 2 kor of barley to A, to be delivered in Ayyār (II), in one instalment according to the creditor’s measure. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note between the same parties. Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-ēreš/Nabû-kāṣir//Pahāru
Title: BM 31532

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 26 kor of dates to A, the assessed field rent (imitti eqli) on land located opposite (muhhi) the Ile''i-Bēl sluice (bitqu). The dates should be delivered in one payment according to the 36 liters measure in Arahsamna (VIII) to the courtyard (haṣāru). B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), (dates for) the šugarrû-supplement, a load of firewood (and) 2 darīku-containers with a 0;0.3 kor capacity. Included are the 1;2.3.0 kor of dates that are the shared income (zittu) of C and D. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Bēl-nādin-apli/Bēl-ahu-ušabši//Pappāya; C = Iddin-Nabû; D = Nergal-ēṭir
Title: BM 30586

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 28 kor of dates to A, which is the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) located at the branch (bābu) of the old Kutha-canal. He should deliver the dates in one instalment according to the 36 liters measure to the courtyard. Deliver is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amount of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (dates for) the šugarrû-supplement, (and) fibres (mangagu), a load of frewood and 1 darīku-container. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the habû uhinnu-tax. In addition, there are promissory notes (u'iltu) for (still pending) claims (rašûtu) (by the same creditor). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nabû-uṣuršu/Mušēzib-Bēl//Sasinnu
Title: BM 41421

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 6 kor of dates to A1, A2 and A3, assessed field rent (imitti eqli) on land located opposite (muhhi) the Hazuzu ditch (harru). The dates should be delivered in one payment according to the 36 liters measure in Arahsamna (VIII) to the courtyard (haṣāru). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, (and) 2 darīku-container(s). In addition, there is a claim by A2 and his brother (against B) which is still pending. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). Witnesses.
 
A1 = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; A2 = Marduk-ušallim/Šāpik-zēri//Nādin-še'im, brother of A3; A3 = Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Šāpik-zēri//Nādin-še'im, brother of A2; B = Bēl-īpuš /Nādin//Uballissu-Marduk
Title: BM 30355

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver within the framework of a business partnership.
Concerns the promissory note for 9 1/3 minas of silver of of medium-quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, that are due to C1, C2, C3 and C4 and in which it is provided as follows: "it is the silver that A invested in a business partnership (harrānu) with B, and hence due from the latter (ina muhhi)”. In the present document, the above-mentioned four persons receive part of this silver, namely 4 2/3 minas from B, the interest on it, and 10 kor (c. 1,800) of dates according to his promissory note. This note they promptly return to the payer (târu-nadānu), and none of them has any more claims against him.  
 
A = Bēl-iddin; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C1 = Nidintu/Kiṣiria; C2 = Bēl-ahu-iddin/Kittia(?); C3 = Iqūpu/Ahabia; C4 = Iddin-Bēl/…
Title: BM 41435

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver.
A1 and A2, a slave of D, receive 1/2 shekel of silver from the 1/2 mina of silver that is due to D from B. The silver is paid by the debtor. The recipients act by C’s order (ina našparti). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names  of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-bullissu/Iddin-Nabû//Dābibī; A2 = Nabû-ayyalu, slave of D; B = Labāši-Marduk/Marduk-ēṭir//Šangû-Šamaš; C=Libluṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; D = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 33149

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver. Paid on behalf of a third party.
A receives 50 shekels of silver of medium quality of which one-eight is alloy from B, paid on behalf of C.  The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Nabû-nāṣir-apli//Ašlāku; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Nabû-ahu-ittannu/Marduk-iqīšanni//Šumu-libši
Title: BM 31526

Paraphrase:
Receipt for assessed field rent delivered in dates.
A receives 6 kor (c. 1080 l) of dates from B, the assessed field rent (imittu) for Darius’ 13th year. Paid in Arahsamna (VIII), i.e. at the date harvest.
 
A = Šamaš-ēṭir/Bulluṭāya/Ēṭiru; B = Širik/Iddināya//Egibi (= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Title: BM 31270

Paraphrase:
Receipt for boat-toll.
A receives payment for toll (miksu) from B for the boat loaded with onions that belongs to him. He should make the boat pass (the bridge/toll-house?) in Simān (III) and hand it back to B. The toll has been fully paid. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Ṭābia//Šangû-Ninurta; B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 31082

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver, payment for obligatory service.
A, on behalf of B, receives 15 shekels of silver from fC, wife of D. Names of 2 witnesses (including Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēria//Nabāya, brother of fC) and the scribe, A.
 
A = Nabû-ēreš/Ṣillāya/Mandidi; B = Nūrea/Bēl-iqīša//Šangû-Nanāya; fC = fIna-Esagila-ramât, wife of D; D = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya(//Nūr-Sîn)
Title: BM 30888

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver.
Concerns the claim for 30 shekels of silver which A holds against C. A receives the indebted silver on the debtor's behalf from B and returns the promissory note pertaining to this debt to the payer (târu-nadānu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šamaš-ēṭir/Balāssu//Nabunnāya; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Bēl-rēmanni/Lâbāši-Marduk//Ašgandu
Title: BM 30672

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver, payment for obligatory service
A receives 19 shekels of silver from B, for the urāšu-service on the walls of the Enlil Gate from the 14th Ṭebēt (X) to the 6th Addar (XII). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nūrea/Bēl-iqīša//Šangû-Nanāya; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Iddin-Marduk/Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 30421

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver from the head of the Egibi family. Rent for a boat.
A1 and A2 receive payment* for the rent (idū) of their boat from B. The amount received is 1/3 mina of white, medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy. The remainder of the tablet is broken off, including the names of the witness and the scribe.

*Verb of receipt is broken off.

A1=Ahu-atbû/Kalbaya; A2=Nabû-ittannu/Iddin-Nabû; B=Širku (wr. mši-rik-ku)/Iddinaya//Egibi
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 31427

Paraphrase:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver. Due from the head of the Egibi family. Fixation of default interest. Witnessed by clerks of the Esagil temple
B should pay 2 2/3 minas of white, medium-quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, that are due from him to A in Simān (III) of the 17th year in Babylon. He does not have to pay interest (ina qaqqadi). However, should he fail to meet the deadline, the debt will start to bear a yearly interest of 20% to be paid on a monthly basis. Names of 11 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Bēl-iddin/Mušēzib-Marduk//Sîn-nādin-šumi; B=Šiški/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Bibliography: Reedition: Abraham 2004, 122; Abraham, OLP 28 (1997), 55ff.; Petschow 1956 (NBPf), 22 no. 47; Dandamaev 1984, 276.
Title: BM 30488

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver from the head of the Egibi family. Partial payment of a debt on behalf of two other persons.
The present document concerns a debt (u'iltu) of 16 minas of marked silver belonging to A, that was contracted to the debit of B1 and B2 (ina muhhi ~ e’elu) and for the payment of which C assumed warranty. We see D paying half of the indebted sum to the guarantor on behalf of (ana muhhi) the two debtors. C acknowledges his receipt (mahāru). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 8 witnesses and the scribe

A=Nabû-uṣuršu/Gūzānu; B1=Rēmūt-Bēl/Šumu-ukīn; B2=Kīnaya/Dannu-ahhēšu-ibni 
C=Nīr-Yaw/Bēl-zēru-ibni; D=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 30223

Paraphrase:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver and onions to the head of the Egibi family. Repayment of the onions will be obtained from the debtor’s income from impost on land. Silver had been transferred to the debtor to pay for rikis qabli. References to an outstanding debt of dates, onions and silver secured by pledge.
B should pay 50 shekels of silver and 50 bundles of onions that are due from him to A in Nisan (I) of the 6th year. A will receive full repayment (šalāmu) from the šibšu-crops from his field (ina šibši eqlišu). In addition (elat), there is an earlier promissory note (u'iltu) stating a claim (rašûtu) for 297!.3.0 kor of dates and 11.2.3 kor of barley. Furthermore (elat), there is a debt (u'iltu) of 1 mina and 10 shekels of silver, charged against B, for which his orchard (eqlu zaqpu) and grain field (pî šulpi) have been taken! as pledge. The (indebted) silver is that which has been given (nadānu, G Stat.) to C to pay for the rikis qabli (of the men who have) to go to Šeladu in Darius’ 5th year.* Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

*kaspa' ša ana rikis qabli ša šanat 5 ša ana alāki ša Šeladu ana C nadnu. Cf. BM41451 (=Dar 167).

A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Rēmūt-Bēl/Šumu-ukīn; C=Nabû-māku-uṣur/Nabû-aplu-iddin
Bibliography: Reedition: Abraham 2004, 096; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 3 (1894), 32; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.)  17, 87, no.150, 279, 321.
Title: BM 41451
Place of issue Remark: broken, most likely Šaḫrīnu, for contextual/archival reasons.

Paraphrase:
About onions from property of Bēl in Šahrīnu. Very fragmentary.
Concerns onions from Šahrīnu that are the prerogative of the temple of Bēl (makkūru), from the harvest of the 11th year of Darius. A promissory note* (u'iltu) regarding these onions had been concluded (e'ēlu), to the debit? of C ([ina pani]). The present document confirms that A received (eṭēru N) the onions from B and undertakes to bring along the promissory note and hand it over (našû-nadānu) to … (broken off). Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe.

*L. 1: ú?-[íl-tí(meš)].

A= Šaddinnu/Madān-ahhē-iddin; B= .../Bēl-uṣuršu; C= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 33959

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver paid on behalf of the head of the Egibi family. Payment of a debt.
A receives (mahāru) 3 minas and 45 shekels of white, medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, from B, paid on behalf of (ana muhhi) C. This silver is part (ina) of a larger claim (rašûtu) that A holds against C. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 13 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Šaddinnu/Madān-ahhē-iddin//Šigûa; B=Nidintu/Kabtia//Ir'anni; C= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 31977

Paraphrase:
Receipt of a hireling from the head of the Egibi family. Paid on behalf of a third party.
A receives (mahāru) a hireling (or: hirelings) (agru) from B for the account of (ana muhhi) C and his brothers, from whom the hireling was due. The hireling is probably needed for the performance of a certain job, during a well-defined period, apparently till the end of Arahsamna (VIII) of the 23rd year of Darius, based on the parallels of BM30764, BM31118 and BM31226, although the pertinent passage is broken off. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Šumu-uṣur/Šamaš-ēṭir; B=Širik/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Nidintu/Kalbaya//Suhaya
Title: BM 31449

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver from the head of the Egibi family. Refers to a letter order.
A receives (mahāru) 5 minas of marked silver from B. This silver is part (ina libbi) of a larger sum of 10 minas of marked silver, mentioned in a letter order (šipirtu) from C that A presented to B (ana pāni PN našû). A didn’t give this letter order to B. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nabû-nādin-ahi/Nabû-bēl-šumāti//Dēkû; B=Širku/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Šaddinnu
Title: BM 31018

Paraphrase:
Receipt of an ilku-payment by the head of the Egibi family. Paid on behalf of a third party.
A receives payment (mahāru) from B for the account of (ana muhhi) C for the ilku-tax from Nisan (I) till Addar (XII) of Darius 25th year that is due from the latter. The exact amount that is paid is not specified. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Šiški/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Iddin-Nabû/Ahhē-iddin-Marduk; C=Tattannu/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Bābūtu
Title: BM 30235

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver, barley and dates with interest.
B owes 2 minas of silver; 45;0.0.0 kor of barley and 80;0.0.0 kor of dates to A, to be paid back in two installments. The barley should be delivered in Ayyār (II); the dates in Tašrīt (VII); and on the silver he has to start paying the usual 20% interest on a monthly basis from next month onwards (lit. "from the 1st of Intercalary Addar [XII2]"). Delivery is due in the creditor' countryhouse (bītu ina ṣēri). The debtor's land (zēru) planted with trees (zaqpu) and grain (pî šulpi) in Bīt-ṭāb-Bēl and his house at the Borsippa canal are pledged to the creditor. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged property until the creditor has received the full repayment of his silver, barley and dates. C acts as a guarantor for the repayment of the debt. The same creditor has also (elat) another claim (rašûtu) against him. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-mukīn-apli/Šumu-uṣur//Amēl-Ea.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Marduk-nāṣir/Šamaš-ahu-iddin; C = Nergal-ušallim/Arrabi
Title: BM 30407

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley.
B owes 6 kor of barley to A, to be delivered at the Piqudu-Canal. The present document states that the barley should be in good-quality (babbanû) and delivered in one installment according to the creditor's 36 liters measure. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Iddin-Nabû/Balāssu//Nabû-šeme.

A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Aplāya/...
Title: BM 30857

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver and old, empty barrels.
B owes 30 3/4 shekels of silver and 21 pieces of old, empty barrels to A, to be delivered on the 20th of Ayyār (II). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-rēmanni/Ea-šumu-ibni//Šangû-Šamaš.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Bēl-kāṣir/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Itinnu
Title: BM 31305

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley. Transportation costs and exit-toll.
B, the royal official appointed over the harbor (bēl piqitti ša kāri) of Bīt-ṭāb-Bēl owes 80;0.0.0 (kor) of barley to A, slave of C, to be delivered in Ayyār (II) in their full amount (gamru). The debtor should also pay for the transportation cost of the barley (gimru) to Babylon and the exit-toll (mūṣû) in Borsippa. Names of 3 witnesses and scribe: Bēl-ušallim/Zēria//Nabāya.

A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of C; B = Itti-maku-ili, bel piqitti-officer of Bīt-ṭāb-Bēl; C = Iddin-Marduk
Title: BM 31068

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with interest.
B owes 1 mina of silver to A, to be paid with interest in Dûzu (IV). The yearly interest rate is fixed at 20% to be paid on a monthly basis. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-šāpik-zēri/Bēl-uballiṭ//Nagiru.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Bēlšunu/Nabû-zēru-iddin
Bibliography: Reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 338; Ziemer, BA 3 (1898), 446f.; Shiff 1987, no. 219.
Title: BM 30803

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B owe 4 3/4 shekels of silver to A, to be delivered at the end of Dûzu (IV). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ṣillāya/Esagilāya.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Kidinnu/Zēria//Šangû-Gula
Title: BM 30659

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes the basic sum (kaspu qaqqadu) of ½ mina and 5 shekels of silver to A, to be paid together with its interest (hubullu) in Nisan (I). The (indebted) silver is what C invested in a business partnership (harrānu) (with A and B). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bazūzu/Šamaš-uballiṭ (= the debtor). The current document was recorded in Huṣṣēti-ša-Bazūzu “which is in the Province of Uruk”.
 
A = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Bazūzu/Šamaš-uballiṭ; C = Iddin-Marduk
Title: BM 30758

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver without interest.
B1 and B2 owe 30 shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eigth is alloy, the price for onions, to A. They should pay the silver without interest in Nisan (I) and assume warranty for each other. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Šamaš-ahu-iddin/Rāš-il. See also BM41401 written on the same day, mentioning the same persons. 

A = Ahu-ittabši/Nabû-malik; B1 = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B2 = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia
Title: BM 30334

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for onion and silver. Fragmentary.
B1 and B2 owe 10000 strings (gidlu) of onions and 10 shekels of silver to A(*). The onions should be delivered in Ayyār (II). The date of delivery for the silver is lost in the broken passages of the tablet. The verb is in the singular (inamdin) although its subject is plural (two debtors). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Ah-iddin/Ardia (debtor).

Notes: (*)Unclear whether it concerns onions and silver or onions worth 10 shekels of silver. In the latter case, note that the phrase šīm kaspi is lacking.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Ah-iddin/Ardia; B2 = Balāṭu/Gimillu
Title: BM 31308

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Investment in an onion-business partnership.
B owes 2 minas and 40 shekels(*) of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be delivered (in onions) as soon as possible ("by the earliest boat", eleppu haruptu) in the next month, Nisan (I). Debtor and creditor are partners in a business venture (harrānu) with the latter being the investing and the former the acting partner. The above sum of silver comes in addition to (elat) the earlier business loan of 5 minas and 52 shekels (ša ina muhhi harrāni) and the already invested capital sum of 3 minas and 30 shekels (ša harrāni), so that now B has 12 minas of silver at his disposal to do business with. Regardless of the above, he should also deliver an additional (nūptu) 1000 strings of onions. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Uballissu-Gula/Marduk-erība//Sîn-ilī.

Notes: (*)BM 31428 has 2 minas and 40 shekels of silver, BM 33067 has 2 minas and 50 shekels of silver

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia
Title: BM 33067

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates.
B, slave of C, owes 10 kor of dates to his master's brother (A), to be delivered in its full amount (gamru) in one instalment and measured according to the 36 liters measure. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII) at the river in Babylon.  Should he fail to deliver the full amount in dates, he will pay the remainder in silver according to the market price of Babylon. Witnesses.

A = Nidintu-Bēl/Marduk-nāṣir-apli//Egibi; B = Madān-iddin, slave of C; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Egibi
Title: BM 33549

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver and barley
B1 and B2 owe [x] minas 1/3 shekels of silver and [x] kor barley to A, to be delivered in Dûzu (IV) according to the creditor's measure ... [broken off]. Witnesses.

A = Bēl-iddin/Marduk//Bibbua; B1 = Šulāya/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//Egibi; B2 = Marduk-ēṭir/Nabû-ušallim//Sîn-šadûnu
Title: BM 31486

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 15 kor of dates to A, assessed field rent (imitti eqli). He should deliver the dates in one payment in Arahsamna (VIII) together with the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), fibres (mangagu), spadices (gipû), a load of firewood (and) 2 darīku-containers. He should also pay for the habû uhinnu-tax. He has not received (eṭēru) any remuneration for his gardening work (šissinnu). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Tabnēa/…-ibni//Ša-nāšīšu
Title: BM 30866

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu). Fragmentary.
B owes a broken amount of dates to A1 and A2, to be delivered in Tašrīt (VII). They are what C invested in the business partnership (harrānu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-zēru-ukīn/Šulāya//Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk.
 
A1 = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; A2 = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia; B = [name is broken off]; C = Iddin-Marduk
Title: BM 30664

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Without interest.
B owes 2/3 minas and 5 shekels of silver to A, to be paid without interest (qaqqadu) in Tašrīt (VII). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Rēmūt-Bēl/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Nubu
Title: BM 30306

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for beams.
B owes 20 quality beams (gušūru) (babbanû) split in logs (tapālu) that are 12 cubits long, to be used as roof beams (išdu, in the expression: bāb ildāti) to A, to be delivered in Abu (V) at the canal in Babylon. Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Marduk-ēṭir/Nabû-gamil//Egibi
Title: BM 31161

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates. Purchase price for beer jars.
B owes a broken amount of dates, the purchase price for 2 jars of old beer, to A. He should deliver them in Arahsamna (VIII) in Babylon. The place of delivery is further specified as follows: at the entrance to the depot (bāb kalakki) in A’s house to a man (?) [the name of whom is broken off]. Witnesses
 
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Nādinu/Nergal-ēṭir//Bābūtu
Title: BM 30609

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for onions, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 1200 onion strings (gidlu) to A within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu) that was established by C as main investor. He should deliver onion strings of good quality (babbanû) in Addar (XII). Witnesses. Scribe: Niqudu/Bēl-erība//Re'i-sīsê.
 
 
A = Širiktu/Nūrea//Dannea; B = Nabû-kāṣir/Šūzubu; C = Iddin-Marduk
Title: BM 32857

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of slave.
B1 and fB2, his wife owe 15 ¾ shekels of silver to A, to be paid on the 15th of Abu (V). The payment is secured by the pledge of the B1's slave (fC). No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged slave until A has received the full repayment of his debt. The silver that B1 and fB2 pay as rent for the house, is within the house. Witnesses.
 
A = Šulāya/Zēru-ukīn//Egibi; B1 = Sîn-iddin/Ina-qibi-Bēl//Ša-ṭābtišu; fB2 = fBurāšu, wife of B1; fC = slave of B1 and fB2
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 125; Petschow 1956 (NBPf), 176; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 4 (1898), 23; Koschaker 1911, 86.
Title: BM 30438

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 1 mina of white, medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be paid on the 1st of Simān (III) in Babylon. C acts as a guarantor for the payment. Witnesses
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-ittannu/Mušēzib-Marduk//Išinu; C = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Nabû-šarru-uṣur (or –ibni)
Title: BM 30347

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 3 minas of white, medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, slave of C. The silver should be paid on the 15th of Šabāṭ (XI) of Darius’ 19th year. Witnesses.
 
A = Bēl-gabbi-Nabû/Ina-ṣilli-Bēl, slave of C; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Nabû-tabni-uṣur
Title: BM 30615

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Purchase price (?).
B owes 4 1/3 minas and 4 shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A. This silver is the rest of the purchase price (šīmu) of [broken off]. He will pay A his silver as soon as A has brought along (abāku) C, his nephew and persuaded him to join the sale ([…] ša B ú-[šal?-lim?], šalāmu D). Witnesses.
 
A = Iddināya/Bēl-rēṣūa; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = P[N]
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 31317

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 6 kor of dates to A, the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) located opposite (muhhi) the Gubbatu-canal. He should deliver the dates in one instalment according to the 36 liters measure to the courtyard (haṣāru). Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), and fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, and 1 darīku-container. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu) nor for the services of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-aplu-iddin/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Lē’êa
Title: BM 30497

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for revenue from impost on land, to be delivered in dates. Very fragmentary.
The tablet is very badly preserved. No more than 3 lines are preserved on the obverse. From them it appears that someone whose name is lost owes 3;3 kor of dates to A. It is revenue from impost on land (imittu) which [broken off]. The description of the land's location is almost completely lost except for the mention of ša šibšu and "located next to C". The lower part of the obverse and upper part of the reverse are broken off. Name of 1 witness. The names of other witnesses are lost in the lacuna at the beginning of the reverse. Name of the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = [the name is broken off]; C = Gūzānu/Ninnea
Title: BM 31985

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley and onions. Payment for a debt.
B owes 4.1.4.0 kor of barley and 1010 strings (gidlu) of onions to A, slave of C. The onions should be delivered in one instalment in Nisan (I) in the creditor’s house. In Ayyār (II), he should deliver the barley under the same conditions. In addition, there is an earlier claim (rašûtu) by the same creditor against the debtor and his brother and which is secured by the debtors' mutual guarantee. Witnesses.
 
A = Madānu-bēlu-uṣur, slave of C; B = Rēmūt-Bēl/Talīmu; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 33950

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with interest and for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 60 kor of dates and 25 shekels of silver to A. The dates are the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) located at the branch (bābu) of the old Kutha-canal. They should be delivered in Arahsamna (VIII) together with the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), fibres (mangagu), (and) spadices (gipû), and a load of firewood (and) 2 darīku-containers. He should also pay for the habû uhinni-tax. On the 25 shekels that he owes he will have to pay a monthly interest of 1 shekel, in addition (elat) to the 10 shekels that he still owes (10 šiqil kaspi mahru). C acts as a guarantor for the payment (of the silver debts). There is still another (elat) claim against him that is still pending (rašûtu mahrītu). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nabû-uṣuršu/Mušēzib-Bēl//Sasinnu; C = Nergal-uballiṭ
Title: BM 41419

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver without interest. Mutual warranty.
B1 and his mother (fB2) owe 1 mina and 10 shekels of silver to A, to be delivered without interest within a one-year period (adi ṭuppi ṭuppi). The two debtors assume warranty for each other. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Kīnāya/Nūrea//Ir’anni; fB2 = fIna-Esagil-bēlet/Rēmūt-Bēl//Egibi, mother of B1
Title: BM 30326

Paraphrase:
Fragmentary. Cannot be classified.
The tablet is too damaged to reconstruct its content. It belongs to the Egibi/Nūr-Sîn archive because Iddin-Marduk/Iqišāya//Nūr-Sîn is mentioned. Scribe: Marduk-…/…//Sîn-karābi-išme
Title: BM Unknown (76-11-17,2627)

Paraphrase:
Receipt for house rent, paid in silver
A receives 8 shekels of silver from B, paid as rent for a house belonging to two women (fC1 and fC2). The parties have not yet settled the accounts (epuš nikkassu qatû) for the brickwork (dullu libnāti), the reed (qanû) and beams (gušūru). It should be done according to the promissory note that belongs to D. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Qīšti-Bēl/Nabû-X//Hubu-X; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fC1 = fBanītu-ēṭirtu/Marduk-šumu-uṣur; fC2 = fAmat-Nanāya/Marduk-šumu-uṣur; D = Nabû-ahhē-iddin, father of B
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 221; Moldenke, CTMMA (1893), no. 28.
Title: MMA 79.7.9

Paraphrase:
Receipt of dates. Fragmentary
A receives 14;0.0.0 kor (c. 2,520 l) of dates from B, paid on behalf of (ana muhhi) C and D. Remainder of the tablet is broken off. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ibni/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Sîn-ahhē-bulliṭ; B = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria/Nabāya; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; D = Marduk-nāṣir/...-Marduk
Title: BM 41404

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price for two women.
A receives 2 1/2 shekels of silver from B, the price for fC1 and fC2, her daughter. This is in addition to an earlier debt … (uncl.). The above sum includes the 2 shekels of silver that he paid to A via D. The latter silver is "of/for" something that is lost in a badly preserved passage.
 
A = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Balāssu//Nappāhu; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fC1 = fIna-ṣilli-bīti-ṣabat; fC2 = fBāba-silim; D = Bēl-šakin-…
Title: BM 33093

Paraphrase:
Receipt for house rental
A receives 1/2 mina and 4 1/2 shekels of stamped(?) silver (ginnu) from B, paid as rent at the beginning of the year for a house which borders C(‘s house). A also acknowledges that he has received the kīnayātu-gifts for the whole year from B. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Arad-Bēl/Hašdāya/...; C = Lâbāši/Nappāhu
Title: BM 31522

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver by the borrower from the lender.
Concerns the debt (u'iltu) for 10 minas of silver that A issued against B. The present document confirms that the latter received the full amount of silver from A. This does not include the 12 1/2 shekels of silver for the purchase of mustard-seeds (kasû). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Zēria/Bēlšunu//Šalla
Title: BM 31264

Paraphrase:
