Receipt for silver.
fA receives 10 minas and 5 shekels of silver from B. This does not include the 1 mina of silver that were paid (by him) to fC, (and) for (the payment of which) a house (had been taken)(*) as pledge. It apparently includes the silver (followed by a broken passage), that fA received - we may assume that meant are all other amounts of silver that she received from the same person in the past. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe. At the end of the document, after the list of witnesses and the date, it is said that included are (also) (adi) the 2 shekels of silver that were paid to D. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe. (*) silver ša ana fA ša bīt maškāni [ṣab-t]a-ta nadnu. The unpublished copy Bertin 746 reads “one mina of silver which had been given to fC for the house [...] as pledge”.
 
fA = fṬābatu/Bēl-ahhē-erība//Ša-ṭābtīšu; B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; fC = fAmat-Ninlil(/Zēru-Bābili ?); D = Ubār
Title: BM 31078

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver.
A receives silver on C’s orders from B. It concerns 16 shekels of silver, including the silver for onions and sheep, with the rest of the details being lost in the broken parts of the tablet. Names of 2 witnesses (introduced by ina ušuzzi). No scribe.
 
A = Rēmūtu; B = Nergal-rēṣūa; C = Madān-bēlu-uṣur
Title: BM 30884

Paraphrase:
Receipt for the impost on temple onions.
A, an oblate (širku) of the Nabû temple, receives payment for the gugallutu-impost from B. The impost is taken from the temple’s onions which are at B’s disposal. Names of 2 witnesses, including Nabû-šarru-bulliṭ, a courtier (and) mayor domo dak-kur in Šahrīnu (rēš šarri bēl bīti dakkur Šahrinu); Scribe: Rēmūt-Nabû/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Banâ-ša-ilia.
 
A = Padāya/Ezida-... (širku); B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 30662

Paraphrase:
Receipt for a person. Related to serving in the king's army.
A1 and A2 receive C, who serves in the King's army, from B1, B2. Somehow this payment is related to the debt of 30 shekels that D1, D2 and D3 owes to E.
 
A1 = Marduk-erība; A2 = [PN]; B1 = Madān-šumu-iddin(?)/Zeria; B2 = Rēmut; C = Nergal-ibni(?); D1 = Nādin, father of D3; fD2 = fBāba-ilat; D3 = Marduk-erība/Nādin; E = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya(//Nūr-Sîn)
Title: BM 30417

Paraphrase:
Undertaking to transmit an order to the head of the Egibi family requiring him to pay silver.
Concerns the 10 shekels of silver that belong to A1 and A2 and are at B's disposal (ina pāni). By! the end of Nisan! (I) C's message (šipirtu) should reach B and he should be urged to pay the 10 shekels of silver to A1 and A2 (našû-nadānu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A1=Tabnēa//Nabû-ušallim; A2=Ubār//Nabû-ušallim; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Nergal-ēṭir/Kalbaya//Šumu-libši
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 30453

Paraphrase:
About a plot of land with a house built on it. Head of the Egibi family is among the neighbours.
All that is preserved of this fragmentary tablet is the description of the land. It measures 24 reeds and is located in the neighbourhood called Šu’anna within Babylon. A and B own neighbouring houses [...]. Their houses (or the land under discussion, uncl.) continues down (murradu, lit. "descent, slope") into the Hubur street (sūqu) as far as (the house of) C. The remainder of the tablet may have recorded a sale. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Bēl-erība/Nabû-bēlšunu//Abu-ul-īde; B=Nabû-bullissu/Nabû-šumu-iškun; C=Šiški/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 31975

Paraphrase:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver and dates to a slave of the Egibi family. Pledge of land. Silver had been transferred to the debtor to pay for rikis qabli.
B should pay 30 kor of dates and 1/2 mina of marked silver that are due from him to A, a slave of C, in Tašrit (VII) of the 12th year in Šahrīnu. Payment is in one instalment according to the 36 liter measure. In the same month he should also pay 1/2 mina of marked silver without interest (ina qaqqadi). The debtor's plot of land planted with trees (eqlu pî šulpi) and palm grove (gišimmaru) are pledged to the creditor until he has received full repayment (šalāmu) of his silver and his dates. The (indebted) silver is that which has been given (nadānu, G Stat.), probably to B, although the text does not explicitly say so, to pay for the rikis qabli (of the men who have) to go to Elam.* Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

*kaspa' rikis qabli ša ana Elam nadnu, a cryptic version of similar clauses found in e.g. BM41451 (=Dar167) and BM41428 (=Dar 164).

A=Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of C; B=Bēl-iddin/Nabû-zēru-ušabši; C=Marduk-nāṣir-apli//Egibi
Title: BM 31027

Paraphrase:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver and onions to the head of the Egibi family. Repayment of the onions is to be obtained from the debtor’s income from impost on land. Silver had been transferred to the debtor to pay for rikis qabli. Reference to an outstanding debt of dates, barley, onions and silver secured by pledge.
B should pay 1/2 mina of silver and 30 bundles of onions that are due from him to A in Nisan (I) of the 6th year. A will receive full repayment (šalāmu) from his (=the debtor's) income from the šibšu-impost on land (ina šibši eqlišu). In addition (elat), there is a previous debt (u'iltu) of 245.3.0 kor of dates and 8.1.2 kor of barley, as well as a debt (u'iltu) of 50 shekels of silver and 44 bundles of onions, all credit claims (rašûtu) charged against B, for which his orchards (eqlu zaqpu) and grain fields (pî šulpi) have been taken as pledge. The (indebted) silver is that which has been given (nadānu, G Stat.) to B to pay for the rikis qabli (of the men who have) to go to Šeladu in Darius’ 5th year. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Nabû-māku-uṣur/Nabû-aplu-iddin
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Bibliography: Reedition: Abraham 2004, 095; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 3 (1894), 32; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 17, 87, n.150, 279, 301, 321
Title: BM 41428

Paraphrase:
Promissory note to deliver flour to the head of the Egibi family. Property of the King. Delivery on account of the bow-fief of the exorcists. Administered by the Governor of Babylon.
Concerns barley flour and wheat flour from the bow-land (qaštu) of the exorcists (āšipu), the collection of which is the prerogative of the king (makkūru) and administered by (ša ina qātē) D. 1/3 of it is from the bow (qaštu) of C1 and his 9 royal commissioners (qīpu) of the scribal school (bīt ṭupšarri). B1 should deliver the full amount for the 11th (or 12th?) year, 4.0.3? kor of barley flour and 1.2.2 kor of wheat flour, to A for the account (ana muhhi) of C1 and his administrators not later than the 29th of Dûzu (IV; or: Tašrīt, VII) of the 12th year. B1 and B2 assume warranty for the delivery of the flour. Names of 9 witnesses and the scribe.

A= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B1= Libluṭ/Murašû//Sîn-tabni; B2= Kuššaya; C1= Bazūzu; D= Nabû-šumu-ukīn
Title: BM 33954

Paraphrase:
About 2 heifers. Mentions a slave of the Egibi family, a messenger from an official, and a farmer of Nergal. Fragmentary.
2 heifers (burtu) belonging to A, a slave of D, which B1, the messenger of the mār-abarakki-official (mār abarakki), and B2, the farmer (ikkaru) of Nergal, according to the letter order (šipirtu) of C … Remainder is broken off. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of D; B1=Iddin-Bēl, (mar abarakku); B2=Ibnaya/Nergal-zēru-ibni, (ikkaru of Nergal); C=Nabû-bullissu/... D=Širik/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Title: BM 31976

Paraphrase:
Letter concerning rikis qabli and the recruitement of troops. The head of the Egibi family is involved.
The names of the sender and addressee are lost but can be reconstructed on the basis of a comparison with AO8930, BM30688 and BM 33077 (Jursa AOAT 414/1).
A complains that he has not heard from B. The troops have not been released this year (paṭāru D). When C came to A to settle accounts (nishu nasāhu), he paid the rikis qabli (nadānu). The addressee is urged to pay (našû N) his share (zittu) of the rikis qabli-obligation and assist C (itti ušuzzu) in recruiting (esēru) soldiers (ṣābu), so that he will not cause delay and let him return empty-handed (etēqu Š). If he fails to do so, A will inform the appointed supervisor (bēl piqitti), and B risks to be hand-cuffed (izqātu) and pressured to pay his rikis qabli (rakāsu). A’s threat is reinforced by an oath.

A=Libluṭ; B=Dummuqu; C=Šišku (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Title: BM 31438

Paraphrase:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver to the head of the Egibi family. Undertaking to return a register to the debtor upon repayment.
B should pay 50 shekels of white, medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, which are due from him to A till the 20th Tašrīt (VII) of the 26th year of Darius. As soon as he has paid, the creditor should give the register (giṭṭu) of the LÚ.DÍM to him. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Nabû-kuzub-ilī/Bēl-rēmanni//Eppeš-ilī
Title: BM 30994

Paraphrase:
Receipt of payment by a royal official for transport costs due from the head of the Egibi family. By order of the Governor of Babylon.
A, clerk (sepīru) of the gardeners (nukarribu) and the water-drawers (dalû) of the Grand Palace and the New Palace, receives payment (mahāru) from B1 to cover the costs for transporting (gimru) 100 kor of barley from the irrigated farmland (tamirtu) in Tâmti (to Babylon). He acts by order of (ina iqbi) C, Governor of Babylon. He already (elat) received payment (mahāru) for the transport costs of 50 kor of barley from B2 and B3, following an order by the same governor, which is recorded in a previous register (giṭṭu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A= Ṣillaya/Bīt-iltammar!; B1= Širik/Iddinaya//Egibi (= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B2= Bēl-upahhir; B3= Hašdaya; C= Gūzānu, (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon)
Title: BM 30639

Paraphrase:
Undertaking to register the receipt of dates in the accounts of the temple of Bēl. Paid by the head of the Egibi family on behalf of a third party.
Concerns 50 kor of dates, a partial payment (la gamru), property (makkūru) of the temple of Bēl in Šahrīnu. A should register the dates in the accounts of the temple of Bēl (lē'û ša Bēl) on behalf of (ana muhhi) C1 and C2, and show (the receipt) to B (ušuzzu-kalāmu) by the end of the month. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nabû-bullissu/Murānu//Pahāru; B=Širik/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C1=Dahhûa; C2=Bēl-aplu-iddin
Title: BM 30233

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver without interest. Pledge of property and land.
B owes 3 mina of medium quality silver, of which one-eigth is alloy to A, to be paid without interest in Addar (XII). He pledges 2000 bundles (pītu) of good-quality onions to the creditor until he has received the full repayment of his debt. The onions are currently in in Duršaha'lil.  In addition, he owes him barley. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nergal-uballiṭ/Nabû-bān-ahi.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nergal-ahu-iddin/Ahhea
Title: BM 31216

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Payment for harbor costs.
B owes 22 shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy, to A1 and A2, to be paid in Kislīm (IX). The silver is for covering the harbor costs that are made in the course of an onion transport (kasap kāri ša eleppi ša šūmi, lit. "silver of the harbor, of a boat with onions"). The silver will be at his(*) disposal (ina pāni) on the day that the creditors' promissory notes .... (uncl.) (ú-[ta]r?, [târu, D]) to the debtor. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-aplu-iddin/Nabû-šumu-iškun/Šangû-Ninurta.
(*) it is not clear who is meant.

A1 = Hašdāya; A2 = Lūṣi-ana-nūri; B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 31097

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for lambs.
B owes a broken amount of good female lambs to A, to be delivered in Nisan (I) in Babylon. C acts as guarantor for the delivery. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Madān-šumu-iddin/<Zēria>//Nabāya (brother-in-law of Iddin-Marduk).

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšīya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-iddin/Nabû-tukulti; C = Bēl-eṭēru/Hannu-KAM
Title: BM 32344

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Payment for harbor costs.
B owes 50 shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy, to A, the royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri), to be delivered (in onions) on the 20th of Nisan (I). The silver is for covering the royal harbor costs that are made in the course of an onion transport (kaspu ša kāri ša šarri). Additionally, the debtor should provide 3500 strings of good quality onions and this is somehow related to C's boat, but it is not immediately clear how (Wunsch 1993, 37). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-šumu-līšir/Mušēzib-Nabû//Nabû-šeme.

A = Gimillu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Sîn-šadûnu, royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri); B = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia; C = Bunene-ibni
Bibliography: Reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 52; Waerzeggers, Akkadica 126, no. 1; Sack 1972 (AM), 62
Title: O 509

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley, silver and onions.
B owes 40;0.0.0 kor of barley, 1 mina of silver and  3330 strings (gidlu) of onion to A, the slave of C, to be delivered in two installments. The silver and onions are due in Nisan (I); the full amount of barley (gamru) according to the creditor's measure is due in Ayyār (II), and should be delivered on the creditor's plot of land (or: house) (bītu). Half of the silver should be paid in onions from the debtor's onion field (ši-ti-ik-šú [šikittu]). This barley was given (to B) (nadānu, G Stat) to buy seeds and pay for the maintenance (of the farmers); and the silver was given to pay for outstanding obligations (rēhu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ibni/Nergal-zēru-ibni//Šangû-Nanāya.

A = Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of C; B = Barīki-Adad//Iahalu (wr. ia-ha-a-lu); C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 41420

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for onions.
B1 and his wife (fB2) owe 2400 strings (gidlu) of onions to A, to be delivered in Ayyār (II) in Ālu-ša-Ah-iddin. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Ahušunu/Ninurta-ahu-ēreš; fB2 = fHiptāya, wife of Ahušunu/Ninurta-ahu-ēreš
Title: BM 30578

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with interest. Pledge of land.
B1 and his mother (fB2) owe 5 shekels of silver to A, to be delivered in Addar (XII) with interest. The debtors' upper field (eqlu elēnu) next to C's plot of land, and his lower field (eqlu šupālu) bordering (miṣru) the abarakku's plot of land and planted, partly with date palms (bīt gišimmarē) and partly with grain (pî šulpi) are pledged to the creditor until the debt is fully repaid. The (indebted) silver is that which ... [broken off]. There are additional promissory notes for which fields had been pledged but the details are lost in the broken passages at the end of the tablet. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Šumu-iddin; fB2 = fBāba-eṭrat/Šamaš-
Title: Pitt-river-Museum (Oxford) 52

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for onion without interest.
B owes 1200 strings of good quality onions to A1 and A2, to be delivered  without interest in Ayyār (II). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Šamaš-ahu-iddin/Rāš-il. See also BM 30334 written on the same day and mentioning the same people. 

A1 = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; A2 = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia; B = Nabû-bān-ahi/Nabû-malik
Title: BM 41401

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B1 and B2 owe 32 shekels of silver to A, master of the royal harbor (rab kāri ša šarri) at Ālu-ša-ṣilli-Ea, to be delivered at the end of Simān (III). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Nikkāya.

A = Gimillu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Sîn-šadûnu, master of the royal harbor (rab kāri ša šarri) of Ālu-ša-ṣilli-Ea; B1 = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B2 = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia
Title: BM 30517

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for onions, mustard-seeds, silver and barrels.
B owes 1200 strings (gidlu) of onions, 3 kor of mustard-seeds (kasû), 4 pieces of old, empty barrels and 1/2 shekels of silver to A. The onions should be delivered in Ayyār (II). The rest of the debt should be delivered in Arahsamna (VIII). About the silver it is said that it was received in instalments (ina mīnīšu mahāru). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Ezida-šumu-ibni/Nergal-šumu-ibni(//Šarru-tešlītu [debtor]).

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Ezida-šumu-ibni/Nergal-šumu-ibni//Šarru-tešlītu
Title: BM 31206

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver without interest.
B owes 10 minas of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be paid in Šabāṭ (XI) of Darius' 13th year without interest. Witnesses

A = Iqīša/Nabû-ukīn; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 33931

Paraphrase:
Promissory note ina pāni (?). Fragmentary.
The beginning and end of this document are broken off. It concerns 40 kor of dates which were placed at A1's and A2's disposal and which B should deliver (to them) (ina muhhi).

A1 = Bēl-aplu-uṣur/Arad-Nabû//Ir’anni; A2 = Gimillu/Esagil-zēru//Rē’i-alpi; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Marduk
Title: BM 31395

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B, slave of A owes 13+x kor of dates to his master, assessed field rent (imitti eqli) for arable land (zēru) outside (ša pānat) the Zababa-Gate. He should deliver the dates in one payment according to the 36 liters measure to the courtyard (haṣāru). Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, and 1 darīku-container. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nabû-pitnanni, slave of A
Bibliography: Strassmaier ZA 4 (1889), 128; Peiser, KB 4 (1896), 298; Krecher 1970, 247; Graziani 1991, no. 32; Oppert 1893, 260
Title: BM 30534

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B1 and B2 owe 11 kor of dates to A1 and A2, the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) located at the [name is broken off]-ditch (nār harri). The dates should be delivered to the courtyard (haṣāru) in one payment according to the 36 liters measure. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). They should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates they shall give spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, (and) 2 darīku-containers. The two debtors assume warranty for each other. In addition, there are two date-palmtrees with a 0;1.2.0 kor (of yield). They will receive (našû) remuneration for their gardening work (šissinnu) according to the amount of work they do (mala ina libbi epēšu). Witnesses.

A1 = Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Šāpik-zēri//Nādin-še'im; A2 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Nabû-tattannu-uṣur/Kurbanni-Marduk//Šangû-Ea; B2 = Nidintu/…-iddin//Sîn-nāṣir
Bibliography: Reedition: Wunsch 2000, no. 237; Krecher 1970, 319; Moore, NBBAD (1935), no. 192
Title: Mnb 1826

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver
B owes 4 shekels of silver to A, to be paid on the 10th of Addar (XII). Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Lâbāši/Mušēzib-Bēl//Arad-Sîn
Title: DT 519

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver
B, slave of F, owes 12 shekels of silver to A, slave of C, to be paid on the 8th of Tašrīt (VII). The silver is meant to compensate F for the loss of income due to the absence of his female slave (fD) (mandattu). She had most likely been pledged by B (her husband) to secure one of his silver debt, and consequently she was unavailable to her master. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-iddin//Egibi (brother of Itti-Marduk-balāṭu).

A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of C; B = Nabû-utirri, slave of Itti-Marduk-balāṭu; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; fD = fMiṣatu, slave of F (and wife of B); F = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu
Bibliography: Reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 235; Krecher 1970, 194; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 1 (1890), 1; Shiff 1987, no. 151
Title: BM 31150

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates and barley.
B owes 1 kor of dates (and) 1 kor of barley to A, slave of C. The barley should be delivered in Ayyār (II), while the dates in Tašrīt (VII). Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-uterri, slave of C; B = Ardia/Nergal-šumu-iddin//Sîn-imittu; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 30576

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates and barley. Fragmentary.
B1 and B2 owe 11 kor of dates and 8 kor of barley to A1 and A2. The dates should be delivered in ṭebēt (X) in Uruk (or) if they deliver 10 kor of [broken off] in Addar (XII), they should deliver the mentioned 8 kor of barley in Pahirtu, according to the nishu-calculation of the (city) [broken off]. If they fail to meet the deadline, they will start paying interest of ½ kor per kor of agricultural produce on a monthy basis. The two debtors assume warranty for each other. Witnesses.
 
A1 = Mušēzib-Bēl/Mardukāya; A2 = Šulāya/Zēru-ukīn//Egibi; B1 = Ahhēšu/Bēl-etummanu; B2 = Amurru-ibni/Amurru-hapak
Title: BM 32903
Place of issue Remark: Wr. uru NIGIN-tu4 Read Kabbartu (Cf. ka-ab-[bar]-tu4 GCCI 2, 95). Or: Pahirtu “Place of gathering”?

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley.
B, mayor domo (rab bīti) of C owes 135 kor of barley to A, to be delivered in Dûzu (IV) at the canal in Babylon. Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Bēl-šūzibanni, mayor domo (rab bīti) of C; C = Nergal-šarru-uṣur
Title: BM 30414

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Fixation of interest at default. Pledge of a house.
B owes 2 minas and 5 ½ shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be delivered without interest (qaqqadu) in Ayyār (II). The debtor will start paying the usual 20% of interest on a monthly basis if he fails to meet the deadline. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for 7 1/3 minas of white silver which is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s house (maškānu ṣabātu). Witnesses.
 
A = Bēl-erība/Iddin-Nabû//Ea-eppeš-ilī; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi.
Title: BM 30293

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 18 kor of dates to A, assessed field rent for land (imitti eqli) located next to C and D, including (adi) A’s bīt ritti-estate. B should deliver the dates in one payment according to the 36 liters measure. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), and fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, 2 darīku-containers with a 0.0.3 kor capacity, 0.0.1 kor for the habû uhinni-tax and the šugarrû-supplement. D acts as guarantor for the delivery.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Ardia/Bēl-ēṭir//Sîn-ilī; C = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti; D = Rēmūt-Gula/Marduk-erība//Miṣirāya
Title: BM 30891

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes ½ minas and 5 ½ shekels of stamped (?) silver (ginnu) to A, to be delivered by the end of Ulūl (VI). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Ardia/Lâbāši//Eppeš-ilī
Title: BM 31231

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates and barley.
B owes 17;2.0.0 kor of dates and 3;2.5.0 kor of barley to A. The dates should be delivered in Tašrīt (VII), in Bit-Hahhuru according to the creditor’s measure. B's earlier debt for 120 kor of dates has been paid (eṭēru G Stat). Nobody is allowed to open (petû)(*) without the creditor's permission (ša lā) his [broken off], which is in the debtor’s house behind sealed doors (ša ina bīt PN [(ša)] ana muhhi pehû bābi). Witnesses.
(*) L. 12: In all likelihood a second verb follows the verb "not to open".
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Šamaš-ina-tēšê-ēṭir/Šamaš-iddin//Šamaš-abārī
Title: BM 30491

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 15 kor of dates, assessed field rent (imitti eqli) for 2 sectors (bābu) of land located next to C1 and C2. One half (ahi zitti) is due to A1; the other half to his brothers (A2 and A3).  B should deliver the dates in one installment according to the 36 liters measure to the courtyard (haṣāru). Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give a load of firewood, (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangagu), x darīku-containers, 0.0.1 kor for the habû uhinni-tax and 0.0.0.3 kor for the šugarrû-supplement. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A3 = Nergal-ušēzib/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Libluṭ/Hašdāya; C1 = Balāṭu; C2 = Nabû-šumu-iškun
Title: BM 33148

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in barley. Fragmentary.
B owes 26.0.0.0 kor of barley to A, slave of C. It is the assessed field rent (imitti eqli) on D’s field, located at the upper gate (bābu elēnu) next to (the field of (?)) the Bēl and Nabû-temples and pledged to A. Details on the terms of repayment are mainly lost in the broken passage at the end of the tablet’s obverse side and beginning of its reverse side. When the text becomes legible again, it is said that the payment for the tithe of the Nergal-temple (ešrû ša Nergal) has been settled (eṭēru G Stat). In addition, there is an earlier claim (rašûtu) but the pertinent passage is badly preserved: […] half a share (ahi zitti) […] D they will … (ú-šu-uz-zu)(?). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Sîn-šadûnu.
 
A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of C; B = [the name of the debtor is broken off]; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; D = Nergal-nāṣir/Nādin
Title: BM 31903

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates and silver. Payment for rikis qabli.
B owes 100 kor of dates (and) 1/3 mina of silver to A. The dates should be delivered in Tašrīt (VII). In Addar (XII) of Cambyses’ 1st year, the silver should be paid at the rate of 100 bundles per shekel(*). He should pay the dates and silver from the income of his earlier pledged plot of land. In addition, there is an earlier claim by A that is still outstanding. The 1/3 mina is the equivalent in silver (šīmu) for the dates and onions that were delivered in payment for the rikis qabli of the 1st year. Witnesses.
(*)1 šiqlu 100 pi-tu4 (?)
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nergal-nāṣir/Nādin
Title: BM 41418

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for revenue from impost on land, to be delivered in dates.
B owes 16.1 kor of dates to A, impost on land (imittu). The dates should be delivered in one instalment together with the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), fibres (mangagu), (and) spadices (gipû), (and) 2 darīku-containers. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Bēlšunu/Bēl-iddin//Agru
Bibliography: Reedition: Wunsch 2000, no. 228; Krecher 1970, 293; Ziemer, BA 3 (1896), 459
Title: BM 31002

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver. A brief reminder.
A receives 9 shekels of silver from fB, paid for the interest that accrued on one of her husband’s (C) silver (debts) after his death. A brief reminder. Names of 2 witnesses (introduced by ina ušuzzi). No name of the scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; fB = fBunanītu, wife of C; C = Apla-dād-natan
Bibliography: Reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 160; Moldenke, CTMMA (1893), no. 18.
Title: MMA 79.7.35

Paraphrase:
Receipt for a donkey.
A receives (mahāru) one white donkey from B. This donkey, which has the cuneiform sign LÚ engraved on his neck (tikku) and ṭu-ru (uncl.) (ṭūru), belongs to the sons of A and it is at C’s disposal. The recipient has not received payment for the middu (maybe the word mindu, “measured amount (of barley)”, is intended here) or any other impost (mimmu gabbu) from the giver. Should C raise claims against B (itti dabābu), the owner will credit this donkey to C and will give B proof of it  (itti PN ušuzzu-nadānu). Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe: Puršû/Arad-Gula/Ēṭiru.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Nabû-ittannu//Ēṭiru; B = Bēl-ittannu/Nergal-kāṣir//Saggilāya; C = Ahhēšāya/Nidintu-Bēl
Title: BM 40547

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price for a bondwoman.
A1, A2 and fA3 receive (eṭēru) 47 shekels of silver from B, the price for their bondwoman that was due from C (=buyer?). The name of the bondwoman is not given.
 
A1 = Mušallim-Marduk/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Kāṣir; A2 = Sūqāya/Marduk-nāṣir/Rab-banê; fA3 = fHabašinnatu/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Kāṣir; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Suqāya.
Title: BM 32920

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver and return of pledged slaves.
Concerns the debt of 3(!) minas of medium-quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, that B owes to A and for which two of the debtor's slaves (C1 and fC2) were taken as pledge.
The promissory note that was issued provided that B should pay back his debt by the 20th of Nisan (I) (the duplicate has Nisan, 10th), i.e. within half a year: should he fail to do so, his pledged slaves would have been transferred to the creditor’s ownership with the purchase price being equal to the value of the debt. In the present document, dated in Abu (V), it is recorded that B gives the 3 minas of silver to A (thus paying his debt within the established deadline). As a result, A promptly returns the promissory note together with the slaves to B (târu-nadānu). Names of 8 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ibni/Šāpik-zēri//Šangû-Sîn; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C1= Nabû-lū-šulmu, slave of B; fC2= fLū-balṭat
Title: BM 31509

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley.
fA, slave of C, receives 10 kor (c. 1,800 l) of barley on her master's orders from B, slave of D. This payment does not include the previous barley which E and fA took (našû) (from B). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA = fNanāya-silim, slave of C; B = Madān-Bēl-uṣur, slave of D; C = Nergal-ahu-iddin; D = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; E = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti
Title: BM 31255

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley. Lease of related payment.
A receives (eṭēru) 9.1 kor (c. 1,656 l) of barley from B, according to the receipt (giṭṭu) that belongs to D. The barley is the šibšu-impost on the harvest from a field in Litamu and paid on behalf of (ana muhhi) C. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šamaš-ēṭir/Bulluṭāya//Ṭābihu; B = Libluṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; D = Nabû-šumu-uṣur
Title: BM 31056

Paraphrase:
Receipt for (broken).
Concerns something the nature of which is lost in the badly preserved passage at the beginning of the document, which is to last for 2 months and owed by B. A receives it from B.
 
A = Širku (wr. ši-il-tu)/Iddināya//Egibi(?) (aka: Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-bullissu/Šamaš-ēreš//Eppeš-ilī
Title: BM 30832

Paraphrase:
Receipt of barley.
A receives 8;4.0 kor (c. 1,584 l) of barley from B in Bīt-Hahhuru. He acts by C’s order and according to what is written in his register (giṭṭu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-nāṣir/Ašarēdu/Bulluṭāya; B = Širku/Iddināya//Egibi (= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/...//…
Title: BM 30657

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley.
Concerns 10 kor (c. 1,800 l) of barley, the produce (ebūru) from a field (eqlu) in Bit-Hahhuru. In Ayyār (II) of the 14th year E received (maḫāru) either this barley or the field (uncl.). The barley is owed by C1 and C2, slaves of B, to D. A presented the creditor’s receipts (giṭṭu) and tablets (ṭuppu) that pertain to these 10 kor of barley to the debtors’ master (ana pani našû) and the latter must have agreed to pay for his slaves. Thus, in the present document A receives the barley according to the said documents of D from B for the account of C1 and C2. Names of 9 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šamaš-ēṭir/Nabû-uballiṭ//Ēṭiru; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C1 = Ubār/ Arad-Bēl//Ea-eppeš-ilī, slave of B; C2 = Rēmūt-Baba, slave of B; D = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-uballiṭ//Ēṭiru; E = Libluṭ/Irībi
Title: BM 30773

Paraphrase:
Receipt of payment for salaries and rations from the head of the Egibi family.
A receives payment (eṭēru) from B for the salary (idū) and rations (kurummatu) of C1, C2 and C3 who went* for 3 months to Elam. The exact amount of silver received is probably lost in the broken part at the beginning of the tablet. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

*lit. who (went/will go) to (adi) Elam.

A=Nergal-ēṭir/Kalbaya//Šumu-libši; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C1=Nabû-iddin/m..., brother of C2; C2=Zitti-Nabû/m..., brother of C1; C3=Sūqaya/Kalbaya
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 31409

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver by a slave of the Egibi family. Payment instead of doing reserve duty in the army. On account of holding institutional land.
A1, a slave of D, and A2 receive payment (mahāru) on amaqātccount of (ana muhhi) C's bow-land (qaštu) from B1 and B2, messenger (mār šipri) of Amurru-šarru-kīni, deputy (šanû) of the menials (kinattu). They are paid off? ([eṭ-r]a-a-a’ [eṭēru]). The amount they receive is 1/2 mina of stamped(?) silver (ginnu) used for purchases and sales (nadānu u mahāru), and this is paid instead (kūm) of actually serving as a reservist(?) (kutallûtu) in the 16th year of Darius. It includes the contributions from E and F, messenger of fG, but the exact amounts are broken off. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe

A1=Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of D; A2=Iddinaya/Ardia; B1=Nergal-ahu-iddin/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ; B2=Nabû-nipšaru/Iqīšaya, (lúKIN.GI4.A [mār šipri]), (šanû); C=Bēl-iddin/Nabû-zēru-ušabši; D=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); E=Madān-iddin ...; F=Iddinaya ..., ( lúA.KIN [mār šipri]) of fG; fG= fSaggaya/Ea-kīni, wife of F
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 32859

Paraphrase:
About a ploughed field from a bow-fief, and about a plow (team) that belongs to the head of the Egibi family. Very fragmentary.
Concerns arable land (zēru) that has been broken up by the mayāru-plow, belongs to A's bow-land (bīt qašti) and has been given to B. What exactly happens with it is lost in the badly preserved passages of the tablet. The plow team (epinnu) of C is mentioned but in a broken context. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nergal-nāṣir; B=Iddinaya/Arad-Bēl; C=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 31433

Paraphrase:
Labour contract to sail a boat to Babylon as part of the kanšu-service. Salary to be paid by the head of the Egibi family.
A shall sail for a monthly salary of 8 shekels in the boat that belongs to B (ina eleppi alāku). It is part of (B's?) kanšu service for the King. B shall give 0.1.1.3 kor royal flour!?(qēmu)*, cress (sahlû) and oil (šamnu) to A each month. The document describes in detail what A can and cannot do with the boat, but the passage is fragmentary. Apparently, he may (or: shall) sail to Babylon and Babylonians are said to be on the boat. Another fragmentary clause stipulates that "from the 10th of Simān (III) [PN] [...] shall g[ive]." Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

*Wr. KI.LÁ (rd. qí-me!?) ša šarri.

A=Bulṭaya/Habaṣīru//Rē'i-alpi; B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 30787

Paraphrase:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver. Due from the head of the Egibi family to the Governor of Kish through an intermediary.
B should pay 23 minas of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, that are due from him to A in Ayyar in Babylon. He does not have to pay interest (ina qaqqadi). He owes the silver because A paid it (it-ta-din [nadānu]), on B's orders (ina qí-bit [ina qibi]) to one of his creditors (rāšû), namely C, Governor of Kish (šākin ṭēmi). Names of 12 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nabû-uballissu (wr.-ú-bal-liṭ-su)/Nabû-kēšir//Eda-ēṭir; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Zababa-iddin/Etellu//Ahhū, (šākin ṭēmi of Kiš)
Title: BM 33936

Paraphrase:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver to the head of the Egibi family.
B should completely pay off (gamāru-ma eṭēru) a broken amount of marked, first-rate quality (babbanû) silver of the kind commonly used for purchases and sales (nadānu u mahāru) that is due from him to A in Šabāt (XI). The previous debt (u'iltu) has already been paid (eṭēru, G Stat). Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Niqūdu/Nergal-iddin//Nūr-zana ...
Title: BM 31951

Paraphrase:
Letter concerning an ilku-payment.
The sender of this letter informs B that C, a Babylonian who resides (ašābu) in D’s house in Bīt-Hahhuru, paid (it-ta-din [nadānu]) for his ilku-tax and B should not argue with him about it (itti PN dabābu). The name of the sender is not preserved. Jursa AOAT 414/1, 168 argues that he was most likely a rab hanšê-official responsible for the mobilisation of troops considering the fact that in the current letter he receives ilku-silver, i.e. silver that was earmarked for paying the soldiers who will actually perform C’s military service. The addressee is to be identified with Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu, head of the Egibi family. C is probably identical with his namesake from the Ibni-ilu family, for whom see Wunsch2000032.

A=…; B=Širik (wr. mši-rik-ki) (=?Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Bēl-iddin (= Bēl-iddin/Sîn-ēreš//Ibni-ilu); D=Bēl-zēru-iddin
Title: BM 31416

Paraphrase:
Receipt of payment by a royal official for transport costs from the head of the Egibi family. By order of the Governor of Babylon.
A, courtier (ša rēš šarri) and clerk (sepīru) of the courtiers (ša rēši) of the New Palace, receives payment (mahāru) from B to cover the costs for transporting (gimru) 316 kor of dates. He acts by order of (ina iqbi) C, Governor of Babylon. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.

A= Aplaya, (ša rēš šarri), (sepīru); B= Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C= Gūzānu, (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon)
Title: BM 30980

Paraphrase:
Summons to settle the payment of silver for the “contribution of the archer” (kind of service obligation?) with the head of the Egibi family.
B should come (alāku) to Babylon on the 20th of Tašrīt (VII) in order to reach an agreement with A (itti PN dabābu, lit. "to argue a case"). It concerns the silver, the "gift" of/for the archer (qašti, wr. lúqašti) which A gave (ša iddinu, =paid?) to B. This type of contribution (nidintu, lit. "gift") probably falls within the category of state service obligations. If B fails to come, he shall pay 1 mina of silver. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Gūzānu/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Gahal
Title: BM 30629

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver from the head of the Egibi family.
Two brothers, A1 and A2, receive (mahāru) silver from B in accordance with what is stipulated (ina) in their promissory notes (u'iltu). The amount is broken but may be reconstructed as 1 ½ minas on the basis of MNB1870 (= TCL 13 185). It includes (adi) half the mina that B had transferred (nadānu, G Stat.) to C (for which see BM77848 = Dar 213). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A1=Bēl-nādin-apli/Bēl-uballiṭ//Pahāru; A2=Nabû-iddin/Bēl-uballiṭ//Pahāru; B=Marduk-naṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C=Šumu-ukīn/Bēl-ēṭir//Šangû-Nanāya
Title: Abraham 2004 001

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates. General pledge.
fB1 and B2 owe 16;3.2.0 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in Arahsamna (VIII), on the creditor's plot of land (bītu). They assume warranty for each other and the one who has dates available at the due date shall deliver them to the creditor. D acts as guarantor for the delivery. Originally, the debt was debited against fB1 and husband (C) with B2 as guarantor. In addition, there is a promissory note for a young male goat and a young sheep, which was due two and a half years ago (lit. "since Ṭebēt (X) of the 9th year"). All their property in and outside the city are pledged to the creditor (for both debts?). No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged property. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Niqudu/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Sippê(a).

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; fB1 = fKaššāya/Nabû-bān-ahi; B2 = Madān-ahu-iddin/Bēl-ahu-ušabši//Malahu; C = Iqūpu, husband of fB1; D = Gūzānu/Rēmūtu//Arad-Nergal.
Bibliography: Reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 200; Marx BA 4 (1902), 50; Shiff 1987, no. 129.
Title: BM 30372

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver without interest. Payment for harbor costs. Fragmentary.
B owes 2 shekels (?) of silver to A, the royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri),  to be paid without interest in Ayyār (II). The silver is "of the royal harbor" (ša kāri ša šarri), meaning that it is paid to cover the shipment costs of agricultural produce. The tablet is broken off after the repayment clause. Names of the witnesses and of the scribe is broken off.

A = Gimillu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Sîn-šadûnu, royal harbor officer; B = Bēl-iddin/Nabû...
Title: BM 32113

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with interest.
B owes 54 2/3 shekels of silver to A, to be delivered in Dûzu (IV) with interest. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for an interest-bearing silver debt. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Rēmūt-Bēl/Mušēzib-Marduk//Egibi.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-edu-uṣur/Rahiannu
Title: BM 31210

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates.
B owes 100;0.0.0 kor of dates to fA, to be delivered in Šabāṭ (XI) in the 36 liters royal measure by the river in Babylon. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bān-zēri//Bēl-eṭēru (debtor).

fA = fIna-Esagila-rāmat/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bān-zēri//Bēl-eṭēru
Title: BM 33059

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley.
B owes 10;1.4 kor of barley to A. The creditor is probably to be identified with the head of the Egibi family (Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu, aka Širku). Names of 2 (or 3?) witnesses, but not introduced by mukinnu ("witness"), and the scribe: Nidintu/… .

A = Širik (without affiliation, or broken?); B = Nabû-šumu-uṣur (without affiliation, or broken?)
Title: MNB 1868
Place of issue Remark: Place name not listed in RGTC 8.

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for onions and silver without interest.
B1 and his wife (fB2) owe 3000 strings (gidlu) of onions and 3 shekels of silver to A. The onions should be delivered in Ayyār (II) in Ālu-ša-Ah-iddin. The silver should be paid without interest in Addar (XII). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Nabû-nāṣir/Mār-bīti-ēreš; fB2 = fHubuṣu, wife of Nabû-nāṣir/Mār-bīti-ēreš
Title: BM 30635

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Fragmentary.
B owes 1 mina and 2 shekels of silver to A, to be paid on the 10th of Dûzu (IV). A fragmentarily preserved passage mentions a slave of Bēl..., the harbor master of Til-Gula. The lower edge of the tablet is broken off. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Mušēzib-Marduk/Šadûnu.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-ahu-rēmanni, slave of Bēl..., harbor master (rab kāri) of Til-Gula
Title: BM 32148

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for onions.
B1, B2, B3, B4, B5, B6 and B7 owe 17000 strings (gidlu) of quality onions to A, to be delivered in Ayyār (II) at the Borsippa canal. The debtors assume warranty for each other. B1 acts as guarantor for the delivery. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note in which B1 appears as the sole debtor (ina muhhi ~, ana elattišu). Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Ahu-ittabši/Nabû-malik; B2 = Nabû-zēru-iddin/Nabû-kî-ili; B3 = Kabtia/Iddin; B4 = Nabû-zēru-iddin/Bariki; B5 = Nabû-ahu-iddin/Ilū-adinu; B6 = Iddin-nūnu/Ahu-likīn; B7 = .../Šamašāya
Title: BM 30577

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver, barley, onions, dates and sesame seeds without interest.
B owes 1 mina and 6 1/2 shekels of silver, 57;3.3.0 kor of barley, 7700 strings (gidlu) and 17 bundles (pītu) of onions, 12;0.0.0 kor of dates and 0;3.3.0 kor of sesame seed to A, slave of C. The debtor should deliver part of the silver (1/2 mina and 6 1/2 shekels) and all of the onions in Nisan (I) of the next year. In Ayyār (II), he should deliver the full amount (gamru) of barley in one payment and according to the measure of the creditors' master (C). Delivery of silver, onions and barley is at the latter's house (or: plot of land) (bītu). As for the dates, they are due on 15th of Šabāṭ (XI) of the current year (lit. "Cambyses' accession year") and should be delivered under the same conditions as the barley. The sesame seeds are due in Dûzu (IV).
In addition, there is previous claim (rašûtu) by A and one by his master (C) against the same debtor. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Sîn-šadûnu.

A = Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-ēṭir/Nergal-šumu-ibni; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Title: Liverpool unknown 27 (Strassmaier 1885)

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 1 mina of stamped(?) silver (ginnu), used for purchases and sales (nadānu u mahāru), to A, to be paid in Ulūl (VI). Witnesses.

A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-iddin/Atrammu
Title: BM 30416

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver
B owes 1 mina of white, medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be paid without interest in Simān (III). C acts as guarantor for the payment of the debt. He should bring the silver to the creditor in Babylon. Witnesses.

A = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-kēšir/M-ušallimMarduk//Eppeš-ilī; C = Itti-Sîn (or: (Ki-Sîn)/Iddināya
Title: BM 31330

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Interest at default. Fragmentary.
The beginning of the tablet is broken off. Then we hear that B owes 1/2 minas and 8 shekels of silver .... [broken off], a remainder, to A. He should pay it without interest according to a previous tablet(?) (GIŠ Ú NU, uncl.) in Dûzu (IV). He will start paying the yearly 20% interest on a monthly basis, if he fails to meet the deadline. Witnesses.

A = …/…//Arabti; B =  Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi (Širku/Iddināya); C = Bēl-nādin-apli
Title: BM 30501

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for revenue from impost on the harvest, to be delivered in dates.
B owes x+4 kor of dates to A, the impost on the harvest (imitti ebūri) from land (eqlu) located opposite (muhhi) the channel (alku) of the canal. He should deliver the dates to the courtyard in one payment according to the 36 liters measure. Deliver is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangagu), 2 loads of firewood, and 2 darīku-containers. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nergal-iddin/Šamaš-ahu-iddin//Gallābu
Title: BM 30405

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 7.2.3.0 kor of dates to A1 and A2, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu) that was established by C as main investor. He should deliver the full amount (gamru) of dates according to the 36 liters measure in Arahsamna (VIII) at the canal in Bit-ṭab-Bēl. Witnesses. Scribe: Nergal-nāṣir/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Nūr-Sîn.
 
 
A1 = Bēl-īpuš/Rāšil//Nappāhu; A2 = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Bēl-mukīn-zēri/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Arad-Nergal; C = Iddin-Marduk(/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn)
Title: BM 33562

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes a [broken amount of] mina(s) and 5 shekels of silver to A, to be delivered at the end of Simān (III). Witnesses.
 
A = Šamaš-mukīn-apli/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 77910

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 2 minas of silver to A, slave of C, to be paid at the end of Nisan (I). Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-uterri, slave of C; B = Iddin-Nabû/šumu-ja//Sîn-nāṣir; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 31148

Paraphrase:
Payment for a necklace to the one who manufactured it.
B pays 10 shekels of silver to A for (šīmu, lit. "purchase price") a necklace (kišādu) with gold mounting (mandītu). Cf. BM30840 (= Nbn 267); also similar are Mnb1828 (= TCL 12, 101) and BM30875 (= Nbn 501).  Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nādin/Nergal-ētir//Bābūtu.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Bēl-ušallim//Bābūtu; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi
Title: BM 30522

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley. Mutual warranty.
B1 and his wife (fB2) owe 1 kor of barley to A, to be delivered without interest in Ayyār (II). The two debtors assume warranty for each other. Witnesses.
 
A = Šulāya/Zēru-ukīn//Egibi; B1 = Hummuru/Adad-…; fB2 = fMulli, wife of B1
Title: BM 31031

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley. Pledge of persons.
B owes 44.3.2.0 kor of barley to A, to be delivered without interest (qaqqadu) in Dûzu (IV) at the Arammu-§a-Nabû Canal in Babylon according to the creditor’s measure. The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s cook (C) and [broken off]. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged cook until A has received the full repayment of his debt. Witnesses and the Scribe: Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi.
 
A = Šullumu/Etellu//Egibi; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; C = Ina-ṣilli-Bēl
Title: BM 30404

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 44 kor of dates to A and his brothers, the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) that extends from (ultu) Šuppatu onwards. The full amount (gamru) of dates should be delivered in one instalment according to A’s measure. Delivery is due in Tašrīt (VII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amount of) spathes (tuhallu), a load of firewood, spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangaga) and 1 darīku-container. He is further obliged to deliver one young (kalūmu) male sheep on the 20th of Addar (XII).  No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu) nor for the services of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-nāṣir/Nādin//Bābūtu
Title: BM 30907

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 22 kor of quality barley (babbanû) to A1 and A2, slave of C, within the framework of the business partnership that was established by C as main investor. The barley should be delivered in one payment according to the 36 liters measure in A1’s house located at the Piqudu-canal. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for 10;2.0.0 kor of barley, which is still pending. Witnesses.
 
A1 = Ubār/Ina-tēšê-ēṭir//Ša-nāšīšu; A2 = Nabû-ayyālu, slave of C; B = Nabû-zēru-ibni(?)/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 41448

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver without interest.
B owes 1/3 minas and 5 shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be delivered without interest (qaqqadu) in Nisan (I). Witnesses
 
A = Kalbi-Bāba/Iddin-Nabû//Arad-Ea; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 31184

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley and silver.
B owes 50 kor of barley, 1(*) mina of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy and 1 mina of stamped (?) silver (ginnu) to A. In Dûzu (IV), the barley should be delivered according to the 36 liters measure. The mentioned silver, namely, 2 minas, of which 1 mina 40(?) and […] (= something the details of which are lost in the broken passage), should be paid in Šahrīnu. It is not said when the silver payment should take place, unless this was specified in the broken passage. In addition, there is an earlier claim by the same creditor which is still pending. Witnesses.
(*)Joannès, Achemenet, reads 2!.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nādin/Mukīn-Marduk
Title: BM 30434

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 2;1.2 kor of dates to A and his brothers, the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) ša šibbu (uncl.) and (planted with) date palms which is located at the ditch (harru) of the Reisissi family. He should deliver the dates in one instalment according to the 36 liters measure. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation to the courtyard (haṣāru): for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), and fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, 0;0.1 kor for the habû uhinni-tax and 0;0.0.3 kor for the šugarrû-supplement. Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = brother of A1; B = Ša-Nabû-šū/Libluṭ
Title: BM 31302

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates, barley and silver. Payment for a debt.
B owes 88.1;3.0.0 kor of dates, 11.2.4.4 kor of barley (and) 4 ½ shekels of silver to A. The silver should be paid in Nisan (I). The full amount of barley should be delivered in one instalment according to the creditor’s measure in Ayyār (II) at the Borsippa-canal. The full amount of dates should be delivered in one [instalment] according to the creditor’s [measure] in Tašrīt (VII) at the [name of the canal is broken off]. The text continues by referring to [land (?)] in Uruk […], that the creditor took as pledge. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged objects until A has received the full repayment of his debt. A fragmentarily preserved passage refers to going on a campaign on behalf of the king (alaktu ša šarri)(*) and travel provisions (ṣidittu) […] that have been paid for to the summoner official (dēkû). The document concludes by pointing out that the (indebted) silver has been paid for the obligations to provide military equipment (rikis qabli) and serve as (or furnish) a replacement (kutallûtu) for Cambyses’ 5th year. Witnesses.
(*) [ana ala]kti ša šarri, Joannès, Achemenet.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēru-iddin
Title: BM 31461

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver an onions. Payment for a debt.
B owes 1/3 mina of silver (and) 40 bundels (pītu) of onions to A, slave of C. The silver should be delivered in Nisan (I) (i.e., in another 11 months), while the onions in [the name of the month is broken off, but probably at the onion harvest time]. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note which is still pending. In [the name of the month], he will [deliver] the rest of the document is broken off. Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-ayyālu, slave of C; B = Nabû-uballiṭ/[PN]; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 33949

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 20 shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-fifth is alloy, in addition to (elat) 5 kor of barley to A. The (indebted) silver is what C invested in a business partnership (with A and B) and is to be used for the purchase (šīmu) of seeds (zēru). They agreed (magāru Gt) that it should be entirely paid back (šalāmu G) from the debtor’s income from an onion field (šikittu) which he is cultivating (erēšu). The barley should be delivered in Dûzu (IV). The earlier promissory note is invalid (hepû). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Sūqāya/Marduk-ēṭir/Ṭābih-kāri.
 
A = Širiktu/Nūrea//Dannea; B = Nabû-damiq/Nabû-bān-zēri; C = Iddin-Marduk
Title: MLC 1760

Paraphrase:
Security for debt. Interest and mutual warranty. Ina-pani debt note.
B1 and B2 owe (ina pāni)  2 minas of silver to A. From the 1st of Ayyār (II) onwards they will have to pay an annual interest of 20%, on a monthly basis. They also guarantee for each other. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-būnšu-apli/Ubār.
 
A = Nabû-…/Ahu-līšir; B1 = Mušēzib-Bēl/Mardukāya; B2 = Šulāya/Zēru-ukīn(//Egibi)
Title: BM 30595

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
The tablet records the purchase of agricultural land which, given its irregular shape, is calculated according to two measured areas: each one of these plots is described separately, marked on the tablet by a line drawn at the end of each paragraph (and indicated below in the paraphrase by LINE).
A purchases 5;1.3.5 kor (71925 m2) of agricultural land (zēru) located in the open country from B. It consists partly of cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi) bearing fruit (iṣṣi bilti) and partly of grain cultivated as well as wasteland (mērešu u kišubbû). It is located below the Bānītu canal, in front of the Zababa Gate, in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon. LINE
The first measured area (mišihtu), consisting of 0;3.1.0.5 Kor (8587,5 m2) of cultivated date garden (gišimmarē zaqpu) and 0;0.1.4.8 Kor (810 m2) of wasteland, has a regular shape: its two long sides measure each 949 cubits (474,5 m) – the upper one in the West borders on (the property of) B, the seller, and the lower one in the East on (the property of) C. The two short sides measure each 40 cubits (20 m): the upper front in the North is adjacent to the royal street (harrān šarri) on the bank (kišādu) of the Bānītu Canal and its lower front in the South borders on the second measured area (libbu eqli). LINE
The second portion (mišihtu) consists of 3;0.1.4.7 Kor (41302,5 m2) of cultivated date garden (gišimmarē zaqpu) and 1;2.5.1 Kor (21225 m2) of land cultivated with grain (mērešu). Its upper side in the West measures 1630 cubits (815 m) and borders on (the property of) B, the seller; the lower side in the East is 1614 cubits (807 m) long and borders on (the property of D). The two short sides measure each 160 cubits (80 m): the one in the North is adjacent to the first measured area and (the property of) C – while the one in the South borders on (the property of) B, the seller. LINE
Overall, the purchased land measures 5;1.3.5 Kor (71925 m2). It includes (ina libbi) 3;3.2.5.2 Kor (c. 49890 m2) of date garden (gišimmarē zaqpu) valued (šuqultu) at a ratio of 1 shekel of silver per 0;0.0.0.6 Kor (45 m2) resulting in a total value of 18 minas and 28 2/3 shekels – and 1;3.0.5.8 Kor (22035 m2) of cultivated as well as wasteland (mērešu u kišubbû) valued (šuqultu) at a ratio of 1 shekel of silver for each 0;0.1 Kor (450 m2) of land resulting in a total value of 49 shekels. A declares the equivalent for this land together with the seller B (A itti B mahīra nabû išām) to be 19 minas and 17 2/3 shekels of silver: he pays (nadānu) the total purchase price (šīmišu gamrūtu), plus 1 mina and 20 shekels of silver as additional payment (kî atri). LINE
B acknowledges that he has received (mahāru) in total 20 minas and 37 2/3 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), and he is satisfied (apālu G Stat). The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. Fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of the seller B, instead of his seal impression (kunukku). Names of 6 witnesses and 4 scribes.
 
A = Kabti-ilī-Marduk/Nabû-tabni-uṣur//Egibi; B = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-kuzub-ilī//Rab-banê; C = Nabû-šarru-ibni/Marduku; D = Šāpik-zēri/Bēlšunu//Kānik-bābi
Title: BM 32849

Paraphrase:
Rescission of previous purchase of land, with receipt for redemption of silver.
A had bought (mahīra epēšu) two plots of land from B, paying their full price (ana kasap gamirtu), in Darius 18th year. The purchase included land cultivated with trees and grain (zēru zaqpu u mērešu) located in Litamu in front of the Uraš Gate in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon, and another house building plot (qanû) in Hursagkalamma, near to C ‘s house . The silver (the exact amount is lost because the top part of the tablet is broken) and its interest (hubullu) have been paid (eṭēru N) by A to B, as written in the document recording the deal (akî ṭuppi mahīri).
Now, one or more years later (the tablet is certainly dated after Darius’ 19th year, but the passage regarding the date is poorly preserved), A rescinds his previous purchase and gives (nadānu) the possessory title (ṭuppi mahīri) back to B. The parties agree that there is no claim or legal lawsuit (dīnu u ragāmu), nor any other creditor’s claim (mimma rašûtu gabbi) from A against B, regarding the field and house building plot of land. Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-muballissu/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Sîn-tabni-uṣur; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Bēl-…/Erība-Marduk//Arad-Nergal
Title: BM 32525+

Paraphrase:
Receipt
A receives (eṭēru) 3 shekels of silver from B for C᾽s urāšu-obligation. This is in addition to previous receipts (giṭṭu). Names of 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A = Bāni-zēri/Dayyān-Marduk//Sîn-šadûnu; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 266; Krecher 1970, 203; Dandamaev, PAS 4 (1986), 77; Shiff 1987, no. 163 (Phd dissertation).
Title: BM 30708

Paraphrase:
Undertaking under oath to bring the new co-debtor after a debt renewal.
A swears to B, by the gods and the king, that by mid (qablu)(*) Šabāṭ (XI) he will bring along (abāku) C,  re-issue (e’ēlu) the promissory notes for silver, wool and sheep that he together with C owe to B, and hand them over (nadānu) to B. It concerns debts that were originally owed by A together with C’s father (D) to B’s father-in-law (E). A had taken the promissory notes about these debts away (našû) from (lapāni) B, no doubt to have them re-issued in his own name and in the name of his new co-debtor C. See also BM31531. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Taqīš-Gula/Arad-Marduk//Bēl-ēṭir.
Notes: (*) Sandowicz 2012 reads i-na instead of qablu.
 
A = Šaddinnu/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Mandidi; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi, E’s son-in-law; C = Širik/Marduk-erība//Sîn-karābī-išme, son of D; D = Marduk-erība/Iqīša//Sîn-karābī-išme, father of C; E = IddinMarduk/Iqīša//Nūr-Sîn; Undertaking under oath to bring along the co-debtor’s son and renew the promissory note.
A takes an oath by the gods and the king about a promissory note (u’iltu) for silver, wool and sheep which he and B owe to C, and which he received (našû) from (lapāni) D, the son of C’s daughter. A swears that that by the middle (qablû) of Šabāṭ (XI) he will present E, the son of his co-debtor,  together with C’s promissory note. He and E will have to bind themselves anew (e’ēlu) (to that agreement), and they will give the document to D. The consequences of a possible failure in sticking to this commitment are not fully written out in this tablet. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Arad-Gula/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Ēṭiru
 
A = Šaddinnu/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Mandidi; B = Marduk-erība/Iqīšāya//Sîn-karābī-išme; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; D = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi, nephew of C; E = Širik/Marduk-erība//Sîn-karābī-išme (son of B)
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 352; Krecher 1970, 271f; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 3 (1894), 53f.; Shiff 1987, no. 227; Sandowicz 2012, no. O.167.
Title: BM 30733

Paraphrase:
Receipt for the partial payment of a silver debt.
Concerning the promissory note (u’iltu) for the total amount of 5 mina of stamped(?) silver (ginnu) and 20 empty barrels belonging to A that are due from B.
Of this total debt A receives (mahāru) from B without interest according to his promissory note 1 2/3 mina and 5 shekels of stamped(?) silver (ginnu) and 20 empty barrels. A receives from B 20 shekels of stamped(?) silver (ginnu) as rent (idū) for his house. A didn’t receive from B his household goods (udê bīti). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Iddin-Bēl/Nabû-udammiq//Nādin-še'im.
See also BM30701 (Dar. 280) in which A and B establish a business partnership. No doubt that the silver and the barrels in this receipt between these two business partners are business assets.
 
A= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B= Bēl-iqīša/Lâbāši//Pahāru
Title: BM 30716

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Purchase price for oxen. Undertaking under oath to pay in time.
B owes a broken amount (x minas) of silver to A, to be paid in Arahsamna (VIII). It is the price for his purchase of 3 four-year-old oxen and (the right to) their female offspring ((w)aldu, wr. maldātu! Pl., T: šiddatu) for 4 years. B swears before Bēl and the king that he will pay (eṭēru) before Arahsamna has passed (etēqu). All (mala bašû) the slaves (amīlūtu) of B and his house in Šahrītu are pledged to A. No other creditor shall dispose of the pledged slaves till A has received his silver in full. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Arad-Bēl/Bēl-ēṭir//Egibi. His previous debt (u'iltu) have been paid (hepû).
 
A= Šulāya/Zēru-ukīn//Egibi; B= Amurru-šamā’/Zabinu
Bibliography:
Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 175; Krecher 1970, 120.
Reedition: Sandowicz 2012, text O.9
Title: BM 33119

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Antichretic pledge of a house.
B owes 1 mina and 20 shekels of silver to A, an alphabet scribe (sepīru) in the crown prince’s service (for whom, see also BM31343 and BM33118). Technically speaking, it is the crown prince's property (makkūru), managed by (ša qātē) A. The debtor’s house located next to D1’s house and D2’s house is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). B will be charged (manû) for whatever work (dullu) that is to be done in the house with bricks (libittu), reeds (qanû) and beams (gušūru). He should also caulk (šanû) the roof and repair the wall foundations (asurrû). E guarantees for the payment of the silver. Silver has been sent (kaspa nadin, lit. “given”) to B by  fF (ina qibi, lit. “by order of ~), a messenger (mârat šipri) of his mother(?) fG. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Gabbi-ilī-šarru-uṣur/Ilteri-hanān, scribe (sepīru) of the C, crown prince; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Cambyses, crown prince (mār šarri); D1 = Bēl-iddin/Rēmūt//Dēkû; D2 = Šāpik-zēri/Nergal-ušallim//Sîn-karābī-išme; E = Nergal-ēṭir/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fF = fAna-makanišu, messenger (mârat šipri) of fG; fG = fQudašu (probably B's mother).
Bibliography: is related to the Šangû-Ninurta archive together with BM 31334, Nbn. 184, Ner. 34, Nbk. 172, Nbk. 164, Nbk. 142, Nbk. 133, BM 31343=BM 36494, BM 33118, BM 31629 (Wunsch 2005 AOAT 330)
Title: BM 32882

Paraphrase:
Summons to establish a case.
In Simān (III) (the exact day is lost in a lacuna), A (B’s slave) will produce (abāku) his witness, who is called to establish the case (kânu Š) against C, another of B’s slave. The witness will have to prove that A gave an iron raqundu (mng. unkn.) to C. Should he prove it, then C will give the raqundu back to A. Name of 1 witness and the scribe: D.
 
A = Šar-Ea (? wr. dú-a), slave of B; B = Neriglissar; C = Hatānu, slave of B; D = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi
Bibliography: Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 61; Krecher 1970, 135; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 2 (1891), 6.
Title: BM 33142

Paraphrase:
Undated list of tracts of land, measured by the 1000. Very fragmentary. Lines 16-17 mentions "star-shaped land (kakkabtu), field (eqlu) of Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya" who is perhaps to be identified with his namesake from the Egibi family. Each line starts with "1000 (tracts of land) of", followed by specifications of the land quality, borders, etc., a.o.:
(land) opposite (tarṣu) the estate of Šamā'-ilu; (land) drained by ditches (kaslu); woodland (qīštu); estate of Nabû (bīt Nabû); orchards (kirû); the estate of Šarru-rēmanni; the wall (dūru ) of Gidāya.
Title: AO 7485

Paraphrase:
Receipt?
Fragmentary document about (the receipt of) dates, as much as …. (badly preserved passage). Apparently, they were due since 9th of Du'ûzu (IV), and now, two months later  A (= the creditor?) receives them from B (= the debtor?), but the verb of receipt is lost in the lacuna at the end of the obverse. The list with the names of the witnesses is also badly preserved. The name of the scribe: Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin (= creditor). Related to the debt mentioned in BM30710 (= Nbn 346).
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Šāpik-zēri//…
Title: BM 31822

Paraphrase:
Promissory note. Fragmentary
B owes A 1 1/2 mina of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni). He will pay it without interest (ina qaqqadu) in (month broken). Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe is Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi.
 
A = Ardia/...//Mušēzib-Marduk; B = .../Gūzānu
Title: BM 30847

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Interest at default.
B owes 1/2 mina of silver to A, to be paid in Arahsamna (VIII). He will start paying the yearly 20% interest on a monthly basis, if he fails to meet the deadline. B is the uncle of A's wife (fNuptāya/ Zēria//Nabāy). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Dummuq/Bēl-iddin//Egibi

A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Lâbāši/Zēria//Nabāya
Title: MMA 79.7.8

Paraphrase:
Sale of Iranian slaves.
The text opens with the indication of the date and place of issue: 2nd of Kislīm (IX) of Cambyses’ 7th regnal year, in Humadêšu (in Iran). A1 and A2 sold their female slaves (lamutānu) fC1 and fC2 for 2 minas and 40 shekels of silver to B, an exorcist (āšipu). The present record contains a statement made by D, the chief merchant (rab tamkāri) with respect to this sale, but its content can be interpreted in different ways. The CAD (I, s.v. idû  1b 11’, p. 26 ) translates “I know him and (i-de-eš ú from the verb idû) the silver has been received from him“ (in-na-áš from the verb našû N). According to F. Joannès (on Achemenet.com) "les esclaves sont offertes (?) à Iddinaia et l'argent lui est redonné", meaning that D intervened by claiming that he donated the slaves to B so that the sellers should pay back the silver they received from this apparently illegal sale. This interpretation is based on a reading "I bestowed  (the slave) to him (i-qí-iš2Ú from the verb qâšu), the silver has been given back to him“ (idem).The record is written in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) 4 persons: Rēmūtu and Murašû, both scribes (ṭupšarru); Habaṣīru, the scribe of the Bīt-kāṣirānu; and Narya-abigna (wr. mNi-ri-a-bi-ig-nu), the Elamite. D’s seal impression (kunukku).
 
A1 = Razma-arva (wr. mRa-za-am-ár-ma)/Razamumarga = Razma-hu-arga (wr. mRa-za-am-ú-mar-ga-'); A2 = Aspa-vētāna (wr. mAs-pu-me-ta-na-')/Aspa-tati-ka (wr. mAs-pu-ta-ti-ka); B = Iddināya/Nabû-ahhē-iddin, ašipu; fC1 = fKāra-dārā (wr. mKa-ar-da-ra-'); fC2 = fPati-ča (wr. mPa-ti-za-'); D = Ṛta-raučah (wr. mAr-ta-ru-šú), rab tamkāri
Title: BM 30704

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave.
A, of his own free will, sells his slave C to B, at a harīṣ-price amounting to 51 shekels of silver. The seller guarantees against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person claiming (pāqirānu) that C is a free person (mār banê). The silver for this purchase has been taken from the income (ina irbi) from […] and given to D. (This silver) is to be kept apart (elat) from a previous claim (rašûtu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ēṭir/Nergal-šuma-ibni; B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; C = Ilu-ikṣur; D = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu
Title: BM 30428

Paraphrase:
Pledge of a house with antichresis. Security for a silver debt.
A owes to B an amount of silver which is unknown because the beginning of the tablet is broken. B takes as a pledge A’s house, located near C’s house. He will pay no rent and there will be no interest on silver (=antichresis). Names of 3 witnesses (including C) and the scribe: Marduk-šāpik-zēri/…-iddin(or: šumi)//Nādin-še’im
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Nergal-uballiṭ//Eppeš-ilī; C = Nabû-ahu-iddin.
Title: BM 33939

Bibliography: To be published by Johannes Hackl.
Title: BM 32049

Paraphrase:
Dated short notice.
A short note of 395000 strings (gidlu) of garlic. The text is fully dated. Considering the fact that it is written in Sīman (III), after the garlic harvest. This short note functions as a stock-taking. No place, witnesses or a scribe are mentioned.
Title: BM 31703

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave.
A, of his own free will, sells his slave C, who is leprous (garbānu) and has the names of his previous owners fD1 and fD2 written (šaṭāru) on his hand, to B for its hariṣ-price amounting to 53 shekels of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy. The seller acknowledges that he has received (eṭēru) the silver of the purchase price for his slave from B. Should a claimant arise with regard to C, then A will free C from claims (murruqu) and hand him over to B. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Rab-banê; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Arad-Madānu; fD1 = fTakiltu; fD2 = fBēletu
Title: BM 31529

Paraphrase:
Addendum to a sale.
A sold six slaves to B: C1, fC2, fC3, C4, fC5 and fC6. The present document points out that D1, fD2 (D1’s daughter), fD3 and fD4 (E1’s and fE2’s daughter) were present to witness the sale (ana mukīnnūti ašābu), thus implying their consent to it. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-aplu-iddin/Etellu//Adad-šumu-ēreš
 
A = Nabû-ēreš/Tabnēa//Ahu-bāni; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C1 = Lūmur-dumqi-Bēl; fC2 = fSinun(t)u; fC3 = fMiṣatu; C4 = Nabû-dīni-epuš; fC5 = fBānītu-suppê-muhur; fC6 = fBāba-magāri-alsīš(?); D1 = Ea-ibni/Nergal-īpuš//Bēlia; fD2 = fGula-qā'išat/Ea-ibni, daughter of D1; fD3 = fNuptāya, daughter of E1 and fE2; fD4 = fṬābatu; E1 = Lâbāši/Zēria//Nabāya; fE2 = fGula-qā'išat
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 184; Krecher 1970, 175; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 4 (1898).82f.; Koschaker 1911, 261.
Title: BM 30652

Paraphrase:
Sale of slaves. Fragmentary.
A1 and A2, of their own free will, sell C and a baby (tulû, reconstr.), their slaves, to B at a harīṣ-price amounting to x+1 shekels of silver. Rest broken off. 4 witnesses (names broken off, only part of their geneaologies are extant) and the scribe.
 
A1 = ...-atari; A2 = Nabû-zēru-iddin/...-ia; B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; C = ...-dīnī-amur
Title: BM 31894

Paraphrase:
House rental.
A rents a house located at the head of the bridge (gišru) to B, for a rental price amounting to 5/6 minas of silver per year. It is agreed that half of the silver should be paid at the beginning of the year, and the remainder in the middle. The renter should caulk (šanû) the roof and repair the wall foundations (asurrû); A will receive 4 shekels of silver less from the rental price, in exchange for the work on the roof. The house is at the renter’s disposal from the 1st of Ayyār (II) onwards. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nāṣiru/Bunanu//Eppeš-ilī
Title: BM 32898

Paraphrase:
House rental.
A rents his house located on the field in the hallat-garden (kirû hallat) of the temple of Bēl to B, C’s slave (qallu), for 13 years. The renter will build an entire (new) reed hut (huṣṣu haṣāṣu), repair its solid beams (gušūru), set doors into all the doorways and place something else (wr. A SI RI, unclear). B will pay 8 shekels of silver for each year, inclusive of […].It is agreed that half of the silver should be paid at the beginning of the year, and the remainder in the middle. On the lower edge of the tablet the month Kislīm (IX) is mentioned, but in a broken context. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe. This contract will be extended, as recorded in BM36432.
 
A = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-ēṭir//Rab-banê; B = Nergal-rēṣūa, C’s slave; C = Iddin-Marduk//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 31781

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
The top part of the tablet is broken, thus most of the details on the type, location and topographical features of the land are lost. From what is extant, one infers that the purchased land was divided into smaller measured areas. One of the sides of the first measured area borders on (the property of) A, the buyer, and another one on the second area listed in the text. More data are available for the second measured area (mišihtu), which is the aškuttu within the field (libbi eqli): its lower side in the East borders again on (the property of) A; the upper front in the North is adjacent to the area previously described and to (the land which belongs to) C, its lower front in the East is near to the … ditch (harru). In total, x+4 1/3 GAR (x+32,5 m2) of land including 1 BÁN 2/3 (750 m2) of a kind of land whose details are unknown. […]+ 2/3 cubits (x+0,3 m) […] A has purchased this land from the two brothers B1 and B2: he has given them the silver corresponding to the total price plus another sum as additional payment, but the exact amount which he paid is lost because of the damaged condition of the tablet.
B1 and B2 acknowledge that they have received (mahāru) the amount of silver corresponding to the entire purchase price of their field, and they are satisfied (apālu, G Stat). The usual closing formula which safeguarded against future complaints appears here in a shorter version: members and descendants of the families are in fact not mentioned. The clause, then, synthetically establishes that the two parties have no legal claims (rugummû), they will not come back on this issue and they will not suit each other. Any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received.The names of the witnesses and of the scribe are lost.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Arad-Gula; B2 = [the name is broken off]; C = Nabû-uṣuršu/…
Title: BM 47925

Place of issue: Ālu-ša-Nabû-uballiṭ//Marduk-erība ša ina muhhi nār Piqūdu
Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
A purchases 0;0.2 Kor (900 m2) of agricultural land (zēru) from three members of the same family: B1, B2, his nephew, and fB3, B2’s mother. The land is located in the open country (eqel ṣēri): it is a cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi) in Litamu, in front of the Uraš Gate in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon – from the bank (kišādu) of the Piqudu-canal until it reaches the full extent (šalāmu) of 0;0.2 Kor (900 m2). Its upper side borders on (the land of) the daughters of C, its lower side on (the land of) fD; its upper front borders on the street that runs along the Piqudu-canal and its lower front stretches until it reaches the full extent of the field (adi muhhi zēri išallimu).
A declares the equivalent of the field (mahīra nabû) to be 14 shekels of silver per 0;0.1 kor (450 m2) and he adds 1/2 shekel of silver as additional payment (kî pî atar).
