6) The sixth measured area (mišihtu), whose size is lost in a lacuna, has once again the same lengths and neighbours for its long sides: 300 cubits (150 m), fC in the West, and A1 and A2 in the East. Its upper front side in the North is 10 cubits (5 m) long and is adjacent to the previous (fifth) measured area, while the lower front side in the South borders on the next plot. LINE
7) The last measured area (mišihtu), of unknown size, has shorter sides. The long ones measure 250 cubits (125 m) and border once again on fC in the West, and A1 and A2 in the East – while its upper front in the North is adjacent to the previous (sixth) plot. LINE
A1 and A2 declare the equivalent for this land together with the seller B (A itti B mahīra nabû išām) to be 1 shekel each X kor of land (the exact amount is lost in a lacuna of the tablet). From a broken passage it is possible to infer that the buyers have given (nadānu) some minas and shekels of silver corresponding to the entire purchase price (šīmišu gamrūtu) of this field, plus more silver as additional payment (kî atri). LINE
The seller acknowledge that he has received the full amount of silver in pieces (šibirtu), and he is satisfied (apālu  G Stat). The following lines, in fragmentary condition, must have recorded the warranty clause against future claims between the parties or members of their families. Names of 5 witnesses and 2 scribes. The exact measurements of each plot of land are recorded in BM30933.
 
A1 = Nergal-Bānûnu/Ṣillāya//Rab-banê; A2 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-kuzub-ilī//Rab-banê; fC = fŠahundu /…, mother of D1 and D2; D1 = Nabû-etel-ilī; D2 = Nabû-uṣur-napišti
Title: BM 32163+

Paraphrase:
Receipt
A receives (mahāru) 6 shekels of silver from B for C’s urāšu-obligation. This is in addition (elat) to the receipt (giṭṭu) of a previous 9 shekels of silver that D received (mahāru) from B. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe. 
 
A = Nergal-ahhē-iddin/Erība-Marduk//Šigūa; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Iddin-Marduk/Nūr-Sîn; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; D = Lâbāši
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 261; Peiser, KB 4 (1896), 258 f.; Shiff 1987, no. 174 (Phd dissertation); Weingort 1939, 27; Dandamaev, PAS 4 (1986), 66.
Title: BM 31180

Paraphrase:
Fixation of interest on a silver debt. Apparently related to money lending within the context of a business partnership.
B owes a broken amount of silver to A, slave of C. It is the capital sum (qaqqadu) and its interest (hubullu) of a debt on which he should (continue) pay(ing) a yearly interest of 20% on a monthly basis. The loan includes (adi) silver from his share (pūt zitti) (in a partnership) with (itti) the brothers D1 and D2. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of C; B = Lâbāši/Nabû-bān-ahi//Kidin-Sîn; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; D1 = Nabû-eṭēr-napšāti/Ea-lūmur; D2 = Kalbāya/Ea-lūmur
Title: BM 31387

Paraphrase:
Memorandum about a delivery of onions. Partial receipt.
It concerns the 150000 strings (gidlu) of onions that had been delivered to D and about which C wrote a message (šipirtu) to B1 and B2  (apparently, urging them to deliver the onions  to him). The present tablet is written in order not to forget (tahsistu la mašê) that A1, C’s slave, and A2 received 124000 strings (gidlu) of (the said 150000) onion strings on behalf of (ina našparti) C, from B1 and B2. and that 18000 of them belong to E. Written in the presence (ina ušuzzu) of 2 witnesses. No scribe.
 
A1 = Arad-Bēl, slave of C; A2 = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Šilāya/Esagilia; B1 = Nabû-ēṭir; B2 = Nādinu; C = Iddin-Marduk(/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn); D = Zababa-ahu-iddin; E = Šūzubu
Title: BM 31217

Paraphrase:
Undertaking to pay
B owes something to A1 and his slave A2. The first part of the first line is broken, so what B owes is not known. B will go (alāku) to Babylon on the 20th day of Kislīm (IX) and will pay (eṭēru) according to (akī) A1’s promissory notes (u'iltu). This is in addition (elat) to A2’s … (broken off) that is at B’s disposal (ina pāni). Apart from the first witness, the names of the other 2 witnesses and the scribe are fragmentary.
 
A1 = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; A2 = Madān-bēlu-uṣur; B = Gūzānu/Nabû-nāṣir/Sîn-nāṣir
Title: BM 30649

Paraphrase:
Takeover of a payment obligation.
The tablet is related to promissory notes (u’iltu) held by A1 and A2, to the debit of B1 and B2. B2 guarantees for B1, for the payment (eṭēru) of the silver. He will bring A1‘s and A2‘s promissory notes and hand them over (našû - nadānu) to B1. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Kiribtu//Bēl-aplu-uṣur.
 
A1 = Šumu-iddin; A2 = Šamaš-šumu-ukīn; B1 = Iddin-Marduk;  B2 = Nabû-ušallim
Title: BM 32918

Paraphrase:
Settlement of accounts.
On the day when A comes and draws up the accounts (nikkassu epēšu) with B, B will pay (nadānu) the amount of silver which has been charged (elû) to him, capital and interest (kaspu u hubullu). The silver, as much as (is needed for) the settlement of accounts, is charged (elû) to A. C will pay (nadānu) the capital and interest (kaspu u hubullu) for this debt. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi
 
A = Nabû...šari; B = Arad-Bēl; C = Nabû-bēlšunu
Title: BM 30940

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave.
A, of his own free will, sells his female slave (qallatu) fC to B for  the full purchase price of 1 mina of silver. A guarantees against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person claiming (pāqirānu) that C is a free person (mār banê). Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe: Erībāya/Balāssu//Eppeš-ilī
 
A = Šumāya/Erēbšu; B = Silīm-Bēl/Marduk//Damqa; fC = fHabaṣītu
Title: MNB 1814

Paraphrase:
Promissory note. Fragmentary
B owes A 5 minas of silver. He will pay this amount and its interest(?) to A in Ayyār (II). He already paid what remained (to be paid) (rīhtu) of the 10 minas of silver that his father owed to A.  Apart from the fragmentary first two names of the witnesses, the list of witnesses and the name of the scribe are broken.
 
A = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/…; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 41447

Paraphrase:
About a fugative female slave. Partly unclear.
The case at hand is that of C, a female slave belonging to A who cannot be found. Should she be seen (amāru N, wr. ta-at-ta-na-ma-ru) with (ina pāni) B, where (ašar) …, (then?) they know (idú) that … should(?) he not heed to it(?) (našu, wr. it-ta-aš-šú) and he (šū) even helps her on her way out(?) (harrānu ana šēpē šakānu)(*), B …. belongs to A (ša A šū).
Notes: (*). CAD: to satisfy someone.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Kalbāya/Marduk-erība; C = f…-tu, female slave of A
Title: BM 31479

Paraphrase:
Securities for a silver debt: pledge of a house and interest
B1 and his wife (fB2) owe ½ minas and 6 shekels of silver to A, which is secured by a lien on the debtors' entire house until the creditor is paid back in full his silver. Additional securities are in place: on part of this debt, namely 26 shekels, the debtors will have to pay a yearly interest of 20%, to be paid on a monthly basis. The remaining 10 shekels is interest-free as it is secured by the pledge in antichresis of the east part of the debtors' house ("no rent on the house, and no interest on the silver").  Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: B1. Written in the presence (ina ašābi) of the debtor's mother (fC).
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Nādin/Nergal-ēṭir/Bābūtu; fB2 = fNuptaia/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//Esagilāya, wife of B1; fC= fBēlessunu, mother of B1
Title: MMA 79.7.33

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave. Very fragmentary.
A, of his own free will, sells his female slave fB to someone whose name is lost. The purchase price amounts to 57 shekels of silver. Rest broken off.
 
A = Madān-šumu-iddin/Nergal-zēra-ibni; fB = fGudādîtu
Title: BM 31821

Paraphrase:
Summons to end a case
In this fragmentary document, A swears that by an unknown day of Intercalary Ulūl (VI2) he will come (alāku) and bring to an end (qatû D) his case (dibbu) with fB about silver and barley. Should he not come, he will pay the 6 shekels of silver (that he owes) to fB, without (ša lā) [… uncl.). He will return (târu) everything that he has […] from the hands of fB [...]. fC guarantees for the (re)payment (eṭēru) of the silver and barley. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-ušallim/Erîba-Marduk//Mandidi.
 
A = Kalbāya/Nergal-ušēzib; fB = fLū-balṭat; fC = fGagāya
Title: BM 31240

Paraphrase:
Receipt
B receives payment (eṭēru) from A for the urāšu-obligation till (adi) the 1st of Tašrīt (VII). The document is dated in Abu (V). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Bulṭāya/Šamaš-ahhē-iddin
Title: BM 31222

Bibliography: To be published by Johannes Hackl.
Title: BM 31124

Paraphrase:
Memorandum concerning the expenditure of barley.
The document lists the distribution of barley to three recipients (fA1, A2, A3).
fA1, slave of B receives 4 kor. A2, slave of C receives 2 kor. A3 of the Bēlillatāya house: 0;2.3.0 kor. In total 6;2.3.0 kor of barley has been removed (rêqu D) from the house. The memorandum (tahsistu) doesn’t mention any witnesses or a scribe. C can be identified as the adoptive brother of Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi. At the time of the recording of this tablet C and Iddin-Marduk are business partners. Wunsch 2000, 46 states that the distribution took place through Madānu-bēla-uṣur, slave of Iddin-Marduk.
 
fA1 = fNanāya-silim; A2 = Nabû-lū-salim A3 = Bēlšunu//Bēl-illatāya; B = Nergal-ahu-iddin; C = Kalbāya
Title: BM 31067

Paraphrase:
Fulfilment of a dowry promise. Receipt of silver instead of a share in a building plot.
Concerns fA2 dowry. Her father (B) still owes her and her husband (A1) [x] minas of silver, the equivalent (šimu) for (a share in) the building plot (qanû), which he apparently promised to give as part of her dowry. In addition (elat), he also owes her 5 minas out of the 18 minas of (promised) dowry silver, as well as the 10 slaves (amēluttu)  and household utensils that are still with him.  In addition (elat) to a dowry, B handed out a sealed document in which he transferred (kanāku – nadānu) one third (šalšu) of his property (nikkassu) to A1 via (itti) fA2. The house in which B resides (ašābu), C, his son, will inherit (NÍ TA BI, Wunsch 1993, 114) (or: he [B] has contractually assigned to C, ir!-ta-kás [rakāsu], Roth, JAOS 111 (1991), 21 n. 4).
A1 and fA2 acknowledge their receipt (mahāru) of the silver for fA2's share (pūt zittišu) in the building plot on which B resides. Names of 3 witnesses, including Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulaya//Egibi, the father of A1 and the scribe: Šāpik-zēri/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Nādin-še'im.
 
A1=Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi fA2= fNuptāya/Iddin-Marduk//Nūr-Sîn, wife of A1 and daughter of B; B= Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn, father of fA2; C=Marduk-rēmanni/Iddin-Marduk
Title: BM 33114

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver. Purchase price for onions. Fragmentary. A receives(?) (verb is broken off) 1300 onion strings from C’s onion field against the payment of 2 minas of silver from/with B. Second half of the tablet is broken off.
 
A = Šamaš-šumu-ukīn/Nabû-kāṣir/Sagdidi; B = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zeria/Nabāya; C = Nabû-bēl- ilāni/Murānu
Title: BM 31441

Paraphrase:
Interim settlement of accounts, within the framework of a business partnership.
Three business partners divide the profits of their partnership in three equal shares as agreed (aki zittišunu). A receives (mahāru)  1 mina of silver, his one-third share in the profits of the business partnership that he owns together with B and C. The silver is what had been paid to the partners in installments (ša ina mînišu mahāru) while trading their onions (ana šūmi). B  receives (mahāru) the 1 mina of silver that had been recorded in his tablet (ina ṭuppi šakānu). C can take (našû) the 1 mina of silver that is about to arrive (erēbu). 
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Ea-nāṣir(/Mušallim//Šangû-Nanāya); C = Marduk-ēṭir
Title: BM 30604

Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 303; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 26; Oppenheim 1936, 85; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 3 (1894),38f.
Title: BM 33096

Paraphrase:
House Rental.
A rents his house to B for 5 years. It is agreed that half of the silver should be paid at the beginning of the year, and the remainder in the middle. The renter should caulk (šanû) the roof and repair the wall foundations (asurrû). Should one of the parties break (nabalkutu) the contract, he will have to pay 10 shekels of silver. The renter will give the silver to fC, A’s wife. Name of 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Ina-Esagila-zēra-ibni//Ir’anni; fC = fNuptaia
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 271;  Kohler and Peiser, BRL 4 (1898), 74; Ziemer, BA 3 (1898), 475f.; Krecher 1970, 203; Shiff 1987, no. 182.
Title: BM 30650

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price for land paid to sellers’ creditor.
A purchases a plot of land (eqlu) from fB1, fB2 und fB3 but pays the purchase price (or part of it), 2 minas, to a third party (C) who had a claim against the sellers that was recorded in a document (u’iltu e’elû) before judges (dayyānu). C acknowledges his receipt (eṭēru) of the silver. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; fB1 = fNadāya/Šamaš-udammiq//Maštuk; fB2 = fIna-Esagil-rāmat/Šamaš-udammiq//Maštuk; fB3 = fBēlilitu/Šamaš-udammiq//Maštuk; C = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Itinnu
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 2000, no. 115; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 4 (1898), 84f; Krecher 1970, 159.
Title: BM 30909

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
A purchases land from B: given its irregular surface area, it was divided into three portions (mišihtu). All the neighbouring properties on each side are recorded in the first lines of the text, however this information is lost because of the damaged condition of the tablet. Only the property adjacent to third portion's lower front in the East is known: it is adjacent to (the property) of C. A declares the equivalent for this land together with the seller B, 3 Kor (40500 m2) in total, to be 14 shekels of silver per 0;0.1 Kor (450 m2) (A itti B mahīra nabû išām). He pays the total purchase price of 21 minas, plus 40 shekels as additional payment (kî pî atri). B acknowledges that he has received (mahāru) in total 21 minas and 40 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), and he is satisfied. The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. One final sentence, written after the date and only partially readable, mentions a purchase price (mahīru) and again a date – but it is not possible to say to which deal this formula is referring to. 9 witnesses (names lost) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Šumu-iddin/Šāpik-zēri//Nabāya; C = Nabû-zēru-iqīša
Title: BM 41859

Paraphrase:
About the purchase of land: undertaking to pay the purchase price to the seller’s creditors.
A undertakes to pay 55 shekels of silver to fB1 and her son B2: this sum corresponds to the price of a field purchased from fC1, fC2 and fC3, and the silver is his at his disposal (ina pānīšu). fB1 and B2 are the seller’s creditors (rāšû): A will pay them off on the 25th of Ulūl (VI), as established in a trial whose verdict has been written down in a document that fB1 and B2 handed over to A. Names of 5 witnesses (the judges, dayyāne) and the scribe. The trial mentioned in this text is recorded in BM31961.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; fB1 = fHibbuṣu/Marduk-šarrani; B2 = Mušēzib-Marduk, son of fB1; fC1 = fNadāya; fC2 = fIna-Esagila-rāmat; fC3 = fBēlilitu
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 2000, no. 113; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 4 (1898), 83f.; Krecher 1970, 158; Roth, AOAT 252 (2000).
Title: BM 31356

Paraphrase:
Share-farming agreement for a cow
The text is related to a brown cow, marked with the signs UD-tu-ú on its front-right thigh and on its back-thigh (ṭurru): A gives it to B in return for a share (ana zitti) in the profits from its labour, estimated at 50 shekels of white silver, of which 1/8 is alloy. The two parties agree that they are both responsible for the milk products (iškurratu) and the fodder supply (tablittu). B guarantees for the cow’s pasturing, caretaking, and  guarding (lit. ‘not escaping’), day and night. A acknowledges that he received from B the silver, a front-end payment for his half share. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of witness and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Egibi
Title: BM 32865

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates. Fragmentary.
B1 and B2 owe 3.2 kor of dates to A1 and A2. The two debtors assume warranty for each other and swore by god and king that they will deliver the dates until the end of Šabāṭ (XI). The rest of the document is broken off. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; A2 = Nergal-ušallim/Šumu-iddin//Ile’’i -Marduk; B1 = Mušēzib-Marduk//Šamaš-ahu-iddin; B2 = Nergal-ušallim/Tabnēa
Title: BM 41403

Paraphrase:
Establishment of a business partnership.
A invests 6 minas of silver in a business partnership (harrānu) with B.
The partners agree that A is entitled (akālu) to a share in the profits (utru) that equals B's (ahu zitti).  B will do business in and out of town (ālu u ṣēru).
This silver is what remains (rīhtu) to be paid by B from the originally 11 minas of silver which A invested in the business six years earlier, in Nebuchadnezzar’s 24th year. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Ēṭiru/Nabû-upahhir//Ile''i-bulluṭa-Marduk.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Lâbāši-Marduk//Ile''i-bulluṭa-Marduk; B = Kāṣir/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 30882

Paraphrase:
Settlement of business accounts.
A and B settle their accounts (epuš nikkassi qatû) with each other. They have made (epēšu, wr. ītepšū, Perf.) the necessary deductions (šumqutu) in mutual agreement (itti ahameš) for the donkeys that A gave to B, and the silver that B gave to A. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Iqīša//Ahi’ūtu; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 218; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 4 (1898); Demuth, BA 3 (1898), 431f.
Title: BM 31266

Paraphrase:
Settlement of accounts.
The tablet records the settlement of the accounts (epuš nikkassi) of a business in first-draft beer (šikaru reštû) for the 13th year of Nabonidus. It is chiefly concerned with the silver sums and beer vats that have been  available to A. He had two major sums of silver at his disposal (ina pani). First, 2 minas and 52 ½ shekels of silver of which at the time of recording the present document remain 16 ½ shekels, the rest having been spent as specified in the present document. The second sum amounts to 2 minas and 55 ½ shekels of silver: its various components are specified in the present document.
The first lines list amounts of beer vats and silver, including 24(?) vats of full-strength beer (šikaru ṭābu), out of which 11 vats x x (uncl.)  what remains  (rēhtu) of the x x x (uncl.) vat(s) for 2 minas and 52 ½  shekels of silver.x x x (uncl.) the ½  mina that had been paid (manû). The said amount (of 2 minas and 52 ½ shekels) at A’s disposal (ina pāni) does not include (elat) the 2 minas and 15 shekels of silver (over which he disposes) since Ulūl (VI) of Nabonidus’ 13th regnal year.
From those 2 minas and 52 ½ shekels B1 (received) 56 shekels and B2 (received) 6 ½ shekels, so that together they owe 1 mina and 2 ½ shekels of silver to C, (plus) 1 1/3 mina and 4 ½ shekels ... (remnants of signs, uncl.) (and) apart from (elat) 7 shekels of silver which are due to D1 and 6 shekels due to(?) D2. In total, (A spent) 2 ½ minas and 6 shekels of silver (of the 2 minas and 52 ½ shekels that were at his disposal); what remains (rēhtu) therefore at A’s disposal (ina pāni A) are 16 ½ shekels of silver.
Then, the text lists 2 minas and 15 shekels of paid (manû) silver, (that have been at A’s disposal) since Ulūl (VI) of Nabonidus’ 13th regnal year, 16 ½ minas of previous (mahrû) ṭuhhû-silver, 1/3 mina and 4 shekels of previous (mahrû) ṭuhhû-silver due to A and his wife fE, and 50 vats (dannu) of good quality beer. In total, 2 minas and 55 ½ shekels of silver and 50 vats of good quality beer are at A’s disposal (ina pāni). This total does not include (elat) empty jars (dannu rīqū) and household goods (udê bīti). The document was drafted in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) F1 and F2.
 
A = Nabû-uterri; B1 = Nādinu/Ina-ṣilli-Bēl; B2 = Padāya/Hanunu; C = Nādinu/Padāya; D1 = Nabû-šumu-uṣur (without affiliation); D2 = Labaši/Bēl-reṣua; fE = fMiṣātu, wife of A; F1 = Marduk-balāssu-iqbi/Nabû-zēru-iddin//Dābibi; F2 = Nabû-uballiṭ/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Ṣāhit-ginê
Title: BM 31147

Paraphrase:
Summon
By Kislīm (IX), 1st,  A will present his witness in Opis. He will witness against B, (maintaining) that C, who acted as guarantor through B, at the established date [...] took the contract away (and) gave it to B. If he will be able to bring his testimony, he will go unpunished. Should he fail to present his witness, he must pay to B what is written in the promissory note, both the barley and its interests. Names of 2 witnesses. Scribe: Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi.
 
A = Gudāya/Hinni-ilī//Mar-banê; B = Bāba-ēreš/Nabû-mukīn-apli; C = Katimu’/Hagūru
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 133; Koschaker 1911, 46ff.; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 1 (1890), 12f.; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 176; Holtz 2014, no. 12.
Title: BM 31162

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for reed bundles.
B owes 800 bundles of reed to A, to be delivered in Simān (III) of the following year. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A= the name of the creditor is broken off; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šamaš-ēṭir/Šumu-libši
Title: MLC 790

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave.
A1 and his wife fA2 sell of their own free will their female slave fC to B. The agreed purchase price is 1/2 mina and 1 shekel of silver. They guarantee against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person claiming (pāqirānu) that fC is a free person (mār banê). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Arad-Nabû/Rēmūt//Nagāru; fA2 = fBābunu/Nabû-ile''i, wife of A1; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; fC = fKalbati
Title: BM30899

Paraphrase:
Addendum to a slave sale.
A sold a female slave to B for 1 1/3 mina of silver (cf. BM30911): the buyer already paid 1 mina of silver to A and his mother (fD) at the occasion of his purchase of their plot of land located on the Zabūnu ditch. Apparently, this land sale did eventually not materialize, as goes forth from a fragmentarily preserved passage, so that the 1 mina that was paid will be credited to B for his purchase of the slave (see also BM30911). (As for) the rest (of the silver): (as soon as) fD‘s name will be included in fC’s sale document (ina ṭuppi), B will announce the (slave's?) market value (māhiru […] šemû Š) (partly uncl.) and will pay the remaining 1/3 mina to A. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-šumu-ibni/šumu-ukīn//Ile’’i-bulliṭ-Marduk; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fC = fŠidatu; fD = fKaššāya, mother of A
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 193; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 1 (1890), 14f.; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 126; Marx, BA 4 (1902), 62.
Title: BM 30600

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates. Very fragmentary.
B owes 40 kor of dates to A. The rest of the document is broken off.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = …-nādin-šumi/Marduk-bāni-ahi
Title: BM 31992

Paraphrase:
Loan ina pāni
B owes 10;3.2 kor barley (c. 1890 liters) to A. The latter is introduced by his first name, Širku, without genealogy, and is probably to be identified with Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-marduk-balāṭu, aka Širku, head of the Egibi family. The document does not relate to when or where B should return the barley which is at his disposal (ina pāni). Names of 4 witnesses, who are introduced by the fomula ina ušuzzi ša "in the presence of", followed by the name of the scribe (Bēl-iddin/Ardia//Bēl-aplu-uṣur) and two more names (additional witnesses?).
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi (Š​irku, without genealogy); B = Nabû-bullissu/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Bēl-aplu-uṣur
Title: BM 31117

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 19 kor of dates to A, the assessed field rent (imittu) to be delivered in one instalment to the courtyard (haṣāru) at the Zabunu-ditch. Deliver is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation:  for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood (huṣabu), and 1 darīku-container. His gardener's remuneration (šissinnu) has not been paid (eṭēru G Stat). Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Līšir/Nabû-bān-ahi//Sîn-šadûnu
Title: BM 30640

Paraphrase:
Sale of female slaves.
A sells two female slaves, fC1 and her daughter fC2, to B for 16 shekels of silver. Rest broken off. Names of 2+ witnesses. Name of the scribe broken off.

A = …-zēru-ukīn/Šamaš-ēṭir; B = Šulāya; fC1 = fAšarši -bītu; fC2 = fIna-E’igikalamma-lūmuraššu
Title: Private (JAOS 40)

Paraphrase:
Court order.
The document is related to 1;0.1 sq. kor (c. 13950 m2) of land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) in the meadowland (ugāru) of Qalūnu, in the district (pīhatu) of Kutha. A bought (šâmu) it from B for its full price (ana kasap gamirtu, lit. “for the entire (sum of) silver”): he is entitled (uzzuzu Š) to (that) field (eqlu) and enjoyes (akālu) its yield (ebūru). Then, he gave 20 shekels of silver to B and took as a pledge (maškanu ṣabātu) the rest (rēhtu) of the land. Then a dispute arose. As long as the case (dibbu) about the sale (mahīru) and the pledge (maškanu) of this land has not been settled (qatû), B will not sell (ana kaspi nadānu) […] or anything from his usufruct share (zittu), he will not give anything out as a gift (širiktu šarāku) nor will he bestow it as a present (rīmūtu râmu). He will not take up (leqû) additional expenses (nishu) or interest-free loans (hubuttūtu) for this land. Names of 6 judges and 2 scribes.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Zēria/Nergal-uballiṭ//Sagdidi
Title: A 1567+

Paraphrase:
Scribal exercise.
The tablet is undated and most likely a scribal exercise. Its content does not seem to have been extracted from an original document; at the end of the text one reads the verb “has received”. The text mentions the storage area (karammu) on the Sin Canal and the following individuals: A and B, both officials in charge of the brewery (rab šikari), C, the royal skipper and D, the royal overseer of the quay. The text is not dated.
 
A = Iqūpu/Bēl-iddin//…, rab šikari; B = Nādinu/Bēl-iddin//Rē'i-sīsê, rab šikari; C = Aplāya/ Šumu-uṣur; D = Rēmanni-ilī
Title: Peek 19

Paraphrase:
Receipt
A receives (mahāru) silver from B for his urāšu-obligation. The exact amount is broken. This is in addition to previous receipts (giṭṭu). Apart from the 1st witness, the names of the 2nd witness and the scribe (A) are partly broken.
 
A = Šamaš-iddin/Bāni-zēri//Sîn-šadûnu; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Iddin-Marduk//Nūr-Sîn
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 283; Shiff 1987, no. 193; Weingort 1939, 27f.
Title: BM 31262

Paraphrase:
Boat Rental.
A1 and A2 rent a boat, which belongs to B, the mayor (hazannu), and is currently at their disposal (ina pani), to C. The rental price amounts to 1/3 mina and 1/10 shekels of silver per day. The two boatmen (mallāhu) A1 and A2 acknowledge that they have received from C the rent money for the days from the 11th to the 26th of Šabāṭ (XI). Name of 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nūr-Šamaš/Amurru-nāṣir; A2 = Nergal-kīnu; B = Nabû-šumu-iddin, mayor (hazannu); C = Nabû-uterri
Title: BM 41414

Paraphrase:
Statement pronounced in front of witnesses.
The text has been written with the purpose of recording the names of the witnesses who were present when A declared that  fC has received (? the verb is lost in a lacuna) the 2 minas and 6 2/3 shekels of silver which B paid (nadānu) instead of  the silver that A owed to her. The final part of the text is fragmentary, only a reference to some commonly held property (karû) can be clearly identified. Names of 3 witnesses (including 2 courtiers, rēš šarri) and the scribe: Bulṭāya/Rēmūtu//Pahāru.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; fC = fSilim-Ištar/Kurigalzu//Ša-nāšišu
Title: BM 31489

Paraphrase:
The tablet opens by stating that these are the witnesses before whom (ina pānišunu) A brought (našû) a promissory note (u’iltu) holding it as proof against B (ana muhhi). They read in it (šasû) “charged against B” (ina muhhi). Names of 4 witnesses, no scribe. No place of issue, but dated.
 
A = Aplāya/Bēl-le’’i//Sîn-imitti; B = Iqīšāya/Kudurru//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 30470

Paraphrase:
Takeover of a guaranty of payment.
A (the debtor’s brother) guarantees for the payment of 2 minas of silver, which B owes to C.  He will bring and hand over (našû - nadānu) to B, his brother, the receipt (giṭṭu) related to the payment. They will take out (našû N) from their own assets (ultu ramāni) (the amount needed) for the (payment of the) debt (u’iltu) they owe to someone whose name is lost in a lacuna within the context of business partnership (harrānu). The final clause of the text establishes that they have completely carried out (qatû) their settlement of accounts (epuš nikkassi). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ibni/Nabû-bān-ahi//Ṣāhit-ginê.
 
A = Nabû-kāṣir/Marduk-erība//Sîn-ilī; B = Rēmūtu/Marduk-erība//Sîn-ilī; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 32923

Paraphrase:
As soon as fA, B’s female slave (qallatu), will be seen (amāru Ntn) or will be heard (šemû Ntn) (of being) with C, then C will bring and hand over (našû-nadānu) to B the daily compensation payment (mandattu) of 0;0.3 kor (c. 18 l) of barley.  Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-nādin-ahi/Kiribtu-Marduk//Dābibi.
 
fA = fAndia, slave of B; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Gūzānu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//Dan-Adad
Title: BM 30868

Paraphrase:
Court protocol.
The tablet records a litigation between A (the plaintiff) and B, brought in front of Nabonidus’  judges. The reasons for the claim are not clear. Names of 6 witnesses and 2 scribes.
 
A = Arad-Gula/Bēl-ahhē-iddina//Rē'û; B = Šamaš-šumu-iddin/...//Etellu
Title: MNB 1127

Paraphrase:
Receipt. Fragmentary
A acting as proxy for (ina našparti) C, receives (mahāru) 20 kor (c. 3600 litres) of dates from D’s slave B. The list of witnesses is fragmentary. The scribe is Bēl-ēṭir/Nabunnāya
 
A = Ēribāya/Nabû-ittannu; B = Nabû-ayyālu; C = Iddin-Bēl/Gūzānu; D = Marduk-nāṣir-apli(/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Title: BM 31372

Paraphrase: Fragmentary document about something that is due to Bēl-iqīša/Zēru-ukīn//Munnabittu, part of his claim (ana muhhi rašūti) …., as much as is available (mala šū). With (itti) Nabû-ahhē-iddin(/Šulāya//Egibi) …. (broken off). Remainder is broken off, incl. the names of the witnesses. The scribe: Bēl-iqīša/Zēru-ukīn//Munnabittu (= the creditor).
Title: BM 31973

Paraphrase:
Cancellation of a previous agreement.
B1 owes silver to A, and for this he pledged his slaves fC1, fC2, and fC3 (as recorded in BM30521 and BMUnknown(Nbn 602)). Apparently he was unable to pay for his debt, so A took away (ana kaspi abāku) the three female slaves from him. Afterwards, the debtor’s mother fB2 provided enough silver to redeem 2 of the 3 slaves and accordingly A gave fC1 and fC2 back (târu D) to B1 and fB2. The debtors ceded (uššuru) fC3 to A, because of (akî) the silver that they still owe him. Now, B1 and fB2 promise not to dispose of the 2 redeemed slaves, nor to give them as a present to anyone, until the arrangement set up (riksu rakāsu) between A and B1’s brother, D, will be settled (qatû). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bāni-zēri//Bēl-ēṭir.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Bēl-iddin/Bānia//Arrabtu; f B2 = fNidintu/Arad-Bēl//Egibi, mother of B1; fC1 = fŠannāya, female slave; fC2 = fKubbuttu, female slave; fC3 = fTabluṭu, female slave, daughter of fC1; D = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Bānia//Arrabtu, brother of A1
Title: MMA 79.7.10

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave.
A, of his own free will, sells his slave C, whom she bought from D, to B for 1 mina of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, forever (ana ūmī ṣâti). A, E and D guarantee against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person claiming (pāqirānu) that C is a royal slave (arad šarrūtu) or a free person (mār banê). They guarantee for each other. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ēreš/Nabû-bān-ahi//Sîn-šadûni
 
A = Arrabi/Adad-ahhē-šullimnat; B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; C = Nabû-natanu; D = Adad- nūri/Šeššuru; E = Bibānu/Ahhē-…
Title: BM 31616

Paraphrase:
Court protocol.
The beginning of the text is fragmentary: from what is extant, one understands that A, by means of his proxy C, bought a female slave from B for the hariṣ-price amounting to 2 1/3 minas of silver; it is also mentioned that the slave is performing duties on behalf of  A. Now, fD1 and fD2, B’s wife and mother-in-law, have brought suit because of this slave and they therefore came in front of Nabonidus’ judges. The judges heard their testimony and read the documents related to fD1’s dowry. According to these, the female slave is not part of her dowry; they have brought B in their presence and let fD1 take as a pledge the arable land located on the Royal Canal, which is B‘s inheritance share. In future times, fD1 and fD2 will not raise claims about this slave nor about the price paid by C. C’s name is identified in the tablet as buyer. Names of the witnesses and the scribe are broken.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-tultabši-līšir/Bēl-zēru-ibni//Nappāhu; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fD1 = fEsagila-rāmat, wife of B; fD2 = fTašmētu-damqat, mother of fD1
Title: BM 31546

Paraphrase:
Land rental.
A and his brothers rent land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) located along the Harru-ša-Zabuna to B, who should perform gardening work (nukaribbūtu). In Abu (V) he should carry out the excavation work (herûtu) for irrigation (labku), he should dig ditches using a winnowing shovel (pīsu). He should remove the clods (akkullātu) and take care of the palm fronds (libbu) and branches (harūtu). He will not cut off the twigs (hūpu). As long as he will farm the land with the shovel (parzillu), he will receive 5 kor (900 l) of dates per kor of land as gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-iddin/Kināya
Title: BM 31035

Bibliography: To be published by Johannes Hackl.
Title: BM 30771

Paraphrase:
Fragmentary notice about dates.
4;2 kor of dates, xxx of A, lessee charged with planting date palms (zaqipānu) (on the land) above the Canal. The dates or the land are at the disposal of (ina pāni) A.
4;3 kor of dates, xxx of A, lessee charged with planting date palms (zaqipānu) (on the land) under the Canal. The dates or the land are at the disposal of (ina pāni) A.
In addition (elat) to the dates, the impost (imittu). The tablet is drawn up in front of 2 ina uzuzzi witnesses.  
 
A = Arad-Bēl (without affiliation)
Title: BM 30583

Paraphrase:
About a slave sale: cancellation of the deal and restitution of money and slaves.
A sold his female slaves fC1 with her two daughters fC2 and fC3 [...] to B for 2 2/3 minas of silver, in Hubadêšu. The deal however was cancelled, and now B akcnowledges that he has received back (eṭēru) the 2 2/3 minas of silver from A; he also promptly gives back (târu D) the promissory note (u’iltu) related to the entire purchase price for these female slaves. As soon as A will send a messenger (mār šipri) to B in Babylon, then (B) will give the slaves to the messenger. If a slave has died (maṭû) or has given birth (alādu) while at B’s place, A bears the loss as well as the profit (lit. "it is of A"). The parties to the contract have taken one document each. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Habaṣīru/Niqūdu; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fC1 = fMiṣatu; fC2 = fNanāya-bēl-uṣur, daughter of fC1; fC3 = fŠēpit-Ninlil-aṣbat, daughter of fC1
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 244f.; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 2 (1891), 40f.; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 10.
Title: BM 30698

Paraphrase:
Oath. Dispute over the manufacturing of furniture and payment of a salary.
Agreement between A and B for the delivery of a bed which A’s father, C, agreed to produce against the payment of 13 shekels of silver, but which he eventually did not deliver. A swears to B, by Bēl, Nabû and the king, that he will surely be present on the established day (Dûzu (IV), 10th) and let B record (uzuzzu Š) his name instead of his father’s. The oath refers to a previous promissory note (u’iltu) for a bed made of musukkannu-wood, which was written at the expense of his father C. A accepted (mahāru) of his own free will (ina zakûti) to make the bed instead of his father. If A will not be present on  Dûzu (IV), 10th, to discuss with B about this promissory note (u’iltu) over which he took responsibility (našû) of his own free will (ina zakûti), then he will have to deliver that bed made with musukkannu-, dimmigirru- and fig-wood to B – who will give (nadānu) him 13 shekels of silver in return. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-iddin/Nabû-gāmil//Suhāya.
 
A = Libluṭ (written Bēl-ile’’i)/Nabû-mitu-uballiṭ//Mudammiq-Adad; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Nabû-mitu-uballiṭ//Mudammiq-Adad; C = Nabû-mitu-uballiṭ
Title: BM 32881

Paraphrase:
List of expenses, within the framework of a business partnership.
This document lists the expenses that A and B incurred from Ṭebēt (X) of Nebuchadnezzar’s 40th year till today, i.e. for 2 years, in the course of running their joint business. They each took 20 shekels of silver (nishūtu nasāhu) from the business’ accounts. There follows a list of expenses for various items: a leather bag (nūṭu), fat (lipu) of the nashapu-type, beef (šīr alpi) and other meat (šīru), and payments to C and D. The document concludes by stating that the expenses of the current year till today have been calculated (manû) as amounting to 1 mina and 50 shekels. Names of 2 ina ušuzzi witnesses (without affiliation). The name of the scribe and the place at which the document was written are not specified.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk (without affiliation, but no doubt /Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn); B = Nabû-ušallim (without affiliation, but no doubt //Īnia); C = Lūṣi-ana-nūri; D = Karêa
Title: BM 30276

Paraphrase:
House Rental.
A rents a house to B for 5 years, from the 1st day of Arahsamna (VIII) onwards. The rental price is 5 shekels per year, plus 100 strings (gidlu) of garlic. The renter should caulk (šanû) the roof and repair the wall foundations (asurrû). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Šāpik-zēri//Sagilāya; B = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia
Title: BM 30483

Paraphrase:
Exchange of land.
The document records the exchange (ṭuppi šupêlti) of plots of land (eqlēti) which A and B have switched with each other (ana ahāmiš šupêlu). B brings in 0;3.4 Kor (9900 m2) of arable land (zēru) located above the New Canal in front of the Enlil Gate, in the district (pīḫatu) of Babylon. The upper long side in the West borders on (the property of) D, the lower side in the South on (the property of) E; the upper front in the North is adjacent to the bank (kišādu) of the New Canal and the lower front in the South borders on (the property of) F. B exchanges this land, which includes (adi) his wife's dowry land (zēru nudunni)  with 0;3.4 kor (9900 m2) of arable land belonging to A. This consists of a field whose description is lost because the tablet is damaged; only the name of one of the neighbours is extant: G. After a gap in the text, the document ends with the usual warranty clause in which the parties agreed that there will be no future comeback nor claim. They write this document recording the exchange (ṭuppi šupêlti) in order to make sure that this agreement will not be changed (lā enû) and each one takes a copy of it. Names of 5 witnesses (including H, A’s brother) and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Munahhiš-Marduk/Bānia//Šangû-Ninurta; fC = fInṣabtu/Ardi-Bēl//Pappāya; D = Iddināya/Rēmūt; E = Ṭābia/Kabtia; F = Bazūzu/Rēmūt; G = Erēbšu; H = Nergal-ēṭir/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 2000, no. 176; Marx, BA 4 (1902), 30; Krecher 1970, 243f.; Winckler, ZA 2 (1887), 177 f.; Unger 1931, no. 48.
Title: BM 41425

Paraphrase:
Fragment of a tablet recording the purchase of land.
A purchases land from fB. The field must have been divided up into smaller areas when describing its measurement and neighbours, but most of this information is lost, except for the second partial area (mišihtu). Its land is adjacent to the dam [of the hanšus?] (makallû [ša hanšānē?]) and is cultivated with 5 date palms (gišimmarē), […] that are inside (ina libbi) an area of  x+1;2.0.2 Kor (19050+ m2). In total, [… x]+2;1.5.4.2 1/2 Kor (32268+ m2) of land cultivated with trees and grain (zēru zaqpu u mērešu). Every other detail on the deal, together with the names of the witnesses and of the scribe, are lost.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/…//Ṭābih-kāri; fB = fRa…/…-Bēl-zēri//Abu-ul-īde
Title: BM 47868

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price for land.
A receives (mahāru) 13 shekels of silver of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, from B as purchase price for a field (zēru) located in Litamu. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ilu-tillatī; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 31130

Paraphrase:
About the payment of silver. Purchase price. Very Fragmentary.
The document is too fragmentarily preserved to extract from it a coherent story. The elements that can be retrieved are: 1½ minas of silver, not including (elat) the documents (giṭṭu) that record previous silver (debts), remainder (rīhtu) of the purchase price for …., from Nabû-…/Marduk-ēṭir, his brother … with each other …. the share of P[N] …. minas of silver including (adi)….The names of at list 2 witnesses, a.o. Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; and the scribe: Arad-Marduk/Kittia/Šangû-Ea
Title: BM 33941

Paraphrase:
Confirmation of ownership.
A has bought the slave E from B, or rather his brother C, through a proxy D for 50 shekels of silver. This document has been written to confirm A’s ownership on the slave and on every possible duplicate of the contract that will may turn up in future. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//…-a//Itinnu.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Tabnēa//Ahu-bāni; C = Nabû-ēreš; D = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Aqara//Arad-Ea; E = Nabû-dīnu-epuš
Title: Liverpool unknown 14 (Strassmaier 1885)

Paraphrase:
Establishment of a business partnership (harranu).
A invests 15 minas of stamped(?) silver (ginnu) in a business partnership with B1 and B2. The partners agree that B1 and B2 will enjoy a share (ahu akālu) in the profits (utru) they make with the silver in or out of town that equals (itti) A's share. This is followed by a broken passage after which it is provided that B1 and B2 assume warranty for each other. They also guarantee for the mentioned capital sum of silver. It may not be used to cover their expenses (etēqu ina muhhi ul etēqu). Furthermore, B1 and B2 may not take part in another (business partnership) (harrānu alāku) apart from (elat) the present one. There are no other funds available apart from the mentioned silver of A […] (and?) of C, who seems to be B1's father. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Bēl-kāṣir/Marduk-ušallim//Ašlāku; B2 = Nidintu-Bēl/Ša-Nabû-šū//Šangû-Ninurta; C = Marduk-ušallim
Title: MNB 1819

Paraphrase:
Division of inheritance.
The present document provide details on how the three Egibi brothers, A1, A2 and A3 divide amongst them their father’s property. It concerns the allocation of shares in houses, slaves, arable land, animals, outstanding debts, business assests and varia.
 
A1, the eldest brother, takes as his half share (ahi zitti) 10 houses and more than 40 slaves. He also receives 6 minas of silver, paid to him as equalizing payment (takpurtu) for property in Borsippa. First, the property in Babylon is detailed: 7 houses, one of which is no more than a reed building (huṣṣu) and a plot of unbuilt land (kišubbû).Then, information about the property in Borsippa follow: this consists of 3 houses and 3;0.3 ½ sq. r (c. 42.87 m2) of built/building land (bītu). Finally, there is a detailed list of the slaves.
 
The other half share (ahi zitti) in houses and slaves goes to A2 and A3, and consists of 6 houses (resp. building land), 4 of which are in Babylon and 2 in Borsippa, and 51 slaves (amīlūtu). Thus, A2 and A3 receive: (1) the family’s main house (lit. “the big house of Nabû-ahhē-iddin”) in Babylon, (2) including the land (qanû) with the houses, some of them dilapidated, that goes with it; (3) another house in Babylon, (4) a 2 sq. r (c. 24,50 m2) building plot (qanû) in the Te-neighbourhood of Babylon; (5) a house in Borsippa, (6) and the big, old house in Borsippa. A2 and A3 give to their older brother 6 minas of silver as equalizing payment (takpurtu) to buy it out: such sum compensates (apālu) for his larger share in the main house (ultu bītu rabû) in Borsippa, and A1 confirms that he has taken (leqû) this silver.

The houses listed above are all identified by their bordering properties and in some cases also by the person from whom it was bought. The slaves are listed by name and usually grouped in families (Slave X, his wife Y, (and) Z, their child(ren)/daughter).
 
Next comes the division (itti ahāmeš izuzzu) of arable land, animals and future income. One half share belongs to A1, the other to A2 and A3. It concerns shares in their land cultivated with trees and grain (zēru zaqpu u mērešu), as much as there is, including also any arable land (zēru) that A1 bought in his name, or in his wife’s (fB) name or through a proxy. The brothers also divide their oxen, small livestock (ṣēnu) and donkeys, their income from nishu-payments that have still not been paid off (ina sūqu), their escaped slaves and all their other goods (mimma mala bašû, lit. “whatever there is”).

Finally, there are a series of cases that need special attention. First comes (the slave) C, his wife and children, his house and his entire property (be it inside or outside his land, lit. “in the house or on the street”): it is agreed that A1, A2 and A3 will divide it into shares (ahi zitti) and each will take his share. Secondly, it is stated that A2 and A3 have paid off (eṭēru) their share (zittu) in the debt (rašûtu) owed by A1. Thirdly, the older brother and A3 are allowed to take (leqû) the properties that were part of their wives’ dowries (nudunnû). Fourthly, the three brothers take whatever property that they made available to D to do business with (harranu), including a house in Hursagkalamma, and divide it into 2 equal shares (ahi zitti). The 0;1 sq. kor (c. 2700 m2) of land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu), located outside (kīdânu) the Zababa Gate, is evenly shared (malmališ zittu) by A1, A2 and A3.
 
Through their commonly held property (karû), they will clear (murruqu) any possible claim (paqāru) about this division, and [...] to each other (ana ahāmeš). Each party has taken one copy of the document each, in order to make sure that this deal will not be changed. Names of 6 judges and 26 witnesses, and the scribe. Seal impressions of 2 judges and of the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A3 = Nergal-ušēzib/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; fB = fAmat-Bābu; C = Madān-bēlu-uṣur; D = Kalbāya
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 304f; Weingort 1939, 23ff, 34f; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 4 (1898), 35ff; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 172; Koschaker 1911, 194.
Title: BM 30337

Paraphrase:
Lease(?) of a harbour house, related to the measurer’s prebend(?)
A in agreement with his brothers gives (nadānu) to B the harbour house (bīt kāri) that is situated next to B’s house against the payment of 4 liters of bread (akalu). The reason for this transfer is ana mādidi “for (performing the office of) the measurer”. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-uballiṭ/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Atkuppu
Title: BM 30250

Paraphrase:
Agreement over the payment of house rent.
The document is dated on the first of Simān (III) of Nabonidus' 6th year and regulates the payment of rent for A's house by B. He still owes 15 2/3 shekels of silver, and from now on he will pay monthly 2 shekels of silver to A as rental price, not including those 15 2/3 shekels of silver. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Name of 1 witness and the scribe.

A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Sūqāya/Kalbāya
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 153; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 2 (1891), 50; Meissner and Tallqvist, WZKM 4 (1890), 128f.
Title: BM30377

Paraphrase:
Addendum to a dowry gift.
fA gives of her own free will a man whose name is broken off, her own dowry slave, as dowry for her granddaughter fC to B. Her gift comes in addition (elat) to the 10 mina of silver and the two slaves  (fE and her brother F), which fA gave in the past as dowry, and in addition to the property which D, the bride’s father gave as dowry for his daughter to B. Names of 3 witnesses, including Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bāni-zēri/Bēl-ēṭiru, the son-in-law of D, and the scribe.
 
fA= fIna-Esagila-ramât/Zēria//Nabāya, grandmother of C; B=Kurbanni-Marduk/Etellu//Ēṭiru, the groom; fC= fNanāya-ēṭirat/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi, bride and granddaughter of fA; D= Itti-Marduk-balāṭu, father of the bride; fE=fBanītu-šulliminni; F=Madānu-ēreš, brother of E.
Title: BM 31854

Paraphrase:
About the payment of a dowry gift. Very fragmentary.
The upper part of the tablet is broken. It concerns 10 mina silver, 5 slaves and household utensils, which A promised to give as dowry for his daughter fC (see BM30585). B, the groom has not yet received it. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe Kurbanni-Marduk/Etellu//Ēṭiru, who is the son-in-law of A.
 
A=Itti-Marduk-balāṭu, father of the bride fC; B=Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bān-zēri/Bēl-ēṭiru, the groom; fC=fTašmētu-tabni, bride and daughter of A.
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 334; Krecher 1970, 229; Tallqvist 1891, 5; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 55; Weingort 1939, 18; Koschaker 1911, 204; Marx, BA 4 (1902), 24; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 2 (1891), 11f.; Roth, JAOS 111 (1991), 26.
Title: BM 31805

Paraphrase:
About the return of equipment from a private house.
Concerns all equipment (udû), as much as there is, belonging to a woman from Medea (fD), who lives (ašābu) in E's house. After her husband (A) and fB were given back (eṭēru) all this equipment by the landlord's grandson (C)*, they swore (tamû) by Bēl, Nabû and the king. The wording of their oath is lost in a badly preserved passage. It refers to something that is due from C, and to the final balance payment (aḫirtu, var. of amirtu)  that they should, so it seems, settle with each other.
*lit. "the eldest son of E's daughter".
 
A = Kakia, husband of fD; fB = fNanāya;  fD = fUhia, woman from Medea (lúma-du-‘i-tu4), wife of A; C = Širiktu/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu(?)//Egibi,  the eldest son of E's daughter (fNuptaia); E = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn.
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 350; Krecher 1970, 254; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 3 (1894), 7; Eilers, ZDMG 94 (1940), 202.
Title: BM 31523

Paraphrase:
Receipt for utensils
A receives (mahāru) 5 bowls (haṣbatu), 1 lower millstone (erû) and 1 upper millstone (naškabu) from B. Should C testify (qabû) that he delivered 10 vessels to B, the latter should give 5 more to A (bābtu 10 haṣbātu B ana A ušallam, [bābtu šalāmu D]). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Rēmūt-Bēl/Basia.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Tattannu/Nabû-rēmanni; C = Nabû-Šūzubu-ile’’i
Title: BM 30959

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a building plot.
A purchases 0;1 sq. r (12,25 m2) of land from B: this consists of a building plot with a house in ruin located in Tē, near Babylon. The upper long side in the West borders on A‘s house, the lower long side in the East is adjacent to B’s house. The upper front in the North and the lower front in the South border on B’s house as well. A has declared the equivalent for this land, 0;1 sq. r (12,25 m2) in total, together with the seller B: 1/2 mina of silver for each 1/2 sq. r (12,25 m2) of land, for a total amount of 1/2 mina of silver. The buyer pays the total purchase price, plus 1 shekel of silver as additional payment (atru) and a garment (lubāru) for the lady of the (sold) house. B acknowledges that he has received 1/2 mina and 1 shekel of silver in pieces (šibirtu). The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Ubārya/Bēl-rēṣūa
Title: BM 31508

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Antichretic pledge of a slave.
B owes 1 mina and 11 shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be paid by the end of Tašrīt (VII). His slave, fC is pledged in lieu of paying interest. Fragmentary. Witnesses and scribe.

A = Bēl-ittannu/Iddin-Bēl; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; fC = fBa-Malakalu (reading of name is uncertain), slave of B.
Title: BM 31516

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver. Partial payment of the total price for a plot of land.
Three sisters, fA1, fA2 and fA3, acknowledge that they received (mahāru) 10 shekels of silver from B in Dûzu (IV). This is a partial payment out of a total price (šīmu) corresponding to x+5 shekels of silver, for 1;2.3 kor (20250 m2) of arable land (zēru) that B purchased from the three sisters (ina qātē … mahāru). The rest of the silver remains deposited with B (paqādu) and will be transferred once the sellers’ creditors (rāšû) will have been satisfied (inneṭṭir [eṭēru]). The document also ratifies that the yield (ebūru) of the present year will belong to the buyer. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA1 = fNadāya/Šamaš-udammiq//Maštuk fA2 = fEsagila-rāmat/Šamaš-udammiq//Maštuk; fA3 = fBēlilitu/Šamaš-udammiq//Maštuk; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi
Bibliography: Sayce, BOR 4 (1889/1890), no. 77; Krecher 1970, 155; Wunsch, NABU 1997/58.
Title: PR V 28.6 (1884.98.12, Pitt-Rivers Museum, Oxford)

Paraphrase:
Court protocol: litigation about the transfer of assets.
Any special agreement (riksu) or a document (u’iltu) about the 2;2 sq. kor (c. 32400 m2) of agricultural land (zēru), the dowry estate (bīt nudunnî) of fB, that A, her eldest son, may have concluded (rakāsu, wr. iš-ku-su) with her, and would bring along (našû) in a dispute with (ana muhhi) his mother: the document belongs to her. The royal scribe transmitted under a sealed document (kanāku - dagālu Š) that land to fB, as the equivalent for (kum) her dowry. In the document it is explicitly mentioned that if anyone among her sons would not respect her (palāhu), then he would not receive (leqû) a share (zittu) in that property. According to that first document that is in fB’s hands, 1;1 kor (16200 m2) out of the total 2;2 sq. kor (c. 32400 m2) of agricultural land (zēru) was the share of her eldest son A. Later, however, she transferred the ownership of this land under a sealed document (kanāku - dagālu Š) to her younger sons C1 and C2. A raised a claim (paqāru bašû Š) against this decision, but fB brought the tablet in front of the city elders and her eldest son retreated (târu D). Now, A’s name is included among the witnesses list in the tablet related to the transfer of the ownership of those 1.1 kor of land which she gave (kanāku - dagālu Š) to C1 and C2. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe: Ea-iddin/Balāṭu//Maštuk.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Sîn-šadûnu; fB = fKurunnam-tabni/Bēl-upahhir//Sîn-šadûnu, mother of A, C1 and C2; C1 = Šāpik-zēri; C2 = Bēl-uballiṭ
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 2000, no. 85; Rutten, RA 41 (1947), 99-103; Roth, JCS 43-45 (1991-1993), 14f.
Title: ParisUnknown

Paraphrase:
Land rental.
A1 rents (ana sūtu nadānu) arable land to B1 (C’s slave) and B2 for 6 year, at a yearly rental price amounting to 27 Kor (4860 l) of dates. The land's borders are described in detail: the upper long side borders on (the properies of) D and E, the lower one on (the properties of) F’s sons and of D. The land belongs to A and his brothers, and A2 holds a share in it as well. For each kor (180 l.) of dates (of the 27 kors (4860 l) that B1 and B2 have to pay each year), they shall give to A1 und A2 (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipu), and fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood (ḫuṣabu) and 2 darīku-containers. They will hoe (herû) the ground from the branching off of the canal (ārittu) to […]. Rest of the tablet broken off. Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = Bēlet-ēreš; B1 = Sîn-ibni; B2 = Rēmūt-Bēl/Danna-Nergal//Rab-banê; C = Mardukāya; D = Iddin-Nabû; E = Bēl-erība; F = Nabû-šarru-ibni
Title: NY 51

Paraphrase:
Rent of a house: agreement over rental price and additional payments.
A rents a house  to B for 8 shekels of silver a year. The house will be at the renter's disposal from the 16th onwards, i.e. in another 10 days. B should also give kīnayātu-gifts in Nisan (I) and 1 shekel of silver as additional payment (nūptu) on the day of Enlil. Names of XXX witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Suhāya;
Title: Peek 16

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
A purchases 1 Kor (13500 m2) of agricultural land (zēru), cultivated as well as newly cleared land (mērešu u taptû) located in front of the Uraš Gate in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon from B. The upper long side in the North borders on (the land of) C, the lower long side in the South on (the land of) D. Its upper front in the West borders on (the land of) the sons of E, its lower front in the East borders on the dam of the hanšus (makallû ša hanšānē) of Babylon. Having agreed upon the price of 1 shekel of silver for each 0;0.2 Kor (900 m2), the total value (šuqultu) for this field corresponds to 15 shekels of silver. The final section of the text, which no doubt included the usual closing and warranty clauses, is poorly preserved. One closing line states that the date palms of that field now belong to A, who has also access to the water (mê ša A). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: B.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Nabû-zēru-iqīša//Esagilāya; C = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kudurru//Išpāru; D = Nabû-uballiṭ/Zēr-Bābili//Etel-pî; E = Etellu/Išpāru
Title: BM 32423 +

Paraphrase:
Purchase of plots of land and of slaves, with redistribution of incomes among creditors.
Composite tablet, known from five copies. A purchases eight plots of land from four members of the same family: B1, his uncle B2, his grandmother fB3 and his mother fB4; these fields belonged to B1 as a consequence of a previous purchases made by his father (C) and his mother.
The text begins providing details for these preceding deals, starting with six plots of land situated in Šuppatu, in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon:
1) C bought 1;4.3.3 Kor (25875 m2) of agricultural land (zēru) in the open country (eqel ṣēri) for 2 minas and 3 shekels of silver, inclusive of the additional payment (adi atri), from D (C ina qātē D … mahīra epešu). It consists parly of a cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi) bearing fruit (iṣṣi bilti) and partly of cultivated as well as newly cleared land (mērešu u taptû). Within this total area, 0;2.0.3 Kor (5625 m2) corresponds to the surface of the land cultivated with dates, whose value (šuqultu) corresponds to 1 mina and 15 shekels of silver; 1;2.3 Kor (20250 m2) is the surface of the cultivated as well as newly cleared land (mērešu u taptû), whose value (šuqultu) corresponds to 45 shekels of silver.
2) C also bought 1;1.4 Kor (18000 m2) of cultivated land (zēru mērešu), of which 1 Kor (13500 m2) is of lower quality (kalû u gabību), for 37 1/4 shekels of silver from E (A ina qātē C … mahīra epešu).
3) fB4 bought a plot of land, whose surface details are lost in a lacuna, for 43 1/3 shekels of silver from [E?] (fD ina qātē [PN] … mahīra epešu). This plot is located in the open country (eqel ṣēri) and it is a cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi).
4) The same woman bought for the same amount of silver another plot of land whose area is unknown, from a seller whose name is also lost. The land is located in the open country (eqel ṣēri): it is a cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi) bearing fruit (iṣṣi bilti).
5) C also bought 0;3.2 Kor (6300 m2) of agricultural land (zēru) in the open country (eqel ṣēri) for 1 mina of silver, from F (A ina qātē E … mahīra epešu). This area includes a cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi) bearing fruit (iṣṣi bilti) as well as cultivated land (mērešu).
6) The description of the last plot of agricultural land is lost in a lacuna, only the term wasteland (kišubbû) can be read with certainty.
Then, the text records the purchase of 2 more areas (erṣetu):
7) Details for the first one cannot be read because of a gap in the tablet: from what is left, we know that fB4 bought this land from someone (whose name is lost) for [x]+2/3 minas of silver.
8) G bought an area of 6 sq. r (73,50 m2) in Tē, inside the city of Babylon, for 2 minas and 4 shekels of silver from H1 and his wife fH2 (G ina qātē H1 u fH2 … mahīra epešu).
Finally, the purchase of the three slaves I1, I2 and fI3 is mentioned: their price (mahīrātišunu) amounts to 5 minas of silver.
Then, the tablet provides the totals: 4;3.5.3 kor (64575 m2) of cultivated land sold for 5 minas and 49 shekels of silver – inclusive of the additional payment (adi atri); 27;5.6 sq. r (371,85 m2) of land sold for 13 minas and 48 1/2 shekels of silver – inclusive of the additional payment and of the clothing (adi atri u lubāri); three slaves I1, I2 and fI3, sold for 5 minas of silver.
Now, A purchases all these properties for 24 minas and 37 shekels of silver, i.e. their full price (šīmīšu! gamrūtu), from B1, B2 (uncle of B1), fB3 (grandmother of B1) and fB4 (mother of B1 and wife of C). The sellers confirm that they have received (mahāru) the whole amount of silver which was due for their fields, houses and slaves, and they are satisfied (aplū) All the parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received.
The income of these business deals are then transferred to L1 and fL2, the creditors (rāšû) of C (B1’s father), B2, fB3 and fB4: they take out 20 minas and 17 shekels from the total amount of silver, as payment for their credit (ina rašûtišunu). M1 and M2, who previously took a house as pledge (maškanu ṣabātu) and have lived inside it since then, take the remaining silver: 4 minas and 20 shekels.
Finally, the text states that the fingernails (ṣupru) of the sellers B1, B2, fB3 and fB4 are impressed on the tablet instead of their seal impressions (kunukku). Names of 7 witnesses and 4 scribes.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Nādin-ahi/Kidin-Marduk//Šangû-Gula; B2 = Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Zēria//Šangû-Gula, uncle of B1; fB3 = fQudašu/Bēl-iddin//Rē'i-sīsê, grandmother of B1; fB4 = fBu'itu/Nabû-bān-ahi//Šangû-Gula, mother of B1 and wife of C; C = Kidin-Marduk/Zēria//Šangû-Gula, father of B1; D = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Nabû-bān-ahi//Šangû-Gula; E = Iddin-Marduk/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Asû; F = Nā'id-Marduk; G = Ṣillāya/Arad-Nabû//Nūr-Sîn; H1 = Lâbāši-Marduk/Bēl-nādin-apli//Ša-ṭābtišu; fH2 = fAmat-Ninlil, wife of H1; I1 = Sillu-Bēl, slave; I2 = Nabû-kuṣranni, slave; fI3 = fKaššāya, slave; L1 = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; fL2 = fIna-Esagila-rāmat, wife of L1; M1 = Ahhea; M2 = Arad-Bēl
Title: BM 32188+

Paraphrase:
Allocation of land
A allocates arable land located in Erasu (= village, town?, uncl.) to fB, not including the 1/4 share of land that she owns together with her brother.
 
A = Marduk-bāni-zēri/Etellu//Bēl-ēṭir; fB = fBu’ītu
Title: BM 30515

Paraphrase:
Confirmation of payment.
It concerns the 5;3.0 kor (c. 1008 l.) of [seeds?] that B owes to A1 and A2. A fragmentary passage makes clear that this claim (rašûtu, wr. ri-šu-tu4) has apparently been paid by C, because any document that may turn up (?) in this matter should be regarded as belonging to (?!) (text has ina muhhi) C. The creditors cannot bring a suit (dabābu) against him. They have been paid (eṭēru). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: A2. A short note at the end of this document points out that a debt owed by D to the same creditors should be considered paid they turn up, they belong to C (D’s son). (cf. BM31384)
 
A1 = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Bēl-rēmanni//Balāṭu; A2 = Šāpik-zēri/ Nergal-ušallim//Sîn-karābī-išme; B = Ardia/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//...; C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi, son of D; D = Šulāya/Zēru-ukīn//Egibi
Title: BM 41391

Paraphrase:
Court protocol(?). Very fragmentary.
The obverse must have contained c. 15 lines but is completely broken off. Also the reverse is almost completely lost, and all that is preserved is the very end of the transaction: as compensation payment for a loss caused (mullû) … followed by the list of witnesses that were present at this court verdict (purussî dīni): names of the sartennu-official: Sîn-erība; and 8 judges (dayyānu), a.o. Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; and the names of 2 scribes: Nādinu//Pahāru, and Nabû-šumu-iškun//Rab-banê
Title: BM 31398

Paraphrase:
Deposition before witnesses.
The tablet records the names of those who witnessed (ina pānišunu) a statement pronounced by A to B. The content of the dialogue is lost, the only readable words refer to an oath taken by C. Rest broken off. Names of 2 witnesses, no scribe. With place of issue, and dated.
 
A = Rēmūtu/Bēl-nādinapli; B = Lâbāši/Zeria//Nabāya; C = Iqīšāya
Title: BM 30607

Paraphrase:
Sale of slaves
A, of his own free will, sells his young female slaves fC1 and fC2 to B. The total purchase price amounts to 4 minas of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy. The seller aknowledges that he has received the entire sum from the buyer. D guarantees against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person claiming (pāqirānu) that fC1 and fC2, who belong to A's household (nīšū bīti), are royal slaves (arad šarrūtu) or free persons (mār banê) – claims that should not arise about these two female slaves. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Kalbāya/Ṣillāya/Nabāya; B = Bēl-iddin/…//Ēṭiru; fC1 = fBānītu-tadinnu; fC2 = fNanāya-silīm; D = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 31299

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 1 mina and 14 shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy, to A. He will pay the silver without interest in Addar (XII) in Babylon. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe: Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Iddin-Nabû//Miṣirayyu.
 
A = Nidintu/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Sasinnu; B = Šiški/Iddināya//Egibi (aka: Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu).
Title: BM 30878

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver. Partial payment of a debt.
Concerning the 2 1/2 minas of medium quality (nuhhutu) silver of which 1/8 is alloy (bitqu) that are part of (ina) A’s claim (uˀiltu) for 3 minas 3 shekels of medium quality silver of which 1/8 is alloy against B (cf. BM30973). A receives in full (mahāru-eṭēru) these 2 1/2 minas from B. Fragmentary list of witnesses and the name of the scribe:  ...-zēru-ibni/Mušēzib-Bēl//Dābibi.
 
A = Arad-Nergal/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Eppeš-ilī; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 31846

Paraphrase:
Court protocol: litigation about a slave sale. Very fragmentary.
A sold his female slave fC to B in Ayyār (II) of Nabonidus' 11th regnal year; the agreed purchase price was recorded in the text, but it is broken off. Someone (possibly D1, whose name is lost, and his sister fD2) brought a suit against this sale (in front of?) E, claiming rights on fC. They came in front of Nabonidus’ judges and E said: "F has […] [f]C. Rest broken off. Names of 6 witnesses (all of them are judges) and 2 scribes.
 
A = Nabû-ēreš/Tabnēa//Ahu-bāni; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fC = fBāba-magāri-alsīš/…; D1 = broken name; fD2 = fSinun(t)u, sister of D1; E = Ina-Esagil-zēru/Rēmūtu//Arad-Nergal; F = .../Nabāya
Title: BM 31535

Paraphrase:
Settlement of accounts.
Contract (u’iltu) related to the settlement of accounts (epuš nikkassi) between A and B. A swears an oath to B acknowledging that he still owes him 10 shekels of silver; it is also acknowledged that A has already given (nadānu) the remaining (rīhtu) 4 1/3 shekels of silver to B (this debt likely refers to the lease of a house and a slave, as recorded in BM33918). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Name of 1 witness and the scribe: Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bāni-zēri//Bēl-ēṭir.
 
A = Kalbāya/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: MMA 79.7.29

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave.
fA, of her own free will, sells her female slave fC to B, at a harīṣ-price amounting to 1 mina of silver. fA guarantees against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person claiming (pāqirānu) that fC1 is a royal slave (amat šarrūtu) or a free person (mār banê). (This sale) is to be kept apart (elat) from B's claim (rašûtu) against fA’s husband, D, which is still pending.  fA acknowledges that she has received 1 mina of silver from B, as payment for the slave fC. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA = fKaššāya/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Mandidi; B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; fC = fKabtāya; D = Marduk-erība, husband of fA
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 318; Ziemer, BA 3 (1898), 471 f.; Shiff 1987, no.  211.
Title: BM 31050

Paraphrase:
Receipt
Concerning the debt (u’iltu) which B owes to A for sesame.
C receives (mahāru) 30;0.0.0 kor sesam on behalf of (ina našparti) his brother B from fD1, wife of A, and D2, slave of A. At the end of the document it is repeated that the sesame is that which is recorded (e’elû) in A’s promissory note against B. The background is B’s purchase of sesame from A. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B =Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-bēlšunu//Lakuburru; C =Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Nabû-bēlšunu//Lakuburru, brother of B; fD1 = fIna-Esagila-ramât; D2 = Nergal-rēṣūa
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 270; Dandamaev 1984, 367, no. 53; Shiff 1987, no.  181.
Title: BM 30420

Paraphrase:
Land rental.
A and his brothers rent land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) located along the Bitqu-ša-Ile’’i-Bēl to B, who should perform gardening work (nukaribbūtu). In Abu (V) he should carry out the excavation work for irrigation; he will take care of the palm fronds (libbu) and branches (harūtu). He will not cut off sprouts (raṭbu). As long as he will dig ditches using a winnowing shovel (pīsu) and remove lumps (parku) from the ground, he will receive 5 kor (900 l) of dates per kor that he will have farmed as gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Kalbāya/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Tabnēa/Marduk-šumu-uṣur-ibni//Ša-nāšīšu
Title: BM 30912

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver, owed by B to A (uncertain). Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = fKabtāya/Kalbāya//Egibi. Archival evidence shows that she is the wife of Nergal-ušēzib/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi, and granddaughter of f…/Šulāya//Egibi
Title: BM 103530

Paraphrase:
Resolution for a dispute related to rights of access.
The text sets forth that A1 and A2 can use only their own way out (mūṣû) which is located near the canal. They are not allowed to use the path which is found behind B’s house: that way out belongs (exclusively) to B. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-erība/Rēmūtu//Miṣirayyu; A2 = Kalbāya/Balāṭu/Rab-banê; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi
Title: BM 31159

Paraphrase:
Interim settlement of accounts within the framework of a business partnership (harranu). Very fragmentary.
The document opens by listing the amounts that each of the partners withdrew (nasāhu) from the business account, but is broken off in the middle. All that is preserved is that A withdrew 1 mina 33 1/4 shekels of silver and B apparenty the same amount.  Remainder lost. Names of at least 3 witnesses and the scribe: …/Bēl-rēmanni//… .
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Bēlšunu/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Sîn-imitti
Title: BM 32676

Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 279f; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 3 (1894), 38; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 171.
Title: BM 30817

Paraphrase:
Exchange of land and slaves.
The document records the exchange (ṭuppi šupêlti) of a building plot (eqel bīti) with land and female slaves (aštapiru) that A and B1 together with his wife fB2 have switched with each other (ana ahāmiš šupêlu). First, a description of the building plot is provided. Its long side in the West measures 56 2/3 cubits (c. 28,3 m) and is adjacent to the houses of C, D and E; the long side in the East is 54 1/3 cubits (c. 27,1 m) long and is adjacent to the house of F. The front side in the North measures 21 1/3 cubits (c. 10,6 m) and borders on the wide street (sūqu rapšu), the thoroughfare of gods and the king; the front side in the South is  20 2/3 cubits (c. 10, 3 m) long and adjacent to the house of G. The total surface of this building plot in Hursagkalamma, in the city of Kiš, is 24 sq. r (294 m2): this is B1 and fB2‘s house. A’s property consists of 1 Kor (13500 m2) of arable land (zēru), cultivated (mērešu) and located in Šuppatu near the house of [PN]; to this, he adds three slaves (aštapiru) fH1, fH2 and fH3. A, B1 and fB2, have exchanged with each other these properties with full and voluntary consent (ina migir libbišunu); each one of them guarantees (pūtu našû) for the exchanged goods. There will be no future comeback nor claim. They write this document recording the exchange (ṭuppi šupêlti) in order to make sure that the agreement will not be changed (lā enû) and each one takes a copy of it. Names of 6 witnesses (including fI, fB2‘s sister) and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Nādin/Nādin-ahi//Amēl-Isin; fB2 = fInṣabtu/Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Arad-Nergal, wife of B1; C = Iribāya/Nādin; D = Libluṭ/Marduk-nāṣir//Nūr-Adad; E = Bēl-iddin/Arad-Gula//Zērāya; F = Basia/Iqīš; G = Mukīl-appāti; fH1= fŠa-Ninlil-udda; fH2 = fNanāya-Ittia; fH3 = fNanāya-kilīlī-uṣrī; fI = fŠin-banâ/Marduk-šuma-uṣur//Arad-Nergal
Title: BM 33973

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
The tablet records the purchase of agricultural land; the text has been divided into paragraphs, marked on the tablet by a line drawn at the end of each one (and indicated below in the paraphrase by LINE).
A purchases land from B: the upper part of the tablet, with the description of the purchased land, is broken; only a family name, Atu, is extant. (LINE) The details on its size and location are still readable: its upper side in the North measures 3750 cubits (1875 m) and borders on (the property of) B; its lower side in the South, that has the same length as the upper side, is adjacent to (the property of) A. Its upper front in the West, 30 cubits (15 m) long, is on the bank of the Euphrates (kišād puratti) and the lower front in the East, same size, borders on (the property of) C. LINE
The total area of this plot of land is 1;4.3.3 kor (25875 m2). It consists of 0;2.0.3 kor (5625 m2) of land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) valued (šuqultu) 1 mina and 15 shekels, at a ratio of 1 shekel of silver for each 0;0.0.1 kor (75 m2) of land,  and 1;2.3 kor (20250 m2) of cultivated as well as newly cleared land (mērešu u taptû) valued (šuqultu) 45 shekels at a ratio of 1 shekel of silver for each 0;0.1 kor (450 m2) of land). A declares the equivalent for this land together with the seller B (A itti B mahīra nabû išām) to be 2 minas of silver. He pays (nadānu) him the total purchase price (šīmišu gamrūtu), plus 3 shekels of silver as additional payment (kî atri). LINE
B acknowledges that he has received (mahāru) in total 2 minas and 3 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), and he is satisfied (apālu  G Stat). The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. Names of 7 witnesses (including one woman, fD, wife of A) and the scribe.
 
A = Kidin-Marduk/Zēria//Šangû-Gula; B = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Nabû-bān-ahi//Šangû-Gula; C = Bēl-iddin/Nūr-Ea//Atû; fD = f(Ina)-Esagil-rāmat/...//Gahul, wife of A
Title: BM 31834

Paraphrase:
Addendum to a land sale.
A purchased (ina qātē … mahāru) two plots of land: the first one was a plot of arable land (zēru) situated along the Sukullâtu-street, which he bought from D and his brothers by means of his proxy, B. This land was part of the dowry (nudunnû) of the sellers’ mother fC; the price, a non-specified amount of silver, was payed to D and his brothers. Later, A also bought (ina qātē … mahāru) a 0;0.1.1 Kor (525 m2) plot of arable land (zēru) that was part of the parcel (qutānu) of D and his brothers; he paid it with silver. The present document was drafted with the sole aim to point out that D’s wife (fE) witnessed the sales (ana mukinnūti wašābu), thus implying her consent to them. The related text BM30449, written the same day as this document, records the presence of another woman (the wife of one of D’s brothers) among the witnesses; the name of the mother is written differently in the two tablets, however it must be the same person. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe. The technical term for proxy is not used, but B’s role is inferable from the content of the text.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Nabû-bān-ahi/Marduk-nāṣir//Mudammiq-Adad; fC = fKuttāya/Bēl-upahhir//Sîn-šadûnu; D = Šāpik-zēri/Šumu-ukīn//Sîn-šadûnu; fE = f[…], wife of D
Title: RM 942

Paraphrase:
About a dispute. Summon(?). Fragmentary.
The first line(s) of the tablet is (are) broken and then a reference is made to something (or someone) under the administrative responsibility (ša qātē) of D [title broken off], and (?) of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) C. 
In the 6th year of king Darius A will(?) produce (elû Š, Pres. wr. ú-še-la; or Pret.? "has produced") him/it before (ina pāni) D because of his dispute with (ana muhhi, broken) B. A has taken him/it away (abāku) from (lapāni) B by order of (ina našparti) C. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Kīnāya/Niqūdu//Nabāya. 
 
A = Zanziri/Nūrēa//Šangu-Nanāya; B = Šišku/Iddināya//Egibi (aka: Marduk-nāṣir-apli//Itti-Marduk-balāṭu); C = Nabû-ušallim; D = Pitihuru
Title: BM 32929

Paraphrase:
Fragmentary receipt
