The tablet is too damaged to reconstruct its content. It belongs to the Egibi/Nūr-Sîn archive because Iddin-Marduk(/Iqišāya//Nūr-Sîn) and his wife fIna-Esagila-rāmat(/Zēria//Nabāya) are mentioned. Legible are the verb mahāru and the word bitqu, which may indicate that the document is a receipt of an amount of silver. Apart from the names of 2 witnesses, name of the scribe, place and date are broken.
Title: BM 31971

Paraphrase:
Establishment of a business partnership
A invested 10 shekels of silver in a business partnership with B (ana harrāni nadānu), who still owes this silver to A (ša A ina muhhi B). The partners agree that they will share equally (ahi zittu akālu) in the profits (utru) that B makes with the silver in or out of town. It is further stipulated that C will run the business (ina našparti alāku). This silver debt comes in addition to (elat) the 3 shekels of silver which B owes within the framework of a business partnership with D. It is silver that fE, wife of F, the courtier (rēš-šarri), ordered (ina amāti) to give to B.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sin; B = Ša-Nabû-lišlim, slave of F; C = Nabû-zuqup-enšu; D = Širiktu/Nūrea//Dannea; fE = fQīšāya,  wife? of F; F = Īnia (rēš-šarri)
Title: BM 30494

Paraphrase:
Dissolution of a business partnership (harrānu). Final balance payment.
The tablet records the settlement of accounts (epuš nikkassi) for a business partnership (harrānu), carried out between A and B after the death of the first partner, C (A’s father). A takes possession (ana muhhi elû) of 6 minas and 16 shekels of silver, taken from the business assets (harrānu), and of fD1, fD2 and her son, (whose value is) calculated (manû) as 4 minas and 30 shekels of silver. This is A’s half share (ahi zitti). B takes possession (ana muhhi elû) of 4 minas of silver, corresponding to the price (šīmu) received for the harvested dates (ebūru), and of fE1, E2 and E3. This is B‘s half share (ahi zitti). The two parties agree that they have completely carried out (qatû) their settlement of accounts (epuš nikkassi). Their promissory notes (u‘iltu) are paid off (eṭēru Stat.), (what was listed in) their writing boards (lēˀu) is obliterated (pašāṭu D Stat.) and their documents (giṭṭu) are broken (hepû D Stat.). They also agree not to divide (karû) for the time being the fugitive slaves (amīlūtu) and everything else that may turn up as belonging to their business (harrānu). They hold an equal share (ahātu) in their land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) and land under grain cultivation (pî šulpi), located at the outlet (bābu) of the Kutha canal. As long as they share this landed property, they will also jointly benefit from the yield (ebūru). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Bēlšunu/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Sinimitti; C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi, father of A; fD1 = fBānītu-bēlu-uṣur; fD2 = fAna-bītišu; fE1 = fArrabatu; E2 = Barqusu; E3 = Nabû-lū-salim
Title: MNB 1129

Paraphrase:
Gift of property by a woman to her sons in return for lifelong maintenance
fA, out of her own free will, issued a sealed document in which she donated some of her assets (kanāku – dagālu Š) to her eldest son B1. The assets in question are: (1) the 60 shekels of silver that are deposited in her name with C, consisting in part of the 35 shekels of silver that D1 owes her, and for which his house has been taken as pledge, and in part of the 20 shekels of silver that  fD2 owes her; (2) the 1;0.2 kor of arable land (zēru) located at the canal (nāru) to Kiš and part of her dowry.
fA also donated 1½ minas and 6 shekels of her silver to her four other sons (B2-5), and although B1 was not present at this donation (ina lā ašābi) he agreed not to contest it (dabābu). B1's title over the assets that had been donated to him is confirmed. As long as his mother lives, he has to maintain (kurummatu) her with the interest on the silver he received and provide her with clothing (muṣiptu). She is not allowed to donate (ana rīmūti râmu) anything from what she gave to him, or make any deductions from it (nishu nasāhu). He is not obliged to pay off (eṭēru, wr. ul iṭṭir) (his mother's) creditors. Names of 3 witnesses, and in the presence (ina ašābi) of fB6, B1's sister; name of the scribe: Marduk-erība/Rēmūt-Gula//Miṣirayyu.
 
fA = fGugūa/Zākir//Išinû; B1= Ea-zēru-ibni(/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Egibi), eldest son of fA; B2= Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ(/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Egibi), son of fA;  B3= Nergal-ina-tēšê-eṭir(/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Egibi), son of fA;  B4= Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu(/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Egibi), son of fA;  B5= Zababa-pir'-uṣur;  fB6= fBābāya/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Egibi; C= Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; D1= Tabnēa/Nabû-ušallim/Sîn-šadûnu; fD2= fTašmētu-rāmat/Arad-Bēl//Egibi.
Title: BM33063

Paraphrase:
Injunction.
By the end of Tašrīt (VII), fA (B’s wife) will bring and hand over (našû-nadānu) the judge’s tablet (ṭuppu) as well as her husband’s document (šaṭāru) to D. These documents are related to land (zēru) located on the Hazuzu ditch (harru): B donated this land to his wife in the presence of his mother (fC) who witnessed the transaction (ana mukinnūtu šūšubu), wrote a document (attesting the transfer of the property) and gave it to his wife. Now, this land has been bought (ana kaspi mahāru) by D, to whom fA should give the tablets. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA = fSūqā’ītu/Rēmūtu, wife of B; B = Bēl-uballiṭ; fC = fKuttāya, mother of B; D = Nabû-bān-ahi/Marduk-nāṣir//Mudammiq-Adad
Title: BM 30505

Paraphrase:
Dowry gift. Very fragmentary.
A gives of his own free will the dowry of his daughter fC to B. It consists of 1 kor (13500 m2) of land from his land at the Hazuzu ditch that is planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) , 3 slaves (amēluttu), and household utensils. The rest of the tablet is broken. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe: Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bāni-zēri/Bēl-ēṭiru.

A=Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B=Kurbanni-Marduk/Etellu//Ēṭiru; fC=fNanāya-ēṭirat, bride and daughter of A.
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 336; Wunsch, AfO 42/43 (1995/1996), no. 3; Krecher 1970, 229; Weingort 1939, 18; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 2 (1891), 11f; Roth, JAOS 111 (1991), 26-27, 37.
Title: BM 32072

Bibliography: To be published by Johannes Hackl.
Title: BM 31830

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver, return of the purchase price to the seller.
A purchased the (slave-)cook C from B by proxy. D1, the middleman, took (našû) 5/6 minas of silver from him in order to pay (eṭēru) the price for the cook to the seller. However, it turned out that D1 did not pay (eṭēru) to the seller. In the present document, A, the seller acknowledges that he received ( eṭēru) the outstanding 5/6 minas of silver and the interest on it from D2, the middleman’s son, according to the promissory note.  Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-nādin-apli/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Šigûa; B = Nabû-kāṣir/Nūr-Sîn//Iddin-Papsukkal; C = Nabû-silīm, a (slave?-)cook (lúMU);  D1 = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Šulāya//Egibi; D2 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi, son of D1
Title: BM 31328

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver. Purchase price of building plots, with transfer of (part of) the silver to the seller’s creditor.
Concerns two building plots (qanû) which A purchased (ana kaspi nadānu) from respectively B1 and B2, and his payment of the purchase price by proxy. The first plot measures 4;0.1.6 gi (c. xxx m2) and was sold for the agreed price (šīmu gamru) of 2 ½ minas and 1 ½ shekels of silver and unspecified amounts of an additional payment (atru) and lubāru-garments. The second plot measures 2;0.6 2/3.0 gi  (c. xxx m2) and was sold for the agreed price (šīmu gamru) of 1 2/3 minas and 7 1 ½ shekels of silver. In the present document the sellers acknowledge their receipt (eṭēru) of the above mentioned sums of silver from C who acts on the buyer’s order (ina našparti). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Neriglissar/Bēl-šumu-iškun; B1 = Marduk-šākin-šumi/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Šigûa; B2 = Kurbanni-Marduk/Šūzibu//Andahar; C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi
Title: BM 31244

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver. Payment of two debts by a third party.
fA1 receives the 1 mina of silver that B owes to her and for which she took a 2 GAR building plot as pledge. It concerns two separate debts: one for 40 shekels of silver and the other for 20 shekels. The silver is paid to her by C and she handed the documents pertaining to these debts over to him. What had been pledge to her is now pledged to C. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Kīnaya/Lamassu-Gula/Šangû-Gula.
fA = fAmāt-Ninlil/Zēr-Bābili/Pahāru; fB = fṬābatu/Bēl-ahhē-erība/Ša-ṭābtišu; B2 = Nabû-uballiṭ, son of fB; C = Marduk-rēmanni/Iddin-Marduk/Nūr-Sîn
Bibliography: Reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 249; Schiff 1987, no.158; Petschow, ZSS 76 (1959), 22.
Title: BM 30836

Paraphrase:
Oath.
A, the deputy (šanû)* of Šahrinu, B’s son, swears (tamû) to C that he will deliver (abāku) some criminals (sarru) by a given deadline (adannu) and that he will pay to C(?) a compensation (sartu) (for them). The overseers (paqudānu) of Šahrinu are also mentioned in the text. Names of witnesses and the scribe.
*wr. šá--nu-ú, emended according to CAD Š/1, 398, s.v. šanû.
 
A = Marduk-iqīšannu, šanû; B = Ardia/…; C = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: MLC 1775

Paraphrase:
Litigation: Obligation to pronounce an oath.
The text states that A, B’s slave, will be available (uzzuzu) on Nisan (I), 1st, and swear an oath to the gods before Šamaš at its rising (niphu, i.e. at sunrise), (standing) within a magic circle (gišhuri) and in front of C. The dispute is about two promissory notes (u’iltu). The first one, for an amount of 1 mina and 15 shekels of silver, was established the 11th of Dûzu (IV) of Nabonidus’ 12th year: for this, A took as a pledge (maškanu ṣabātu) the arable land (zēru) located in front of the Giššu Gate. The second one, for 6 1/4 shekels of silver, was established the 10th of Abu (V) of the same year and must be paid by D: A will bring and show (kalāmu D) this document to C. In the oath, A will swear that he holds no lawsuit against C and that he is committing no fraud (niklu). Neither did he receive silver, barley, clothes (muṣibtu), nor anything else from his property (makkūru) – nor did he take anything himself, or turned to a superior (mamma elû) who did it for him. After D’s death, he did not change (šanû D) the cuneiform writing (tikip santakki) of these promissory notes – beyond the changes that were made already during D’s life. Then, he will swear that he did not appropriate (katāmu) D’s valuables (būšu) or property (makkūru) nor did he say “I have it; I know where it is”. He must state that he is not holding a deposit (tarkuttu), a promissory note (u’iltu), a special arrangement (riksu), a document (ṭuppu) nor anything else belonging to D – and that he never gave anything to anyone, nor does he know where it has been placed, nor did he give anything to anyone and hide (pasānu) it from (lapān) C. According to this oath, he does not claim anything that was not written in the promissory note that he showed (kalāmu D) to C. After having sworn this, he will release (muššuru) C’s […]. If he does not swear, A will return the previous promissory note dated to Dûzu (IV) and he will hand it over to C (târu D-nadānu). One final clause states that A will swear only if the 20th day is a free (petû, lit. ‘open’) day: if not, then he will swear the following month (Ayyār (II), 20th). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-uterri, slave of B; B = Iddināya (=Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi); C = Nādinu; D = Nabû-ēreš
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 2000, no. 166; Krecher 1970, 196; Oppenheim, JAOS 61 (1941), 253f; Joannès, Lafont 1997, 173.
Title: BM 31738+

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
The tablet records the purchase of agricultural land which, given its irregular shape, is calculated according to two different measured areas: each one of these smaller plots is described separately, marked on the tablet by a line drawn at the end of each paragraph (and indicated below in the paraphrase by LINE). 
Overall, the purchased land consists of 0;2.3.3.9 Kor (7042, 5 m2) of agricultural land (zēru). It consists of a cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi), and is located at the branch of the Borsippa Canal in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon. LINE. 
The first measured area (mišihtu) is first defined by its borders: the upper side in the North measures 583 2/3 cubits (291,8 m) and borders on (the property of) C; its lower side in the South measures 580 5/6 cubits (290,4 m) and borders on (the property of) D. Its fronts measure 44 1/8 cubits (22,08 m), and are adjacent to (the property of) E and his brothers in the West, and the royal street (harrān šarri) in the East. In total, this area consists of 0;2.2.3.1 Kor (6532,5 m2) of land, including (adi) 0;0.0.1.4 Kor (105 m2) of bow property (bīt qašti), whose upper and lower borders (miṣru) are included in this plot of land. LINE
The second measured area (mišihtu) is also defined through its bordering properties: its upper side in the North measures 48 cubits (24 m) and borders on (the property of) C, the lower side in the South measures 50 cubits (25 m) and borders on (the property of) D; its fronts measure 41 2/3 (20,8 m) cubits and are adjacent to the royal street (harrān šarri) in the West and to the royal marshes (raqqatu ša šarri) in the East. In total, this area consists of 0;0.1.0.8 Kor (510 m2) of land. LINE
The total surface of this measured field (eqlu mišihtu) is 0;2.3.3.9 Kor (7042,5 m2). LINE
A declares the equivalent for this land together with the seller B (A itti B mahīra nabû išām) to be 1 shekels for each 3 3/4 gar (28,1 m2) of land. The buyer gives (nadānu) 4 minas and 10 2/3 shekels of silver as its total price (šīmišu gamrūtu), plus 4 1/3 shekels of silver as additional payment (kî atri). LINE
B acknowledges that he has received (mahāru) in total 4 minas and 15 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), and he is satisfied (apālu  G Stat). The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. Fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of the seller B, instead of his seal impression (kunukku). Names of 6 witnesses and 2 scribes.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Nabû-zēru-iqīša/Marduk-Šarrani//Esagilāya; C = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kudurru//Išpāru; D = Mušēzib-Bēl/Šullumāya//Etel-pî; E = Rēmūtu-Gula/Etellu//Išpāru
Title: BM 41511

Paraphrase:
Court protocol.
A presents a complaint against B1 and B2 in front of the judges of Nabonidus. The two men claimed that they owed a debt (u’iltu) amounting to 5 minas of silver to C, for which their field near the Hazuzu ditch (harru) had been taken as a pledge (maškanu ṣabātu). According to them that field was then sold (ana kaspi nadānu) to D, A’s father, thus they demanded for 30 shekels of silver from A, in exchange for the promissory note (u’iltu) related to the first debt. A, soliciting proofs, withheld (kalû D) the tablet and asked them to present C, but then B1 grabbed (habātu) that promissory note away from his hands and chewed it (kasāsu). The judges interrogated (ša’ālu) B1 and B2, who maintained that the promissory note had been paid off (eṭēru), and that A had summoned them for no reason. The judges then asked them to present (abālu) C, the (alleged) creditor, but the two men did not do it and changed (nakāru) their declaration, saying that they did not know him. Therefore, the judges now deliberate (malāku): the promissory note brought by B1 and B2 turns out to be false (ana surrāti), and the two must pay to A 10 times the 5 minas of silver of the debt that hey had falsified. Moreover, for the purpose of bringing forward (abāku) the scribe who wrote the false promissory note, they placed B1 and B2 him in fetters and handed them over (paqādu) to A. Names of 7 judges and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Šāpik-zēri/Šumu-ukīn//Sîn-šadûnu; B2 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Šumu-ukīn//Sîn-šadûnu; C = Rēmūtu/Ina-qibit-Nabû; D = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi, father of A
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 186; Moore, NBBAD (1935), no. 219; Holtz 2014, no. 29.
Title: BM 32165+

Paraphrase:
Fragment of a document related to the purchase of a house.
The text mentions 2 minas and 10 shekels of silver, what remains (rēhtu) (to be paid) for the price (šīmu) of A1’s and fA2’s house. The house is now at someone’s disposal (name lost). Rest broken off. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-zēru-līšir/Nabunnāya.
 
A1 = Apla-dādu-abārī/Apla-dād-natan; fA2 = fBunanitu, mother of A1
Title: BM 31675

Paraphrase:
Land lease agreement
Concerns the arable land that the brothers A1 and A2 leased to B's disposal against the payment of a fixed rent (sūtu). B should cultivate (erēšu) the land and at harvest time, in Ayyar (II) of Darius' 16th year, he can take the (entire) barley yield (ebūru ša uṭṭāti). After the harvest, he should release the field (muššuru) to its owners (A1 and A2). He is also entitled to cultivate the bīt dulli-field that is included in the lease agreement (u'iltu ša sūti) but as yet uncultivated (la epšu), and afterwards release it to its owners. He cannot bring suit (ragāmu) against B with regard to the cultivation of the arable land that was previously fallow (taptû) (and) had not been tilled prior to the conclusion of the said lease agreement. Names of 10 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-nādin-šumi und A2 = Rēmūt-Bēl, sons of Erība-Marduk/Mandidi; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Bibliography: Petschow 1956 (NBPf.),10; Krecher 1970, 313f; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 3 (1894), 42; Koschaker 1911, 187.
Title: BM 41432

Paraphrase:
Warranty for a debtor. Undertaking to bring the indebted object/sum.
A guarantees for B, who is indebted to C: on the 15th of Arahsamna (VIII) B will bring it (the object is not mentioned explicitly) and hand it over to C. Should he fail to do so, then A will pay B’s debt to C in full. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šamaš-ilu/ Nabû-ahu-iddin; B = Nabû-nāṣir/Mušēzib; C = Šulāya/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//Egibi
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 121; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 1 (1890), 12f; Koschaker 1911, 44f.
Title: BM 32868

Paraphrase:
Marriage agreement with divorce and adultery clauses
Dialogue document. The groom A asks the bride’s father B to give (nadānu, imp. bi in-nam-ma) him fC, his daughter, in marriage (ana aššūti). The request is followed by B’s statement of accidence (šemû) and the confirmation that he gave his daughter to A in marriage. This is followed by clauses foreseeing the dissolution of the marriage. Should B divorce (muššuru) his wife (fC), or should he want to take a second wife (aššatu šanītu ahāzu), i.e. in addition to her, he will have to pay her 6 minas of silver, and she can go (alāku) where she wishes (ašar ṣebât) Should fC commit adultery and be caught in flagrante (kašādu),  she will be put to death with an iron dagger. The parties to the contract swore (nīš zakāru) by Nabû and Marduk, and by Nebuchadnezzar not to contravene the agreement (ana la enê). Names of 5 witnesses, a.o. the bride’s brother Mār-šarru-ilūa/Arba’ilāya and the scribe: Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi.
 
A= Nabû-ahu-iddin/Aplāya; B= Dalīli-eššu/Arba’ilāya; fC= fBanât-Esagil, daughter of B.
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 133; Marx, BA 4 (1902), 7f.; Peiser, ZA 3 (1888), 77ff; Revillout, PSBA 9 (1887), 172ff.
Title: Liverpool unknown 8 (Strassmaier 1885)

Paraphrase:
Transfer of slaves as security for a dowry
The first part of the tablet records in direct speech B’s request to his son-in-law A1 for a compensation of his daughter's (A2) dowry silver after the  creditors (rāšû) of A1’s father reduced it (nušurrû šakānu). A2’s dowry consisted of 7 mina of silver, 3 slaves (amīlūtu), household utensils (udê bīti), and an additional 3 mina of silver belonging to the dowry casket (quppu). The second part of the tablet records in direct speech A1’s statement of accedence for this dowry compensation. In response to B’s request A1 grants ownership title over (pāni dagālu Š-stem) the slave fC and her 3 children, the slave fC2 and her 2 children and whatever he owns in and outside town in a sealed document (kanāku) instead of the 7 mina of dowry silver (kūm nudunnû). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; A2 = fIna-Esagila-rāmat/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Zēria/Nabû-ibni//Nabāya; fC1 = fUbartu; fC2 = fNanāya-kēširat
Title: BM 32139

Paraphrase:
Sale of slaves. Fragmentary.
A sells? (verb broken off) […] and fC2, D’s slaves, to B. The agreed purchase price is 1/2 mina of silver. B guarantees against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or claims that might be laid by E (pāqirānu). Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = …/Nabû-šumu-iškun//…; B = Rikis-Adad(IM.DÙ), slave of D; fC = fBāba-asītu; D = Bēl-šumu-iškun/Nabāya; E = Nabû-utaqqi-ina-qāti
Title: BM 31120

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Detailed arrangement for its repayment.
B owes 4 shekels of silver to fA and a complicated arrangement for its repayment is made against the background of the creditor's intention to buy a female slave (fC) from the debtor's sister fD1 and niece fD2 in the near future. B can deduct (maqātu Š) his debt of 4 shekels to fA from the slave's purchase price on the 2nd of Kislīm (IX), which is within a couple of days. However, should  fA not buy the female slave, a different procedure should be followed: B should then pay off his silver debt in dates. The exchange rate (mahīru) is fixed at 1 shekel per 0;0.3 kor of dates, being the exchange rate of Til-Gubbi (being 10% lower than the usual 1:1 rate). To this he should add 0;0.4 kor of dates. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-balāssu-iqbi/Nabû-zēru-iddin/Dābibi
 
fA = fTašmētu-damqat/Nabû-ahhē-iddin(//Egibi); B = Gimil-Nergal/Bēl-ušallim//Abu-ul-īde; fC = fIna-ṣilli-Esabad, slave, of fA; fD1 = fTappašra (= fTapaššara), sister of B; fD2 = fŠikkû, daughter of fD1 and niece of B
Title: BM 30231

Paraphrase:
Receipt or promissory note for dates. Very fragmentary.
The tablet is very damaged. It mentions 12 kor of dates that B, slave (qallu) of A, owes his master. He will deliver the 12 kor of dates in Arahsamna (VIII) (broken). The list of witnesses is broken. The scribe of the tablet is Bēl-udammiq/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balātu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = broken name
Title: BM 31875

Paraphrase:
Undertaking to give proof of registration. Fragmentary.
Concerning a bridle (pugudātu) and the ⌈KA-SAG!-KA⌉-a-na belonging to A at the disposal of (ina pāni) of B.
In Tašrīt (VII) of the 17th year B will come (alāku) to A’s house
and will give proof of registration (uzuzzu - nadānu) to C for the utensils (udû), the bridle and the ⌈KA-SAG!-KA⌉-a-na. If he doesn’t register this, he will give it to A. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe: Habaṣīru/Nidintu//Ēriš-ana-Esagil.
 
A = Širku/Iddināya//Egibi; B = Iddin-Bēl/Napuštu//…; C = Ibria (without affiliation)
Title: BM 32902

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave through a proxy.
A sells his female slave fC together with her son to B. It is pointed out that the sale is concluded through D, who acts as proxy (ina našparti) on behalf of the buyer. It is acknowledged that  D has taken away (ana kaspi abāku) the slaves, whose total purchase price (gamru) corresponds to 5/6 mina of silver, and that he wrote a document (u’iltu) in B’s name. The silver has been given (nadānu) to A. Should any document related to this deal turn up in D’s house, it belongs to B. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-kāṣir/Bēl-rēmanni//Bābūtu.
 
A = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Balāṭu//Ša-nāšīšu; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; fC = fGula-rēmanni; D = Marduk-iqīšanni/Bānia//Ilī-tillatī
Bibliography: Moldenke, CTMMA (1893), no. 12; Krecher 1970, 148; Petschow, RIDA 3e Série 1 (1954), 167ff.; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 175.
Title: MMA 79.7.11

Paraphrase:
Sale of slaves.
A1 and his mother fA2, of their own free will, sell their slaves (lamutānu) fC1 and C2 to B for a hariṣ price amounting to 55 shekels of silver. The sellers guarantee against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person raising claims (pāqirānu); D1 and D2 guarantee for a one year period (adi ṭuppi ana ṭuppi). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-šumu-līšir/Balāssu//Dannēa.
 
A1 = Kabtia/Nabû-nā'id//Mandidi; fA2 = fGuzummu, mother of A1; B = Kāṣir/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; fC1 = fUbārtu; C2 = Nabû-ēdu-uṣur; D1 = Šāpik-zēri/Kīna//Egibi; D2 = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Bēl-nāṣir
Title: BM 31015

Paraphrase:
Court protocol.
fA1, fA2 and fA3, D’s daughters, sold (ana kaspi nadānu) a field (eqlu) located in Babylon, in front of the Uraš Gate, to Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi (not explicitly mentioned in this text, but see the contract recorded in BM32674+). Now, fB1, wife of C (D’s brother) together with her son B2 bring suit concerning that field: they came in front of Nabonidus’ judges, who hear their arguments (dibbu šemû). According to fB1’s testimony, C had made an agreement (riksu) with the three women, since there was a claim (paqāru) against their field. The agreement established that C would return (târu D) the field and give it to fE, D’s wife, and to fA1, fA2 and fA3, D’s daughters. If C failed to return that field, [...] they would have received a half shekel per each shekel [...] And if 6 minas of silver, the principal amount (qaqqadu), [...] 1 mina and the expenses (gimru) [...] (This fragmentary passage must have contained a monetary penalty to be paid in case of failure to return the field). That agreement was brought in and the judges read (šasû Gtn) it and they deliberated (šâlu Gt): [...] The final lines of the tablet are severely damaged, thus the judges’ decisions cannot be reconstructed. Only the final clause which states that there will be no more claims or suits is extant. Names of 6 judges and 2 scribes.
 
fA1 = fNadāya/Šamaš-udammiq//Maštuk; fA2 = fEsagil-rāmat/Šamaš-udammiq//Maštuk; fA3 = fBēlilitu/Šamaš-udammiq//Maštuk; fB1 = fHibbuṣu, wife of C; B2 = Mušēzib-Marduk son of fB1; C = Iddin-Nabû, brother of D; D = Šamaš-udammiq; fE = fTašmētu-damqat, wife of D; fF1 = fNadā, daughter of D; fF2 = fIna-Esagil-ramât, daughter of D; fF3 = fBelilitu, daughter of D
Title: BM 31961

Paraphrase: Fragment of a record mentioning Gimil-Šamaš/Bēl-ēreš.
Title: BM 64342

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B1 owes fA 1/3 mina of white cut silver without stamp-mark (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. This is remainder of the loan document concerning 5/6 mina of white silver. B1 will pay the silver in Ayyār (II). This is apart from (elat) the remainder (rēhtu) according to the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 2/3 mina of silver due from B2, son of B1, and his mother fB3 for whose payment (eṭēru) C is guarantor (pūtu našû). 4 witnesses (including Šamaš-erība/Iddin-Nabû//Isinnāya and Šamaš-ahu-ittannu/Nidintu, deputy [šanû] of Šamšāya) and the scribe.
 
fA = fTabluṭ/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Šamaš-ēriba/Bēl-iqīša//Isinnāya; B2 = Bēl-iddin/Šamaš-ēriba//Isinnāya; fB3 = fAmtia, mother of B2; C = Nabû-nāṣir; Scribe = Šamaš-kāṣir/Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu
Title: BM 74552

Paraphrase: Fragment of a legal record in which Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê and either his wife [Inbāya]/Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili or one of her two brothers [Ea-iddin or Nidintu]/Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili are mentioned in connection with silver.
Title: BM 71117

Paraphrase:
Receipt of dates: In Ulūl (VI) of the present year the scribe A receives from B1 38 kor (6,840 l) of dates which B1 and B2 owe to him and the priest (šangû) of Sippar. It is the income from impost (imittu) of Darius 26th year for the treasury (namkūru) of Šamaš in Borsippa, in front of the gate (abullu), on the main road (harrānu rabîtu). 10 kor (1,800 l) out of the total sum were paid to C according to (akî) the letter order (šipirtu) of the two creditors. A returned (târu) the document (šaṭāru) according to which D guarantees (pūtu našû) for B1. A did not receive dates from D on account of B1. B1 has to return to A the letter order of the two creditors. Each party has taken a copy. 6 witnesses (including Iddin-Bēl/Ahhē-erība, aramaic scribe of the treasurer [sēpiru ša mašenni]) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê, ṭupšarru (scribe); B1 = Ṭābia/Nabû-ahhē-šullim//Nūr-Papsukkal; B2 = Nabû-lū-šulum/Šūqāya; C = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Nabû-ēreš; D = Iddin-Bēt/[–]; Scribe = Zumbu/Ibāya//Šamaš-abāri
Title: RSM 1889.107

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 ½ minas of cut silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debtor will pay the silver, without interest (qaqqadu), in Ayyār (II). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ahu-iddin/Basia; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ//Aqar-Nabû
Title: BM 74532

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 1,000 kor (180,000 l) of dates. He will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII) in Sippar in the measure (mašīhu) of the king. C guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the dates. 10 witnesses (including the courtier [ša rēš šarri] Nabû-ittia), and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Nabû-šumu-iškun; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Šamaš-kāṣir
Title: BM 74604

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 15 kor (2,700 l) of dates. The debtor will deliver the dates in Arahsamna (VIII), in the enclosure (haṣāru), in one delivery (ina muhhi išten ritti). C guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the dates. This is apart from (elat) the promissory note (u’iltu) of 115 kor of dates of A due from (ina muhhi) B, D1, D2 and C. 6 witnesses and the scribe (who is D2).
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Arad-Bunene/Na’id-Marduk//Ile’i-Marduk; C = Iddin-Bēl/Šamaš-uballiṭ//Ile’i-Marduk; D1 = Ardia; D2 = Šūzubu/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk; Scribe = D2
Title: BM 74592

Paraphrase:
Oath concerning the redemption of debts: B swears (tamû) to C by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that on the 10th of Dûzu (IV) of Darius 10th year he will give him in Sippar the dates according to (akî) the promissory note (u’iltu) of A, property (makkūru) of Šamaš. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bulṭāya/Marduk-erība//Isinnāya; B = Nabû-lū-salim/Rēhētu; C = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; Scribe = Hašdāya/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ//Adad-šamê
Title: BM 74588

Paraphrase:
Clearance of debts: According to the wording of the tablet, an account is drawn up (nikkassu epēšu) concerning 5 5/6 minas of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel, without interest (qaqqadu), belonging to A: B, on behalf of (ana muhhi) the debtor C, uncle of A, paid (eṭēru) 7 1/3 minas and 2 shekels of silver, including interest (hubullu), to the creditor (rāšû) A. Thereafter A bought the slave woman (qallatu) fD belonging to B. B brought the promissory note (u’iltu) from A and handed it over (našû-nadānu) to the debtor C. Therewith C has been paid 8 minas of silver, price (šīmu) for his female slave (amīltu), by B. In fact, B pays to C 8 minas for fD and sells her for 7 1/3 minas to A. This legal fiction seems to have been established on the background of a dowry payment (BM74548). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; C = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša// Ṣāhit-ginê; fD = fNanāya-šumahūa; Scribe = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 74605

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B1 and his wife fB2 owe A 5 kor (900 l) of dates, the remainder (rēhtu) of the harvest of the 3rd year of Darius. They will pay in Tašrīt (VII) on the (ina muhhi) quay of Sippar (Kār-Sippar). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû); the one who is available (qerbu) must pay (eṭēru). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Nabû-ēṭir/Nabû-gāmil// Nabûnnāya; fB2 = fBurāšu, wife of B1; Scribe = Līššir/Išparu
Title: BM 56731

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver for the purchase of wine: A1 and A2, slave (qallu) of C, by order of (ina našparti) the priest (šangû) of Opis C, receive 52 shekels of silver from B in order to purchase 4 vats (šappu) of wine. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nergal-ahhē-iddin/Nergal-ēṭir; A2= Nabû-šālim, qallu (slave) of C; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Sîn-ibni, šangû (priest) of Opis; Scribe = […]-bi-Šamaš/[…]//[…]-tu
Title: BM 74526

Paraphrase: Fragment of a legal document mentioning a member of the Ṣāhit-ginê family and Bēl-iddin on the obverse. 3+ witnesses and the scribe Nidintu/Lūṣi-ana-nūri, brother-in-law of Marduk-rēmanni.
Title: BM 64344

Paraphrase:
Receipt of dates: A, on behalf of (ina našparti) C1 and his mother fC2, receives from B 11 kor (1,980 l) of dates according to the promissory note (u’iltu) of A against C1 whose payment (eṭēru) is guaranteed (pūtu našû) by fC2. There are no more claims (rašûtu). 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-muballissu/Mušēzib-Marduk//Imbu-īnāya; B = Bēl-ittannu/Uballissu-Gula//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; C1 = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; fC2 = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri; Scribe = Arad-Marduk/Bēl-upahhir//Bā’iru
Title: MLC 1744

Paraphrase: Fragment of a legal record mentioning Marduk-rēmanni, oil-presser (ṣāhitu) of Šamaš, in connection with a duty (ka?-ṣir?-ú-tu, “tailoring”) on the 5th of Šabāṭ (XI).
Title: BM 71073

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1/3 mina of cut silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debtor will pay the silver on the 5th of Tašrīt (VII). C guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the silver. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Ṭābia/Nabû-ahhē-šullim//Nūr-Papsukkal; C = Bulṭāya/Bēl-rēmanni//Nappāhu; Scribe = Zumbu/Ibāya//Šamaš-abāri
Title: BM 74551

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A1, A2 and A3 1 ½ minas of white cut silver (kaspu ṣepû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debtor will pay the silver, without interest (qaqqadu), in Nisān (I) in Babylon. Seal impression (kunukku) of the debtor. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Lâbâši/Basia; A2 = Iddin-Bēl/Itti-Bēl-lummir; A3 = Nabû-utirri, qallu (slave) of Marduk-šumu-iddin; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Nabû-mukīn-apli
Title: BM 79644

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2/3 mina and 1 shekel of cut silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. They will pay the silver back in Addar (XII). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû); the one who is available (qerbu) must pay (eṭēru). 8 witnesses (including Marduk-bēl-napšāti/[Itti]-Bēl-lummir//Šangû-Šamaš and Tabnēa/Iqīša-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Nabû-kāṣir/Šāpik-zēri//Šangû-Šamaš; B2 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-kāṣir//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Nabû-bēlšunu/Itti-Nabû-gūzu
Title: BM 63806

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina of cut silver with stamp-mark (kaspu nuhhutu ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debtor will pay the credited silver, including interest (hubullu) of Šabāṭ (XI) Darius 12th year, in Dûzu (IV). 8 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Marduk-mukīn-apli/Bēl-uballiṭ//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; Scribe = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 79710

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A [x] minas of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt will bear a monthly interest of one shekels of silver per mina (20% p.a.). 3 witnesses (including Bēl-na’id and Ša-Bēl-atta, brothers of B) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-nādin-šumi/Kidin-Marduk//Rē’i-sisê; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê
Title: BM 74581

Paraphrase:
Receipt of payment for corvée work: A receives from B the payment for the corvée workers (urāšu) at the bridge (gišru). The payment is for the period from (ultu) Nisān (I) of Darius 3rd year until (adi) Šabāṭ (XI) of Darius 5th year. Each party has taken a copy (šaṭāru). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Kalbāya/Ṣillāya//Nabāya; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Mušēzib-Marduk/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Šigûa
Title: BM 74601

Paraphrase:
Dissolution of a joint venture because of death: After the death of A1, father of A2, A2 and B1 together draw up and divide the accounts (nikkassu epēšu zâzu) from the business partnership (harrānu) concerning the capital 5 minas of silver and 190 empty vats invested by A1 and 5 minas of silver and 90 empty vats invested by B1. The business partnership is over – no binding remains. A2 receives in full (mahāru eṭēru) from B1 the 5 minas, with profit (utru), and 190 vats. B1 has taken over the obligation (ana muhhi e’ēlu) of the debt according to the promissory notes (u’iltu) due from (ina muhhi) C1 and C2 respectively. The house received from D and the promissory note concerning 30 kor (5,400 l) of barley, the remainder (rēhtu) of the promissory note concerning 3 minas of silver due from C3, belong to the business partnership between A2 and B2. 3 witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy.
 
A1 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša/Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Bēl-iddin/Būru-šēzib; B2 = Nabû-iddin; C1 = Kalbi-Bābu; C2 = Erība/Dummuqu; C3 = Nabû-tukulti-ēdu/Nabû-ušēzib; D = Būru-zēru-iddin; Scribe = Bēl-zēru-ibni/Nabû-nāṣir//Ṣāhit-ginê
Title: BM 74673

Paraphrase:
Lease of vats: 22 empty old vats, including a leaky (gurruru) one without bitumen (kupru), belonging to A are at the disposal of B. 2 witnesses and the scribe. Additional clause: The rent (idū) of the vats is paid (eṭēru Stat.).
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Nabû-ittannu/[…]//[…]; Scribe = Adad-šumu-uṣur/Tabnēa/Šangû-Adad
Title: BM 61736

Paraphrase: In a letter to Hašdāya the lower-ranking Bēl-bullissu refers to silver in connection with a certain Iššār-dān in a broken passage and to the workers who came back from Susa. In the end he asks for news from the addressee.
Title: BM 79582

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house in Babylon: A rents out to B a house, adjoining the house of C, for 14 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû) rent (idū) per year, beginning with next month Dûzu (IV). The lessee shall pay one half share of the rent (ahi kaspi) at the beginning of the year and the remainder (rēhtu) in the middle of the year. He will repair (batqu ṣabātu) the walls (asurrû) and renew the roof (ūru šanû). On the day of Enlil and the kīnayātu-offerings he will make an additional payment (nūptu). 5 witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy. An additional witness is mentioned at the very end.
 
A = Adad-ahu-iddin/Būru-zēru-iddin; B = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-gîne; C = Libluṭ; Scribe = Šamaš-ēṭir/Bēl-uballiṭ
Title: BM 74525

Paraphrase: Fragmentary loan of silver: Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê owes [PN] [x] amounts of silver. The debt will bear an interest of one shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). This is apart from (elat) the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 1 mina of silver. 1+ witnesses – remainder of the witness list and the date formula lost.
Title: BM 64194

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B1 and fB2 owe A 1 mina and 24 shekels of white silver without stamp-mark (kaspu peṣû ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The female slave (amtu) fC, whose hand (qātu, mistake: sag-ti) is inscribed (šaṭāru) with the names of the debtors, is placed as a pledge. 6(+) witnesses and the scribe. The indebted silver is for paying (eṭēru) D, creditor (rāšû) of B1.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit- ginê; B1 = Rēmūt-Bēl/Zababa-napšātu-uṣur/Agru; fB2 = fAya-enqet, daughter (“son” according to text) of B1; fC = fNanāya-lummir, slave of B1; D = Bēl-ṣarbi-nāṣir; Scribe = Bulluṭu/[…]
Title: BM 74643

Paraphrase:
This broken legal record is concerned with 3 minas of white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel charged in 2 promissory notes (u’iltu) of A1 and A2 against B. Broken passage. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Lâbâši/Basia; A2 = Nabû-utirri, qallu (slave) of Marduk-šumu-iddin; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Erība/Tattannu
Title: BM 64274

Paraphrase:
Sales of a slave girl: B has voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) given his three-year old female slave (amtu) fC to A for 1/2 mina of silver. If ever there will arise claims (paqāru) on account of (ana muhhi) fC, the seller clear the claims (murruqu) and give her back to her new owner. 8 witnesses and the scribe. Additional note about a statement of B to A that fD has died.

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Rēmūt-Bēl/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; fC = fAna-muhhi-Bēlet-taklāku; fD = fAya-bēlet-la’inni/Nanāya-[x]; Scribe = Tabnēa/Iqīša-Marduk
Title: BM 79706

Paraphrase:
Lease of a prebend: A rents out to B the prebend of the temple enterer (isiq ērib bītūti) before Šamaš of Sippar for 2 minas of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) per year. From (ultu) the 1st of Nisān (I), the lessee enjoys the yield (ebūru) of the prebend, that is, the share (zittu) from the offering table (paššūru) comprising [x] kor (liter) of bread, [x] kor (liter) of beer daily and a shoulder cut (imittu, 15 uzu for uzu.15), [broken], honey, wine and 0;0.0.1 kor (1 l) and 1/8 liter (summunu) of pressed (oil) (halṣu) monthly. Each party has taken a copy. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the priest (šangû) of Sippar (Ina-Esagil-lilbur) and the judge (dayyānu) (Nabû-iddin) as well as 3(+) other witnesses. Seal impression (kunukku) of the priest of Sippar (Ina-Esagil-lilbur).
 
A = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Balāṭu; B = Marduk-rēmanni (here once mistakenly referred to as Nabû-rēmanni)/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Iddin-Bēl/Ardia//Atû
Title: BM 74628

Paraphrase:
Oath concerning the redemption of debts: B swears (tamû) to A1 by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that before (kâdi = kī + adi) the 1st of Šabāṭ (XI) he will come in order to (akî) pay (eṭēru) A1 according to the loan documents concerning donkeys and flock (ṣēnu) of A2 due from (ina muhhi) him. 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Sîn-ahu-iddin/Ša-Nabû-šū; Scribe = Šamaš-iddin/Gimil-Šamaš//Bābūtu
Title: BM 61002

Paraphrase:
Summoning of a debtor: Until (adi) the end of Ayyār (II) C will bring along (abāku) B to A1 in Sippar in order to draw up the accounts (nikkassu epēšu) of the herd (lahru), the shorn wool (gizzatu), the offspring (tamlittu) and the donkeys. If C does not bring B, he has to pay according to the promissory note (u’iltu) of A2 charged against (ina muhhi) B. All this is apart from (elat) the previous deadline (adannu). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Sîn-ahu-iddin/Ša-Nabû-šū; C = Tattannu/Nabû-milkī; Scribe = Munahhiš-Marduk//Mudammiq-Nabû
Title: BM 61185

Paraphrase:
Oath concerning the delivery of sheep: B swears (tamû) to A by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that he will bring 2(?) sheep before the 25th of month [x]. In return A swears to B that he will stop his argument (dibbu) against him if he keeps the promise. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = [Bēl-x]/Ṭāb-gurru; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Munahhiš-Marduk//Mudammiq-Nabû
Title: BM 64214

Paraphrase:
Oath concerning the payment of silver: B swears (tamû) to C by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that he will pay (eṭēru) the silver according to the promissory note (u’iltu) of A before the 1st of Tašrīt (VII). If he fails to pay, D, whom the creditor has taken as a pledge, will become property of the creditor as full compensation of the claimed silver. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar; B = Nabû-iddin/Iddin-Nabû//Sîn-karābī; C = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-[x]//Sîn-imittu
Title: BM 74681

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house: A rents out to B a house for [x] amounts of white silver (kaspu peṣû) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The location of the said house is lost. The tenant shall pay one half share of the rent (ahi kaspi) at the beginning of the year and the remainder (rēhtu) in the middle of the year. He will renew the roof (ūru šanû) and repair (batqu ṣabātu) the walls (asurrû). Each party has taken a copy. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-bullissu/Marudk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Niqūdu/Rēmutu; Scribe = Bēl-bullissu/Nabû-ittannu
Title: BM 67297

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 0;4 kor (144 l) of dates. He will bring the indebted dates in Šabāṭ (XI). C guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the dates. 3 witnesses and the scribe. The month of delivery is also the month of the prebend of the arranger-of-the-sacrificial-table (mubannûtu) of B.
 
A = Šamaš-kāṣir/Nabû-bēlšunu; B = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Bēl-abu-uṣur/Nidintu; Scribe = Bēl-bullissu/[GN]-aplu-iddin//Isinnāya
Title: BM 74569

Paraphrase: Oath concerning the delivery(?) of dates(?): [PN] swears (tamû) to Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that he will deliver(?) [x] amount of dates(?) before [x] day of Tašrīt (VII). 4 witnesses and the scribe (name lost).
Title: BM 64209

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver: C, deputy (šanû) of A, receives from the scribe (ṭupšarru) of Ebabbar B 3 minas (and [x] shekels) of white silver with stamp-mark (kaspu peṣû ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel for “fitting-out” (rikis qabli) the workers of the king (ṣāb šarri) who are travelling to Susa in the present year under the supervision (ša qātē) of A, the royal resident (qīpu) of Ebabbar. This is in addition (elat) to 307 minas of wool, 0;1 kor (36 l) of salt, 0;1 kor (36 l) of cress (sahlû), 0;1 kor (36 l) of oil and 10 sandals (mešēnu) received from B by C. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šamšāya, qīpu (royal resident) of Ebabbar; B = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-šumu-līšir/Šangû-Ištar, ṭupšarru (scribe) of Ebabbar; C = Šamaš-ahu-ittannu/Nidintu, šanû (deputy) of A; Scribe = […]//Šangû-[…]
Title: BM 74977

Paraphrase:
Broken receipt of silver: A, by order of (ina našparti) fC, receives from B [x] amounts of white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. This is part of the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning the remainder (rēhtu) of the price (šīmu) of a commodity (lost) due from (ina muhhi) B because? (broken) of fC. Another broken passage mentioning D. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Adad-ahu-iddin/Būru-zēru-iddin;  B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; fC = f[…]-a/Gabrī-[…]; D = Nabû-ittannu/[…]; Scribe = Nabû-ittannu/[…]
Title: BM 72749

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house: A rents out to B a house for 7 shekels of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginne) rent (idū) per year, beginning with the 1st of Ulūl (VI). Most of the information about the exact location of the rented house is lost, but it is said to adjoin a bīt kuruppi-warehouse and the house of C. The lessee shall pay one half share of the rent (ahi kaspi) at the beginning of the year and the remainder (rēhtu) in the middle of the year. The lessor already received the full rent for the first year and the lessee will make an additional gift (nūptu) in Dûzu (IV) and Kislīm (IX). Each party has taken a copy. 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-sattukki; B = Bēl-zēri/Šaddinnu //Itinnu; C = […]/Nergal-šēzib; Scribe = Rēmūt-Bēl/Bēl-uballiṭ
Title: BM 79511

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave woman: B voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) sells his slave woman (qallatu) fC to A for 2 ½ minas cut silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. If ever there will arise claims (paqāru) of the seller concerning fC, he will clear the claims (murruqu) and give her back to her new owner. 9 witnesses (including Iddin-Nabû/Bēl-zēru-iddin//Ṣāhit-ginê) and the scribe.

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Iddin-Marduk/Ile’i-bulluṭ-Marduk//Nappāhu; fC = fŠulum-Bābili; Scribe = Mušēzib-Marduk/Taqīš-Gula/Egibi
Title: BM 74589

Paraphrase:
Loan of barley: B owes A 35 kor (6,300 l) of barley. The debtor will give the barley in Sippar in Ayyār (II). This is apart from (elat) the previous promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 3 minas of silver. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Šumu-iddin; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê
Title: BM 74474
BM 74629

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes the royal merchant (tamkār šarri) A 5 minas of cut silver (nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. Beginning with the first day of Tašrīt (VII), the debt bears a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). C guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the silver. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-mukīn-apli/Šeru-hanan, tamkār šarri (royal merchant); B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; Scribe = Bēl-iqīša/Taqīš-Gula//Dābibī
Title: BM 79672

Paraphrase:
Oath concerning the delivery of barley: B swears (tamû) to C by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that he will give him 20 kor (3,600 l) of barley on the 2nd of Tašrīt (VII) in Sippar. The barley is part of the claim (rašûtu) of the brothers A1 and A2. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Itti-Bēl-lummir/Bēl-ēreš; A2 = Gimil-Šamaš/Bēl-ēreš; B = Nādinu/Hašdaya; C = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Erība-Marduk//Rē’i-sisê
Title: BM 92729

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates and barley: B1 owes A 600 kor (108,000 l) of dates and 400 kor (72,000 l) of barley, capital sum (qaqqadu) and interest (hubullu). B1 will give 100 kor (18,000 l) of dates in Arahsamna (VIII) and 50 kor (9,000 l) of barley in Ayyār (II). C, slave (qallu) of B1, guarantees (pūtu našû) for the full payment. The dates and barley are part of the credit (rašûtu) due from B2, grandfather of B1. 11 witnesses and the scribe. A has not received anything on behalf of (ana muhhi) D1 and D2. Seal impression (kunukku) of B1.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Erība-Marduk/Nidinti-Marduk;  B2 = Bēlšunu/Nabû-nāṣir, grandfather of B1; C = Šamšāya/Niqūdu, slave of B1, D1 = Gimil-Šamaš/Bēl-ēreš; D2 = Itti-Bēl-lummir/Bēl-ēreš; Scribe = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Erība-Marduk
Title: BM 61134

Paraphrase:
Fragment of a lease of a prebend: fA1 gives prebends for the performance of the duties (ēpišānūtu) to B1 and B2. The details about the leased prebends are lost, but compare with BM72761, BM74504 and BM63824. The lessees guarantee (pūtu našû) for not interrupting (lā baṭlu) the service and punctuality (of the performance of the cult). They will give monthly to fA1 (as far as preserved) 4;2.3 kor (810 l) of dates and two shares (ahu) of vegetables (mašqu) from the prebend of the arranger-of-the-sacrificial-table (mubannûtu). The income from the other prebends (including the prebend of the oil-presser) given to fA1 is not preserved. 3+ witnesses (including Bēl-bullissu/Marudk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê) and the scribe (name lost).
 
fA1 = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B1 = Iddināya/Nidintu//Rabâ-ša-Ninurta; B2= Šamaš-kāṣir/Šellibi; Scribe = Nidintu/Bēl-ibni//Gahal
Title: BM 67274

Paraphrase:
Summon to hand over the promissory note: Until (adi) the 2nd of Tašrīt (VII), A will bring to B2 and hand over (našû-nadānu) the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 4 1/3 minas of silver, claim (rašûtu) of A due from (ina muhhi) B1, father of B2. B1, father of B2. There are no claims left – even if the promissory note turns up somewhere. 9 witnesses and the scribe. Seal impression (kunukku) of the priest (šangû) of Sippar (Nādin-ahi).
 
A = Nergal-ahhē-iddin/Marduk-bēl-napšāti//Šangû-Šamaš; B1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B2 = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Bēl-rē’išunu/Rēmūt-bēl-ili//Bēl-eṭēru
Title: Peek 12

Paraphrase: Fragment of a sale of a slave by two sellers (probably […]-bānûnu and name lost) to Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê. […]-bānûnu guarantees (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqirānu). 5+ witnesses.
Title: BM 64207

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver amounts: A receives from B [x] amounts of silver by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. This amount is divided into 22 shekels of silver for [x], 20 shekels of silver for the bow-service (qaštu) of kanšû-duty, [x] shekels of silver for support troops of the service (lúši-i-di ša našparti) and [x] shekels of silver that are given to C as urāšu on account of (ana muhhi) B. Each party has taken a copy. 3 witnesses and the scribe. Broken additional clause in the end.
 
A = Nergal-ibni/Tabnēa//Nabûtu; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Kalbāya; Scribe = [x]-Marduk/[GN]-kāṣir
Title: BM 74638

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2 5/6 minas of white cut silver without stamp-mark (kaspu ṣepû nuhhutu ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). The bīt kuruppi- warehouse on the quay of Sippar (Kār-Sippar), bordering the houses of C1 and C2, is placed as a pledge. 8 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ahu-ittannu/Bēl-iddin//Bābūtu; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C1 = Tēšî-ēṭir/Zēria; C2 = Iddin-Nabû/Kīnā; Scribe = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Nabû-mukīn-apli
Title: BM 74534

Paraphrase:
Receipt of barley: A receives from the priest (šangû) C, on behalf B, 50 kor (900 l) of barley. This is the payment (eṭēru) according to (akî) the promissory note (u’iltu) of A due from (ina muhhi) B. On the 10th of Abu (V) A will give the promissory note to B. 8 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Zikranu-ahu-iddin/Silim-Bēl; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Guzānu, šangû Sippar (priest of Sippar); Scribe = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 63805

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver for a horse: B owes A 1 ½ minas and 5 shekels of white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) for a white horse. The debtor will pay the silver in Abu (V). 7 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Nabû-bānûnu/Nergal-ušallim/Rē’i-sisê; Scribe = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Bābu-ēreš//Šumu-libši
Title: BM 61035

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 5 minas of cut silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The arable land (zēru) of the debtor, bordering C, is placed as pledge. This includes (adi) the previous promissory note (u’iltu) of A concerning 1 mina of silver. 5 witnesses (including Bēl-nāṣir, brother of B) and the scribe. Seal impressions of the debtor twice.
 
A = Ina-Esagil-lilbur/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ša-nāšišu; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-sattukki; C = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Nabû-šumu-uṣur; Scribe = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê
Title: BM 74683

Paraphrase:
Oath concerning the payment of silver: B swears (tamû) to A1 by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that on the 1st of Ṭebēt he will come (alāku) and draw up the accounts (nikkassu epēšu) of the flock (ṣēnu), the wool and the donkeys according to (akî) the promissory note (u’iltu) of A2 and the accounts of the ½ mina of silver due from him – in this case there is no promissory note. He will pay (eṭēru) the silver to A1. 6 witnesses (including Šamaš-ahu-iddin/Nabû-nāṣir//Ṣāhit-ginê) and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl- uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Sîn-ahu-iddin/Ša-Nabû-šū; Scribe = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqiša//Ṣāhit-gine
Title: BM 78146

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 28 ½ shekels of refined silver (kaspu qalû) and 17 shekels of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni). B will pay it back in Tašrīt (VII). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Nidinti-Bēl/Bēl-rēmanni; Scribe = Nidintu/[…]//Sîn-nāṣir
Title: BM 79641

Paraphrase:
Partly redemption of debts of barley: A receives from B 50 kor (9,000 l) of barley due from B on the basis of promissory notes (u’iltu) concerning barley and dates. This payment is apart from (elat) the 10 kor (1,800 l) of barley and 10 kor (1,800 l) of dates received by A from B. 3 witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-šunu/Nabû-nāṣir; Scribe = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Erība-Marduk//Rē’i-sisê
Title: BM 74331

Paraphrase:
Receipt of rent: A receives from B the rent (idū) of the house from (ultu) Nisān (I) of Darius 15th year until (adi) the end of Ulūl (VI) of Darius 15th year. 3 witnesses (including Bēl-nāṣir, brother of A) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Kidinnu/Mušēzib-Marduk; Scribe = Uballissu-Gula/Ahhē-iddin-Marduk//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili
Title: BM 74545

Paraphrase:
Lease of a prebend: fA1 gives prebends for the performance of the duties (ēpišānūtu) to B1 and B2 for 5 years (according to an additional clause at the end of the contract). This concerns the prebend of the arranger-of-the-sacrificial-table (isiq mubannûtu) in Ebabbar in Sippar of the months Ayyār (II), Dûzu (IV), Šabāṭ (XI) and the 21st to 30th of Arahsamna (VIII), the prebend of the oil-presser (ṣāhitūtu) of the first 15 days of Tašrīt (VII) as well as 13 sweet cakes (muttāqu) of the whole year. The lessees guarantee (pūtu našû) for not interrupting (lā baṭlu) the service and punctuality (masnaqtu) of the performance of the cult. They will give to the lessor 4;2.3 kor (810 l) of dates, 1 takkašu loaf (ṣibtu ša takkaši), 2/3 of a vat (bītu) of billatu-beer and two shares (ahu) of vegetables (mašqu) from the mubannûtu-prebend and 0;0.1.1 kor (7 l) of sesame, 30 containers (kindu) of pressed sesame (kupsu) and 0;0.0.0.5 kor (½ l) of sesame oil from the prebend of the oil-presser. For the prebend of sweet cakes (muttāqūtu) the lessor receives 0;0.2.1 kor (13 l) of emmer (kunāšu), 0;0.2.1 kor (13 l) of sesame and 0;0.0.1.5 kor (1 ½ l) and 1/16 liter (ahu summunu, “half share of 1/8 liter”) of honey. 7 witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy. Additional penalty clause: The one who violates (nabalkutu) the agreement will pay 5 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû).
 
fA1 = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B1 = Ahušunu/Uballissu-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B2= Iddināya/Nidintu//Rabâ-ša-Ninurta; Scribe = Nidintu/Bēl-ibni//Gahal
Title: BM 63824

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 1;1.4 kor (240 l) of dates. He will give the indebted dates in Ayyār (II). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Bēl-iddin//Balāṭu; B = Ahušunu/Uballissu-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Šumu-iddin/Šamaš-iddin//Dannēa
Title: BM 74571

Paraphrase: Fragment of a legal document mentioning Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê, scribe of Ebabbar (ṭupšar Ebabbar), in connection with 22 kor (3,960 l) of salt meant for the regular offerings (sattukku) of Šamaš. The record is apart from (elat) 2 oxen and 6 kor (1,080 l) of barley. The remainder of the tablet, including the witness list and the date formula, are not preserved.
Title: BM 64327

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina and 8 shekels of cut silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. He will pay it back in the month […]. 1+ witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-aplu-uṣur/Balassu//Šumu-ibni; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Marduk-šāpik-zēri/Taqīš-Gula/Arad-Ea
Title: BM 64251

Paraphrase:
Loan of barley: B owes A 7;1.4 kor (1,320 l) of barley. The debtor will give the barley in Simān (III) in Sippar. 4 witnesses (including the father of B) and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-nāṣir/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Arad-Gula/Arad-Bunene//Ilē’i-Marduk; Scribe = Mannu-iqabbu/Nanni//Šigûa
Title: BM 79260

Paraphrase:
Loan of barley: B, slave of C, owes A 3 kor (540 l) of barley. The debtor will give the barley in Ayyār (II). This is apart from (elat) to the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 600 kor (108,000 l) of dates and 400 kor (72,000 l) of barley of A due from C for whose payment (eṭēru) B guarantees (pūtu našû). 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Šamšāya, slave of C; C = Erība-Marduk; Scribe = Tabnēa/Iqīša-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 74583

Paraphrase:
Oath concerning the handing-over of a loan document: C swears (tamû) to B by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that on the 10th of Tašrīt (VII) he will give the tablet of A to him. The tablet is concerned with 7 minas of white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel and one lapis lazuli (uqnû) which A deposited (paqādu) together with C. 8 witnesses (including Bēl-iddin/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Balāṭu and Libluṭ/Arad-Marduk//Bēliya’u, enterers of the Marduk Temple [ērib bīt Marduk]) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bulluṭ/Nabû-iddin//Amēl-Ea, C = Nabû-bullissu/Lâbâši//Šangû-Gula; Scribe = Iddin-Bēl/Ardia//Atû
Title: BM 74586

Paraphrase:
Loan of barley: B owes A 3 kor (540 l) of barley. The debtor will give the barley in the house of the creditor in Simān (III). 3 witnesses (including Bēl-itannu, brother of B) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Šamaš-iddin/Ipria//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Zēria//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 79676

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B1 and B2 owe A 1 mina of cut silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt bears a monthly interest of one shekel silver per mina (20% p.a.). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû); the one who is available (qerbu) must pay (eṭēru). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Adad-ahu-iddin/Adad-nādin-zēri; B1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B2 = […]/[…]//Basia; Scribe = B1
Title: BM 63850

Paraphrase:
Partly broken loan of silver: B owes A [x] minas of cut silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel and 33 shekels of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) by 1/8 alloy per shekel. The debt bears a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Nabû-ittannu/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/[…]//Uṣur-amat-Ea
Title: BM 68618

Paraphrase:
Lease of arable land for joint cultivation: A rents out for cultivation (ana errēšūti nadānu) 30 square kor (405,000 m2) of arable land (zēru) to B. 15 kor of the land are located in the hūpu-land and administered by D1. The other 15 kor of land are located in the hammašatu-land and administered by D2. Both form part of the crown land (nakkandu ša šarri) under the responsbility of C, deputy (šanû) of the treasurer (mašennu), and were rented by A for cultivation (ana errēšūti ṣabātu). Lessor and lessee will plough (erēšu) the land together and share the costs for transport (gimru) and for the removing (nasāhu), to be paid to the administrators D1 and D2, as well as the costs for the farmer (ikkaru). Broken passage. 3 witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Niqūdu, slave (qallu) of Bēlšunu; C = Bēl-šumu-iškun; D1= Nādinu; D2 = Kalbāya; Scribe = Šamaš-zēru-ušebši/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Dābibī
Title: BM 74487

Paraphrase:
Loan of barley: B owes A 12 kor (2,160 l) of barley. The debtor will give the barley in Ayyār (II). [x] witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bulluṭ/Iddin-Bēl? (or Nabû?); Scribe = Gimil-Šamaš/Rēmūt-Bēl//Šumu-libši
Title: BM 64283

Paraphrase:
Lease of a prebend: fA1 gives prebends for the performance of the duties (ēpišānūtu) to B1 and B2. This concerns the prebend of the arranger-of-the-sacrificial-table (isiq mubannûti) in Ebabbar in Sippar for 3 months and 10 days, that is, the months Ayyār (II), Dûzu (IV), Šabāṭ (XI) and the 21st to 30th of Arahsamna (VIII), the prebend of the oil-presser (ṣāhitūtu) of the first 15 days of Tašrīt (VII) as well as 13 sweet cakes (muttāqu) of the whole year of the “greeting-of-the-temple” ceremonies (šalām bīti). They will give to fA1 4;2.3 kor (810 l) of dates, 1 takkašu loaf (ṣibtu ša takkaši), 2/3 of a vat (bītu) of billatu-beer and two shares (ahu) of vegetables (mašqu) from the mubannûtu-prebend and 0;0.1.1 kor (7 l) of sesame, 30 containers (kindu) of pressed sesame (kupsu) and 0;0.0.0.5 kor (½ l) of sesame oil from the prebend of the oil-presser. For the prebend of sweet cakes (muttāqūtu) fA1 receives 0;0.2.1 kor (13 l) of emmer (kunāšu), 0;0.2.1 kor (13 l) of sesame and 0;0.0.1.5 kor (1 ½ l) of honey (dišpu, di-ip-šú). The lessees guarantee (pūtu našû) for not interrupting (lā baṭlu) the service and punctuality (masnaqtu) of the performance of the cult. Each party has taken a copy. 4 witnesses (including Kuṣurāya/Nidintu//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili) and the scribe.
 
fA1 = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B1 = Libluṭ/Guzānu//Balīhu; B2= Ahušunu/Uballissu-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Bēl-bullissu/Nabû-ittannu//Šangû-Ištar
Title: BM 74504

Paraphrase:
Lease of work: A rents out to B for the performance of duties (ēpišānūtu) of work (dullu) at the Aya Gate for three years. B will pay the rent (idī) of the house to A. 4 witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-iddin/Šellibi//Šigûa; Scribe = Ardia/Mušēzib-Marduk//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili
Title: BM 74630

Paraphrase:
Heavily broken legal record perhaps relating to a land lease for cultivation since ploughs (epinnu) and iron are said to be given to [PN] (and) to the Šamaš Temple. B1, B2 and B3 are mentioned but their rôle remains unclear. 5(+) witnesses and the scribe.
 
B1 = Nidintu/Ardia//Šangû-Šamaš; B2 = Itti-Bēl-lummir, B3 = Balāṭu, mašennu (treasurer); Scribe = Uballissu-Gula/Ahhē-iddin-Marduk//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili
Title: BM 66255

Paraphrase:
Loan of barley: B owes A 3 kor (540 l) of barley. The debtor will give the barley in Ayyār (II). Furthermore, A led away (abāku) his ox, he has rented out (ana zitti nadānu) to B. 3 witnesses (including Bēl-itannu, brother of B) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Niqūdu/Ipria//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Zēria
Title: BM 74535

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 4 shekels of white cut silver without stamp-mark (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. He will pay the silver on the [x] day of Addar (XII). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-nāṣir/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-ittannu/Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu = Nidintu/Bēl-ēṭir-napšāti; Scribe = Nidintu/Bēl-ēṭir-napšati
Title: BM 79184

Paraphrase:
Settlement of a dispute concerning a prebend: After B gave to A the prebend of the oil presser (isiq ṣāhitūti) before Bēl in Esagil for an amount of silver, he states that the prebend is his and that A is not the his nephew. The bishop (šatammu) of Esagil (GN-ahu-iddin) checked the copy (šaṭāru) in question and [gave back to A?]. Another broken sentence concerning the charging (manû) of the credit (rašûtu). Passage broken. 6 witnesses (all ērib bīti of Marduk) and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ, (deceased?) father of Marduk-remanni; B = Dādia/Kabtia//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = [Ša-GN]-šū//Šarru-arazû
Title: BM 64447

Paraphrase:
Receipt of sheep: A, in the name (ina šumi, usually: ana šumi) of C, receives from B 30 female lambs (parratu). The payment takes place in accordance with what is provided in the promissory note (u’iltu) of C. Until (adi) the 1st of Tašrīt (VII) the creditor will bring the debt note and hand it over (našû-nadānu) to the debtor. 8 witnesses (including Bēl-šarru-uballiṭ, courtier [ša rēš šarri]) and the scribe. This document is linked to BM114712.
 
A = […]; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Zēr-Bābili/Muṭēriṣu; Scribe = Nidintu-Marduk/[…]
Title: BM 64235

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 37 kor (6,660 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the field (eqlu) in Du(r)bissu. The debtor will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII), in the enclosure (haṣāru), in the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu. Passage broken. With each kor of dates he will give palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date palm fibres (mangagu) and [broken]. 2 witnesses and the scribe. The wages in dates (sissinnu) are not yet paid off (eṭēru Stat.).

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-kāṣir//Uballissu-Marduk; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Sîn-imittu
Title: BM 79637

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B1 and his wife fB2 owe A 2 minas of refined silver (kaspu qalû) and 3 minas of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni). They will pay in the month […]. Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû); the one who is available (qerbu) must pay. A certain object (broken) is placed as a pledge. 4 witnesses (including the coutier [ša rēš šarri] Terrik-šarrussu) and the scribe.
 
A = Balāṭu/Nabû-tukulti-ēdu; B1 = Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu//Nergal-uballiṭ; fB2 = fNūptāya, wife of B1; Scribe = Iddin-Nabû/Šulāya
Title: BM 61789

Paraphrase:
Establishment of a business partnership: A invests 8 minas of silver for a business partnership (harrānu) with B and C as active partners. C will run the business (našpartu alāku) instead of his brother A and together with B. Whatever B will generate from (ina muhhi) the 8 minas of silver, he and C each will enjoy (akālu) a half share (ahi zitti) in the profit (utru). B shall not make extra costs (etēqu etēqu) without the consent of A. B guarantees (pūtu našû) for the payment of the invested silver without interest (qaqqadu). 3(+) witnesses (including Šamaš-aplu-uṣur/Bēl-erība, father of B, and Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša //Ṣahit-ginê) and the scribe (name lost).
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Sîn-mukīn-apli/Šamaš-aplu-uṣur//Pahhāru; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê
Title: BM 67224

Paraphrase:
Partly broken dialogue document concerning an adoption of a son: fB approaches A, her son-in-law, and asks him to adopt (ana mārūti nadānu) his eldest son C, her grandson. A grants the request (šemû) and entrusts C. fB will voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) give the adoptee 0;0.1 kor (6 l) of bread and 0;0.1 kor (6 l) of first quality (rēštu) beer, income of the prebend of the temple-enterer (isiq ērib bītūti) in Egukug(a), the Ziqqurrat of Sippar, which [PN] had given to her in a sealed tablet as compensation for 10 minas of silver. Large gap. The adoptee will provide his adoptive mother with food (ipru), ointment (piššatu) and clothing (lubuštu). He will grow up at her place and enjoy the usufruct of her assets (nikkassu) as long as she lives and receive her assets when she dies (ana šīmti alāku). She will not adopt any other son. Broken passage and gap. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; fB = fZazītu/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Bā’iru; C = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 67208

Paraphrase:
Receipt of barley: A receives from B, on behalf of (ana muhhi) the debtor C, 26 kor (4,680 l) of barley. This is a partly repayment according to the promissory note (u’iltu) of A due from C. Each party has taken a copy (šaṭāru). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-sattukki; B = Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-Marduk/Šangû-Šamaš; C = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Bēl-ibni//Gahal
Title: BM 74560

Paraphrase:
Lease of a prebend: fA1 gives prebends for the performance of the duties (ēpišānūtu) to B1 and B2. This concerns the prebend of the arranger-of-the-sacrificial-table (isiq mubannûti) in Ebabbar in Sippar of the months Ayyār (II), Dûzu (IV), Šabāṭ (XI) and the 21st to 30th of Arahsamna (VIII), the prebend of the oil-presser (ṣāhitu) of the first half of Tašrīt (VII) as well as 13 sweet cakes (muttāqu) of the whole year. The lessees guarantee (pūtu našû) for not interrupting (lā baṭlu) the service and punctuality (masnaqtu) of the performance of the cult. They will give to the lessor (from what is preserved) 4;2.3 kor (810 l) of dates, 1 takkašu loaf (ṣibtu ša takkaši), 2/3 of a vat of good quality (babbanû) billatu-beer and two shares (ahu) of vegetables (mašqu) from the mubannûtu-prebend and 30 containers (kindu) of pressed sesame (kupsu) and 1/16 liter (ahu summunu, “half share of 1/8 liter”) honey. The income for the lessor of the prebend of sweet cakes (muttāqūtu) is entirely lost. 4 witnesses (including Kuṣurāya/Nidintu//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili and Bēl-bullissu/Nabû-ittannu//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili) and the scribe. Additional penalty clause: The one who violates (nabalkutu) the agreement will pay 5 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû).
 
fA1 = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B1 = Iddināya/Nidintu//Rabâ-ša-Ninurta; B2= Šamaš-kāṣir/Šellibi//[…]; Scribe = Nidintu/Bēl-ibni//Gahal
Title: BM 72761

Paraphrase:
Fragment of a lease of a prebend (comparable to BM78165): fA1, widow of A2, gives prebends for the performance of the duties to B. This concerns the prebend of the arranger-of-the-sacrificial-table in Ebabbar in Sippar of the months Ayyār (II), Dûzu (IV), Šabāṭ (XI) and the 21st to 30th of Arahsamna and the prebend of the oil-presser. From the income B will deliver to fA1 emmer (kunāšu), 1/8 liter (summunu) honey and sesame. 2+ witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA1 = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; A2 = Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Iddin-Nabû; Scribe = Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu/Šūzubu//Ile’i-Marduk
Title: BM 71128

Paraphrase:
According to this heavily broken loan document A will give [x] amount of [x] commodity to [PN]. 7 witnesses and the scribe (name lost).
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê, ṭupšar Ebabbar (scribe of Ebabbar)
Title: BM 64321

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2 1/3 minas of white silver (kaspu ṣepû) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debtor will pay the silver, without interest (qaqqadu), in Nisān (I). He has to pay this silver as a penalty for the flock (ṣēnu) which is illegally seized property (ṣibtūti) of A. It is instead of cutting off (batāqu) his hand (rittu). 7 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Nusku-īnāya/Nusku-ayalu; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Basia/[…]//Bēl-eṭēru
Title: BM 64208

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 7;2.3 kor (1,350 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of Du(r)bissu. The debtor will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII), in the enclosure (haṣāru), in the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu, in one delivery (ina muhhi išten ritti). With each kor of dates he will supply palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date palm fronds (libbu), date palm fibres (mangagu) and loads of palm-frond ribs (biltu ša huṣābi). The wages in dates (sissinnu) are not yet paid off (eṭēru Stat.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-sattukki; B = Bēl-uballiṭ/Ṣillāya//Mušēzib; Scribe = Nabû-ittannu/Nergal-ina-tēšî-ēṭir//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 74594

Paraphrase:
Receipt of rent: A receives from B the rent (idū) of the house until (adi) the end of Simān (III) of Darius 17th year. Each party has taken a copy. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Šamaš-iddin/Nabû-šumu-iškun; Scribe = Rēmūt-Bēl/Bēl-uballiṭ
Title: BM 74575

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes 34(+) kor (6,120 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of A. The debtor will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII), in the enclosure (haṣāru), in the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu and in one delivery (ina muhhi išten ritti). With each kor of dates he will give loads (of palm-frond ribs) (biltu [ša huṣābi]), palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date palm fibres (mangagu), date palm fronds (libbu), one (container of) pressed dates (darīku) and one basket of palm feathers (qappatu). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-kāṣir//Uballissu-Marduk; Scribe = Hahhūru/[PN]
Title: BM 79576

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2 ½ minas of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt will bear a monthly interest of one shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). This loan document is apart from (elat) previous promissory notes (u’iltu). 5 witnesses (including Bēl-nāṣir, brother of A) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Ina-rēšî-ēṭir/Zēria//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê
Title: BM 74580

Paraphrase:
Oath concerning the payment of silver: B1 swears (tamû) to A1 by Bēl and Nabû that he will give to him 1/3 mina of silver, claim (rašûtu) of A2, father of A1, due from B2, father of B1, on the 10th of Ṭebēt (X). It is from the share (pūt zitti) of B1 which he holds (našû) together with his brothers. This is apart from (elat) the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 5/6 mina of silver. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Kiribti-Marduk/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B2 = Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Nabû-ēreš//Aya-tabni
Title: BM 61753

Paraphrase:
Establishment of a business partnership: A invests 10 minas of silver and B invests 5 1/3 minas of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel for a business partnership (harrānu) with B and C as active partners. C will run the business (našpartu alāku) instead of his brother A and together with B. Whatever they will generate from (ina muhhi) the sum of 15 1/3 minas of silver, A and B each will enjoy (akālu) a half share (ahi zitti) in the profit (utru). Beginning with Dûzu (IV), B and C will yearly pay 20 shekel of silver from the commonly held property (karû) as rent (idū) for the house to A. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Šūzubu/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk
Title: BM 61755

Paraphrase:
Partly broken dialogue document concerning a settlement about a promissory note: By order or (ina pî) a certain C (perhaps the father of the mayor), A approaches (mahāru) the priest (šangû) of Sippar (Marduk-šumu-iddin) because of a promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 15 minas of silver which has been declared(?) by the mayor (hazannu) of Sippar (Šamaš-ibni/Nabû-uṣalla) to B. According to a broken passage, B probably needed it for a trip to Uruk. B will bring the promissory note to the mayor in Tašrīt (VII). The judicial settlement (purussî dīnu) took place in the names of the priest of Sippar, the temple enterer (ērib bīti) of Šamaš (Bēl-aplu-iddin//Šangû-Sippar), two more individuals and the scribe.
 
A = Šamaš-ibni/Nabû-nāṣir//Ṣāhit-sattukki; B = Šamaš-aplu-uṣur/Bānia//Pahhāru; C = Nabû-uṣalla; Scribe = Arad-Bēl/Bēl-ušallim//Adad-šamê
Title: BM 67336

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 22 kor (3,960 l) of dates. He will give 4;2.3 kor (810 l) of the indebted dates in Tašrīt. The remainder he will pay in Arahsamna (VIII). fC guarantees (pūtu našû) for the payment of the dates. Seal impressions (kunukku) of the judges Nabû-balassu-iqbi and the Huziri. The contract is drawn up in the presence of (ina mahar) 4 witnesses (including the two judges) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-muballissu/Mušēzib-Marduk//Imbu-īnāya; B = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; fC = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; Scribe = Bēl-ittannu/Rēmūt-Bēl//Naggāru
Title: BM 79512
Place of issue Remark: Place name lost, but presumably Babylon.

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A, overseer (rabû) of Bēl-ittannu, 1;2.4 kor (276 l) of dates. He will pay the dates on the 15th of Ayyār (II) in Sippar. C guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the dates. 4 witnesses and the scribe, identical with the guarantor C.
