A = Mušēzib-Nabû, rabû (overseer) of Bēl-ittannu; B = Ahušunu/Uballissu-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; C = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = C
Title: BM 62406

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: fB1 and her son B2 owe A 5/6 mina of white cut silver without stamp-mark (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu ša lā ginne). They will pay (nadānu) the silver in Dûzu (IV). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû) in view of the payment. C guarantees (pūtu našû) for the payment of the silver. 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bulṭāya/Kalbi-Bābu; fB1 = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B2 = Nabû-balassu-iqbi/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Rēmūt-Bēl/Bēl-uballiṭ
Title: BM 74556

Paraphrase:
Oath concerning the payment of debts: B swears (tamû) to A by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that he will pay (eṭēru) him a broken amount of silver, capital sum (qaqqadu) and interest (hubullu), on the 25th of Simān (III). The payment will be according to (akî) what is provided in the promissory note (u’iltu) that C, who is in a business partnership (harrānu) with [PN], holds against D. The remainder of the tablet is destroyed.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = […]; C = Itti-Bēl-lummir; D = Nabû-šumu-uṣur
Title: BM 64230
BM 74529

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 55 kor (9,900 l) of dates. He will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII). 3 witnesses (including Aplāya/Mušēzib-Marduk//Balīhu) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-ittannu/Arad-Bēl//Balīhu; Scribe = Bēl-ibni//Gahal
Title: BM 61028

Paraphrase:
Broken loan of vats: B owes A 8 empty old vats with bitumen (kupru), damaged (batqu) and leaky (gurrušu *gurruru). The debtor will deliver the vats in Dûzu (IV). 3(+) witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Adad-Bēl-sihi(h)ti/Būru-šēzib; B = Ardia/Kīnāya; Scribe = Bēl-kāṣir/Bēl-bullissu
Title: BM 56796

Paraphrase:
Broken receipt of silver payments: A, by order of (ina qībi) C, receives from B a broken amount of what seems to be silver, paid for the rent of a certain month (the name of which is broken off) of Darius 11th year. This includes (adi) the [previous claim] for 5 minas of silver that was still pending. Each party has taken a copy (šaṭāru). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Murānu; B = Dādia/[…]-ahhē-iddin; C = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = […]/Ardia//[…]
Title: BM 64204

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2 minas of silver by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel and 1 ½ minas of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) of 1/8 alloy per shekel. The debt will bear a monthly interest of one shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). This loan document is apart from (elat) to the previous promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 1 mina and 10 shekels of silver. 4 witnesses (including Bēl-nāṣir, brother of A) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Tēši-ēṭir/Zēria//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê
Title: BM 74603

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 3 minas of cut silver (kaspu nuhhutu) with 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt will bear a monthly interest of one shekel per mina (20% p.a.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Šumu-iddin; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Zēria/Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 74597

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B1 owes A 20 shekels of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) and 10 shekels of refined silver (kaspu qalû). B1 will pay in Dûzu (IV). The silver is given to B2, father of B1, for cattle. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Nabû-etel-ilāni//Šangû-Šamaš; B2 = Nabû-etel-ilāni//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Šūzubu/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk
Title: BM 74473

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina and 12 shekels of silver. The debtor will pay on the 15th of Tašrīt (VII). D, slave (qallu) of the debtor and baker (nuhatimmu), is placed as a pledge. Beginning with the next day, that is, 5th of Abu (V), D will give a compensation payment (mandattu) to the creditor instead of interest (hubullu). C guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the silver. Being the orginal creditor, C has no more claims (rašûtu). 2 witnesses (including Taqīš-Gula/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Ṣāhit-ginê) and the scribe. The text is linked to the sale document BM74988.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Nabû-zēru-iqīša/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Isinnāya; C = Mušallim-Marduk/Lâbâši//Ša-nāšišu; D = Ina-ṣilli-Bīt-Akītu; Scribe = C
Title: BM 74962

Paraphrase:
Partly transfer of dowry: On the basis of the document (u’iltu) concerning 4 minas of silver, dowry (nudunnû) of fC, A receives from (his father-in-law) B1 ½ mina of silver. 2 witnesses (Iqīša/Dayyān-Marduk, father of A, and Bazuzu, son of B1) and the scribe. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ašābi) fB2, mother of the bride fC and wife of B1. Each party has taken one (exemplar of the text) so there should be no retracting (enû).
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Šamaš-mukīn-apli/Mušēzib-Bēl//Balīhu; fB2 = fZazītu, mother of fC and wife of B1; fC = fBu’ītu/Šamaš-mukīn-apli//Balīhu; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê
Title: BM 79733

Paraphrase:
Partly transfer of dowry: Along with his daughter fC, B promised to give as a dowry (nudunnû) 4 minas of silver, the (slave) D1 and 55 shekels of silver, the price (šīmu) of fD2, probably a weaver (iš-x-x-tu4, [išpartu]), to A. From these items, he herewith gives the silver amount for fD2. 5+ witnesses (including Nabû-mušētiq-uddi/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//Sîn-šadûnu) and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Mukīn-zēri//Balīhu; B = Bēl-kāṣir/Nabû-šumu-šakin//Sîn-šadûnu; fC = fSunnā; D1 = Nabû-dīnī-īpuš; fD2 = fPān-nanāya-adaggal, išpartu(?) (weaver); Scribe = Nabû-šumu-līšir/Balassu//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili
Title: BM 79586

Paraphrase: Expenditures of gold and golden objects for a breast ornament of Bēltu-ša-Rēš during times of hardship: Kudurrānu receives 11 ½ shekels of gold, remainder of the gold for the breast ornament (irtu) of Bēltu-ša-Rēš, comprising 51 mountings (mandītu) for cylinder seals, 25 golden pomegranates (nurmû), 21 chains (harharu), 27 rings (sanhu), 25 zuburinnu (mng. unknown) of golden pomegranates and 27 gi’nâtu ša summuhu (gi-i’-na-a-ta ˹šá su˺-um-m[u], mng. unknown) for the golden breast ornament of Bēltu-ša-Rēš.  This administrative procedure happened during the locking of the gate (edel bābi), that is, during times of hardship.
Title: NCBT 511

Paraphrase:
Settlement of a dispute between father and son: Father B and his son A have mutually agreed upon (gamālu D, see comment Zadok and Zadok 2005: 626–7) that 735 square cubits (183.75 m2) of land located in front of the city gate which has been given to C1 as well as 392 square cubits (98 m2) of a house bordering on the house of D which have been given to C2, together with 4 minas of silver, belong to A. 8 witnesses (including Šamaš-zēru-iqīša/Arkāt-ilī-damqāti, governor [šākin ṭēmi] of Borsippa; Nabû-nādin-šumi/Nūr-Papsukkal, temple-enterer [ērib bīti] and bishop [šatammu] of Ezida) and the scribe, also identified as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi).
 
A = Bēl-ikṣur/Zarātu; B = Zarātu, father of A; C1 = Ša-Nabû-šū; C2 = Silim-ilu; D = Useppi; Scribe = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Barīhu
Title: BM 26523

Paraphrase: List of date gardens and their gardeners in Uruk: 7 groups of altogether 47 date gardens with length measures of 40 up to 800 cubits (20 – 400 m). Out of the 47 gardens, 43 gardens are located inside of Uruk and the remaining 4 next to the city wall at the Hariṣu Canal and the Harri Canal.
Title: VAT 8496
Place of issue Remark: no place given, but it must be Uruk

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B1 and B2 owe A ½ mina and 1 shekel of silver. It is an interest-free debt (hubuttūtu). 8 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šumāya; B1 = Bēl-šumu-iškun; B2 = Bēl-iddin//Dan-Adad; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Šangû-Šamaš-Bābili
Bibliography: San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 54 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in van Driel, ZA 79 (1989), 113.
Title: BM 78622

Paraphrase:
Loan of reed: B owes 30 talents of reed, property (nikkassu) of the Šamaš Temple, including the former reed B took from C as collateral (ana nishi našû). The debt sum will increase by a corresponding amount (ana birâ). B will give it back in the month Šabāṭ (XI). 3 witnesses (including Ibnāya from the Isinean family) and the scribe.
 
B = Nabû-[…]/Bēl-usāti//Isinean; C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Ša-nāšišu; Scribe = Etellu//Bēl-ēṭeru
Bibliography: Peiser, KB 4 (1896), 174–75 (transliteration, translation); San Nicolò and Ungnad, NRV no. 226 (translation, notes).
Title: VAT 238

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave girl (during a period of hardship): B voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) gives his small woman (sinništu ṣahirtu) fC to A1, A2 and A3. B guarantees against claimants. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Arad-Gula; A2 = Dannēa; A3 = Ninurta-uballiṭ; B = Ea-ibni; fC = fAlannišu
Bibliography: Mentioned by McCown and Haines, OIP 78 (1967), 76.
Title: IM 57916

Paraphrase:
Receipt of land: A1 and A2 receive land with its front measuring 100 cubits (50 m). It is located on the bank (kišādu) of the Euphrates and beneath (šupālu) the reed huts (huṣṣu) of C and forms part of the hanšû-land of D. A1 guarantees (pūtu našû) for the payment of land with a front measuring 50 cubits (25 m), that is, half of the land. 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A1 = Aplāya//Nusku-iddin; A2 = Bēl-ušallim//Egibi; B = Zākiru//Rab-tarbāṣi; C = Bēl-ēṭir; D = Nabû-ēreš//Sîn-ili; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iddin
Title: BM 64162

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: 1 mina of silver belonging to A is at the disposal of (ina pāni) B. B will repay the capital sum (qaqqadu) of the debt at the opening of the gate (ina petî bābi). 2 female witnesses (Šarrāya and Etellītu, two daughters of Erība-Marduk) and his (the creditor’s) own scribe (ṭupšarru ramanišu).
 
A = Šamaš-iddin//Nabû-useppi; B = Balāssu//Šumāya; Scribe = Šamaš-zēru-iqīša//Aplāya
Title: HS 485

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B1, B2 and B3 owe A 2 minas of silver. The debtors should pay the debt on the 5th day of the following month (II), that is, within c. one week. If they fail to pay on time, the debt will bear a daily interest of 1/2 shekel. 3 witnesses and the scribe who is identical with B3.
 
A = Enlil-šumu-iddin//Murašû; B1 = Nāˀid-Marduk//[…]-ati; B2 = Nabû-šumu-līšir//Ṣāhit-ginê; B3 = Arad-Gula//Bāˀiru; Scribe = B3
Title: MMA 86.11.181

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a storage shed: A purchases from B a storage shed (bīt šutummi), finished with roof and doors, for 3 minas and 10 shekels of silver, together with an additional payment (atru) of 5 kor of dates. The shed is located in the pure storage shed of Ezida. Its upper side (in the north) borders on the storage shed of C1 and its lower side (in the south) on the shed of C2. Its upper front (in the west) borders on the wide street (sūqu rapšu), the processional road (mālaku), and its lower front (in the east) on the shed of C3. The storage shed covers an area of 588 square cubits (147 m2). The purchase price is based on the price of 15 5/6 shekel of silver per 49 square cubits (12.25 m2) field. 9 witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Marduk-kudurrī-uṣur//Irˀanni-Marduk, ērib bīti (temple-enterer) of Marduk; B = Bēl-uballiṭ//Amīlāya, brewer (sirāšu) of Marduk; C1 = Bēl-īpuš/Aplāya; C2 = Etillu//Ilšu-abūšu; C3 = Nabû-iddin//Arkāt-ilāni; Scribe = Bēl-[…]//Rāši-ili
Bibliography: BE 8/1: 23-25 (transliteration, translation); BR 8/7, 16 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Nielsen 2011 passim.
Title: CBS 18

Paraphrase: Broken legal document with the witness list partly preserved on the reverse. The transaction takes place in the presence of the priest (šangû) of Ur and the prefect (šaknu) of Ur (names broken) and the scribe Nabû-šumu-iddin//Ahu-ušabši.
Bibliography: Legrain, MJ 17 (1926) 392 no. 57 (copy, transliteration, and translation of date only). Catalogued in Studies Oppenheim: 43, no. 44.2.17.
Title: IM 57171

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: C1 owes A via B 3 minas of silver. The debt is secured by the pledged property (bīt maškani) of C1 received from C2, C3 and his mother fC4. He won’t get these assets back. The remainder is with A. 9 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-šāpik-zēri; B = Kudurru/Bēl-eṭēru//Šangû-Dilbat; C1 = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Lâbâši//Basia; C2 = Nabû-ittabši-līšir; C3 = Marduk-šumu-ibni; fC4 = fBēlessunu, mother of C1; Scribe = Etellu/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Egibi
Title: Ash. 1924.490

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a garden for 24.5 shekels of silver from B. The sold garden forms part of the hanšû-land of C. It borders on the Lagamal Canal (Harru-ša-Lagamal) and the royal road (harrān šarri) as well as on the properties of D1 and D2. 2 witnesses and the scribe, also described as writers of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki). This is a retroact for Marduk-šāpik-zēri//Egibi.
 
A = Mukīn-zēri//Basia; B = Uraš-lēˀi//Šāpiku; C = Iddina//Zākiru; D1 = Ubār/Uraš-iddin; D2 = Ammēni-ilī/Nanāya; Scribe = Rēmūtu/Uraš-ibni
Title: Ash. 1924.486

Paraphrase:
Payment of silver: Redemption of 1 mina and 50 shekels of silver, credited by A to B, by the transfer of fC. The remainder of the operative section and the witness list are not preserved.
 
A = […]; B = Ahu-šubši/[…]; fC = fĒṭirtu
Title: VAT 15954

Paraphrase: Examination of cattle: 125 cows, under the responsibility of the shepherd […]/Iddin-Nergal, are counted.
Title: YBC 11297

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document about a settlement of a dispute concerning small livestock: A files a suit against B saying that he did not receive a share of the revenue of the sale of 27 small livestock animals. The assembly of the Babylonians and Dilbateans sent them to the ordeal of the 14th of Addar (XII). A will give 1 mina of silver and B 2 minas of silver. They will go to the ordeal on the 4th of Abu (V). 8 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ēṭir; B = Nabû-šumu-ēreš; Scribe = Nabû-ahu-iddin//Bāˀiru
Bibliography: HE 355: Scheil, RA 18: 32-33 (transliteration); BR 8/7, 85 (transliteration, translation); DCEHE 60 (copy, notes).
Title: BM 29029

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Ištar of Uruk for 15 days, from the 1st to the 15th day of Nisān (I) of the following year (Kandalanu 18), for 1 mina and 15 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 5 shekels of silver, from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Naˀid-Marduk). 6 witnesses  and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) (of the seller).
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Nādin/Bēl-ušallim; Scribe = Mukīn-zēri/Zabīdāya
Title: IM 65074

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A [x] mina of silver without interest (qaqqadu). Beginning with the month Kislīm (IX), the debt will bear an interest of 8 shekels per mina (13.3% p.a.). 1 square kor (13,500 m2) of land, situated beneath the Canal of the Mulberry (harru ša ṣarbi), is placed as a pledge. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B = Nabû-ibni//Šigûa; Scribe = Nergal-šumu-uṣur//Egibi
Title: VAT 17899

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land and an empty house: A purchases three parcels of land for 34(+?) minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The three parcels of land include the half share (ahu) of an orchard (kirû), an empty house plot (bītu kišubbû) and a piece of grain-cultivated land (zēru pî šulpi). The orchard is located in the meadowland (ugāru) of Uruk. Its upper side, its lower side and its upper front borders on the houses of C1, C2 and C3. Its lower front follows the royal canal (nār šarri). No cardinal directions for the sides of the orchard are given. The empty house plot is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Market Gate (bāb mahīri) inside Uruk. Its upper side (in the west) borders on the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the god and the king and its lower side (in the east) on the house of C4. Its upper front (in the north) borders on the house(s) of C5 and C6 and its lower front (in the south) on the narrow street (sūqu qatnu). The plot of cultivated land is located in the meadowland of the Angillu irrigation district (tamirtu) and along the upper (elû) royal canal (nār šarri) in the meadowland of Uruk. Neither cardinal directions for the sides nor any other information about the bordering areas are given. No side lengths are given for any of the three plots. All this is the (inheritance) share (zittu) which B2, the father of the seller, received from B3, the grandfather of the seller. 15 witnesses (including the priest [šangû] of Larsa) and the scribe. Fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu/Sîn-nāṣir; B1 = Nabû-nādin-šumi/Šulāya/Ṭābia; B2 = Šulāya/Ahhēa/Ṭābia; B3 = Ahhēa/Aplāya/Ṭābia; C1 = Kudurru//Nabû-naˀid; C2 = Nādinu//Ērešu; C3 = Pirˀu//Bēl-useppi; C4 = Ilūˀa/Šullumu; C5 = […]/Šullumu; C6 = Nabû-erība//Šāpiku; Scribe = Rēmūt-Bāba//Arkât-ilī
Bibliography: Contenau, TCL 12 12 (copy); Moore, NBBAD (1935), 12 (edition). Mentioned in Wright 1994, 127.
Title: AO 10337
Other markings Description: on the left and right edges

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house in Uruk: A purchases a ruined house (bītu abtu) for 2 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 2 shekels of silver, from B. The sold house is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Market Gate (bāb mahīri) inside of Uruk. Its upper and lower side (in the north and south) as well as upper front (in the west) border on the houses of C1, C2 and C3. Its lower front (in the east) borders on the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the god and the king. It measures 55 x 30 cubits (27.5 x 15 m). The seller has taken an oath (nīšu zakāru) by the god Marduk well as his divine spouse Zarpanītu and by the king. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the leader of the tribe Bīt-Amukāni (Ea-zēru-(i)qīša). 12 witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B = Ahu-iddin-Marduk/Aplāya; C1 = Ibnāya//Ahu-šubši; C2 = Nabû-ušēzib/Dāmiru; C3 = Nanāya-īpuš/Pirˀu; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-līšir//Nabû-zēru-ukīn
Title: BM 118970

Paraphrase: Expenditure of coloured wool: Wool and different types of coloured wool (ṣirpu [red dyed wool], takiltu [blue-purple wool], tabarru [red dyed wool]) are given to various different people (including several women) for the manufacture of garments.
Title: MLC 1815

Paraphrase: Expenditures of silver for the kettles before Bēltia and Nanāya during times of hostilities in the land: Out of the capital sum (qaqqadu) of 27 minas and 13 shekels of silver, at the disposal of (ina pāni) Nabû-zēru-ibni for the repair (batqu) of kettles (taphu) before the potstand (kankannu) of Bēltia and Nanāya, he weighed (hâṭu) and used 24 ½ minas and 1 shekel of silver, that is, 16 ½ minas and one shekel as the first supply (hāṭu) and 8 minas as the second supply. These 24 ½ minas and 1 shekel of silver will be recast (patāqu), while the remainder of 2 1/3 minas and 3 shekels of silver, together with 19 shekels ina parīdānu (mng. unknown), won’t be recast.
Title: NBC 4904

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a field: A purchases a field (eqlu) for 13 shekels of silver from B. The sold field is located on the other river bank (ahullā) and forms part of the hanšû-land of Nabû-zēru-iddin. It reaches from the Euphrates as far as Larak. Curses. 5 witnesses and the scribe who is identical with B.
 
A = Ninurta-ahu-iddin/Bēl-usātu; B = Ninurta-erība/Uballiṭua; Scribe = B
Title: WCMA 20.1.31

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases from B the prebend of the scribe (isiq ṭupšarrūti) in the house of the dates (bīt gišimmari) of Ezida (Nabû Temple) for 4 months for 5 ½ minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu). The sold prebend affords Dilmun dates, regular dates, emmer (kunāšu), salt, sesame, honey, ghee (himētu), nabrû-offerings, sweet bread (mutqû), siltu-groates and other food rations (kurummatu) together with 0;0.1 kor (6 l) of sesame being under the responsibility of (ina qātē) of C. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the temple-enterer (ērib bīti) of Nabû and the bishop (šatammu) of Ezida (Nabû-nādin-šumi//Nūr-Papsukkal) as well as the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Borsippa (Nabû-bēl-šumāti//Ilia). 7 witnesses (including Nabû-ušēzib, “the one in charge of the rations of the king” [ša-muhhi-kurummāti-šarri“] and Šumāya from the Basia family) and the scribe, who like the buyer, belongs to the Balāṭu family. Along with the entry of the witness Šumāya it is said that 10 kor (1,800 l) of barley and a garment (TÚG.KUR.RA) are given. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir//Balāṭu; B = Tabnēa//Basia; C = Aplāya//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Nabû-iddin//Balāṭu
Title: VAT 13392

Paraphrase: Administrative document concerning a royal land grant: 91 officials in charge of hanšû-land (rab hanšê) each receive 150 of x-measure land from the king. The granted land reaches from the bank of the Canal of Marduk-apla-iddina as far as the border of Bīt-Zu-gunabu. It is determined that 1,100 of x-measure “of the temple” equal to 1,000 of x-measure “of the king.” Note that the measurement unit is never given along with the numbers.
Bibliography: Cocquerillat 1968: 107 (partial transliteration). Mentioned in Nielsen 2011: 164, fn. 38. Catalogued in Studies Oppenheim: 42, no. 44.2.8.
Title: VAT 8498
Place of issue Remark: no place given, but it must be Uruk

Paraphrase: Administrative document dealing with the delivery of gold: This document records 1/3 shekel of gold, delivered on delay (hāṭu arkû), for the metal adornment (šamšānu) on the front of the raqqatu-garment of Aya and [x] amounts of gold of the month Nisān (I) at the disposal of Bēl-ahu-ušabši for the flowers(?) (a-a-ri) of Aya.
Bibliography: Peiser, KB 4 (1896), 170–73 (transliteration, translation); San Nicolò and Ungnad, NRV no. 722 (translation, notes).
Title: VAT 189

Paraphrase: Fragmentary loan of silver.
Title: HS 484

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a date garden: A purchases from B a planted and cultivated (zaqpu u pî šulpi) date garden (kirî gišimmari) for [x] amounts of silver. The plot of land is located in the area of Bīt-Zabīni in the district (pīhatu) of Uruk. Its upper side (in the east) and its upper front (in the north) border on (the properties of) C, presumably the father of the buyer. Its lower side (in the west) borders on the bank (kišādu) of the Harru-ša-nēri canal. The bordering area of the lower front (in the south) is not specified. No dimensions are given. In connection with the upper side and the lower side it is stated that they have to be measured out (madādu). The remainder of the main text body and the beginning of the witness list are broken. 6+ witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Marduk-aplu-uṣur/Ina-tēšî-ēṭir; B = Bēlšunu/Nabû-ušallim; C = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Rēmūtu; Scribe = Bēl-šumu-iškun/Bēl-ahhē-erība
Title: MMA 86.11.217

Paraphrase: Broken document about the distribution of of silver. The transaction takes place in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) of 9 witnesses and the scribe Šumāya.
Bibliography: Legrain, MJ 17 (1926) 392 no. 55 (copy, transliteration, and translation of final line only); UET 1 263 (partical copy, transliteration and translation of final line only). Mentioned in Brinkman, OrNS 46: 317, no. 14 (on place and date).
Title: UM 52-30-56

Paraphrase:
Cancellation of a purchase of land during hard times: A purchases 0;4 square kor (10,800 m2) of land with young date palms for silver from B at times when the gate was locked (edel bābi). The land is located in the irrigation district (tamirtu) Bazia, in the meadowland (ugāru) of Dilbat, and forms part of the hanšû-land of C. The purchase is cancelled. A receives back his money and gives the tablet to the seller. 7 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ša-pî-Uraš//Salāmu; B = Šamaš-iddin//Bā’iru; C = Uraš-iddin//Saggillu; Scribe = Lâbâši-Marduk/Iddin-Papsukkal
Title: Ash. 1924.484

Paraphrase: Fragment of a legal record concerning barley of Rēmūtu which is at the disposal of Libluṭ/[…] and Ṣulua. It has been written by a certain Ša-pî-[…].
Title: MLC 1787

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1/2 mina of silver without interest (qaqqadu). The remainder of the operative section and the witness list are not preserved.
 
A = Ahu-šubši//[…]; B = […]
Title: VAT 17915

Paraphrase:
Cancellation of a purchase of a prebend: According to the annihilated tablet (ṭuppi šiprēti), A has purchased the prebend of the temple-enterer (ērib bītūti) in the Eimbianu, the Uraš Temple, before Bēlet-ekalli for 2 minas and 2 shekels of silver from B. However, C raises claim on the sold property since it is family estate. The purchase is cancelled and the prebend is property of C. 11(+) witnesses and the scribe.

A = Kudurru/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ//Šangû-Dilbat; B = Iqīša-Marduk/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Egibi; C = Marduk-šāpik-zēri/Erība-Marduk//Egibi; Scribe = Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Bēl-ipuš/Egibi
Bibliography: Ash.1924.485: edited as OECT 10, 398. Mentioned in Langdon, JRAS 2: 321.
Title: YBC 11389

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 10 minas of silver. The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of a house. It is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ēṭir/Šangû-Dilbat; B = Iddin-Nabû/Isinnāya; Scribe = Nabû-zēru-līšir/Iqīša-Marduk
Title: YBC 11309

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Bēltia from the [x]th to the 21st day (of the present month) for 6 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-ušabši) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-šumu-iddin). 4 witnesses (including Ahu-lūmur, a son of A) and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šaṭir ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Rēmūtu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin; B = Līširu/Nādin-apli; Scribe = Nādin-apli /Kunāya
Title: IM 65070

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A ½ mina of silver. The debt will bear an interest of 10 shekels per mina (16.7% p.a.). 10 square kor (135,000 m2) of land, bordering the wine house (bīt karāni) of B2, is placed as a pledge. 3 witnesses and the scribe, who is identical with B2.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B1 = Marduk-šumu-ibni//Šangû-Zāriqu; B2 = Aplāya//Nābutu; Scribe = B2
Title: VAT 17898

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house in Uruk: A purchases a ruined house (bītu abtu) for 50 shekels of silver, together with an additional payment (atru) of one woolen garment (TÚG.KUR.RA), from B. The sold house is located in the Eanna district (erṣet Eanna) inside Uruk. Its upper side (in the north) and its upper front (in the west) border on houses already owned by the buyer. Its lower front (in the east) borders on the house of C and its lower side (in the south) borders on a blind alley (biriti lā aṣîti). No side lengths are given in the record. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-ušabši) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-iqīša). 10 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B = Nabû-ēreš/Hašdia; C = Ahhēšāya/Nanāya-uṣalli; Scribe = Balāṭu/Bēl-lēˀi
Title: BM 118985

Paraphrase: List of shorn sheep: Nabû-kī-šāri, slave (amīlūtu) of Nabû-šēzibanni, gives in sum 465 shorn (gazzu) sheep.
Title: MLC 1814

Paraphrase: Inventory of precious metals (and other precious materials like stone) for the manufacture of a golden tiara: In sum 29 (minas) and 15? shekels of red gold, including  1 mina and 14 ½ shekels of refined copper, are made available for the manufacture of a golden tiara (agû) for the goddess Uṣur-amāssu. As finished work (dullu epšu) the tiara will combine 47 5/6 minas and 16 ½ shekels red gold. The document was written by Širikti-Marduk/Ibni-Ištar, scribe (ṭupšarru) of Eanna.
Title: YBC 11390

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document concerning the purchase of a prebend: B1 and B2 approach A with a request to buy the prebend of the temple scribe (ṭupšar bītūti) of (literally) their father, and their entire assets (nikkassu ša āli u ṣēri), for 50 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu). A grants the request and weighs out and pays (hâṭu-nadānu) the money in order to receive a sealed tablet (kunukku) over the ownership of the prebend of the temple scribe. The amount of 50 shekels of silver is the outstanding amount of 2 minas and 40 shekels of silver less 1 mina 50 shekels of silver which belong to (ana muhhi pî) C1 and C2, (literally) brothers of B1 and B2. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Ur (Sîn-tabni-uṣur). 5 witnesses (including Nabû-ahu-uṣur/Bēl-iqīša, ša-qurbūti and Sîn-šarru-uṣur, scout [dayālu]) and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the two sellers. In case B1 comes to Ur, A will voluntarily (in hūd libbi) give him the house located next to D as well as the prebend (isqu) before the Lady of Ur. In case B1 does not come to Ur, this property will remain in the possession of A.
 
A = Ningal-ušēzib/Palil-iddin; B1 = Balāssu/Sîn-bār-ilāni/Halluršu; B2 = Ahhū-ṭābū/Nabû-šumu-iddin/Nabû-nāṣir; C1 = Aplāya; C2 = Nabû-mudammiq-ilī; D = Sîn-iddin/Sîn-ahu-šubši; Scribe = Sîn-šar-ilāni/Bēl-īpuš

*Note that the family relationships “father” and “brother”, as given in the text, do not (necessarily) correspond to the actual relations. B1 and B2 apparently had not the same father and it remains unclear if and how C1 and C2 could have (partly) been brothers of B1 and B2.
Title: BM 113929

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina of silver. Beginning with the present day, the debt will bear a yearly interest of 10 shekels per mina (16.7% p.a.). The houses of C1 and C2, both sons of B, are placed as a pledge. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-zēri/Aplāya; B = Upāqu/[…]; C1 = Aplāya/Upāqu; C2 = Nabû-šumu-ukīn; Scribe = Marduk-bēl-ilāni/Nabû-zēru-iddin
Title: CMAG 1922.90.04

Paraphrase:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases 11 square reed (134.75 m2) of wasteland (eqlu kišubbû) for 4 shekels of silver, together with an additional payment (atru) of 1 shekel of silver, from B. The sold land is located in the Kullaba district (erṣet Kullaba) inside of Babylon. Its upper side borders on a narrow street (sūqu qatnû) and its lower side on the main building of the Akitu festival (bīt rēši akītum). Its upper front borders on the house of C1 and its lower front on the house of C2. 5 witnesses (including another individual, Nabû-šumu-iškun, from the Arkāt-ili-damqu family) and the scribe.

A = Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Arad-Ea; B1 = Nabû-bēlšunu//Nappāhu; B2 = Nabû-bēlšunu//Bēl-ēṭir; C1 = Bēl-nāṣir//Sîn-dayyānu; C2 = Bēl-iqīša, atkuppu (reed worker); Scribe = Nabû-bēlšunu//Arkāt-ili-damqu
Bibliography: Peiser, KB 4 (1896), 172–75 (transliteration, translation); San Nicolò and Ungnad, NRV no. 33 (translation, notes).
Title: VAT 451

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: 1/3 shekel of silver belonging to A are at the disposal of (ina pāni) B. Beginning with the following year, the debt will bear a monthly interest of 1/3 shekel of silver per shekel. 4 witnesses (including Šamaš-zēru-iqīša, another member of the Nabû-useppi family) and the scribe.
 
A = Šamaš-iddin//Nabû-useppi; B = Balāssu//Šumāya; Scribe = Šamaš-zēru-iqīša//Aplāya
Title: HS 483

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B1, B2 and B3 owe A1, A2, A3, A4, A5 and A6 3 minas of silver. Beginning with the present month, the debt will bear a monthly interest of 5 shekels (33% p.a.). The debtors mutually guarantee for the repayment of the debt (ištēn pūt šanî našû). An additional clause, literally meaning “whoever sees (the debtors), receives the silver”, possibly refers to “joint creditorship”. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1= Aššur-dannu; A2 = Aya-abū; A3 = Batūl; A4 = Igigi; A5 = Nergalāya; A6 = Damqia; B1= Perˀu; B2 = Šumāya; B3 = Nabû-gāmil; Scribe = Murānu//Egibi
Bibliography: San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 55 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in van Driel, ZA 79 (1989), 113 and in Nielsen 2011 passim.
Title: MMA 86.11.155

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a field: A purchases from B a field (eqlu) for 1/3 mina and [x] shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), including [x] shekel of silver for the seller’s fingernail impression. The description of the bordering areas is not preserved. The plot of land measures 37 x 25 cubits (18.5 x 12.5 m). 11+ witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Perˀu/Šu[…]; B = Šamaš-erība//Eppēš-ilī; Scribe = Abi-maqar//Nabû-ušallim
Bibliography: BR 8/7, 25 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Nielsen 2011: 164, fn. 36.
Title: CBS 12796

Paraphrase:
Fragmentary document concerning the settlement of a dispute involving money: A dispute involving the parties A and B1 and B2 about slaves (amīlūtu) and an amount of 1 mina and 1/3 shekels of siver is settled in the assembly (puhru) of the mār bānê. The document is sealed in the presence of the prefect (šaknu) of the king (Ṣalam-šarri-iqbi), the prefect of the slaves(?) ([…]-ili) and priest (šangû) of Sîn ([…]-mušebši. Broken witness list.
 
A = Ahu-kiru-ibni; B1 = Sîn-ēṭir; B2 = Gabbi-ilāni-šarru-uṣur
Title: IM 57169

Paraphrase:
Loan silver: 8 shekels of silver, purchase price (šīmu) of dates, belonging to A are at the disposal (ina pāni) of B. B will pay half of the debt in silver and the other half in dates. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ahhē-erība//Atkuppu; B = Ṣillāya//Saggilāya; Scribe = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ//Bēl-eṭēru
Title: Ash. 1924.1260

Paraphrase: Loan: Heavily broken debt note involving interest payments.
Title: VAT 17914

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes to A [x] amount of silver. Beginning with following month Kislīm (IX), the debt will bear a yearly interest of 8 shekels per mina (13.33% p.a.). The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of a field. [x] witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim/Lē’êa; B = Nabû-ibni/Šigûa; Scribe = […]
Title: YBC 11409

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina and 1/3 shekel of silver. The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of a prebend (details broken) and the entire assets (mimmûšu ša āli u ṣēri) of B. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-zēru-ušabši/Kunāya; B = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; Scribe = Šūzubu/Bēl-iqīša
Title: IM 65079

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Kanisurra until the end of the present month for 25 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-ušabši) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-iqīša). 5 witnesses (including Nabû-šar-ahhēšu, a brother of B) and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šaṭir ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Aplāya/Ubba; B = Nabû-zēru-iddin/Ša-Nabû-šu; Scribe = […]/Erība
Title: IM 65071

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 10 shekels of silver. The debt will bear an interest of 9 shekels per mina (15% p.a.). The woman fC is paced as a pledge. 1 witness and the scribe, who is identical with B.

A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B = Šabāya//Egibi; fC = fBānītu-šarri; Scribe = B
Title: VAT 17889

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B1 owes A 15 minas of silver. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel per mina (20% p.a.). The debt is secured by a pledge which includes: B1’s 1/6 (inheritance) share (zittu) in an orchard; the half share (ahu) of the same orchard, which is the (inheritance) share of B2, the brother of B1; a house in Uruk against which B1 has already drawn silver (nasāhu) for making a payment (eṭēru) on behalf (ana muhhi) of B2; a plot in Babylon which measures 637 square cubits (159.25 m2) and borders on the houses of C1 and C2; (and) the entire assets (nikkassūšu ša āli u ṣēri) of B1. 5+ witnesses and the scribe. In text BM11898 we learn about another 1/6 share of the inheritance of Ahhēa.

A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu//Sîn-nāṣir; B1 = Nabû-ēṭir/Ahhēa//Ṭābia; B2 = Šulāya/Ahhēa//Ṭābia; C1 = Nabû-ušallim//Amati; C2 = Šumāya//Miṣirayyu; Scribe = Aplāya//Šangû-Sippar
Title: YBC 11413

Paraphrase:
Purchase of field: A purchases a half share of a field (eqlu) for 2 ½ minas of silver from B1 and his mother fB2. The plot of land comprises a date garden (kirî gišimmari) and wasteland (kišubbû) and is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Ninurta Temple inside of Uruk. Its upper side borders on the city wall (dūr āli), while its lower side, upper front and lower front border on (the properties of) C1, C2 and C3. The upper front also borders on a street (sūqu). No cardinal directions are given in the record. Its upper side measures 350 cubits (175 m), its lower side and upper front 300 cubits (150 m) and its lower front 200 cubits (100 m). The plot presumably is the first half of the land bought by A from B1 and B2 one year later (BM119872). The transaction is concluded in the presence (ina ušuzzi) of the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Ahhēšāya) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Balāṭu). 14 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of the sellers.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B1= Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Kudurru; fB2 = fNasqat; C1 = Zākiru, aškāpu (leatherworker); C2 = Eanna-ibni, pahāru (potter); C2 = Zibāya/Ērešu; Scribe = Bēl-īpuš//Šamaš-bāri
Title: BM 118979

Paraphrase: Examination of cattle: Nabû-rēṣūwa, from Dūru-ša-Ammi-jabab, gives in sum 63 bovines (littu).
Title: MLC 1813

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A purchases from B1, B2 and B3 two plots of land. First, A purchases 4 square kor (54,000 m2) arable land (zēru), a garden with date palms bearing fruit (kirî gišimmari zaqpi iṣṣi bilti), for 19 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of ½ mina of silver. The sold garden is located in the meadowland (ugāru) of the Zababa Gate in the province (pīhatu) of Babylon. Its upper side (in the north) borders on the Imgur-Illil Wall and on (the property of) C1 and its lower side (in the south) on the bank (kišādu) of the Bānītu Canal (Nāru-ša-Bānītu) as well as (the property or properties of) C2 and C3. Its upper front (in the west) borders on (the property of) C4 and its lower front (in the east) on the bank of the Bānītu Canal. Second, A purchases 30 square kor (405,000 m2) of arable land, a field in the countryside planted with trees (eqlu ṣēru pî šulpi) for 7 ½ minas of silver. The sold land is located in the meadowland of the Bēl sluice in the province of Babylon. Its upper side (in the north) borders on (the property of) C5 and its lower side (in the south) on (the property of) C6. Its upper front (in the west) borders on the bank of the Gubbat Canal (Nāru-ša-Gubbat) and its lower front (in the east) leads up to the dam (makallû) of the hanšû-land. In case the sold land is smaller or bigger than the determined in the present document, the two parties will settle it with each other. 12 witnesses and the scribe (not specified). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the three sellers.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-ibni/Bēl-iddin//Ēppeš-ili; B1 = Zēria/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Ēppeš-ili; B2 = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Ēppeš-ili; B3 = Nādin/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Ēppeš-ili; C1 = Rēmūtu//Sangû-Ea; C2 = Šākin-šumi//Itinnu; C3 = Tabnēa//Nabû-ēṭir; C4 = Tabnēa//Bā’iru; C5 = Nabû-šumu-iddin//Ēppeš-ili; C6 = Ērišu//Arad-Nergal; Scribe = Nabû-bēl-usāti/Ea-lēˀi//Itinnu
Bibliography: San Nicolò and Ungnad, NRV no. 46 (translation, notes).
Title: VAT 3163

Bibliography: Mentioned in Oppenheim, Iraq 17 (1955), 70 fn. 1; McCown and Haines, OIP 78 (1967), 76; Brinkman, Power and Propaganda (1979), 248 fn. 116.
Title: IM 57923

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: 1 mina of silver belonging to A are the disposal of (ina pāni) B1 and B2. Beginning with the present day, the debt will bear a yearly interest of 10 shekels of silver (16.66% p.a.). 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ninurta-uballiṭ//Erība-Marduk; B1 = Šamaš-uballiṭ//Dummuqu; B2 = Iqīšāya//Iddia; Scribe = Ninurta-ušallim//Nabû-useppi
Title: HS 482

Paraphrase:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases from B wasteland (eqlu kišubbû), for [x] minas and 15 shekels of silver, including silver for [x] kor of barley for the seller’s fingernail impression. The plot is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Gate of LUGAL.GU(D).SI.SÁ inside of GIR.GI.LUM.KI (= Nippur?). Its upper side (in the north) borders on a property of the buyer A and on a house of C1 and its lower side (in the south) on the property of C2. Its upper front (in the east) borders on the property of C3 and its lower front (in the west) on another property of the buyer. Its upper side measures 34 cubits (17 m), its lower side 30 cubits (15 m), its upper front 32 cubits (16 m) and its lower front 21(?) cubits (10.5 m). 11+ witnesses (including C3) and the scribe, also defined as sealer of the tablet (kānik ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Aplāya//Šumāya; B = Nergal-uballiṭ//Hayānu; C1 = Nergal-uballiṭ//Nabû-ahu-[…]; C2 = Šumu-ibni//[…]; C3 = Ninurta-ašarēdu//Zabūšu; Scribe = Bēl-[…]//Rāši-ili
Bibliography: BR 8/7, 17 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Nielsen 2011: 224, fn. 4.
Title: CBS 12804

Paraphrase:
Settlement of a dispute: The dispute between A and B concerning the slave fC and four children is settled before D, the governor of Ur, and the assemblies (puhru) of Babylon, Borsippa and Ur. It has been decided that A receives the slave together with a purchase document.
 
A = Damqia/Šūzubu; B = Kudurru//Kidin-Sîn; fC = fŠāhitti; D = Sîn-balāssu-iqbi, governor of Ur
Title: IM 57168

Paraphrase:
Broken loan of silver: B1 and B2 owe A 4 1/24 (gerû) shekels of silver. The redemption of the debt involves 0;2.4 kor (96 l) of dates (details broken). Witness list and date formula are heavily broken.
 
A = Lâbâši/Nādinu; B1 = Umnuzu; B2 = Bēl-šumu-iškun
Title: MLC 1672

Paraphrase: Court procedure: Badly preserved tablet concerning a court procedure, possibly about the  purchase of a slave.
Title: VAT 17913

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes to A 2/3 mina of silver without interest (qaqqadu). Beginning with the present day, the debt will bear a yearly interest of 9 shekels per mina (15% p.a.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim/Lē’êa; B = Marduk-šarrāni/Šangû-Zāriqu; Scribe = Nādin-ahi/Irˀanni
Bibliography: VAT 17896: edited as FB 10, 4. Mentioned in Nielsen 2011: 139, fn. 49.
Title: YBC 11334

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 6 shekels of silver. It is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of a prebend (unspecified) before Nanāya beginning with the present day - the time of completion is not preserved. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ibni-Ištar/Bēl-ušallim; B = Lâbâši/Gudadu; Scribe = Šūzubu/Bēl-iqīša
Title: W. 20032,9

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document concerning the purchase of a prebend: B1 and B2 approach A with a request to take over the service of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Nanāya for the 10th of Ṭebēt (X). A grants the request and pays 5/6 mina and 2 shekels of silver for the prebend. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Hinnumu). 2 witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the two sellers.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/ŠU-zēri; B1 = Purussû/Uprāya; B2 = Šumu-uṣur/Kudurru; Scribe = Ahhēšāya/Bēl-usāti
Title: IM 65069

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1/3 mina of silver. The debt will bear a yearly interest of 8 shekels per mina (13.3% p.a.). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B = Bēl-uballiṭ/Šumāya/Arad-Nergal; Scribe = Bēl-kaṣir
Title: VAT 17894

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house in Uruk: A purchases a ruined house (bītu abtu) for 1 ½ minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 2 shekels of silver, from B. The sold house is located in the Eanna district (erṣet Eanna) inside of Uruk. Its upper side (in the north), its lower side (in the south) and its lower front (in the east) border on the houses of C1, C2 and C3. Its upper front (in the west) borders on a house already owned by the buyer. No side lengths are given in the record. 16 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B = Nabû-ahu-ēreš//Nanāya-uṣalli; C1 = Šāpiku, ṣāhitu (oilpresser); C2 = Nabû-ēreš//Hašdia; C3 = Ahhēšāya/Nanāya-uṣalli; Scribe = Bēl-rēmanni/Kudurru
Title: BM 118978

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a date garden (kirî gišimmari) for 2 5/6 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The sold garden is located inside of Uruk. Its lower front (in the south) borders on the moat (harīṣu) of the gate (abullu) of the goddess Irnin(n)a and its lower side (in the west) on the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the god and the king. Its upper side (in the east) borders on (the property of) C. The bordering area of the upper front (in the north) is not specified. The upper front and the lower front each measure 100 cubits (50 m). The upper side is said to be as long as the one of (the property of) the neighbour C. The length of the lower side is not specified. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Ahhēšāya) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-nāṣir). 15 witnesses (including the ašlāku [tanner] Nabû-useppi) and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.  

A = Lâbâši/Nabû-lēˀi; B = Bēlšunu/Ahhēšāya; C = Bēl-ēṭir; Scribe = Nabû-lēˀi//Iddin-Papsukkal
Title: BM 118965

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1/2 mina of silver. Beginning with the present day, the debt will bear an interest of 1/5 (hummušu) shekel per shekel (20% p.a.). 3 witnesses and the scribe, defined as writer of the promissory note (šāṭir u’ilti).
 
A = Taqīš-Gula//Širik; B = Ninurta-kabit//Sîn-ēreš; Scribe = Tabnēa//Kurigalzu
Title: IM 75773

Paraphrase:
Expenditure of barley: A1 and A2 provide 30 kor (5,400 l) of barley as seed grain (zēru).
 
A1 = Erēšu; A2 = Zabīnu
Title: MLC 1812

Paraphrase: Fragmentary legal record concerning a plot of arable land (zēru) of Nabû-bullissu(?) and another? field in? Bīt-qanê of? Nergal-uballiṭ. Other individuals involved are […]/Šulāya//[…] and […]/Nādin-ahi//Šangû-[…]. 3(+) witnesses and the scribe ([…]//Arad-Ea).
Title: MM 901

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A purchases 30 square kor (405,000 m2) of arable land (zēru) in the newly cleared countryside (eqlu ṣēru taptû), forming part of hanšû-land, for 3 2/3 minas and 5 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû) in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The sold land is located in the meadowland (ugāru) of the reed marshes (appāru) of the Bēl sluice (bābi ša Bēl) in the province (pīhatu) of Babylon. Its upper side (in the north) borders on (the property of) C1, from the same family as A, and its lower side (in the south) borders on (the property of) the seller B. Its upper front (in the west) borders on the bank (kišādu) of the Gubbat Canal (Nāru-ša-Gubbat) and its lower front (in the east) on (the property of) C2. 8 witnesses (including several members of the Ēppeš-ili family and the Arad-Nergal family) and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B. In case the sold land is smaller than 30 square kor, A will take the missing share from the land of B. In case the sold land is bigger than 30 square kor, B will take the surplus back. Another individual is said to have been present.

A = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Bēl-lēˀi//Ēppeš-ili; B = Ērišu/Nādin//Arad-Nergal; C1 = Nabû-šumu-iddin//Ēppeš-ili; C2 = […]//Mādidu; Scribe = Bēl-usātu//Itinnu
Bibliography: San Nicolò and Ungnad, NRV no. 45 (translation, notes).
Title: VAT 2963

Bibliography: Mentioned in Oppenheim, Iraq 17 (1955), 70 fn. 1; McCown and Haines, OIP 78 (1967), 76; Brinkman, Power and Propaganda (1979), 248 fn. 116.
Title: IM 57924

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: 5 shekels of silver belonging to A are at the disposal of (ina pāni) B. The debt will bear an interest of 1/5 per shekel of silver (20% p.a.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ninurta-uballiṭ//Erība-Marduk; B = Ninurta-ahu-iddin//Nabû-zēru-ibni; Scribe = Ninurta-gāmil//Aplāya
Title: HS 481

Paraphrase: Account dealing with the payments of silver to Ebabbar in Sippar, at least partly for the acquisition of domestic animals. Inter alia a smith (nappāhu) is listed as contributor of a silver amount (broken) and brewers (sirāšu) as well as bakers (nuhatimmu) are mentioned too.
Bibliography: San Nicolò and Ungnad, NRV no. 721 (translation, notes).
Title: VAT 583

Paraphrase:
Legal document concerning the redistribution of dates: 60 kor (10,800 l) of dates from A1 to B1, 30 kor (5,400 l) from A2 to B2, 60 kor (10,800 l) from A3 to B3, 60 kor (10,800 l) from A4 to B4 and B5. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the royal resident (qīpu) (Ninurta-šarru-uṣur) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-nādin-ahi). 4 witnesses and the scribe (not specified). According to an additional note C is at the disposal of (ina pāni) D.
 
A1 = Kudurru/Taqbi-līšir; A2 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin; A3 = Zēria/Zēru-ukīn; A4 = Nabû-gāmil/Zēru[..]; B1 = Bēl-ēreš; B2 = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Ibnāya; B3 = Mukīn-Innina/Nabû-zēru-iddin; B4 = Marduk-šumu-līšir; B5 = […]; C = Ibni-Ištar; D = Nabû-šumu-iddin/Rēmūtu
Title: AO 6825

Paraphrase:
Letter of A to his master B: The clans (qinnu) of Temāya and Teimanāya from Eridu came and collaborated with the Quradu-Arabs.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-ibni; B = Ningal-iddin, šākin ša Ur(?) (governor of Ur)
Title: UM 52-30-40

Paraphrase:
Purchase of orchards and wasteland: A purchases from the house of B gardens and wasteland (kišubbû). One piece of land borders on the Bānītu Canal and on the dam (makallû) of the hanšû-land of C1 as well as on the Piti Canal. A second piece of land borders on the royal road (harrān šarri), the Haṭiṭu Canal beneath (šupālu) Hursag-kalamma and the wide street next to the house of C2. 8 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-eṭēru//Miṣirāya; B = Nūr-Sîn; C1 = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Bibēa; C2 = Iddin-Nergal/Bā’iru; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Balāssu/Maštuk
Bibliography: Mentioned in Gurney 1982: 128 fn. 2 and in Peat 1983: 127 no. 22 (with reference to McEwan).
Title: Ash. 1924.942
MLC 1783

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A [x] mina of silver. In the first instance, the debt is free of interest (hubuttūtu). If a repayment by B stays out, the debt will bear a yearly interest of [x] shekel. The intermediate period is not preserved (or not specified). The witness list is not preserved.
 
A = Bēl-ibni//Etellu; B = […]//Arrabtu
Title: VAT 17912

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: The two brothers B1 and B2 as well as B3 owe to (the temples of) Ištar and Nanāya 10 minas of silver. If they fail to pay within due time, the debt will bear an (monthly) interest of 1 shekel per mina (20% p.a.). Guarantee clause. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
B1 = Zabīdāya/Tappûa; B2 = Iddin-Nabû/Tappûa; B3 = Bēl-ahu-iddin/Bēl-upahhir; Scribe = Eanna-šadûnu/Marduk-nāṣir
Title: YBC 4121

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2 minas of silver during the fourth year of "locking of the gate" (edel bābi). The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of a prebend (unspecified) during the first 6 days of the month Ṭebēt (IX) and the entire assets (mimmûšu ša āli u ṣēri) of B. It is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). 5 witnesses (another son of Kunāya) and the scribe.
 
A = Ibnāya/Kunāya; B = Marduk-nāṣir/Bēl-ahu-iddin; Scribe = Nidintu/Šumāya
Bibliography: Duplicate IM 65090: edited in Hunger, BaM 5, no. 22.
Title: IM 65088

Paraphrase:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases wasteland (kišubbû) for 50 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 1 shekel of silver, from B. The sold land is located in the district of the Great Gate (erṣet bābi rabî) inside of Uruk. Its upper side (in the south) borders on the house of C1 and its upper front (in the east) on the house(s) of C2 and C3. Its lower side (in the north) and its lower front (in the west) border on the houses of C4 . The lower front also borders a narrow street (sūqu qatnu). The plot covers an area of 33 x 43 cubits (16.5 x 21.5 m). 5 witnesses (including Zabidāya, father of the scribe, and Iddin-Nabû both from the Sîn-leqe-unninnī family) and the scribe. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Naˀid-Marduk). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Rēmūtu/Barbaru; C1 = Balāssu/Marduk-ēṭir; C2 = Balāṭu/ˀAdu; C3 = Iqišāya/Nabû-ahhē-šullim; C4 = Ahu-atâ/Nūrea; Scribe = Apkallu/Zabidāya//Sîn-leqe-unninnī
Title: IM 65075

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A ½ mina of silver. The debt is free of interest (hubuttūtu) for half a year, that is, until the end of the month Kislīm (IX). If B fails to pay by then, the debt will bear a yearly interest of 9 shekels per mina (15% p.a.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B = Nabû-šumu-iddin//Nūr-Sîn; Scribe = Līdānu//Balīhu
Title: VAT 17897

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a half share (ahu) of a date garden (kirî gišimmari) for 5 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 10 shekels of silver, from B. The sold garden is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Ninurta Temple inside of Uruk and actually borders on the Ninurta Temple. No other information about location and seize of the garden is given in the record. The other half of the said garden is already owned by the buyer (BM118972). The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-ušabši) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-iqīša). 17 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Kudurru; Scribe = Balāṭu/Bēl-lēˀi
Bibliography: IM 57079: Figulla, UET 4 15 (copy); San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 11 (transliteration, translation).
Title: IM 57079
Other markings Description: IM 57079: on the left, upper and lower edges; IM 118966: on all four edges

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house in Uruk: A purchases a ruined house (bītu abtu) for 1 ½ minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The sold house is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Market Gate (bāb mahīri) inside Uruk. Its upper and lower side (in the north and south) as well as upper front (in the west) border on the houses of C1, C2 and C3. Its lower front (in the east) borders on the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the god and the king. It measures 55 x 30 cubits (27.5 x 15 m). The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Ina-ṭēši-ēṭir) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-nāṣir). 15 witnesses (including Bēl-ēreš//Ahu-ušabši) and the scribe, also identified as the writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir//Nabû-zēru-iddin; C1 = Ibnāya//Ahu-ušabši; C2 = Nabû-ušēzib//Dāmiru; C3 = Nanāya-īpuš//Pirˀu; Scribe = Ibnāya//Dummuqāya
Title: BM 118964
YBC 11319
Place of issue Remark: uru.šá-ṣur-d.IM, cited by Walker and Kramer, Iraq 44: 75

Paraphrase:
Broken administrative document recording the expenses of different kinds of metal; with A and B involved.
 
A = […]; B = Ištar-zēru-ibni (or Nabû-zēru-ibni, Bēl-zēru-ibni), title lost
Bibliography: Mentioned in Frame and Waerzeggers 2011,145 (in connection with BM 113926, BM 113928-BM 113929).
Title: HE 609

Paraphrase: Purchase of land in Babylon: A (name lost) purchases 588 square cubits (147 m2) of wasteland (eqlu kišubbû) for [x] amounts of silver from B (name lost). The sold land is located in the district (erṣetu) of the New Town inside of Babylon. Its upper side (in the south) borders on a street (sūqu) and its lower side (in the north) on the house of C (name lost). The bordering areas of the upper front (in the west) and the lower front (in the east) are broken. The side lengths of the sold land are said to be “broken” (hepû). [x] witnesses and the scribe (broken).
Title: MM 804

Paraphrase: Legal record with a heavily destroyed obverse. 8 witnesses and the scribe (name lost) preserved on the lower edge and the reverse.
Title: BM 77689

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a woman: A purchases from B the woman fC for 2/3 mina and 3 shekels of silver. B guarantees (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqiru) of fC. 6 witnesses (including Nabû-balāssu-iqbi, overseer of the wine [mutīr pūti ša muhhi karāni]; Aššur-ālik-pāni, overseer of the fortresses [mutīr pūti ša muhhi biranāti], and Bēl-iddin, overseer of the fowlers of the king [rab ušandê ša šarri]) and the scribe.
 
A = Bibēa; B = Nabû-šumu-iškun; fC = Kidinnītu; Scribe = Marduk-nāṣir
Bibliography: Peiser, KB 4 (1896), 166-167; San Nicolò and Ungnad, NRV no. 108.
Title: VAT 170

Bibliography: Mentioned in Oppenheim, Iraq 17 (1955), 70 fn. 1; McCown and Haines, OIP 78 (1967), 76; Brinkman, Power and Propaganda (1979), 248 fn. 116.
Title: IM 57901

Paraphrase:
Loan of reed: 30 talents of reed belonging to Šamaš are at the disposal (ina pāni) of B1 and B2. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
B1 = Šamaš-ēpuš; B2 = Bēl-ēpuš; Scribe = Kidinnu//Nappahu
Bibliography: KB 4: 174-75 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Nielsen 2011: passim.
Title: BM 92718

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A [x] minas of silver without interest (qaqqadu). Beginning with the present day, the debt will bear a monthly interest of ½ shekel of silver (10% p.a.). 4 witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir uˀilti).
 
A = Nusku-mašrû-ilāni//Enlil-īpuš; B = Kināya//Ninurta-nāṣir; Scribe = Ninurta-aplu-ibni//Šamaš-iddin
Title: HS 480

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 8 shekels of silver. Beginning with the 7th of Arahsamna (VIII), the debt will bear an interest of 10 shekels per mina (16.66% p.a.). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šumāya; B = Nabû-erība; Scribe = Bēl-useppi//Arad-bīt-Nergal
Bibliography: San Nicolò and Ungnad, NRV no. 163 (translation, notes). Mentioned in van Driel, ZA 79, 113.
Title: VAT 527

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A [x] minas and 43 shekels of silver without interest (qaqqadu). Beginning with the following month, that is, Tašrīt (VII), the debt will bear an interest of 1/5 shekel of silver per shekel (20% p.a.). The share of the prebend (isqu) of B is placed as a pledge. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ninurta-mudammiq/Kudurru; B = Nabû-ahhē-erība/Balāssu; Scribe = Nabû-mukīn-apli
Bibliography: Moore, NBBAD (1935), no. 15 (transliteration, translation); San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 66 (transliteration, translation).
Title: AO 7859

Paraphrase:
Broken dialogue document about a loan of silver: This document deals with ½ mina and 5 shekels of silver belonging to A which are at the disposal of (ina pāni) B1 and then of his brother B2. A approaches B1 because of this issue (broken passage). 5(+) witnesses and the scribe, also described as writer of the promissory note (šāṭir u’ilti).
 
A = Zākiru; B1 = Nabû-useppi; B2 = Nabû-nāṣir; Scribe = Ea-ṣīr-ilāni/Ea-ibni
Title: UM 52-30-18

Paraphrase:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases wasteland (kišubbû) for 7 shekels of silver from B. The sold land is located in the district of Kiš, in Egišhurbisukudsukud, and borders on the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of Bēlet Kiš as well as on the properties of C1, C2 and another property of the buyer. The land covers an area of 637 square cubits (159.25 m2). 4 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.

A = Nabû-ahu-iddin//Isinnāya; B = Nergal-īpuš//Mahhû; C1 = […]-zēri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; C2 = Hulapia//Gahal; Scribe = Esagil-šumu-ibni//Pahhāru
Title: Ash. 1929.22

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A purchases from the brothers B1 and B2 arable land (zēru) for 11 ½ shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu). The land is located along the marsh (raqqatu) of Aṣūnu in the meadowland (ugāru) of Dilbat and forms part of the hanšû-land of C. Its upper side borders on (the property of) the buyer and the lower side on (the property of) D. The upper front borders on the irrigation district (tamirtu) of Nagū and the lower front on the drain channel (ārittu) of the property of the diviner (bīt bārî). The purchased land covers an area of 0;2.5 kor (7,650 m2). 5 witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of the two sellers.
 
A = Lâbâši/Nādinu; B1 = Nabû-kāṣir/Bēl-upahhir; B2 = Uraš-nāṣir/Bēl-upahhir; C = Iqbi-Uraš/Kidinnu//Rē’i-alpi (oxherd); D = Uraš-ušallim/Nabû-erība; Scribe = Nabû-nādin-ahu//Šangû-Dilbat
Bibliography: BR 8/7, 22 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Nielsen passim.
Title: MLC 1739

Paraphrase:
Loan of barley: B owes A 2 kor (360 l) of barley which he will deliver in the month Simān (III) of the following year (Ššu 15). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Tuklatu; B = Aplāya//Damqa; Scribe = Bēl-usātu//Ša-nāšišu
Title: VAT 17911

Paraphrase: Examination of small livestock: 217 small livestock animals, under the responsibility of the shepherd […]-ahu-[…] (name broken), are counted.
Title: YBC 11299

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B1, B2 and B3 owe A ½ mina of silver. The debt will bear an (monthly) interest of 3/4 shekel (15% p.a.). B1, B2 and B3 guarantee (pūtu našû) for each other. The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Kanisurra for 16 days. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Erēšu/Nabû-bēlani; B1= Kabtāya; B2 = Dumqāya; B3 = Nabû-zēru-ušabši; Scribe = Nidintu/Šumāya
Bibliography: Duplicate W.20032,6: edited in Hunger, BaM 5, no. 20.
Title: IM 65073

Paraphrase: This is a heavily broken legal text with only the witness list preserved which mainly includes descendants of the Lēˀêa family.
Title: VAT 17907

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 ½ minas of silver. The debt will bear a yearly interest of 12 shekels per mina (20% p.a.). 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim; B = Silim-Bēl// Lēˀêa; Scribe = […]//[…]baša
Title: VAT 17895

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house in Uruk: A purchases a built house (bītu epšu) for 10 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The sold house is located in the Eanna district (erṣet Eanna) inside of Uruk. Its upper side (in the west) borders on the house of C1 and its lower side (in the east) on the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the god and the king. Its upper front (in the north) borders on the house of C2 and its lower front (in the south) on a blind alley (biriti lā aṣîti). It measures 57 x 32 cubits (28.5 x 16 m). The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-ušabši) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-iqīša). 10 witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller. This document is a near duplicate of BM118967.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B = Mukīn-zēri/Ahhēšāya; C1 = Nanāya-uṣalli/Zākiru; C2 = Nabû-bēl-ilī/Bēl-idūa; Scribe = Mukīn-zēri/Šākin-šumi
Bibliography: TBER, pls. 33-34 (copy); TEBR 77 (edition, study). Duplicate AO 10318: edited as TCL 12, 10; NBBAD 10 (transliteration, translation).
Title: AO 10347
Other markings Description: on its top, left and right edges

Paraphrase:
Label of a delivery of a commodity: A commodity (perhaps wool) from fB is under the administrative authority of (ša qātē) A.
 
A = Bau-alsi-ki-abluṭ; fB = fIlitti
Title: IM 75887

Paraphrase: Probably a grant of people: It is said that it is not allowed to lead the granted people out of Eanna. Curses. The grant took place before Nabû-ušabši, governor of Uruk (šākin ṭēmi), Aššur-bēl-uṣur, royal resident (qīpu) of Eanna as well as Nabû-udammiq/Nabû-ušallim, rab širki, and Nabû-ušēzib, measurer (mandidu). The remainder of the tablet is broken.
Title: HE 469

Paraphrase:
Sale of cups: B sold 2 cups (1 šulpu cup and a bronze cup) for the exact price (šīm hariṣ) of 12? ½ shekels of silver to A. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Kudurranu; B = Bēlšunu//Siatu; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iddin/Ninurta-ušallim
Title: BM 29505

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: fB owes A 2 minas of silver. The debt bears an interest of [x] shekel of silver per mina. 5 witnesses (including Kudurru of the Balīhu family and Raši-ili, brother of the female debtor) and the scribe.
 
A = Nādin-ahi//Balīhu; fB = fMaqartu; Scribe = Šeza/Šangû-Šamaš
Bibliography: Langdon, JRAS 2: 323 (copy by Johns). Mentioned in Oppert, RA 1/1: 3; Nielsen 2011 passim.
Title: BM 49164

Paraphrase:
Purchase of individuals: A purchases from B1 and B2 the individuals C1, fC2 and […] for [x] shekels of silver. The sellers guarantee (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqiru) of the sold individuals. 9 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-šumu-ibni; B1 = Mardukāya; B2 = Murānu; C1 = Bēl-ibni; fC2 = Sipparītu; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-uṣur
Bibliography: San Nicolò and  Ungnad, NRV no. 107 (translation, notes).
Title: VAT 4919

Bibliography: Mentioned in Oppenheim, Iraq 17 (1955), 70; Brinkman, Studies Oppenheim p. 26 fn. 146 and OrNS 34 (1965), 243 fn. 9; McCown and Haines, OIP 78 (1967), 76.
Title: IM 57904

Paraphrase:
Settlement of a dispute concerning land: A starts a lawsuit (dīnu gerû) against B concerning the dimensions of the field of Bīt-Ibuni before C. According to A this field does not reach from Dukkuindu to the lowland (ušallu) of the Gubbatu Canal. After it has been decided that both have to go to the ordeal (huršānu), B brings and hands over (našû-nadānu) ½ mina and 3 shekels of silver to A. A voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) gives a sealed tablet to B in which he promises not to return to this issue and litigate against him again. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ša-Nabû-šû; B = Munnabittu; C = Bēl-lē’i, governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Babylon; Scribe = Balāssu//Bēl-ēṭir
Title: BM 92999

Paraphrase:
Summary tablet dealing with 7 cases of silver owed to Rēmūt-Gula under the condition that the debt bears interest of 1/5 shekel of silver per 1 shekel (20% p.a.):
 
In case (a) B1 and B2 owe A 1 mina of silver. They mutually guarantee (pūtu našû) for the repayment of the debt. The one who is available, will pay the debt sum in full (šalāmu D). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
B1 = Šullum//Enlilia; B2 = Aplāya//Ninurta-nāṣir; Scribe = Ninurta-zākir-šumi//Ahu-lūmur; (24th of Ulūl (VI), Sîn-šarru-iškun 2)
 
In case (b) B owes A 1 mina of silver to be paid back on the first of Tašrīt (VII). (Alternatively, this is just the date when the legal transaction has been concluded.) 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
B = […]//Nabû-ēreš; Scribe = Ninurta-ēṭir//Kudurru; (Aššur-etel-ilāni 3 or year of accession to the throne of Sîn-šarru-iškun)
 
In case (c) B owes A [x] amounts of silver. Further details are broken. 4 witnesses and the scribe. In additional clause seems to say that B has to pay interest (ṣibtu) for two years.
 
B = […]//Dummuqu; Scribe = […]//Kalum; (Aššur-etel-ilāni 3)
 
In case (d) B1, B2 and B3 owe A [x] amounts of silver. They mutually guarantee (pūtu našû) for the repayment of the debt. The one who is available, will pay the debt sum in full (šalāmu D). 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
B1 = […]//Bammāya; B2 = Tēšî-ēṭir//Ninurta-iddin; B3 = […]//[…]-šumu-ēreš; Scribe = Ninurta-ahhē-iddin//[…]; (broken, Sîn-šarru-iškun 2)
 
In case (e) B owes A [x] amounts of silver. No interest (ṣibtu) has to be paid. He will pay the debt in full (šalāmu D) on […]. Neither the witnesses nor the scribe are preserved. Possibly case (e) is not to be separated from (f).
 
B = […]-uballiṭ//Bēl-usāti; (Dûzu, Sîn-šarru-iškun 2)
 
In case (f) B1 and fB2 owe A [x] amounts of silver. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
B1= Bēl-ibni; fB2 = fŠuzianna-rīšat, daughter of B1; Scribe =  Kudurru//Ninurta-erība; (10th Šabāṭ, Sîn-šarru-iškun 2)
 
In case (g) fB owes A 1 shekel of silver. She will give it back without interest (ṣibtu), at the opening of the gate (ina petî bābi). 3 witnesses.
 
fB = fAhāt-ēreš/Aplāya
Title: HS 479

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 16 shekels of silver. In case B brings along and gives C (abāku-nadānu) to A at the end of the current month, no interest will be charged and B will be freed from his debts. If he fails to do so, the debt amount will increase by 1 ¼ shekels of silver. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Zēru-ukīn//Sîn-šadûnu; B = Nabû-ušallim/Rēmūtu; C = Nabû-gāmil; Scribe = Nabû-ēṭir//Sîn-šadûnu
Bibliography: Peiser, KB 4 (1896), 168–71 (transliteration, translation); San Nicolò, NRV, no. 162 (translation, notes); San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 86 (transliteration, translation).
Title: VAT 82

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A purchases from B 2 fields of hanšû-land and 1 field of ešertu-land, which belong to C, for the price of 2 minas silver. So far A only paid 1 mina of silver; as soon as the outstanding amount of another 1 mina of silver is paid by A, a sealed record will be drawn up. The details about the fields are as follow: One hanšû-land is located in the irrigation district (tamirtu) of Mahû and at the entrance of the irrigation district of Lītamu. It reaches from the bank (kišādu) of the Euphrates to the estate of D. The other hanšû-land is located on the Kiš Canal (Nāru Kiš). The land covers an area of in total 2,100 square cubits (525 m2). The transaction takes place in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) of 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-lēˀi-kulatti//Saggilāya, šākin ṭēmi ša Bābili (governor of Babylon); B = Bēl-ušallim//Ir’anni; C = Bēl-ēpuš//Asû; D = Kaṣṣir; Scribe = Ṭāb-ašābi-Marduk//Ir’anni
Title: AO 4605

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: 12 shekels of silver belonging to A are at the disposal of (ina pāni) B1 and B2. The debtors mutually guarantee for the payment of the debt. The debt will bear an (monthly) interest of 1.5 shekels per mina (30% p.a.). 4 witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the promissory note (šāṭir uˀilti).
 
A = Damqia; B1 = Šalammu; B2 = Šarēdu; Scribe = Sîn-nādin-šumi/Šadûnu
Title: IM 57119

Paraphrase:
Agreement about the payment of silver: B owes A 1/3 shekel of silver of expenses (nishu). Beginning with the present day, B will pay (eṭēru) where A produces (kalāmu D) C. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iškun; B = Nabû-bēl-ilāni; C = Aqara; Scribe = Šamaš-ušēzib
Bibliography: BR 8/7, 56 (transliteration, translation); Delaunay 1977, Part II, 4 (transliteration, translation, comment). The same tablet (or a duplicat) in Moldenke 1893: 66-67, no. 4 (printed, cuneiform copy, transliteration, translation). Mentioned in van Driel, ZA 79: 113; Nielsen 2011 passim.
Title: MLC 409

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A purchases wasteland (kišubbû) for [x] minas of white silver (kaspu peṣû), together with an additional payment (atru) of ½ shekel of silver, from B. The sold land is located in the district (erṣetu) of Babylon inside of Babylon. Its upper side (in the north) borders on he house of C1 and its lower side (in the south) on the narrow street (sūqu qatnu). Its upper front (in the east) borders on the house of C2 and its lower front (in the west) on the house of C3. Like A, also C1 and C2 belong to the family of Ea-qayala-išemme. The size (given in reeds) of the plot is not preserved. No cardinal directions are given in the record. 2 witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B.
 
A = Someone from the Ea-qayala-išemme family; B = Bēl-ēreš//Ararru; C1 = Šarrāni//Ea-qayala-išemme; C2 = Ahu-iddin//Ea-qayala-išemme; C3 = Šarēdu//Luštamar-Adad; Scribe = Munnabittu//Eppēš-ilī
Title: VAT 17910

Paraphrase: Examination of small livestock: 353 small livestock animals, under the responsibility of the shepherd […] (name lost), are counted.
Title: YBC 11274

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2 ½ minas of silver which under the responsibility of (ina qātē) C is guarantee (pūtu našû). The debt will bear an interest of 10 shekels per mina (16.66% p.a.). The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of a prebend (details broken or unspecified) before Nanāya for x day(s) and of the entire assets (mimmûšu ša āli u ṣēri) of B. 4 witnesses (including two sons of Nabû-ušallim) and the scribe.
 
A = Kalūmu/Nabû-ēṭir; B = Marduk-nāṣir/Bēl-ahu-iddin; C = Nabû-šumu-ušabši; Scribe = Marduk-erība/Šumāya
Title: IM 65072

Paraphrase: This is a heavily broken dialogue document about a surety with one partner being someone from the Lēˀêa family. Also Bēl-ušallim is mentioned.
Title: VAT 17906

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina of silver. The debt will bear a yearly interest of 8 shekels per mina (13.3% p.a.). 2 witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the promissory note (šāṭir uˀilti).
 
A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B = Ša-pî-Bēl//Bēl-[…]; Scribe = Šidlāya//Nanāya
Title: VAT 17887

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house in Uruk: A purchases a built house (bītu epšu) for 10 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The sold house is located in the Eanna district (erṣet Eanna) inside of Uruk. Its upper side (in the west) borders on the house of C1 and its lower side (in the east) on the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the god and the king. Its upper front (in the north) borders on the house of C2 and its lower front (in the south) on a blind alley (biriti lā aṣîti). It measures 57 x 32 cubits (28.5 x 16 m). The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-ušabši) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Nabû-iqīša). 11 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller. This document is a near duplicate of AO10347.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B = Mukīn-zēri/Ahhēšāya; C1 = Nanāya-uṣalli/Zākiru; C2 = Nabû-bēl-ilī/Bēl-udūa; Scribe = Mukīn-zēri/Šākin-šumi
Title: BM 118967

Paraphrase: Land grant of Sîn-šarru-uṣur, governor of Ur, to the Ištar Temple (Eanna): Sîn-šarru-uṣur, governor of Ur, grants land to Ištar and Nanāya for the life of Šamaš-šumu-ukīn, king of Babylon. The granted land reaches from Sippar to Sūrānu.
Bibliography: Mentioned in Durand, RA 75: 181-82 (HE 144 instead of HE 114). Scheil, RT 36. Duplicate AO 6793: TCL 12, 13 (copy) and NBBAD 13 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Durand, RA 75: 181-82.
Title: HE 144

Paraphrase:
Lease contract for six years within one family clan: B rents for cultivation (ana errēši ṣabātu) shares (zittu) of land of A1 and A2 for six years. The leased land forms part of the hanšû-land of C. It is located in the irrigation district (tamirtu) Bāb-surri and reaches from the Road of Gula as far as si-gu-ˀ (= hapax, topographical designation). B gives one third of the harvest (to the two lessors). 2 witnesses and the scribe of the promissory note (ṭupšarru ša uˀilti).

A1 = Nabû-ušēzib/Banê-ša-ilia; A2 = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Banê-ša-ilia; B = Šamaš-nāṣir/Banê-ša-ilia; C = Šumāya/Banê-ša-ilia; Scribe = Nabû-iddin-ahi/Banê-ša-ilia
Title: BM 27854

Paraphrase: Legal record concerning the payment of a copper amount for silver: The governor (šākin māti) gives 1 talent and 53 minas of copper, which is equivalent to 17 shekels of silver, to the Šamaš Temple. The transaction takes place in the presence of (ina mahar) 2 witnesses. Compare with BM82563.
Bibliography: Langdon, JRAS 2: 323 (copy by Johns). Duplicate BM 49173: edited in Oppert, RA 1/1, 7.
Title: BM 49172
Place of issue Remark: The place is not preserved in BM 49172, but the duplicate BM 49173.

Bibliography: Mentioned by Oppenheim, Iraq 17 (1955), 86 fn. 52; McCown and Haines, OIP 78 (1967), 76.
Title: IM 57860

Paraphrase: Heavily broken legal record.
Title: HS 724

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A ½ mina of silver. Beginning with the following month, that is, Arahsamna (VIII), the debt will bear a yearly interest of 5 shekels (8.33% p.a.). 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A = Šumāya; B = Bēl-uballiṭ; Scribe = Bēl-ēṭir//Šangû-Ea
Bibliography: San Nicolò and Ungnad, NRV no. 161 (translation, notes). Mentioned in van Driel, ZA 79, 113.
Title: VAT 528

Paraphrase:
Exchange of houses: In this document of exchange (šupêltu) A and B mutually agree upon and carry out the exchange of their houses. In exchange of his house A receives from B a house together with a field and 50 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu). The house of A is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Gate of IGI.BI.NIBRU.KI.A.ŠÈ and borders on the property of C. It measures 40 x 30 cubits (20 x 15 m). The house of B is located in the district of the Royal Gate and borders on a property already owned by A. It measures 15 x 12 cubits (7.5 x 6 m). The field (eqlu) of B is located in the city Madummē and borders on the canal close to Ur (harru ina ahi Ur) and on (the property of) the ancestor of B? (Nergal-nāṣir). His front measures 90 cubits (45 m). The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šakkanakku) of Ur (Sîn-balāssu-iqbi). 6 witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi).
 
A = Sîn-bēl-kullati//Usātu; B = Balāssu//Nergal-nāṣir; C = Sîn-nādin-ahi/Sîn-ṭēm-ilāni; Scribe = Kudurru/Nabû-ahhē-iddin
Title: IM 57093

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B1 and B2 owe A 10 shekels of silver. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1/4 shekel (5% p.a.). B1 and B2 mutually guarantee for the repayment of the debt. Witnesses (including Indēšu from the town Mandera) and the scribe.

A = Ahu-iddin; B1 = Nabû-nāṣir; B2 = Kudurru; Scribe = Bēl-īpuš
Bibliography: Mentioned in Moorey 1978: 94 and in Gurney 1982: 128 fn. 2.
Title: Ash. 1930.366a

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 12 ½ shekels of silver without interest (qaqqadu). The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel per mina (20% p.a.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-bēl-ahhēšu; B = Šumāya//Nappāhu
Bibliography: Scheil, RT 24: 28-29, 64 (partial transliteration); Delaporte, ZA 19: 386-88 (copy, transliteration, translation). Mentioned in van Driel, ZA 79: 113; Nielsen 2011 passim.
Title: MLC 1228

Paraphrase: Change of ownership: This is a heavily broken legal document recording change of ownership between Bēl-ušallim/Šumāya and another man.
Title: VAT 17909

Paraphrase: Examination of small livestock: 246 small livestock animals, under the responsibility of the shepherd Marduk/Nabû-ušēzib, are counted.
Title: NCBT 228

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document concerning the returning of a share: B1 approaches A because of the share of a prebend (isqu) of B2 which has been received by A. A grants the request and hands over 6 shekels of silver to B1. 4 witnesses and the scribe. The transaction takes place in the 5th year of "locking of the gate" (edel bābi).
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B1 = Ibnāya/Bulluṭu; B2 = Rāši-ili/Bulluṭu; Scribe = Kīnāya/Šumāya
Title: W. 20032,29

Paraphrase: This is a heavily broken loan of silver without interest (qaqqadu) with Bēl-ušallim as creditor.
Title: VAT 17905

Paraphrase:
