Loan of silver: B owes to A 1 mina of silver. The debt will bear a yearly interest of 9 shekels per mina (15% p.a.). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B = Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṭābihu; Scribe = Lâbâši-Marduk//Bēl-eṭlu-dannu
Title: VAT 17888

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a date garden (kirî gišimmari) for 3 minas and 50 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 7 shekels of silver, from B1. The sold garden is the (inheritance) share (zittu) the seller divided (zâzu) with his uncle B2. It is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Ninurta Temple inside of Uruk. Its upper side borders on (the property of) the seller’s grandfather B3 and its upper front on (the property of) the seller’s uncle B2. Its lower side borders on the Ninurta Temple and its lower front on the street (sūqu). Neither cardinal directions nor measures are given for the sides of the plot. 11 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B1 = Ahhēšāya/Hašdia/Šangû-Ninurta; B2 = Zibāya/Ērešu; B3 = Ērešu//Šangû-Ninurta; Scribe = Šulāya/Ibnāya
Title: BM 118968
FLP 1833
Other markings Description: originally presumably nailimpressions, but not preserved

Paraphrase:
Two fragments of a purchase of real estate: Newly cleared land (taptû), which is located on the bank (kišādu) of Bānītu Canal (Nār-Bānīti) in Babylon, is sold. Apparently it borders on property of C1, C2, C3 and C4. Instead of seal impressions (kunukku), fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of the sellers.
 
B1 = Kabtia; B2 = Nāˀid-[…]; B3 = […]-Ea; C1 = Bēl-ēreš; C2 = […]-Sîn//Arad-Bēl; C3 = Nabû-[…], herdsman of horses (rēˀî imēri); C4 = […]-Bēl
Title: A 1652
PTS 2005

Paraphrase:
Transfer of property: A voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) transfers (dagālu Š) a house and a garden, located at the Gate of Bīt-hašu, for 2/3 to his mother-in-law fB1 as well as fB2 and for 1/3 to his wife fB3. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Borsippa (Nabû-zēru-līšir//Arkāt-ilāni-damqāti) and the bishop (šatammu) of Ezida (Nabû-zēr-Bābili-ukīn//[…]). 6 witnesses and the scribe, also identified as writer of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki). According to an additional clause, fB1 will take the interest (ṣibtu) in case fB2 refuses to be in the service (našpartu alāku) with her. In case fB1 dies, the 2/3 of the house and the field will be handed over to fB2.
 
A = Ša-Nabû-šū//Barīhi; fB1 = Kupītu, mother of fB2; fB2 = Banāt-Esaggil; fB3 = Arabua, wife of A; Scribe = Šamaš-iddin//Ilia
Title: BM 26533

Paraphrase:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases purchases wasteland (eqlu kišubbû) for [x] amounts of silver from B. The sold land is located in the Kullaba district (erṣetu) inside of Babylon. Its upper side (in the north) borders on the house of C1 and its lower side (in the south) borders on the house of the buyer A. Its upper front (in the west) borders on a street (sūqu) (details broken) and its lower front (in the east) on the house of C2. The sold land measures 21 cubits (10.5 m) x 14 cubits (7 m), comprising an area of 294 square cubits (73.5 m2). 5(+) witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.

A = Aplāya//Irˀanni; B = Bēl-ibni//[…]; C1 = Dummuqu/Nabû-ēreš//[…]
C2= […]//Bēl-pihāti; Scribe = […]//Sîn-tabni
Bibliography: BR 8/7, 23 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Nielsen 2011: 25, fn. 23.
Title: BM 55454
Place of issue Remark: [-], but can be assigned to Babylon because of its content

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave girl (during a period of hardship): The siblings B1 and fB2 sell their small woman (sinništu ṣahirtu) fC to A1 and A2 for the exact price (šīm hariṣ) of 11 shekels of silver. B1 and fB2 guarantee (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) or claimants (pāqirānu) of fC. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Iddin-Nergal; A2 = Arad-Gula; B1 = Šamaš-iqīša/Marduk, brother of fB2; fB2 = Bau-asīti/Marduk, sister of B1; fC = Kubbeia
Bibliography: Mentioned by McCown and Haines, OIP 78 (1967), 76.
Title: IM 57922

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: The farmer B owes the Šamaš Temple 3 shekels of silver. B shall deliver according to the rural purchase price (mahīri ša ṣēri) in Addar (XII) in the town Galhē. If he fails to do so, the debt will bear an interest of 1;1 kor (216 l) per 3 kor (540 l) of barley belonging to the Šamaš Temple. 3 witnesses (Ša-Nabû-šū, village manager of the governor [rab ālāni ša šākin māti]; Šarrukāya, village manager of the new cohort [rab ālāni ša kiṣri ešši]; Marilihiˀ, ša-rēši) and the scribe.
 
B = Kalbāya, ikkaru (farmer); Scribe = Marduk-zēru-ibni, ṭupšarru ša šākin māti (scribe of the governor)
Title: BM 64038

Paraphrase: Heavily broken legal record.
Title: HS 711

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1/2 mina of silver. It is an interest-free loan (hubuttūtu): Within the period of one year (ṭuppi), there will be no interest (hubullu). If he fails to pay within one year, the debt will bear a monthly interest of ½ shekel (10% p.a.) from Tašrīt (VII) of Šamaš-šumu-ukin 10th year on. 7 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šumāya; B = Tukultu; Scribe = Balāṭu//Ahhēˀu
Bibliography: Peiser, KB 4 (1896), 166–67 (transliteration, translation); San Nicolò and Ungnad, NRV no. 160 (translation, notes). Mentioned in van Driel, ZA 79, 113.
Title: VAT 81

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A purchases from B a field planted with trees and grain (zaqpu u pî šulpi) for 3 minas of silver, together with an additional payment (atru) of 10 shekels of silver. The land forms part of the hanšû-land in the neighbourhood of Uruk (Urukāya). Its upper side borders on (the property of) C1 and its lower side on (the property of) C2. Its upper front borders on Rudāya and its lower front on the Royal Canal which is in the centre of Uruk. 3 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-ēreš/Nabû-šumu-iškun; B = Nabê-tagabbi/Yada’; C1 = […]/Bēl-itu’a; C2 = Balāssu/Nabû-ušēzib; Scribe = Balāssu/Marduk
Title: AO 6854

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document concerning the purchase of a girl: A asks B to sell him fD, the young woman (ṣahirtu) belonging to C who is at the disposal of (ina pāni) B. A (in the text B) weighs out and pays (hāṭu-nadānu) the stipulated amount of 1 mina of silver. B (in the text A) guarantees (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqiru). 7 witnesses and the writer of the promissory note (šāṭir uˀilti).
 
A = Šulāya; B = Šūzubu; C = Ilu-bāni; fD = fŠāhitti; Scribe = Nabû-ušēzib/Balāssu-uṣur
Title: IM 57089

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A purchases from B a land for 7 shekels of silver. The land forms part of the hanšû-land of Nabû-lē’i/Amēlāya and is located in the irrigation district (tamirtu) of Ha’hu and borders on the dam (makallû) of the hanšû-land. 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Marduk-ahu-ibni/Amēlāya; B = Bēl-iddin//Eppēš-ilī
Title: Ash. 1932.519

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A purchases arable land (zēru), a garden (kirû) and […] for 3 minas and 10 shekels of pure silver (kaspu elû), together with an additional payment (atru) of 3 shekels of silver, from B. The sold land covers an area of 1;0.4 square kor (15,300 + m2) and is located in the district (pīhatu) of the city of […] of the family of Qīpu. Its upper side borders on the big garden (kirû rabû) of B and its lower side on (the properties of) C1 and C2. Its upper front borders on the river Puhu[…] and its lower front on (the property of) C3. Only traces of the witness list are preserved on the reverse of the tablet. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B.
 
A = Nummuru//Ilūtu-bāni; B = Šarrāni//Qīpu; C1 = Balāssu/Kināya; C2 = Ibnāya//Qīpu; C3 = Šarrāni//Ir’anni
Title: VAT 15897

Paraphrase: Examination of small livestock: 236 small livestock animals, under the responsibility of the shepherd Ahu-ilia/Sîn-liqin, are counted.
Title: NCBT 232

Paraphrase:
Settlement of a dispute concerning the purchase of a prebend: A1 claims his right of priority over a prebend which B has purchased from C and to which A2, the brother of A1, has laid a claim. The bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Gimillu/Nadnāya) and the elders of Eanna, who presided over the process, granted the claim of A1. The settlement takes place during a year of "locking of the gate" (edel bābi).
 
A1 = Nabû-udammiq/Nergal-uballiṭ; A2 = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Nergal-uballiṭ; B = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; C = Nādin/Bēl-ušallim; Scribe = [...]
Title: IM 65087

Paraphrase: Broken loan of silver: Two creditors owe silver to Bēl-ušallim, who is apparently not identical with Bēl-ušallim of the Lēˀêa family. However, the witness list mainly lists offspring of Lēˀêa.
Title: VAT 17902

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes to A1 and A2 [x] minas of silver without interest (qaqqadu). Beginning with Nisān (I) of the following year (Kan 16), the debt bears interest of 11(+?) shekels of silver per year. An orchard (kirû) of B is pledged to A1 and A2. It adjoins the royal canal (nār šarri) and its four sides border on (the properties of) C1, C2, C3 and C4. The remainder of the tablet is not preserved.
 
A1 = Bēl-ahu-iddin/Ubāru; A2 = Ša-Nabû-šū/Nabû-ēṭir; B = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; C1= […]/Lū-maššûˀa; C2 = […]/[…]; C3 = […]/Nādin; C4 = […]/[…]-erība
Title: NBC 8393

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house: A purchases an empty house plot (bītu kišubbû) for 56 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 2 shekels of silver, from B1 and B2. The upper side and the lower side of the land border on the houses of C1 and C2. Its upper front borders on the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the god and the king and its lower front on an orchard already owned by the buyer. The cardinal directions are not preserved. It is a square plot, each side measuring 100 cubits (50 m). The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-ušabši). 9 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of the sellers.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B1 = Nanāya-uballiṭ/Nabû-šumu-iškun; B2 = Aplāya/Dannāya; C1 = Bēlani//Ērešu; C2 = Zākiru, aškāpu (leatherworker); Scribe = [...]/Nabû-ahu-ēreš
Title: BM 118984

Paraphrase: Note about an administrative transaction: Bēlšunu of the Nergal Temple of Udannu is entrusted with different types of items belonging to the temple. The note has been sealed by Nabû-abi-ludari, custodian of the equipment (rēdî udê).
Title: YBC 11546

Paraphrase:
Broken dispute concerning the redemption of a slave: After A redeemed (paṭāru) a slave (amīlūtu) from the hands of (ina qātē) B, B came and took away (abāku) his former slave from A. Consequently A took hold of B and reclaimed the full amount of money he had paid for the slave. The remainder of the main text is broken, while on the lower half of the reverse 3 witnesses and the scribe are preserved.
 
A = Nabû-ēreš; B = Bēl-ibni; Scribe = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//[…]
Title: BM 38239

Paraphrase:
Court decision concerning a slave: In case B comes to Babylon or Borsippa and does not impose a decision with A concerning C1, his slave, D and C2, another slave of B, will come to A. A broken clause determines what will happen in case of the death of B. Instead, he will bring in (nabāku) and give (nadānu) D. Witnesses and scribe.

A = Nabû-ahhē-šullim/Iluta-bani; B = Bēl-iqīša/Munnabitu; C1 = Nabû-ēreš, slave of B; C2 = Bēlu-uballiṭ, slave of B; D = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Arkat-ili-damqa; Scribe = Nabû-mutir-gimil//Rē’î-alpi
Title: BM 82645

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 13 1/12 shekels of silver. Beginning with the month Dûzu (IV), the debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel per mina (20% p.a.). The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of the entire assets (mimmûšu ša āli u ṣēri) of B. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Hašdāya; B = Nabû-rīm-ilī; Scribe = […]/[…]ahhēšu
Title: A 5290

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house: A purchases from B a built house (bītu epšu) for 2 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu). The sold plot measures 588 square cubits (147 m2). 7 witnesses and the scribe, also identified as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi).
 
A = Amēl-Nanāya//Miṣirāya; B = Šākin-šumi//Nabû-ēṭir; C = Nabû-iqīša; Scribe = Nabû-iddin//AŠ-SUR
Title: BM 26528

Paraphrase: Administrative document recording the distribution of cattle: [x] bulls (puhālu), [x] bull calfs (bīru) and [x] (heifer) calfs (arhu ṣehru) – in sum 360 bovine animals – are at the disposal of Šūšāya and Šullumu.
Title: IM (AUWE 11 166)
Place of issue Remark: no place given, but it must be Uruk

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 10 shekels of silver. Beginning with Addar (XI), the debt will bear an interest of 12 shekels per mina (20% p.a.). 4 witnesses and the scribe. An additional witness seems to be mentioned after the date formula.
 
A = Šulāya; B = Aqara; Scribe = Bēl-ušallim
Title: BM 49171

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave girl (during the siege of Nippur when 0,0.1 kor (6 l) of barley costs 1 shekels of silver): B voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) sells his small woman (sinništu ṣahirtu) fC to A1 and A2 for the exact price (šīm hariṣ) of 15 shekels of silver. B guarantees (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) or claimants (pāqirānu) of fC. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Arad-Gula; A2 = Iddin-Nergal; B = Ninurta-ahu-iddin/Šumāya, fC = fAmatsu-aqrat
Bibliography: Mentioned by McCown and Haines, OIP 78 (1967), 76.
Title: IM 57920

Paraphrase:
Loan of barley: B owes A [x] kor of barley. B will pay his debt along with interest (hubullu) from its harvest (ebūru). The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Idduna; B = Nāṣiru; Scribe = Kināya//[…]
Title: HS 593

Paraphrase:
Withdrawal of a business share: A1 removes (nasāhu) his share from the total amount of 1 mina and 1 shekel of silver jointly owned by A1, A2, A3, A4 and A5, presumably the financial basis of a business partnership. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Perˀu; A2 = Šumāya; A3 = Nabû-gāmil; A4 = Bēl-šumu-iškun; A5 = Nādin-Marduk; Scribe = Bēl-ibni//Bēl-eṭēru
Bibliography: San Nicolò and Ungnad, NRV no. 656 (translation, notes). Mentioned in van Driel, ZA 79, 113.
Title: VAT 564

Paraphrase: Transfer of ownership: Pu’uqtu voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) entrusts her property (nikkassu) to her sister (name lost) under the condition that she can dispose on it as long as she lives. In case she gives birth to a son, he will receive it instead. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
Title: AO 10341

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases from B a share of the prebend (isqu) of the brewer (sirāšūtu) in the cella (bīt papāhi) of Ninazu located in the centre in the temple of Egidda for [x] days per year for ½ mina of silver in pieces (šibirtu). The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin) of Ur (Sîn-tabni-uṣur). 7 witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Nergal-uballiṭ//Zēru-iddin; B = Sîn-uballiṭ//Nergal-iddin; Scribe = Sîn-iddin//Sîn-ahu-šubši
Title: UM 52-30-8

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 10 shekels of silver. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1/4 shekel (5% p.a.). The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of the young woman (ṣahirtu) fC. 2 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Bēl-ahhē-erība; B = Aia-ahu/Upāqu; fC = fIna-Esaggil-šimīnni
Title: Ash. 1963.1475

Paraphrase:
Purchase of wasteland in Dilbat: A purchases from B wasteland (kišubbû) for 2 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu). The plot is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Gate of Uraš inside of Dilbat. Its upper side (in the east) borders on another property of the buyer and its lower side (in the west) on the property of C1. Its upper front (in the north) borders on the property of C2 and its lower front (in the south) on the property of C3, son of the buyer. The plot covers an area of 46 square cubits (12.25 m2) and is a passage (mūṣû), a narrow street (sūqu qatnu), with no exit  (lā aṣû). 3 witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller. The field (eqlu) belongs to (pāni dagālu) B.
 
A = Upāqu/Nabû-uṣallu; B = Ša-pî-Nabû/Ibāya; C1 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Nabû-bāni; C2 = Baratirˀu/Kiribtu; C3 = Bēl-rēmanni/Upāqu, son of A; Scribe = Kudurru//Iddin-Papsukkal
Bibliography: BR 8/7, 6 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Nielsen passim.
Title: MLC 488

Paraphrase: Receipt of dyes: Adad-tišmar receives 3 minas of red dye (hurhuratu), 1 mina of alum (gabû) and 10 shekels of scarlet dye (tabarru).
Title: VAT 17908

Paraphrase: Examination of small livestock: 660 small livestock animals, under the responsibility of the shepherd Marduk-nāṣir (Marduk-uṣur)/Ahhēa, are counted.
Title: NCBT 225

Paraphrase:
Settlement of a dispute concerning the purchase of a prebend: A1 and A2 purchased the prebend of the brewer (sirāšūtu) before Bēltia for 5 days, from the 20th to the 25th of [x] month, for 1 mina and 15 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. This prebend, however, has already been purchased by C from D, with E, (if restored correctly) brother of D, being the guarantor (pūtu našû). The dispute will be settled between B and E in Ayyār (II) of the following year in favour of A1 and A2, while B will be charged with interest beginning with Simān (III).  2+ witnesses (and the scribe).
 
A1 = Marduk/Tabnēa; A2 = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Mušēzib-Marduk/Erība; C = Ahhēa/Erība; D = Ammēni-ilī/Nabû-šimanni; E = Bēl-ahhē-iddin; Scribe = […]
Title: IM 65080

Paraphrase: Broken loan of silver with Bēl-ušallim as debtor.
Title: VAT 17901

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a date garden (kirî gišimmari) as well as wasteland (kišubbû) for [x] minas and 7 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû), together with an additional payment (atru) of 1 shekel of silver, from B. The sold plot of land is located in the district (erṣetu) of the New Canal (nāru iššetu) in the meadowland (ugāru) of the district(?) of Uruk (bīt Uruk). Its upper side borders on (the property of) C1 and its lower side on (the property of) C2. Its lower front follows the Iššeti canal as far as (the property of) the neighbours. No cardinal directions for the sides are given in the record. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-kudurrī-uṣur). 6 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B = Šāpiku//Bēlani; C1 = Bēl-zēru//Ahhūtu; C2 = Nabû-ahu-ēreš; Scribe = Ēreši/Šāpiku
Title: NBC 8392

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document concerning a loan of silver: B1 approaches A with the request of a loan of 10 minas of silver to pay (eṭēru) expenses that he incurred (gimru gamāru) on behalf of B2. A grants the request. B2’s cattle pen (tarbaṣu) and orchard (kirû) in Uruk(?) are pledged to A. Without A’s consent the cattle in the pen is not allowed to go beyond a distance of half a double mile (bēru; = 5.4 km) upstream or downstream; an interest clause is set at 1/8 shekel per shekel (12.5% p.a.). 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-šullim//Ilūtu-bāni; B1 = Nabû-ahhē-erība//Gallābu; B2 = Nabû-nādin-šumi//Ṭābia; Scribe = Marduk//Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk
Title: BM 118986

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver in exchange for livestock: 15 men (B1-B15) owe 5 minas of silver to the Šamaš Temple in Sippar. This is the price of 300 sheep and goats which the debtors have to deliver in the month Ulūl (VI). If the men fail to deliver by then, the livestock’s offspring will belong to Šamaš too. On the other hand, if the messenger of Šamaš won’t manage to come on time to pick the livestock up, the livestock’s offspring belongs to the men. 4 witnesses (including Marduk-ušallim, prefect [šaknu] of Ruˀa) and the scribe. Compare with BM49172.

B1 = Ha-[…]/[…]; B2 = Atumānu/Zabia; B3 = Akbāru/Taˀalla; B4 = […]-ēṭir/Ahu-bahdu; B5 = Šumu-ukīn/Aya-nahria; B6 = Zabīdu/Tammeš-idarī; B7 = Šiˀilu/Ahu-ṭāb; B8 = Gabbaˀ-il/Ilu-idāri; B9 = […]-lia/Gugallu; B10 = […]/Biˀ-ummē; B11 = […]/Nabê-rām; B12 = […]/Iddin-Nergal; B13 = […]-lu-rām/Ammānu; B14 = […]/Bīt-Šamaš-rām; B15 = […]/Daˀbanu; Scribe = […]
Title: BM 82563

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a ruined house: A purchases from B a ruined house (bītu abtu) for 1 mina and 12 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 2 shekels of silver. The sold house is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Canal of Urkayītu (Harru-ša-Urkayītu) inside of Uruk. Its upper side (in the north) borders on the narrow street (sūqu qatnu) and its lower side (in the south) on the house of C1. Its upper front (in the west) borders on the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the god and the king and its lower front (in the east) on the house of C2. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the royal resident (qīpu) of Uruk and Eanna (Šamaš-ilūa). 13 witnesses (including Bēl-ušallim and Ṣillāya, two other sons of Bēl-šumu-iškun, and Šumu-iddin, another son of Ša-Nabû-šū) and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Nadna-Marduk/Bēl-šumu-iškun//Eṭēru; B = Ṣillāya/Nazia; C1 = Iqīšāya/Ša-Nabû-šū; C2 = Ahhēa/Bēl-rēmanni; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Zēr-Bābili
Title: A 3658

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a field: A purchases from B 1/6 share of hanšû-land belonging to C for 21 shekels of silver. The sold land is located in the city of Šaṭirtu and its upper front borders on the bank (kišadu) of the Euphrates. It measures 290 square reeds (72.33 m2).  The buyer A already has another share (pūt zitti) of the same land at his disposal. 7 witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Marduk-zēru-ibni//Nūr-Sîn; B = Bēl-iqīša//Egibi; C = Nabû-iqīša; Scribe = Marduk-ušallim//Egibi
Title: BM 114720

Paraphrase: Administrative document recording the distribution of cattle: 15 bulls (puhālu), 451 cows (arhu rabû), 80(+) two-year-old bullocks (alpu šaniu) – the remainder of the enumeration is lost – are at the disposal of someone (details lost).
Title: IM (AUWE 5 41)
Place of issue Remark: no place given, but it must be Uruk

Paraphrase:
Purchase of property including a ruined house: A purchases land, including a passage (mūṣû) and a ruined house (bītu abtu), for 39 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 1 shekel of silver, from B. The sold property is located in the district (erṣetu) of Tuba inside of Babylon.  The first property measures 24 19/24 cubits (c. 12.8 m) x 14 cubits (c. 7 m), comprising an area of 343 square cubits and 2,352 square fingers (c. 81.75 m2). Its upper side (in the west) borders on the house of C1 and its lower side (in the east) on the house of C2. Its upper front (in the north) borders on the house of C3 and its lower front (in the south) on the plot of land within a measured area (libbū eqli). The second property measures 8 cubits (4 m) – upper side, 7 1/6 cubits (c. 3.6 m) – lower side, 5 3/4 cubits (c. 2.9 m) – upper front, and 6 cubits (c. 3 m) – lower front, comprising an area of 42 square cubits 3,360 square fingers (c. 12 m2). Its upper side (in the west) borders on the house(s) of C1 and C4 and its lower side (in the east) on the plot of land within a measured area. Its upper front (in the north) borders on the house of C3 and its lower front (in the south) on the house of C1. The passage (mūṣû) borders on the house of C1. It measures 8 cubits (c. 4 m) x 2.5 cubits (1.25 m). In sum the sold property covers an area of 406 square cubits and 3,360 square fingers (c. 103 m2). 10 witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller. At the time this document was written, the enemy was encamped (nadû Stat.) against Babylon and famine (sunqu) was in the land – on the black market (ina puzri, lit. secretly) the price (mahīru) for 0;0.0.3 kor (3 l) barley was 1 shekel of silver.
 
A = Ubāru//Šumu-libši; B = Kunāya//Adad-šumu-ēreš; C1 = Dummuqu//Rēmūt-Ea; C2 = Bēl-ēṭir//ALAM.KA; C3 = Gilūa//Itinnu; C4 = Lâbâši//Nabûtu; Scribe = Nabû-[…]//[…]
Bibliography: Unger 1931: 303-304, no. 34 (translation); BR 8/7, 20 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Oppenheim, Iraq 17: 76-77 and Nielsen 2011 passim.
Title: BM 33537
Place of issue Remark: [-], but can be assigned to Babylon because of its content

Paraphrase:
Redemption of a boy (during the siege of Nippur when 0,0.1 kor (6 l) of barley costs 1 shekel of silver): A1 and A2 redeem (paṭāru) from fB1 and his mother fB2 C for the exact price (šīm hariṣ) of 12 shekels of silver. fB1 and fB2 guarantee (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) or claimants (pāqirānu) of C. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Arad-Gula; A2 = Iddin-Nergal; fB1 = Nippur-rišāt; fB2 = Bēlit, mother of C; C = Kalba-Bau/Bam[…], from the town Marad
Bibliography: Mentioned by McCown and Haines, OIP 78 (1967), 76.
Title: IM 57921

Paraphrase:
Transfer of individuals to the temple: B voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) gives 4 individuals (amīlūtu)– his female slave fC1 together with her children C2, C3 and fC4 – for 1 mina and 1/3 shekel of silver to the Šamaš Temple (in order to settle his debts). B guarantees (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqiru) of fC1 and her children. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the royal resident (qīpu) of Esaggil (Marduk-rā’im-šarri). 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
B = Dābibī/Arad-Gula; fC1 = Isinnāyati; C2 = Šamaš-nebi-ana-ilāni; C3 = Arad-Bunene; fC4 = Burāšu; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-līšir/Nabû-naˀid/[…]-tabni-uṣur
Title: BM 92997

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house: A purchases a courtyard house (bīt tarbāṣi) and […] for [x] amount of silver from B. The sold land is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Gula Gate inside Nippur. Its upper side (in the north) and its lower side (in the south) border on the houses of C1 and C2. The bordering areas of the upper front and the lower front are not preserved. Its upper front measures 21.5 cubits (10.75 m) and its lower front 25 cubits (12.5 m). Both the upper and the lower front measure 18 cubits (9 m) each. 4+ witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B.
 
A = […]; B = Ninurta-ahu-iddin//[…]; C1 = Šumu-iddin//[…]; C2= […]; Scribe = Ninurta-[…]//dIZI-GÙN-a-a
Title: HS 457

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A ½ mina and 1 shekel of silver. Beginning with the following month, that is, Kislīm (IX), the debt will bear an interest of 1 shekel per mina (20% p.a.). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Iqīša/Bēl-nāṣir; B = […]/Šumāya; Scribe = Kurigalzu/Balāṭu
Bibliography: San Nicolò and Ungnad, NRV no. 165 (translation, notes).
Title: VAT 3146

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house: A purchases from B a house for 1 1/3 mina 3 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 1 KUR.RA garment as well as 22? containers with a capacity measure of 3 seahs (ṣimdu) of barley for the temples. The plot of land is located in Ur; further details about its general location are not preserved. Its upper side (in the south) borders on the property of A and its lower side (in the north) as well as the upper front (in the east) on the properties of C. Its lower front (in the west) borders on a blind alley (biriti lā aṣîti). Its lower side measures 13(+) cubits (6.5 m), its upper front 19 cubits (9.5 m) and its lower front 21 cubits (10.5 m). The length of the upper side is not preserved. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin) of Ur (Ningal-iddin). 9+ witnesses. The text breaks off towards the end of the witness list.
 
A = Damqia/Šūzubu; B = Šumāya/Bēl-iddin//Abi-meram; C = Marduk-nāṣir/Sîn-bēl-zēri; Scribe = […]
Title: IM 57074

Paraphrase: Letter to the governor: Bēl-uballiṭ writes a letter to the (unnamed) governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Kiš, his lord, about something (broken) ever since 40 years. The 7th year Šamaš-šumu-ukīn is mentioned.
Title: Ash. 1924.2344

Paraphrase:
Broken loan of silver: B owes A 1/3 shekels of silver. The debt is concluded along with the obligation of making (labānu) kiln-fired bricks (agurru) under the responsibility (ina qātē) of C. If this obligation is not fulfilled, the debt will bear a monthly interest of ½ shekel of silver (10% p.a.). 2 witnesses and the scribe, described here as writer of the promissory note (šāṭir u’ilti).
 
A = […]//Inurta-[…]; B = Nabû-kī-[…]; C = Nabû-ēreš; Scribe = Nabû-nāṣir//Ninurta-iqīša
Title: MLC 333

Paraphrase: Heavily broken legal record.
Title: NBC 8392A

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document concerning the payment of debts: By order of (ina našparti) C, his son A1, his wife fA2 and his mother fA3 address B about 6 minas of silver without interest (qaqqadu), claim (rašûtu) of D, father of C and grandfather of A1, which is due from (ina muhhi) E who placed gardens (kirû) at the Lagamal Canal (Harru-ša-Lagamal) as a pledge. B shall pay (eṭēru) the debt and release (uššuru) the pledged property (bīt maškani) from the sons of E. He agrees in the repayment (šullumdu). The case is settled. On the day the sealed documents are opened, A1, fA2 and fA3 will give it to B. 9 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Tabnēa/Kudurru/Bēl-ēṭir//Šangû-Dilbat; fA2 = fHiptāya, mother of A1; fA3 = fSinunu, mother of the father of A1; B = Šāpik-zēri/Bammaya//Egibi; C = Kudurru/Bēl-ēṭir//Šangû-Dilbat; D = Bēl-ēṭir//Šangû-Dilbat; E = Lâbâši/Mukīn-zēri//Basia; Scribe = Nabû-nādin-šumi/Šulāya//Basia
Title: YBC 11385

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Nanāya for 5 days, from the 1st to the 5th of Ṭebēt (X), for 1 ½ minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 2 shekels of silver, from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-udammiq). 5 witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Marduk-nāṣir/Bēl-ahu-iddin; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Ahhēa
Title: IM 65078

Paraphrase: This is a heavily broken legal document about a security with Bēl-ušallim involved. An official who seals doors (kānik bābi) is mentioned.
Title: VAT 17893

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a date garden (kirî gišimmari) from B1. The purchase price (which is not preserved) corresponds to the claim (rašûtu) towards B2, the father of the seller, and, hence, is in fact not handed over; instead the garden serves as compensation. The transferred garden is located in the district (erṣetu) of the royal canal (nār šarri) in the meadowland (ugāru) of Uruk. Its upper side borders on (the property of) C1, its lower side on (the property of) C2 and its lower front on hanšû-land. Its upper front, which measures 230 cubits (115 m), follows the royal canal (nār šarri). No cardinal directions are given in the record. 9 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller. The same type of procedure is recorded in BM118977.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/[Kiribtu]; B1 = Ahu-iddin-Marduk/Bēl-ibni; B2 = Bēl-ibni/Šamaš-īpuš; B3 = Ahhēa/Zabdānu; C1= Balāṭu/Nabû-nāṣir; C2 = Nabû-lēˀi/Marduk; Scribe = Nadīnu//Arkât-ilī
Bibliography: Mentioned in Walker and Kramer, Iraq 44 (1982), 75.
Title: BM 118982

Paraphrase:
Transfer of debt with adding security: A’s claim (rāšûtu) to B1 over 2 minas of silver has been transferred to B2, the brother of B1. Beginning with the current day, the debt bears an interest of 2 shekels of silver per month (20% p.a.). According to a fragmentarily preserved clause, the debt is secured by a pledge in terms of the house of B2. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Kunāya//Basia; B1 = Šulāya//Ṭābia; B2 = Nabû-ēṭir//Ṭābia; Scribe = Bēl-ušallim//Irˀanni
Title: FLP 1288
BM 47482
Place of issue Remark: no place, but mentions šākin ṭēmi of Dilbat

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A purchases from B in sum 588 square cubits (147 m2) measured area of a plot of land for 5 minas and 18 shekels of silver and 1 kor (180 l) of barley. 9 witnesses and the scribe (lost).
 
A = Bēl-ēpuš//Zanniea; B = Bēl-iddin//Bēl-aplu-uṣur
Title: BM 78288

Paraphrase: Memorandum dealing with the expenditure of beams: According to this document of expenditure (tēlītu) 1–3 beams (gušūru) are in each case provided for 7 individuals (Šamaš-ahu-iddin, Ilu-iddin, Aplāya, Kudurrānu, Bēl-ušebši, Uqūpu, Nabû-zēru-ibni), the bishop (šatammu) and for the maintenance of the Akītu Temple.
Title: BM 49565

Paraphrase:
Copy of a dialogue document concerning the purchase of gold: A, priest (šangû) of Sippar, gave 1 talent of silver of the Šamaš Temple to B1 and B2 along with the order to acquire gold. B1 and B2 obtained 3 minas and 1 shekel of gold for that talent of silver. From that amount of gold A gave 27 minas and 53 shekels in silver to Esangila and assigned the remainder (rēhu) to the estate of Šamaš by adding it to the silver of Šamaš. In addition, he bought C and his family (qinnu) for 2 ½ minas of silver. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (bēl pihāti) of Esangila (Marduk-šumu-ibni/Arad-Ea) and the šatam bīt unāti  (Marduk-bān-zēri/Esangila). 9 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Bulluṭu//Bunene-ibni, šangû (priest) of Sippar; B1 = Šākin-šumi//Mādidu; B2 = Marduk-erība//Kutimmu; C = Arad-Nanāya, Scribe = Zēria//Kidin-Sîn
Title: BM 114719

Paraphrase:
Partly broken purchase of a ruined house: A purchases from B a ruined house (bītu abtu) for [x] amounts of silver. The sold house is located inside of Uruk (further details broken). On each side it borders on other houses whose owners are not preserved. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Ahhēšāya) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Balāṭu). 7 witnesses (+ an additional witness added at the end of the tablet) and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = […]; B = Ša-Nabû-šū//[…]; Scribe = Nabû-ahu-ušabši//Iddin-Nabû
Title: A 3674

Bibliography: Cocquerillat 1968: 107 (partial transliteration). Mentioned in Nielsen 2011 passim.
Title: NBC 1197
Place of issue Remark: no place given, but it must be Uruk

Paraphrase: Administrative document recording the distribution of cattle: [4]? bulls (puhālu), 116? cows (arhu rabû), 15? two-year-old bullocks (alpu šaniu), 21 heifers (arhu šanīta), 21 bull calfs (bīru) and 26? (heifer) calfs (arhu ṣehru) – in sum 203 bovine animals – are at the disposal of Ša-Nabû-šū/Nabû-ušēzib.
Title: IM (AUWE 5 40)
Place of issue Remark: no place given, but it must be Uruk

Paraphrase:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases 196 square cubits (c. 48.96 m2; for the measuring unit nikkas qanû see comment in San Nicolo 1951: 9) of wasteland (eqlu kišubbû) for [x] amounts of silver from B. The sold land is located in the district (erṣetu) of the New Town inside of Babylon. Its upper side (in the west) borders on the wide street (sūqu rapšu), the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the god and the king, and its lower side (in the east) borders on the house of C. Its upper front (in the north) borders on the house of the buyer A and its lower front (in the south) on the passage (mūṣû) of C. Its upper and lower side each measure 28 cubits (14 m), its upper front 15 cubits (7.5 m) and its lower front 16.5 cubits (8.25 m). 8(+) witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.

A = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir//[…] (forms probably part of the Basia family; see Nielsen 2011: 62, fn. 189); B = Marduk//Egibi; C = Nergal-ēṭir//Basia; Scribe = Marduk-šarrani//Sîn-nāṣir
Bibliography: BR 8/7, 4 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Landsberger 1965: 31; Nielsen 2011 passim.
Title: BM 92712

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document concerning the purchase of a girl during the siege of Nippur in Sîn-šumu-lēšir 3rd year (when 0,0.1 kor (6 l) of barley costs 1 shekel of silver and people were forced to sell their children): fB approaches A and asks to lead away (abāku) and keep alive (bulluṭu) her daughter fC for the exact price (šīm hariṣ) of 6 shekels of silver. A accepts fB’s offer and hands over the money. In case of transgressors (sēhû) or claimants (pāqirānu) of fC, fB has to either replace fC or hand over the revenue for fC. Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Ninurta-uballiṭ/Bēl-usāti; fB = Gugalla; fC = Riˀindu
Bibliography: Mentioned by McCown and Haines, OIP 78 (1967), 76.
Title: IM 57915 (2 NT 297)

Paraphrase: Administrative record dealing with the expense of oil: 10 containers (nēsepu) of oil are given from (lapāni) Nabû-kuzub-ilāni for (the preparation of) dapnû?(-oil) (tab-ni-ti) in the Akītu (festival house).
Title: BM 93006

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document concerning the transfer of land: B approaches A and asks him to give him a half share (zittu) of the royal land allotment (zu’’uztu šarri) belonging to the hanšû-land of C. A agrees and gives B half (ahu) of his date garden (kirî gišimmari) and half of another plot of land (details broken). 8 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Arrabu/Šarrāni; B = Šamaš-erība/Šarrāni; C = Nabû-zēru-ibni; Scribe = Ninurta-nādin-šumi//Kalūmu
Title: HS 576

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A purchases a third share (zittu) of the hanšû-land belonging to C for 2 1/2  shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B1 and B2 (though only B1 acts as an active contractual partner). The sold share of land is located within the share of D and extends from the Borsippa Canal to the dam (kilâtu). It measures 18 square cubits (31.5 m2). The transaction is concluded before (ana mahar) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Borsippa (Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Ilia) and the bishop (šatammu) of Ezida (Nabû-nādin-šumi//Nūr-Papsukkal), also defined as temple-enterer (ērib bīti) of the Nabû Temple. 3 witnesses (including Nabû-damqi, another member of the Iddin-Papsukkal Family) and the scribe, also identified as the writer of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki).
 
A = Nabû-erība//Nappāhu; B1 = Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Iddin-Papsukkal; B2 = Rāši-ili//Iddin-Papsukkal; C = Iddin-ahu//Ilūtu-bāni; D = Nabû-ēreš; Scribe = Nabû-mutīr-gimilli//Râšua
Title: HS 456

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A [x] amount of silver without interest (qaqqadu). Beginning with the current day, the debt bears an interest of 1/12 shekel silver per shekel (8.33% p.a.). The debt is secured by the pledge of the entire assets (mimmû) of B. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Aplāya//[…]; B = […]-mukīn-zēru/[…]; Scribe = Šamaš-ina-eše-ēṭir//Šamaš-iddin
Bibliography: BR 8/7, 64 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Nielsen 2011: 231, fn. 24.
Title: CBS 12812

Paraphrase:
Loan of barley: B owes A [x] kor of barley. He will pay the debt until the end of Dûzu (IV) in the form of silver. Per 0;0.0.18 kor (18 l) of barley B will pay 1 shekel of silver. 3(+) witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = […]; B = Nergal-nāṣir/Kabtia; Scribe = Enlil-kidin//Bēl-erība
Title: AO 4508

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document concerning the purchase of a house: B approaches A and asks him to buy his house so that he is able to maintain (akālu) himself and pay off (šalāmu) his creditors (rāšû). A grants this request and weighs out and pays (hâṭu-nadānu) to B 1 1/3 minas and 3 shekels of silver for the offered house. The sold house is located in the district of … (lost) inside of Babylon. Its upper side borders on a wide alleyway (sulû rabû) and its lower side on (the property of) C1. Its upper front borders on a narrow street (sūqu qatnu) and its lower front on (the property of) C2. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Ur (Nabû-rēši-išši) and the priest (šangû) of Ur (Balāssu). 5 witnesses and the scribe, also identified as the writer of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki).
 
A = Rēmūtu//Dummuqu; B = Ibāya//Balāssu; C1 = Bēl-iddin//Aplāya; C2 = Amēl-Šamaš; Scribe = Nabû-zēru-[…]//[…]-na’id
Title: UM 52-30-6

Paraphrase:
Settlement of a dispute: A litigates against B about land at the Lagamal Canal (Harru-ša-Lagamal) which his father has purchased against silver. B will have to pay 7 shekels of silver. A won’t file another suit against B. Curse formula. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Lâbâši/Basi; B = Lâbâši//Šangû-Dilbat; Scribe = Rēmūt-Nabû/Isināya
Title: Ash. 1924.491

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document with a heavily broken obverse: B approaches A and asks him for something which also involves the sum of 50 shekels of silver. 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A = Kurigalzu; B = Upāqu; Scribe = Kudurru
Title: MLC 332

Paraphrase:
Purchase of fallow land: The temple of Ištar of Uruk and Nanāya purchases three fallow fields for 87 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from the two brothers B1 and B2, sons of B3 who is the actual owner of the field. The sold land is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Šamaš Gate inside Uruk. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the royal resident (qīpu) of Eanna (Šamaš-ilāya) and the scribe of Eanna (Širikti-Marduk/Nabû-ušallim//Hunzu’). 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
B1 = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Zērūtu; B2 = Tabnēa/Zērūtu; B3 = Zērūtu/Šulāya; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Nergal-nāṣir//Mudammiq-Adad
Title: YBC 3955

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Nanāya for 5 days, from the 16th to the 20th of Ṭebēt (X), for 1 2/3 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 2 shekels of silver, from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-udammiq). 4 witnesses  (including Nergal-ibni, son of the governor) and the scribe. The transaction takes place in a year of "locking of the gate" (edel bābi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Naˀid -Marduk/Rāši-ili; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Ahhēa
Title: IM 65077

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A [x] mina of silver without interest (qaqqudu). The details about the debt’s interest are not preserved. Neither is the witness list preserved.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim; B = […]; Scribe = […]
Title: VAT 17892

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a date garden (kirî gišimmari), bearing fruit (iṣṣi bilti), for 5 1/3 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 10 shekels of silver, from the three brothers B1, B2 and B3. The sold garden is located in the Akītu district (erṣet akītu), [in the meadowland (ugāru) of Uruk]. Its upper side borders on (the property of) C1 and its lower side on (the property of) C2. Its upper front follows the canal (harru) of the goddess Nanāya and its lower front borders on a road (harrānu). The upper front and the lower front each measure 330 cubits (165 m). No cardinal directions are given in the record. 21 witnesses and the scribe. The tablet is dated to the year of Aqarâ, provincial governor of Babylon in the reign of Assurbanipal. Fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of sellers.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B1 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Ahhēšāya; B2 = Mukīn-zēri/Ahhēšāya; B3 = Nabû-nāṣir/Ahhēšāya; B4 = Ahhēšāya; C1 = Kudurru/[…]; C2 = Marduk-ēreš//Nabû-[…]; Scribe = Nādinu//Šumu-ukīn
Bibliography: Frame, RA 76 (1982), 157–166 (copy, edition). Mentioned in Frame 1992: 286–287.
Title: BM 118973

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a half share (ahu) of an orchard (kirû) for 2 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 5 shekels of silver, from B who formerly purchased it from C. The sold garden is located along a moat (harīṣu). Its upper side and its lower side border on (the properties of) D1 and D2 respectively. No other specification concerning the location and measures of the garden are given in the record. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Ahhēšāya). 13 witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B = Nabû-ušabši/Nabû-nāṣir; C = Šāpik-zēri/Balāssu, nuāru (musician); D1 = Nabû-ušallim//Nādinu; D2 = Zēru-ukīn//Šāpik-zēri; Scribe = Ammēni-ilī//Bulluṭu
Title: BM 118981

Paraphrase:
Broken label of a delivery of a commodity: A commodity (perhaps wool) from fB is under the administrative authority of (ša qātē) A1 and A2.
 
A1 = Marnalu; A2 = Amurru-mukīn-išdiya; fB = f[…]-sarurat
Title: ND 6220

Paraphrase: Administrative record about the disbursement of sesame: 10;2 kor (1,872 l) of sesame in vessels (ina sūti) are measured out (madādu) on the present day by Nabû-kuzub-ilāni for oil for the temple.
Title: RSM 1889.102

Paraphrase:
Land rental.
A1 rents a field which belongs to his wife fA2 for 5 years to B. The land is planted with trees (zēru zaqpu), located in Litamu, from the bank (kišādu) of the Piqūdu Canal to the (property of) C, and it borders on (the properties of) fD and of E’s sons. The central part of the text is fragmentary: from what is extant, one infers that the renter shall dig a ditch and that he will receive the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). Likely the text included provisions related to irrigation duties. When the text resumes, the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu) is mentioned again: B will receive 5 kor (900 l) of dates per kor of land. As long as he will hoe (dekû) the soil with the plow (epinnu), loosen it (pašaru) and break up the clods(?) (šetirtu), he will receive 4 kor (720 l) of dates as gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). Whoever breaks the contract shall pay 1 mina of silver. Along the years, the renter will finish the entire digging work (herû-ma qatû); he has at his disposal 1 shovel (marru) whose weight is 2 minas and 6 shekels. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; fA2 = fAmat-Bāba/Kalbāya//Nabāya; B = Madānu-iddin; C = Kināya; fD = fInba-Arad-Marduk; E = Nabû-ittannu
Bibliography: reediton: Wunsch 2000, no. 191; Krecher 1970, 284; van Driel, BSA 5 (1990), 231, 239.
Title: BM 30590

Bibliography: To be published by Johannes Hackl.
Title: BM 30737

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave.
A1 and his wife fA2, of their own free will, sell their female slave fC, to B for an agreed purchase price amounting to 1/2 mina and 2 shekels of silver. The sellers guarantee against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person claiming (pāqirānu) that fC is a palace servant (arad ekalli) or a free person (mār banê). They guarantee for each other. Names of 3+ witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-zēru-ukīn/Šulāya//Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk; fA2 = fṬabatu/Uballiṭ-Marduk//[...], wife of A1; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fC = fAna-ālišu
Title: BM 30869

Paraphrase:
Division of shares in a business company and interim account of its assets.
A , his brothers and B divide among them the arable land planted with date palms and cultivated with grain located at the outlet (bābu) of Borsippa canal next to [PN and PN]. A and his brothers will get 1 kor, and B will get 1 kor. The attribution of the shares (zittu ṣabātu) will be decided by casting lots (pūru maqātu, lit. (where) the lot falls”). Also the slaves will be divided in this way: C and fD at the first casting, and E and fF and the second. Certain assets will not be divide but remain in the business account: it concerns the female slave fG , 25 shekels, and the silver needed to purchase 4 slaves from H. The same is true for the following assets: 200 vats filled with first quality (rēštu) and full-strength beer (ṭābu), 20 empty vats, 10 fermenting vats (namzītu) with stands (namharu), 90 kor of dates still at the depot (kalakku),  15 kor of sifted (nahlutu) mustard-seeds, and 14 animals from the flock (ṣēnu) . Excluded from the above (elat) are: still outstanding credits or claims (lit. “promissory notes of the street”, sūqu), and everything that B plans to undertake (hasāsu). In order to avoid any further changes in the above agreement, each of the partners has taken a copy of the present document. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Bēlšunu/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Sîn-imitti; C = Lūṣi-ana-nūri; fD = fLe’’itu; E = Nergal-dānu; fF = fImmirtu; fG = fNinlil-silīm; H = Marduk-šāpik-zēri
Title: BM 30512

Paraphrase:
House rental.
A rents a house located in Borsippa near C’s house to B, at a yearly price of 1/2 mina of stamped silver (ginnu). The renter should caulk (šanû) the roof and repair the wall foundations (asurrû). He should pay for the additional payment (nūptu) in Nisan (I), Dûzu (IV) and Kislim (IX); it is also agreed that half of the silver should be paid at the beginning of the year, and the remainder in the middle. The house is at the renter’s disposal from the 2nd of Ayyār (II) onwards. Names of 3 wiitnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Iddin-Bēl/Šamaš-iddin//Šamaš-bari; C = Bulṭāya
Title: BM 31376

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house.
A purchases from B a house in ruins (abtu) to be demolished and built anew, whose size is 13 sq. r (159,25 m2). The house is located in Hursagkalamma in Kiš, near C1, C2 and C3, by the narrow street (sūqu qatnu). For now, the buyer pays 50 shekels of silver, inclusive of 5 shekels of additional payment (atru) and lubāru-garments. When the receipt for payment in full (ṭuppi apilti) will be sealed, he will pay the rest. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe: Madānu-ahhē-iddin/Tabnêa//Bēl-ēṭiru
 
A = Nabû-nāṣir/Ina-Esangila-zēru; B = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ša-nāšīšu; C1 = Mušēbši/Aškāpu; C2 = Bābia/Mār-bīti-ēṭir//Gallābu; C3 = Rihītu
Title: BM 34530

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
The tablet records the purchase of agricultural land; the text has been divided into paragraphs, marked on the tablet by a line drawn at the end of each one (and indicated below in the paraphrase by LINE).
The first lines of the tablet are damaged, thus several details about the type and size of the land which A purchased from B1 and B2 are lost: from what is extant onegathers that it is located in front of the Uraš Gate in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon. LINE
The upper side in the North borders on (the property of) C and the lower side in the South on (the properties of) A, the buyer as well as the one of the two brothers D1 and D2; the upper front in the West borders on (the property of) the brothers E1 and E2. Details for the lower front in the East are lost. A declares the equivalent for this land together with the sellers B1 and B2 (A itti B mahīra nabû išām) to be 1 shekel of silver for each 0;0.0.1 Kor (75 m2) of land. The total price and the amount of silver given as additional payment are lost in a lacuna of the tablet.
B1 and B2 acknowledge that they have received (mahāru, wr. ma-ha-ar) the amount of silver corresponding to the entire purchase price of their field, and they are satisfied (apālu G Stat, wr. a-pa-a). Only the first words of the usual formula that  protects the parties against future claims or suits are extant – then, the tablet breaks. The names of the witnesses and of the scribe are lost.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B1 = Nabû-ēreš(?); B2 = Šāpik-zēri; C = Marduk-zēru-ibni/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Sîn-šadûnu; D1 = Rēmūtu/Nādinu//Sîn-šadûnu; D2 = Bēl-iddin/Nādinu//Sîn-šadûnu; E1 = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Nādin-ahi; E2 = Bēlšunu/Nādin-ahi
Title: BM 34015

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
A purchases land located in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon from B. Some details about the field are lost in a lacuna at the beginning of the tablet, but not those about its size and the bordering properties. Its upper side in the North measures 720 cubits (360 m) and borders on C’s land; its lower side in the South has the same length and borders on D’s land. The upper front in the West measures 49,50 cubits (24,75 m) and is adjacent to the upper irrigation canal (harru elû) while its lower front in the East, that has the same length, borders on the royal street (harrān šarri).
The buyer has declared the equivalent of the field (mahīra nabû) to be 1 mina of silver and has given to B, the seller, the total price (šīmišu gamrūtu) plus 3 shekels of silver as additional payment (ša kî pî atri). In total, B receives (mahāru) 1 mina and 3 shekels of silver from A as purchase price of his field (eqlu). The seller is satisfied (apālu G Stat) and the two parties agree that in future times there will no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families.
In Kislīm (IX), B will bring the original document attesting the purchase (ummi eqli, lit. “mother of the field”) and hand it over to A (našāmu-nadānu), who will give him 1/3 shekels of silver in return. After this clause the tablet breaks: the names of the witnesses and the scribe are lost.
 
A = Kidin-Marduk/Zēria//Šangû-Gula; B = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Tabnēa//Ah-bāni; C = Nā'id-Marduk; D = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Šangû-Gula
Title: BM 32115

Paraphrase:
Addendum to a land sale.
A purchased (ina qātē mahāru) two fields: the first one was a plot of arable land (zēru) situated along the Sukullâtu-street, which he bought from D and his brothers by means of his proxy, B. This land was part of the dowry (nudunnû) of the sellers’ mother fC; the price, a non-specified amount of silver, was paid to D and his brothers. Later, A also bought (ina qātē mahāru) 0;0.1.1 Kor (525 m2) of arable land (zēru) that was part of the parcel (qutānu) of D and his brothers; he paid for it with silver. The present document was drafted with the sole aim to point out that D’s wife (fE) witnessed the sales (ana mukinnūti ašābu), thus implying her consent to them. The related text Rm942, written the same day as this document, records the presence of another woman (the wife of one of D’s brothers) among the witnesses; the name of the mother is written differently in the two tablets, however it must be the same person. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe. The technical term for the proxy B is not used, but his role is inferable from the content of the text.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Nabû-bān-ahi/Marduk-nāṣir//Mudammiq-Adad; fC = fKurunnam-tabni/Bēl-upahhir//Sîn-šadûnu; D = Nabû-ēreš/Šumu-ukīn//Sîn-šadûnu; fE = fBurāšu/Aqara//Šigûa, wife of D
Title: BM 30449

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver
A broken amount of silver belonging to A is at the disposal of (ina pāni) fB for the purchase of barrels of one-year old (mār šatti) beer. The compensatory payment for (A's) loss of income from (her) work (mandattu) and payment for the rent (idū) of the house .... (uncl., = she already paid him?). The tablet is drawn up in front of 2 ina uzuzzi witnesses. The scribe is Marduk-balāssu-iqbi/Nabāya.
 
A= Širku (without genealogy) (aka Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); fB=fNanāya-ana-bītišu
Title: BM 31519

Paraphrase:
Division of inheritance.
The tablet records a division of inheritance among members of the Išparu family.
A takes possession (ṣabātu) of a property whose details are largely lost in the initial lacuna. His younger brothers B1 and B2 take possession (ṣabātu) of x+1/2 square cubits of a surface area which is located near C’s property. Then, the text lists the agreement related to the settlements (ālu) that are located on the inherited land: B1 owns (dagālu) the houses in which D1 and D2 live, according to his share (kūm zittīšu). B2 owns (dagālu) the house in which A lives, according to his share (kūm zittīšu). Each one of them will pay (lit. “give”, nadānu) for the maintenance costs (kurummatu) of their mother fE, according to her share (akî zittīšu). fF, a female slave, belongs to (dagālu N) the older brother A, according to his share (kūm zittīšu). G belongs to the younger brothers B1 and B2, according to their share (kūm zittīšunu). After the real estate and slaves, the document records shares related to a prebend, but due to the synthetical nature of the text it is not possible to infer to which specific prebendary activity it refers. It is stated that A owns (dagālu) one half day “of Sippar”, while the two younger brothers B1 and B2 own (dagālu) the other half. All the brothers will pay in full (eṭēru D), in equal amounts (ahātu), for the nishu-expenses (nishu) and credits (rašûtu) owed by their father; they will also share equally in their father’s nishu-income that is still outstanding (sūqu, lit. "in the market"). The two younger sons are entitled to equal shares (ahātu) in arable land (zēru), whose details are not clear (wr. 3(PI)? TUK?-iá) and that is (possibly) adjacent to H’s property. Each one takes possession (arādu, see CAD A/2 s.v. A 1a 10’) of the front side of their shares (of land), going down until the dam (makallû) of the hanšû-land. The text ends invoking a curse on whoever will change the words written in the document. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Rēmūt-Gula/Etellu//Išpāru; B1 = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Etellu//Išpāru, brother of A; B2 = Mušēzib-Marduk/Etellu//Išpāru, brother of A; C = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kudurru//Išpāru; D1 = Madān-ahu-iddin; D2 = Šamaš-uballiṭ; fE = fKaribtu, mother of A, B1 and B2; fF = fBazītu, slave of fE; G = Libluṭ; H = Nā'id-Marduk
Title: BM 31367

Paraphrase:
Dissolution of a business partnership. Division of the profits.
A1 and B1 were partners in a business venture (harrānu šakānu) in which they had equal shares (ahi zittu). Their sons (A2 and B2) divide (zâzu D) among them the arable land (zēru) that belongs to the partnership. The details of the division are broken off. The partners to the contract have taken a copy of the document each.
 
A1 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; A2 = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin;  B1 = Rēmūt/Kurbanni-Marduk//Eppeš-ilī; B2 = Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Rēmūt
Title: BM 48009

Paraphrase:
Concerns 73 pieces of small livestock [...], among which 27 two-year olds and 36 one-year olds, which B, slave of A, owes to his master. All the animals have been delivered by the creditor’s messenger to B. This does not include the promissory note for small livestock that are at B's disposal within the framework of a lease agreement (giš BAR sutu). Names of witnesses and scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Zababa-iddin, slave of A
Title: BM 30889

Paraphrase:
Receipt of payment of a silver debt. Subrogation.
Concerns the debt for 3 minas of silver that B1 and B2 owe to A and for which a promissory note has been issued (e’ēlu). A receives payment (eṭēru) for this debt from C (his father-in-law). He should compel the debtors to pay (lapāni našû, lit. "to take from"), and give the silver to C (nadānu) in good conscience (ina amāti, lit. "on the word of").  He guarantees the collection of the said sum of silver (šipir ša kaspa, lit. “doing of this sum of silver”). In addition, there is an earlier promissory note which is still pending. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Rēmūt/Sallana; B2 = Gūzānu/Sūqāya; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 31338

Paraphrase:
Dowry gift.
A gives of his own free will the dowry of his daughter fC to B. It consists of 10 mina silver, 5 slaves and household utensils. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A=Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi, father of fC; B=Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bāni-zēri/Bēl-ēṭir, the groom; fC= fTašmētu-tabni, bride and daughter of A.
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 288; Krecher 1970, 206; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 55; Weingort 1939, 17f; Tallqvist 1891, 6f.; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 2 (1891), 11f; San Nicolò, Aegyptus 27 (1947), 126f; Demuth, BA 3 (1898), 415f; Roth, JAOS 111 (1991), 26.
Title: BM 30585

Paraphrase:
Statement in court about testimony by a witness.
On the 5th of Kislīm (IX), A will bring his witness to Piqūdu to let him testify against B, who maintains that the plaintiff should not argue a case (dabābu) against him about the dead slave (qallu), since he is ready to  compensate him in full for the life of his slave. Should the witness testify against B, then B will pay 1 mina of silver corresponding to the purchase price for A’s slave. Should the witness not testify, [B will go unpunished]. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šarru-ukīn/Ammānu; B = Idî-ilī/Dīnāya
Title: BM 30346

Paraphrase:
Addendum to the purchase of a house by proxy
A purchased a 5 gi (c. 45 m2) big house and a share (ahu) in a slave (C) from B by proxy. He gave D, his proxy, the silver to buy the property: 2 5/6 minas of medium-quality silver of which 1/8 is alloy. The latter received (mahāru) the purchased property from the seller and a sale document (šaṭāru) was written at A's request (ṣibûtu). The present document aims pointing out that D has no share (zittu) whatsoever in either the house or the slave. Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nergal-ušēzib/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Bēl-šubat-..., slave of B; D = Nabû-ittannu/Ardia//Sîn-ilī
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 326f; Petschow RIDA 3e Série 1 (1954), 131f.; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 48; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 4 (1898), 33f; Weingort 1939, 25f.
Title: BM 30637

Paraphrase:
Pledge of housewith anitchresis as security for a silver debt.
B owes 4 ½ minas of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A. The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s house located in the Mušēpišu-ša-hubur street, next to the houses of C and D. The creditor enjoys the usufruct of the house in lieu of receiving interest (antichresis). Accordingly, he does not pay rent for the house, and B does not pay interest on his debt until the capital amount, 4 ½ minas of silver has been fully repaid (eṭēru N). The debtor’s house is placed at the creditor’s disposal starting from the 1st of Nisan (I) of the 19th year, i.e. in roughly three weeks from this document's date of issue. Names of 14(?) witnesses and the scribe: Nidinti-Marduk/Bēl-kāṣir.
 
A = Nergal-ušallim/balāṭu//Ir’anni; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Nidintu/Iddināya; D = Nabû-ittannu
Title: BM 31061

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Antichretic pledge of a house.
B owes 2 minas of silver to A, an alphabet scribe (sepīru) in the service of the crown prince (mār šarri). His house located next to the creditor's house is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). For the creditor, see also BM32882 and BM33118).  Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Rēmūt-Nabû/Šamaš-pir'u-uṣur//Eppeši-ilī

A = Gabbi-ilī-šarru-uṣur/Ilteri-hanān; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; W1= Nabû-mukīn-apli/Marduk-damiq//Eppeš-ilī; W2=Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; W3= Iddin-Nabû/Ibnāya//Dābibi
Title: BM 31343

Paraphrase:
Undertaking of payment.
fA1, A2 and A3 will pay the 45 shekels of silver, together with their interest, which they owe to B to the creditor’s son, C. This corresponds to a debt that they owe to Marduk (i.e. to the Esagila). Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA1 = fKaššat/Nabû-ēṭir//Rab-banê; A2 = Marduk-šāpik-zēri/Bēl-uballiṭ/Nāgiru; A3 = Bēl-iddin, son of A2; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli
Title: Ash. 1971.404

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
The tablet records the purchase of agricultural land; the text has been divided into paragraphs, marked on the tablet by a line drawn at the end of each one (and indicated below in the paraphrase by LINE).
A purchases agricultural land (zēru), consisting of two plots, from B: the first one consists of 0;2 Kor (5400 m2) of land in the open country (eqel ṣēri), a cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi) bearing fruit (iṣṣi bilti) and the second one consists of 0;3.2 Kor (9000 m2) of cultivated land (mērešu) in Litamu in front of the Uraš Gate, in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon. LINE
The upper side in the North of this land borders on (the properties of) C1 and C2, its lower side in the South on (the property of) D; its upper front in the West is adjacent to the bank (kišādu) of the Piqūdu Canal and its lower front in the East is adjacent to the lower end (šēpītu) of the 5000 field complex.
In total, the land measures 1;0.2 Kor (14400 m2) – of which 0;2 Kor (5400 m2) are land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu). LINE
A declares the equivalent for this land together with the seller B (A itti B mahīra nabû išām): the orchard is valued (šuqultu) at 3 minas and 12 shekels, and the land cultivated with grain at  46 2/3 shekels. The buyer gives (nadānu) 3 minas and 58 2/3 shekels of silver as total price (šīmišu gamrūtu) of this field, plus 4 shekels of silver as additional payment (kî atri). LINE
B acknowledges that he has received (mahāru) in total 4 minas and 2 2/3 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), and he is satisfied (apālu G Stat). The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. The field will then be measured: should it be found smaller or larger than what was originally calculated they will compensate each other (ahāmiš apālu) according to the field-price ratio (mahīru) they agreed upon. Fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of the seller B, instead of his seal impression (kunukku). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-ēṭir/Līširu/Ṣāhit-ginê; C1 = Habaṣīru; C2 = Balāṭu/Aškāpu; D = Balāṭu/Ur-Nanna
Title: BM 30685

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver in order to acquire gold.
A receives (mahāru)  2 minas 5 shekels of silver from B by C’s orders (ina našparti). He should spend it (nadānu) on (ana) gold.
 
A = Niqūdu/Nabû-iqīša//Maštuk; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; C = Mušēzib-Bēl/Ta’imbadē
Title: BM 30679

Paraphrase:
Legal document. Very fragmentary.
From the fragmentary beginning of the text one infers that B1, his brother and his wife borrowed silver from A1 (12 1/2 minas) and fA2 (10 minas). About 2/3 of the tablet is broken off; when the text resumes, one reads that A1 showed compassion (rēmu rašû) [for (?) …] his wife. In a broken passage, the remaining silver is mentioned. The lower part of the tablet is extant, and the text can be read again. It states that the creditors (? their names are lost in the previous gap) brought back the promissory notes (u’iltu) for their credit balance (rašûtu) and handed them over (târu D-nadānu) to C1 and C2 (B1’s sons), B2, (C1’s brother), and fC3 (B1’s mother). The transaction recorded in this document is probably related to that in BM30122 and BM38111+. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; fA2 = fIna-Esagila-rāmat/Zēria//Nabāya; B1 = Kidin-Marduk/Zēria//Šangû-Gula; B2 = Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Zēria//Šangû-Gula, brother of B1; fB3 = fBu’ītu/Nabû-bān-ahi//Šangû-Gula, wife of B1; C1 = Nādinu, son of B1; C2 = Nabû-ušallim, son of B1; fC3 = fQudāšu, mother of C1
Title: BM 31435

Paraphrase:
Lease of land. Dialogue document.
A asks to B, a servant (qallu) of C, the governor (bēl pihāti) of [...], to give him a plot of royal land (zēru ša šarri) on the bank of the Harru-Canal, his [...] under C’s administrative responsability, to plant date palms (ana zāqipānūtu). Some elements in the description of this plot of land is still unclear. B grants (šemû) A’s request: he gives him a plot of land whose short side measures 800 cubits (c. 400 m), located on the bank of the Harru-Canal. The plot stretches from the border with X till the border of Y (their names cannot be read), and it is given for an unlimited period of time (ana ūmī ṣâti); he will enjoy (akālu) a half share (ahi zitti)? The remaining of the text is very fragmentary. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šulāya/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//Egibi; B = Hahhuru/ Nadnāya, qallu; C = Zēria, governor (bēl pihāti) […]
Bibliography: Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 136; Krecher 1970, 123; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 4 (1898), 75; Petschow, JCS 19 (1965), 103ff.
Title: BM 41394

Paraphrase:
Warranty for a donkey within the framework of a sale.
Concerns a five-year old black donkey with two marks* on its left flank which A sold to B for 2 minas of silver. The seller assumes warranty against the status of holder of prior claims (uškûtu) for this donkey. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
* a spade (marru) and a qalpu (meaning unknown)
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iddin/Arad-Bēl//Egibi; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 31077

Paraphrase:
List of witnesses.
The tablet records the names of the witnesses before whom (ina pānišunu) A … on the 18th day of Abu (V) to Bištu-ša-ṣinnatu … (rest lost in a lacuna) and B until the 20th day of [Abu (V)] … Rest broken off. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/ Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Ahu-ittabši/Nabû-malik
Title: BM 31394

Paraphrase:
Testament.
The text records A’s testament. A, of his own free will (ina hūd libbišu), transmits under seal (kanāku - dagālu Š) his entire property (nikkassu) located inside and outside the city to his wife fB, C’s daughter. As long as his son D will live, he will enjoy the usufruct (akalu akālu) of A’s property together with fB. A also gives (nadānu) 2 sq. kor (c. 27000 m2) of arable land (zēru) and 5 slaves (amīlūtu) to F for fE('s dowry); moreover, he gives (nadānu) his daughter fG 1 kor (c. 13500 m2) of arable land (zēru) and 3 slaves (amīlūtu) (as dowry). fB, D, fE and fG will take (leqû) the inheritance (arkatu) together (ahameš). As long as A lives, his property (nikkassu) will be at his disposal. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: A.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fB =fNuptāya/Iddin-Marduk//Nūr-Sîn, wife of A and daughter of C; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; D = Marduk-nāṣir-apli, son of A; fE = fTašmētu-tabni, daughter of A and wife of F; F = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bāni-zēri(//Bēl-ēṭir); fG = fEsagila-bēlet, daughter of A
Title: BM 31698+

Paraphrase:
Sale of slaves. Fragmentary.
A, of his own free will, sells slaves to B, through a proxy fE: the slaves are C1 and his wife fC2, C3, C4, fC5, fC6,C7, C8 (name missing, his eldest brother), C9 and C10. In total, he sells ten of his slaves for a purchase price amounting to 22 minas of silver. After a large gap in the tablet, the warranty clause must have followed (only the words “A guarantees against..” are extant). At the end of the text, the seller acknowledges that he has received the entire sum of the purchase price from the buyer. Names of xxx witnesses.
 
A = Kalbāya/Ṣillāya//Nabāya; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C1 = Silīm-Bēl; fC2 = fHabaṣīrtu, wife of C1; C3 = Bēl-eṭranni; C4 = Šēpit-Bēl; fC5 = fBēl-lū-balṭat; fC6 = fMurašītu; C7 = Šamaš-iddin, brother of C8; C8 = […]; C9 = Šamaš-bēlu-uṣur; C10 = fŠikkû (wr. fSik-ki-pa-šá); fE = fBu’ītu
Title: BM 30996

Paraphrase:
Securities for a silver debt: fixation of interest and pledge of slaves.
B owes 1/3 minas of silver to A on which he has to pay a yearly interest of 20%. The debt is further secured by the pledge of two slaves:  fC1 and her daughter. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ēṭir/Mukīn-zēri//Egibi.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Arad-Marduk/Marduk-ēṭir//Ša-ṭābtišu; fC3 = fMiṣatu, slave of A
Title: BM 25716

Paraphrase:
Promissory note. Fragmentary
B1 and his wife fB2 owe A 1/3 mina of silver. The rest of the tablet and the first part of the list of witnesses is broken. The name of the scribe is Ea-ušallim/Madān-ahhē-iddin//Bēl-ēṭiru 
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Līširu/Balāssu; fB2 = fŠinabanāya/...
Title: BM 31982

Paraphrase:
Receipt. Fragmentary
The first 3 lines of the tablet are very fragmentary. The 1st line mentions a 7 year old black donkey. The 2nd line is broken, but probably continues the donkey's description. The 3rd line contains A’s name. From what is legible it is clear that A sold (ana kaspi nadānu) the donkey to B for the full purchase price (gamru) of 25 shekels of medium quality (nuhhutu) silver of which 1/8 is alloy (bitqu). A receives (mahāru) from B the donkey’s purchase price of 25! shekels of silver. C guarantees (pūtu našû) against a holder of prior claims (uškûtu) to the donkey. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe: Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//man?-a-a
 
A=Sūqāya/Nabû-zēru-ukīn; B=Širku/Iddināya//Egibi; C=Bēl-nādin-.../Iddin-Nabû
Title: BM 31232

Paraphrase:
Establishment of a business partnership.
B owes 1/3 minas(*) of silver to A, his business partner. The background to this debt is the subsidiary partnership (harrānu) contracted by A (investor) with B (acting partner) and financed by assets drawn from the parent partnership (harrānu) between C (investor) and A (acting partner). A and B agreed that the latter will run the business (našpartu ša harrāni alāku), but that both partners share equally (ahi ... akālu) in the profits (utru). B is not entitled to profit from any other investments of the partnership between C and A, only from the enterprise for which he is commissioned (mimma elat ša B ianu). He should not spend more (etēqu) than one shekel (on travel expenses) and cover any excesses from his own account. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ṭabiya//Suhāya.
(*) Text: 1/3 shekels.

A = Rēmūtu (Rēmūtu/Kurbanni-Marduk//Eppeš-ilī); B = Bēl-iddin (Bēl-iddin/Nergal-uballiṭ//Aškāpu); C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi
Bibliography: Moldenke, CTMMA (1893), no. 13; Krecher 1970, 150; Petschow, RIDA 3e Série 1 (1954), 167ff.; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 31f; Oppenheim, JNES 6 (1947), 119
Title: MMA 79.7.14

Paraphrase:
Sale of slaves.
fA sells his slaves (amēluttu) C1 and C2 to B for a hariṣ price amounting to 1/2 mina of silver, of which 1/8 is alloy. Note that the usual "of (the seller's) own free will" is lacking. The seller guarantees against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû), a person claiming (pāqirānu) that these slaves are free persons (mār banê), or the existence of a(nother) document (sipru) pertaining to these slaves. See also BM31024 (= Nbk 37). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Šamaš-šumu-līšir/Adad-šumu-iddin//Aškāpu.
 
fA = fGuzummu/ Šapullātu; B = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Mandidi; C1 = Bāba-ēṭirat; C2 = Itti-Nabû-īnia
Title: BM 31004

Paraphrase:
Court protocol. Fragmentary.
A1 and A2 said thus to the judges of Nabonidus: "In Neriglissar’s 2nd regnal year, our mother fB has handed over (dagālu Š) to us […] and fC, a slave who was part of her dowry (ardu ša nudunnê), by means of a sealed document. One year later, of her own free will (ina migir libbišu), she has also (given to us?) 2;2 square kor (c. 32400 m2) of land which the royal scribes had transferred to her (dagālu Š) as countervalue of her dowry (kūm nudunnê). They wrote in her document: ‘Whoever among her sons will not respect (palāhu) her, will not receive his inheritance share’. […] D […]”. The final lines of the two sons’ speech is lost, as well as the following section of the text which must have included the judgement. The few words that are extant mention a purchase price (šīmu), a sealed document written by fB, something that is registered (uzuzzu Š) on tablets, as well as the receiving of the judges’ verdict (dīnu). After another mention of A1’s and A2’s names, the text breaks off. Names of 5 judges and 2 scribes.
 
A1 = broken off; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Šumu-ukīn//Sîn-šadûnu; fB = fKurunnam-tabni, mother of A1 and A2; fC = broken off, slave of fB; D = Mušēzib-Bēl
Title: BM 31672

Paraphrase:
Land rental.
A1 rents land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) and a grain field (pî šulpu), located at the branch of the ancient Kutha Canal near (the property of) the sons of [PN] and C, to B, who should perform gardening work (nukaribbūtu). The landlord owns it together with his brothers and A2. The renter should dig (verb broken off) a ditch 0;0.2 r (3,5 m2) deep and build a dam (musannitu). He should also build (aṣû Š) 2 drainage canals (āṣītu), one above and one below the ditch. For the entire field, newly cleared as well as cultivated land (taptû u bīt dulli), A1 will give to B as follows: 6 kor (1080 l) of dates per kor of newly cleared land (taptû), and 5 kor (900 l) of dates per kor of cultivated land (bīt dulli) – as long as the renter finishes the entire digging work (herû-ma qatû). Should B be negligent in his work, then he will pay to A1 5 Kor (900 l) of dates per kor of land under his responsibility. The field is at the renter’s disposal for 5 years. As for the arable land that he will farm, B will pay a quarter of the šibšu-tax to A1.  Whoever breaks the contract shall pay 1 mina of silver. Names of 8 witnesses and a slave.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Bēl- ēṭir; B = Aplāya/Iqīša-Marduk//Suhāya; C = Mušēzib-Marduk//Sîn-šadûnu
Title: BM 33151

Bibliography: To be published by Johannes Hackl.
Title: BM 31611

Paraphrase:
Oath
A1 and his son A2 swear to B by the gods and the king that on a specific day (the number is lost in a lacuna) of Šabāṭ (XI) of Darius’ 14th regnal year they will bring along (abāku) (to B) 2 [...],1 red draft ox (šaddidu) and a young cow, in total 4 bovines, that A1 sold (ana kaspi nadānu) to B and that the seller and his father previously brought along (abāku) in front of C, B’s slave (qallu). A1 and A2 will also give to the buyer the tablet (immû) (related to this purchase). A2 will show (kalāmu D) the promissory note (u’iltu) for a cow and its calf to B, and he will bring along (abāku) the animals: should he fail to return and present (târu-nadānu) them, then A2 and A1 will give 200 kor (c. 36000 l) of dates and 30 kor (c. 5400 l) of barley to B. This is what remains (rīhtu) to be paid from a promissory note (u’iltu) for an amount of 110 kor (c. 19800 l) of barley and 200 kor (c. 36000 l) of dates. D guarantees for A2 and A1, with regards to the delivery of the mentioned bovines. A note written at the end of the document points out that the agreement recorded in this tablet does not include (elat) another claim (rašûtu) charged against A1. Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Aššur-abu-uṣur; A2 = Iqīša-Marduk/Nabû-zēru-ibni; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Šēpēt-Bēl-aṣbat, slave of B; D = Bēl-ēdu-pitni/Balāṭu
Title: BM 31060

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave to finalise a previous unfinished deal.
A, of his own free will, sells his female slave fC to B for a hariṣ purchase price amounting to 2/3 mina of silver. A guarantees against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person claiming (pāqirānu) that fC is a palace slave (amat ekalli) or a free person (mār banê).  In the purchase price is included 1 mina of silver from the price of a plot of land located on the Zabūnu ditch: B paid this silver to fD1 and her son D2, but then he never finalised the purchase of the land (cf. BM30600; see also BM30911). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ile’’i-bulliṭ-Marduk; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fC = fŠidatu; fD1 = fKaššāya/Šulāya//Nanna-utu; D2 = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu
Bibliography:
Krecher 1970, 191f.; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 178; Koschaker 1911, 261; Marx, BA 4 (1902), 62; 
Kohler and Peiser, BRL 1 (1890), 41f.
Title: BM 30911

Paraphrase:
Apprenticeship contract
A, slave of C, will be at the disposal of (ina pāni uzuzzu) B, slave of D, in order to learn the baker’s profession (nuhatimmūtu) starting in Abu (V) of the 6th year of king Cyrus.
