For about 3 months till the end of Arahsamna (VIII)*, B will teach him the bakers craft.
If he fails to do so, he will pay each day 0;0.1.0 kor barley to A as his slave wage (mandattu) as longs as he is at B’s disposal. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ina-qāti-Nabû-bulṭu; B = Rehētu; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu(/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi); D = Basia
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 211; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 61; San Nicolò 1950, 10f, 13f; Demuth, BA 3 (1898), 420f.; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 2 (1891), 54f.
Title: BM 30952

Paraphrase:
Interim settlement of accounts within the framework of a business partnership (harranu);
A and B make an interim account of the expenses that they had while running the business they set up together. First, A transferred (nasāhu)  1 mina and 30 shekels of silver from (ultu) the business accounts to B (ina muhhi) for the following expenses:  30 shekels were put at C1’s disposal; 20 shekels were used to purchase (abāku)  fD from C2, and 40 shekels of silver were (withdrawn) from  (ultu) the business account. So, B withdrew (nasāhu)  in total 1 mina and 30 shekels from the business account before A (ana tarṣi). Secondly, A transferred 1 mina 7 ½ shekels of silver for the purchase of D2 from C2 to (ana) the business account. As for the two slaves that were thus purchased: fD1 belongs to B and D2 belongs to A. The amounts that they thus transferred from (and to) the business account (nishētu) are acceptable amounts (muquttû). None of the partners exceeded (etēqu) the allowed amount (manma ina muhhi manma ul etiq, lit. “one party did not exceed as against the other”). Finally, with respect to the ½ mina of silver which A withdrew from the business account (ultu nasāhu) (and) lent out (u’iltu ša A, lit. the promissory note credited to A), and the 1 mina of silver that he lent to C3: A has debited (nadānu) these amounts from his own assets (ramānu). Names of 3 witnesses, and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Bēlšunu/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Sîn-imitti; C1 = Kidin-Marduk/Ina-Esagil-zēri//Nūr-Sîn; C2 = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Būṣu; C3 = Mušēbši/Qīšti-Marduk; fD1 = fSilīm-Ištar, a female slave of C2; D2 = Bēl-attā-tale’’i, a slave of C2
Title: Liverpool 29-11-77,9

Paraphrase:
House rental.
A rents a house to B for 10 shekels of silver per year. The location of the house is not specified. It is agreed that half of the silver should be paid at the beginning of the year, and the remainder in the middle. The renter should caulk (šanû) the roof and repair the wall foundations (asurrû). He should also pay for the additional payment (nūptu) in Nisan (I), Dûzu (IV) and Kislim (IX). The house will be at his disposal from the 1st of Dûzu (IV) onwards, i.e. next month. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Ibnāya//Ir’anni
Title: BM 30587

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house
A purchases from B1 and B2 a house in ruins (abtu) in the district (pīhatu) of Kiš, in Hursagkalamma in the centre of the city. Its size is 10 sq. r (c. 122,5 m2) and it is located near (the house of) C, by the narrow street (sūqu qatnu), and the sons of D1 and D2. The purchase price is 3.5 minas of white silver (kaspu peṣû): Name of 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bān-zēri//Bēl-ēṭiru; B1 = Marduk-iqīšanni/Zēria//Šumu-libši; B2 = Zababa-napišti-uṣur/Marduk-iqīšanni//Šumu-libši; C = Zababa-iddin/Šarid//Bā'iru; D1 = Erība-Marduk/Mušēzib-Nergal; D2 = Nidinti-Bēl/Kalbāya//Bābūtu
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 31298

Paraphrase:
About the purchase of a field.
A, acting as a proxy, purchases 0;0.2.2 kor (1050 m2) of arable land (zēru) for 56 shekels of white silver from B. The field is an orchard (kirû) planted with date palms (gišimmarē zaqpu), situated in the open country (ṣēru), in front of (meḫratu) the Uraš Gate in the district (pīḫatu) of Babylon. The document is written at C’s request (ana ṣibûti), whose silver has been used for the purchase and establishes that A, his intermediary, has no share in this field. Names of 8 witnesses and the scribe. The scribe is the proxy himself: Arad-Bāba/ Mušēzib-Marduk//Ašlāku.
 
A = Arad-Bāba/Mušēzib-Marduk//Ašlāku; B = Nergal-ušezib/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 2000, no. 221; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 4 (1898), 33; Krecher 1970, 326.
Title: BM 41433

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
Fragment of a tablet recording the purchase of land. One can recognize the names of the buyer A and the seller B; the presence of the expression “to compensate each other” (ahāmiš apālu ) suggests that the few words that are extant refer to the measurement of the field that will take place after the exchange of silver between the two parties.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Balāṭu/…
Title: BM 32743

Paraphrase:
Addendum to a land sale.
A purchased (lit. “received”, mahāru) a plot of arable land (zēru) located in Šuppatu from B (as recorded in BM31346). The present document was drafted with the sole aim to point out that the seller’s brother (C) witnessed the sale (ana mukinnūti ašābu), thus implying his consent to it. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi B = Nergal-zēru-ibni/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Asû; C =  Iddin-Marduk/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Asû
Title: BM 40741

Paraphrase:
Sale of a donkey. Very fragmentary.
A sells to B for 35 shekels of silver a black donkey on whose neck (tikku) is written C’s name. Rest broken off. Names of 2+ witnesses and the scribe: A.
 
A = Nergal-ušēzib/Ardia/Ša-nāšišu; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi(?); C = Ningal-iddin
Title: BM 31706

Paraphrase:
Division of inheritance.
The top part of the tablet is lost, when the text resumes, one can deduce that A (whose name is lost) receives (mahāru) something from B. Then, the text continues listing the division of the inheritance: C receives from B (ina qātē B eṭēru N) the land of the business partnership (harrānu), which he holds jointly with D’s sons and that is located at the opening (bitqu) of the Ile’’i-Bēl canal. C acknowledges that he is satisfied (apālu  G Stat) with his share, amounting to a one-fourth share in the inheritance; the parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each others. In the final (fragmentary) part of the document it is stated that a female slave, fE, remains their commonly held property (karû). Names of 1+ witnesses; name of the scribe broken off.
 
A = broken name; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Nergal-ēṭir (without affiliation, probably B’s brother); D = Rēmūtu/Kurbanni-Marduk//Eppeš-ilī; fE = fLētka-idî-Zarpanītu
Title: BM 31691

Paraphrase:
Dissolution of a business partnership (harranu).
Concerns the business partnership between A and B, its dissolution and the payment of outstanding debts. A still owes silver to C1, C2 and C3 and guarantees before his business partner that he will pay (eṭēru) it. As a result A and B have settled (epuš nikkassi qatû) their business accounts. Name of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Širiktu(/Nūrēa//Dannēa); B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; C1 = Nabû-bēl-ilāni, C2 = Šāpik-zēri; C3 = Bēl-zēru-ibni
Title: BM 31087

Paraphrase:
This is a memorandum (tahsistu) written in order not to be forgotten. It opens by listing the names of 4 witnesses in who’s presence fA guarantees to B that her son-in-law C will not leave the place until the 10th of Ayyār (II). Among the 4 witnesses we find X, the messenger of an agricultural supervisor (gugallu). The name of the scribe is not mentioned.
 
fA = fSilim-Ištar(/Kurigalzu//Ša-nāšišu); B = Iddin-Marduk; C = Lâbāši/Zeria//Nabāya
Title: BM 30471

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Subrogation.
Concerns the debt for 4 1/3  minas of silver that B owes to fA and for which a promissory note has been issued in her name (ana šumi) against B (e’ēlu). C , the creditor's son-in-law, undertakes to give back the promissory note to the debtor upon repayment of the debt (târu D-nadānu). Apparently, the title to the debt had been transferred to him, and together with it also the pertinent document(s). Each of the parties receive one copy of the present document. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Nappāhu.
 
fA = fIna-Esagila-rāmat/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Bēl-erība/Pir'u//Ir’anni;  C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 345; Krecher 1970, 242; Koschaker 1911, 119; Ziemer, BA 3 (1898), 467f.; Shiff 1987, no. 224.
Title: BM 30785

Paraphrase:
Summon.
On Simān (III), 25th, A will come and present his arguments (dibbu) against fB, the female temple oblate (širkatu) of Bēltia in the Esangila. If he will not show up, he will offer to Bēl a substitute for the female slave. Name of 1 witness. Scribe: Belere§/Šāpik-zēri/Mandidi. The text seems to belong to the Egibi/Nūr-šîn archive on the basis of its museumnumber (only).
 
A = Amurru-iddin(Amurru-šumu?)/Mardukāya; fB = fAhatabišu, širkatu
Title: BM 33911

Paraphrase:
About a fugative slave
Concerns fC, slave of A, whom B helped to flee (halāqu Š) from her master's house. A caught (kašādu) her in B's possession. He had mercy with him (rēma rašû) and [x] la (uncl.) he received from him. This last sentence is partly uncl. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Lâbāši/Šumu-ukīn; fC = fTašlīm
Title: BM 30678

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates. Tax-related. Fragmentary.
B1 and B2 owe 33 kor of dates to A in return for a payment (šīmu) that A made (nadānu G Stat.) on their behalf (ana muhhi) to the palace for the [x]-me (= a tax?) of Cambyses' 4th year.. In addition, there is an earlier claim (rašûtu) for silver between the same parties that is still pending. From this point onwards the document is very fragmentarily preserved: [(...)] silver to/for (?) […], which C (?), the deputy (šanû), […] for the credit of the mentioned silver in Tašrīt(VII) of Cambyses’ 5th year, […] the dates […] he will deliver/pay. The debtors assume warranty for each other. A short remark at the very end of the document points out that excluded from the above (u elat!) is also the silver that was given (nadānu G Stat.) to D and E. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nidinti-Bēl/Nabû-ahhē-uballiṭ.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Ibnāya; B2 = Šumu-iddin/Nabû-ahu-uṣur family name not certain; C = Ahu-līšir(?); D = Nabû-iddin; E = Nergal-ana-bītišu /Nabû-ušallim//Dēkû
Title: BM 31123

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for revenue from impost on land, to be delivered in dates.
B1 and his mother (fB2) owe x+1 kor of dates to A1 and A2, to be delivered in Tašrīt (VII). The two debtors assume warranty for each other. He will show (kalāmu D) how much work he has done (mala ina libbi epēšu) and receive (našû) a remuneration for the gardening work (šissinnu) in accordindance therewith. The document concludes by pointing out that the dates are the rest (rīhtu) of the revenue from impost on land (imittu) for (Nabonidus') 8th year (i.e. the current year).

A1=Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulaya//Egibi; A2=Bēl-nādin-apli/Nergal-ušallim//Ile''i-Marduk; B1=Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Nādin//Ea-ilūta-bāni; fB2=fTapāša, mother of B1
Bibliography: Reedition: Wunsch 2000, no. 240; Krecher 1970, 157. Also published in CT 51 44.
Title: BM 34531

Paraphrase:
Settlement of accounts.
The tablet records the settlement of accounts (epuš nikkassi) between A and B, in particular the payment for the work of forced labourer(s) (urāšu) from the  1st of Abu (V) of Cyrus’ 3rd regnal year to the end of Simān (III) of the following year. A’s debt towards B is finished (qatû), they no more owe silver to each other. The text, however, also points out that another settlement of accounts (epuš nikkassi) between the two is still not solved (ul qatû): this debt is related to a period from Addar (XII) of the king’s 2nd regnal year to Dûzu (IV) of the following year. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-rēmanni/Nabû-zēru-iqīša//(E)sangilia.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya; B = Bāni-zēri/Dayyān-Marduk
Title: 1982.A.1749

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave.
A sells his slave, C, to B for 2 minas of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy. Names of witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šumu-iddin/Nabû-ahu-uṣur; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Nabû-ittia
Title: MLC 1768

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
The tablet records the purchase of agricultural land which, given its irregular shape, is calculated according to two measured areas: each one of these plots is described separately, marked on the tablet by a line drawn at the end of each paragraph (and indicated below in the paraphrase by LINE).
A purchases  0;1 Kor (2700 m2) of agricultural land (zēru) from three members of the same family: B1, his sister fB2 and his brother-in-law B3. It is a cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi), in the meadowland (ugāru) at the branch of the Borsippa Canal in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon. LINE
The first portion (mišīhtu) measures 457 cubits (228,5 m), its upper side in the North borders on (the property of) C1 and C2, its lower side in the South measures 450 cubits (225 m) and borders on (the property of) A, the buyer. Its upper front in the West measures 22 1/2 cubits (11,25 m) and borders on (the property of) D, its lower front in the East measures 21 cubits (10,5 m) and is adjacent to the royal street (harrān šarri). In total, the area of the first measured area (mišīhtu) above the royal street (elān harrān šarri) is 0;0.5.2.7 Kor (2452,5 m2). LINE
The second plot has a more regular surface: its long sides both measure 57 1/2 cubits (28,75 m) – the one in the North borders on (the property of) C2 and the one in the South on (the property of) A; its upper front in the West is 21 1/2 cubits (10,75 m) long and borders on the royal street (harrān šarri) and the lower front in the East is adjacent to the marshes (raqqatu) on the bank of the Euphrates (kišād nār Puratti). The total surface of this measured area (mišīhtu), which is below the royal street (šaplān harrān šarri), is 0;0.0.3.3 Kor (247,5 m2). LINE
In total, thus, A purchases 0;1 Kor (2700 m2) of land from B1, his sister fB2 and his brother-in-law B3. The buyer declares the equivalent for this land together with the sellers (A itti B mahīra nabû išām) to be 1 shekel of silver for each 3 3/4 gar (28,1 m2) of land. A pays (nadānu) them 1 mina and 36 shekels of silver for the total price (šīmišu gamrūtu) of this field, plus 6 1/2 shekels of silver as additional payment (kî pî atra). B1, fB2 and B3 acknowledge that they have received (mahāru) in total 1 mina and 42 1/2 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), and  they are satisfied (aplū). The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. Names of 6 witnesses (including fE, mother of B1 and fB2) and 2 scribes.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B1 = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Nabû-udammiq//Išpāru; fB2 = fQudāšu/Nabû-udammiq//Išpāru, sister of B1; B3 = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kudurru//Išpāru, brother-in-law of B1; C1 = Mušēzib-Bēl/Esagil-zēri//Nūr-Sîn; C2 = Bān-zēri/Nā'id-Marduk//Išpāru; D = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Šākin-šumi//Malahu; fE = Ramūa/Šamaš-iddin/Sîn-tabni
Title: BM 41406

Paraphrase:
Undertaking under oath.
The tablet concerns C, B’s slave, who is at A’s disposal. A swears to B, by the gods and the king, that on the 1st of Kislīm (IX) of Darius’ 20th regnal year he will bring along (abāku) the slave and deliver (nadānu) him/her to B. The slave’s name is written mBa-al-ta-in and qualified as lúGÉME = amtu, “female slave”. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = broken name; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Baltain (written mBa-al-ta-in), slave of A
Title: BM 33150

Paraphrase:
Sale of a pledged slave.
A, of his own free will, sells his slave C to B; the agreed purchase price amounts to 52 shekels of silver. A guarantees against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person claiming (pāqirānu) that C is a free person (mār banê). The silver from this sale is used to pay off D, A's creditor, to whom the sold slave had been pledged. After having received the silver that was due to him,  D gives B the documents pertaining to this debt. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Lâbāši-Marduk/Nādin//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; C = Bēl-ṣullê-šemu; D = Mardukāya/Rēmūt-Bēl//Atkuppu
Title: BM 33916

Paraphrase:
Warranty for a sold slave by the seller and her brother.
fA, of her own free will, sold her slave fC to B, for a full price (gamru) amounting to 1/2 mina and 7 shekels of silver. fA and her brother D guarantee against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person claiming (pāqirānu) that fC is a royal slave (arad šarrūtu) or a free person (mār banê). Names of 3 witnesses (among others Sūqāya/Marduk-ibni//Rab-banê, fA’s husband) and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bānia//Arabtu.
 
fA = fHabasinnatu/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Kāṣir; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; fC = fŠemartāya, slave of fA; D = Mušallim-Marduk/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Kāṣir, brother of fA
Title: BM 31163

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver. House rent.
A1 and C’s slave fA2 receive (mahāru, verb reconstructed) from B1 and B2 by order of (ina našparti) C 11 shekels of stamped(?) silver (ginnu). The silver is the payment of the rent for D's house (? reconstructed) for the first half (rēš šatti) of Darius' 10th or 11th year. They (?) guarantee (pūtu našû) for the payment (?) of the silver that is due from C. The parties have each taken a copy of this document. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Nidinti-Bēl//Nādin-še'im.
See also the house rental contract: BM31182 (Camb. 182) and 2 other receipts: BM 33560 (Dar. 424) and BM31032 (Camb. 253).
Note a different interpretation of this tablet on Achemenet due to the reading of rīmūtu instead of rēš šatti in line 2 and of rašûtu instead of našpartu in line 3. As such the silver is decribed as a gift (rīmūtu) of the 11th year of D and as a claim (rašûtu) of C.
 
A1 = Nidintu-Bēl/Damqia//Nādin-še’i; fA2 = Šēpet-Bēl-aṣbat, slave of C; B1 = Bēl-uballiṭ; B2 = Nidintu/Arad-Bēl//Šumu-libši; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli; D = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Itti-Nabû-balaṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 30289

Paraphrase:
Sale of slaves. Very fragmentary.
A, of his own free will, sells a female slave and her young son (the slaves‘ names are lost). Rest broken off. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-bullissu/Nabû-šumu-…//…
Title: BM 32041

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver (u'Iltu). Interest at default.
B owes 1/2 mina of medium quality silver with an 1/8 alloy to A, to be paid without interest at the end of Simān (III) to C in Babylon. If he fails to do so, the debt will start bearing a yearly interest of 20% to be paid on a monthly basis, namely from Dûzu (IV) onwards. Names of 8 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ibni/Iddin-Nabû//Ile’’i-Marduk
 
A = …-iddin/Nergal-ušallim//Ea-eppeš-ilī; B = Širku/Iddināya//Egibi; C = Bānia (wr. Ba-na-ia!, without affiliation)
Title: Ash. 1878.5

Paraphrase:
Promissory note. Fragmentary
B owes A 1 mina of silver. He will pay him at the end of Addar (XII). The tablet is written on the 1st day of month Šabāṭ (XI). The rest of the tablet is broken. Apart from the name of the last witness, the list of witnesses is broken. The name of the scribe is Sîn-tāqiš-bulliṭ/Iddin-Nabû//Egibi.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balātu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Marduk-iqīšanni/Zēria// Šumu-libši
Title: BM 31901

Paraphrase:
Gift of a slave.
A has written a sealed document (kanāku) with which he released (mār banûti nadānu) B, his slave who is called Rēmūtu, on the condition that B will provide him with food (kurummatu) and clothing (lubūšu). However, B fled (halāqu) as soon as A sealed the document for the release (ṭuppi mār banûti), and he did not give to his previous owner the due payment for food (ipru), ointment (piššatu) and clothing (lubuštu). fC, D’s wife, respected (palāhu), looked after (adāru) and cared for (suddudu) A (her father-in-law), and she gave him food, ointment and clothing. Thus, A of his own free will (ina hūd libbišu), declared null (pasāsu) the tablet related to B’s release and sealed (kanāku) this new one. In it he transmits the property (dagālu Š) of the fugitive slave to fC and her daughter fE, who will respect (palāhu) him. After fC’s death, B will belong to fE. The text ends with the curse formulas addressed to whomever will change what is written in the tablet. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Iqīšāya/Kudurru//Nūr-Sîn; B = Rēmanni-Bēl; fC = fIna-Esagila-rāmat/Zēria//Nabāya, wife of D; D = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; fE = fNuptāya, daughter of fC and D
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 211; Peiser, KB 4 (1896), 244f.; San Nicolò, Aegyptus 12 (1932), 42; Peiser, KA (1889), 87 f; Shiff 1987, no. 135; Dandamaev 1984, 438, no. 39.
Title: BM 31020

Paraphrase:
Interim settlement of accounts, within the framework of a business partnership..
The 11 shekels of silver at C1’s disposal [broken off], the 9 shekels of silver at C2’s disposal are credited to A (ana muhhi elû), and the 20 shekels of silver at C3’s disposal are credited to B. The business’ mustard-seeds that are still undivided (karû) and which have been taken for the land  (uncl.)(ana māti ṣabātu), the 15 shekels of silver at C4’s disposal, and the 15 shekels of silver at C5’s disposal will be divided between them in equal shares. As for the 10 kor of barley which [broken off] at C6’s disposal: they are credited to B. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Arad-Marduk/Kittia//Šangû-Ea.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya(//Nūr-Sîn); B = Ea-nāṣir/Mušallim(//Šangû-Nanāya); C1 = …/Iddāya; C2 = Nabû-zēru-iqīša/Šākin-šumi; C3 = Rēmūt/Nabû-mukīn-apli; C4 = Silīm-..., slave of D; C5 = Tabnēa/Šangû-Zariqu; C6 = Itti-…; D = Nabû-rēmanni
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 187; Moldenke, CTMMA (1893), no. 25.
Title: MMA 79.7.19

Paraphrase:
Warranty for the sale of slaves.
A (lawfully) led away (ina qātē abāku) 2 female slaves (amīlūtu), fC1 and fC2, from B. In this text, D guarantees (našû) for these two slaves and confirms that he will bring them along (abāku) to Babylon and hand them over to A’s messenger (mār šipri). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/ Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B =  Nabû-kāṣir/Nabû-zēru-līšir; fC1 = fDidinnatu;  fC2 = fAlikšu-lūmur; D = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Nabû-na’id//Balāṭu
Title: BM 30991

Paraphrase:
Promissory oath.
A swears by the gods Bēl and Marduk, and by king Darius to B, C’s slave: "I will certainly pay by Tašrīt (VII) of Darius’s 15th regnal year according to what is stipulated in the promissory note for 1 mina of stamped(?) silver (ginnu) and 1/2 mina of medium-quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, which you issued for me in [a place the name of which is broken off]." Rest too fragmentary. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mukīn-apli(or Kināya)/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Šangû-Adad; B = Madānu-bēlu-uṣur, slave of C; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 31515

Paraphrase:
Land rental.
A gives land cultivated with grain (zēru pî šulpu) located in Šuppatu, along the Piqūdu Canal, for 3 years to B, for cultivation (errēšūtu). He should hoe (dekû) and turn over (pašāru) the ground, and […]. As long as he will watch over it, he will pay the šibšu-tax to the landlord just as the neighbour (itû) who lives above. Should he let the field go fallow (nadû Š), he shall still pay the šibšu-tax just as the neighbour (itû) who lives above. He does not have to deliver the šibšu-tax for the first year. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Kunāya//Sîn-šadûnu
Title: BM 30818

Bibliography: To be published by Johannes Hackl.
Title: BM 31874

Paraphrase:
Oath. Undertaking to close accounts.
A swears (tamû) to B before Bēl, Nabû and the majesty (adê) of king Darius that he will come (alāku) on the 21st day of Dûzu (IV) and will bring (našû)  … of B’s brother according to the written document (šaṭāru). He guarantees (pūt) for what C didn’t give (nadānu) and will satisfy the claim (harrānu ana šēpē ša PN šakānu) of B’s brother D. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-ul-īni/Nabû-udammiq//Rab-banê.
 
A = Nabû-uballiṭ/…//Ša-nāšišu; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Aplāya; D = Nādin
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 271; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 3 (1894), 58; Kienast 1988, 19; Sandowicz 2012, text O.164.
Title: BM 30931

Paraphrase:
List of the freemen before whom a statement has been made.
The document lists the names of 6 freemen (mār-banê) in whose presence (ina pāni) A declared that he did not see (amāru) B at his guard duty (maṣṣartu) on the 3rd of Ulūl (VI). The list is dated and was issued in Bīt-Hahhuru.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu(//Egibi); B = Bēl-ēreš/Kīnāya
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 335f.; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 4 (1898), 49; San Nicolò and Ungnad NRV, 617, no. 714.
Title: BM 30638

Paraphrase:
Apprenticeship contract
A gives voluntarily his slave C, a tailor (kāṣiru), to B to learn the craft of tailoring lamhuššu-garments (kāṣirūt lamhuššûti).
B will teach C the craft of the tailor (kāṣirūtu) for 2 years and 3 months.
A will pay (eṭēru) C 2 kor of flatbread (kusīpu) and will provide (katāmu D-stem) him till the end of the 2 years and 3 months with clothes (muṣiptu). They each took a copy of the document (šaṭāru). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Iddia/Ki-Sîn; C = name broken off
Title: BM 31341

Paraphrase:
Interim settlement of accounts within the framework of a business partnership (harranu). Fragmentary.
The document opens with a list of items, but their amounts are damaged. It concerns at least 100 vats for new, first-quality beer (rēštu), and broken amounts of  vats for old, first-quality beer empty vats,  fermenting vats (namzītu), 4+ slaves, 30+ kor of dates, 10+ kor of mustard seeds, x various amounts of silver, a.o. 7 shekels for the purchase of 80 kor of limestone/dung(?) ( abattu) and 1 shekel  for the purchase of kor of cress (sahlû). In total, 7 minas and 1 shekel of silver that have been inspected in the house (amāru). This is followed by a badly preserved passage which lists 60 kor of dates and miscellaneous amounts of silver that were put  at the disposal (ina pāni) of 5  named individuals (C1-5). Further also the  1 mina and 5 1/12 shekels of silver at C6’s disposal  of which 14 ½ shekels were  debited from the account tablet (lēˀu ) that registers  disbursals (tēlītu) since the 15th of [name of month is broken off] of the 3rd year, 20 2/3 shekels of scrap silver were paid out to/for (tēlītu) […] and 30 shekels of silver that were lent out in Neriglissar’s 0th year and are still outstanding. This brings us to a total of 10 minas and 28 shekels of silver in the business account of A and B that are are placed at B’s disposal. [The name is broken off] promises under oath (tamû) to(?) A that if fD , but at this point the tablet breaks off. Names of at least 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Bēlšunu(/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Sîn-imitti); C1 = Nabû-zēru-iqīša; C2 = Bēl-ahu-...; C3 and C4= [the names is broken off]; C5 = Iddin-Marduk; C6= Marduk-mušētiq-uddê; fD = fIshunnatu
Title: BM 31481

Paraphrase:
House rental.
A rents a house to B for 3 years, at a yearly price of 7 1/2 shekels of silver. It is agreed that half of the silver should be paid at the beginning of the year, and the remainder in the middle. The renter should caulk (šanû) the roof and repair the wall foundations (asurrû). He should also pay for the additional payment (nūptu) in Nisan (I), Dûzu (IV) and Kislim (IX). The house is at the renter’s disposal from the 1st of Arahsamna (VIII) onwards. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Bēl-uballiṭ/Aplāya//Ir’anni
Title: BM 30482

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house
This contract refers to a surface area of 32;0.5.14 gi (c. 401,77 m2) on which stands a built house (bītu epšu) and one in ruins (abtu), and still another part is unbuilt (kišubbû). The description of its location and neighbours is fragmentarily preserved. It is located in Bīt-Hursagkalamma in Kiš, near the house of the sons of Bēl-šumu-ibni/Miṣiraa to the west and near the house of B and the street […] to the east […].  A sells it (verb broken off) to a man whose name is broken off. The price is broken off as well. The seller's mother (whose name is broken off) was present (ina ašābi) at the sale. Names of 6 witnesses, 3 of whom belong to the same family as one of the neighbours (Miṣirāya), and the scribe: Tukulti-Marduk/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Atkuppu.
 
A = Mušallim-Marduk/…; B = Bābilāya/…
Title: BM 32653

Paraphrase:
Fragment of tablet about land.
The tablet is severely damaged; a plot of land is mentioned in its opening lines, but the context in which it appears is doubtful. From what is extant one infers that in the past A bought from B a plot of land located in Šuppatu which was adjacent to his property and to that of fC. The purchase price they agreed upon was 58 2/3 shekels of silver. Every other information is lost; the tablet certainly did not record a purchase of land, but it must have established some provisions related to this previous deal. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Mukīn-Marduk/Arad-Nabû//Asû; fC = fNidintu-Bāba/Rēmūt
Title: BM 31939

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
A purchases agricultural land (zēru) from a woman whose name is lost; also the description of the property is incomplete because of the poor condition of the beginning of the tablet. A few details on the neighbouring fields are still extant – the upper side is adjacent to (the property of) P]N and the lower side to (the property of) B; the lower front borders on (the property of) C. In total, this plot of land measures [x.x.]+1,5 Kor (20250+ m2), including (adi) 0;2.3 Kor (6750 m2) of wasteland (kišubbû, reconstructed): A has declared the equivalent for this land together with the seller (A itti fPN mahīra nabû išām). The precise amount of silver that has been established between the two as purchase price is lost in a lacuna of the tablet; only the sum given as additional payment (kî atri), 5 shekels, is preserved. The rest of the document in which the seller acknowledges that she received the full amount of silver and which records the warranty clause against future claims between the parties is severely damaged. The bottom half of the tablet with the list of witnesses, the name of the scribe and the date and place of issue of the document itself is completely broken off.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Murašû/…//Arad-Nergal; C = Bēl-ittannu/…//Arad-Nergal
Title: BM 32350

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: revision and allocation of shares in the light of a previous contract.
The text begins by recalling a business deal that took place in Šabāṭ (XI) of Nebuchadnezzar’s 30th year, when A – governor of Babylon (šākin ṭēm Bābili) – purchased 23;2.3 Kor (137250 m2) of agricultural land (zēru) from B, through his proxy C (ina našpartu). It was a field in the open country (eqel ṣēri), consisting partly of a cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi) bearing fruit (iṣṣi bilti), and partly of cultivated as well as newly cleared land (eqlu mērešu u taptû); the land was located above and below the New Canal, in front of the Enlil Gate in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon.
A payed 19 minas and 30 shekels of silver for this land; at the moment of the purchase, he sealed (kanāku) a document in which it was stated that if the field would have been found smaller or larger than what was originally calculated, the parties would satisfy each other’s claims (ahāmeš apālu ) in accordance with its price (kî mahīri). However, they never came nor measured the field.
The second half of the tablet, that records the new purchase and the consequences of the revision of the previous deal, is unfortunately severely damaged. One reads that, according to the king’s instruction, A, in his role of governor (šākin ṭēmūti) of the inhabitants of Babylon (mārē Bābili), had [...] and promised to the inhabitants of Babylon to give it (the field?) back [...].
Fifteen years after the first purchase, in the accession year of the king Neriglissar, D acquires (mahāru) this field (eqlu šuati), 23;2.3 Kor (137250 m2) of agricultural land (zēru), from A’s four sons E1, E2, E3 and E4. He pays 22 minas and 20 shekels of silver, and confirms that F owns a half share (ahi zitti ša F šakānu).
The rest of the tablet is too broken to allow a correct reconstruction of its contents: from what can still be read in the final clauses one infers that the full price has been received (eṭēru) and that there will be no opportunity to come back to the issue.  Names of 6 witnesses and 2 scribes.
The first half of this tablet refers to a purchase also recorded in BM32640+, BM48351 and BM41399.
 
A = Marduk-ēṭir/Marduk-zēru-ibni//Ēṭiru, šākin ṭemi of Babylon; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Šamaš-unammir//Basia; C = Aplāya/Iqīša-Marduk//Sîn-nādin-šumi; D = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; E1 = Marduk-šākin-šumi/Marduk-ēṭir//Ēṭiru; E2 = Iqīša-Marduk/Marduk-ēṭir//Ēṭiru; E3 = Nabû-bān-ahi/Marduk-ēṭir//Ēṭiru; E4 = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Marduk-ēṭir//Ēṭiru; F = Nergal-ušallim/Šumu-iddin//Ile''i-Marduk
Title: BM 32184

Paraphrase:
Sale of a donkey. Fragmentary.
The left side and middle part of the tablet are broken.
A sells B an earth-coloured she-donkey for 1 mina 14 shekels of silver. The description of this donkey in the first 3 lines is fragmentary. Legible are ša-hi-⌈x⌉ and ina muhhi tikki. A party (name broken) assumes guaranty against a person with prior claims (uškûtu) to the donkey. From here the rest of the tablet is broken. Fragmentary list of witnesses, including a member of the Egibi family. The scribe is Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi.
 
A=Bulluṭu/…-zēru-ibni; B=Ardia/Dādia//Nabāya
Title: BM 32052

Paraphrase:
Farm-sharing agreement concerning a heifer
A and B negotiate a cattle share-farming agreement in early summer (6th month). A allows B to use (lit. “gives”) a marukuttu-heifer (burtu, wr. alap bu-uš-tu4 ma-ru-šu-ut-tu4) during 5 years in return for a share (ana zitti) worth 1/3 minas of white silver. A is allowed to take (abāku) each bull (alap bi-i-ri) that is born in the course of this period for 1/3 minas of silver as soon as it has reached the full (qatû D) age of two. B guarantees for the care (suddudu), herding (rē'û) and guarding (maṣṣartu) of the heifer. They agree to share the milk products (iškarātu) and the calves (telittu The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. A short remark at the very end of the document states that A has not given B anything from what is due to B as his share. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Ubār/Arad-Bēl//Eppeš-ilī
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 280; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 3 (1894), 44f.; Petschow 1956 (NBPf. 68); Koschaker 1911, 258; Landsberger, MSL 8/1, 66; Meissner, BAW 2, 24f.
Title: BM 33086

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley. Partial payment of a debt.
Concerns the repayment of B's debt of 86;2.3 kor of barley to A. In the present document A receives 25 kor of barley, apart from the 24;2.3 kor of barley that was previously delivered. The remaining 36;1.3 korof barley is still pending. More on the repayment of this debt at BM30569 (= Nbk 191). Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Rēmūt/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Gahal; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi
Title: BM 30325

Paraphrase:
Hiring of a person
A will serve with B from the 20th of Nisan (I) till the 10th of Abu (V). B will pay him 10 shekels of silver as his salary (idu): half of it in Nisan (I) and the remainder at the end of Dûzu (IV). The person who violates the contract (nabalkutu) shall pay 5 shekels of silver. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Zababa-šumu-iddin/Šamaš-uballiṭ//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia
Title: BM 31072

Paraphrase:
Deposition before witnesses about the responsibility of guarding the palace gate.
The document lists 7 witnesses (A1, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6 and A7) who were present when, on the 27th Šabāṭ (XI) of Nebuchadnezzar’s 22nd regnal year, B and his warrantor C (māhiṣ pūti) have taken over the guarding (maṣṣartu naṣāru) for D until the closing of the palace gate (adi turri bābi ina bāb ekalli). After (malDītu , wr. ma-al-DI-tu4) the closing of the gate (turru bābi), these witnesses said to B and C: “The gate is closed, the lord may go”. On the edge of the tablet one reads the names of E1, the high officer (rab sikkati) and E2, the courtier (ša rēš šarri).
 
A1 = Šulāya/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; A2 = Pir’u/?; A3 = Nabû-zēru-ušabši/?; A4 = Bēl-ahhē-iqīša/?; A5 = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Bulluṭu; A6 = Mušallim-ilī/Rēmūt-Bēl; A7 = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Aplāya; B = Nabû-nebana-ilī (nabunabianaili, nabuibbianaili); C = Mušēbši-Marduk; D = Bēlet-ilia; E1 = Ana-muhhi-Bēl-amur, rab sikkati; E2 = Mušēzib-Nabû, ša rēš šarri
Title: BM 30655

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver. Purchase price for a slave.
A receives (mahāru) 12 shekels of silver, what remains (rīhtu) to be paid from the purchase price for the slave C which he sold to B. The rest of the tablet is broken off. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Rēmūt/Kurbanni-Marduk; B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; C = Mahrītu-Bē
Title: BM 31507

Paraphrase:
Dowry gift.
A gives of his own free will the dowry of his daughter fC to B. It consists of 1 kor (13500 m2) of land from his land at the Hazuzu ditch that is planted with trees (zēru zaqpu), 3 slaves (amēluttu) and household utensils. Each of the parties has taken one copy of the present document. Names of 3 witnesses, among them the brother of A, and the scribe Kurbanni-Marduk/Etellu//Ēṭiru, who is the son-in-law of A.
 
A=Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi, father of fC; B=Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bān-zēri/Bēl-ēṭir, groom; fC=fIna-Esagila-bēlet, bride and daughter of A.
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 335; Krecher 1970, 229; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 2 (1891), 11f.; Ziemer, BA 3 (1898), 471; Tallqvist 1891, 3ff.; Roth, JAOS 111 (1991), 26; Weingort 1939, 18.
Title: BM 30358

Paraphrase:
Injunction.
Concerns the debt (u’iltu) of 44 minas of silver, the capital sum (qaqqadu) which B owed to C and which  fA1 and A2 (B’s mother and son) took from (ultu pāni našû) D, C's son (after his death) in E's presence (ina pāni). On Addar (XII), 20th, of Darius‘ 3rd year fA1 and A2  will bring and hand over (našû-nadānu) these 44 minas of silver to D, the son of the creditor according to what was written in C’s promissory note. They guarantee for each other. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA1 = fKaššat/Nabû-ēṭir//Rab-banê; A2 = Bēl-iddin/Marduk-šāpik-zēri//Nāgiri; B = Marduk-šāpik-zēri//Bēl-uballiṭ//Nāgiri; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; D = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; E = Arahu
Bibliography: Kohler and Peiser, BRL 3 (1894), 23;  Koschaker 1911, 85; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 44.
Title: BM 30770

Paraphrase:
About a debt for silver. With pledge.
fA issued a promissory note for 1/2 minas of silver against B in Dûzu (IV), - exact day is broken off. After she took something or someone (the pertinent passage is badly preserved) as pledge , she gave(?) to C ... (and again, the passage is very fragmentary).  Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA = fBānâtu-Esagil/Šumu-iddin; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; C = Banê/Šumu-iddin
Title: BM 31564

Paraphrase:
Decision record, royal judges. About the settlement of a silver debt after the debtors' death
B1 and his wife (fB2) owed 3 minas and 50 shekels of silver to A. See also Mnb1809 (= TCL 12 122). A legal dispute arose about this debt between the creditor and C, the debtors' heir (iarītu), set against the background of the inheritance of the couple's property (nikkassu) in general, and their encumbered slaves (amīlūtu bīt maškāni) in particular. C declared that he does not want to take upon himself (epēšu) his father's inheritance (iaritūtu), and A should satisfy his claim (šalāmu) from (ina) the lien (bīt maškāni) on B1's slaves (amīlūtu) . Thereupon (arki), the creditor brought (abālu) four slaves (D1-4) from B1's household (nišū bīti) whom had been pledged to him before (ana mahar) the king's judges. They decide in his favor, and grant him the ownership over the slaves (pāni šudgulu) in lieu of (kūm) his claim of 3 minas and 50, being equal to the slaves' full market value (šīmu). They have been transferred to him (nadānu), he has received them (mahāru) and is satisfied (apālu) so that he cannot bring suit in the future (rugummu ul īšu). In order that there may never again be a lawsuit (la sahāru-ma la ragāmu) in the future (matima) about these slaves, the judges issued a written statement (ṭuppu šaṭāru), sealed it (barāmu) with their seals and gave it to A. Names of 5 witnesses, all judges (dayyānu), introduced by the formula ina mahar "before" and further identified as ṭuppi šāṭir "writer of the tablet". Second listed witness-judge is Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Lâbāši-Marduk//Ašgandu; B1 = Arad-Gula(/Nabû-ile’’i//Bā'iru); fB2 =  fDamqāya, wife of B1; C = Nergal-uballiṭ; fD1 = fAna-Tašmētu-atkal, slave of B1; fD2 = fAmtia, slave of B1; fD3 = Nanāya-ana-bītišu, slave of B1; D4 = Zababa-iddina, slave of B1.
Bibliography: Krecher 1979, 164; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 4 (1898), 85f; Marx, BA 4 (1902), 45 ff.; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 178; Scheil, RA 12 (1915), 100f; ; Moore, NBBAD (1935), 299; Meissner, AfO 11 (1936/1937), 153f; Wunsch, AfO 44/45 (1999), 59-100.
Title: BM 30645

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 10 kor of dates, the assessed field rent (imitti eqli) on land that belongs to fA's dowry (nudunnû). It is her 1/5th share in the rent income that she earns together with C. B should deliver the dates (- it is not explicitly said to whom -) in one payment according to the measure of fA 's father. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, (and) 1 darīku-container. There is still another claim (rašūtu) against B that is still pending. The settlement of accounts (epišti nikkassi) with the debtor concerning the imittu-dates of the 26th year is not yet completed (qatû). Witnesses.
 
fA = fErištu, daughter of D; B = Madān-iddin/ Ubār//Itinnu; C = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Nabû-šarru-uṣur; D = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Bibliography: Reedition: Wunsch 2000, No. 235. Roth, JAOS 111 (1991), 19-37 30, note 33
Title: BM 34546

Paraphrase:
Court record about the settlement of a debt
A argues his case (dibbu dabābu) against (itti) B before the E= sartennu and the judges of Nabonidus. C, B's father owed a debt of 2/3 minas and 4 shekels of silver to A's faher and a house belonging to C was pledged as collateral for the loan. The plaintiff presents the debtnote (u'iltu) to the judges and the sartennu and reads (šasû) it to (ina mahar) them. The judges and the sartennu demand (erēšu) from B to show written proof (riksu idātu) that the debt has already been paid (ša eṭēru), which he is unable to bring (abālu) After deliberation (malāku, Gt), the sartennu and the judges award (pāni dagālu Š) several parcels of B's land, amounting to a total of 2 reeds 2 cubits 8 fingerlengthsmeasuringto A. They also write a tablet (šaṭāru) including the precise dimensions of the parcel, to ensure the permancnee (ana la enê) of the land transfer,  seal it (ebēru) with their seals (kunukku), and hand it over to A.Names of the sartennu and 7 judges; and two scribes: Nergal-bānûnu//Rab-banê and Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi.
 
A = Nabû-gāmi/Nabû-ahhē-buliṭ//Miṣirāya (plaintiff); B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Nādin//Rab-banê (defendant); C = Nādin/Nabû-nādin-šumi//Rab-banê, father of B; D = Nādin; E= Sîn-erība (without affiliation), sartennu
Bibliography: reedition: Holtz 2014, no. 32; Krecher 1970, 165; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 2 (1891 70ff.; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.), 178; Koschaker 1911, 261; Meissner and Tallqvist, WZKM 4 (1890), 121f.
Title: BM 41415

Paraphrase:
Inheritance division: allocation of shares.
In its opening lines, the text mentions a previous document issued by A1, A2 und A3 (B’s sons), according to which they divided their shares (zâzu), by mutual agreement (mitgurtu). They agreed that the property of the business partnership (harrānu) established by their father and C would remain undivided (karû). Afterwards, in Cambyses’ 3rd regnal year, A1 allocated (uzzuzu, lit. “registered in the account”) to C a share in [x] kor of land planted with trees and grain (zēru zaqpu u mērešu), as well as 2 female slaves, fD1 and fD2. In Tašrīt (VII) of a year which cannot be determined since the numeral is lost in a lacuna, A1 and A3 settled their accounts (nikkassu qatû) […] (short launa) A3 did not allocate a share in the 37 1/2 shekels of silver to A1, his older brother. A3 sold (lit. “gave”, nadānu) to A1 his entire share in (the property located in) Bit[...]. In Cambyses’ 7th regnal year, the same 2 brothers agreed on the allocation of their shares (uzzuzu, lit. “registered in the account”) in the land located on the New Canal, which their father B assigned to their mother fE by means of a sealed document (kanāku - dagālu Š), providing that she would enjoy a lifelong usufruct of it (akalu akālu), and that after her death the land would become part of her sons’ assets. A2 transferred the property of his share (in this land) to his brother A3, writing the agreement in a sealed document (kanāku-dagālu Š); then, A3 sold (lit. “gave”, nadānu) the land that was A2’s share to his nephew F (the eldest son of A1), for 3 1/2 minas of silver. He received (eṭēru) this entire sum from F. As for the land located in Dilbat, this remains at A3’s disposal. As for the house located near G’s property, which A3 pledged (maškanu šakānu) for 2 1/2 minas to A1: he will pay this sum of silver to F, and F will give him the house back (muššuru). The 2 1/2 minas cannot be counted (manû) among the 3 1/2 minas of silver (which F owes for the purchase of A2’s share). F will release (zakû D) his father’s (A1) promissory note (u’iltu) related to 2 minas and 37 1/2 shekels of silver owed by A3, and he will give it to the debtor. A3 confirms that he did not (? The text is broken and its interpretation must be considered as speculative) sell the arable land (zēru) in Dilbat nor the one located at the opening (bitqu) of the Ile’’i-Bēl canal, whose surface amounts to 0;0.0.4 1/2 sq. kor (c. 337,5 m2) and that corresponds to A2’s fourth share, to F. The end of the tablet is fragmentary, but one can infer that the parties to this agreement take an oath to seal their accord. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: [Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk]/Bāni-zēri//Bēl-ēṭiru.
 
A1 = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu; A2 = Iddin-Nabû; A3 = Nergal-ēṭir; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi, father of A1, A2 and A3; C = Bēlšunu; fD1 = fNanāya-bēlu-uṣur; fD2 = fAna-bītišu; fE = fQudāšu, mother of A1, A2 and A3; F = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; G = Bēl-iddin/Rēmūtu//Dēkû
Title: BM 31959+

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
A purchases 1;0.5 Kor (15750 m2) of agricultural land (zēru) in the open country (eqel ṣēri) from B. It consists of cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi) bearing fruit (iṣṣi bilti), located in front of the Ištar Gate in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon, at the opening of the ancient Kutha canal.
The upper long side in the North borders on (the property of) A, the lower side in the South on (the property of) C; the upper front in the West is adjacent to the bank (kišādu) of the Euphrates and the lower front in the East to the royal street (harrān šarri). A declares the equivalent for this land, 1;0.5 Kor (15750 m2), together with the seller B (A itti B mahīra nabû išām) to be 16 shekels of silver per 0;0.1 kor (450 m2) of land. He gives (nadānu) B the total purchase price, amounting to 9 minas 20 shekels of silver, plus 9 1/3 shekel as additional payment (kî pî atri). B acknowledges that he has received (mahāru) in total 9 minas and 39 1/3 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), and he is satisfied (apālu  G Stat). The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. Fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of the seller B, instead of his seal impression (kunukku). Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-ēṭir/Bēl-ušēbši//Nūr-Sîn; C = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Ibnāya//Nūr-Sîn
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 2000, no. 199 A; Ball, PSBA 14 (1892), 167f.; Krecher 1979, 255; Unger 1931, no. 49.
Title: BM 32180+

Paraphrase:
Sub-pledge of a slave woman.
A took as a pledge (maškanu ṣabātu) B, a slave woman (qallatu) belonging to C1 and his wife fC2, for 22 shekels of silver and 15 kor (c. 2700 l) of barley. Now, with this document he pledges (maškanu šakānu) the same slave woman to D. Names of 4 witnesses (including fC2) and the scribe: Bēl-aplu-iddin/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti.
 
A = Nergal-ušallim/Arrabi; B = Aška’iti-ēreš; C1 = Silim-Bēl/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Qaqqadanītu; fC2 = fEsagila-rāmat/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ, wife of C1; D = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 212; Marx, BA 4 (1902), 61; Shiff 1987, no. 136.
Title: BM 30269

Paraphrase:
Fragment of a tablet concerning liabilities.
The content of this document cannot be reconstructed with certainty, given the poor condition of the tablet. In the first lines, one finds the name of a scribe (ṭupšarru), A. Then, a debt owed by B is mentioned – followed by fields (eqlu), houses (bītu) and possibly slaves (the word amīlūtu is lost because of a gap at the beginning of the line). In the following fragmentary passage the name of C is mentioned, followed by an unknown amount of silver that is at D’s disposal. E […] has received (našû) for the payment of the creditors (ana eṭēru ša rāšûti) […] In the final fragmentary passage three more names can be read: those of F1 and F2, and G. Names of 3 witnesses and 2 scribes: [Kabti-ilī-Marduk]//Atkuppu and [Libūru]//Nabûnnāya.
 
A = Libūru, scribe; B = Kidin-Marduk; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; D = Rēmūtu; E = Nabû-rīhtu-uṣur; F1 = Arad-Bēl; F2 = Ahhea; G = Marduk-šumu
Title: BM 41533

Paraphrase:
Establishment of a business partnership (harranu).
A1 and A2 invest 5 minas of silver and 130 pieces of empty barrels in a business partnership with two slaves: B1, slave of C and B2, slave of A2. The parties agree that the investors are entitled to a share in whatever the slaves make with the silver and the barrels in or out of town that equals that of the slaves. B1 and B2 should be fed (aklu akālu G, lit. "eat bread")) and clothed (mu%iptu katāmu N) for the entire period that they run the business (našpartu alāku), and this in addition (elat) to the household utensils that are (already) at their disposal. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; A2 = Marduk-Šāpik-zēri/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Nādin-še'im; B1 = Šēpit-Nabû-aṣbat, slave of C; B2 = Nabû-dīni-epuš, slave of A2; C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin
Bibliography: Petschow 1956 (NBPf.61) ; Krecher 1970, 178; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 2 (1891), 58; Koschaker 1911, 261.
Title: BM 41409

Paraphrase:
Warranty for a sold slave undertaken by the seller's son.
fA1, of her own free will, sold her slave C to B, for a full price (gamru) amounting to 1/2 mina and 5 shekels of silver. D, fA1’s son, guarantees against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person claiming (pāqirānu) that C is a royal slave (arad šarrūtu) or a free person (mār banê). They guarantee for each other. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA1 = fBēlilitu/Bēl-ušēzib//Ša-nāšišu; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; C = Bazūzu, slave of fA1; D = Etellu/Balāssu//Dannēa, son of fA1
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 140; Marx, BA 4 (1902), 53; Koschaker 1911, 261; Peiser, ZA 3 (1888), 83f.
Title: BM 30574

Paraphrase:
Delivery and sale of onions
Concerns a total of (napharu) 2000 bundles (pītu) of onions belonging to A and originating from land labeled “from the mountain” (ina šadî), stretching from (ultu) the border of the field of the sailor C1 as far as the border of the field of the sailor C2, according to (ki) the preferential share (pūt zittu) of D1 and D2. A delivers (nadānu) these onions to B. Out of this 2000 bundles, a 100 were taken out (muššuru) because de facto they belong to E and another 100 were taken out because of bad quality (bīšu). The remainder (rēhu) of 1800 bundles A sells to B for 1 mina of silver per 660 bundles. The sale is prompted (aki) (lit. in accordance with) by the credit claim (rašûtu) of F1 and F2, the royal merchants (tamkār šarri) (against A). A bears the responsibility (pūt našû) for the safekeeping (maṣṣartu) and the good quality of the bundles till the 10th day of Nisan (I) by then B should have received the dates. Names of 2 witnesses, including F2 and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ēda-uṣur/Rahiannu; B = Nabû-kuṣranni/Gabbi-ina-qātē-Šamaš; C1 = Iṣṣurri/Zabidaja; C2 = Nabû-bān-ahi; D1 = Šamaš-ahhē-iddin/Ša-Nabûšu; D2 = Kināya/Nergal-hazuili; E=Bēl-iddin/Nabû-kul-lim; F1=Ili-ha-na-nu/Gabbi-ina-qātē-Šamaš; F2=Ardia/Nabû-aha-iddin
Title: BM 32867

Paraphrase:
Promissory note
B owes A 10 mina of medium quality (nuhhutu) silver of which 1/8 is alloy (bitqu), 71 kor of dates and 13 kor of barley. He will deliver the 13 kor of barley in Simān (III) of the 20th year. In Addar (XII) he will pay the 10 mina of silver and deliver the 71 kor of dates at the canal in Babylon without interest. The payment of the debt is secured by the pledge (maškanu) of the debtor’s 98 m2 house, located in the street of Hubur next to the houses of C1 and C2. The elat-clause is broken. Names of 8 witnesses and the scribe: Mušēzib-Marduk/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Rab-banê. See also the receipts: MLC 689 (BRM 1 79 // Dar. 539), BM30255 (Dar. 545), BMUnknown(Dar536) and the promissory notes: BM30746 (Dar. 507); BM35338 (Dar. 462).
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Bēl-ēṭir//Ir’anni; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C1 = Ardia/Apkallu; C2 =Nergal-zēru-ibni
Title: BM 31578

Paraphrase:
Settlement of a silver debt.
Concerns the claim for payment (rašûtu) which A holds against B2 and (originally) B1, his father. The parties shall not sue each other (ragāmu D) in the future, as the entire debt (rašûtu gabbu) has been paid off (eṭēru, G Stat.). The document also relates to C's debt (to B1) for which his house had been given in antichresis as security: B1 had after-pledged this house to A together with his creditnote (u'iltu) and the securities it included, a.o. the guarantees given by Šulāya (=B1 or D?) and E that the debt be repaid (pūt eṭēri našû). This debt is settled as well (eṭēru, G Stat.). Any document (u'iltu) that should turn up in A's house about a claim for payment (rašûtu) to him against B2, Šulāya (=B1 or D?), C or E, is considered invalid (lit. "broken", hepû D, wr. hu-up-pa-a'). Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nergal-uballiṭ/Išum-uballiṭ//Bēl-ēṭiru; B1 = Šulāya/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//Egibi; B2 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; C= (Marduk-)šāpik-zēri/Marduk-zāru-ibni//Šangû-Ninurta; D = Šulāya, without affiliation (either = B1 or another Šulāya); E = Arad-Bēl, without affiliation.
Title: BM 30348

Paraphrase:
House rental.
A rents C’house to B for a yearly rental price of 24 shekels of stamped silver (ginnu). The house is located near (the one of) D1 and D2.
 
A = Iddināya/Mušēzib-Šamaš//Saggilāya; Širku/Iddināya//Egibi; C = Šahhuru; D1 = Bēl-nādin-apli/Bēl-bullissu; D2 = Nidintu/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Saggilāya
Title: FLP 1421

Paraphrase:
Sale of slaves.
A, of his own free will, sells his female slaves fC1 and fC2, to fB for a total purchase price amounting to 3 minas of silver. The seller guarantees against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person claiming (pāqirānu) that they are palace slaves (amat ekalli) or free persons (mār banê). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-Šāpik-zēri/Bēl-uballiṭ//Nagiru; Bf = fIna-Esagila-rāmat/Zēria//Nabāya; fC1 = fBānitu-guzu; fC2 = fNinlil- Silīm
Title: BM 30362

Paraphrase:
About the property of a childless couple, possibly implying their divorce. Fragmentary.
A has married (ana aššūtu rašû) fB the 28th year of Nebuchadnezzar, but the couple did not have (rašû) any male or femal offspring (māru u mārtu). Together (itti ahāmeš), they wrote a document (ṭuppu) according to which their assets (nikkassu) and land (eqlu) belong to both of them (aḫata šunu). A court protocol (ṭuppu dīni) that belongs to the couple is mentioned, but here the tablet breaks off. List of witnesses, among which are C1,C2, and C3. Scribe: Šamaš-nāṣir/Bēl-ušallim//Miṣirāya.
 
A = …/Nabû-le’’i//Bā’iru; fB = fDamqāya/Ina-tēšê-ēṭir//Marduku, wife of A; C1 = Tabnēa/Nabû-le’’i//Bā’iru; C2 = Bēl-nāṣir/Nabû-le’’i//Bā’iru; C3 = Bēl-kāṣir/Šākin-šumi//Marduku
Title: BM 31921

Paraphrase:
Sale of land and receipt of the purchase price
A sells a built house (bītu epšu) measuring 6;0.6.13 sq. r (c. 84,94 m2) and located in Šuanna in Babylon to B.
1;0.0.2.13 r (c. 8,27 m) upper long side in the West near C’s house; 1;0.0.1.8 r (c. 7,66 m) lower long side in the East near D’s house; 1/2;0.0.6.13 r (c. 6,77 m) upper front in the North near E’s house; 1/2;0.0.6.15 r (c. 6,77 m) lower front in the South near the same plot of land – in total, 4;0.1.17 sq. r (c. 51,98 m2) of land, first measured area.
1/2;0.0.6.15 r (c. 6,77 m) upper long side in the North near the previous measured area, 1/2;0.0.6.12 r (c. 6,74 m) lower long side in the South near the … Canal; 1/2;0.0.2.4 r (c. 4,58 m) upper front in the West near C’s house; 1/2;0.0.3 r (c. 5 m) lower front in the East near D’s house – in total, 2;0.6.13 sq. r (35,94 m2) of land, second measured area.
A declares the equivalent for this land, 6;0.6.13 sq. r (c. 84,94 m2) in total, together with the seller B to be 1 mina and 15 shekels of silver for each 1/2 gar (12,5 m2) for a total purchase price amounting to 8 2/3 minas of silver. The buyer pays the total purchase price, plus 17 shekels of silver as additional payment and a garment for the lady of the (sold) house. B acknowledges that he has received in total 8 minas and 57 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), and he is satisfied (apil). The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. What remained of B's debt to Marduk's temple has been settled with the silver from the sale (kaspu šīm bīt šuāti ana makkūr Marduk nadin). Names of 9 witnesses, includingArad-Bēl/Bēl-uballiṭ, an oblate (širku) of Marduk and 2 temple scribes (tupšar bīt Marduk: Nabû-nāṣir/Sîn-tabni and Balāṭu/Arad-Ea). Name of the scribe: Libūru//Nabûnnāya.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Šūzubu/Nabû-nādin-urri; C = Ardia/Apkallum; D = Nergal-zēru-ibni/Bēl-ile’’i; E = Bēl-ile’’i/Esagilāya; F = Arad-Bēl/Bēl-uballiṭ;
Title: BM 32892

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave
A1 and his wife fA2 gave their slave C to B as a pledge for 50 shekels of silver, and they have set a due date (adannu) (for the payment of their debt). Now (since the term has passed by and they cannot pay), A1 and fA sell this slave to B, for an hariṣ-price amounting to 50 shekels of silver. The sellers guarantee against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person raising claims (pāqirānu) about this slave. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Zēria; fA2 = fĒṭirtu/Ahhē-iddin, wife of A1; B = Tēšê-ēṭir/Nabû-le'’i//Šamaš-abārī; C = Nabûma-attū'a
Title: BM 30654

Paraphrase:
Promissory oath.
Beginning broken. The texts becomes legible while in the middle of a direct speech: " … A will bring along the men and […] who have been mustered for(?) B, and C, the agricultural worker (errēšu). He will hand them over to B in Opis."  Should he fail to do so, there will be a "reduction of the money bag" (miṭītu ša himti). D will pay in full the 14 1/3 minas of silver which are due to B. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe: Nabū-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya
 
A = Silīm-Bēl/…//…; B = Nergal-šarru-uṣur/Bēl-šumu-iškun; C = Bādî-il; D = Nabû-kuzub-ilāni
Title: BM 31493

Paraphrase:
Fragment of a tablet concerning land rental.
A rents arable land (zēru) which he owns together with his brothers, located along the Harru-ša-Ina-qibi-Bēl and near C’s field, to B, who should perform gardening work (nukaribbūtu). Rest broken off. Names of 1+ witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-Rē'ûšunu; C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Talīmu
Title: BM 32098

Paraphrase:
Land rental.
The top of the tablet is broken off. The document concerns land located on the New Canal, rented by fA to B. The renter should irrigate it by drawing water from a well (ina dālu dalû). Both fA and B will enjoy the yield. The renter should dig a ditch above the canal. In a broken context, arable land (zēru) belonging to C is mentioned. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA = fQudašu; B = Šulāya/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Edu-ēṭir; C = Nergal-ēṭir
Title: BM 31401

Paraphrase:
Dowry gift. Substitute of promised dowry silver by a female slave.
A asked B to give his nubile (batultu) daugher fC in marriage (ana aššati nadānu) to his son D, and B accepted. In this document, the two take arrangements with regard to fC’s dowry (nudunnû), that will consist of: 1 mina of silver, 3 female slaves fE1, fE2, fE3 and household goods (udê bīti). However, B has given (nadānu) his female slave (qallatu) fF to A, in lieu of 2/3 of the 1 mina of dowry silver, corresponding to her complete value (ana šīm gamru). Then, B will give to A 1/3 of a mina of silver, the amount still due (babtu) on the one mina of silver, for the dowry to be completely paid (apālu G stat.). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 6 witness and the scribe: Nabû-mukīn-apli/Pir’//Uballissu-Gula.
 
A = Nabû-nādin-ahi/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Arad-Nergal; B = Šumu-ukīn/Mušallimu; fC = fIna-Esagila-banât, daughter of B; D = Uballissu-Gula, son of A; fE1 = fLa-tubaššinnu, fE2 = fIna-ṣilli-Esabad, fE3 = fTaslimu; fF = fNanāya-kīširat, slave of B
Title: BM 30958

Paraphrase:
List of the freemen before whom a statement has been made.
The document lists the names of 6 freemen (mār-banê) in whose presence (ina pāni) A took over the responsibility (pūtu našû) for B toward (ina qātē) C. The list is dated and was issued in Bīt-Hahhuru.
 
A = Bēl-ēreš; B = Nabû-bullissu/Nidintu-Bēl; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu(//Egibi)
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 336; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 4 (1898), 49; Koschaker 1911, 41; 258.
Title: BM 31342

Paraphrase:
Apprenticeship contract
A gives (nadānu) voluntarily his slave C to the stone cutter (purkullu) B, who is a slave (qallu) of the crownprince (mār šarri) Cambyses, during 4 years to learn the craft of stone cutter (purkullūtu).
B will teach C the craft of stone cutter. When he fails to do so, he will pay 20 shekels of silver (to the slave or his owner). When he teaches him in the 4 years the craft, … (broken off).
A will provide (katāmu D-stem) C with clothes (muṣiptu).
Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
At the end of the document, after the list of witnesses, place and date, there is a fragmentary line mentioning 5 shekels of silver, the month Nisan (I) and the verb nadānu. 
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Hašdāya; C = Gûzu-ina-Bēl-aṣbat
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 216; Petschow 1956 (NBPf.) 171; San Nicolò 1950, 32; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 2 (1891), 53f.; Demuth, BA 3 (1898), 421f.
Title: BM 30976

Paraphrase:
Interim settlement of accounts in court, within the framework of a business partnership.
Concerns the business partnership that A and his son B ran C and D as their co-workers (šutāpu) between Nabopolassar's 18th year and Nebuchadnezzar's 18th year, i.e. for at least 21 years. The partners settle their accounts before the judges (nikkassu epēšu);  It is decided (parāsu) that A and B (still) owe 50 shekels of silver, but that there are no other claims between them. The partnership is dissolved, an oath before the community (puhru) and the gods has been taken (nīšu zakāru), and their accounts are settled (epuš nikkassi qatû). All  promissory notes have been broken (i.e. invalidated). Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-mukīn-apli, father of B; B = Nabû-Bēlšunu, son of C; C = Šulāya/ŠNabû-)Zēru-ukīn(//Egibi); D = Mušēzib-Bēl (without affiliation)
Title: BM 30328

Paraphrase:
House rental.
A rents a house located at (ina) the Giššu-Gate to B for 3 years, for a yearly rental price amounting to 16 shekels of silver. The renter should caulk (šanû) and repair the roof. He should pay for the additional payment (nūptu) in Nisan (I), Dûzu (IV) and Kislim (IX); it is also agreed that half of the silver should be paid at the beginning of the year, and the remainder in the middle. The house is at the renter’s disposal from the 1st day of a month whose name is broken. B has already paid (verb broken off) 8 shekels of silver from the rental price. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Arad-Bēl/Kalbāya//Šumu-libši
Title: BM 31182

Paraphrase:
Dissolution of a business (partnership).
The document opens with a list of the equipment (udû) that A should give (nadānu) to fB, slave of C: 5 beds (eršu), 10 chairs (kussû), 3 tables (paššuru), 1 lamp stand (ingurēnu), 3 knives (sirpu), 1 iron spade (marru), 1 axe (qulmu), 1 fermenting vat (namzītu), 1 potstand (kankannu), 1 kettle (mušahhinu), 1 stand for a large vessel (šiddatu), 1 pair of tongs (maššānu), 1 chest (arannu) of ušukullatu - reed. They no longer own anything jointly. They will not renew litigation (târu) against each other. A is not allowed to take out (wr. ul <ú!>-še-UṢ-ṣu lit. will cause to go out) any of the equipment that belongs to fB between now and (adi) the end of Šabāṭ (XI). fB will pay the house rent (idu) from her own assets (ultu ramānišu nadānu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe. After the list of witnesses, the scribe, date and place, it is mentioned that A should give the document that states D’s credit claim to fB.
 
A = Marduk-iqīšanni (without affiliation); fB = fIshunnatu (without affiliation); C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu(/Šulāya//Egibi); fD = fLillikanu (without affiliation)
Title: BM 31046

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land. Transfer of silver to the Esagila as compensatory payment.
The tablet records the purchase of agricultural land; the text has been divided into paragraphs, marked on the tablet by a line drawn at the end of each one (and indicated below in the paraphrase by LINE).
A purchases 24 Kor (324000 m2) of agricultural land (zēru) from the four brothers B1, B2, B3 and B4. The land is located in the open country (eqel ṣēri), and it consists partly of cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi) and partly of cultivated as well as newly cleared land (mērešu u taptû) above and below the New Canal in from of the Enlil Gate, in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon. LINE
Its upper side in the West borders on (the property of) C1, C2, C3 and C4 and its lowers side in the East on (the property of) D. Its upper front in the North borders on the royal domain (eqel pīhat šarri) and its lower front on the dam of the hanšus (makallû ša hanšānē). LINE
2 kor (27000 m2) of this land is planted with big date palms whose value (šuqultu) corresponds to 9 minas of silver, i.e. 1 shekel of silver for each 6 2/3 gar (50 m2); 1;4.1.4 Kor (25050 m2) is planted with young date palms (tālāni) whose value (šuqultu) corresponds to 2 minas and 47 shekels of silver, i.e. 1 shekel of silver for each 20 GAR (150 m2). The remaining 20;0.4.2 Kor (271950 m2) is cultivated as well as newly cleared land (mērešu u taptû) whose value (šuqultu) corresponds to 10 minas and 4 1/3 shekels of silver, i.e. 1 shekel of silver for each 60 GAR (450 m2). A declares the equivalent for this land together with the sellers B1, B2, B3 and B4 (A itti B mahīra nabû) to be 21 minas and 51 1/3 shekels of silver for its total price, plus 28 2/3 shekels of silver as additional price (kî atar). LINE
In total, the four brothers have received 22 minas and 20 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), corresponding to the total price for this field. The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. B1, B2, B3 and B4, then, hand over this silver to the Esagila as compensatory payment (šullundu): they were in fact in debt for oxen that were part of Marduk’s property (makkūru). Names of 8 witnesses (the šākin-ṭēmi of Babylon and 7 judges) and of 4 scribes. The tablet shows multiple fingernail and seal impressions.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin; B1= Marduk-šākin-šumi/Marduk-ēṭir//Ēṭiru; B2 = Iqīša-Marduk/Marduk-ēṭir//Ēṭiru; B3 = Nabû-bān-ahi/Marduk-ēṭir//Ēṭiru; B4 = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Marduk-ēṭir//Ēṭiru; C1 = Silīm-Bēl/Arad-Nergal//Ibni-ilu; C2 = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Iddinnunu/Bēl-ēṭiru; C3 = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Marduk-šarrani//Itinnu; C4 = Kalbāya/Zākiru//Bēl-ēṭiru; D = Nabû-ēreš/Šulāya//Sîn-nādin-šumi
Title: BM 41399

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
Fragment of a tablet: only the final part of the text with the closing formulas is preserved. The buyer, B, acknowledges that he has received the full amount of silver that was due for his field and he is satisfied (apālu  G Stat). The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other; should someone from the Andahar (i.e. the seller’s) family complain against this purchase, the claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the received silver. One final clause states that should a claim (paqāru) arise (bašû N) C, B’s brother, will clear the property (murruqu) and will hand it over to the buyer, A. Names of 2+ witnesses; name of the scribe lost.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-uballiṭ/Lūṣi-ana-nūr//Andahar; C = Iddin-Bēl/Lūṣi-ana-nūr//Andahar

Agreement about the measurement of a field after the sale and after the seller’s death.
A purchased 1 kor (13500 m2) of arable land (zēru) from B (ana kaspi mahāru) in Šabāṭ of Cambyses 2nd year. Part of the land is already cultivated (mērešu), while the other part is newly prepared for cultivation (taptû) and it includes scattered date palms. On the day of the purchase, they put the agreement down in writing in a sealed document; the buyer took a written and sealed copy of the agreement (kanāku - leqû), which also specifically clarifies (šūdû [edû]) that they will check the measurements of that field. Should it be found larger or smaller (atru u maṭû) than what was originally calculated, they will compensate each other (ahāmeš apālu ). However, the seller died before the land could be measured. After a gap in the tablet, the text resumes and mentions the name of C, possibly a neighbour whose plot of land extended up to the dam of the hanšû (makallû ša hanšānē). The passage is too broken to determine the exact context. At the end of the document, A agrees with D (no doubt the seller’s legal successor) that they will not make claims against each other about the measurement of the field. To seal the deal, they both pronounce an oath. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Bazūzu/Etellu//Išparu; C = Marduk-rēmanni/N[abû-…]; D = Bēl-ahhē-iddin
Title: BM 30363

Paraphrase:
Testimonies (a.o. under oath) about the role of a slave as witness. Fragmentary.
A large part of this fragmentarily preserved document consists of declarations in direct speech in which the role of C, witness to a property transfer, is discussed. In the opening lines, in fact, A1 declares under oath (nīš zakāru) before the judges (dayyānu) that he does not know (idû) C, the third witness listed in the tablet (ṭuppu) that records the transfer of assets (nikkassu) to fB2. The name of the donor is lost in a lacuna, but can safely be reconstructed as B, and if we assume that fB2 the beneficiary, was his wife, we are dealing with a property transfer between husband and wife. Then A2 testifies (verb is broken off) before D, the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Babylon that when B1 (the donor) fell ill, he sent E to someone (possibly C), asking him to come over. He (possibly C) eventually went to B1 (ana pāni alāku) and they decided not to bring suit against A2 (itti dabābu). The following fragmentary passage mentions B1’s arable land (zēru) and building plots (qanû), and again states that "they did not bring suit". It seems that a dispute had arisen about some of the assets that B1had transferred to fB2, but that it eventually did not lead to a formal lawsuit. In the final lines, mostly lost, the role of C is brought up again in directly quoted testimonies by persons whose identity cannot be established. It is claimed that he could strictly speaking not act as witness (šībū), considering the fact that he is a slave (qallu šū). Someone apparently allowed him to be listed (šaṭāru) among the witnesses since they were both present (amāru, lit. "to see") when the purchase price was paid (mahīru nadânu). Finally, in a direct speech someone states that although B1's tablet has been changed (enû), he/she remembers (hasāsu) to whom it had been given. On the lower edge of the tablet there are the seal impressions of 5 judges: F1, F2, F3, F4, F5.
 
A1 = (name broken off)]; A2 = (name broken off); B1 = Nabû-mukīn-apli;  fB2 = fBunanītu; C = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Nabû-šumu-ibni//Rišana-Esangila; D = Nabû-iddin, šākin ṭēm Bābili; E = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti; F1 = Nergal-Bānûnu, judge; F 2 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin, judge; F 3 = Nabû-šumu-ukīn, judge; F 4 = Bēl-ēṭir, judge; F 5 = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi, judge
Title: MM 363b

Paraphrase:
Resettlement of claims among business partners.
Concerns A1's and A2's claim (rašûtu) for at least 150 bundles (pītu) of onions (exact amount is broken off) that they hold against B within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu). The onions are C's investment in the business. A promissory note stating B's indebtness has been issued (u'iltu e'ēlu). In the present document A1 transfers his part of the claim to A2 (pāni dagālu) who thus becomes the sole titleholder (ana muhhi e'ēlu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.

A1 = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Bēl-ušallim//Arkat-ilī; A2 = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia; B = Šumu-ukīn/Zēria; C = Silīm-Bēl/Bēl-nādin-apli//Kānik-bābi
Title: BM 31563

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley. Partial payment of a debt
Concerns the repayment of B's debt of 86;2.3 kor of barley to A. Part of it, namely 24;2.3 is paid directly to A in accordance with the promissory note; another part is paid to one of A's creditors, D, as follows: he receives from B a slave named C and worth (šīmu) 18 kor of barley as well as 6;2.3 kor of barley. More on the repayment of this debt at BM30325 (= Nbk 212). Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Rēmūt/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Gahal; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; C = Bēl-šullimanni; D = Nabû-ēṭir/Rēmūt-Bēl
Title: BM 30569

Paraphrase:
Hiring of a person
A1 and A2 will travel overland (ana ṣēri alāku) with B, the slave of C  for a monthly payment of 4 ½ shekels of silver, leaving this very day (the 11th of Ayyar (II)). Their parents (C and fD) receive (maḫāru) their (children’s) one-month salary (idu), namely the 4 ½ shekels of silver, from B. The person who violates the contract (nabalkutu) shall pay 4 ½ shekels of silver. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nādin(/Marduk-nāṣir//…); A2 = …/Marduk-nāṣir]//…; B = Ṣilli-Bēl, slave of C; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; D = Marduk-nāṣir, father of A1 and A2; fE = Ṭubūtu, mother of A1 and A2
Title: BM 31220

Bibliography: To be published by Johannes Hackl.
Title: BM 32073

Paraphrase:
About a slave sale: delivering obligation.
D sold three slaves to B: C, for 1 mina and 30 shekels of silver, plus E1 and E2 for 3 minas and 30 shekels of silver. By the end of Dûzu, the seller's brother A will bring one of the sold slaves (C), and deliver him (abāku-ma nadānu) to B. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Bēl-ahhē-erība/Rē'i-sīsê; B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; C = Nabû- kiššunu; D = Bēlšunu/Bēl-ahhē-erība/Rē'i-sīsê; E1 = Nabû-killanni; E2 = Ninlil-šadū'a
Title: BM 31156

Paraphrase:
Deposition.
Concerns A's legal efforts to take possession of four slaves as compensation for having repaid a debt on behalf of C1  and his wife. In Nabonidus’ 8th regnal year, B raised a claim against C1 (concerning) 2 1/3 minas of silver, and issued a promissory note against him and his wife fC2. He took their children fD1, fD2, fD3 and D4, their house and every property they held inside and outside the city as a pledge. They guaranteed for each other and A guaranteed for the payment as well. Now, C1 did not pay; he and his wife died – after which B brought A in front of Nabonidus' judges who looked into the written legal evidence (riksu). They entitled (rašû Š) A to those 2 1/3 minas of silver, apart from the silver that he had previously given to the creditor.  A paid the silver to B, he has given A the promissory note as well as a copy (gabrû) of the process protocol (ṭuppi dīni). The judges referred A back (nahāsu Š) to C1’s house to recup his silver from the inheritance. A then brought E1, C1’s heir (iarītu) and fE2, his sister-in-law, before the judges. They looked into his documents and E1 and fF declared that they don't want to take up C1’s inheritance (iaritūtu epēšu) and agree that A takes as pay-off (šalāmu G) from C's property (nikkassu) and from the slaves (amīlūtu) that had been pledged to him. Thus they (fem. pl.) undid A's document (ṭuppu paṭāru G; partly uncl.) and … (verb broken off).  From the following fragmentary passage, that continues to report A’s speech, it becomes clear that he took possession (abāku) of the four slaves (fD1, fD2, fD3 and D4 ) for the 3 minas and 50 shekels of silver, covering future as well as previous claims against C1’s and fC2. As a result the slaves are at his disposal (ina pāni). His document related to their status of free persons (mār banê) is sealed. The end of the plaintiff's speech is damaged: it mentions the issue of bringing along witnesses (muddû abāku) and taking an oath by E1-2, (C1’s two nephew) and G. This is followed by a break of about 10 lines. At the end the judges, having heard the witnesses (mukinnūtu)  gave (verb reconstructed) fD1, mother of fD2  and the slaves … fD2 to A. A month later the case is readdressed in BM30645 (=Nbn 668). Names of 7 judges and 2 scribes; third listed witness-judge is Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi.
