He had now brought suit (ragāmu) claiming: "I am a free person (mār banê),  in the employment of (ṣabātu, lit. "held by") D, the third man (tašlīšu) of E1 and fE2 C’s daughter”. They argued the case (dīnu dabābu) before the chief judge (sukkallu), the chief officials (rabû), as well as Nabonidus’ judges (dayyānu). They heard their matter and read the contract(s) (riksu) related to the slave status (ardūtu) of A from Nebuchadnezzar’s 35th regnal year to Nabonidus’ 7th regnal year when he was (eventually) sold (to H). He had been taken as pledge (maškanu šakānu), given as a dowry to fF who at a later time sealed a document according to which she handed him over together with a house share to G1, her son, and G2, her husband. The judges asked A to show them (kalāmu D) evidence of his free status (mār banûti). A answered (apālu) this: “I fled twice from my master’s house, and I hid (lit. “I was not seen”) for many days. Since I was afraid, I said so: ‘I am a free person (mār banê)!’ But I do not hold the status of free person. I am fB’s slave, redeemed by payment of silver! She has handed me over to fF, her daughter, who has sealed a document according to which I belonged to G1, her son, and G2, her husband. Since fB’s and fF’s death, I have been a slave owned (lit. “sealed”) for silver by H. I will go and serve (palāhu) my master (bēlum)”. The chief judge (sukkallu), the chief officials (rabû) and the judges (dayyānu) heard his testimony (mukinnūtu) and restored his slave status (kî ardūtu turru) while E1 and fE2 (C’s daughter), and fF, who gave the dowry, were present (ina uzuzzi) . Names of 3 witnesses: Sîn-šēzib, the chief judge (sukallu), Šuma-ukīn and Nergal-ahu-uṣur, the judges; and the scribe: Ile''i-Marduk//Eppeš-ili.  Seal impression of the 2 judges and Kiribtu, the kizû.
 
A = Barīki-ilāni; fB = fGagāya/…, mother of fF; C = Ahu-nūri/Nabû-nādin-ahi; D = Bēl-rēmanni; E1 = Šamaš-udammiq/Nabû-nādin-ahi; fE2 = fQudāšu/Ahu-nūri; fF = fNuptāya/Gagāya, daughter of fB; G1 = Zababa-iddin, son of fF; G2 = Iddināya, husband of fF; H = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 33084

Paraphrase:
Addendum to a house sale.
A has purchased (ina qātē mahāru) a house from B1, B2, C and C's brothers. The present document was drafted with the sole aim to point out that fD was present to witness (ana mukīnnūti ašābu) the conclusion of A's purchase (lit. ina ṭuppi ša A "at A's tablet”), thus implying her consent to it. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B1 = Lâbāši/Marduk-zēru-ibni; B2 = Kalbāya/Marduk-zēru-ibni; C = Gimil-Gula/Zēria; fD = fIlat/Nabû-ēṭir
Bibliography: Krecher 1990, 141; Peiser, KB 4 (1896), 204ff.; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 3 (1894), 62; Koschaker 1911, 261.
Title: BM 30848

Paraphrase:
Receipt of payment; purchase of land. Fragmentary.
A buys 6 sq. r (c. 73,5 m2) of land (erṣetu) from B, including a house in ruins (abtu) and a reed building (huṣṣu) located in Tē, in Babylon. Its upper long side in the North is adjacent to the broad Mutaq-Nergal-ša-hadê street, and the lower long side in the the South borders on C’s house. Its upper front in the West is adjacent to the Šullaṣu-street and the lower front in the East borders on D’s house. The last lines of the tablet are severely damaged: from what is extant, one infers that at first the field-price ratio is set out (1 2/3 minas of [silver…] per each unknown surface of land) and subsequently the full purchase price is fixed. An additional payment (atru) of 4 shekels of silver as well as a garment given as expenditure (tēlītu) is also part of the agreement. Names of the witnesses and the scribe are lost.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Šaddinnu/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Mandidi; C = Bēl-aplu-iddin//Iddin-Marduk; D = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Silīm-Bēl//Sîn-karābī-išme
Title: BM 32024

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a building lot.
A purchases 17;0.4.17 1/2 sq.r (c. 216,5 m2) of land from B: this consists of a building plot with a house in ruin in Tē, near Babylon. Given its irregular shape, the land is calculated according to two measured areas. The area of the first one covers 14 r (171,5 m2) in total: its upper long side in the West is 2 1/2;0.0.6.8 r (c. 20,66 m) long and borders on the surface area of the night guard’s sons – the lower long side in the East, 3;0.0.2 r (c. 22 m) long, is adjacent to the way out (mūṣû) of the same field and C’s house. The lower front in the North measures 1;0.0.30 r (c. 22 m) and borders on the way out (mūṣû) of (the property belonging to) the night guard’s sons and D; the lower front side in the South is 1;0.0.3 1/2 r (c. 8,75 m) long and borders on E’s house. The second measured area covers 3;0.0.4.17 1/2 r (c. 45,02 m2) in total. Its upper long side in the North is 1;0.0.0.14 r (c. 7,29 m) long and is again adjacent to the way out (mūṣû) of (the property belonging to) the night guard’s sons and D; the lower long side in the South measures 1;0.0.1.8 r (c. 7,66 m) and borders on C’s house. Its lower front in the West is 1/2;0.0.5 1/2 r (c. 6,25 m) long and is adjacent to the same field as the first measured area; the lower front side in the East, which measures 1/2;0.0.4 1/2 r (c. 5,75 m), is adjacent to the broad street. A declares the equivalent for this land, 17;0.4.17 1/2 sq.r (c. 216,5 m2) in total, together with the seller B to be 18 1/3 shekels of silver for each 1/2 sq. r (12,5 m2) of land. The buyer gives (nadānu) the total purchase price (šīmu gamru) amounting to 6 2/3 minas and 2 1/3 shekels of silver, plus 8 shekels as additional payment. B acknowledges that he has received in total [...]+5 1/3 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), and he is satisfied. The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. To make sure that the agreement will not be changed, they have taken an oath by Nabû, Marduk and the king. Names of 11 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Marduk-Šāpik-zēri/Marduk-zēru-ibni//Šangû-Ninurta; C = Gimillu/Itti-Esagila-zēri//Šangû-Ea; D = Ibnāya/Balāssu//Bā'iru; E = Bānia/Nabû-kullimanni
Title: BM 32870

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver
B owes a broken amount shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be paid in Abu (V). Witnesses.

A = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Arad-Bēl; B = Širku (aka Marduk-nāṣir-apli)/Iddināya//Egibi
Title: BM 31946

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Fixation of interest.
B owes 5/6 minas and 4 shekels of silver to A, to be paid with interest (hubullu) in Tašrīt (VII). The interest is fixed at 20%, to be paid on a monthly basis. In addition, there is an earlier claim for [the rest of the document is broken off]. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Līšir/Nabû-tabni-uṣur//Sîn-šadûnu
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 31114

Paraphrase:
Land rental. 
Concerns [x] kor of arable land located in Nuhšanitu, together with B1’s and B2’s guardhouse and an orchard - land stretching from the branch of the Borsippa Canal to […]. A received this land from C (and then) leased it to B1 from the house of Bibānu. […] The lessor should spade it and irrigate it with floodwater. He is responsible for gardening the date palm fronds (libbu) and branches (harūtu). He should also dig an exit(?). He guarantees for the land and the orchards; he should not cut off (murrû) the fresh dates (uhinnu). He should build a wall around the orchards and tilt(?) (kanāšu) the dam. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.

A = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Bunene-bān-zēri//Bēl-ēṭiru; B1 = Nabû-ahu-rēmanni; B2 = Qīštia; C = Murašû/Iddin-Marduk//Ilia
Title: BM 31705

Paraphrase:
Renouncement to claims about the purchase of a field.
The text seems to be a duplicate of an original tablet, which was however poorly copied: as a result, it includes some mistakes and elisions. Two brothers who own land are mentioned: A, who purchased (lit. “received”, mahāru) 2;1.4 Kor (31500 m2) of  grain field (zēru pî šulpu) within the hanšû-land of B, that adjoins (ana ṭāh miṣir) (the land of) C, – and D, who bought 1;1.4 Kor (18000 m2) of grain field (zēru pî šulpu) from E (ina qātē … mahāru). The second buyer had already access to 2 kor (27000 m2) of arable land (zēru), which was the dowry (nudunnû) of his wife fF. Three sellers (fG1 fG2 and fG3) agree that they will not complain to the two buyers about this land, and in his turn D will not complain to them about the remainder of the land. Names of 3+ witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Ša-Nabû-šū; C = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Nādin//Rēš-ummani; D = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Šulāya//Egibi; E = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Bēl-uballiṭ//Nappāhu; fF = fBēlessunu; fG1 = fTubqitu/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Pahāru; fG2 = fAbnatu/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Arkât-ilī; fG3 = fBusasa/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Arkât-ilī
Title: Private (Wunsch 2000, 116)

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
The tablet records the purchase of agricultural land; the text has been divided into paragraphs, marked on the tablet by a line drawn at the end of each one (and indicated below in the paraphrase by LINE).
A purchases 6 Kor (81000 m2) of agricultural land (zēru) located in the open country (eqel ṣēri) from B: it is a cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi) bearing fruit (iṣṣi bilti) including a fruit garden (adi limīti) in Dūru-ša-karābī. LINE
Its upper side in the North borders on (the property of) C, the lower side in the South on (the properties of) the four brothers D1, D2, D3 and D4; its upper front in the West is adjacent to the bank (kišādu) of the New Canal and the lower front in the East borders on the royal gizzatu-land. LINE
In total, 6 Kor (81000 m2) of agricultural land (zēru), including (adi) the fruit garden (limītu). LINE
A declares the equivalent for this land together with the seller B (A itti B mahīra nabû išām) to be 1 shekel of silver for each 0;0.0.0.6 Kor (45 m2) of land, for a total price of 30 minas of silver. He also gives 2 minas of silver as additional payment (kî atri). The total amount corresponds, thus, to 32 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu). LINE
B acknowledges that he has received (mahāru) the total amount of silver which was due to him as purchase price of his field, and he is satisfied (apālu  G Stat). The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. The field will be measured: should it be found smaller or larger than what was originally calculated, they will compensate each other (ahāmiš apālu ) according to the field-price ratio (mahīru) they agreed upon. Names of 11 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Iddin-Bēl/Nabû-uṣuršu/Miṣirayyu; C = Mušēzib-Marduk/Zākiru//Aškāpu; D1 = Bēl-rēmanni/Dummuqu//Miṣirayyu; D2 = Bazūzu/Dummuqu//Miṣirayyu; D3 = Nidintu/Dummuqu//Miṣirayyu; D4 = Šaddinnu/Dummuqu//Miṣirayyu
Title: BM 32872

Paraphrase:
Receipt for compensatory payment.
A purchased (ina qātē … mahāru) a plot of land (zēru) from four brothers (B1, B2, B3 and B4). The land consists of a field (eqlu) situated in the open country (ṣēru), partly an orchard (kirû) planted with date palms (gišimmarē zaqpu) – fruit-bearing trees as well as young date palms – and partly wasteland (kišubbû) above and below the New Channel in the district (pīḫatu) of Babylon. He paid the total price (whose amount is not specified in this document) in silver (ana kasap gamirtu), and he received from them a notary document, a receipt attesting the full payment (ṭuppi apilti: for this term see BaAr 2 pp. 170f). Then, he entitled C to a half share. Afterwards however, D, son of one of the sellers, raised claims against A and C as a result of a more accurate measurements of the land which apparently was bigger than what was originally calculated. Eventually, he acknowledges that he has received (eṭēru) a compensatory payment from the surplus of the land (utru ša zēri). All the parties agree that they will not go back to this issue and that in future they will not lodge claims against each other about the size of that field. 6+ witnesses and 2 scribes. Seal impressions of the scribes.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B1 = Marduk-šākin-šumi/Marduk-ēṭir//Ēṭiru; B2 = Iqīša-Marduk/Marduk-ēṭir//Ēṭiru; B3 = Nabû-bān-ahi/Marduk-ēṭir//Ēṭiru; B4 = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Marduk-ēṭir//Ēṭiru; C = Nergal-ušallim/Šumu-iddin//Ile’’i-Marduk; D = Ahu-iddin-Marduk/Marduk-šākin-šumi//Ēṭiru
Title: BM 33103

Paraphrase:
Receipt
A1 and A2, acting as proxy for (ina našparti) C,  receive 11 mina of silver from B for D᾽s urāšu-obligation. Apart from the name of 1 witness and the scribe, the list of witnesses is broken.
 
A1 = Bēlšunu/Bēl-iqīša/Šangû-Nanāya; A2 = Nabû-lillu/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ea-…; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu; C = Nūrea/Bēl-iqīša/Šangû-Nanāya; D = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 213; Dandamaev, PAS 4 (1986), 76; Weingort 1939, 27 f.
Title: BM 31700

Paraphrase:
Asset transfer.
This tablet is a duplicate of an official document and present several syntactic problems due to a wrong or careless copying. A1, A2, A3, A4 and A5, B’s sons, transmit land and slaves (zēru u amīlūtu) to their mother fC under a sealed document (kanāku - dagālu Š). In this document, they swear to each other by the gods and the king that if in future one of them should receive (kanāku – našû) from (ina qātē) their mother a share (zittu) of that land or those slaves that they entrusted to their mother without the other's consent (la ahāmiš), then … (the consequences are not written in the document: the scribe must have omitted a few lines from the original tablet). Should their mother give something (from this property) to someone else in front of them (i.e. with their consent), then he will enjoy it (akālu?, wr. i-ku-lu). Any special arrangement (riksu) received by one of the brothers from his mother without the other brothers’ consent will be considered as invalid (hepû). Written in the presence (ina ašābi) of fC. Names of 4 witnesses (including one of fC's brothers: Tabnēa/Bēl-upahhir//Šîn-šadûnu) and the scribe (another brother of fC): Marduk-šumu-ibni/Bēl-upahhir//Šîn-šadûnu.
 
A1 = Bēl-ušallim; A2 = Nabû-ēreš; A3 = Šāpik-zēri; A4 = Mušēzib-Bēl; A5 = Bēl-uballiṭ; B = Šumu-ukīn//Šîn-šadûnu, father of A1, A2, A3, A4 and A5; fC = fKurunnam-tabni(/Bēl-upahhir//Šîn-šadûnu), mother of A1, A2, A3, A4 and A5
Title: BM 30238

Paraphrase:
Share-farming agreement for a donkey
A allows B to use (lit. “gives”) his non-marked (šamātu) donkey mare and her suckling (ša šizbu) foal in return for a share (ana zitti) in the profits produced with the animals. His share is fixed at 1/3 mina of medium-quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy. He has not yet received (mahāru) the silver from B. The share-farming agreement will run for 6 years, during which B guarantees (našû) for the caretaking (suddudu), the fodder (rītu) and the guarding (maṣṣartu) during day and night of these animals. The two hold equal shares (ahātu) in offspring (tamlittu) and donkey foals (mūru). Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe: Nidinti-Bēl /Marduk-nāṣir//Eppeš-ilī. An additional, 7th witness is listed after the place and date of issue.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Gimillu/Iranni
Title: BM 30913

Paraphrase:
Fixation of interest at default.
B owes [x] minas and 5 shekels of silver to A, to be paid on the 1st of Tašrīt (VII). Should he fail to meet the deadline, he will have to paying interest on a monthly basis. The interest rate is fixed at 1 shekel minus (maṭû) one-sixth of a shekel (suddû, wr. 6-‘). Any promissory note that B comes up with (ša B [i]-il-la-a) is invalid (hepû) (Or: the promissory note that is issued for B has been paid). Names of 3 witnesses, a.o. Šulāya/Zēru-ukīn//Egibi; and the scribe:  Šamaš-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi.
 
A= Marduk-šāpik-zēri/Marduk-zēru-ibni//Šangû-Ninurta; B= Ibnāya/Nabû-nāṣir(?)
Title: BM 30677

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver (u'iltu). Pledge of a house.
B owes 2 minas of silver to A, an alphabet scribe (sepīru, cf. BM32882 and BM31343). His house located next to the creditor's house is pledged. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/…//Tunāya.
 
A = Gabbi-ilī-šarru-uṣur/Ilteri-hanān; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; W1= Bel-iddin/Balāṭu//Ea-pattannu; W2= Gimil-Gula/Zēria//Itinnu; W3= Libluṭ/Iddinnunu//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 33118

Paraphrase:
Summons to establish a case.
Fragmentary: Only a few sentences of this text are readable. At the beginning, it is recorded that [A] will bring (abāku) his witness, who is called to establish the case (kânu Š) against [B]. Then the text breaks off, when it resumes one can read “As many days as it is established in the tablet (?)” [...] After a lacuna, 1/3 mina and 1 shekel of silver are mentioned, which are at his (we do not know whose) disposal. Someone must (pay off?) in full the silver with its interests. He will take receipt of the tablet related to that 1/3 mina and 1 shekel of silver. Should he fail to establish the case, then C will immediately give the 1/3 mina and 1 shekel of silver back. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: D.
 
A = .../Addia//Uballiṭ-Marduk; B = [the name is broken off]; C = Addia, father of A; D = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi
Title: BM 30805

Paraphrase:
Document related to a house. Very fragmentary.
The tablet records the purchase of a house (l. 7, šīmu), for which however also the payment of a rent is mentioned (l. 3, idū) and the obligation to do maintenance work (batqa iṣabbat l. 9). The opening lines refer to judges (probably including A among them). More individuals are recorded, whose names and role in the deal cannot be determined with certainty: B and C. The document was written in front of 4 judges; name of the scribe: Nabû-šumu-iškun//Rab-banê
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Nabû-ahu-iddin//Nādinu-x; C = Bānûnu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin(//Ṣillāya? cfr. Nbn 536, so Krecher p. 163); D = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Dayyān-Marduk (? cfr. Nbn 536, so Krecher p. 163)
Title: BM 41411

Paraphrase:
Land and house rental.
A rents arable land and houses, which are upstream (elēnu) from the Surra canal in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon, to B, in all likelihood for seven years Excluded are the houses located next to the sons of D1 and the sons of D2, which are (already) at the disposal of C1 and(?)(*) C2. The renter will perform maintenance work (bīt epšetu) and give the houses back (uššuru) to A at the end of the year. As for the arable land, he will fence (lamû) 0;1 sq. kor (2700 m2) of land and plant fruit trees (gapnu) and date palms. At the end of the seventh year, the property will go back to A (partly reconstructed). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. With regard to the area downstream, he will plant (verb lost in a lacuna) fruit trees and date plants in the garden of the house(s). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
Notes: (*) Slightly differently, Joannès at achemenent.com.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = broken name; C1 = Aplāya/Bānia; C2 = Nabû-zēru-līšir/Sîn-šadûnu; D1 = Bel-…; D2 = Šamaš-iddin/…
Title: BM Unknown (Camb 192)

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
The tablet records the purchase  0;1+x Kor (2700+ m2) of agricultural land between two individuals whose names are unknown because of its fragmentary condition. The purchased field consists of an orchard bearing fruit (iṣṣi bilti), and is located in front of the […] Gate: its upper side measures 514 cubits (257 m) and borders on (the fields of) […] and of A, its lower side has the same length and borders on (the land belonging to) [the sons?] of B. The rest of the tablet is lost, at the end of the reverse a few words of the usual formula in which the seller acknowledges that he has received the full amount of silver that was due to him and that he is satisfied are extant. The tablet ends with the warranty clause against future claims in which the parties agree that there will be no suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. Names of 6 witnesses and 2 scribes.
 
A = Bānia/...; B = Etel…-…
Title: BM 34447+

Paraphrase:
Fixation of interest on a silver debt.
B owes 3 minas of silver to A. The debt bears a 20% interest (1 shekel per 1 mina) to be paid on a monthly basis. C acts as a guarantor for the payment. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-bān-ahi/Iqīšāya//Nādin-Marduk; C = Bēl-rēmanni/Marduk-ušallim
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 192, Moldenke, CTMMA (1893), no. 24.
Title: MMA 79.7.5

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave
 A1 with his wife fA2 and A3, of their own free will, sell a slave, C, to B for 23 shekels of silver. The sellers guarantee against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person raising claims (pāqirānu); they also guarantee against the escape (pūt halāqu) or death of C for a one year period (adi ṭuppi ana ṭuppi). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Pir'u/Marduk-ušallim//Ahu'u; fA2 = fGagāya, wife of A1; A3 = Zēria/Lâbāši//Ahu'u; B = Nabû-zēru- ukīn/Bēl-iddin//Šangû-Ea; C = Barīk-il
Title: BM 31153

Paraphrase:
About a slave sale: delivering obligation.
A sold the female slaves fC1 and fC2 to fB and her clan (qinnu) for 2 minas and 20 shekels of silver. A will bring them over and deliver them (abāku-ma nadānu) in the month Simān (III). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Marduk-ēṭir//Nappāhu; fB = fIna-Esagila-rāmat/Zēria//Nabāya; fC1 = fMamitu- Silīm; fC2 = fSidada-lūmur
Title: BM 30495

Paraphrase:
Security for a debt of silver and utensils: general pledge.
B owes 1 mina of stamped(?) silver (ginnu)  of which one-eighth is alloy and which is used for purchases and sales (nadānu u mahāru) to A, and in addition (elat) the following utensils (udû): 1 lamp (bīt nūri), and 1 lower and 1 upper millstone (namhartu) of Makan-wood. The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s entire property in and outside the city. Names of 5 witnesses, the first one being a brother of the creditor (Nabû-zēru-ibni/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi), and the scribe: Marduk-šumu-iddin/Šāpik-zēri//Dēkû.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-bullissu/Iddin-Nabû//Dābibi
Title: BM 30285

Bibliography: To be published by Johannes Hackl.
Title: BM 31119

Paraphrase:
Dated short notice.
A short note about 41 1/4 shekel of silver that are at the disposal (ina pāni) of A (and hence due from him). This silver includes the previous silver from Simān (III).
The tablet is drawn up in front of the ina uzuzzi witness Lāqīp.  
 
A = Iddin-Marduk(/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn)
Title: BM 31106

Paraphrase:
Sale of a slave.
A1 and his wife fA2, of their own free will, sell their female slave fC to B for the hariṣ-price amounting to 1/3 mina and 5 shekels of silver. The sellers guarantee against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person claiming (pāqirānu) that fC is a free person (mār banê). A broken passage at the end of the tablet informs that something/someone of the king (details are broken off) (wr. [..A]B?.A.MEŠ), that D [and?] A1, took (našû), has become scarce (maṭû) and they gave it back to E, the governor of the sealand (šakin tâmti). (The deal has been concluded) with fF, A’s mother-in-law, consent (ina ašābi). Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Rēmūtu-Bēl//Egibi; fA2 = fBu’ītu, wife of A1; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; fC = fNanāya-kēširat; D = Nergal-uballiṭ; E = Nabû-šuzzizanni, šakin tâmti; fF = fBābu-ilat/Bebēa, mother-in-law of A
Title: BM 30301

Paraphrase:
Receipt of salary for manufacturing furniture.
B ordered a piece of furniture (erimmatu, bed?, wr. na4NUNUZ) at A's and provided him with the musukkannu-wood from which it was to be made. The present document records A's receipt (mahāru) of 3 shekels of silver, his salary (idū); and B's receipt of the piece of furniture. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-šāpik-zēri/Mušēzib-Bēl//Nabûnnāya.
 
A= Nabû-nāṣir/Nabû-ušabši//Mudammiq-Adad; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi
Title: BM 31324

Paraphrase:
Sale of slaves.
A, of his own will, sells C1 with his wife fC2 and their children C3, C4, C5 and fC6 (6 slaves in total) to fB at a harīṣ-price amounting to 2 minas and 20 shekels of silver. The seller guarantees against (suits brought by) a person acting unlawfully (sēhû) or a person claiming (pāqirānu) that these female slaves are royal slaves (arad šarrūtu) or free persons (mār banê). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib/Marduk-ēṭir//Nappāhu; fB = fIna-Esagila-rāmat/Zēria//Nabāya; C1 = Bēl-ēṭiranni; fC2 = fŠidada-lūmur, wife of C1; C3 = Nabû-kīni-uṣur; C4 = Nabû-kāl-lūmur; C5 = Nabû-būnia; fC6 = fMamitu-Silīm
Title: BM 41396

Paraphrase:
House rental.
The tablet records the extension of a house rental agreement with 7 years. The property is located on the field in the hallat-garden (kirû hallat) of the temple of Bēl, spreading from the right-of-way (uṣû) to the rear part (kutallu) of B’s house, and it was rented from A to B for repair and maintenance work (ēpišānūtu). In three broken lines a promissory note (uˀiltu), the rear part (kutallu) of C’s house and (a property?) belonging to D are mentioned. B will receive money (maybe the silver recorded in the promissory note previously mentioned) for the building of the reed hut (huṣṣu). The house will be built with bricks, as the ones of the neighbours (itû). The renter will live 20 years in the house. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe. The first rental agreement for this house is recorded in BM31781.
 
A = Bēl-iddin/Nergal-ēṭir//Rab-banê; B = Nergal-rēṣūa; C = Bēlšunu; D = Nabû-ēṭir
Title: BM 36432

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
Upper half of a tablet, in which only the first lines recording information on the type and surface of the purchased land are preserved. The deal concerns 0;0.4.0.9 Kor (1867,5 m2) of agricultural land (zēru) located in the open country (eqel ṣēri): it is a cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi) bearing fruit (iṣṣi bilti), located in the meadowland (ugāru) of the Bitqu-ša-Ile’’i-Bēl in front of the Zababa Gate in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon. Its upper long side in the West, whose length is lost in a lacuna, borders on (the property of) A, the lower side, also of an unknown length, borders on another property of someone whose name is lost. Rest of the text broken. 5 witnesses (names lost) and the scribe. The reading of A’s name is not certain, since the proper name is lost in a lacuna: the identification is suggested on the basis of his father's name.
 
A = Rēmūt?/Kurbanni-Marduk//Ea-eppeš-ilī
Title: BM 32492

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
The tablet records the purchase of agricultural land; the text has been divided into paragraphs, marked on the tablet by a line drawn at the end of each one (and indicated below in the paraphrase by LINE).
A purchases 0;0.2 Kor (900 m2) of agricultural land (zēru) from B: it is a cultivated date garden (kirû gišimmarē zaqpi), located in the open country (eqel ṣēri) at the opening of the Borsippa Canal, in front of the Šamaš Gate in the district (pīhatu) of Babylon. LINE
Its upper side in the West borders on the royal marshes (raqqatu ša šarri) and its lower side on the East on the royal street (harrān šarri). Its upper front in the North borders on the buyer’s property and its lower front in the South on (the land of) C. LINE
A declares the equivalent for this land together with the seller B (A itti B mahīra nabû išām) to be 32 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû). He has given him the total price, plus 1 shekel of silver as additional payment (kî pî atri). LINE
The seller acknowledges that he has received (mahāru) 33 shekels of white silver in pieces (šibirtu), corresponding to the total price for his field, and he is satisfied (apālu  G Stat). The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. LINE. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Nabû-uballiṭ/Zēr-Bābili//Etel-pî; C = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Nabû-ēṭir//Sîn-šadûnu
Title: BM 33912

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land.
fA purchases land, land planted with trees as well as newly cleared land (zēru zaqpu u taptû), from B. Because of a break at the beginning of the tablet it is not possible to get any background information about the plot, whose property was shared among members of the Egibi family. From what remains of the first lines, in fact, one understands that two members of the Egibi family, C and D, did not divide (zu’uzu) it. The text provides information only on the properties adjacent to its upper and lower front sides, i.e. the bank (kišādu) of the Banītu canal on the one side and the dike (makallû) of the field on the other side. B has given (nadānu) this field, in its entirety (mādu u īṣu), to fA for 7 minas and 7 shekels of white silver in pieces (kaspi peṣû šibirti). He acknowledges that he has received (eṭēru) the total amount from the buyer, and he is satisfied (apālu  G Stat). The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other; should someone from the Egibi family complain against this purchase, the claimant (pāqirānu) will have to repay twelvefold the received silver. Names of witnesses and scribe lost.
 
fA = fAmat-Bāba/Kalbāya//Nabāya; B = Bēl-udammiq/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; D = Nergal-ēṭir/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 32016+

Paraphrase:
Transfer of ownership of land.
fA owns (possibly as a part of her dowry) a plot of arable land (zēru), situated opposite the Zababa Gate in the district (pīḫatu) of Babylon, which has been legally entrusted to her husband B. He received it in compensation for his claim (kūm rašûtu) against his wife, obtaining from the judges a tablet recording his right. He then pledged (maškanu šakānu) it to C, the slave (qallu) of D. Now, fA offers legal ownership over the field to the slave’s owner, in exchange for a non-specified gift (qīštu). She also offers him the original document attesting the purchase (ummi eqlēti, lit. “mother of the fields”). D, then, hands over 10 shekels of silver as a gift, and the woman gives him the original document in return, transferring (muššuru) ownership to him. fA puts the agreement down in writing (šaṭāru) and gives the document to D, in order to make sure that it will not be changed in the future. Names of 3 witnesses (including Bēl-udammib/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Egibi, D’s brother-in-law) and the scribe.
 
fA = fEsagil-bēlet/Nādin-ahi//Eppeš-ilī, wife of B; B = Nabû-ēreš/Tabnêa//Ahu-bāni; C = Nabû-utirri, slave of D; D = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 2000, no. 167; Tallqvist 1891, 20f; Demuth, BA 3 (1898), 427-429; Krecher 1970, 218.
Title: BM 31110

Paraphrase:
Fragmentary promissory note.
The first two lines of the tablet are broken. But it is clear that B owes (ina muhhi) A an amount of silver (kaspu). The tablet mentions in a damaged passage a payment (nadānu) for work or service (dullu) on a ship (eleppu). The payment of the debt is secured by the pledge (maškanu) of B’slave, C. Apart from the first witness, the names of the witnesses and the scribe are broken.
 
A =Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn, creditor; B = Bēl-šumu-iškun/Bēl-ahhē-iqīša//Sippe, debtor; C = X-rēmanni, slave of B
Title: BM 32129

Paraphrase:
Loan ina-pāni. Related to a business partnership.
A places 21200 strings of onions from a business partnership (harrānu) he has with C at B’s disposal (ina pāni). On the 15th of Ayyār (II) B should count out (manû) the strings and give them back (nadānu) to A  in [...]. A guarantees for the quality (?) (nuhhutu) of the clipped silver (šibirtu) with a one-eighth alloy (ša ina 1 šiqlu bitqu) that is at B’s disposal. He also guarantees for the (re)payment (eṭēru) of 31 shekels of silver with a one-eighth alloy. This is followed by an erased passage of about 1 1/2 lines starting with the phrase ina qātē "from". Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nergal-ahu-iddin/Nabû-zēru-uṣur//Nappāhu.
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia; B = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Nabû-kēšir//Bābūtu; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 30573

Paraphrase:
House rental.
A1 and A2, B’s slave, will live inside a house in Bīt-šar-Bābili, belonging to C and located near the house of D1 and D2. Every year they will pay 13 shekels of silver as rental price. They will live in this house from the 3rd of Ayyār (II) onwards. Whenever they will happen to be (maqātu) in Bīt-šar-Bābili(?), they can live in the house up to one year (adi ṭuppi). Should they break the contract, they shall pay 10 shekels of silver as compensation. They will caulk the roof and repair the wall foundations. C will erect a courtyard. A1 himself will perform all the work on the roof beams and the roof. He will also take care of the cracks (in the walls). It is agreed that half of the silver should be paid at the beginning of the year, and the remainder at the end. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Kināya(?)/Libbiali-lūmur; A2 = Nabû-uterri, salve of B; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Nabû-šumu-iddin/Zēru-ukīn; D1 = Mušēzib-Nabû; D2 = Nabû-Dayyān
Title: BM 30312

Paraphrase:
Agreement over tenant’s duties.
A, C’s slave, rents a house belonging to B1, fB2 and fB3. This document states that he will build a reed hut (bīt huṣṣi) from the entrance of this house (pānat bābi) to its way out (mūṣu), and lay bricks for its foundations. Should he fail to do so, the lessors B1, fB2 and fB3 will receive 4 shekels of silver each year as rental price, instead of the construction work on the house. Name of 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-uterri, salve of C; B1 = Nabû-iddin/Bēl-(i)le’’i; fB2 = fBānītu-ēṭirat; fB3 = fAmat-Nanāya/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Atû; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 31254

Paraphrase:
Summon/Injunction
About a slave sale: undertaking to finalise the payment.
By the 5th of Abu (V), A will produce the silver that he owes for the slaves that he bought (mahāru) from B, as established in B’s promissory note (u’iltu). Should he fail to do so, he will bring bring over the slave and hand him back (abāku-ma nadānu) to B. C guarantees for A. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-iqīša/Šellibi//Atkuppu; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Amtia/Ibnāya//Dābibi
Bibliography: Marx, BA 4 (1902), 59; Krecher 1970, 224; Koschaker 1911, 257; Peiser, KB 4 (1896), 286ff.
Title: BM 30437

Paraphrase:
Fulfilment of a dowry promise.
Concerning 2 kor (27000 m2) of arable land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu), 5 slaves (amēluttu) and household utensils, which A1 promised (qabû) to B as dowry for his daughter fC. Later, on the 1st of Addar (XII) in the 14th year of Nabonidus (i.e., after A1᾽s death) his son A2 fulfilled the promise: he gave B 2 kor (27000 m2) of arable land planted with trees located on the road to Kiš, from the Royal Road along the bank (kišādu) of the Banītu-Canal till the dike (makallû) of the arable land that A2 co-owns (ša itti) with his business partner D. He also gave B the 5 female slaves (fE1,fE2, fE3, fE4, fE5), who were bought from the Nappahu family, and the household utensils. With regard to the slaves that fF promised to B, it is agreed that B can demand (bu᾽û) them from fF. Archival evidence makes it plausible that the 2 kor are part of A2’s share in 6.1.3.5 kor of land which he and D co-own (see Wunsch 2000, 54). The text stipulates how the business partners should restructure their shares in the land so that A2᾽s brother-in-law can take possession of his part in it. However the entire passage is fraud with difficulties. In translation it reads: “according to the amount of their shares (aki zitti) they (i.e., A2 and D) will … (uncl.: SAG.KI i-šaq-qí-lu-ma), and then A2 and B can each take possession (itti ahāmeš ṣabātu)” of their parts. Each of the partners has taken a copy of the present document. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A=Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B=Dummuqu/ Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Egibi, the groom; fC=fQibī-dumqī-ilat, the bride, daughter of A1 and sister of A2; A2=Itti-Marduk-balāṭu, son of A1 and brother of fC; D=Bānûnu(/Ṣillāya//Rab-banê), business partner of A2; fE=fAmtia; fE2=fŠēpitāya; fE3=fBanītu-tuklat fE4=fGimilinni; fE5=fLā-tubāšinni; fF=fQudāšu (without affiliation)
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 2000, no. 39; Krecher 1970, 188; Roth, JAOS 111 (1991), 24; Marx, BA 4 (1902), 21; Kohler and Peiser, BRL 1 (1890), 23f.
Title: BM 30439

Paraphrase:
List of expenditures
The obverse side of the tablet, written portrait-oriented, lists the different parties (A1, A2, A3) in connection with silver expenditures. A third of the right side of the tablet is broken off.   
27 shekels of silver of A1 … (broken off)
13 1/4 shekels of silver of A2 … (broken off)
25 shekels of silver of A3 … (broken off)
10 1/8 shekels 2 sectors … (broken off)
19 1/2 shekels of A1 … (broken off)
15 shekels of silver which were deducted from the undivided property (= business assets?) (karû) are at B's disposal (ina pāni)
20 shekels of silver for choice beer (kurunnu) which from the house … (broken off)
Silver which has been taken away in the presence of the sons of C … (broken off)
sent to (abālu Š) D in the city ... (city name broken off).
sent to D … (broken off)
The reverse side of the tablet, written landscape-oriented, notes the expenditures in connection with the transport of onions and dates by boat:
20 shekels of silver, the miksu-tax paid (nadānu) for the boats loaded with onions.
3 mina of silver, from the silver for the dates at F’s disposal, were paid to D for transporting by boat F’s dates.
Of which 2 mina and 3 1/2 shekel … (broken) dates from Addar of the 5th year … (broken) of G
The rest of the reverse is broken off.
…sold from the boat filled with dates, of which 15 kor of dates belong to E (and) are at B’s disposal. No names of witnesses or a scribe.
 
A1 = Gūzānu…; A2 = Arad-Bēl…; A3 = broken off;  B = fIna-Esagila-rāmat/Zēria//Nabāya; C = Kīnāya (without affiliation); D = Madānu-bēlu-uṣur (without affiliation); E = Nūrēa; F = Nabû-ayyālu (without affiliation); G = Nergal-rēṣūa
Title: BM 31918

Paraphrase:
Settlement of accounts.
A has paid (ana nadānu) 10 minas of silver for (additional) expense(s) (nishu) to B1 and B2. From this amount, C receives (eṭēru) 5 minas – corresponding to B2’s share (pūt zitti) – from B1. Thus, the parties have completely carried out (qatû) their settlement of accounts (epuš nikkassi). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Iddin-Nabû/Bānûnu//Si’īti.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Šumu-iddin/Zeria; B2 = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Tabnēa; C = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Tabnēa
Title: BM 31218

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver, payment for a share in land.
Concerns a building plot (qanû). A1’s share in it (pūt zitti) is worth 52 shekels of silver.  A2 receives (mahāru) exactly this amount of silver from B1, in addition (adi) to the 12 shekels of silver which B2 had given him (nadānu) at a previous occasion (kaspu mahru, lit. “the previous money”). Assuming that the building plot was shared by A1 and A2, it follows that the latter sold his share for 52 shekels to B1 and for 12 shekels to B2. It is likely that A1 also sold his share, for 52 shekels (to B2?).
 
A1 = Iddin-Nabû/Aqara//Nabāya; A2 = Marduk-šarru-uṣur/Marduk-nāṣir//Ir’anni; B2 = Kalbāya; B1 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi
Title: BM 30249

Paraphrase:
Pledge of houses with antichresis. Security for a silver debt.
B owes 1 mina and 17 shekels of silver to A. In the past he rented houses to his creditor's slave for refurbishing works (ana epišānūtu) (see BM31781). It is now agreed that these houses will serve as antichretic pledge for his silver debt (ki hubul kaspi). Accordingly, the creditor's slave who is renting the houses, should pay his rent (idu) to his master rather than to B (lit. A ikkal [akālu]). This is the arrangement till the end of the year (or: till the end of the rental period) (adi qīt šanāti), at which point B should pay off his debt and the houses should return to him.  Note that the word "pledge" (maškanu) is not explicitly used in the text. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Nabû-ēṭir//Rab-banê.

A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-ēṭir//Rab-banê; C = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 31340

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with antichretic pledge of slave
B owes 2 minas and a broken amount of shekels of medium quality white silver, of which one-eighth is alloy, to A. He pledges two of his female slaves: fC1, on whose hand the name of the debtor's father is written and fC2, on whose hand the debtor's own name is written. The income from their work will cover the debt (antichresis).

A = Mušēzib/Bēl-abu-uṣur(?); B = Šišku/Iddināya//Egibi; fC1 = fMušēzibtu, slave of B or B's father, Iddināya; fC2 = fNāru
Title: RCT 20 A

Paraphrase:
Promissory note(?)
In this very fragmentary record Iddināya should deliver barley (or dates). There is no information available on when/where/why due the tablet's fragmentary state of preservation. Names of at least 1 witness (Tabnēa/Erīšu), and the scribe: Šullumāya/Miṣirayyu.
Title: BM 54811

Paraphrase:
Fragmentary promissory note
The first 4 lines are very fragmentary. B owes A an amount of onions (šūmi).
The rest of tablet is broken, including the names of the witnesses and the first part of the name of the scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Mušēzib/...qu/Šangû-...
Title: BM Unknown (76-11-17,2626)

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document concerning a marriage agreement: A1 voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) approaches B1 and his wife fB2 and asks them to give their daughter, the nubile girl (batultu) fC, into marriage with his eldest son A2. B1 and fB2 grant (šemû) the request and give their daughter into marriage (ana aššati nadānu). Together with his daughter fC, B1 voluntarily promised to give as dowry (nudunnû) to A2 cash, real estate, slaves and moveables. Thus he gives 4 minas of white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel including (adi) the 1 mina of silver in her dowry casket (quppu), 6 shekels of gold, a house of 6 reeds (294 square cubits = 73.5 m2) in the district (erṣetu) of Kullab in Babylon, bordering the house of D and the broad thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of Bēlet-Bābili, the (slave woman) fE1 together with her daughter fE2, and household goods (udê bīti). On the day A2 marries fC, B1 will hand over the dowry according to this tablet. A1 guarantees (pūtu našû) for the feeding (ipru), care (piššatu) and clothing (lubuštu) of his wife. The sealing (kunukku) of this tablet (ṭuppu) happened before 10 individuals and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Nādin-ahi/Šamaš-ēṭir; fB2 = fAmat-Nanāya, wife of B1; fC = fBulliṭ-iššu; D = Ubār; fE1 = Ana-muhhi-Nanāya-taklāku; fE2 = Itti-Ninlil-īnāya, daughter of fE1; Scribe = Bēl-iddin//[…]
Title: BM 64177

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house: A rents out to B his entire house for 10 shekels of silver rent (idū) per year beginning with (ultu) month [x] for 3 years. The lessee has to renew the roof (ūru šanû). He will charge (ana muhhi PN manû) his lessor with the costs for the bricks (libittu), reed (qanû) and beams (gušūru) needed for renovation work (dullu epēšu), if they exceed the 30 shekels of silver, that is, the rent for 3 years. 3 witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy.

A = Nergal-uballiṭ/Ṭābia; B = Bēl-nāṣir/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 79792

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: fB1, B2 and B3 owe A 3 minas of white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. They will pay the silver in Dûzu (IV) of Darius 31st year. Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû). The one who is available (qerbu) must pay (eṭēru). fC, slave woman (qallatu) of fB1, is placed as a pledge. D guarantees (pūt našî) for the full payment of the silver. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ahušunu/Iddin-Šamaš/Ṣarbatu; fB1 = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B2 = Arad-Bēl/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; B3 = Libluṭ/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; fC = fŠumahūa; D = Ubār/Bēl-iqīša/Isinnāya; Scribe = Rēmūtu/Nabû-aplu-iddin
Title: BM 74548

Paraphrase:
Heavily broken receipt: A receives (restore either mahāru or eṭēru) from B something the details of which are lost in the broken passage at the beginning of the tablet. In the first, broken passage C1, C2 and C3 are mentioned – their role remains unclear. This is related or not related (adi or elat) to previous promissory notes (u’iltu) of barley and dates. Each party has taken a copy. 3(+) witnesses (including […]/Nabû-[…], governor [pīhatu]) and the scribe (lost).
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Erība-Marduk/Nidinti-Marduk; C1= […]; C2 = Itti-Bēl-gūzu; C3 = Itti-Nabû-īnāya
Title: BM 64211

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver: A receives from B 24 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû) which is to paid until the end of Simān (III) of the present year. Each party has taken a copy. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Kīnāya//[…];  B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Bēl-uballiṭ/Marduk-rēmanni
Title: BM 61704

Paraphrase:
Lease of a prebend: B1 and B2 rent out to A 10 necks (kišādu) of mutton a month, daily one neck of mutton from (ultu) the 5th to (adi) the 15th day of every month, together with 17 necks (kišādu) of beef in the entire year for 20 shekels of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginne) per year. This is the prebendary meat income from the main course of the morning (rabû ša šēri) before Šamaš in Ebabbar in Sippar. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B1 = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Šamaš-uballiṭ//Šumu-libši; B2 = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Šumu-libši; Scribe = Bēl-uballiṭ/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Šumu-libši
Title: Peek 7

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 27 kor (4,860 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of Du(r)bissu of Darius 14th year. The debtor will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII), in the enclosure (haṣāru), in the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu, in one delivery (ina muhhi ištet ritti). With each kor of dates he will give loads of palm-frond ribs (biltu ša huṣābi), palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date palm fronds (libbu) and date palm fibres (mangagu). 6 witnesses and the scribe. In Arahsamna (VIII) A will measure (mašāhu) the dug-out arable land (zēru hirîtu) beneath (šupālu) the date palms (gišimmaru) together with B, who dug (herû) it out, and pay his wages in dates (sissinnu).

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-kāṣir//Uballissu-Marduk; Scribe = Iddin-Bēl/Bēl-kāṣir//Kānik-bābi
Title: BM 74615

Paraphrase:
Loan of sheep: B owes A 30 female lambs of Akkad breed (parratu akkadu). The debtor will give them in good quality (babbanû) in Babylon in Simān (III). 6 witnesses and the scribe. This document is linked to BM64235.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Muṭēriṣu; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Nabû-napšātu-uṣur/Šāpik-zēri//Marduk
Title: BM 114712

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina and 10 shekels of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt will bear a (monthly) interest of one shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). 2 witnesses (including Bēl-nāṣir, brother of A) and the scribe. The previous promissory notes (u’iltu) are paid off (eṭēru Stat.).
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Tēši-ēṭir/Zēria//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = […]/Lu’-[…]//[…]
Title: BM 79629

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B1, B2, B3, B4 and all the enterers of the Šamaš Temple (ērib bīti) owe A1 120 kor (36,000 l) of dates. They will pay the dates back in the enclosure (haṣāru) in Arahsamna (VIII) in one delivery (ina muhhi ištet ritti). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû); the one who is available (qerbu) must pay (eṭēru) the dates. This is apart from (elat) the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 200 kor (36,000 l) of dates due from all the temple enterers as well as the loan document concerning 5 kor (900 l) of dates, without interest (qaqqadu), due from (ina muhhi) B2 and B5 and the loan document concerning of A2 due from B1. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Iqīša-Marduk/Etel-pî-Šamaš//Šangû-Šamaš; B2 = Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B3 = Šamaš-šumu-līšir/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk; B4 = Nabû-kāṣir/Šāpik-zēri//Šangû-Sippar; B5 = Šamaš-iddin; Scribe = Iddin-Nabû/Nergal-ēṭir//Ša-nāšišu
Title: BM 74625

Paraphrase:
Oath concerning the stay in Sippar: B swears (tamû) to A by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that he will move not ½ meter (šiqlu qaqqaru) from Sippar without permission of A. C guarantees (pūtu našû) for B. If B goes to another place (ašru šanû), C will bear the guilt of a transgression against the governor of Babylon and Across-the-River (pīhat Bābili u Eber-nāri) (Uštānu) (hīṭu ša PN šadādu). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Ahu-līt/Idī-il; C = Eulmašāya/Kalbāya; Scribe = Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu/Bēl-kāṣir//Sîn-da’’in
Title: BM 64245

Paraphrase:
Record about a business venture with only part of the reverse preserved: This transaction is apart from (elat), first, the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 70 kor (12,600 l) of dates belonging to A at the disposal of B and, second, the business partnership (harrānu) of C. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Šamaš-mukīn-apli/Mušēzib-Bēl//Balīhu; C = Ile’i-bulluṭ-Marduk; Scribe = […]-šumu-uṣur/[…]
Title: BM 64242

Paraphrase:
Receipt of dates: The scribe of Ebabbar A, by order of (ina qībi) B1, receives from C 23;0.5 kor (4,170 l) of dates. This is the partial payment of the dates, impost (imittu) of the treasury (namkūru) of Šamaš of Hasape and Ṭīl-ṣalmi of Darius 24th year, due from (ina muhhi) B1 and B2. The transport costs (maltaku, usually meaning “test”) have not been deducted (nahāsu) from them. This is in addition to (elat) the earlier promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 36;4.1 kor (6,630 l) of dates, impost of the treasury of Šamaš of Hasape and Ṭīl-ṣalmi of Darius 24th year at the disposal of B1 and B2, which A brought as a partial payment and handed over (našû-nadānu) to D, slave (qallu) of the bishop (šatammu) of Esagila (Ina-Esagila-lilbur). A has registered (ušuzzu) the partial payment of B1 and B2 of in sum 60 kor of dates (10,800 l) on the writing board (lē’u) of Šamaš and will show (kalāmu D-stem) the entries to the two payers. Each party has taken a copy (šaṭāru). 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê, ṭupšarru (scribe) of Ebabbar Temple; B1 = Iddin-Bēl-/Zabdia; B2 = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Gallābu; C = Arad-Bēl/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Arad-Ea; D = Bēl-šullimmani, qallu (slave) of Ina-Esagila-lilbur, šatammu (bishop) of Esagila; Scribe = Bēl-iddin/Iqīša-Marduk//Arad-Ea
Title: BM 74564

Paraphrase:
Receipt of dates: A1 and A2 receive 25 kor (4,500 l) of dates from B1 and B2. This is part of the income from the impost (imittu), treasury (namkūru) of the Šamaš Temple, of Xerxes 1st year, the collection of which is managed under the supervision of (ša qātē) the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) C. The dates are currently at the disposal of B1 and B2. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-Nannûtu; A2 = Nidintu; B1 = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-sattukki; B2 = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-rē’išunu; C = Arad-Anunītu, gugallu (agricultural supervisor); Scribe = Iddin-Nabû/Bēl-uballiṭ//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili
Title: BM 62409

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver
fB1, her son B2 and B3 owe A1 and A2 1 mina and 10 shekels of white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The house of B2 on the quay of Sippar (Sippar ša kāri), adjoining the houses of C1 and C2, is placed as a pledge for 3 years. It is pledged to the creditors in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). The contract is drawn up in the presence (ina mahar) of 8 witnesses (including the judges [dayyānu] Iltaptūku, Iqīša-Marduk, Iddin-Bēl and Zēria). No scribe is expliticely mentioned. Seal impressions (kunukku) of the judges Zēria Iltaptūku and Iqīša-Marduk.
 
A1 = Nādin/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu; A2 = Saggillu/Kiribtu; fB1 = fInbāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B2 = Arad-Bēl/Marduk-rēmanni, son of fB1; B3 = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê, C1 = Iddin-Nabû; C2 = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir
Title: BM 74633

Paraphrase:
Broken loan of silver: B owes A 1/3 mina of cut silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel and 2 kor (360 l) of dates. The debtor will pay the silver and the dates in Dûzu (IV). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Kunāya/[…]; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = […]
Title: BM 61713

Paraphrase:
Conclusion of a litigation case: A receives in full (mahāru eṭēru) from B 3 1/3 minas of white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel, the sum of 2 1/3 minas and 1 mina of indebted silver. Therewith the settlement between the two litigants is finished and the cutting off (batāqu) of the hand (rittu) of B as well as the illegally seized property (ṣibtētu) of A are no longer an issue. 19 witnesses (including the father of B) and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Nusku-īnāya/Nusku-ayalu; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Mīnu-ana-Bēl-dān/Mušēzib-Marduk//Imbu-īnāya
Title: BM 78192

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house in Babylon: A rents out to B an annex house (bīt ṭīpi) for 10 shekels of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginne) rent (idū) per year. The rented house borders on the houses of the lessor and C. The lessee shall pay one half share of the rent (ahi kaspi) at the beginning of the year and the remainder (rēhtu) in the middle of the year. 1+ witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Barsipāya/Erība//[…]; C = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Zēria; Scribe = Murānu/Bēl-uballiṭ//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili
Title: BM 61742

Paraphrase:
Lease of land: The tenant A rents out for cultivation (ana errēšūti nadānu) to B1 30 square kor (405,000 m2) of arable land (zēru), located in the crown land (nakkandi šarri) of Bar-tibni, which is part of the lease of the rent farmer (ina muhhi sūti) C of the hazātu (mng. unclear). The leased land consists of the bīt ritti-land of D1, the bīt ritti-land of B1 and his brothers and 10 square kor (135,000 m2) of the bīt ritti-land of D2. A will provide barley seed (uṭṭatu ša zēri) and he has to pay (eṭēru) the share (zittu) of the king. B1 and B2 will provide the oxen and the farmers (ikkaru). They guarantee (pūtu našû) for working the land (epēšu) and for the guard of the land (maṣṣartu). For land they do not work, they will give to A barley at a rate equal to that of the neighbouring fields. B1 and B2, together with A, will enjoy (akālu) from (ina muhhi) the storehouse (maškattu) a quarter from whatever is grown (elû) on the land. Each party has taken a copy. 7 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Bēl-ibni/Adad-ahu-uṣur; B2 = Iddia/Tattannu; C = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti; D1 = Adad-rahat; D2 = Nabû-ittannu/Šadûnu; Scribe = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša
Title: BM 74622

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 20 kor (3,600 l) of dates. The debtor will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII). 10 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Marduk-nāṣir/Nergal-iddin//Balīhu; Scribe = Gūzu-ina-Bēl-aṣbat/Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu
Title: BM 79734

Paraphrase:
Receipt of dates: According to the order (qību) of E, mayor domo (rab bīti) of B2, A, on behalf of (ina našparti) his nephew C1, receives 60 kor (10,800 l) of dates from D1 and D2, slave (qallu) of B2. The dates are due from (ina muhhi) B1, father of B2, according to the credit (rašûtu) of C2, father of C1. 2 witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Bēlšunu/Nabû-nāṣir; B2 = Erība/Bēlšunu; C1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C2 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; D1 = Ša-Nabû-šū/Nabû-ēreš; D2 = Šamšāya, slave of B2; E = Iddin-Bēl/Šumu-ukīn, rab bīti (mayor domo) of B2; Scribe = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê
Title: BM 61034

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B1, B2, B3, B4, B5, B6 (and all the enterers of the Šamaš Temple, in accordance with BM74625) owe A1 200 kor (36,000 l) of dates. They will pay the amount of dates back, according to the measure (mašīhu) of the king, in Arahsamna (VIII) in one delivery (ina muhhi ištet ritti). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû); the one who is available (qerbu) must pay. 3 witnesses (including Ardia/Nergal-iddin//Balīhu) and the scribe. All this is apart from (elat) the previous promissory note (u’iltu) of A2, father of A1, charged against (ina muhhi) B2 as well as the 10 kor (1,800 l) of dates due from B3 and the 5 kor (900 l) of dates, without interest (qaqqadu), due from B4 and B7 all owed to A1.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Bēl-aplu-iddin/Balīhu//Šangû-Šamaš; B2 = Iqīša-Marduk/Etel-pî-Šamaš//Šangû-Šamaš; B3 = Marduk-nāṣir/Nergal-iddin//Balīhu; B4 = Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B5 = Šamaš-šumu-līšir/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk; B6 = Nabû-kāṣir/Šāpik-zēri//Šangû-Sippar; B7 = Šamaš-iddin; Scribe = Iqīša-Marduk/Etel-pî-Šamaš//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 61744

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 5 minas of scrap silver with stamp-mark (kaspu qallalu ša ginni), income (erbu) of the cashbox (arannu), and 190 old empty vats. He will give everything back in Simān (III). 3 witnesses (including Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê) and the scribe. This document is linked to BM63848.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣahit-ginê; B = Bēl-iddin/Būru-šēzib; Scribe = Murānu/Šamaš-zēru-ušebši//Dābibī
Title: BM 79714

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house in Babylon: A rents out to B a house for 3 ½ shekels of silver rent (idū) per year. The rented house is located in the city quarter Ahullā qalla in Babylon. It adjoins the houses of C1 and C2 as well as the house of the sons of C3. The tenant will perform maintenance work (batqu ṣabātu) and renew the roof (ūru šanû). For any other work he performs in the house, he can charge (manû) his landlord. The tenant shall pay one half share of the rent (ahi kaspi) at the beginning of the year and the second half in the middle of the year. 2 witnesses (including Nabû-mukku-elip/Bēl-zēru-ibni//Rab-banê) and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-zēru-uṣur//Rab-banê; C1 = Ina-ṣilli-Esagil; C2 = Šākin-šumi; C3 = Nabû-nipšari; Scribe = Nabû-kāṣir/Šulāya//Nappāhu
Title: BM 74357

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes 16 kor (2,880 l) of dates to A. He will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII) of the present year in Babylon at the storage area (karammu) of Bēl. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Harīṣānu/Anu-še’e; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Šellibi//Sîn-nāṣir
Title: 1982.A.1801

Paraphrase:
Hiring a worker: A1 and A2 hire B for the period of 12th of Ulūl (VI) until 10th of Arahsamna (VIII) for the wages (idū) of 2;2.3 kor (450 l) of dates, 5 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), baskets of 0;0.3 kor (18 l) of nubazu-dates and 5 loads of palm-frond ribs (biltu ša huṣābi). The hirers will give the dates at the end of Tašrīt (VII). Each party has taken a copy. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Bēl-nāṣir/Bēl-uballiṭ; A2 = Ribâta/Nabû-balassu-iqbi; B = Agiria/Nanāya-šumu-uṣur; Scribe = Nidinti-Bēl/Nabû-ahu-[x]
Title: BM 79208

Paraphrase:
Sublease of a prebend: B rents out (ana ebūri nadānu) to C the income of the prebend of the temple enterer (isiq ērib bītūti) before (ina mahar) Šamaš, whose ultimate owner is A, for 16 shekels of silver. The income in question comprises 0;0.0.3 kor (3 l) of bread, 0;0.0.3 kor (3 l) of beer and 2 meat portions (pīru ša šīri). C will give 0;0.3 kor (18 l) of dates to the sub-lessor B. This is apart from (elat) the document (u’iltu) of B at the disposal of C. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ubār-Nabû-ittannu/Eppēš-ilī; B = Bēl-nāṣir/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Nidintu/Sūqāya//Ile’i-Marduk; Scribe = Iddin-Bēl//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 78671

Paraphrase:
Receipt of barley: A, by order of (ina našparti) C, receives from B 200 kor (36,000 l) of barley from the plough(-land) (epinnu) in Bāb-Nār-Rē’i?-[…]. This is part of the barley for which D guaranteed (pūtu našû) the paying of the barley on behalf of C indebted to B. Each party has taken a copy (šaṭāru). 7 witnesses (including Bēl-ittannu/Ipria and Bēl-nuhšu/Kiribtu, both from the Ṣāhit-ginê family) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-bān-zēri/Šāpik-zēri//Isinnāya; B = Talīmu/Nabû-ṣābit-qātē; C = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti; D = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iškun/[…]
Title: BM 74533

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: The brothers B1 and B2 owe 21;3 kor (3,888 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the treasury (namkūru) of Šamaš of Darius 25th year of land in Hasape at the bank (kišādu) of the Sumander Canal. They will pay (eṭēru) the dates in Arahsamna (VIII) to the treasury of Šamaš in Bīt-Ša-Bēl-ūdu. Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû) for the payment. 4 witnesses and the scribe as well as another witness after the date.

B1 = Nabû-uballiṭ/Zabdia; B2 = Iddin-Bēl//Zabdia; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Bēl-iddin//Mušēzib
Title: BM 74530

Paraphrase:
Fragmentary loan of silver: B owes A [x] amounts of white cut silver without stamp-mark (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. 1+ witnesses and the scribe (lost).
 
A = Šumu-ukīn/Bunene-ibni; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê
Title: BM 71170

Paraphrase:
Receipt of barley: A, by order of (ina našparti) the debtor C, receives from B 50 kor (900 l) of barley. This is a partly repayment according to the promissory note (u’iltu) of A concerning 600 kor of dates and 400 kor of barley due from (ina muhhi) C. This is apart from (elat) the previous promissory notes. Each party has taken a copy. 8 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-iddin/Marduk; C = Erība-Marduk/Nidinti-Marduk; Scribe = Dayyān-Marduk/Nabû-zēru-līšir/Basia
Title: BM 74623

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver: A receives from B 5 minas of cut silver (kaspu nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel according to his promissory note (u’iltu) for which the debtor placed his arable land (zēru) in Du(r)bissu as a pledge. Before the 15th of Šabāṭ (XI) the creditor will bring the debt note and hand it over (našû-nadānu) to the debtor. 5 witnesses (including Basūru, courtier [ša rēš šarri]) and the scribe. The text is linked to the loan document BM74587.

A = Ina-Esagil-lilbur/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ša-nāšišu;  B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Šāpik-zēri/Mušēzib-Marduk//Amēl-Ea
Title: BM 74607

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 25;2.3 kor (4,590 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of the harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of Du(r)bissu. B will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII), in the enclosure (haṣāru), in the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu, in one delivery (ina muhhi ištet ritti), with for each kor of date palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date palm fibres (mangagu), pressed dates (darīku), date palm fronds (libbu) and loads of palm-frond ribs (biltu ša huṣābi). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-kāṣir//Uballissu-Marduk; Scribe = Nabû-mušētiq-uddi/Dayyān-Marduk//Rē’i-alpi
Title: BM 74680

Paraphrase:
Loan of barley: B, slave of C, owes A ½ 0;5 kor (90 l) of barley. He will give it back in Ayyār (II). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Šamšāya, slave of C; C = Bēlšunu; Scribe = Rēmūt-Bēl/Arrab
Title: BM 74613

Paraphrase:
Establishment of a joint venture: A1 and A2 jointly invest in a business partnership (ana harrāni šakānu). Each of them gives 5 minas of scrap silver with stamp-mark (kaspu qallalu ša ginni), income (erbu) of the cashbox (arannu). In addition, A1 gives 180 old empty vats and 10 new vats, and A2 80 old empty vats and 10 new vats. Whatever A2 will make from (ina muhhi) the sum of the invested capital (curiously 270 instead of 280 vats are summed up), they will enjoy an equal share (ahātu) in the profit (utru). This contract does not include (elat) the house which B invested in the same business. The domestic staff (nišē bīti) of A2 will be in the service (našpartu alāku) for the venture. The wife and daughters as well as the slaves of A2 will enjoy (akālu, ik-ka-ri!) rations (kurummatu) from the venture. 2 witnesses (including Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê) and the scribe. This document is linked to BM79714.
 
A1 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-iddin/Būru-šēzib; B = Būru-zēru-iddin; Scribe = […]-aplu-uṣur/[…]
Title: BM 63848

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Zēria//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = B
Title: MMA 86.11.188

Paraphrase:
Fragment of a lease of a prebend: A leased the manufacture (ēpišānūtu) of 2 ṣibtu-garments of Šamaš for the clothing ceremony (lubuštu) of Ayyār (II) to B. The lessee guarantees (pūtu našû) for not interrupting (lā baṭlu) the cult and punctuality (masnaqtu) of the performance of the cult. Break. 2+ witnesses and the scribe.
 
A Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni/Ṣāhit-sattukki; B = […]/Iqīša-Marduk//Eppēš-ilī; Scribe = Bēl-iddin/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili
Title: BM 62363
Place of issue Remark: Place note perserved, but presumably Sippar. ;

Paraphrase:
Lease of a prebend: The brothers A1 and A2 give prebends for the performance of the duties (ēpišānūtu) to B1 and B2 for 3 years. This concerns the prebend of the arranger-of-the-sacrificial-table (isiq mubannûti) in Ebabbar in Sippar of the months Ayyār (II), Dûzu (IV), Šabāṭ (XI) and the 1st to 10th of Arahsamna (VIII), the prebend of the oil-presser (ṣāhitu) from the 1st to 15th of Tašrīt (VII) as well as sweet cakes (muttāqu) of 14 “greeting-of-the-temple” ceremonies (šalām bīti) of the whole year. Large gap. The lessees shall give fine sesame oil (rūštu, re-eš-ti) and billatu-beer, income from these prebends, to the lessors. 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Marduk-balāssu-iqbi/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Libluṭ/Guzānu//Balīhu; B2 = Šamaš-ēṭir/Nabû-nāṣir//Isinnāya; Scribe = Nidintu/Bēl-ibni//Gahal
Title: BM 78165

Paraphrase:
Guarantee for escort: C1 and C2 guarantee (pūtu našû) that they will bring along (abāku) B, the scribe (ṭupšarru) of Ebabbar, and bring him to the mayor domo (rab bīti) A, creditor (rāšû) of B, on the 4th of Dûzu (IV). If they fail to do so, they will pay A 60 kor (10,800 l) of barley on the 5th of Dûzu (IV). 9 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Abdia, rab bīti (mayor domo) of […]; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê, ṭupšarru ša Ebabbar (college scribe of Ebabbar); C1 = Balāṭu/Šamaš-mukīn-apli; C2 = Bīt-il-šarru-uṣur/Nabû-rapa’; Scribe = Nergal-ēṭir/Nabû-[…]//[…]
Title: BM 74520

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 4 1/3 minas of white cut silver with stamp-seal (kaspu ṣepû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debtor will pay the silver in Ulūl (VI). Broken passage about the usage of the silver. 0;0.0.3 kor (3 l) of bread, 0;0.0.3 kor (3 l) of beer and meat, share (zittu) of the offering table (paššūru) in E-edinna, temple of Šarrat-Sippar, from the 1st [x] month to the [x] day of the same month as well as 10 tights (šabru) of the prebend of the gatekeeper (isiq atûti) of the gate (abullu) of [x] are placed as a pledge. 5(+) witnesses and the scribe.

A = Nabû-nādin-ahi/Marduk-bēl-napšāti//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Bēl-iddin?/Iddināya//Šigûa
Title: BM 64276

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2/3 mina of silver by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. He will pay the silver in Nisān (I). The house of the debtor, located in (ina qereb) Sippar and bordering the building plot (qanû) of the treasurer (mašennu) and the processional road (mālaku) of Šarrat-Sippar, is placed as a pledge. It is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). If these conditions are not kept, the debt bears a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). This is apart from (elat) the previous promissory note (u’iltu) on the basis of which A already took 1 mina of silver from B. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Nabû-bānûnu/Nergal-ušallim//Rē’i-sisê; Scribe = […]//Rē’i-sisê
Title: BM 61750

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 4 kor (720 l) of dates. He will give barley according to (akî) the exchange rate of dates (šupêltu ša suluppi) in Ayyār (II) on the quay of Sippar (Kār-Sippar). 4 witnesses (including Marduk-šumu-ibni, father of Nabû-zēru-iqīša, and […]-nādin-ahi, son of Marduk-šumu-ibni from the Isinnāya family) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Šamaš-kāṣir/Kīnāya// Isinnāya; Scribe = Bēl-iddin//Šarru-arazû
Title: BM 79593

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 3 minas and 16 ½ shekels of white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt will bear a monthly interest of one shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). The credited silver is the remainder of the previous promissory note (u’iltu) concerning in total 5 minas of silver. 6 witnesses (including Basūru, courtier [ša rēš šarri]) and the scribe. The text is linked to the receipt BM74607.
 
A = Ina-Esagil-lilbur/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ša-nāšišu;  B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Šāpik-zēri/Mušēzib-Marduk//Amēl-Ea
Title: BM 74587

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 3 minas of silver. The bīt kuruppi-warehouse next to the warehouse of A is placed as a pledge. 1+ witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Zēria//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Iddin-Marduk/Ile’i-bulluṭ-Marduk//Nappāhu
Title: BM 64331

Paraphrase:
Payment of the pending compensation of dowry: On the first day of Dûzu (IV) B2 and his brothers will pay to fA (their stepmother) 3 minas of silver. This is instead of the dowry (nudunnû) which her husband B1, father of the brothers, promised to give her in addition to (elat) the slave woman fC who is also part of the dowry. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina mahar) the judges (dayyānu) Bēl-iddin, Nargiya and Munahhiš-Marduk each of whom also put a sealing (kunukku) on the tablet. Except for the scribe no other witnesses are mentioned.
 
fA = fBu’ītu/Šamaš-mukīn-apli; B1 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B2 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; fC = fNanāya-bēlu-uṣrī; Scribe = Līšir//Išparu
Title: BM 61183

Paraphrase:
Transfer of dowry: B promised to give to (his son-in-law) A1 a dowry (nudunnû) along with his daughter fC, consisting of 5 minas of silver, the (slaves) fD1 and fD2 and household goods (udê bīti). In the present document the groom and the bride are paid (eṭēru Stat.) the said goods. In addition (elat) to these goods, they (already) received the jewelry (šukuttu) worth 1 mina and 10 shekels of silver that fA2, mother of A1, put on fC as a marriage gift (biblu). 2(+) witnesses and the scribe (name lost).
 
A1= Mušēzib-Marduk/Ṣillāya//Sūhāya; fA2 = fBurāšu; B = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; fC = fIna-Esagil-râmat/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; fD1 = fNanāya-lummir; fD2 = fNanāya-kēširat
Title: BM 64195

Paraphrase:
Promised transfer of a dowry: Along with his daughter fC, B1 voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) promises to give as a dowry (nudunnû) 3 minas of silver, 20 reeds (980 square cubits = 245 m2) of land in Sippar adjoining the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the gods and the king and the house of D, 0;2 square kor (5,400 m2) of land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) located between the Nāru-ša-šalla Canal and the Tīl-Gubbi Hill, a slave (amīlūtu) and household goods (udê bīti) to A. B1 will give the dowry to (his son-in-law) A on the day he marries. 6 witnesses (including Iqīša/Dayyān-Marduk//Ṣāhit-ginê, father of A, and Taqiš-Gula/Bēl-ahhe-iddina//Ṣāhit-ginê) and the scribe. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ašābi) fB2, mother of fC and wife of B1.

A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Šamaš-mukīn-apli/Mušēzib-Bēl//Balīhu; fB2 = fZazītu, mother of fC and wife of B1; fC = fBu’ītu/Šamaš-mukīn-apli//Balīhu; D = Rēmut-Bēl/Bēl-uballiṭ//Isinnāya; Scribe = Mušēzib-Marduk/Šulāya//Nappāhu
Title: BM 74346

Paraphrase:
Oath concerning the payment of silver: B swears (tamû) to A1 by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that until (adi) the 1st of Abu (V) he will finish (šalāmu D-stem) the legal case (amātu) concerning the 7 kor (1,260 l) of barley of the promissory note (u’iltu) of A2, father of A1, established at his expense of and that his words (amātu) will certainly be truthful (kēnu). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušēbši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Na’id-[DN]/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ša-nāšišu
Title: BM 74515

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 2;0.5 kor (390 l) of dates. He will pay the dates in Arahsamna (VIII) in Sippar. 3 witnesses and the scribe (not specified as such) who is identical with B.
 
A = Kiribtu/Iddināya/Ēdu-ēṭir; B = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = B
Title: BM 63822

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B1 owes A 1/3 mina of white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. B1 will pay it on the 15th of Tašrīt (VII). The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). The 1st, 2nd, 11th and 12th day of each month of the prebend of the butcher’s prebend (isiq ṭābihūti) in Ebabbar, temple of Šamaš of Sippar, is placed as a pledge. This is apart from (elat) the promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 4 1/3 minas of silver, without interest (qaqqadu), of A due from B2, father of B1, for which the gatekeeper’s prebend (isiq atûti) of the main gate (abullu) and 0;0.3 kor (18 l) of bread before Šarrat-Sippar have been placed as a pledge. 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nergal-ahhē-iddin/Marduk-bēl-napšāti//Šangû-Šamaš; B1 = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; B2 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Bēl-ittannu/Nabû-zēru-līšir/Ša-ṭābtīšu
Title: BM 74632

Paraphrase:
Receipt of rent: A receives from B 1 mina and 18 shekels of white cut silver without stamp-mark (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. It is the payment for the rent (idū) of the house and for the šugarrû (= date palm product) that was still needed to be paid for the period from Arahsamna (VIII) of Darius 25th year until the end of Ṭebēt (X) of the present year, i.e. for the past 3 years and 3 months. After A will have brought the document (šaṭāru) in Šabāṭ (XI) of the present year, B will entrust (paqādu) to A the bīt kuruppi-warehouse. After the said period, B has to pay 2 shekels of white silver per month to A. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-sattukki; B = Bēl-zēri/Bunene-ibni; Scribe = Marduk-ēreš/Nabû-mukīn-apli
Title: BM 63228

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates and silver: B owes A 83 kor (14,940 l) of dates and 2 minas of white cut silver without stamp-mark (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The house of B at the quay of Sippar (Kār-Sippar), bordering the houses of C1 and fC2, is placed as a pledge from Tašrīt (VII) of the present year onwards to secure 1 mina of the indebted silver. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel of white silver per mina (20% p.a.). B will pay the debts in Arahsamna (VIII) on the quay of Sippar in the house of A. 7 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šumu-ukīn/Bunene-ibni; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C1 = Iddināya/Kī-Sîn; fC2 = fAsītu-tabni; Scribe = Ina-ṣilli-Bēl/Niqūdu
Title: BM 64170

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1/3 mina of white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. This is the missing payment for the remainder (rēhtu) of the rations (kurummatu) until (adi) the end of his life. He will pay the silver at the end of Šabāṭ (XI). 7 witnesses (including Šamaš-iddin and Hadāya, brothers of A) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-uṣuršu/Nabû-iddin//Ea-ibni; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Šamaš-iddin/Libluṭ//Šangû-Ea
Title: BM 74591

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1/3 mina white cut silver (kaspu peṣû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-kāṣir/ina-tēšî-ēṭir//Ea-nāṣir; Scribe = Nidintu/Nādin/Ilē’i-Marduk
Title: BM 74618

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina and [50?] shekels of cut silver without stamp-mark (kaspu nuhhutu ša lā ginni) of 1/8 alloy (bitqu). The house of the debtor, adjoining the […] street (sūqu) and the houses of C1 and C2, is placed as a pledge. It is pledged to the creditor in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). According to a broken passage, the creditor will [give] […] and kīnayātu-gifts for the house to the debtor at the end [of the year?]. 8 witnesses (including several members of the Ṣāhit-ginê family) and the scribe.

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Nabû-mukīn-[x]//Ša-ṭābtīšu; C1 = Nabû-ittannu/Ea-šumu-uṣur; C2= Nergal-ibni//Rab-banê; Scribe = […]/Bēl-uballiṭ//[…]
Title: BM 64227

Paraphrase:
Oath concerning the redemption of debts: B swears (tamû) to A1 by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that before the 1st of Kislīm (IX) of Darius 6th year he will bring along (abāku) the flock (ṣēnu) and draw up the accounts (nikkassu epēšu) with A1 about the offspring (tamlittu), the shorn wool (gizzatu) and the donkeys on the basis of the promissory note (u’iltu) of A2. B will satisfy A1 (harrānu ana šēpē ša A1 šakānu). 5 witnesses (including Nergal-šumu-iddin, brother of A2 and uncle of A1) and the scribe. This is in addition to (elat) the summons (šaṭāru ša adannāti).
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Sîn-ahu-iddin/Ša-Nabû-šū; Scribe = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: MLC 1779a

Paraphrase:
Fragmentary lease contract concerning plough oxen: A rents out for cultivation (ana errēšūti nadānu) 4 plough oxen (alpu ša epinni) to B1 and B2. They guarantee for taking care (suddudu) and the guard (maṣṣartu) of the oxen. In case they do not work (epēšu) the land, they shall pay the same rate as their neighbours. For the period of 5 months the lessor will give 0;0.1.3 kor (9 l) of barley as a monthly ration (kurummatu) to the lessee B1. 2 witnesses and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy.
