A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Lâbâši/Bēl-ahhē-erība; B2 = Gimillu/Ipria//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Nabû-ittannu/Nabû-šumu-līšir//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili
Title: BM 74624

Paraphrase:
Joint lease of animals: A jointly rents out (ana zitti nadānu) to B his 2 white female donkeys, 2 male yearling donkey foals (mūru) and 1 two-year-old female donkey-foal for 1 1/3 minas of silver which he will obtain in full (šalāmu) from the offspring (tamlittu) of the animals. They will equally (ahāta) share the profit (utru). Of the fertile ewes from among 100 female small livestock – 60 fertile (ālittu) ewes, 30 female lambs (parratu) and 10 fertile she-goats – B will give the male and female lambs (parru u parratu) during 2 years. Per 100 ewes he shall give 2 talents and 10 minas of wool, including (adi) the shorn wool (gizzatu) of the female lambs. The present contract is apart from (elat) the 3-year-old donkey of A. B guarantees (pūtu našû) for taking care (suddudu) and the guard (maṣṣartu) of the donkeys. Per goat he shall give 5/6 mina of hair (šārtu). 2 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Sîn-ahu-iddin/Ša-Nabû-šū; Scribe = Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu/Bēl-kāṣir//Sîn-dā’in
Title: BM 74662

Paraphrase:
Duplicate of a slave sale for the redemption of debts: C has voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) sold his two slaves (amīlūtu), the bakers (nuhatimmu) D1 and D2, to fB, his wife, for 2 minas of silver. C guarantees (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqirānu) – the two bakers are neither of the status of royal servants (arad šarrūti) nor of the status free persons (mār banûti) nor “new break (hēpu)” in text. Out of the sum of 2 minas of silver, 56 shekels are used to pay A. 2 witnesses and the scribe. The text is linked to the loan document BM74962.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Iqīša; fB = fNin-[…]/Lâbâši//[…]; C = Nabû-zēru-iqīša/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Isinnāya; D1 = Ina-ṣilli-Bīt-Akītu; D2 = Ar-[…]; Scribe = Iddin-Marduk/Bēl-zēri//Sîn-tabni
Title: BM 74988

Paraphrase:
Lease of vats: A rents out (ana idī nadānu) to B [x] vats for [x] amounts of silver as rent (idū) which he already received from B. The debtor shall show (kalāmu) and give the vats back to the creditor in Dûzu (IV). 3 witnesses and the scribe (name lost).
 
A = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni; B = Nuhšannu/Iddin-Nabû
Title: BM 64260

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 6 kor (1,080 l) of barley and 6 kor (1,080 l) of dates. He will pay the barley in Ayyār (II) and the dates in Tašrīt (VII). The dates are those which the creditor registered (uzuzzu) in the treasury (namkūru) of Šamaš on behalf of (ana muhhi) the debtor. 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Nidintu/Sūqāya//Ile’i-Marduk; Scribe = Šūzubu/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk
Title: BM 74609

Paraphrase:
Fragmentary oath: [B] swears to A by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that he will bring him 1 ½ minas of silver and hand them over (našû-nadānu) on the 24th of Simān (III). If he fails to do so, the garment mender (mukabbû) C, slave (qallu) of [B], will become property of A. Remainder, including witness list and date formula lost.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; [B] = name lost; C = Nabû-ina-Esagil-lummir
Title: BM 84354

Paraphrase:
Oath concerning the stay in Sippar: B swears (tamû) to A by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that are no longer any debt notes (u’iltu rašûtu) due from him. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Šumu-ukīn/Bunene-ibni; Scribe = Balāṭu/Zēria//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 74558

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 20 minas of white cut silver (kaspu ṣepû nuhhutu) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). The debtor’s field is placed as a pledge until (adi) A has obtained in full (šalāmu) the credited sum of silver which he took up as guarantor (pūtu našû) for B on account of (ina qātē) D. The said field is located in Du(r)bissu and borders (the properties of) the judge (dayyānu) C1, C2 and C3 and the banks (kišādu) of the Euphrates as well as the Du(r)bissu Canal. 6 witnesses and the scribe. Seal impression (kunukku) of B.
 
A = Ṭābia/Nabû-šumu-iškun; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C1 = Uštānu, dayyānu (judge); C2 = Kalbi-Bābu; C3 = Lullā/Zabdia; D = Šulum-Bābili; Scribe = Bēl-nādin-apli//Eṭēru
Title: BM 74541

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: The scribes (ṭupšarru) of Ebabbar B1 and B2 owe A 55 kor (9,900 l) of dates. They will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII) in Darius 20th year. With the equivalent of the dates in silver the two debtors paid for the sheep and oxen that are needed for the regular offerings (ginê) of Šamaš of the months Dûzu (IV), Abu (V) and Ulūl (VI). This is apart from (elat) the previous promissory note (u’iltu) of 25 kor (4,500 l) of dates in the name (ana šumi) of C and the 6 kor of dates, remainder (rēhu) of the previous promissory notes due from (ina muhhi) the scribes B1 and D. The two debtors will bring the dates from the treasury (namkūru) of Šamaš and hand them over (našû-nadānu) to the creditor. 9 witnesses and the scribe. Seal impression (kunukku) of B2.
 
A = Šamaš-uballiṭ/[…]; B1 = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-šumu-līšir//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili, ṭupšar Ebabbar (scribe of Ebabbar); B2 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê, ṭupšar Ebabbar (scribe of Ebabbar); C = Šamaš-iddin/Nabû-šumu-iškun; D = Habaṣīru, ṭupšarru (scribe); Scribe = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 62553

Paraphrase:
Receipt of barley and wheat: A receives from C1 and C2, servants of B, 50 kor of barley and 2 kor of wheat. This is a partly repayment according to the promissory note (u’iltu) of A concerning 600 kor of dates and 400 kor of barley due from (ina muhhi) B which is guaranteed (pūtu našû) by C1. This is apart from (elat) the previous promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 100 kor of dates, but includes the 17 kor of barley from D. 9 witnesses (including Bēl-uballiṭ/Šamaš-iddin//Ṣāhit-ginê) and the scribe. Each party has taken a copy (šaṭāru).
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Erība-Marduk/Nidinti-Marduk; C1 = Šamšāya, slave of B; C2 = Nannia, slave of B; D = Šagê; Scribe = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Erība-Marduk//Rē’i-sisê
Title: BM 74621

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 1/3 minas of cut silver without stamp-mark (kaspu nuhhutu ša lā ginni) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt will bear a monthly interest of one shekels of silver per mina (20% p.a.). C guarantees (pūtu našû) for paying (eṭēru) the silver. 8 witnesses (including Nidintu, son of C) and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Nergal-ašarēdu/Kabtia// Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Nabû-ittannu/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Šamaš-erība/Bēl-iqīša//Isinnāya
Title: BM 74584

Paraphrase:
Decision about repayment: B will bring along (abāku) and pay (eṭēru) A1 the entire flock (ṣēnu) on the 1st of Kislīm (IX) of Darius 6th year according to (akî) the promissory note (u’iltu) of A2. Instead of the ewes (ṣēnu ālittu), which are part of the offspring (tamlittu) of the flock, fC, slave woman (qallatu) of B with a wrist (rittu) branded (šaṭāru) with B’s name, belongs to (pāni dagālu) A1. 5 witnesses (including Nergal-šumu-iddin, brother of A2 and uncle of A1) and the scribe.

A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīša//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Sîn-ahu-iddin/Ša-Nabû-šū; fC = fNanāya-ana-bītīšu; Scribe = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 74661

Paraphrase:
Oath concerning the holding of a lawsuit: B1 swears (tamû) to A1 by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that he will bring along (abāku) his father B2 to Sippar on the 22nd of Addar (XII). There he shall litigate (dabābu) with A1 about (ana muhhi) the flock (ṣēnu) of A2, A1’s father, which is at the disposal of B2. In case B2 does not litigate with A1, he will pay according to the verdict the judges (dayyānu) give (dânu). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Nabû-bullissu/Sîn-ahu-iddin; B2 = Sîn-ahu-iddin, father of B1; Scribe = Iddin-Nabû/Nergal-ēṭir//Ša-nāšišu
Title: BM 74658

Paraphrase:
Decision about the clearance of future claims: B2 shall clear (murruqu) from claims and give the thigh (pēmu) (of mutton) from offerings before the divine chariot (narkabtu) of Šamaš to A who bought it for 2 minas of white silver (kaspu peṣû) from B1, brother of B2. If B2 fails to do so, he has to pay the 2 minas of silver to A. Half a month (šapattu) of the butcher’s prebend (ṭābihūtu) in Ebabbar, Šamaš Temple in Sippar, and B2’s house at the Gate of Bunene (bāb Bunene) are placed as a pledge. 3(+) witnesses and the scribe (name lost). The text is linked to BM79783.
 
A = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B1 = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Nūrea//Isinnāya; B2 = Šamaš-uballiṭ/Nūrea//Isinnāya
Title: BM 64210

Paraphrase:
Broken loan of silver: B owes A 4 shekels of silver. The debtor will pay the silver in Tašrīt (VII). 4 witnesses and the scribe. The indebted sum as well as the creditor and the debtor are mentioned at the end of the tablet in Aramaic.

A = Nidinti-Bēl/[x]//Raksu; B = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = […]/Bēl-[…] or Nabû-[…]
Title: BM 71056

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 2;2.5 kor (462 l) of dates (suluppu). He will pay (eṭēru) the indebted dates in Šabāṭ (XI) in the month of the arranger-of-the-sacrificial-table prebend (mubannûtu). C guarantees (pūtu našû) for the payment (eṭēru) of the dates. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-eṭēru/Iqīša-Marduk//Ea-Eppēš-ili; B = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Libluṭ/Guzānu; Scribe = Bēl-ittannu/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Balāṭu
Title: BM 71151

Paraphrase:
Fragmentary loan of silver: B owes A [x] amounts of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginne). Other details and the upper part of the witness list are lost. 2+ witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Zēria//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê
Title: BM 66127

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 mina of cut silver without stamp-mark (kaspu nuhhutu ša lā ginne) by 1/8 alloy (bitqu) per shekel. The debt will bear an interest of one shekel of silver per mina (20% p.a.). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Zēria//Šangû-Šamaš; Scribe = Nidintu/Līšir//Išparu
Title: BM 74565

Paraphrase:
Loan of barley: B owes A 50 kor (900 l) of barley. The debtor will pay the barley in Simān (III). C, priest (šangû) of Sippar, guarantees (pūtu našû) and swears (tamû) by Bēl and the king for the punctual (adannu ul-te-ti-qu = the deadline shall not expire) payment (eṭēru). 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Aqabu/Basia; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Guzānu, šangû (priest) of Sippar; Scribe = B
Title: BM 74542

Paraphrase:
Loan of a garment: B owes A one uzāru-garment of good quality (babbanû). He will give it on the 1st of Addar (XII). If he does not give, the debtor will pay 10 shekels of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginne). 3 witneses and the scribe.
 
A = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B = Šamaš-iddin/Šamaš-rē’išunu; Scribe = Lâbâši/Nabû-nāṣir//Nannûtu
Title: BM 74577

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B1, B2 and B3 owe A 380 kor (68,400 l) of dates. They have sworn (tamû) to the creditor by Bēl, Nabû and the king of Babylon that they will give the dates in Arahsamna (VIII), in the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu, in the enclosure (haṣāru), in one delivery (ina muhhi išten ritti). Each is responsible for the other (ištēn pūt šanî našû); the one who is available (qerbu) must pay (eṭēru). The dates are meant for the white silver (kaspu peṣû) for the “fitting-out” (pasa’du) given to C by the rab banê. 13 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B1 = Arad-Bunene/Na’id-Marduk//Ile’i-Marduk; B2 = Ardia/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk; B3 = Iddin-Bēl/Šamaš-uballiṭ//Ile’i-Marduk; C = Balāṭu; Scribe = Šūzubu/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk
Title: BM 74606

Paraphrase:
Receipt of dowry: A receives from (his father-in-law) B [x] minas of silver, the remainder of 3 minas of silver which form part of the dowry (nudunnû) of his wife fC. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; fC = fNadāya/Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; Scribe = Šūzubu/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ile’i-Marduk
Title: BM 74514

Paraphrase:
Heavily broken loan document: B owes A1 and A2 [x] commodity. Details not preserved. 3(+) witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Aplāya/Mušēzib-Bēl//Rē’i-sisê; A2 = […]/[…]//Pahhāru; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Gimil-Šamaš/Rēmūt-Bēl//Šumu-libši
Title: BM 64280

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 40 shekels of stamped silver (kaspu ša ginni). He will pay in Šabāṭ (XI). The promissory note (u’iltu) concerning 28 ½ shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû) and 17 shekels of stamped silver of A due from (ina muhhi) B is paid off (eṭēru Stat.). 2 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Nidinti-Bēl/Bēl-rēmanni; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; Scribe = Nergal-šumu-iddin/Iqīša//Ṣāhiṭ-ginê
Bibliography: Assyrian and Babylonian contracts with Aramaic reference notes: no. 33
Title: BM 92734

Paraphrase:
Clearance of future claims: C, the original owner of the right to a thigh (pēmu) of mutton from offerings before the divine chariot (narkabtu) of Šamaš of Sippar, will clear (murruqu) the thigh from any claims and give it to its present owner A, his grandnephew. A received it from B, who previously bought (ana kaspi mahāru) the right from C. 4 witnesses (including Tabnēa/Mušēzib-Marduk//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili) and the scribe. The text is linked to BM64210.

A = Lūṣi-ana-nūri/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; B = Nabû-uṣuršu/Nūrea/Isinnāya; C = Iddin-Nabû/Marduk-nāṣir//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; Scribe = Ubalissu-Gula/Ahhē-iddin-Marduk//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili
Title: BM 79783

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document. A leases from B two canals: the Bēl Canal, also known as the Saḫiri Canal, and the canal of Mušēzib-Bēl with adjacent crown land (uzbarra). Lease terms: duration is not specified. Fixed yearly rent (sūtu) of 36,000 liters from the field crops of which 27,000 liters in barley (uṭṭatu) and the rest in wheat (kibtu), emmer (kunāšu) and millet (duḫnu), measured in the large standard (mašīḫu rabû). Payable at the barley harvest (month II). Additional rights and duties: A may divert (šadādu) water from the reservoir (ṣibittu) in Bīt-[…]. A shall pay to B an additional surcharge (mandattu) in livestock for pasturing (1 ox and 5 male sheep). B guarantees that there will be no litigation (la dababa) or contestation (la ḫarara) by C who is in charge of rents (ša muḫḫi sūti) for the [Sîn] Canal district against A for his use of water and land. A (?) shall pay a silver fine if (broken).
Made up in the presence of 7 witnesses a.o. Ninurta-iddin/Ninurta-erība, governor (šaknu) of Nippur.
Title: CBS 4993+
Items and quantifiable data: 1-, Fields;</unit>150kor, Barley;</unit>10kor, Wheat;</unit>30kor, Emmer;</unit>10kor, Millet;</unit>1-, Cattle;</unit>5-, Sheep/Goats;</unit>2-, Canals

Paraphrase: "Sed ut perspiciatis unde omnis iste natus error sit voluptatem accusantium doloremque laudantium, totam rem aperiam, eaque ipsa quae ab illo inventore veritatis et quasi architecto beatae vitae dicta sunt explicabo. Nemo enim ipsam voluptatem quia voluptas sit aspernatur aut odit aut fugit, sed quia consequuntur magni dolores eos qui ratione voluptatem sequi nesciunt. Neque porro quisquam est, qui dolorem ipsum quia dolor sit amet, consectetur, adipisci velit, sed quia non numquam eius modi tempora incidunt ut labore et dolore magnam aliquam quaerat voluptatem. Ut enim ad minima veniam, quis nostrum exercitationem ullam corporis suscipit laboriosam, nisi ut aliquid ex ea commodi consequatur? Quis autem vel eum iure reprehenderit qui in ea voluptate velit esse quam nihil molestiae consequatur, vel illum qui dolorem eum fugiat quo voluptas nulla pariatur?"
Transliteration: "Sed ut perspiciatis unde omnis iste natus error sit voluptatem accusantium doloremque laudantium, totam rem aperiam, eaque ipsa quae ab illo inventore veritatis et quasi architecto beatae vitae dicta sunt explicabo. Nemo enim ipsam voluptatem quia voluptas sit aspernatur aut odit aut fugit, sed quia consequuntur magni dolores eos qui ratione voluptatem sequi nesciunt. Neque porro quisquam est, qui dolorem ipsum quia dolor sit amet, consectetur, adipisci velit, sed quia non numquam eius modi tempora incidunt ut labore et dolore magnam aliquam quaerat voluptatem. Ut enim ad minima veniam, quis nostrum exercitationem ullam corporis suscipit laboriosam, nisi ut aliquid ex ea commodi consequatur? Quis autem vel eum iure reprehenderit qui in ea voluptate velit esse quam nihil molestiae consequatur, vel illum qui dolorem eum fugiat quo voluptas nulla pariatur?"
Title: Test Roxanne Wyns 001 nnn

Paraphrase: Note (with obverse and reverse apparently interchanged): Šuzubu sent 26 kor (4,860 l) of barley via camels to Babylon. From these 6 kor (1,080 l) are extraction (nishu) and 20 are missing? (lá).
Title: MLC 1798

Paraphrase: Purchase of a slave: Details unknown. The text mentions the šatammu (Šamaš-šumu-lēšir) and the mayor (hazannu) Šamaš-šarru-uṣur.
Title: BM 50110
YBC 11386

Heavily damaged legal record of unclear type: A type of contract between A1 and A2 and B concerning land. Witnesses and the scribe.

Title: BM 82770

Quitclaim concerning a purchased field: For the field which has been bought by A from B, a sealed tablet (kunukku) is made ready (hâru B) for B. A will not return the money and he will not litigate with C, son of B, about the field (A kaspišu ul itarima A ana muhhi eqli itti C ul idabbub). Witnesses and scribe.

A = Nabû-kāṣir/Kidin-Sîn; B = Nenea/Kidin-Sîn; C = Bēl-ibni/Nenea; Scribe Bēl-ahu-iddin//lú.šiški?
Title: BM 26377

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A [x] amounts of silver. In case he fails to pay in due time, the debt will bear a monthly interest of 1/2 shekel per mina (10% p.a.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Mušēzib-Marduk/[…]; B = Nāṣir/Ṣillāya, Urukean; Scribe = […]/Kidin
Title: BM 114731

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B1, B2 and B3 owe A 1 mina of silver for a joint business venture (ana harrāni). A will receive (akālu) a share (zittu) of ½ mina of silver from the debtors. 2 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Šamaš-ahu-iddin//Arad-Nergal; B1 = Šākin-šumi//Zērāya; B2 = Iddina-apli//Ea-pattanu; B3 = Nabû-ibni//Išinukku; Scribe = Nabû-bēlšunu//Arad-Nergal
Title: CUA 10

Paraphrase:
Note: 0;1.4 kor (60 l) old dates for hašilātu-date-dish (hašiTU) are at the disposal of B.

B = Arad-Ayyata or Yaqayata
Title: MLC 1797

Paraphrase:
Redemption of debts: A receives from B1 1/3 minas and 5 shekels of silver and will receive another 1/3 minas and 5 shekels of silver from B2, brother of B1, in the month Arahsamna (VIII) in Babylon. Both amounts of money, in sum 50 shekels of silver, actually belong to C who is creditor of B1. Witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir u’ilti).

A = Tabnēa; B1 = Bēlšunu/Kudurrānu; B2 = Ahhešāya/Kudurrānu; C = Balāssu/Ea-ibni; Scribe = Marduk-zēru-ibni//Malahu
Title: BM 29171

Paraphrase: Account of divine garments of different type: The accounts of different types of garments of red and blue wool (tabarru, takiltu), work (dullu) of the weavers Šamaš-šumu-ibni and Iqišāya as well as a certain Dummuqu, are settled.
Title: BM 50031

Paraphrase: Fragment of a property transfer: A gift or another type of property is transferred to Balāssu. Witnesses (including Nabû-iqbi/Nūr-Papsukkal, temple enterer [ērib bīti] of Nabû and šatammu of Ezida, as well as Mušallim-il, royal prefect? [šākin šarri]) and the scribe.
Title: BM 82718

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document over a marriage agreement: B approaches (qabû) fC and asks her to be his wife. fC grants (šemû) the request. Litigation clauses including the iron dagger clause. 5(+) witnesses and the scribe.

B = […]su/Nādinu; fC = Qunnabātu/Nabû-zēr-lēšir
Title: BM 50149

Paraphrase:
Note: 0;4.5 kor (174 l) of millet (duhnu) is at the disposal of B.

B = Ahu-ēriba
Title: MLC 1796

Paraphrase: Administrative record over the expenditure of dates: makkasu-dates are provided to the cooks Ibnāya, Balāssu, Bēl-na’id, Zikāru, Kunāya Ibnāya/Kudurru for the monthly guqqû-offering.
Title: BM 49982

Paraphrase:
Copy of a purchase of a garden during times of hardship: A purchases from the brothers? B1, B2, B3 and B4 a garden, part of the land of C. The sold garden is located at the Lagamal Canal (harru ša Lagamal) in Dilbat. Witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impressions.

A = Bēl-iqīša//Ṭābihu; B1 = Ea-ibni; B2 = Munnabittu; B3 = Nergal-ēṭer; B4 = Nabû-gāmil/Šumāya; C = Šumāya/Basia
Title: YBC 11377

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document over a marriage agreement: B approaches (qabû) fA1 and A2 and asks them to give their daughter fC into marriage with him. fA1 grants (šemû) the request. B voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) gives fA1 his property, that is, his assigned property (nungurtu ša āli u ṣēri) and the property from his paternal estate (nikkassu ša bīt ābi). Litigation clauses including the iron dagger clause. 9(+) witnesses and the scribe.

fA1 = Ahāt-aqrat, mother of fC; A2 = Bēl-iqīša; B = Mār-bīti-ahhē-iddin/Arad-[…]āya; fC = Nanāya-kīširrat, daughter of fA1; Scribe = […]/Kidannu
Title: BM 54158

Paraphrase:
Note: 2 kor (360 l) of barley at the disposal of (pānu) the potter B.

B = Nabû-iddin, pahhāru (potter)
Title: MLC 1811

Paraphrase:
Expenditure of barley or flour: Barley or flour is withdrawn for the domestic staff (nišū bīti) via various individuals, including A1, A2 and A3.

A1 = Yaqayata; A2 = Baruqa’; A3 = Marduku
Title: MLC 1795

Paraphrase: List of barley yield: An amount of barley yield (nishu) of the present year is listed and handed over, along with several individuals (including a third man [tašlīšu]) and the Nabû Temple.
Title: BM 108370

Paraphrase:
Loan of reed: B owes an amount of mišihtu-measurements of reed, property (makkūru) of Šamaš. The debt will bear interest. Witnesses and the scribe.

B = Hanūnu, rab ikkarāte ša šākin māti (chief farmer of the governor)
Title: BM 50762

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A purchases from the two brothers B1 and B2 as well as their mother fB3 garden land (qutānu). The sold land is located at the Lagamal Canal (harru ša Lagamal) and the Šamaš Gate (abul Šamaš) in Dilbat. Witnesses and scribe. Fingernail impressions. Additional note: This transaction took place during times of hardship when the enemy sieged the city and the price for 0;0.0.3 kor (3 l) barley was 1 shekel of silver.

A = Marduk-šāpik-zēri/Bammāya//Egibi; B1 = Nabû-ittabši-lēšir/Labāši//Basia; B2 = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Labāši//Basia; fB3 = Bēlessunu, mother of B1 and B2
Title: YBC 11317

Paraphrase:
Purchase of hanšu land: A purchases hanšu land for 20 shekels of silver from B. The sold land is located in the meadow (tamertu) of […] and borders on a dike (makallu). 6 witnesses (including Ninurta-ušabši and Lāqipu from the Miṣirāya family) and the scribe.

A = Bēl-ēṭir//Miṣirāya; B = Ubar/Šigua; Scribe = […]/Gahal
Title: BM 78167

Paraphrase: Note: 3 positions of small amounts of spices and plants for? Ṭab-Uruk for x-e-ga.
Title: MLC 1810

Paraphrase: Expenditure of dates: The woman Šarbāya gives 0;0.1 kor (6 l) of dates for a torch? (di-ra-pa, emend. to dipāru?).
Title: MLC 1794

Paraphrase: List of barley yield: An amount of barley yield (nishu) from the 4th to the 11th day in the month Kislīm (IX) of the present year is listed, along with several individuals (including farmers [ikkāru], a man from Uruk, a chariot maker [nagger narkabti]).
Title: BM 108508

Paraphrase:
Partly broken purchase of a garden: A purchases a garden from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-zēru-lēšir) and the šatammu of Eanna (Bēl-uballiṭ). 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A = […]-ēṭer/[…]-iddin; B = Bēl-zēri; Scribe = Mardu
Title: PTS 2479
BM 78159

Paraphrase: Account of barley income: Small amounts of late barley (uṭṭatu uppultu) are given as estimated amount (imittu) and as šibšu-tax by various positions, including individuals bearing west-semitic names.
Title: MLC 1809

Paraphrase: Expenditure of flour: An amount of flour is at the disposal (pānu) of various positions.
Title: MLC 1793

Paraphrase: List of estimated income of dates: In sum 136 dates are listed as estimated harvest (imittu) of the present year and handed over. There is inter alia a gardener from the town of […] mentioned.
Title: BM 108510

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes silver, property (makkūru) of Šamaš, for reed. He will pay the debt according to the price before the šatam Ebabbar (Šamaš-udammiq) and the qīpu (Kudurru/Šanašišu). Witnesses and the scribe.

B = Iqišāya; Scribe = Šamaš-muter-gimilli/Nannutu
Title: BM 75779

Paraphrase: Administrative document over the income of gold and bronze: 13 1/3 minas and 5 shekels of red gold, an incense stand (nignakku) of Šadunu, 1/3 mina and 6 ½ shekels of bronze and 2 good-quality cauldrons came in. 13 minas and 51 ½ shekels of red gold together with 7 minas and 15 ½ shekels of bronze …
Title: NCBT 368

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 13 2/3 shekels of silver. In case B fails to pay on time, the debt will bear an interest of 10 shekels per mina (16.66% p.a.). Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Marduk-erība/Zerāya; B = Nabû-zēru-ukīn/Šanašišu; Scribe = B(?)
Title: BM 54223

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B1, B2, B3, B4 and B5 owe to (ina muhhi ina pāni) the Šamaš Temple 30 talents of silver. For each mina of silver, the debtors have to give one sheep (ṣēnu) to the Šamaš Temple in Ulūl (VI). If they do not deliver on time, they have to give the sheep together with their offspring (tālittu). In the presence of (ina uzuzzi) 5 witnesses (including Bēl-īpuš, royal resident (qīpu) of Sippar, as first witness and Na’id-Marduk, apparently another title-bearer [lost], as second witness; see Nielsen 2011: 169-170) and the scribe.
 
B1 = Šumu-iddin; B2 = Marduk-mušallim; B3 = Šarrāni; B4 = Marduk//Girrema; B5 = Nabû-mušallim; Scribe = Nabû-nāṣir-napšāti
Bibliography: Moldenke 1893 no. 1 (printed copy, transliteration, translation). Delaunay 1977, Part II, 1 (transliteration, translation, comment). Cast CBS 16502: BE 8/1, 141 (edition). Mentioned in Nielsen 2011 passim.
Title: MMA 86.11.76

Paraphrase: Fragmentary document probably dealing with the expenditure of barley: Extraction (nishu) of barley at the disposal (pānu) of various individuals, including a “third man” (tašlīšu).
Title: MLC 1792

Paraphrase: Account of šibšu-tax for an estate of the daughter of the king: Several individuals (including a farmer [ikkāru]) are supposed to pay the estimated amount (imittu) of 44 kor (7,920 l) barley as šibšu-tax for the soils (qaqqarātu) of the royal daughter (mārat šarri) in the town of […].
Title: BM 108527

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes silver, property (makkūru) of Šamaš in the responsibility of A, for bricks for the construction of a ramp (marhaṣu) by Bēl-iqīša/Rabaša, Ninurta-eriba, Kudurru/Ša-Našišu, Bēl-ahhu-balliṭ/Edeṭer and Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Aplāya.

A = Bēl-šarru-uṣur, ša-rēš-šarri, bēl piqitti ša kāru; B = Nabû-bēl-šumāti, ērib-bīt-Šamaš
Title: BM 97376

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for wool: B owes Eanna (Ištar Temple) 55 ½ minas of wool from 47 ewes. He has to deliver it on the 15th of Simān (III) to Eanna via C. The transaction is concluded in the presence (ina ušuzzi) of the qīpu of Uruk and Eanna (Šamaš-ilāya). Witnesses and the scribe.

B = Bēl-ahu-iddin; C = Bibea
Title: NCBT 1177

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 19 shekels of silver. The debt will bear an interest of 3 ¾ shekels of silver (20% p.a.). Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Itti-Nabû-UD; B = Uraš-bēl-ili/Lagamal-ušēzib
Title: BM 54216

Paraphrase: Loan of gold: Two individuals lend gold. If they do not pay it to the temple in due time, a fine will be imposed on them. The transaction took place in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the bishop (šatammu) of the Eanna Temple (Marduk-nāṣir) and the royal resident (qīpu) (Nabû-rēmanni). 5 witnesses and the scribe.
Title: NBC 1051

Paraphrase:
Loan of barley: fB owes A 2;1.4 kor (420 l) barley. The barley has to be paid without interest (qaqqadu) Dûzu (IV). The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) Indēšu/Bēl-usippi. No other witnesses are mentioned, but the scribe.
 
A = Nādinu//Amēl-Nanāya; fB = fEtellītu, wife of Lagamal-ēṭir; Scribe = Puhhuru//Nabû-lēˀi
Title: MLC 1786

Paraphrase:
Expenses of barley: In sum 21;1.4 kor (3,840 l) extraction (nishu) of barley is given at the disposal of various individuals, including the farmer B1 and B2.

B1 = Ahu-iaqia, from Bit-Kalbāya, ikkaru nahia (farmer); B2 = Marduk, from Ur
Title: MLC 1791

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes silver, property (makkūru) of Šamaš. He will pay the debt according to the price in Sippar in the month Nisān (I). 2 witnesses and the scribe.

B = Šāpik-zēri/Šullumu; Scribe = Iddin-ahu/Irani
Title: BM 49166

Paraphrase:
Administrative document over the expenses of iron: 1 talent of iron (ṣi-la-nu) and 1 talent of nails (sikkatu) from Hume – in sum 2 talents of iron – are at the disposal of A, the iron smith, for the equipment (unūtu) of the bronze smiths.

A = Nanāya-ēreš, nappah parzilli (iron smith)
Title: NCBT 1093

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 16 shekels of silver. The debt will bear a yearly interest of 2 shekels. Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Šumāya/Buṣu; B = Balāṭu/Dullupu; Scribe = Nabû-apkal-ili/Dullupu
Title: BM 54214

Bibliography: BR 8/7, 14 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Nielsen 2011: 164, fn. 38.
Title: VAT 8495

Paraphrase: Expenditure of barley: Extraction (nishu) of barley given to various positions, including named individuals. Each position receives 1 kor (180 l).
Title: MLC 1806

Paraphrase: Expenses of wool for weavers: Wool is withdrawn and given to the female weavers in order to produce combed wool (pušikku).
Title: MLC 1790

Paraphrase: Administrative document over the expenses of oil: In sum 6 containers (nēsepu) oil are at the disposal (lapan) of Nabû-kuzub-ili for the širkus and for expenses (tēlītu) from Bit-Kare.
Title: BM 49167

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 2 1/12 shekels of silver. The debt will bear an interest in terms of barley. Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Apkallu/Dullupu; B = Upāqu/Ahu-iddin; Scribe = Nabû-mušetiquddu/Arkat-ili-damqa
Title: BM 54213

Paraphrase: Examination of small livestock: 51 rams (puhālu), 441 full-grown ewes (lahru), 85 female lambs (parsallu), 20+ male lambs (pargallu), 4+ goats (enzu), 1+ he goats (mašgallu), 2+ female kids (ùz.mí.áš..gàr.me), [x] male kids (máš.tur.me) - in sum 425+ - livestock animals are at the disposal (ina pāni) of Bibea/Nūrea.
Title: 1982.A.1779

Paraphrase: Administrative document over the expenses of gold: [x] minas and 13 shekels of gold for 937 rosettes (ajaru) and tenšû-ornaments, decoration for mušiptu-garments, and [x] and 55 shekels of gold for [x] big and [x] small lions, again perhaps small decoration objects for garments. Penalty clause.
Title: GCBC 791

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a date garden: A purchases 2;2.3 kor (432 l) (or 2;2.4 kor [438 l]?), cultivated date garden (kirî gišimmari) for 1/3 mina and 5 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of ½ shekel of silver, from B1, fB2 and fB3. The sold garden is located in the irrigation area (tamirtu) Hamašu of the district (pihātu) of the Gutean City (URU qu-ta-a-a-nu). Its upper side (in the north) borders on (the property of) C1 and its lower side (in the south) on the garden of C2. Its upper front (in the west) borders on the royal road (harrān šarri) and its lower front (in the east) on the irrigation canal (harru) of C3. Surprisingly, the payment clause only talks about 1;2.4 kor (276 l) garden. Rather than being a mistake, this circumstance seems to be connected with the subsequent clause. Though partly broken, this uncommon clause seems to determine that it is upon the buyer A to choose which part of B1’s land he exactly wants to take over. The following penalty clause determines that in case of any rebellion (sīhu) and claims (pāqirānu) towards A, A is entitled to take into his possessions (ina libbi ṣabātu) another garden of B1 which is located in front of the city (mihrat āli) and borders on the city gate (abullu) and the canal (nāru) of a second garden (kirû šanû) as well as on the properties of C4 and C5. 11 witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the three sellers.

A = Upāqu/Lā-bāši//Šigūa; B1 = Nabû-erība/Ahhēa; fB2 = Bunānītum, mother of B1; fB3 = Erištu, wife of B1; C1 = Šulāya/Nabû-ēreš; C2 = Aliaˀu; C3 = Balāssu; C4 = Nabû-ušēzib/Hiṭā; C5 = Banūnu//Sîn-bēl-zēri; Scribe = Nergal-ušēzib//Damqa
Bibliography: San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 19 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Oppenheim, Iraq 17 (1955), 76.
Title: IM 113235

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document over the guarantee on a married woman: B approaches (ana pāni alāku) fA and tells him that he will be the guarantor (pūtu našû) of fC1, wife of C2. Subsequent clauses about escape (halāqu) etc. are broken. 2+ witnesses, identified as such at the end of the witness list while no scribe is explicitly specified.

fA = Suddurti; B = Nabû-iddin/Ea-ibni, huṣṣuāyu? (reedhut-dweller/-builder?); fC1 = Hazannutu, wife of C2; C2 = Ayya-idati, husband of fC1
Title: MLC 1805

Paraphrase:
List of sheep of the king withdrawn: In sum 3 sheep of the king are withdrawn for B1, B2, B3 and B4 for masTAR of fA and for B5.

fA = Gudatu; B1 = Nūrānu; B2 = Dannilua or Dannea, manzāz pāni?; B3 = Bēl-lumur; B4 = Arad-Ṣarpanitu; B5 = Nabû-rēmanni
Title: MLC 1789

Paraphrase: Trees have been cut down in the garden of Šamaš. Willows (hilēpu) and datepalms and the length of beams.
Title: BM 114758

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for reed: 20 loads of reed of the Šamaš Temple are at the disposal (ina pāni) of B. The debt will be paid back on a specific date. The debt will bear an interest. Witnesses and the scribe.

B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šamaš-nāṣir/Šanašišu; Scribe = Nabû-muter-gimilli/Nannautu (d.ŠEŠ.KI.Ù.TU)
Title: FLP 1517

Paraphrase:
Summary tablet of 2 promissory notes: In case (a) B1 owes A 1/3 mina of silver. In case (b) B2, son of B1, owes 10 shekels of silver to A. The debt will bear interest. The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of a field, which, if restored correctly, is in Bit-nappahu. Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Bēl-ibni/Erība-Uraš; B1 = Kiribtu; B2 = Balāṭu/Kiribtu
Title: BM 54192

Paraphrase: Administrative document over the expenses of, in sum, 12 minas and 8 shekels of gold: 8 minas and 52 shekels of gold for 561 rosettes (ajaru) and 560 tenšû-ornaments, decoration of additional mušiptu-garments, and 3 minas and 16 shekels of gold for 70 big and 25 small lions, again perhaps small decoration objects for garments.
Title: GCBC 572

Paraphrase: Note: 4 talents of wool from Hinunu to Nanāya. Usually 1 mina wool can be acquired for 20 shekels of silver. Here, 3 minas of wool can be acquired with 1 shekel of silver.
Title: MLC 1804

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A an amount of silver. The debt will bear an interest of 1/5 per shekel. The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of a house (bītu). Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Kidinnāya; B = Ninurta-iddin/Ibni-Enlil; Scribe = Qišti-Bēl
Title: FLP 1453

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 1/3 mina of silver, capital sum (qaqqadu). The debt will bear a yearly interest of 3.5 shekels. Witnesses (including Balāṭu, son of A) and the scribe.

A = Kiribtu; B = Ša-Nabû-šu/Labāši; Scribe = Šāpi-Nabû//Aškāpu
Title: BM 54151

Paraphrase:
Partly broken legal document over the redemption of a debt of silver: B has to pay 4 minas of silver to his two brothers A1 and A2 on the 25th(?) of Tašrīt (VII). If he manages to do so, A1 and A2 will give him the orchards. If this is not the case, the orchards will belong to A1 and A2. In either case, B is not entitled to give the orchards to anyone else. If he gives back the money according to the tablet of Kurigalzu, A1 and A2 will purchase the orchards. Witnesses and the scribe.

A1 = Nādin/Kudurānu; A2 = Bēl-iddin/Kudurānu; B = Nabû-ušallim/Kudurānu; Scribe = Bēl-iddin/Munnabitu
Title: BM 29415

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house: A purchases a built house (bītu epšu) for 1 mina and 15 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The sold house is located in the Ehilianki district (erṣet Ehilianki) inside of Babylon. Its upper side borders on (the property or properties of) C1 and C2 and its lower side on (the property of) C3. Its upper front borders on (the property of) C4 and its lower front on (the property of) B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-ušabši). 3 witnesses and the scribe (not specified). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.

A = Ina-ešē-ēṭir//Nabû-ēṭir; B = Eriši//Nabû-bēlāni; C1 = Šulāya//Nabû-nāṣir; C2 = Bēl-ahhē-rība//Eṭēru; C3 = Eriši//Šāpiku; C4 = Ṣillāya//Nabû-ahhē-iddin; Scribe = Šumāya//Ahhēšāya
Title: YBC 9120

Paraphrase: Purchase of an empty house plot (eqlu kišubbû) located in the district of Babylon (erṣet Bābili) inside of Babylon. Scribe = Munnabiti//Ēpeš-ili
Title: Bab. 14338

Paraphrase:
Judicial settlement (dīnu ik-ri-e-ma) about the return of security: According to an oral agreement between A and B1, B2 as well as B3, B1 and B2 released (ni-ip-ga-tim) fC1 and her family (LÚ.kin-ni-šu , literally “his family”), including C2, C3, fC4, C5 and C6 and two sons of fC1, altogether belonging to A (nišē bītya) and having served as security for their master, for 5 minas of silver (ahāṭu, nadānu, “A examined and gave”) to A. B1 and B2 voluntarily (ina hūd libbīšunu) sealed (kanāku) and handed over (nadānu) a irrevocable and incontestable document (ṭuppu lā târi u lā dabābu) on the basis of which B1 and B2 can be made liable to pay (adāru, nadānu) in case of a claim (rašû u dīnu) made against (eli) the father of B1 and B1 as well as B2 on account of (ina eli) fC1 and her folks. 7 witnesses (including a haṭanu kaspi - “inspector of the silver”). Fingernail impressions of B1 and B2.

A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Sîn-šadûnu, temple-enterer (ērib bīti) of Marduk; B1 = Nabû-usalli/TUR-E-dayan; B2 = Šamaš-nāṣir/Ṣillai (Ṣilla-ai); B3 = Nūr-Papsukkal/Ṣillai (Ṣilla-ai); fC1 = Liˀîtu; C2 = Amēl-Nanāya; C3 = Nergal-nāṣir; fC4 = Šugurti; C5 = Kaštinnam-tabni; C6 = Kudaîtu
Bibliography: BE 8/1: 19 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Nielsen 2011 passim.
Title: EAH 202

Paraphrase:
List of barley, which has been given and sold for silver: 1.4 kor (324 l) of barley are sold for the extraordinary amount of 4 minas and 3.5 shekels of silver to A. This price (mahīru) is set due to the fact that ana 3 pi a4 from the storehouse (bīt kalakki) in the garden (kirû). In total 158 kor (28,440 l) of barley are sold for silver.

A = Hailanu, kutimmu (goldsmith)
Title: MLC 1803

Paraphrase:
Redemption of a debt: B has to go (alāku) and clear his case (dīnu) with the prefect (šaknu) of Humuttu and A at the end of Ulūl (VI). If he does not do so, he has to pay 2/3 shekels of debt (hubullu) to C. 5 witnesses (including the šatammu of Ebabbar [Šulāya/Ankas-sadu-nahid] and the qīpu [Šamaš-bine-šar] and the scribe.

A = Anburrie; B = Aplāya; C = Marga; Scribe = Gimillu/Bēl-[…]
Title: BM 49169

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a prebend: A1 and fA2 purchase from B, brother of A1, ½ day of the prebend of the baker (isiq nuhatimmūti) of Ezida (Nabû Temple) on the 2nd day of each month, every year, for ½ mina and 2 shekels of silver. Witnesses (partly broken, but includes šatammu of Ezida) and the scribe.

A1 = Nabû-ahhē/Nabû-mukīn-apli
fA2 = Ahiti?, wife? of A1
B = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Nabû-mukīn-apli
Scribe = […]/[…]/Baru?
Title: BM 96136

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A an amount of silver, capital sum (qaqqadu). The debt will bear an interest of 1/5 shekels of silver. Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Bābilāya/Labāši; B = Bēl-useppi/Ahu-iddin
Title: BM 47353

Paraphrase:
Settlement of a dispute concerning property: B1 approaches A and asks him to give back the house of B2, his father, which A has bought from C. Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Bēl-ēṭir; B1 = Rēmanni/ Nabû-ahhē-iddin; B2 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin, father of B1; C = Bammāya; Scribe = Ukširi/Iranni
Title: BM 29105

Bibliography: Peiser, KB 4 (1896), 170–71 (transliteration, translation); San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 13 (transliteration, translation).
Title: BM 92706

Paraphrase:
Siege text relating to the famine during Šamaš-šumu-ukin 19th year: B1 and B2, B1’s son, sell to A their slave girl fC for [x+]2 shekels of silver and 0;0.0.110 kor (110 l) barley. The sellers guarantee (pūt našû) against rebellion (sīhu) and claims (pāqirānu) of fC. Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Mammâ; B1 = […]tâ; B2 = Šamaš-zēr-ibni/[…]tâ; fC = Nanāya-kešrat
Bibliography: Mentioned in Pinches, JTVI 26 (1893), 169; Oppenheim Iraq 17 (1955), 77 fn. 26 (partial transliteration, translation).
Title: BM 77216

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: The gatekeeper B owes A 10 shekels of silver. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1/6 shekel. 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Marduk-ēṭir//Bēl-ēṭeru; B = Ahu-erība, maṣṣar abulli abul Marduk (keeper of the Marduk Gate); Scribe = Šamaš-ina-eše-ēṭir//Šamaš-iddin
Title: Bab. 28395

Paraphrase:
Expenditures of cattle: In sum 3 cattle animals are given before B inter for the marriage of C. 2-year-old sahirtu-cows (small cows) are for Uruk and the sacrifices before the gods, including Bēltia. A bull (bīru) is for D.

B = Yatiru; C = […]/Iltammeš; D = Dannilua
Title: MLC 1802

Paraphrase: In this fragmentary tablet the qīpu of Ebabbar (Šarru-lu-[…]) is mentioned.
Title: MMA 86.11.203

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver (ina pāni?): B owes A 10 shekels of silver. The debt will bear an interest of 8 shekels per mina (13.33% p.a.). Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Puhhuru//Iluta-bani; B = Nabû-iddin//Iluta-bani
Title: BM 95091

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A an amount of silver. The debt will bear an interest. B will repay the debt in terms of barley according to its price in Dûzu (IV). Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Zēria/Na?; B = Balāṭu/Bābilāya
Title: BM 47348

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document over a release: B approaches A, the šatammu, and asks to release (paṭāru) C. A grants the request. There is also the ša-rēši D mentioned. Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Bēl-ēṭir, šatammu (of Dilbat); B = Bēl-lēˀi; C = Nūr-Šamaš; D = Nabû-uballiṭ, ša-rēši; Scribe = Napširi
Title: BM 29084

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document over the redemption of debts: B approaches A, his brother, and asks him to pay off his debts of 2 ½ minas of silver and to give him another ½ mina of silver for his own maintenance (akālu). A grants this request and receives a sealed document (kunukku) concerning B’s share (zittu) in C’s property. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Ur (Sîn-tabni-uṣur). 5 witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.

A = Sîn-ahu-iddin/Šāpiku; B = Gula-balāssu-iqbi/Šāpiku; C = Bēl-iqbi; Scribe = Šumāya//Naziya
Bibliography: Mentioned in Frame and Waerzeggers 2011,145 (in connection with BM 113926-BM 113929).
Title: BM 113928

Paraphrase:
Fragment of the reverse of the copy of legal record, possibly a purchase document: [x] witnesses and the scribe, also identified as writer of the tablet (šāṭir kunukki). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller? B.

B = Kidin-Marduk//Kunāya; Scribe = […]-šumu-iškun/Šumu-libši//Nagāru
Title: IM - / W. 24405

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: 17 ¼ shekels of silver of A are at the disposal (ina pāni) of B. Beginning with the following month, that is Tašrīt (VII), the debt will bear an interest of ¼ shekel per shekel. The debt is secured by the pledge of C, son of B. 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Marduk-zēru-ibni//Nergal-ēṭir; B = Nergal-ēṭir//Bēl-iqbi, father of C; C = Arrabu/Nergal-ēṭir//Bēl-iqbi, son of B; Scribe = Ša-TAB-Nabûšu/Nanāya-uballiṭ
Bibliography: Langdon, JRAS (1928), 321, 235 (translation); San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 53 (transliteration, translation).
Title: Ash. 1928.1

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a built house in Uruk (written on a stone tablet): A purchases a built house (bītu epšu) for 3 1/3 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 10 shekels of silver, from B. The sold house is located in the district of the Kanisurra Canal (erṣet nār Kanisurra) inside Uruk. Its upper side (in the north) borders on the house of C and its lower side (in the south) on a narrow street (sūqu qatnu). Its upper front (in the east) borders on the inner side of the field (libbi eqli) of the seller and its lower front (in the west) borders on the canal (nāru) extending to the seven date palms (gišimmaru) on the island (ina uṣalli). It measures 47 x 42 cubits (23.5 x 21 m). Except for the common penalty clauses, also elaborate curses are written on this stone tablet. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Ahhēšāya) and the šatammu of Eanna (name lost). 20 witnesses and the scribe. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.

A = Aidaˀ//Sagranu; B = Nabû-ahhē-šullim//Kuddiya; C = Šākin-šumi//Nummuru; Scribe = Nabû-ušallim//Balāṭu
Title: BM 130827

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 1/3 minas and 6 shekels of silver. It is an interest-free loan (hubuttūtu). 4 witnesses and the scribe.  
 
A = Šumāya; B = Bēl-ahhē-erība; Scribe = Bēl-kāṣir
Bibliography: San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 52 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in van Driel, ZA 79 (1989), 113 and in Nielsen 2011 passim.
Title: MMA 86.11.211

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: A gives B silver in order to acquire gold. This transfer took place in the presence of C.

A = Šumu-ukīn; B = Ilaram/Ilu-iddin; C = Šuzubu/uṣallu
Title: MLC 1801

Paraphrase: Fragmentary document about the delivery of reed: A delivery of reed happens in the presence of qīpu of Ebabbar (Šarr-lu-[…]).
Title: BM 52848

Paraphrase:
Purchase of hanšu land: A acquires two fields from B. The transferred land is located in the meadow (tamertu) of šaddanu qablu and forms part of the maintenance land (zuˀuztu) of king Marduk-apla-iddina, king of Babylon, and, at the same time, belongs to the hanšu land of C1 and C2. Details about the neighbouring parties. Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Nādin-ahi; B = Ubar/Šigua; C1 = Nabû-bēl-šumāti; C2 = Nummuru, ṭipu of C1
Title: BM 46799

Paraphrase:
Inheritance transfer of property: A transfers (nadānu) 4 slaves (amēlūtu), a field (eqlu) and a house (bītu) to fB, his wife. The field actually comprises an orchard (kirû) along the Hiltu canal (ina muhhi nār hilti). fB will have the property at her disposal as long as she lives. Only when she dies, the property will be divided among C1, C2 and C3, presumably sons of A. Curses. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Ur (Sîn-tabni-uṣur). 12 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Bēl-iqbi/Nabû-ahhē-ušallim; fB = Ṣarbû, wife of A; C1 = Sîn-ahu-iddin, son of A?; C2 = Rēmūtu, son of A?; C3 = Gula-balāssu-iqbi, son of A?; Scribe =Sîn-iddin/Sîn-ahu-šubši
Title: BM 113927

Paraphrase:
Exchange of fields: A and B exchange their fields (eqlu) with each other. The field of A is located above the city and borders on (the property of) C1. It includes a šīhu-estate. The field of B borders on (the property of) C2. The part which goes as far as the river is – according to the limiting marks (ina kandurî) excluded and belongs to D. In case there is a surplus of the field of A, B will receive it for 0;0.1 square kor (450 m2). In case there is a surplus of the field of B, A will receive it for 0;0.0.3 square kor (1,350 m2).  2 witnesses and the scribe. A breach of contract will be avenged with a fine of 1/2 mina of silver.
 
A = Bēl-ēreš/Daiānu; B = Erība-ilu/Uraš-iddin; C1 = Mušēzib-ilu/Bābu-ēreš; C2 = Danil//Bāˀiru; D = Ea-bānu; Scribe = Uraš-iddin//Aburrēa
Title: LB 1336

Bibliography: Peiser, KB 4 (1896), 176–77 (transliteration, translation); San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 71 (translation, translation).
Title: BM 93000

Paraphrase: Expenditure of barley: Extraction (nishu) of barley is at the disposal (pānu) of various individuals, including a farmer (ikkaru), a courtier (mazzāz pāni), a skilled worker? (lē’û?, aš-giš-da) and a refugee (munnabittu).
Title: MLC 1800

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 50 shekels of silver. For the period between the first and the third year of Hallušū, the interest is already included in the loan amount (hubuttūtu). If B fails to pay within this period, the debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel per mina (20% p.a.). The debt is secured by the pledge of a garden (kirû) at the gate? (ú-bul-lum, abullu) of Kanisurra. 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Nabû-ēṭir/Nabû-nāṣir; B = Tabnēa/Šumu-iddin; Scribe = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Nabû-nāṣir
Title: PTS 2713

Paraphrase: Purchase of a slave: The text mentions the šatammu of Ebabbar (Šamaš-šum-līšir) and the qīpu of Ebabbar (Šamaš-ēpeš-šarri).
Title: BM 67175

Paraphrase:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases from B wasteland (kišubbû). It is located in the district of Uruk (erṣet Uruk) in the area of the Adad Temple (qereb bīt Adad). Its upper side (in the north) borders on the house of C1 and its lower side (in the south) on the house of C2. The sold land measures 30 x 9 cubits (15 x 4.5 m). Witnesses and the scribe.

C1 = Aplāya/Nabû-ušēzib; C2 = Hašdia/Inaṣ
Title: YBC 4016

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley: 0;1.3 kor (54 l) barley (uṭṭatu) of A, at the disposal (ina qāti gamālu) of B, has been given (nadānu) by C to D. Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Nabû-rēmanni; B = Kudurru; C = Bēl-ēṭir; D = Puhhuru; Scribe = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Nanāya
Title: BM 94631

Paraphrase:
Settlement of a dispute concerning a purse: As decided at court, A will seek the purse (hindu) of C, his uncle. In case A does not find the purse, B will swear an oath to A that he does not have the purse. In case A finds the purse, B is cleared. There is also a deposit involved. Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Nabû-nebiana-ili; B = Bulluṭu; C = Nabû-uballiṭ; Scribe = Gimillu/Rišua
Title: BM 29531

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver and barley: B owes A [x] amounts of silver and [x] amounts of barley (uṭṭatu), capital sum (qaqqadu). The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of the house (bītu) of C. x witnesses and the scribe.

A = Ina-tēši-ēṭir/Banê-ša-ilia; B = Labāši/Banê-ša-ilia; C = Iddin-Nabû; Scribe = Aplāya/Nappahu
Title: BM 26728

Paraphrase: Fragmentary document over the expenditure of oil: Extraction of oil is given out to various positions.
Title: MLC 1799

Paraphrase:
Gift of land: B gave his field (eqlu), 0;4.3 kor (162 l) arable land (zēru) and 4 talents? of reed (qanû), which he bought from C1, C2 and fC3, to his wife fA. The field is located in bīt Eṭerāya and reaches from the royal road (harrān šarri) as far as the irrigation dike (kilâti) of Til-buri. The arable land is located along the bank (mašdu/maldu, ma-al-di) of the Euphrates. Witnesses and the scribe. Date at the beginning of the text.

fA = Maqartu B = Rašil; C1 = Bābilāya; C2 = Šamaš-bēlu-uṣur; fC3 = Zabiti; Scribe = […]
Title: BM 87279

Paraphrase: The text mentions the šatammu of Ebabbar (Šamaš-šum-līšir).
Title: BM 50186

Paraphrase: Administrative list over the distribution of hanšu land: Cadastral map of hanšu plots and their associated rab hanšes, which were granted by the king. The plots reach from the area (līmu) of the temple as far as Bit-Ahhešāya. Originating from the Bab-nār-šarri, the front of each hanšu field measures 300 cubits (150 m). Among the rab hanšê’s we find inter alia Nabû-ēṭir/Nabû-šumu-ēreš, Mukīn-zēri/Nabû-udammiq, Šumāya/Zabunu, Nabû-šumu-ēreš/Nabû-ušallim and the governor (šākin ṭēmi) Na’id-Marduk.
Title: YBC 11566

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A [x] shekels of silver. The debt will bear an interest of 20% p.a. Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Damqiya/[…]; B = Nabû-upahhir/Iluta-bani; Scribe = Mušēzib-Bēl/Rab-tarbāṣi
Title: BM 94613

Paraphrase:
Lease of an orchard: B leases from A1 and A2 an orchard. Details of the transaction are broken. Witnesses and the scribe.

A1 = Nabû-kāṣir/Rāšil; A2 = Bēlšunu/Bakaiti; B = Bēlšunu; Scribe = Nabû-ušallim/Ilu-tabani
Title: BM 29481

Paraphrase:
Transfer of a pledge: B gave fC to A as pledge for 1 mina of silver. There will be no wages for fC from A and no interest for B. As soon as A requests his silver, B will get C back. x witnesses and the scribe.

A = Ašarēdu; B = Šākin-šumi; fC = Innāya; Scribe = Nabû-tabni-šuklil/Arkat-ili-damqa
Title: BM 26630

Paraphrase:
Gift given by mother to 2 daughters: fB gives 1 sq. kor (13500 m²) of date garden (zēru zaqpu) to her 2 daughters, fA1 and fA2. This land is in her possession in accordance to the content of  VAT91. fB sealed and made over 0;3.2 sq. kor (9000 m²) of land and her slave (Bēl-silim/fŠeleppūtu, her mulūgu-slave) to fA1 and 0;1.4 sq. kor (4300 m²) of land to fA2. During her lifetime fB enjoys usufruct of the land. When she dies, it shall be divided as above. 5 witnesses and the scribe (Qīšti-Marduk/Šūzubu//Kānik-bāb).
 
fA1 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi (elder daughter of fB and C); fA2 = fAmat-Ninlil/Balāṭu//Egibi (younger daughter of fB and C); fB = fKaššāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu; C = Balāṭu/Ibnāya//Egibi
Bibliography: VS 5 43 = VS 5 44; Baker 2004, no. 19; Peiser, BV (1890), 26.
Title: VAT 110
Items and quantifiable data: 0;3.2.0sq. kor B, Fields;</unit>0;1.4.0sq. kor B, Fields;</unit>1-, Slaves

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 1/3 mina of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. He is to pay in Simānu (III) of the 25th year of Darius. 5 witnesses and the scribe (Širiktu-Marduk/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Sîn-damāqu).
 
A = Ana-Bēl-upāqu/Ea-zēru-ibni//Bāˀiru; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: BM 77592+

Paraphrase:
Dowry receipt: A is paid (eṭēru) the dowry of his wife fC by (ina qāt) B. It comprises: 8 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy with 1 mina of quppu-silver, 2 slaves, a table (paššūru), a pot stand (gangannu), a bed (gišná) with dimigirru and fig-ornaments (tittu), a small bed (eršu qallatu) with a musukkannu-attachment (musukkannu mandītu), a footstool (šupāl šēpi), a woman’s(?) chair (kussû ša sinniš[ti]), a lamp (bīt nūru), a bronze (lamp) stand (kallu siparru), a bronze lantern (šāšītu siparru), a bronze brazier (mušahhin sip[arri]), 3 bronze cups (kāsu), a bronze baṭû-vessel, a bronze ladle (nāṭilu), 2 bronze strainers (šāhilu), a bronze mukarrišu-vessel, a bronze grate(?) (kišukku), a wooden chest (gišarannu), 3 muṣiptu-garments, and an upper(?) kišku-cloth (kišku an.na); the earlier receipt of 5 5/6 minas of silver included. 6 witnesses, including the brother-in-law of B (Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi), and the scribe (= A).
 
A = Nidintu-Marduk/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Rab-banê; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fC = fTabluṭ/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu
Title: BM 77570
Other markings Description: BM77399+BM77731 sealed on upper and lower edges; BM77570 not sealed

Paraphrase:
Conversion of dowry silver into land: B transfers to fA the ownership of 1 kor of land in lieu of 4 minas of silver. The silver value of the land equals that of gold which B took (našû) from the dowry chest (quppu) of fA. fA has usufruct on the land and may hand it down only to her daughter. The description of the plot of land is broken, it stretches from an unknown place to the dam (makallû) in Nabātu. 4 witnesses, including 2 sons of fA (Esagil-mukīn-apli and Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi) and her brother (Iqīšāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu) and the scribe (Bēl-iqīša/Bāniya//Bāˀiru).
 
fA = fKaššāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu; B = Balāṭu/Ibnāya//Egibi
Title: VAT 92

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with pledge of a slave, partly damaged. B and his brothers owe an unknown sum of silver to A; B’s slave Bēl-lūmur is given to A as an antichretic pledge. The debtors’ mother fŠidātu/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāḫu acts as a guarantor. The debt results from a tax payment made by A on behalf of B and his brothers to an unnamed rab ḫanšî (commander of fifty). The four witnesses include as first witness fŠidātu’s father Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zīri//Nappāḫu (partly restored).

A = Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi (filiation restored); B = Bēl-šumu-iškun/Nabû-nādin-šumi//Gaḫal (partly restored)
Title: VAT 1961+

Paraphrase:
Attestation of witnessing the sale of a slave: The tablet records that A was present as witness among the elders (lúab-bameš) at the drawing up of the tablet in which fD was sold to fB by fC. 4 witnesses, including the maternal uncle of fB (Iqīšāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu) and the brother of fB (Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi), and the scribe (Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-parakki).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Šulāya//Rab-banê (oldest son of fC); fB = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; fC = Nūptāya/Nāˀid-Marduk//Bābūtu; fD = fNanāya-bēlu-uṣrī
Title: VAT 101

Paraphrase:
Marriage contract: B1 and B2 give their sister fṢirāya in marriage to A (ina ḫūd libbišunu … nadānu). The dowry includes 1 kor (1.35 ha) of land (zēru) on the Ḫarru-ša-Aplāya, facing the Šamaš gate in the disctrict (pīḫātu) of Babylon. This land is the preferential share (pūt zitti) of B1 and B2’s mother fZunnāya. The remainder of the dowry consists of the female slave fRamûa, said to be in addition to another slave, fŠēpītāya, and of some furniture and garments. The operative section of the text concludes with a curse formula invoking Marduk [and Ṣarpanītu]. Five witnesses introduced by ina kanāk ṭuppi igi, including the groom’s brother Bēl-ēreš/Mušēzib-Marduk//Gaḫal. Scribe: Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Balāssu//Bēl-eṭēri.

A = Nabû-nādin-šumi/Mušēzib-Marduk//Gaḫal; B1 = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāḫu; B2 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāḫu
Title: BM 92794

Paraphrase:
Promissory note

B owes one sheep worth 1 ¼ shekels of silver to A. It is to be delivered (nadānu) in Simān (III). Two witnesses, including Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāḫu, and the scribe: Šamaš-zēru-ušabši/Balāṭu//Bāˀiru. A seal (bald figure facing left, left hand raised up before the face) is impressed twice on the lower obverse of the tablet; the impressions flank the drawing of a sheep.

A = Nabû-bān-zēri/Bēl-kāṣir//Nappāḫu; B = Lâbâši/Marduk-zēru-ibni//Nappāḫu
Title: VAT 457
Other markings Description: two impressions of the same seal flanking drawing of a sheep, lower obverse

Paraphrase:
Transfer of a house as antichretic pledge.

B pledges a house to A for two years as security for 1 1/3 minas of silver. The pledge is antichretic. Previously, B had taken the house as a pledge for the same amount of silver from C, with the additional injunction to rebuild the house (ša … akî … kaspi maškani u epēši ša bīti ṣabtu). The house is to be released to C only when C pays his debt to B and B subsequently clears his debt with A. The silver in question is said to be part of the dowry of fZunnāya, daughter of Adad-zēru-ibni. The obligation for the delivery of the qinayyātu offerings is to be shared. The house borders on properties of Nabû-šumu-ibni/Rēmūtu//Sippê and Gimillu//Banāya.
Four witnesses; scribe: Ea-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Rēˀû. The tablet displays a geometrical drawing on the left edge.

A = Nabû-bān-zēri/Bēl-kāṣir//Nappāḫu; B = Bēl-aḫḫē-iddin/Būr-Adad//Itinnu; C = Nabû-šumu-līšir/Balassu//Gallābu
Title: VAT 83
Other markings Description: drawing (geometrical figure: house plan?) on left edge

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a fine new undergarment: B is to deliver to A 1 fine new ungergarment (šupalītu) in Ayyāru (II) of the 23rd (sic; that is before the tablet was written) year. A is to pay 1 shekel of stamped silver to B. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nidintu-Marduk//Rab-banê) (brother-in-law of A).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Aplāya/Pirˀu//Amēl-Ea
Title: VAT 366

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 1/3 mina 1 shekel of white, unstamped, cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Ša-alāli).
 
A = Bēl-zēru-ibni/Bēl-iddin//Bābūtu; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 494+

Paraphrase:
Note of credit arrangement by proxy: A draws up a promissory note (uˀiltu) against B at the behest of C for 5/6 mina 5 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The document stresses that the silver belongs to C and not to A. A is to register (izuzzu Š) the promissory note and give (proof of) it to C. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Nidintu-Marduk//Rab-banê).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Rēmūt-Nabû/Ina-ṣilli-Bēl//Nuhāšu; C = Erībāya/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: MMA 86.11.159

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver (damaged): B owes A 1/3 mina 2 shekels of [cut] silver [of 1/8 alloy]. [remainder of obv. and beginning of rev. lost]. At least 1 witness legible and the scribe ([...]/Mušēzib-Marduk//[..]).
 
A = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 1932+

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver (ilku): A receives from B ½ mina of cut si[lver of 1/]8 alloy of the promissory note (uˀiltu) for [x min]as 4 shekels of white silver of the service obligation (ilku) of B and his bow troops(?) (ṣāb(?) qaštānišu). 4 witnesses and the scribe (Arad-Bābu/Mušēzib-Marduk//Šangû-Gula).
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Rēmūtu//Egibi; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 2094(+)
Other markings Description: textile impression in centre of obv.

Paraphrase:
Revocation of the purchase of a slave: The chief judge (sartennu) and the judges (dajānu) revoke the purchase of C by A from B for 2 minas 15 shekels of silver. After the purchase the slave was given to the house of a Persian (ša bīt parsāyi) of the household of D, who sent him back (to B?). A receives the 2 minas 15 shekels of silver and its interest and he returns the pertaining documents (uˀiltu) to B. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Marduk-šumu-ibni/Bēl-aplu-iddin//Egibi).
 
A = Habaṣīru/Tabnêa; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; C = Nabû-ittannu; D = Marduk-šāpik-zēri
Title: VAT 126+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (heavily damaged): [beginning of tablet lost] The extant part of the tablet starts with the mention of containers of pressed dates (darīku) at the river [...]. 2 clauses follow excluding 5 shekels of silver owed by A and 1 kor of dates, interest-free [loan] (hubuttūtu), from this debt. It ends with the final clause concerning the guard’s fee (kādu) and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) not having been paid. 1 witness legible, remainder of tablet lost.
 
No real protagonists legible; A = Arad-[...]
Title: VAT 2003

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates (damaged): A owes 8;x kor of dates to an illegible second party, impost (imittu) of the field in [Kār-Nabû ...], the share of fB1 with B2. He is to pay in Arahsamnu (VIII) [... in the storehouse, in] the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI, together with palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date bask[ets (gipû), date-palm fibres (mangagu), 1] container of pressed dates (darīku) and 10 loads of date-frond ribs (huṣābu). The levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) [is unpaid]. 3 witnesses, the name of the scribe is not legible.
 
A = [...]/Bēl-nādin-apli//[...]; fB1 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B2 = Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi (brother of fB1)
Title: VAT 1980+

Paraphrase:
Lease of field in Kār-Tašmētu: B1 rents to A 1 kor of land in Kār-Tašmētu, the dowry of fB2, of which the long side lies next to (the property of) C. The yearly rent for ten years amounts to 8;2.3 kor of dates, 10 loads of [palm-frond r]ibs (huṣābu), 20 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), 20 date baskets (gipû) [date palm fibres? (mangagu) and x containers of pr]essed dates (darīku). A is to pay the guards’s [fee (kādu) and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu). He is to deliver all the 8;2.3 kor of dates in the storehouse (haṣāru). He is to work all of the land and is responsible for the irrigation (pūt šaqûti ša mê). A clause against pruning (arû D, ú-mar-ru) any living part (raṭbu) (of the trees) and one against transgression of the agreement on pain of paying 1/3 mina of silver follow. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-erība/Šākin-šumi//Šigûa). Addendum: each party has taken a copy. The Dilmun date palms belong to B1. The land is at A’s disposal from Tašrītu (VII) of the 6th year.
 
A = Habaṣīru/Bēl-rēmanni//Egibi; B1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fB2 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; C = the son of Ašlāku
Title: VAT 140

Paraphrase:
Receipt for house rent (damaged): A receives from B rent of his house (amount illegible). Addendum: Each party has taken a copy. 6 witnesses and the [scribe] ([...]/Iddin-Nabû//[...]).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = [...]tu/Ardia//[...]
Title: VAT 2038

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver, part of the price of a house: A receives from B 3 1/3 minas of silver of the price of the house he had taken as security from C on behalf of C (cf. VAT512). 2 witnesses and the scribe ([Marduk-šumu-uṣur]/Bēl-ušallim//Isi[nāya]).
 
A = Šullumāya/Marduk-erība//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; C = Iqīšāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu
Title: VAT 2033

Paraphrase:
Document concerning division of inheritance [damaged]: The fragmentary state of the tablet precludes an exact understanding of its terms. The text deals with the division of B’s inheritance among A1, A2 and A3. The text seems to be mostly concerned with outstanding promissory notes (uˀiltu). In this context also C is mentioned. The tablet breaks off after the mention of a bed (eršu) and a brazier (mušahhinu). No witnesses or scribe extant.
 
A1 = Bēl-ahhē-erība/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu (son of B); A2 = Iqīša-Marduk/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu (son of B); A3 = Bēl-ēṭir/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu (son of B); B = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Mušallim-Marduk//Nappāhu; C = Bēl-ahhē-iqīša
Title: VAT 509

Paraphrase:
Lease of prebendary duties (heavily damaged): the text concerns the rations and beer of the measurer’s(?) prebend (m[andidūtu]) of Išhara. The prebendary service in question seems to begin with the 1st day of month [x].
 
No protagonists are legible.
Title: VAT 1950

Paraphrase:
Sale of butcher’s prebend of Išhara: B sold voluntarily (ina migir libbišu) to A his butcher’s prebend in Ešasurra, the temple of Išhara in Šuanna, for 3 minas of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The prebend comprises ox and sheep from the royal offerings, offerings of the kāribu, ginû-offerings, qiqqû-offerings, offerings of the eššēšu-festivals, bayyānūtu-offerings, greeting of the temple (šalām bīti) offerings, coils (tīrānu), brain(?) (g[ab]bu), gan ṣēli-meat, trimmings (nukāsātu), epigastrium (karšu), naṣrappu-meat, 2 ankle cuts (kursinnu), omasum (riqītu), bāb urkāti-meat, hilidamu-meat, and fatty tissue around the intestines (hinṣu) not cut off (qarāšu), for the whole year. B receives the money from A and is thus paid. Standard final clause excluding further litigation follows. 14 witnesses, including a judge (Nabû-bēlšunu//[?]), and the scribe (Bēl-bullissu/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Saggilāya).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Ana-Bēl-ēreš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk
Title: BM 77424

Paraphrase:
Record of dispute conducted before citizens (mār banê): A and B dispute over the prebend before Bēl-āliya-ša-Šarrabānu. B was not granted rights (šuršû) over the prebend. B says that his prebend is at the disposal of A, so A should give him the 10 shekels of silver that B had paid on his behalf to C. A list of 5 witnesses follows; no scribe. Rubrum: It is a notice (tahsistu) so as to not forget.
 
A = Šākin-šumi/Nadnāya//Nappāhu; B = Balāṭu/Marduk-erība//Nappāhu; C = Zūzāya
Title: VAT 90

Paraphrase:
Inventory of household items: List of the household items (udû) of A: 1 bed (eršu) of musukkannu-wood, a footstool (šupāl šēpi) , 1 bed of willow (hilēpu), 1 coffer of willow, 1 bronze brazier (mušahhinu) of 3 sūt in capacity, 1 bronze brazier in the size of a talammu-vessel, 2 bronze cups (kāsu), 1 bronze mukarrišu-vessel, 1 bronze baṭû-vessel, 20 habību-vessels [...], 2 vats (namzītu), 2 wooden pot stands (gangannu, ka-kan-na-ti), 2 storage vessels (huttu), 2 namharu-vessel, 1 (lower) grinding stone (erû) and an upper grinding stone (narkabu), 2 chairs, 2 stools (littu), 1 lantern (šašītu) comprising 6 minas of iron.
 
A = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 387

Paraphrase:
Dowry contract: B gives dowry with his daughter fC to A. The dowry comprises: 0.4 kor of planted land in Kār-Taš[mētu] next to the properties of D1, D2 and D3, [...] (the slave) [fNi]nlil-silim [...], a footstool ([šupāl] šēpi), a chair (kussû), [...], a lamp (bīt nūru), a bronze lamp stand (kallu), a bronze lantern (šāšīt siparri ša bīt nūru), 2 cups (kāsātu), a bowl (qabūtu), a brazier (mušahinnu), a grate (ki[suk]ku); apart from 0.1 kor of planted land that A had bought (mahīru epēšu) from B. 7 witnesses at the sealing of the tablet (ina kanāk ṭuppu šuāti), including the adoptive father of A (Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu), the brother of A (Marduk-šumu-iddin/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu), the maternal uncle of fC (Iqīšāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu) and the brothers of fC (Esagil-mukīn-apli and Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi); 1 ina ašābi-witness, the wife of B (fTašmētu-damqat/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu), and the scribe (Qīšti-Marduk/Šūzubu//Kānik-bābi).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Balāṭu/Ibnāya/Egibi; fC = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu; D1 = Marduk-nāṣir/[-]//[-]; D2 = Nabû-nādin-šumi/Mušēzib-Marduk//Gahal; D3 = Bēl-ēreš/Mušēzib-Marduk//Gahal
Title: BM 77600

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (heavily damaged): B owes A [x amount of an unkown commodity] and is to pay it on the 20th Tašrītu (VII). 2 witnesses legible, remainder of rev. lost.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Marduk-mukīn-apli/Lābāši//Imbu-īnīa
Title: VAT 1978

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes to A ½ mina of silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears a yearly interest of 12 shekels per mina. B’s property in town and country are A’s security and no other creditor is to have disposal over it. B is to pay [the interest] monthly. The silver is at B’s disoposal from the 1st of Kislīmu (IX). Dated to the 1st year of Cambyses, king of Babylon, while Cyrus was king of all the lands. 3 witnesses, 1 ina ašābi-witness, B’s wife, and [the scribe] (Nabû-zēr-iddin/Nabû-ušallim//Irˀanni).
 
A = Šumu-iddin/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-ušallim/Gimillu//Irˀanni
Title: BM 114806

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 1 mina 12 shekels of silver. He is to pay it in Ayyāru (II). The silver is credit (rašûtu) secured against gold coils (qullu) and gold rings, which he may take after having paid A. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Qīšti-Marduk/Šūzubu//Kānik-bābi).
 
A = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: BM 77354

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver (ilku): A receives from B 7 ¼ shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy as the service obligation (ilku) of B. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-aplu-iddin//Rab-banê).
 
A = Bēl-iqīša/Nabû-uṣuršu//Tunāya; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 139

Paraphrase:
Purchase of slave: B1 and fB2 sell fC1 and C2 to fA for 3 ½ minas of silver. A clause follows concerning D1’s and D2’s responsibility regarding for fC1 and C2, in the case of lawsuits (pūt sihî), vindication (pūt pāqirāni) and claims for the status of a royal slave (arad šarrūti) and freedom (mār banûti). B1 and fB2 have received full payment. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Marduk-erība/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Egibi).
 
fA = fŠa-pî-kalbi/Marduk-rēmanni//Sippê; B1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-[...]//Šamaš-abāri; fB2 = fNinli-ēṭirat/Nabû-šumu-ibni (wife of B1); fC1 = fMannu-idāssu-īde (slave of B1and fB2); C2 = Ša-pî-kalbi (son of fC1); D1 = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-šumu-idddin//Basia; D2 = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Šigûa
Title: VAT 119

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates (heavily damaged): [x];1.4 kor of dates, [imp]ost (imittu) of the field in Kār-[...] are owed to fA [...]. [remainder of obv. and beginning of rev. lost] No witnesses legible, the scribe only partly ([...]/[...]//Būṣu).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi
Title: VAT 1908

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B owes to A 8 kor of dates, impost (imittu) of the harvest of the field in Kār-Nabû-ša-ina-muhhi-nāri-ša-Ahhē-šullim. The field is part of the dowry of fC1; C2 is its co-owner. He is to pay in Arahsamnu (VIII), together with 1 kor palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date-palm fibres (mangagu), 10 loads of date-frond ribs (huṣābu) and [1] container of pressed dates (darīku). [The guard’s fee(?) (kādu) and the levy of the agricultu]ral supervisor (gugallu) [are not paid]. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Ša-Marduk-šullum(?)/Mudammiq-Adad). Addendum (only in VAT134): The šissinnu is not paid.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Erība-Marduk/Rēmūtu//Rab-banê; fC1 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi (wife of A); C2 = Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi (brother of fC1)
Title: VAT 134

Paraphrase:
Heavily damaged fragment: Of the operative section of the tablet only the part of the name of A is extant. One witness is legible, the remainder of the tablet is lost.
 
A = Arad-Nergal/Nabû-muqqu-elip//Egibi
Title: VAT 2014

Paraphrase:
Receipt for house rent: A receives from B the rent of his house till the end of Šabātu, 19th year of Darius. Addendum: Each party has taken a copy. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Undaššer[?]/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Arad-Ea).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu; B = Nabû-bullissu/Basia//Siˀātu
Title: VAT 360

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for the remainder of a house purchase price: B owes to A 1 mina 52 ½ shekels of silver as the remainder of the price of A’s house. He is to pay it in Kislīmu (IX). 2 witnesses and the scribe (Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Mušēzib-Marduk//Sîn-tabni).
 
A = Iqīšāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 114

Paraphrase:
Division of inheritance: A1, A2, A3 divide the [...] slaves and what has been left behind by their parents B1 and fB2 among themselves. [Rest of obv. lost] At least 4 witnesses and the scribe ([...]-ibni(?)/Nabû-kēšir//[...]).
 
A1 = Bēl-ahhē-erība/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu (son of B1 and B2); A2 = Iqīša-Marduk/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu (son of B1 and B2); A3 = Bēl-ēṭir/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu (son of B1 and B2); B1 = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Mušallim-Marduk//Nappāhu; fB2 = fInbāya/Ina-tēšî-ēṭir (wife of B1)
Title: VAT 2010

Paraphrase:
Letter order: A has D bring (abālu Š, ul!-te-bi-lak-ku-nu-ši) a letter to B1 and B2, his fathers. He asks them to debit (izuzzu Š) his account with 2 kor of dates, which are booked as pappasu of Išhara, for the tithes (ešrû) of C.
 
A = Dihummu; B1 = Dādia; B2 = Bittānu; C = Erībāya/Nabû-aplu-iddin; D = Šellebu(/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu)
Title: VAT 458

Paraphrase:
Sale of butcher’s prebend of Išhara: B sold voluntarily (ina migir libbišu) to A his butcher’s prebend in Ešasurra, the temple of Išhara in Šuanna, for 3 minas of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The prebend comprises ox and sheep from the royal offerings, offerings of the kāribu, ginû-offerings, qiqqû-offerings, offerings of the eššēšu-festivals, bayyānūtu-offerings, greeting of the temple (šalām bīti) offerings, coils (tīrānu), brain(?) (g[ab]bu), gan ṣēli-meat, trimmings (nukāsātu), epigastrium (karšu), naṣrappu-meat, 2 ankle cuts (kursinnu), omasum (riqītu), bāb urkāti-meat, hilidamu-meat, and fatty tissue around the intestines (hinṣu) not cut off (qarāšu), for the whole year. B receives the money from A and is thus paid. Standard final clause excluding further litigation follows. 14 witnesses, including a judge (Nabû-bēlšunu//[?]), and the scribe (Bēl-bullissu/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Saggilāya).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Ana-Bēl-ēreš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk
Title: BM 77478+

Paraphrase:
Concerning the witnessing of a prospective prebend sale: In case A passes on (by sale or lease) the prebend in the shrine of Bēl-āliya-ša-Šarbānu for ½ qa of bread, ½ qa of beer, ¼ share in the harmil-joints of oxen and a share in the offerings on the meal table (paššūru) C shall be present (ašābu) as witness. This prebend belonged to C who had adopted A and to whom he bequeathed all his assets in town and country. 4 witnesses, including the brother-in-law of A (Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi), and the scribe (Idin-Nabû/Šūzubu//Kānik-bābi).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Šākin-šumi/Nadnāya//Nappāhu; C = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 123

Paraphrase:
Record of oath: B will give ½ mina of silver to fA as it is written in the promissory note (uˀiltu; cf. VAT51), since she swears that she has not taken anything apart from the things mentioned in the said document. Furthermore fA will not demand (erēšu) any rations (kurrummatu) of B. 3 witnesses, including the brother of fA (Bēl-usāt/Niqudu[=Nabû-mušētiq-uddê]//Nūr-Sîn), and the scribe(?) (Mušēzib-Marduk/Etellu//Egibi).
 
fA = fTappaššar/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//Nūr-Sîn (cf. Baker 2004, 32f. for filiation); B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 118

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley: B owes 5 kor of barley to A. He will deliver it in Dûzu (IV) at the door of the silo (ina bāb kalakki) in the mašīhu-measure of A. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Zēria//Gahal).
 
A = Iqīšāya/Zēria/Bābūtu; B = Balāṭu/Ibnāya/Egibi
Title: VAT 87

Paraphrase:
Gift given by mother to 2 daughters: fB gives 1 sq. kor (13500 m²) of date garden (zēru zaqpu) to her 2 daughters, fA1 and fA2. This land is in her possession in accordance to the content of  VAT91. fB sealed and made over 0;3.2 sq. kor (9000 m²) of land and her slave (Bēl-silim/fŠeleppūtu, her mulūgu-slave) to fA1 and 0;1.4 sq. kor (4300 m²) of land to fA2. During her lifetime fB enjoys usufruct of the land. When she dies, it shall be divided as above. 5 witnesses and the scribe (Qīšti-Marduk/Šūzubu//Kānik-bāb).
 
fA1 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi (elder daughter of fB and C); fA2 = fAmat-Ninlil/Balāṭu//Egibi (younger daughter of fB and C); fB = fKaššāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu; C = Balāṭu/Ibnāya//Egibi
Bibliography: VS 5 43 (formerly VAT 109) = VS 5 44; Baker 2004, no. 19; Peiser, BV (1890), 26.
Title: VAT 109
Items and quantifiable data: 0;3.2.0sq. kor B, Fields;</unit>0;1.4.0sq. kor B, Fields;</unit>1-, Slaves

Paraphrase:
Receipt (heavily damaged): A receives from B an unkown commodity. Each party has taken a copy. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Nidintu-Marduk//[Rab-banê]) (son-in-law of A).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-bullissu/Basia//Si[ˀātu]
Title: VAT 2095+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 1/3 mina of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. He is to pay in Simānu (III) of the 25th year of Darius. 5 witnesses and the scribe (Širiktu-Marduk/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Sîn-damāqu).
 
A = Ana-Bēl-upāqu/Ea-zēru-ibni//Bāˀiru; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: BM 77407

Paraphrase:
