Receipt for silver: A receives from B 12 ½ shekels of white silver out of the owed promissory note (uˀiltu) 2/3 mina 4 ½ shekels. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/[...]//[...]). (The dating of the tablet breaks off in the middle of the king’s name [Ida-ri].)
 
A = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabu-mukīn-zēri//Ēṭiru; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 2034

Paraphrase:
Promissory note or receipt for silver (heavily damaged): A, the chief of the craftsmen, [receives(?) from] B 2/3 mina of cut silver of 1/8 alloy for year [x] of Darius. No witnesses legible, the scribe (Bazūzu/Iqīšāya//Bābūtu).
 
A = chief of the craftsmen? (rab ummânē) (unnamed, title partly restored); B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 1923

Paraphrase:
Purchase of slave (heavily damaged): B sells his female slave (whose name is lost) to A for 2/3 mina of silver. [remainder of obv. and rev. lost]. Indication of witnesses and scribe lost.
 
A = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu; B = [...]-Marduk/Zēria//Egibi
Title: VAT 1914

Paraphrase:
Purchase of slave: B sells C to A for 1 mina 3 shekels of silver. A clause follows concerning A’s and fD’s responsibility for C, in the case of lawsuits (pūt sihî), vindications (pūt pāqirāni) and and claims of status of a royal slave (arad šarrūti) and freedom (mār banûti).
 
A = Šūzubu/Rēmūtu//Kānik-bābi; B = Mīnû-Bēl-dān/Rēmūtu//Šumu-libši; C = Lugalmaradda-tukultu (slave of B); fD = fNūptāya (mother of B)
Title: VAT 86+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates (heavily damaged): A owes [x amount of dates]. He is to pay it [in Arahsamnu (VIII)] in the storehouse (haṣāru) in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI, together with 10 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), 10 date baskets (gipû), [...], 10 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu). This excludes 1;3.2 kor of dates of the 6th year and 0;2.3 kor of dates. The latter dates are in not further specifiable connection with B. The last legible clause speaks about confirming something of the 5th year in a promissory note (uˀiltu). [remainder of tablet lost].
 
A = [...]/[...]//Egibi; B = Bēl-šumu-uṣur
Title: VAT 2070

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B owes to A 8 kor of dates, impost (imittu) of the harvest of the field in Kār-Nabû-ša-ina-muhhi-nāri-ša-Ahhē-šullim. The field is part of the dowry of fC1; C2 is its co-owner. He is to pay in Arahsamnu (VIII), together with 1 kor palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date-palm fibres (mangagu), 10 loads of date-frond ribs (huṣābu) and [1] container of pressed dates (darīku). [The guard’s fee(?) (kādu) and the levy of the agricultu]ral supervisor (gugallu) [are not paid]. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Ša-Marduk-šullum(?)/Mudammiq-Adad). Addendum (only in VAT134): The šissinnu is not paid.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Erība-Marduk/Rēmūtu//Rab-banê; fC1 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi (wife of A); C2 = Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi (brother of fC1)
Title: VAT 137

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates (damaged): B owes to fA 16 kor of dates, the impost (imittu) of the 1 kor of land of fA. He is to pay in [Arahsamnu (VIII)]. [remainder of obv. and most of rev. lost]. A possible scribe is only party legible (Nabû-TIN-[...]).
 
fA = fEsagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = Arad-Nergal/Nabû-muqqu-elip//Egibi
Title: VAT 1977

Paraphrase:
Receipt for house rent: A receives from C on behalf of B the rent for his house till the end of Abu (V), 18th year of Darius. Addendum: Each party has taken a copy. He receives the šugarrû for the middle of the year. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Marduk-bēlšunu/Nabû-uballiṭ//Ēṭiru).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-uṣuršu/Nabû-kēšir//Andahar; C = Nabû-bullissu/Bēl-šumu-iškun//Ahu-bani
Title: VAT 357

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with house as security: B owes to A [x] minas of silver. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel per mina from Dûzu (IV). A takes B’s house as security. This is apart from an earlier promissory note for which he took a house as security. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Arad-Gula/[Bēl-ahh]ē-iddin(?)//Nabûnnāya).
 
A = Nergal-[...]/Marduk-erība//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Iqīšāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu
Title: VAT 512

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with house as security: B owes to A ½ mina of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears yearly interest of 12 shekels of silver per mina (20%). The interest will start accrueing with Tašrītu (VII). His house next to those of D1 and D2 is pledged as security. The silver is due in Ulūlu (VI). fC vouches for the payment of the silver. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-šumu-iškun/Mušallim-Marduk//Nappāhu).
 
A = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Mušallim-Marduk//Nappāhu; fC = fInbāya/Ina-tēšî-ēṭir (wife of B); D1 = Napuštu/Bulluṭu; D2 = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Marduk
Title: VAT 89

Paraphrase:
Receipt of king’s share in prebendary income: A receives (mahāru) from B [...] of the royal rations (kurummat šarri) of the temple of Išhara of the 1st year of Xerxes, king of all the lands. At least 2 witnesses and the scribe (Šir[ku]/[...]/Miṣirāya).
 
A = Bēl-ittannu/Marduk-zēru-ibni//Šumu-libši; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 3613

Paraphrase:
Testament with bequests including prebends of Išhara and Papsukkal: B makes over to A1 a butcher’s prebend in the temple of Išhara and to A2 a prebend before Papsukkal of the temple of Bēlet-Eanna on the bank of the canal and a date garden on the Gubbātu canal. He also makes over to fA3, fA4 and fA5 assets in circulation (mimmûšu ša sūqi ša illâ), including all escaped slavesthat may turn up, and to fA4 and fA5 the dates at the disposal of Lābāši and his nishu-assets still in circulation. In an earlier tablet B has made over to fA3 a house, which will belong to fA3 and where A1 and A2 will live together with her. He has also made over to her his assets. B had made over to fA3 the aforementioned butcher’s prebend of Išhara, but she voluntarily made it over to A1. fA3 will enjoy the income of the prebends together with A1 and A2. Furthermore she is to provide dowries (nudunnû) for fA4 and fA5 out of her own dowry. 5 witnesses, including the brother of fA3 (Nādin-ahi/Šamaš-nāṣir//Ileˀˀi-Marduk), 3 ina ašābi-witnesses (fA3, fA4 and fA5) and the scribe (Bēl-rēmanni//Sagdidi).
 
A1 = Kalbi-Bau/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Ileˀˀi-Marduk (older son of B); A2 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Ileˀˀi-Marduk (younger son of B); fA3 = Amat-Ninlil/Šamaš-nāṣir//Ileˀˀi-Marduk (mother of B); fA4 = Ṭābatu/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Ileˀˀi-Marduk (sister of B); fA5 = Tabanni/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Ileˀˀi-Marduk (sister of B); B = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Šaddinu//Ileˀˀi-Marduk
Title: BM 77643+

Paraphrase:
Lease of prebendary duties (partly damaged): B, whom C adopted, gives ½ qa of bread and ½ qa of beer in Ešumešu, the shrine of Bēl-āliya-ša-Šarbānu [to ...]. (Also white silver is given, but in unclear context due to damage). 4 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-mukīn-apli/Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Adad-šammê). Addendum: the bread is at his disposal from the 1st of Abu (V).
 
A = Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Ea-zēru-iqīša//Eppeš-ilī; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; C = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 492

Paraphrase:
Concerning a widow’s settlement: A establishes (šakānu; il-ta-kan) ½ mina of silver as the share of fB in place of her rations (kurrummatu). A takes that silver from the promissory note (uˀiltu) for 1 mina 10 shekels of silver that is owed to C by D. As security C had taken the house of D, which now belongs to A who inherited the assets of C (cf. VAT116). The remainder of the 1 mina 10 shekels of silver belong to A. As long as fB has not been paid her ½ mina of silver, she will live in the southern wing(?) of the said house. The eastern wing belongs to A. fB also swears by Ištar of Babylon that she possesses nothing else than 1 copper brazier (mušahhinu), 1 copper cup (kāsu), 1 bed (eršu), 1 table (paššūru) and a chair (kussû), 4 (sic) items belonging to C. And she does not conceal (ana pašīri šakānu) any promissory notes from A.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fB = fTappaššar/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Nūr-Sîn (wife of B; cf. Baker 2004, 32f. for filiation); C = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu; D = Bēl-aplu-iddin/Dādiya/Rab-banê
Title: VAT 51

Paraphrase:
Receipt for brazier: A receives from B on behalf of D a brazier (mušahhinnu) weighing 4(?) minas of bronze that D owes to A and fC. [2 lines lost] 2 witnesses and the scribe (Dunqu/Tabnêa//Šangû-Gula).
 
A = Itti-Nabû-Balāṭu/Nabû-bālti-ilī//Atkuppu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fC = [Lū]-dia/Nabû-bālti-ilī//Atkuppu (sister of A); D = Ardia
Title: VAT 490

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with land as security: B owes A 1/3 mina 1 1/12 shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. He is to pay it on the 10th Arahsamnu (VIII). His land planted with date-palms in Kār-Tašmētu next to that of C is A’s security. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Nidintu-Marduk/Rab-banê).
 
A = Baqqa/Iddin-Nabû//Rab-banê; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; C = Nabû-kuṣuršu/Nādin//Gahal
Title: BM 77416

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: A receives from B on instructions of C 1/3 mina 1/8 [shekel of] cut [silver] of 1/8 alloy. He returns the promissory note (uˀiltu). 2 witnesses and the scribe (= A). (Cf. VAT 144)
 
A = Nergal-ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//Egibi; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; C = Lūṣi-ana-Nūr-Marduk
Title: VAT 2044+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note or receipt of silver (heavily damaged): A is owed(?) [x min]as 50 shekels of silver [up to the en]d of Addāru (XII) of the 6th year of [Cambys]es by an unkown second party. At least two witnesses legible and the scribe (Bēl-kāṣir/[...]mil(?)/[...]).
 
A = [Iddin-Nabû]/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 1971

Paraphrase:
Obligation to produce debtor: C is to have B pay to A his debt of 1 mina of white cute silver of 1/8 alloy till the 10th of Ṭebētu (X), for which A had taken fD, his slave woman, as a pledge, since C vouched for the payment. If he does not produce B, C has to pay the debt himself. 5 witnesses, including 1 added later on, and the scribe (Itti-Bēl-lummir/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Egibi).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-ittannu/Marduk-ēṭir; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Bēl-aplu-uṣur; fD = fUqūpatu (slave of B)
Title: VAT 379

Paraphrase:
Purchase of slave: B sells C to A for 1 mina 3 shekels of silver. A clause follows concerning A’s and fD’s responsibility for C, in the case of lawsuits (pūt sihî), vindications (pūt pāqirāni) and and claims of status of a royal slave (arad šarrūti) and freedom (mār banûti).
 
A = Šūzubu/Rēmūtu//Kānik-bābi; B = Mīnû-Bēl-dān/Rēmūtu//Šumu-libši; C = Lugalmaradda-tukultu (slave of B); fD = fNūptāya (mother of B)
Title: VAT 85

Paraphrase:
Receipt for dates(?) (heavily damaged): A receives from (?) B an illegible product in connection with a date-palm. The supposed dates come from 0;1.2 kor of land of fC, which she shares with another person. [remainder of obv. and most of rev. lost]. Possibly at least 3 witnesses, no scribe legible.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = [...]-aplu-iddin/Niqūdu//[...]; fC = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi
Title: VAT 1979

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates (obv. heavily damaged): The witnesses, the mention of B as the tenant and also of fA – albeit in an unclear context – suggest that the subject of this tablet is similar to that of n VAT353, which concerns dates as impost on fA’s field. 4 witnesses, including the scribe of VAT353 (Nabû-aplu-iddin/Erība-Marduk//Rab-banê), and the scribe (Nabû-iqīšanni/Marduk-bēl-zēri//Šumu-libši). The location, Kār-Nabû, is further specified as nāru-ša-Ahhē-šullim.
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = Balāṭu/Iddin-Bēl//Sîn-dāˀin
Title: VAT 496

Paraphrase:
Record of oath concerning debt of dates: A swears by Bēl, Nabû and Darius, the king. He swears to come before B on the 10th of Arahsamnu (VIII) and give him 0;2.3 kor of dates out of his credit (rašûtu). 3 witnesses and one more added at the end, and the scribe (Arad-Gula/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Nabûnnāya).
 
A = Arad-Nergal/Nabû-muqqu-elip//Egibi; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 563

Paraphrase:
Receipt for house rent: A receives from B the rent of his house in the amount of ½ mina(?) (tablet gives shekel) minus 1/4 shekel of white silver of 1/8 alloy. Addendum: each party has taken a copy. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Arad-Marduk/[...]//Egibi).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fB = fĒṭirtu/Nabû-zēru-iqīša, wife of Zumbāya
Title: VAT 5472

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house (damaged): B [rents] to A his house next to the thoroughfare of [Nabû and Nanāya], the no-through [street] ([sūqu] lā āṣû, la aṣ-ṣu-ú), for [a yearly rent of x shekels of silver] of 1/8 alloy for 2(?) years. [A is to pay half at the beginning of the the year and the re]st [in the middle]. (remainder of obv. and main part of rev. lost). Only part of the filiation of the scribe is legible ([...]/[...]//Basia). Addendum: [Each party has tak]en [a copy].
 
A = [...]/Nabû-[...]//[...]; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 1913

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with house as security: B owes to A 1 mina of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears yearly interest of 12 shekels of silver per mina (20%). B’s house next to that of C is pledged as security. The interest will start accruing on the 1st of Ayyāru (II). 2 witnesses, including the brother in law of A (Bēl-usāt/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//Nūr-Sîn), and the scribe (Habaṣīru/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Šumu-libši).
 
A = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Mušallim-Marduk//Nappāhu; C = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Ša-Nabû-šū//Pahāru
Title: VAT 115

Paraphrase:
Roster for prebendary service of Išhara: A, (name lost, šatammu of Esagil) addresses (qabû) the priests (šangû) of Išhara requesting them to prepare (gamālu) 0;0.3 kor of bread and 0;0.3 kor of beer, makkasu-dates and maṣhatu-flour daily. B1 is to perform the service (izuzzu) from the 1st to the 5th day every month; B2 from the 6th to the 15th day; B3 from the 16th to the 20th day; B4 from the 21st to the 30th day. Additionally they will bring (zabālu) qeršu and greens (mašqu) from Esagil. The tablet is sealed, probably by the šatammu himself.
 
A = the bishop (šatammu) of Esagil, name lost; B1 = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B2 = the house of Bittānu; B3 = [...]/Ina-qībi-Bēl; B4 = Dihummu/Šāpik-zēri;
Title: VAT 486+

Paraphrase:
Testament with bequests including prebends of Išhara and Papsukkal: B makes over to A1 a butcher’s prebend in the temple of Išhara and to A2 a prebend before Papsukkal of the temple of Bēlet-Eanna on the bank of the canal and a date garden on the Gubbātu canal. He also makes over to fA3, fA4 and fA5 assets in circulation (mimmûšu ša sūqi ša illâ), including all escaped slavesthat may turn up, and to fA4 and fA5 the dates at the disposal of Lābāši and his nishu-assets still in circulation. In an earlier tablet B has made over to fA3 a house, which will belong to fA3 and where A1 and A2 will live together with her. He has also made over to her his assets. B had made over to fA3 the aforementioned butcher’s prebend of Išhara, but she voluntarily made it over to A1. fA3 will enjoy the income of the prebends together with A1 and A2. Furthermore she is to provide dowries (nudunnû) for fA4 and fA5 out of her own dowry. 5 witnesses, including the brother of fA3 (Nādin-ahi/Šamaš-nāṣir//Ileˀˀi-Marduk), 3 ina ašābi-witnesses (fA3, fA4 and fA5) and the scribe (Bēl-rēmanni//Sagdidi).
 
A1 = Kalbi-Bau/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Ileˀˀi-Marduk (older son of B); A2 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Ileˀˀi-Marduk (younger son of B); fA3 = Amat-Ninlil/Šamaš-nāṣir//Ileˀˀi-Marduk (mother of B); fA4 = Ṭābatu/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Ileˀˀi-Marduk (sister of B); fA5 = Tabanni/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Ileˀˀi-Marduk (sister of B); B = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Šaddinu//Ileˀˀi-Marduk
Title: BM 92793

Paraphrase:
Receipt for dates: A receives 35 kor of dates, the tithe (ešrû) of the sukkallu (Nabû-ēṭir), from B on behalf of C, the temple enterer (ērib bīti) of Išhara. No witnesses, no scribe.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Nabû-bēlšunu//Rab-banê; B = Šūzubu//Kānik-bābi C = Iddināya (=Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu)
Title: VAT 472

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver (heavily damaged): (The exact details of the transaction are lost) A appears in connection with [x] shekels of silver. No witnesses extant, the scribe is Iqīšāya/[Nabû]-balāssu-iqbi//[Nappāhu]. Addendum: each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 1910

Paraphrase:
Dowry receipt: A is paid (eṭēru) the dowry of his wife fC by (ina qāt) B. It comprises: 8 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy with 1 mina of quppu-silver, 2 slaves, a table (paššūru), a pot stand (gangannu), a bed (gišná) with dimigirru and fig-ornaments (tittu), a small bed (eršu qallatu) with a musukkannu-attachment (musukkannu mandītu), a footstool (šupāl šēpi), a woman’s(?) chair (kussû ša sinniš[ti]), a lamp (bīt nūru), a bronze (lamp) stand (kallu siparru), a bronze lantern (šāšītu siparru), a bronze brazier (mušahhin sip[arri]), 3 bronze cups (kāsu), a bronze baṭû-vessel, a bronze ladle (nāṭilu), 2 bronze strainers (šāhilu), a bronze mukarrišu-vessel, a bronze grate(?) (kišukku), a wooden chest (gišarannu), 3 muṣiptu-garments, and an upper(?) kišku-cloth (kišku an.na); the earlier receipt of 5 5/6 minas of silver included. 6 witnesses, including the brother-in-law of B (Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi), and the scribe (= A).
 
A = Nidintu-Marduk/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Rab-banê; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fC = fTabluṭ/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu
Title: BM 77399+
Other markings Description: BM77399+BM77731 sealed on upper and lower edges; BM77570 unsealed

Paraphrase:
Conversion of dowry silver into land: B transfers to fA the ownership of 1 kor of land in lieu of 4 minas of silver. The silver value of the land equals that of gold which B took (našû) from the dowry chest (quppu) of fA. fA has usufruct on the land and may hand it down only to her daughter. The description of the plot of land is broken, it stretches from an unknown place to the dam (makallû) in Nabātu. 4 witnesses, including 2 sons of fA (Esagil-mukīn-apli and Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi) and her brother (Iqīšāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu) and the scribe (Bēl-iqīša/Bāniya//Bāˀiru).
 
fA = fKaššāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu; B = Balāṭu/Ibnāya//Egibi
Title: VAT 91

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for supply of 1 gulīnu-garment: B owes A 1 gulīnu-garment. He is to bring it to him on the 15th Tašrītu (VII) of the [4th?] year; on pain of paying 8 shekels of silver otherwise. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Sîn-[tabni]).
 
A = Iddināya/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Balāṭu//Egibi
Title: VAT 117

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver to be repaid in barley: B owes A 1/3 mina of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina. In Tašrītu (VII) he is to pay barley in lieu of silver according to the price in Babylon, adding 2 kor of barley per mina. 5 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-ibni//[...]).
 
A = Bēl-iddin/Marduk-šākin-šumi//Rab-banê; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: BM 77412

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver: A receives from B 5 shekels of silver up to the end of Tašrītu (VII). 1 ina ušuzzi-witness (Mušēzib-Marduk/Nabû-zēru-iqīša), no scribe.
 
A = Nidintu/Kalbāya; B = Iddināya
Title: VAT 142

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley: A receives from C on behalf of B on the instrcutions of D 10 kor barley out of the final payment (šullundu) of barley of the crown prince’s estate. A is to register the barley with D and give (proof of) it to C. No witnesses, no scribe given.
 
A = Šellebu/Līširu//Bēl-ušumgal; B = Dādia; C = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu (messenger [mār šipri] of B); D = Nidintu-Bēl (the one in charge of debts(?) [ša muhhi rēhāni] of the crown prince’s estate)
Title: VAT 389

Paraphrase:
Deposition regarding an adoption which is read in the presence of citizens (mār banê): Witnesses are recorded before whom A1 and fA2 reads out (šasû, il-su-ú) the agreement (riksu) concerning fB whom fA2 took from the street, raised and whose foot she impressed on the clay. The list of witnesses follows; no scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-nādin-šumi/Mušēzib-Marduk//Gahal; fA2 = fṢirāya/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu (wife of A1); fB = fŠēpītāya (adoptive daughter of fA2)
Bibliography: Baker 2004, No. 191; BV 127; NRV 712; Dandamaev 1984, 103f.; San Nicolò 1930, 448ff.;
Title: VAT 477

Paraphrase:
Obligation to hand over promissory note: By the 28th of Addāru (XII) of the 20th year B is to give to A the promissory note (uˀiltu) for 1 mina 5 shekels of white cut silver and its interest, the credit of C, for which D is the security. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-ušallim/Bēl-iddin//Rab-banê).
 
A = Šumu-iddin/Šulāya//Šangû-Gula; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; C = Kāṣir/Esagil-šadûnu//Sîn-tabni; D = Itti-Bēl-gūzu (slave of A)
Title: VAT 362

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B1 and B2 owe to fA 16.1 kor of dates, im[post] (imittu) [from the field] of fA. They are to pay it all in [Arah]samnu (VIII) in the storehouse (haṣāru) in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI. For each 1 kor of dates, palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû),[date-palm fibres (mangagu)], containers of pressed dates (darīku) and 10 loa[ds of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu)] are to be delivered. She is to pay the ṣapītu and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) to C. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Tukulti-Marduk/Lābāši//Amēlû).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Marduk-šumu-ibni/[...]//[Nabûn]nāya; B2 = Nabû-bullis[su]/[...]//[...]; C = [...]ṭu
Title: VAT 1930+

Paraphrase:
Receipt for dates imittu: A receives from B dates (in an unspecified quantity), the impost (imittu) and harvest of the 13th year of Darius of fC. The dates are her preferential share (pūt zitti) with D1 and fD2. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-aplu-iddin/Erība-Marduk//Rab-banê). Addendum (written between indication of witnesses and scribe): The palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), containers of pressed dates (darīku) and palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) are paid. The location, Kār-Nabû, is further specified as nāru-ša-Ahhē-šullim.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Balāṭu/Iddin-Bēl//Sîn-dāˀin; fC = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi (wife of A); D1 = Nabû-tabni-uṣur; fD2 = fTabluṭu
Title: VAT 353

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B owes 3;2.3 kor of dates to fA1 and fA2, impost of their field, of which 2/3 is the share of fA1. He is to pay it all in Arahsamnu (VIII). It is said that their accounts are settled (qatû), but the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) and the guard’s fee (kādu) are unpaid. A clause against pruning (arû D, ú-mar-ru) any living part (raṭbu) (of the trees) follows. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Nergal-ušallim//Eppeš-ilī). Addendum: the settlement for water rights (nikkassū ša mê) is unpaid.
 
fA1 = fEsagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; fA2 = fGigītu/Balāṭu//Egibi (sister of fA1); B = Arad-Nergal/Nabû-muqqu-elip//Egibi
Title: MM 1089

Paraphrase:
Receipt for house rent: A receives from B the rent of his house from Nisannu (I), 4th year of Darius, till Ulūlu (VI), 5th year of Darius. Each party has taken a copy. B swears an oath by the king regarding the repairs to the drain (asurrû) of the house. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-ušallim/Nabû-kēšir//Bāˀiru).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Ṭābih-karri
Title: VAT 135

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house: B rents to A his house next to the no-through street ([sūqu lā] āṣû) and the thoroughfare of Nabû and Nanāya, for a yearly rent of 1/3 mina of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy for two years. A is to pay half at the beginning of the year and the rest in the middle. He is to renew (šanû) the roof and repair (batqa ṣabātu) the drain (asurrû). And in Nisannu (I), Dûzu (IV) and Kislīmu (IX) he is to make additional payments (nūptu). However, he may charge (manû) B any cost of his work on the bricks (libittu), the reeds (qanâtu) and the roof (ūru) exceeding 1 shekel of silver. Each party has taken a copy. B receives the 10 shekels for his half-year. The document ends with a clause against transgression on pain of payment of 1 mina of white silver. 5 witnesses and the scribe (Širiktu/Bēl-ēṭir). Addendum: The house is at A’s disposal from [day x month x year 18].
 
A = Nabû-šullimanni, slave of Rēmūtu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 503+

Paraphrase:
Exchange of houses: fA and B exchange houses. B also gives her an equalisation payment (takpuštu) of 27 shekel of silver. fA’s house is situated next to those of C1, C2 and C3 and the narrow street (sūqu qatnu). B’s house is situated next to those of C4, C5 and C6 and the narrow street. Each party is to give the other the corresponding tablets and ummi eqli documents. 6 witnesses, 1 ina ašābi-witness (fHīptāya/Aplāya//Rab-banê) and the scribe (Madānu-[...]/Bēl-šumu-ibni//DA-[...]). Addendum: Each party has taken their tablets of the exchanged real estate (qanû). Fingernail impressions of fA and B are in place of seals.
 
fA = fHīptāya/Ṣillāya//Ea-ṣalam-ilī; B = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Mušallim-Marduk//Nappāhu; C1 = Nabû-mukīn-apli/Mušallim-Marduk//Nappāhu; C2 = Nabû-ēṭir/Šāpik-zēri//Rēmut-ilī; C3 = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Nādinu//Pahāru; C4 = Zērūtu/Balāssu; C5 =Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Marduk//Rēˀû; C6 = Nabû-ahu-ušabši/Nabû-īpuš
Title: VAT 476

Paraphrase:
Receipt for prebendary meat: A receives (mahāru) from B prebendary meat of [...] of ox and sheep before Išhara from Dûzu (IV) of the 29th year till the end of Simānu (III) of the 30th year. 5 witnesses and the scribe ([...]//Rab-banê).
 
A = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr (agent [bēl piqitti] of the one in charge of the cashbox [ša-muhhi-quppi]); B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: BM 77563
Other markings Description: seals on upper obverse and upper edge
Julian date Remark: 492/491 (the numeral of the days might be higher than 12)

Paraphrase:
Bequest of butcher’s prebends of Išhara and Papsukkal: B gives to A his two butcher’s prebends before Išhara in Ešasurra in Šuanna and Papsukkal of Ekitušgirzal, the temple of Bēlet-Eanna on the canal bank in the Newtown in Babylon. The prebends comprise ox and sheep of the royal sacrifice and the sacrifice of the kāribu, ginû, quqqû for the whole year, a “coil” (tīrānu), a brain(?) (gabbu), gan ṣēli-meat, meat trimmings (nukāsātu), the epigastrum (karšu), naṣraptu-meat, and every year four hides of sheep(?) before Išhara, the omasum (riqītu), bāb urkāti-meat, hilidamu-meat, the fatty tissue around the intestines (hinṣu) not cut off (qarāšu), and ox, sheep, birds and lamb of the 8th of Nisannu (I), and a shoulder share of ox and sheep before Papsukkal. After the operative section a curse formula invoking Marduk, Zarpanītu, Išhara and Papsukkal and directed against a violaton of the agreement  and an oath formula invoking Marduk, Zarpanītu and Nebuchadnezzar follow (nīš … izzakrū [zakāru]). 4 witnesses and the scribe (Ea-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Rēˀû). (All three tablets are copies of a damaged original that we do not possess.)
 
A = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Šaddinnu//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; B = Izkur-Marduk/Imbia//Ileˀˀi-Marduk
Title: BM 77294

Paraphrase:
Statement before citizens: A states before citizens (mār banê) that B1 and B2 had kept watch (on his behalf) on the 5th of Addāru (XII) until the closing of the gate (adi turri bābi), but he did not pay them. A list of 4 witnesses follows; no scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B1 = Bēl-īpuš/Marduk-bēlšunu//Irˀanni; B2 = Gūzānu/Mušēzib/Marduk
Title: VAT 449

Paraphrase:
Receipt for interest on silver: B pays (eṭēru) to A the interest on a silver debt up to the end of Simānu (III) of the 16th year of Nabonidus.  Addendum: each party has taken a copy. 1 witness and the scribe (Nabû-zēru-iqīša/Nabû-bēlšunu//Rab-banê).
 
A = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Gimillu//Šangû-Adad
Title: VAT 88

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver, part of dowry: A receives (mahāru) 5 5/6 minas of cut silver of 1/8 alloy as part of the dowry (nudunnû) of fC from (ina qāt) B. Both parties take a copy of the tablet (šaṭāru). 8 witnesses (1 added after text), including the brother-in-law of B (Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi), and the scribe (= A).
 
A = Nidintu-Marduk/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Rab-banê; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fC = fTabluṭu/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu
Title: BM 77398

Paraphrase:
Receipt for dowry slaves: A1 and A2 receive (eṭēru) from B the remainder of the slaves promised to A2 as dowry. The chattels are said to correspond to B’s entire share in the dowry owed. Three witnesses, all descendents of Nappāḫu. Scribe: Qīšti-Marduk/Šūzubu//Kānik-bābi. Some markings (parallel lines) on lower edge

A1 = Nabû-nādin-šumi/Mušēzib-Marduk//Gaḫal
A2 = fṢirāya/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāḫu
B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāḫu
Title: VAT 103

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver (fragment): Only the clause concerning interest arising every 2 years in the amount of 12 shekels per mina is extant. 1 witness legible, remainder of rev. lost
 
No protagonists legible.
Title: VAT 2096
Other markings Description: geometric drawing on upper left edge

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with land as security: B owes A 1 mina 50 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears a monthly interest of 1 shekel of white silver per mina, starting on the 1st of Ṭebētu (X) of the 26th year of Darius. 0;2.3 kor of B’s best land planted with date-palms (ina bunni zērišu) in Bīt-Hahhūru is A’s security. A clause against claiming the security of other creditors follows. 8 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-īpuš/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Šumu-libši). Addendum on the edge of the tablet: The silver was used to pay fC (cf. BM77408).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Iddin-Bēl/Nabû-uṣuršu//Burāqu; fC = fŠinbanâ/Arad-Gula//Irˀanni
Title: VAT 376

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver: A receives from B 5 shekels of silver up to the end of Tašrītu (VII). 1 ina ušuzzi-witness (Mušēzib-Marduk/Nabû-zēru-iqīša), no scribe.
 
A = Nidintu/Kalbāya; B = Iddināya
Title: VAT 141

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for date-palm products: B owes A 14 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) consisting of 40 good-quality bundles per load. He is to deliver them in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the workshop (mušēpišu) of the estate of the crown prince in Babylon. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-ittannu/Bazūzu).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Bēl-iddin/Ahušunu//Arad-Papsukkal
Title: VAT 374

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for remainder of price of slave: B owes to A1 and A2 ½ mina 2 shekel of cut silver of 1/8 alloy, which is the remainder of the purchase price of fC. He is to pay on the 2nd of Ayyāru (II). 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nidintu-Bēl/Niqūdu//Adad-šumu-ēreš).
 
A1 = Nidintu/Dihummu//Pahāru; A2 = Šadûnu/Bēl-šumu-iškun//Nūr-Sîn; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fC = fŠa-Ninlil-ūda;
Title: VAT 495+

Paraphrase:
Purchase of slave: B sells C, whose hand is inscribed with the name of B’s wife (fTubqītu), to A for 1 1/3 mina of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. In case of a claim on C, B is to clear him and give him to A. B has received full payment. 12 witnesses, 1 ina ašābi-witness, the wife of B (fTubqītu/Bēl-lūmur//Adad-šēˀā), and the scribe (Bēl-ittannu/Bazūzu).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Šumu-iddin/Šulāya//Šangû-Gula; C = Itti-Bēl-gūzu (slave of B)
Title: VAT 372

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates (damaged): The document deals with [x];2.3 kor of [dates the impost (imittu) on the field in] Nabātu of fA1, [her preferential shar]e with A2. The tenant of the field is lost with the remainder of the obv. At least 2 witnesses and [the scribe] (Nabû-it[tannu]/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//LÚ[...]).
 
fA1 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi (brother of fA1)
Title: VAT 2026

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates (heavily damaged): B owes to fA [x kor of dates, impost of her field in] Kār-Marduk (for Kār-Nabû?; cf. VAT2024, VAT382)-ša-ina-muh[hi-nāri-ša-Ahhē-šullim (cf. VAT446)]. He is to pay it all [in Arahsamnu (VIII)] in the storehouse (haṣāru) in [the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI] in Kār-Nabû, together with [palm-leaf baskets, date-p]alm fibres (mangagu), loads of palm-[frond ribs (huṣābu) and 1 container of pressed dates (darīku)]. (remainder lost)
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = [...]/Rēmūtu//[...]
Title: VAT 2086

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B owes to fA 4 kor of dates, [impost (imittu) of her field] together with the land (zēru) of fC. He is to pay in Arahsamnu (VIII). Various further payable fees and items follow, among which only the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu), the guard’s fee (kādu), date-palm fibres (mangagu), 10 loads of [palm-frond ribs (huṣābu)], and 1 container of pressed dates (darīku) are legible. 1 witness and the scribe (Bēl-iddin/Rēmūtu). Addendum: a damaged clause concerning witnessing follows on the rev and one on the left edge mentioning the 24th day.
 
fA = Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = Arad-Nergal/Nabû-muqqu-elip//Egibi; fC = Gigītu/Balāṭu//Egibi (sister of fA)
Title: VAT 1982+

Paraphrase:
Receipt for house rent: A receives from B the rent of his house; the period for which is lost. Addendum: Each party has taken a copy. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Ṭāb-ṣilli-Marduk/Rab-banê).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Pirˀu//Nannûtu
Title: VAT 2041

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house: B rents his house to A. The house is next to the broad street (sūqu rapšu), the thoroughfare of Nabû and Nanāya, the yearly rent amounts to 1/3 mina of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy, the duration of the lease is three years. A is to pay half at the beginning of the year and the rest in the middle. He is to renew (šanû) the roof and repair (batqa ṣabātu) the drain (asurrû). And in Nisannu (I), Dûzu (IV) and Kislīmu (IX) he is to make additional payments (nūptu). However, he may charge (manû) any costs for the repair works to B. The house is at A’s disposal from the 1st of Ulūlu (VI) of the 16th year. Addendum: Each party has taken a copy. 5 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-ittannu/Nabû-tabni-uṣur//Dābibī).
 
A = Nuhšāya/Pālil-uballiṭ; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 447
Other markings Description: geometric drawing on left edge; marking at right-hand side, end of l. 3

Paraphrase:
Lease of house: B rents to A his house which is next to that of C. The rent is 13 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy per year. A is to pay half of it at the beginning of the year and the rest in the middle. B has received the payment of the beginning of the year. A is to renew (šanû) the roof and repair (batqa ṣabātu) the drain (asurrû). In Nisannu (I), Dûzu (IV) and Kislīmu (IX) he is to make additional payments (nūptu). However, he may charge (manû) to B any cost of his work exceeding 1 shekel of stamped (ginnu) silver. The house will be at A’s disposal from the 1st of Simānu (III) for two years. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Ardiya//Nabûnnāya).
 
A = Nabû-bullissu/Nabû-kāṣir//Sîn-šadûnu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; C = Ṭāb-ṣilli-Marduk/Balāṭu//Rab-banê
Title: VAT 508+

Paraphrase:
Receipt of cuts of meat: A1 and A2 receive in payment from B the rapaštu-joints and the arkātu-joints of the rations of the weaned lambs (parāsu) from the quqqû-offerings till the end of Simānu (III) of the 28th year (of Darius). God Šamaš is listed as the only witness; the scribe is party to the transaction (A1).
 
A1 = Zumbu/Iddināya; A2 = Bēl-iddin/Damqiya; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 505

Paraphrase:
Bequest of butcher’s prebends of Išhara and Papsukkal: B gives to A his two butcher’s prebends before Išhara in Ešasurra in Šuanna and Papsukkal of Ekitušgirzal, the temple of Bēlet-Eanna on the canal bank in the Newtown in Babylon. The prebends comprise ox and sheep of the royal sacrifice and the sacrifice of the kāribu, ginû, quqqû for the whole year, a “coil” (tīrānu), a brain(?) (gabbu), gan ṣēli-meat, meat trimmings (nukāsātu), the epigastrum (karšu), naṣraptu-meat, and every year four hides of sheep(?) before Išhara, the omasum (riqītu), bāb urkāti-meat, hilidamu-meat, the fatty tissue around the intestines (hinṣu) not cut off (qarāšu), and ox, sheep, birds and lamb of the 8th of Nisannu (I), and a shoulder share of ox and sheep before Papsukkal. After the operative section a curse formula invoking Marduk, Zarpanītu, Išhara and Papsukkal and directed against a violaton of the agreement  and an oath formula invoking Marduk, Zarpanītu and Nebuchadnezzar follow (nīš … izzakrū [zakāru]). 4 witnesses and the scribe (Ea-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Rēˀû). (All three tablets are copies of a damaged original that we do not possess.)
 
A = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Šaddinnu//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; B = Izkur-Marduk/Imbia//Ileˀˀi-Marduk
Title: BM 77529

Paraphrase:
Statement before witnesses: On the 10th of Ulūlu (VII) in the gate of the Išhara temple A states before witnesses that B was maligned (qalālu, qullul), had kept the watch (maṣṣartu) on behalf of C and did not abandon his post (il-li-nim, read[?]: il-li-ik!, alāku [MA]). A list of 4 witnesses follows; no scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Arad-Nergal; C = Hašdāya/Aplāya//Bēl-eṭēri
Title: MMA 86.11.147

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: B has paid his debt of 6 shekels of silver on 1/8 alloy to A (mahāru). This does not include an earlier obligation (uˀiltu) over ½ mina and 1 shekel of silver of 1/8 alloy, for which A took (ṣabātu) B’s slave (fNanāya-kēširat) as pledge. Addendum: each party has taken a copy. 2 witnesses, 2 ina ašābi-witnesses, the wife B (fQudāšu) and his son (Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Bēl-eṭēri), and the scribe (Bēl-ahu-ušabši/Zēria//Šangû-Adad).
 
A = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-šumu-iddin/Marduk-zēru-ibni//Bēl-eṭēri
Title: BM 114780
Other markings Description: possibly incised Aramaic letter(?) on left edge

Paraphrase:
Dowry contract: B gives dowry (nudunnû) with his daughter fC to A. The dowry consists of: 8 minas of white cut silver with 1 mina of quppu-silver of 1/8 alloy, (the slaves) fŠa-Ninlil-ūda and […]-ana-ahhē[šu](?) and household goods (udê bīti; see BM77399+ for details on these goods). The tablet was sealed before (ina kanāk ṭuppi) 10 witnesses, including the brother-in-law of B (Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi), the brothers of fC (Šellebu and Bēl-ēṭir/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu), and the scribe (Ea-iddin/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Šigûa). 2 [ina ašā]bi-witnesses(?), including the wife of B (fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi).
 
A = Nidintu-Marduk/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Rab-banê; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fC = fTabluṭ/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu
Title: BM 77400

Paraphrase:
Dowry receipt: B gives to fA as her dowry (nudunnû) 0;2.3 kor (6750 m²) land, the remainder of his land in Kār-Tašmētu, and a slave woman (fqallatu), fMušēzibtu. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-udammiq/Zēria//Egibi). Dated to the 1st year of Cambyses, king of Babylon, while Cyrus was king of all the lands.
 
fA = Amat-Ninlil/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = Balāṭu/Ibnāya//Egibi (father of fA)
Title: VAT 107

Paraphrase:
Fragment of indeterminable content: The fragment possibly contains part of a witness list.
 
No protagonists determinable.
Title: VAT 1931

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver (heavily damaged): A [receives] 18 shekels of silver on the instructions of [...] [from ...]. No witnesses legible, the scribe (Rāš-il/[Nabû-mukīn-zēri]//Rab-banê).
 
A = Bēl/Nabû-[...]/Šumu-iddin//[...]
Title: VAT 1984

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver (damaged): B owes fA 2 minas 12 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina. [remainder of obv. and beginning of rev. lost] At least 8 witnesses and the scribe ([Līšir]u/Bazūzu).
 
fA = fŠinbanâ/Arad-Gula//Irˀanni; B = Iddin-Bēl/Nabû-uṣuršu//Burāqu
Title: BM 77408

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: C returns to A 2 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy that A had given to B on behalf of C. A is thus paid the 2 minas of silver. 3 witnesses, including 1 added later on, and the scribe (Nabû-ittannu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Sîn-tabni).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Pirˀu//Nannûtu; B = Bēl-erība/Gūzānbu; C = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 462

Paraphrase:
Receipt (heavily damaged): [beginning lost] A brings [an unknown commodity to an unknown party on behalf of another]. the payment is to be registered (izuzzu Š) on the writing board (lēˀu) of Bēl and (proof of) it should be given to A. At least 3 witnesses are partly legible, the remainder is lost.
 
A = Še[llebu/...//...]
Title: VAT 1974

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a slave: B sells fC to fA for 2 minas 52 shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The price is paid. A clause follows concerning D’s responsibility for fC, such as her not being of the status of a royal slave (pūt lā amat šarrūti) or a free citizen (lā mār banûti), clearance of legal implications (murruqu) and claims (lā paqāru). 12 witnesses, including 1 witness added later, and the scribe (Ṭāb-ṣilli-Marduk//Rab-banê).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Ēṭiru; fC = fŠa-Ninlil-ūda; D1 = Nergal-ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ēṭiru
Title: VAT 184

Paraphrase:
Purchase of slave: B sells C, whose hand is inscribed with the name of B’s wife (fTubqītu), to A for 1 1/3 mina of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. In case of a claim on C, B is to clear him and give him to A. B has received full payment. 12 witnesses, 1 ina ašābi-witness, the wife of B (fTubqītu/Bēl-lūmur//Adad-šēˀā), and the scribe (Bēl-ittannu/Bazūzu).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Šumu-iddin/Šulāya//Šangû-Gula; C = Itti-Bēl-gūzu (slave of B)
Title: BM 92797

Paraphrase:
Receipt for levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallūtu): A receives from B in payment the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallūtu) on the 0;3.2 kor of land in Nabātu, which is the preferential share of fC. B retains (izuzzu, ina uˀilti uzuz) the right to the promissory note (uˀiltu) for 19 kor of dates. 3 witnesses and the scribe ([Nidintu]-Marduk//Rab-banê).
 
A = Aplāya/Remūt-Bēl//Eppeš-ilī; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fC = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi
Title: VAT 474

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B1 and B2 owe to fA 5 kor(?) of dates, impost on her field in Kār-Nabû. They are to pay it all in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the storehouse (haṣāru), and together with 1 kor palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date-palm fibres (mangagu), 10 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu). Addendum: They bear responsibility for each other. A clause excluding dates as credit (rašūtu) of an earlier agreement (riksu). 2 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-mutīr-gimil/[...]-MU//Sîn-šadûnu). Addendum: The levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is paid, the šissinnu is not.
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Arad-Bēl/Rēmūtu//Sîn-dayyān; B2 = Iddin-Bēl/Rēmūtu//Sîn-dayyān (brother of B1) (written Sîn-dāˀin in VAT446)
Title: VAT 382

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B owes to A 8;4 kor of dates of the impost (imittu), in which fC has a third share. He is to pay it in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the storeroom (haṣāru) in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI; with each kor he is to give palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date-palm fibres (mangagu), 12 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu), and 2 containers of pressed dates (darīku). A clause against pruning (arû D, ú-ma-ru) any living part (raṭbu) (of the trees); one excluding 1 kor of dates and 3 1/3 shekels of silver that B owes to A; one stating that the šissinnu is not paid; and one stating that the ṣapītu, the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) and the guard’s fee (kādu) are unpaid follow. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi [brother of fC).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Arad-Nergal/Nabû-muqqu-elip//Egibi; fC = fAmat-Ninlil/Balāṭu//Egibi
Title: VAT 108

Paraphrase:
Receipt for house rent: A receives in payment from B the rent of his house for the months from Simānu (III) till Arahsamnu (VIII) of 10th year of Darius. Each party has taken a copy. 1 ½ shekels of white silver of B are at A’s disposal. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Mušallim-Marduk/Šūzubu//Kānik-bābi). A promissory oath (kî adî) concerning repairs to the house by B follows at the end. (cf. MMA86.11.153).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Šāpik-zēri//Miṣirāya
Title: VAT 181

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house: B rents his house to A. The house is next to the no-through street (sūqu lā āṣû) and the thoroughfare of Nabû and Nanāya,  the yearly rent amounts to 18 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy, the duration of the lease is three years. A is to pay half at the beginning of the year and the rest in the middle. A is to renew (šanû) the roof and repair (batqa ṣabātu) the drain (asurrû), the brickwork (libittu), reeds (qanâtu) and roof (ūru), for whose costs he may charge (manû) B [further possible conditions are damaged]. B [receives the payment of the beginning of the year]. Addendum: Each party has taken a copy. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-bullissu/Nabû-aplu-id[din]//Saggilāya)
 
A = Mūrānu/Bēl-iddin//[...]; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 1960+

Paraphrase:
Lease of house: B rents to A his house which is next to that of C. The rent is 15 shekels of silver per year. A is to renew (šanû) the roof and repair (batqa ṣabātu) the drain (asurrû). In Nisannu (I), Dûzu (IV) and Kislīmu (IX) he is to make additional payments (nūptu). He is to pay half the silver at the beginning of the year and the rest in the middle. The house is his from the 1st of Tašrītu (VII). Addendum: Each party has taken a copy. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-iddin/Tabnêa//Asû).
 
A = Nabû-lū-salim/Iddin-Nabû; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; C = Ṭāb-ṣilli-Marduk/Balāṭu//Rab-banê
Title: VAT 131

Paraphrase:
Receipt of king’s share in prebendary income: A receives from B the royal rations (kurummat šarri) from the quqqû-offerings of the sheep and lamb of the temple of Išhara for the months Simānu (III), Kislīmu (IX) and Ṭebētu (X) of the 25th year of Darius. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nidintu-Marduk//Rab-banê).
 
A = Nidintu/Bēl-eṭēri-Nabû (širku of Marduk); B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 388

Paraphrase:
Bequest of butcher’s prebends of Išhara and Papsukkal: B gives to A his two butcher’s prebends before Išhara in Ešasurra in Šuanna and Papsukkal of Ekitušgirzal, the temple of Bēlet-Eanna on the canal bank in the Newtown in Babylon. The prebends comprise ox and sheep of the royal sacrifice and the sacrifice of the kāribu, ginû, quqqû for the whole year, a “coil” (tīrānu), a brain(?) (gabbu), gan ṣēli-meat, meat trimmings (nukāsātu), the epigastrum (karšu), naṣraptu-meat, and every year four hides of sheep(?) before Išhara, the omasum (riqītu), bāb urkāti-meat, hilidamu-meat, the fatty tissue around the intestines (hinṣu) not cut off (qarāšu), and ox, sheep, birds and lamb of the 8th of Nisannu (I), and a shoulder share of ox and sheep before Papsukkal. After the operative section a curse formula invoking Marduk, Zarpanītu, Išhara and Papsukkal and directed against a violaton of the agreement  and an oath formula invoking Marduk, Zarpanītu and Nebuchadnezzar follow (nīš … izzakrū [zakāru]). 4 witnesses and the scribe (Ea-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Rēˀû). (All three tablets are copies of a damaged original that we do not possess.)
 
A = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Šaddinnu//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; B = Izkur-Marduk/Imbia//Ileˀˀi-Marduk
Title: BM 77555+

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley: A receives from B an unspecified quantity of barley of the price of bread, fine beer, meat, and makkasu-dates, the rations (kurrummatu) of the prebend of A before Išhara, which were imposed (šakānu) upon him by the palace, from Simānu (III) year 4 to the end of Tašrītu (VII) year 6 of Darius. At least 4 witnesses and the scribe (Iddin-Nabû//Ahhē-iddin). Addendum: The barley and dates correspond to the earlier documents.
 
A = Ina-ṣilli-Esagil/Zēria (the alphabet scribe [sēpiru]); B = Iddināya(=Iddin-Nabû)/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 179

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes 7 ½ shekels of silver of 1/8 alloy to A. B will pay the capital amount at the end of Dûzu (IV). Addendum: 3;3 kor of an earlier obligation are not included in this. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Arad-Gula/Balāssu).
 
A = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu; B = Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu/Nabû-šumu-līšir
Title: MMA 86.11.77

Paraphrase:
Statement before citizens: A makes a declaration (qabû) to B1 before 6 citizens (mār banê). A to the effect that he has no claim (rašûtāya iānu) against B2, son of B1, will not approach him (kašādu). 6 witnesses, among who is another member of the Nappāhu family (Mukīn-zēri/Ea-zēru-iqīša//Nappāhu), no scribe.
 
A = Nidintu/Nabû-šumu-iddin; B1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B2 = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu
Title: VAT 501+

Paraphrase:
Fragment of indeterminable content: The operative section is lost. At least 4 witnesses, remainder lost
 
No protagonists legible.
Title: VAT 510

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver (heavily damaged): A [receives] from B [x shekels of silver] from the promissory note (uˀiltu) [for 1 mina 10 shekels? (cf. BM77391 and VAT391)]. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Libluṭ/Nabû-[...]//Marduku).
 
A = Bulṭāya/Šaddinnu//Nūr-Sîn; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 506

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 1 mina of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears a monthly interest of 1 shekel [of silver per min]a. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Lābāši-Marduk/Bēl-iddin//Sîn-tabni-uṣur).
 
A = Hašdāya/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Sîn-šadûnu; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: BM 77409
Other markings Description: patch of textile impression in centre of lower obv.

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: A receives from B on behalf of C 12 shekels of silver. A clause excluding earlier 2 shekels of silver [...] follows. Each party has taken a copy. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Kalbi-Bābu/Nabû-muqqu-ēlip//Ea-ibni).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Lābāši/Mušallim-Marduk//Mušēzib; C = Ubāru/Nabû-ušallim
Title: VAT 484

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley: A receives from C on orders (ina qību) of B 18;1.4 kor of barley. This barley is of the bow-obligation of B which was given to C. Further, a promissory note (uˀiltu) was drawn up against C to the effect of him having to register (izuzzu Š) it in the writing board (lēˀu) of Bēl and give (proof of) it to D. Addendum: The barley of E owed by [an illegible party] is paid. 8 witnesses and the scribe (Līširu/Bazūzu).
 
A = [...]/Niqūdu; B = Ubāru/Nādin//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; C = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Erība-Ea//Šangû-Nabû; D = Nabû-bullissu/Ubāru//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; E = Arad-Madānu
Title: VAT 480

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a slave: B1 and fB2 sell fC to A for 2 ½ minas 5 shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. A clause follows concerning B1’s and fB2’s responsibility regarding possible claims (pūt pāqirāni) over fC2. The price includes 1 ½ minas of silver that B1 and fB2 owe to fD, for which fC was taken as security. A gives the promissory note (uˀiltu) of fD to B1 and fB2. 8 witnesses, fD as ina ašābi-witness, and the scribe (Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Egibi).
 
A = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Ēṭiru; B1 = Nidintu-Bēl/Niqūdu//Adad-šumu-ereš; fB2 = fKabtāya/Taqīš//Sîn-tabni-uṣur (mother of B1); fC = Ša-Ninlil-ūda (slave of B1 and fB2); fD = fṬābatu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Sîn-tabni (wife of A; cf. VAT184).
Title: VAT 146

Paraphrase:
Purchase of slave: fB sells fC, whose hands are inscribed with the name of fA, to fA for 2 1/3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. Full payment has been made. A clause follows concerning D1’s and D2’s responsibility regarding fC, in the case of lawsuits (pūt sihî), vindication (pūt pāqirāni) and claims for the status of a royal slave woman (amat šarrūti) or freedom (mār banûti). 1 ina ašābi-witness, the mother of fB (fTabluṭu/Bēl-iddin/Rēˀi-sīsê), 11 witnesses (including 1 witness added later), and the scribe (Mudammiq-Nabû/Nabû-zēr-līšir).
 
fA = fTabluṭu/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu; fB = fKusippitu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Rēˀi-sīsê; fC = fBānītu- rēˀûa (slave of fB); D1 = Bēl-ittannu/Mušēzib-Marduk//Sūhāya; D2 = Mūrānu/Mušēzib-Marduk//Sūhāya
Title: VAT 180

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates (heavily damaged): B owes fA [x kor of dates]. He is to pay it all in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the storehouse (haṣāru) in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI, together with 1 kor a load (of palm-frond ribs [huṣābu]), palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date-palm fibres (mangagu) and 1 container of pressed dates (darīku). [...] The ṣubātu and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are not paid. 2 witnesses and the scribe ([...]-Nabû//[...]).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = [...]/Niqūdu//Pappāya
Title: VAT 1933+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates (heavily damaged): B1 and B2 owe to fA [x.x.].4 kor of dates, [impost (imittu) on her field in Kā]r-Nabû. They are to pay [in ... together with ...] 5 loads [of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) ...]. Addendum: They bear responsibility for each other. 3 witnesses and the scribe ([...]/Lābāši/[...]).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = [...]-Bēl/Rēmūtu//[Sîn-dāˀin]; B2 = Lābāši/[...]
Title: VAT 2024

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B owes to fA1 and fA2 [x+]2;3.2 kor of dates, impost (imittu) of the harvest of their field in Kār-Tašmētu, of which 2/3 is the share of fA1. He is to pay in Arahsamnu (VIII) 20;1 kor of dates in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI, together with various date-palm products of which only a [container of pressed] dates ([darī]ku) is still legible. 1 witness and the scribe (Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Šūzubu//Kānik-bābi). Addendum written inbetween the indication of the witness and the scribe: the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallūtu?) and the guard’s fee (kādu) are unpaid.
 
fA1 = fIna-Esagil-ramât(initial ina was erased)/Balāṭu//Egibi; fA2 = fGigītu/Balāṭu//Egibi (sister of fA1); B = Arad-Nergal/Nabû-muqqu-elip//Egibi
Title: VAT 104

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house (damaged): A rents his house to B for yearly 1/3 mina 5 shekels of stamped silver of 1/8 alloy. The (damaged) clause concerning half of the payment at the beginning of the year and the remainder in the middle follows. [remainder of obv. lost] [The house is at B’s disposal from the 1st] of Kislīmu (IX), 5th year. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Ṭāb-ṣilli-Marduk/Rab-banê).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Bēl-supê-muhur/Bēl-ibni//Šangû-parakki
Title: VAT 138

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house (heavily damaged): the text concerns the rent of the house of A [next to the no-through street] and the [tho]roughfare of Nabû [and Nanāya] for an illegible [yearly] amount of silver. [Remainder of obv and main part of rev. lost].
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 2089

Paraphrase:
House lease contract (partly damaged): B gives to A his house that is next to that of C for [x amount of silver] until the month Tašrītu (VII). 2 witnesses and the scribe ([Mar]duk-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Ileˀˀi-Marduk).
 
A = Nabû-lū-salim/Iddin-Nabû; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; C = Ṭāb-ṣilli-Marduk/Balāṭu//Rab-banê
Title: MM 1031

Paraphrase:
Lease of prebendary duties (heavily damaged): Only a few meat items of income of certain days, of the 4th and the 17th day can be perceived on the heavily damaged obverse of the tablet. A seems to be the lessee (given the expression ana A [...] iddin) of the prebend. His duty extends [fr]om the 10th day to [x]. 3 witnesses and the scribe(?) ([...]/Iqūpu//Šumu-libši). The dating is lost apart from the damaged indication of the year.
 
A = Šellebu[/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu]
Title: VAT 1920+

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver, price of a prebend: A receives in payment from B the remaining silver (of unspecified amount) of the price of the prebend of the 8th of Nisannu (I) comprising 1 head of a sheep and 1 head of an ox. 5 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-naˀid/Iddin-Nabû//Egi<bi>). Addendum: [Each party has tak]en [a copy]. (For the original document of purchase see BM77551+.)
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Kidinnu(=Kidin-Marduk)//Bēl-eṭēri; B = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu;
Title: BM 77395

Paraphrase:
Lease of prebendary duties: Concerning a prebend at the disposal of A, B [will give] [...] one vessel of billatu-beer, [...], and makkasu-dates out of the prebendary payments (maššartu) to A. For the food offerings of Išhara, A supplies bread, high-quality beer, makkasu-dates [and ...], and bears responsibility for interruption (pūt baṭli) and inspection (pūt masnaqti), (as well as?) for [...] the burnt-flour offering (maṣhatu) and the charcoal. Start and duration of the service are lost. Addendum: each party has taken a copy. 3 witnesses. Indication of scribe or date lost.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Arad-Marduk/x//Eppeš-ilī
Title: VAT 2035

Paraphrase:
Receipt for rations: fA receives (mahāru) 0.2.3 kor, her rations (kurrummatu) from Arahsamnu (VIII) of the 33rd year to the end of Ṭebētu (X) of the 33rd year, from B. Addendum: each party has taken a copy. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Marduk-ēṭir/Itti-Nabû-[balāṭu?]//Bēl-eṭēri).
 
fA = Hīptāya/Balāṭu//Rab-banê; B = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu (husband of fA)
Title: VAT 380

Paraphrase:
List of barley disbursements: 2;1.4 kor barley to A; 0;3.4 kor barley at the disposal of (ina igi) fB; 0;0.5 kor barley to C; 0;0.5 kor barley at the disposal (ina igi) of fB; rest of list is illegible. These are to be distributed (nadānu). Total amount of 17 pānu (unclear numeral 50 following in same line). No witnesses or scribe are given.
 
A = Nabû-nādin-šumi/x//x; fB = fŠidatu/x//x; C = Nabû-kuṣuršu/x//x
Title: VAT 471

Paraphrase:
Promissory note(?) (heavily damaged): Most of the operative section is lost. Only the clause concerning the date of payment in the 20th year of Darius is partly legible. At least 2 witnesses, remainder lost.
 
No protagonists legible.
Title: VAT 1924

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver (damaged): A receives from B on behalf of C 5/6 mina 6 shekels of white silver in accordance with the promissory note (uˀiltu) for this exact amount, for which B acted as guarantor. A is to bring the corresponding promissory note in Šabāṭu of the [27th] year to give it to B.
 
A = Nidintu/Šamaš-pirˀ-uṣur//Pahāru; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; C = Nergal-uballiṭ/Arad-Gula//Irˀanni
Title: BM 77414

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 1 ½ minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy, which was originally owed to C. The debt bears a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina. He is to pay the debt plus interest in Nisannu (I) of the [2]5th year. 5 witnesses and the scribe ([...//E]gibi).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Bēl-iddin/Rēmūtu//Atkuppu; C = Iddin-Nabû(/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu) (father of A)
Title: BM 77544

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: A receives from B on instructions of fC the interest on the 16 shekels of silver till the end of Šabāṭu (XI) of the 5th year that fD owes to fC. He further receives from B 6 1/8 shekels of silver on behalf of fD. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-mudammiq/Zēria//Egibi).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi (brother-in-law of A); fC = fṢirāya/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu (sister of A); fD = fTašmētu-damqa/Šumu-iddin (mother-in-law of A)
Title: VAT 96

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B owes A 10 kor of dates, the property (makkūru) of the god Bēl. He is to register (izuzzu Š) them in Ayyāru (II) on the writing board (lēˀu) of Bēl and give (proof of) it to A. 5 witnesses and the scribe (added after the dating) (Nabû-šumu-iškun/Lābāši).
 
A = Iddināya/Kalbāya; B = Iddināya/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 459

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a slave: B1 and fB2 sell fC to A for 2 ½ minas 5 shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. A clause follows concerning B1’s and fB2’s responsibility regarding possible claims (pūt pāqirāni) over fC2. The price includes 1 ½ minas of silver that B1 and fB2 owe to fD, for which fC was taken as security. A gives the promissory note (uˀiltu) of fD to B1 and fB2. 8 witnesses, fD as ina ašābi-witness, and the scribe (Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Egibi).
 
A = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Ēṭiru; B1 = Nidintu-Bēl/Niqūdu//Adad-šumu-ereš; fB2 = fKabtāya/Taqīš//Sîn-tabni-uṣur (mother of B1); fC = Ša-Ninlil-ūda (slave of B1 and fB2); fD = fṬābatu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Sîn-tabni (wife of A; cf. VAT184).
Title: VAT 147

Paraphrase:
Purchase of slave: fB sells fC to fA for 4 minas of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. This silver comes from fA’s dowry chest (quppu) that she gave to her mother, fB, from the 1st year of Darius. A clause follows concerning fB’s responsibility regarding legal implications about fC, such as lawsuits (pūt sihî), claims (pūt pāqirāni) and matters concerning the status of a royal slave woman (amat šarrūti) and free citizen (mār banûti). 4 witnesses and the scribe (Marduk-bēlšunu/Mušēzib-Marduk//[Sîn]-šadûnu?).
 
fA = fKusippitu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Rēˀi-sīsê; fB = fTabluṭu/Bēl-iddin/Rēˀi-sīsê (mother of fA); fC = fBānītu-rēˀûa (slave of fB)
Title: VAT 383

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates (heavily damaged): B owes fA [x kor of dates]. He is to pay it all in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the storehouse (haṣāru) in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI, together with 1 kor a load (of palm-frond ribs [huṣābu]), palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date-palm fibres (mangagu) and 1 container of pressed dates (darīku). [...] The ṣubātu and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are not paid. 2 witnesses and the scribe ([...]-Nabû//[...]).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = [...]/Niqūdu//Pappāya
Title: VAT 448

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B1 and B2 owe to A1 2 kor of dates, the remainder of the impost (imittu) of fA2 that is the debt of B1 and B3. They are to pay in Arahsamnu (VIII). 2 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-uballiṭ/Mušēzib-Bēl//Kalbi-Nanna). The location, Kār-Nabû, is further specified as nāru-ša-Ahhē-šullim. Addendum: They bear responsibility for each other.
 
A1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fA2 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Libluṭ/Arad-Gula//Egibi; B2 = Arad-Bēl/Rēmūtu//Sîn-dāˀin; B3 = Iddin-Bēl/Rēmūtu//Sîn-dāˀin
Title: VAT 446

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B owes to A1 30 kor of dates, impost (imittu) on the yield of the plot (ebūr eqli) in Kār-Tašmētu corresponding to the amount of fA2’s dowry (nudunnû). He is to pay in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the storehouse (haṣāru) in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI, together with palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), [date-palm fibres (mangagu)], 15 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and 1 container of pressed dates (darīku). An illegible clause excluding other items follows. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-nādin-šumi/Mušēzib-Marduk//Gahal [brother-in-law of A1]). Addendum: Another clause excluding 2;2.3 kor of dates of fC. 1 shekel of silver and 0.2 kor of dates are at the disposal of B.
 
A1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fA2 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi, wife of A1; B = Arad-Nergal/Nabû-muqqu-elip//Egibi; fC = Gigītu/[ Balāṭu//Egibi]
Title: VAT 500+

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house: A rents his house to B1 and B2 for monthly ½ and 1/24 of a shekel of silver until the end of Nisannu (I). They are to repair the drain (batqa ša asurrî ṣabātu) and make the additional payments (nūptu). They are to pay the rent monthly. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-šumu-iddin/Marduk-zēru-iddin). Addendum: The house it at the disposal of B1 and B2 from the 1st of Šabāṭu (XI).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B1 = Nabû-ttannu/Mušēzib-Marduk; B2 = Gūzānu/Mušēzib-Marduk
Title: VAT 128

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house: B rents his house to A, which is next to the no-through street (sūqu lā āṣû, la-ṣu-⌈ú⌉) and the thoroughfare of Nabû and Nanāya, for a yearly rent of 18 shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy for five years. A is to renew (šanû) the roof and carry out repairs (batqa ṣabātu). In Nisannu (I), Dûzu (IV) and Kislīmu (IX) he is to make additional payments (nūptu). However, he may charge (manû) to B any cost of his work on the bricks (libittu), the reeds (qanâtu and the roof (ūru) exceeding 1 shekel of silver. B is to deliver half of the payments at the beginning of the year and the remainder in the middle. The house will be at A’s disposal from the 1st of month [x] for five years. The tablet closes with a clause against transgression on pain of paying 1 mina of white silver. Addendum: each party has taken a copy. 6 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-uballiṭ/Rēmut-Bēl//Dābibī).
 
A = Bēl-eṭēri-Nabû/Būr-idrī; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 475

Paraphrase:
Obligation to bring tablet: B is to give to A the tablet concerning the exchange of real estate (qanâtu) with C (cf. VAT67), which bears drawings (ša ṣalmāni), by the 10th of Ulūlu (VI), 2nd year of Cyrus. In case the tablet is not handed over, B has to clear himself with an oath. Then it is stated that B gave a copy of said tablet to A. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Iddin-Bēl/Aqara//Sippê).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Lābāši/Kurbanni-Marduk//Šamaš-bāri; C = Bēl-rēmanni/Nabû-bēlšunu//Rab-banê
Title: VAT 129

Paraphrase:
Lease of prebendary duties: B performs on behalf of A the prebendary duties in the Išhara temple from the 18th to the 30th of Dûzu (IV) every year. In return he receives 1 gulīnu-garment [...], 1 lubāru-garment and 1 hullānu-cloth every year. B bears the responsibility of interruption (pūt baṭli) and inspection (pūt masnaqti) of [...]. An only partly legible clause follows saying that B shall not conume [...] the meat of the share of the meal table (paššūru) in Kislīmu (IX). 6 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-iqīšanni/Marduk-bēl-zēri//Šumu-libši). Addendum: Each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Libluṭ//Mudammiq-Adad; B = Šellebu/Iddināya(=Iddin-Nabû)//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 497

Paraphrase:
Additional payment in connection with purchase of singer’s prebend: B gives back to A (further) 2 shekels of silver, after he had bought the prebend before Išhara of the 8th of Nisannu (I), comprising rights to 1 head of an ox, 1 lā illû head of a sheep and the (non-choice?) lā illû habsurukku-joint, from A for the full price (i.e. 16 shekels of silver, cf. BM77551+). It is further stated that C was present as a witness at the drawing up of the purchase tablet (BM77551+), possibly as an appendix to the witness list of that tablet as he is not listed in the witness list there. 8 witnesses + 4 added afterwards, and the scribe (= A).
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Kidinnu(=Kidin-Marduk)//Bēl-eṭēri; B = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu; C = Erība-Marduk/Nabû-nāṣir//Bēl-eṭēri
Title: BM 77393

Paraphrase:
Lease of baker’s and brewer’s prebends: B gives the baker’s and brewer’s prebend to A for their performance (ēpišānūtu) on 3 days per month, scil. from the 21st to the 23rd day. The mealtimes (naptanu) will be at A’s disposal for 3 years from the 21st of Arahsamnu (VIII). A bears responsibility (pūtu) for the 2 prebends, the makkasu-dates, the guarding (maṣṣartu), the cleansing (ebēbu, ubbubu) of the pot stand (gangannu), the charcoal (pēntu) and the qeršu-cake, as well as any interruption (pūt baṭli) and inspection (pūt masnaqti). Furthermore he will supply good bread and sweet high-quality beer. He will check the rations (kurrummatu) and give them to x. From the maššartu of month x he will measure out (madādu, i-man-dad) 0;0.0.2 kor of barley as compensation for his losses (miṭītu). In one year’s time B will give 0;3.2 kor of makkasu-dates and 12 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) to A. Addendum: whoever transgresses the agreement hast to pay 10 shekels of silver. 1 witness and the scribe (Nabû-mukīn-apli//Šangû-Nergal).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-uballiṭ/Iqīšāya//Mudammiq-Adad
Title: VAT 106
Other markings Description: sealing in the centre of the lower edge with drawing left of it

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley rations: A receives (mahāru) from B1 3.2.3 kor of barley of the rations (kurrummatu) of fC from Šabāṭu (XI) of the 31st year (of Darius) to the end of Tašrītu (VII) of the 33rd year (of Darius) on the instructions of fC (ina našparti). This includes 0;2.3 kor from B2. Addendum: each party has taken a copy. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nidintu-Marduk//Rab-banê).
 
A = Iqīšāya/Iddin-Marduk//Rab-banê; B1 = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu (only mentioned by his first name; husband of fC); B2 = Bēl-ittannu/?//? (only mentioned by his first name; same as one witness Bēl-ittannu/Bēl-ibni//Rab-banê); fC = Hīptāya/Balāṭu//Rab-banê (only mentioned by her first name; wife of B1)
Title: BM 77418

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes 1 mina of cut silver of 1/8 alloy to A. Addendum/Rubrum: It is the credit against B. Witnesses broken off, the name of the scribe partly legible (Bēl-iq[īša?]/?//?).

A = Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-šumu-iškun/Nabû-nādin-šumi//Gaḫul
Title: VAT 2073

Paraphrase:
Hire of a person(?) (heavily damaged): The details of the contract cannot be reconstructed. 4 shekels of silver are mentioned and the wages of some person referenced, in connection with A, B [who takes(?)] responsibility for C, and with D. At least 3 witnesses, remainder lost.
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = [...]/Bēl-šumu-iddin; C = Bēl-ittannu; D = Artamišu
Title: VAT 2000

Paraphrase:
Receiprt for silver: A receives from B 55 shekels of silver from the outstanding promissory note (uˀiltu), that is capital plus interest, for 3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy for which C acts as guarantor. Each party has taken a copy. 6 witnesses, including one added later on, and [the scribe] (Marduk-tabtani-bulliṭ/Nabû-zēr-līšir//[...]).
 
A = Bēl-ušēzib/Ardia//Qaqqadānītu; B = Iddin-Bēl/Nabû-uṣuršu//Burāqu; C = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 381

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 11 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. He is to pay in Ayyāru (II) of the 23rd year of Darius. 5 witnesses and the scribe (Bulṭāya/Nabû-šumu-uṣur).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Aplāya/Damqa
Title: VAT 392

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A ½ mina 2 ½ shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina. He [is to pay] in Abu (V). 6 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-uṣur-napištu/Nabûnnāya).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Šākin-šumi/Nergal-zēru-ibni//Sîn-nāṣir
Title: VAT 143

Paraphrase:
Administrative document about ilku obligation(?) (heavily damaged): A, B, C, D, E are listed at the beginning of the tablet. [4? ...] ṭīpānu-men of A and [...] of 100 of F are mentioned in the following. (remainder of rev. uninscribed).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Guzānu/Ana-Bēl-useppe; C = Šulum-Bābili/Ana-Bēl-useppe (brother of B); D = Libluṭ/Iqīšāya//Bābūtu; E = Haddāya/Bēl-ušallim//Nappāhu; F = Ṭāb-[...] /(?)Šamaš-MU[...]
Title: VAT 2036(+)

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver: B pays A 18 ¼ shekels of silver, which is the remainder of a debt over 1 mina of silver for which A took fC as security. So the promisory note (uˀiltu) for 1 mina, which has been entrusted to D, belongs to B. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Iddin-Nabû//Sippê).
 
A = Habaṣīru/Tabnêa; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fC = fNanāya-bēlu-uṣrī (slave of B); D = Nabû-zēru-iqīša
Title: VAT 2055+

Paraphrase:
Purchase of slave: B sells C to A for 1 1/3 mina of silver. A clause follows concerning B’s responsibility regarding legal implications about C, such as lawsuits (pūt sihî), claims (pūt pāqirāni) and matters concerning free citizen status (pūt mār banûti). 4 witnesses and [the scribe] ([...]-Marduk/[...]//[...]). [Possible addendum lost].
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Nāˀid-Bēl/Arad-Bēl//Etellu; C = Atkal-ana-Bēl (slave of B)
Title: VAT 385

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates (damaged): fA is owed 6;4 kor of dates, impost of the harvest of the field in Kār-Nabû­-ša-ina-m[uhhi-nāri-ša]-Ahhē-šullim, by an illegible second party. (remainder of obv. and beginning of rev. lost) 2 witnesses legible and the scribe (Nabû-uṣuršu/Nabû-[...]//Rab-banê).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi
Title: VAT 2047

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates (damaged): B owes to fA [x kor] of dates, i[mpost (imittu) on her field in Kā]r-Tašmē[tu]. He is to pay it all in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the storehouse (haṣāru) in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI, together with 5 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu), 10 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), 10 date baskets (gipû) and 1 container of pressed dates (darīku). A clause excluding an earlier promissory note (uˀiltu) against B follows. 2 witnesses and the scribe whose name is not legible.
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = Iddin-Nabû/Zababa-iddin//Arad-Nergal
Title: VAT 502

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates (heavily damaged): (beginning of obv. lost) [It concerns the debt of B towards] fA1. B is to pay to A2 3 kor of dates in Arahsamnu (VIII) in Babylon. A damaged clause follows stating that A2 bears responsibility for the work (pūt dulli). 4 witnesses partly legible, [remainder of rev. lost].
 
fA1 = fIna-Esagil-ramât(written: [...-í]l-mat-ra) /Balāṭu//Egibi, wife of A2; A2 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Balāṭu/Nabû-bālti-ilī//Atkuppu
Title: VAT 2040

Paraphrase:
Lease of a house: A rents his house to B for yearly 18 shekels of white, unstamped cut silver of 1/8 alloy for two years. The house is next to those of C1 and C2. He is to renew (šanû) the roof (ūru) and repair (batqa ṣabātu) the drain (asurrû). In Nisannu (I), Dûzu (IV) and Kislīmu (IX) he is to make additional payments (nūptu). It is at his disposal from the 1st of Simānu (III). B may charge (manû) any costs for the work on the bricks, reeds and roof-beams in silver to A. A provides him with bricks, reeds and roof-beams for the repairs. A receives as the instalment from the beginning of the year 10 shekels of white cut silver. Addendum: Each party has taken a copy. 5 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-nāˀid/Nergal-ušallim/Kānik-bābi). Addendum: B may not charge to A the hire of a builder due to the altered rent.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Šāpik-zēri//Miṣirāya; C1 = Nabû-ittannu/Marduk-zēru-ibni//Esagilāya; C2 = Nanāya-iddin
Title: MMA 86.11.153

Paraphrase:
Fragment concerning price of excess land (heavily damaged): 2 ½ shekels of silver are the remainder of the price of excess reeds. Remainder of obv. and main part of rev. lost; only part of the filiation of the scribe is extant ([...]/[...]//Nappāhu). (possibly connected to BM92796 and VAT68)
 
No protagonists are legible.
Title: VAT 2008

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A ½ mina of silver. [remainder of obv. and beginning of rev. lost] Space for 1-2 witnesses and the scribe ([...]/Ina-tēšî-ēṭir).
 
A = Nabû-šumu-līšir/Zēru-ukīn//Ēṭiru; B = Lābāši/Kurbanni-Marduk//Šamaš-bāri
Title: VAT 1941

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with prebend as security: B owes to A 1 minas 3 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20%), which will commence with the 1st of Ayyāru (II) of the 28th year (of Darius) (scil. the following month). B’s prebend in the temple of Išhara is the security of A. 6 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-asûa/[Iddin-Nabû]//Atkuppu).
 
A = Ana-Bēl-upāqu/Šamaš-erība//Munnabittu; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 1895+

Paraphrase:
Purchase of prebend: B sells (nadānu) to A for 16 shekels of silver 1 head of ox and the lā illû (non-choice?) habsurukku-joint, and 1 head of sheep and the lā illû habsurukku-joint of his prebend in Ešasurra before Išhara of the 8th of Nisannu (I) for all time. The price is paid in full. Standard final clause excluding further litigation follows. 14 witnesses and the scribe (Nidintu-Bēl/Līširu//Bēl-ušumgal).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu; B = Marduk-rēmanni/Kidinnu(= Kidin-Marduk)//Bēl-eṭēri
Title: BM77551+

Paraphrase:
Lease of prebendary duties: A will give 0.2.2 kor of barley to B from the prebendary payment (maššartu). Every day B will give one šappu-bowl of barley beer to A. 1 witness and the scribe (Nabû-aplu-iddin/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Rab-banê).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Ina-qāt-Bēl-lumhur, slave of Iqīšāya
Title: VAT 481
Other markings Description: drawing on right-hand side of lower edge

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver (very damaged): A1 receives (mahāru) from B 2 minas of cut silver of 1/8 alloy [and x shekels of gold], of the dowry of his wife (aššatu, al-ti), A2. The whole dowry amounts to [x] minas of silver and 10+x shekels of golden jewellery (šukuttu); not including 5(?) shekels of gold. (Remainder of obv. and beginning of rev. lost.) 2 witnesses extant and the scribe ([Nabû-aplu-id]din/Nabû-mukīn-apli//[Pa]hāru).
 
A1 = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu; fA2 = Hīptāya/Balāṭu//Rab-banê; B = Ṭāb-ṣilli-Marduk/Balāṭu//Rab-banê
Title: BM 141782

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes ½ mina of cut silver of 1/8 alloy to fA. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel per mina. B and his brothers originally owed the silver to C, their creditor. D paid C on their behalf (ana muhhišu u ana muhhi ahhēšu). fA in turn paid D. The house of B, bordering on that of Libluṭ/Ibnāya//Asû, and his possessions (mimmašu gabbi) are pledged.
Three witnesses and the scribe (Ṭāb-ṣilli-Marduk//Rab-banê). According to the partly restored VAT1961+ fA is the mother of B and his brothers.
 
fA = fŠidatu/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāḫu; B = Bēl-šumu-iškun/Nabû-nādin-šumi//Gaḫul; C = Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu; D = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāḫu (brother of fA)
Title: VAT 145

Paraphrase:
Contract for brick making (heavily damaged): The heavily damaged operative section talks about making (labānu) [x amount of bricks] per day, contracted to A and possibly others. At least 4 witnesses and [the scribe?] (Mušēzib-[...]).
 
A = Š[ellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu]
Title: VAT 520

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: A receives from B 8 shekels white cut silver from the promissory note (uˀiltu) 1/3 mina 4 shekels of silver. Each party has taken a copy. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-[uṣur-napišti/]Nabû-zēru-līšir).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Ubāru/Dummuqu//Tunāya
Title: VAT 2100+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 10 shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears a monthly interest of 1 shekel per mina. B is to pay in Addāru (XII). 8 witnesses, including 1 added later on, and the scribe (Nabû-nādin-šú/Iddin-Bēl//Bāˀiru).
 
A = Mūrānu/Ibnāya; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 356

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 17 ½ shekels of white cut unstamped silver of 1/8 alloy. The indication of the exact month when B is to pay his debt is lost. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Mušallim-Marduk/Šūzubu//Kānik-bābi).
 
A = Lūṣi-ana-Nūr-Marduk/Marduk-erība//Egibi; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 144

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: A receives in payment from B on behalf of C the silver of the ṭīpu-payment (additional payment?) of the bow-obligation (ṭīpu ša qašti) from the end of Simānu (III) of the 3rd year of Darius till the end of Simānu (III) of the 6th year. C is to bring the earlier receipts (giṭṭu) to show them to A. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Marduk-nāṣir//Miṣirāya).
 
A = Rēmūtu/Marduk-šākin-šumi//Atkuppu; B = Ina-Esagil-zēri/Nergal-uballiṭ//Sagdidi; C = Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Marduku
Title: VAT 456

Paraphrase:
