Receipt of silver: B pays A 18 ¼ shekels of silver, which is the remainder of a debt over 1 mina of silver for which A took fC as security. So the promisory note (uˀiltu) for 1 mina, which has been entrusted to D, belongs to B. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Iddin-Nabû//Sippê).
 
A = Habaṣīru/Tabnêa; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fC = fNanāya-bēlu-uṣrī (slave of B); D = Nabû-zēru-iqīša
Title: BM 79305

Paraphrase:
Receipt for dates: B owes A 8;2 kor of dates with interest. A receives them and their interest according to B’s promissory note (uˀiltu). A clause against further promissory notes against B follows. A is to hand over the promissory note on the 2nd day of month [x] to B. 7 witnesses (1 witness added on the edge), and [the scribe] (Ea-iddin/Na[bû-ahhē-iddin//Šigûa).
 
A = Nergal-nāṣir/Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Pahāru; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: MM 883

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates (damaged): B owes [x kor of dates of the field of fA which she shares with C1] and fC2. He is to pay it all in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the storehouse (haṣāru) in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI, together with 1 kor a load (of palm-frond ribs), 15 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date-palm hearts (liblibbu), date-palm fibres (mangagu), date baskets (gipû) and 1 container of pressed dates (darīku). B is paid the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu, gugallūtu). 6(?) witnesses, remainder of rev. lost.
 
[fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi]; B = Niqūdu/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Pahāru; [C1 = Nabû-tabni-uṣur (brother of fA)(?)]; fC2 = fTabluṭu/Iddin-Nabû (daughter of fA)
Title: VAT 511

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates (heavily damaged): B owes to A [x.x].3 kor of dates. He is to pay [in Arahsamnu (VIII) ...]. [remainder of obv. and most of rev. lost]. No witnesses or scribe legible.
 
A = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Zababa-iddin//Arad-Nergal
Title: VAT 1939+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B owes to A 2;1 kor of dates, 10 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu), 1 container of pressed dates (darīku), the remainder of yield of the plot (ebūr eqli)  from the 11th year of Darius. He is to pay it in Arahsamnu (VIII) in [Babyl]on. B is paid the dates of corvée labour (dullu) and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu). A damaged passage follows concerning the witnessing of an illegible act in the 12th year of Darius and the statement against having cut [(something) ...] and that evidence thereof will be provided. [beginning of rev. lost] 2 witnesses extant and the scribe (Nabû-mukīn-apli//Šangû-Nergal).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Balāṭu/Nabû-bālti-ilī//Atkuppu
Title: VAT 354

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for supply of bricks: B delivers to A 110 bricks in Dûzu (IV). 1 witness and the scribe (Mūrānu/Bānia//Sîn-tabni).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Rihhētu, slave of [...]
Title: VAT 465

Paraphrase:
Plan of uban plot (damaged): The obverse speaks about measurements (mišhatu, meš-ha-at) of a plot of land near the Zababa Gate. A is mentioned. 2 2/3 shekels of silver are the price of excess sq. r. The reverse gives the ground plan of the plot with the south end, i.e. the right side of the tablet, damaged. The north end, whose upper side measures 15 ⌈5/6⌉(?) ammatu, borders on the house of B1; the western end, whose lower side measures ⌈16 2/3⌉(?) ammatu, borders on the house of B2; and the eastern end, whose upper side measures 16 ammatu, borders on a narrow through-street (sūqu qaṭnu āṣû). The total area amounts to 5;0.1.(13 ½) sq.r (ca. 64 m²) (possibly connected to BM92796 and VAT384).
 
A = [...]/Kurbanni-Marduk//[...]; B1 = Marduk-šumu-uṣur; B2 = [...]/[...]
Title: VAT 68

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: B owes A ½ mina of white silver and has given his house as security. A receives the money from C who has bought said house (cf. BM77513). A was present as a witness at the drawing up of the purchase tablet (A is not in the witness list of BM77513, but the first witness [Bēl-iddin/Nādin-ahi//Maštuk] and the scribe are). 2 witnesses and the scribe (Mušallim-Marduk/Šūzubu//Kānik-bābi).
 
A = Nabû-šumu-līšir/Zēru-ukīn//Ēṭiru; B = Lābāši/Kurbanni-Marduk//Šamaš-bāri; C = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 95

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with prebend as security: B owes to A 1 minas 3 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20%), which will commence with the 1st of Ayyāru (II) of the 28th year (of Darius) (scil. the following month). B’s prebend in the temple of Išhara is the security of A. 6 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-asûa/[Iddin-Nabû]//Atkuppu).
 
A = Ana-Bēl-upāqu/Šamaš-erība//Munnabittu; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: BM 77394
Other markings Description: In the centre of the upper edge ŠE.GA (“good”) is written in Old Babylonian script.

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document regarding the adoption of a grandson with bequest: A approaches B1 and fB2 with the request to adopt C, their 3-year-old son. They grant the request (šemû, iš-še-[mu-ú⌉) to A and give him C for adoption (ana mārûti). A makes over to C prebendary income, viz., the heads of purified sheep (immeru ubbubu), [the epigastrium? (karšu)], the allotment (isihtu) of sheep, [... ...] for the whole year, all that is before [Papsukkal] of Bīt-Bēlet-Eanna by the canal of Ešasurra before Išhara, and 1.1.4 kor planted and arable field, which is on the iltuk of the riv[er?] next to the property of Bēl-iddin//Arad-[Bēl/Nabû] and next to the nār-Kaldu, next to the Harru-ša-Ninurta. 5 witnesses “are present at the sealing”, and the scribe (Bāniya/Sūqāya//Bēl-eṭēri).
 
A = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Nergal-uballiṭ//Bēl-eṭēri; B1 = Kidin-Marduk/Iddin-Nabû//Bēl-eṭēri (son-in-law of A); fB2 = Ramûa/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Bēl-eṭēri (wife of B1; daughter of A); C = Marduk-rēmanni/Kidin-Marduk//Bēl-eṭēri (son of B1 and fB2)
Title: BM 77344

Paraphrase:
Lease of prebend regarding the food offerings of Išhara for two years: B will provide (nadānu) the meal (naptanu) of Išhara, which belongs to A, from the 1st of Ayyāru (II) of the 2nd year of Cyrus for 2 years. B bears the responsibility of interruption (pūt baṭli) and inspection (pūt masnaqti) of the bread and beer. In return A gives 2;3.2 kor of barley from the prebendary payment (maššartu) to B. 1 witness and the scribe (Libluṭ/Iqīšāya//Mudammiq-Adad). Addendum: A will deliver the barley in Esagil; each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Ina-qāt-Bēl-lumhur, slave of Iqīšāya
Title: VAT 1945+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes 1 mina of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy that is part of the dowry of fA2 to A1. B will pay (nadānu) the capital amount in 5 years. He pledges 2 sq. r of his house. 6 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-aplu-iddin/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Pahāru).
 
A1 = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu; fA2 = Hīptāya/Balāṭu//Rab-banê; B = Ṭāb-ṣilli-Marduk/Balāṭu//Rab-banê
Title: BM 77543

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (heavily damaged): B owes fA an unkown commodity. He is to pay it in Tašrītu (VII). 4 witnesses, including an oblate of Marduk (širku, širik Marduk) (Bēl-nāṣir/Nabû-ušallim), and the scribe ([...]-Bēl/[...//...]).
 
fA = f[...]/Ṣāṣiru//Ahiau; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: BM 77527

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: fA receives from B 9 shekels of white silver out of the promissory note (uˀiltu) for 2/3 mina of white silver against C. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Ahušunu/[...]//Rabâ-ša-Ninurta). Addendum: Each party has taken a copy.
 
fA = fEsagil-ramât/Lābāši-Marduk; B = Šellebu(/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu); C = Bēl-iddin/Marduk-šākin-šumi//Rab-banê (husband of fA)
Title: BM 77441

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for remaining silver: B owes A 10 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy, which is the remainder of the promissory note (uˀiltu) for 1 mina 10 shekels of silver. He is to pay in Nisannu (I). C vouches for the payment. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Nidintu/Bēl-iddin//Lēˀêa).
 
A = Bulṭāya/Šaddinnu//Nūr-Sîn; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; C = Bēl-ēreš/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Ileˀˀi-Marduk
Title: VAT 391

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 16 shekels of stamped silver for trading (nadānu u mahāru). 2 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-iddin/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Bēl-aplu-uṣur)
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Rēmūt-Nabû/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//Sîn-nāṣir[?...]
Title: VAT 136

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver (ilku) (damaged): For 6 months in the 10th year out of one bow-obligation (qaštu) of A1 and A2, A1 (?) [pays?] on behalf of B the service obligation (ilku). He received in payment from B the silver of [the service obligation (?)] out of the bow-obligation. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Iddin-Nabû/Š[ūzubu]//Kānik-bābi).
 
A1 = Šūzubu/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Bābūtu; A2 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Iddināya/[...] (= A2 ?)
Title: VAT 483

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B1, B2, B3, B4, B5, and B6 owe A 200 kor of dates. They are to pay it [by the end of Abu (V)] on [the river]. A conditional clause concerning failment to pay that is not entirely legible follows. At least 6 witnesses and [the scribe] (Erība-Marduk/[Nabû]-aplu-iddin//Rab-banê).
 
A = Nabû-uballiṭ/Nabû-[...]//Gahul; B1 = Bēl-ibni/Rēmūtu//Bābūtu; B2 = Arad-Bēl/Gūzānu//Tunāya; B3 = Bēl-ibni/Nabû-uṣuršu//Tunāya; B3 = Hašdāya/[Mušallim//Bābū]tu; B4 = Šellebu[/Bazūzu//]Bābūtu; B5 = [...]/[...]//[...]; B6 = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 513+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates (heavily damaged): B1, B2 (and possibly a third tenant) owe fA 12;2 kor of dates, impost of the harvest of her field in Kār-Nabû­-ša-ina-muhhi-nāri-ša-Ahhē-šul[lim]. [remainder of obv. and beginning of rev. lost]. No witnesses legible, the scribe (Nergal-šumu-ukīn/[...]//Egibi.
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B1  = [...]/[...]//Egibi B2 = Niqūdu/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Pahāru;
Title: VAT 1964+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates (damaged): B owes to fA 0;1.3 kor of dates, impost (imittu) on the harvest of fA’s field. He is to pay in [Arahsamnu (VIII)] in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI, together with [...] loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and [...]. The dates are the preferential share of fA with C. At least 3 witnesses and the scribe ([...]-Marduk/[...]//Rabi-ilia) legible.
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = Iddin-Nabû/Zababa-iddin//Arad-Nergal; C = Nabû-nādin-šumi[/Mušēzib-Marduk//Gahal; (cf. BM77600)]
Title: VAT 1999+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B owes to fA 2 kor of dates, the impost (imittu, imitti eqli) of 1 kor of land of fA’s in Kār-Tašmētu. He is to pay the entire 2 kor of dates in the storehouse (haṣāru) in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI in Arahsamnu (VIII); additionally 10 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), 10 (loads of palm frond ribs [huṣābu]), [x] date baskets (gipû) and 2 containers of pressed dates (darīku). The guard’s fee (kādu) and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are paid. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Nergal-šarrāni//Dābibī). Addendum: the land is dowry property of fA.
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = Balāṭu/Nabû-bālti-ilī//Atkuppu
Title: VAT 182

Paraphrase:
Cancellation of an agreement to rebuild a house: A and B annul their rental contract (for renovation) of A’s house. A may dispose of his house as he pleases. Addendum: Each party has taken a copy. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Marduk-ēṭir//Rab-banê).
 
A = Erība-Marduk/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Rab-banê; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu
Title: BAT 378

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with urban land as security: B owes fA 1/3 mina 4 shekels of silver by Tašrītu (VII). The built-on and unbuilt plots of land that B shares with D1 and D2 are security for it. A clause making all earlier promissory notes in the household of fA and C invalid and the property of B follows. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Lābāši-Marduk/Kurbanni-Marduk//Šamaš-bāri).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu/Egibi; B = Iqīšāya-Marduk/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu
C = Iddin-Nabû</Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu> (husband of fA); D1 = Bēl-ahhē-erība/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu (brother of B); D2 = Bēl-ēṭir/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu (brother of B)
Title: VAT 130

Paraphrase:
Purchase of house: A buys the house and hut (bītu epšu u huṣṣu) in the Šuanna district in Babylon of B (cf. for this house VAT98 and VAT67).  The price is 36.5 shekels of silver per sq. r., so A purchases the 5;0.0.10 sq. r for 3 minas 5 shekels of block silver and additional 6 shekels for the clothing of the mistress of the house (lu-bar-ri ša bēlet bīti); i.e. 3;11 minas of silver in total. The house comprises 2;0.2.4 sq. r on the upper side on the west, next to the house of C1, 2;0.1.3? sq. r (would be 2;0.2.4 according to VAT98 and VAT67) sq. r on the lower side on the east, next to the narrow through-street (sūqu qatnu āṣû), 2;0.1.3? sq. r (would be 2;0.1.6 according to VAT98 and VAT67) on the upper front on the north, next to the exit (mūṣû) of C1, and 2;0.1.6 sq. r on the lower front on the south, next to the house of C2 and next to the sq. r of the dowry (nudunnû) of fC3; i.e. a total of 5;0.0.10 sq. r. Clauses confirming the reception of the money and excluding further litigation on part of A’s party on pain of paying the price 12 times over follow. 6 witnesses ((ina kanāk ṭuppi), 1 ina ašābi-witness (fAmat-Ninlil, wife of B, who took 8 shekels of silver as a gift), and the scribe (Libūru/Nabûnnāya [same as in VAT67]). Fingernail impressions of B are in place of a seal.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Lābāši/Kurbanni-Marduk//Šamaš-bāri; C1 = Ṭāb-ṣilli-Marduk/Balāṭu//Rab-banê; C2 = Aššur-erība (AN.ŠÁR-eri-ba); fC3 = fLū-balṭāt/Nergal-ušallim//Egibi (cf. VAT98 which gives fLū-idiya/Marduk-ušallim//Egibi; and VAT67)
Title: BM 77513

Paraphrase:
Concerning purchase of prebend [only fragment]: The fragment concerns the (butcher’s) prebend and corresponding tablet of purchase of A from B (cf. BM77478+?). It contains a clause concerning the defense of the purchase by B against future disputes and claims. [Rest of tablet lost]
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Ana-Bēl-ēreš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk
Title: BM 77681

Paraphrase:
Receipt of gift of silver: A, messenger [mār šipri] of the ša-muhhi-bītāni, receives in payment (eṭēru) from C the gift  (qīštu) of (an unspecified amount of) silver of B. The tablet is sealed with a seal probably associated with the ša-muḫḫi-bīt­āni.
 
A = Šamaš-iddin/Uṣur-ilia (messenger [mār šipri] of the ša-muhhi-bītāni); B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; C = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 122
Other markings Description: 2 seals on the lower obverse and 1 on the left edge

Paraphrase:
Contract for performance of prebendary duties: The share of B1 of the prebend of B1 and B2 before Kāribu of the shrine of Marduk consisting of a monthly instalment of 4 large (rabbû) takkasû-cakes is at the disposal (ina muhhi) of A. Each month A will give the cakes of the rations (kurrummatu) to B1. B1 in return will give one uzāru-cloth to A. 7 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-nāṣir/Mudammiq-Nabû//Rab-banê).
 
A = Damqiya/Marduk-šumu-ibni/Isinnāya; B1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B2 = Šumu-iddin/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu (elder brother of B1);
Bibliography: Baker 2004, No. 39a; BV 70; NRV 594; van Driel 2002: 81
Title: VAT 358

Paraphrase:
Cancellation of promissory note: The promissory note (uˀiltu) for 2 minas of cut silver of 1/8 alloy, which is the price of muṣiptu-garment(s), that fA drew up (eˀēlu) against B, her husband, is to be broken (hepû), wherever seen, because fA did not pay B the money as stated in the promissory note (uˀiltu). The latter had been drawn up “as a statement of interest” (ana ṣibûtu). 5 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-aplu-iddin/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Pahāru).
 
fA = Hīptāya/Balāṭu//Rab-banê; B = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu
Title: MLC 1816

Paraphrase:
Obligation to swear an oath (heavily damaged): The heavily damaged operative section seems to deal with the obligation of A to swear an oath before Muštēšir-habli (the deified weapon of Marduk) by a certain date. A clause dealing with the penalty for failing to swear the oath is added. At least 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-šumu-imbi//[...]-Bēl).
 
A = [...]/Nādin
Title: VAT 519

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: A receives from B 1 mina of white silver out of the capital and interest from the promissory note (uˀiltu) for 2 minas 12 shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. Each party has taken a copy. 5 witnesses and [the scribe] (Erībāya/Saggilu//[...]). Addendum: B is thus clear of the entire [debt].
 
fA = fŠinbanâ/Arad-Gula//Irˀanni; B = Iddin-Bēl/Nabû-uṣuršu//Burāqu
Title: VAT 377

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B1 and B2 owe A 18 shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. They are to pay in Tašrītu (VII). 3 witnesses and the scribe (= B1).
 
A = Nabû-uballiṭ/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Sîn-šadûnu; B1 = Nidintu-Marduk/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Rab-banê; B2 = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: BM 78102

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B1 and B2 owe A [x shekels of si]lver which is the credit owed by C. They are to pay in Šabāṭu (XI). Each party has taken a copy. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Qīšti-Marduk/Šūzubu//Kānik-bābi).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B1 = Nabû-zēru-iddin/Nabû-ušallim//Irˀanni; B2 = Iddia/Nabû-ušallim//Irˀanni (brother of B1); C = Nabû-ušallim//Irˀanni (father of B1 and B2)
Title: VAT 121

Paraphrase:
Debt note concerning ilku (damaged): 1/3 mina of cut silver of 1/8 alloy which is a third of a bow-obligation (qaštu) till the end of Ṭebētu (X) of the 9th year of Darius and the service obligation (ilku) of B are mentioned. A1, A2 and B(?) are mentioned following the introduction of the subject of the tablet, whose roles are unclear due to the broken context. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Bazūzu/Iqīšāya//Bābūtu).
 
A1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; A2 = [...]/Bēl-useppe//[Bābūtu]; B = Šūzubu/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Bābūtu
Title: VAT 453

Paraphrase:
Attestation of witnessing the sale of a slave: The tablet records that A was present as witness among the elders (lúab-bameš) at the drawing up of the tablet in which fD was sold to fB by fC. 4 witnesses, including the maternal uncle of fB (Iqīšāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu) and the brother of fB (Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi), and the scribe (Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-parakki).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Šulāya//Rab-banê (oldest son of fC); fB = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; fC = Nūptāya/Nāˀid-Marduk//Bābūtu; fD = fNanāya-bēlu-uṣrī
Title: VAT 100

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B owes A 1 kor of dates. He is to pay it in Kislīmu (IX) in Babylon on the river. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-bullissu/Nabû-napišti-uṣur//Asû).
 
A = Bēl-ana-mērehti/Bēl-nādin-apli//Ša-nāšišu; B = Erībāya/Iddināya//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 365

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates (damaged): B1 and B2 owe to fA [x amount of dates]. [They bear responsibility for] each other and [whoever] will be at hand [is to pay the debt, together with a load of] palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), [...] 1 container of pressed dates (darīku). The šissinnu and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) [are not paid(?)]. At least 3 witnesses, remainder of rev. lost.
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Niqūdu/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Pahāru; B2 = Mukīn-zēri/Hambaqu//Mutakkilu
Title: VAT 2075

Paraphrase:
Receipt for dates: A receives from C on behalf of fB 1;4 kor dates out of a debt owed to fB by C which amounts to 4;2.3 kor(?). These are the capital amount and interest of the harvest of fB’s field from the 23rd year. Addendum: each party has taken a copy. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Šulum-Bābili/Zababa-pirˀ-uṣur).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu; fB = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu; C = Iddin-Nabû/Zababa-iddin//Arad-Nergal
Title: VAT 393

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B owes to A 1 kor of dates. He is to pay in Arahsamnu (VIII) in Kār-T[ašmēt]u. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Mušēzib-Marduk/Aplāya//Šangû-Adad).
 
A = Iddināya/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-bālti-ilī//Atkuppu
Title: VAT 1922+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes to A 2/3 mina of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. He is to pay it back in Addāru (XII) of the 23rd year. B’s house is the security for A until he is paid back (eṭēru, in-ni-ṭi-ru). 5 witnesses and the scribe ([...]/[...]//Gahul).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu; B = Erībāya/Iddināya//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 1963+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes to fA 1/3? mina 6 ½ shekels of [white silver] by Ulūlu (VI). 3 witnesses and the scribe ([Mušallim-Marduk/Š]ūzubu[//Kānik-bābi]).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu/Egibi; B = Iqīša-Marduk/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 518

Paraphrase:
Exchange of houses: A and B exchange houses in the Šuanna district of Babylon. A’s house comprises 2;0.2.4 sq. r on the upper side on the west, next to the house of A, 2;0.2.4 sq. r on the lower side on the east, next to the narrow through-street (sūqu qatnu āṣû), 2;0.1.6 sq. r on the upper front on the north next to the exit (mūṣû) of C1, and 2;0.1.6 sq. r on the lower front on the south, next to the house of C2 and next to a property belonging to the dowry of (nudunnû) of fC3; i.e. a total of 5;0.0.10 sq. r (cf. VAT98). B’s house comprises 3;0.3.(3+5/6) sq. r on the upper side on the west, next to the narrow no-through street (sūqu qatnu lā āṣû), the exit of the houses, 3;.0.2.8 sq. r on the lower side on the east, next to the house of C4, 3 sq. r on the upper front on the north, next to the narrow no-through street, and 3;.0.0.14 sq. r on the lower front on the south, next to the house of C5 (= total of 10;0.3.7 sq. r). Since B’s house is almost double the size of A’s, A pays 2/3;4 minas of silver per sq. r. Thus A pays 3;58 minas of block silver and additional 8 shekels for the clothing of the mistress of the house (<lu>-ba-ri ša bēlet bīti); i.e. 4;6 minas of silver in total. The document closes with the usual final: the money was received, further litigation on part of the party of B is excluded on pain of paying the price 12 times over, each party has taken a copy. 6 witnesses (ina kanāk ṭuppi), 1 ina ašābi-witness (fAmat-Ninlil, wife of B), and the scribe (Libūru/Nabûnnāya). Fingernail impressions of B are in place of a seal.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Nabû-bēlšunu//Rab-banê; B = Lābāši/Kurbanni-Marduk//Šamaš-bāri; C1 = Balāṭu/Kurbanni-Marduk//Rab-banê; C2 = Bēl-šumu-iškun/Nabû-zēru-ušabši//Atû; fC3 = fLū-idiya/Nergal-ušallim//Egibi (but cf. VAT98 which gives: fLū-idiya/Marduk(!)-ušallim//Egibi); C4 = Erībāya/Marduk-šumu-uṣur; C5 = Šamaš-šumu-līšir/Nādin//Pahāru
Title: VAT 67

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver, price of a butcher’s prebend: fA1 receives (mahāru) 3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy from B, which is the price of the butcher’s prebend in Ešasurra, the temple of Išhara, that C sold to him (as it was made known [edû Š] in BM77478+). fA1 returns to B the corresponding promissory note (uˀiltu; cf. BM77521) and the tablet concerning the dispute over the prebend with D (cf. BM77417). 10 witnesses extant; indication of scribe and dating lost.
 
fA1 = Kabtāya/Damqiya; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; C = <Ana->Bēl-ereš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk; D = Bēl-iddin/Nergal-ušēzib//Ileˀˀi-Marduk
Title: BM 77541

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for remainder of the price of a prebend: B owes to A 15 shekels of white silver of 1/8 alloy, which is the remainder of the price of a prebend of A. In Nisannu (I) B is to pay up. Apart from the 15 shekels he is to also pay 4 shekels of silver to C. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-rēmanni//Rab-banê).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Mušēzib-Marduk/Šamaš-pirˀ-uṣur//Eppēš-ilī; C = Gula-zēru-ibni.
Title: VAT 133

Paraphrase:
Lease of prebendary duties: A1 leases (nadānu) to B the prebendary duties concerning takkasû-cakes each month for 17 days before Kāribu in Esagil, the temple of Marduk. The prebend belongs to A1 and A2. Each month, starting with the 1st of Addāru (XII), B will take (našû) 6 cakes from Esagil for A1. Addendum: Each has taken a copy.
 
A1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; A2 = Šumu-iddin/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu (elder brother of A1); B = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ahiyaūtu
Title: VAT 352

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver, the price of muṣiptu-garment(s): B owes 2 minas of white silver of 1/8 alloy without interest, which is the price of muṣiptu-garment(s), to fA. But fA will not receive the money from B for 15 years. When B receives (mahāru[?], i-di-har) the silver for fA, he will pay (nadānu, i-na-da-áš-šú) fA the capital amount without interest. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nidinti-Bēl/Līširu//Bēl-ušumgal).
 
fA = Hīptāya/Balāṭu//Rab-banê; B = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu (husband of fA; cf.  MLC1816)
Title: BM 77385

Paraphrase:
Contract for supply of timber: B is to deliver to A 3 good-quality beams (gušūru) at the end of Ayyāru (II) at the dam of Kār-Tašmētu. These 3 beams comprise 2 good-quality, thick (šapṣu, šepṭūtu), trimmed (gaṣṣūtu) beams of similar girth (tāpalu), 2/3 cubit in width, one of which is 10 cubits long for a gate-support(?) (bāb išdu), and the other, a middle beam (qablû) 5 cubits long, plus 1 hewn(?) (hubû) beam 8 cubits long. A is to pay B 0;1 kor of dates. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Ea-iddin/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Šigûa).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Libluṭ/Nabû-šar-ahhēšu//Damiqu
Title: VAT 386

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver (heavily damaged): A is owed 3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy, by whom is unknown. [remainder of obv. and witness list on rev. lost] the scribe (Muraššû/[...]//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili).
 
A = Bēl-ušēzib/Ardia//Qaqqadānītu
Title: VAT 2006

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with interest: B owes A 1 mina 10 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears a yearly interest of 6 shekels of silver per mina. 7 witnesses and the scribe (Širiktu-Marduk/Rēmūtu//Bābūtu).
 
A = Bulṭāya/Šaddinnu//Nūr-Sîn; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 355

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A [x mi]nas 6 ½ shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears monthly interest of 1 shekel per mina. He is to pay it in Arahsamnu (VIII). 1 witnesses and the scribe (Qīšti-Marduk/Šūzubu//Kānik-bābi).
 
A = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Bēl-aplu-iddin//Saggilāya; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāh
Title: VAT 120

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: A receives in payment from B [x] shekels of silver as the property of the bow-troops (makkūr ṣābē ša qašti) from Abu (V) till Ṭebētu (X) of the 5th year of Cambyses. [break of ca. 1 ½ lines] Addendum: Each party has taken a copy. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-nādin-šumi/Mušēzib-Marduk//Gahal).
 
A = Nabû-nādin-šumi/Mušēzib-Marduk//Gahal; B = Bēl-iddin/Kūnāya//Ahu-bani
Title: VAT 463

Paraphrase:
Obligation to produce a witness to a transaction: A1 and A2 are to have B preside (ašābu Š) as witness (mukinnûtu) to fD’s purchase document (uˀiltu) of fC, as B raises claim (ana paqāri alāku) with E over fC (cf. VAT93). A clause in case of non-compliance on pain of paying 1 mina 12 shekels of silver and 1 kor of barley follows. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Libūru/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Nabûnnāya).
 
A1 = Šamaš-pirˀ-uṣur/Nāˀid-Marduk//Bābūtu; A2 = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Šulāya/Rab-banê; B = Iddin-Nabû/Šulāya/Rab-banê; fC = fNanāya-bēl-uṣrī (slave of fD); fD = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; E = Iddināya (= Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu, husband of fD)
Title: VAT 94

Paraphrase:
Memorandum for the receipt of barley: A receives from C 0;4.1 kor of barley owed by B. (No witnesses or scribe given).
 
A = Iddināya; B = Qīštia; C = Bēl-kāṣir
Title: VAT 466

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) of dates: B1 and B2 owe to fA 12 kor of dates, impost (imittu) of the fie[ld in  Kār-Nabû]­-ša-ina-muhhi-nāri-ša-Ahhē-šul[lim]. They are to pay it all in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the storehouse (haṣāru), in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI. For each 1 kor of dates, a load of palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date-palm fibres (mangagu), a load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and 1 container of pressed dates (darīku) are to be delivered. They bear responsibility for each other and whoever will be at hand is to pay. The šissinnu and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are not paid. 3 witnesses, including the uncle of fA (Silim-Bābu/Ibnāya//Egibi), and the scribe (Bēl-ittanu/Nabû-uballiṭ//Kutimmu).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Niqūdu/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Pahāru; B2 = Mukīn-zēri/Hambaqu//Mutakkilu
Title: VAT 364

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B owes to fA 6 kor of dates, impost (imittu) on the harvest of fA’s field in Kār-Tašmētu. He is to pay it all in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the storehouse (haṣāru) in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI, together with 1 kor loa[ds of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu)], date baskets (gipû), date-palm fibres (mangagu) and 1 container of pressed dates (darīku). At least 4 witnesses, and the scribe(?) (Bēl-ēṭir/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Dābibī) – although without such designation.
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = Iddin-Nabû/Zababa-iddin//Arad-Nergal
Title: VAT 504

Paraphrase:
guard’s fee (kādu) and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu), 15 loads of palm frond ribs (huṣābu) and 17 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu) out of 17 kor of dates from the yield of the plot (ebūr eqli) that C owes to fB. On instructions of fB he receives it from D on behalf of C. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-ahhē-iqīša/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi). Addendum: his šissinnu has not been paid.
 
A = Šākin-šumi/Nadnāya//Nappāhu; fB = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi, wife of Iddin-Nabû; C = Balāṭu/Nabû-bālti-ilī (gardener [nukaribbu] of fB); D = Šamaš-iddin/Nabû-zēru-iqīša//Balāṭu
Title: VAT 102

Paraphrase:
Lease of building with obligation to supply bread (damaged): (beginning of obv. lost) fA rents a building for 3 years to an unknown second party. They are to renew (šanû) the roof (ūru) and repair the drain (asurrû). They also must not interrupt the bread deliveries (baṭlu ša akali). 2 witnesses legible, remainder of rev. lost.
 
fA = [...]//Aqara
Title: VAT 2048

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver interest: A receives from B 4 shekels of silver from the interest on a promissory note (uˀiltu) for ½ mina of silver. Addendum: Each party has taken a copy. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-iddin/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Ahu-bani).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Iqīšāya-Marduk/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 125

Paraphrase:
Division of a house: B inherits from A2 part of the jointly inherited house of 12 sq. of A1 and A2, after the latter had passed away (šīmtu abālu, u-bil-lu). In the 6th year of Cyrus B and A1 divide the house, with the following shares of B: 16 cubits 4 fingers on the upper side on the west, next to the house of A1, 16 cubits 4 fingers on the [lo]wer [side] on the east, next to the narrow through-street (sūqu qatnu āṣû), 15 cubits 6 fingers on the upper front on the north [next to the ex]it (mūṣû) of B2, 15 cubits 6 fingers on the [lower front] on the south, next to the house of D1 and next to plot [of the dowry of (nudunnû)] of fD2; i.e. a total of 5 square reeds 10 square fingers (ca. 62 m²). The rest, as little or much there is, together with the exit-way belong to A1. Addendum: A1 has no outstanding credits against A2 or C, so the agreement is not to be altered (enû). Each party has taken a copy. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-zēru-iqīša/Nabû-bēlšunu//Rab-banê).
 
A1 = Balāṭu/Kurbanni-Marduk//Rab-banê; A2 = Gimillu/Kurbanni-Marduk/Rab-banê (brother of A1); B = Bēl-rēmanni/Nabû-bēlšunu//Rab-banê; C = Etellu (his relation to r A2 is not further specified) D1 = Bēl-šumu-iškun/Nabû-zēru-ušabši//Atû; fD2 = fLū-idiya/Marduk-ušallim//Egibi
Title: VAT 98

Paraphrase:
Dispute over purchase of butcher’s prebend: B raises a claim on the butcher’s prebend before Išhara that C bought from A2 (cf. BM77478+) and regarding which fA1 drew up a promissory note (uˀiltu) over 3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy (cf. BM77521). fA1 pays B 1 mina of white silver to settle the dispute. A clause against further litigation follows, including the return of the 1 mina of silver to fA1 and this tablet to B in case of further claims. 7 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-iqīša/Šumu-iddin//Lēˀêa).
 
fA1 = Kabtāya/Damqia; A2 = Ana-Bēl-ēreš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk; B = Bēl-iddin/Nergal-ušēzib//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; C = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: BM 77417

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for remainder of the price of a prebend: B owes to A 15 shekels of white silver of 1/8 alloy, which is the remainder of the price of a prebend of A. In Nisannu (I) B is to pay up. Apart from the 15 shekels he is to also pay 4 shekels of silver to C. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-rēmanni//Rab-banê).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Mušēzib-Marduk/Šamaš-pirˀ-uṣur//Eppēš-ilī; C = Gula-zēru-ibni.
Title: VAT 132

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with prebend as security: B1 and fB2 owe 5/6 mina of silver of 1/8 alloy to A. The debt will bear a yearly interest of 12 shekels of silver per mina (20 %). They pledge the prebend of Kāribu of the gate of the shrine of Marduk as security. No one else has right of disposal (šalāṭu) over the prebend as long as the debt towards A stands. B1 and fB2 vouch for each other. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Bānûnu/Nabû-ēṭir//Rab-banê). Addendum: Previous promissory notes (scil. DCEPHE435 and VAT97) of A against B1 are invalid (hepû, huppû).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nādin//Nappāhu; fB2 = fMaqartu/Nabû-ēṭir//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 113

Paraphrase:
Rescinding of gift of slave: fA took pity (rēmu rašû) on her sons and returns (turru) C. Before, fA had promised C to fB1 along with 0.3.2 kor of planted land in Nabātu (cf. VAT109). Now neither fB1 nor fB2 will have the right of disposal (šalāṭu) over C. But they still have the right to the 1 kor of land of fA. 2 ina ašabi-witnesses, fB1 and fB2, 5 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-iddin/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ//Ea-pattannu). Addendum: each party has taken a copy.
 
fA = fKaššāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu; fB1 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi (elder daughter of fB); fB2 = fAmat-Ninlil/Balāṭu//Egibi (younger daughter of fB);  C = Bēl-silim/fŠeleppūtu (cf. VAT109)
Title: VAT 112

Paraphrase:
Fragment of indeterminable content: A is mentioned in connection with a load (biltu) of an unkown commodity. The operative section is too fragmentary to determine its content. 3 witnesses and the scribe ([...]/Nabû-nādin-šumi//[...]).
 
A = Dihummu/Handašānu//Ileˀˀi-Marduk
Title: VAT 1959+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 1 mina 8 shekels of white unstamped cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina starting on the 1st of [...]. The clause when the debt is to be paid is not legible. 7 witnesses and the scribe (Uballissu-Marduk/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Ēṭiru).
 
A = Šellebu/Bazūzu//Bābūtu; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 361+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with interest: B owes A 1 mina 10 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears a yearly interest of 6 shekels of silver per mina. 7 witnesses and the scribe (Širiktu-Marduk/Rēmūtu//Bābūtu).
 
A = Bulṭāya/Šaddinnu//Nūr-Sîn; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: BM 77391

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 18 shekel of silver. He is to pay in Nisannu (I). 2 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-erība/Rēmūt-Bēl//Zannētu).
 
A = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 99

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver (ilku): On the 15th day fB is to pay to A 12 shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy as the service obligation (ilku) of D till the end of Tašrītu (VII) (?) of the 11thyear of Darius, for the payment of which C guarantees. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Šangû-parakki).

A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fB = fTabluṭu/Iqīšāya//Bābūtu; C = Hambāqu/Ina-Bēl-ultarrah; D = Libluṭ/Iqīšāya//Bābūtu (brother of fB)
Title: VAT 183

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a slave: fB sold fC and her month-old son to fA for 1 mina 12 shekels of silver. A clause follows concerning D1’s and D2’s responsibility for fC2, in the case of lawsuits (pūt sihî), vindication (pūt pāqirāni) and claims for the status of a royal slave (amat šarrūti) and freedom (mār banûti). 3 witnesses and the scribe (Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Balāssu//Bēl-eṭēri). Addendum: fB has received payment.
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; fB = Nūptāya/Nāˀid-Marduk//Bābūtu; fC = fNanāya-bēl-uṣrī; D1 = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Šulāya/Rab-banê (son of fB); D2 = Pirˀu/Nāˀid-Marduk//Bābūtu (brother of fB)
Title: VAT 93

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B owes A 2;2 kor of dates. He is to pay in Arahsamnu (VIII). C vouches for the payment. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-nādin-ahhi/Tēšî-ēṭir//Ša-ṭābtišu).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Šumu-ukīn(?)/Taqīš-Gula; C = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Tēšî-ēṭir
Title: VAT 455

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) of dates: B1 and B2 owe to fA 12 kor of dates, impost (imittu) of the fie[ld in  Kār-Nabû]­-ša-ina-muhhi-nāri-ša-Ahhē-šul[lim]. They are to pay it all in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the storehouse (haṣāru), in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI. For each 1 kor of dates, a load of palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date-palm fibres (mangagu), a load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and 1 container of pressed dates (darīku) are to be delivered. They bear responsibility for each other and whoever will be at hand is to pay. The šissinnu and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are not paid. 3 witnesses, including the uncle of fA (Silim-Bābu/Ibnāya//Egibi), and the scribe (Bēl-ittanu/Nabû-uballiṭ//Kutimmu).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Niqūdu/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Pahāru; B2 = Mukīn-zēri/Hambaqu//Mutakkilu
Title: VAT 363

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for palm-frond ribs: B owes to A 6 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu). He is to pay it all in Arahsamnu (VIII). 2 witnesses and the scribe (Nidintu/Nādin).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû(//Nappāhu); B = Iddin-Nabû/Zababa-iddin(//Arad-Nergal)
Title: VAT 478

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver and dates: fB owes A 1/3 mina of white silver of 1/8 alloy and 4 kor of dates. She is to pay in Arahsamnu (VIII). 2 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-ittannu//Esagilāya).
 
A = Bēl-ēreš/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; fB = fNūptāya/Habaṣīru//Egibi
Title: VAT 373

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with house as antichretic pledge: B1, B2 and B3 owe to fA 1 1/3 min of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. Their house next to those of C1 and C2 is antichretically pledged as security to fA for two years. After they pay her she will relinquish the house. In the meantime she is to have the drain (asurrû) repaired (batqa ṣabātu) and roof (ūru) renewed (šanû). The house is at fA’s disposal from the 17th of Arahsamnu (VIII). 3 witnesses and the scribe (Iddin-Bēl/Nabû-ēṭir//Šangû-Ninurta).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Bēl-iddin//Irˀanni (brother of B2 and B3); B2 = Nidintu/Bēl-iddin//Irˀanni (brother of B1 and B3); B3 = Erībāya/Bēl-iddin//Irˀanni (brother of B1 and B2); C1 = Balāṭu; C2 = Munahhiš-Marduk/Nabû-kāṣir//Asû
Title: VAT 105

Paraphrase:
Receipt for payment of purchase price of excess area of house: A buys from B the area of the bought house exceeding 5 sq. r after the surveying (mišhatu, mi-iš-ha-tu4) in the amount according to B’s share (cf. BM92796). 2 witnesses and the scribe (Tabnêa//Nūpu).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Bēl-ahhē-erība/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 384

Paraphrase: Administrative list concerning disbursements from the temple of Išhara: 20 kor of barley for bread and beer, 32 kor of barley for oxen, 19 kor of barley for sheep, 9.2.3 kor of barley for lambs, 6.1.4 kor of barley for birds are listed. A total of 84.4.1 kor of barley of the temple of Išhara is given, although the total should be 86.4.1. (Rev. uninscribed).
Title: VAT 461

Paraphrase:
Concerning payment of price of butcher’s prebend: B2 assumes half a share of the payment of 3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy, the price for the prebend before Išhara, that fA charged against B1 (cf. BM77521 and BM77478+).  5 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-ittannu/Arad-Bēl//Šarru-teṣlītu).
 
fA = Kabtāya/Damqiya; B1 = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B2 = [?]/Nergal-ušallim//Qaqqadānītu
Title: BM 77413

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with prebendary income as security: B owes 10 shekels of silver of 1/8 alloy to A. A takes B’s prebendary bowls (malâtu) of 0;0.0.2 kor in total before the golden vats (dannūt hurāṣi) in Esagil as security until he receives (šalāmu) his 10 shekels. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel per mina (20%). 3 witnesses and the scribe (Esagil-mukīn-apli/Balāṭu//Egibi, brother-in-law of A). 
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nādin//Nappāhu
Title: DCEPHE 435

Paraphrase:
Division of inheritance consisting of prebends: A1 and A2 divide temple enterer’s (ērib bīti) prebends. The income consists of 0;0.0.4 of bread, 0;0.0.4 of fine beer and the sheep of the eclipses before Sîn of Egišnugal. The share of A1 is 5/6 of the prebend before Kāribu of the shrine of Marduk and the vats of fine beer before Zāriqu. The share of A2 is 3 qa of bread, 3 qa of fine beer before Išhara and 1/6 of the prebend before Kāribu of the shrine of Marduk.The one who performs the office of priest (šangû) shall enjoy the income(?)of his prebend (pānāt isqu). They also shall observe the kinayyātu-offerings of their father according to their share. 5 witnesses and the scribe (Esagil-šumu-ukīn/Iqīšāya/Ēṭiru). Addendum: each party has taken a copy so that the agreement would not be altered
 
A1 = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; A2 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: BM 92792

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: fB owes 8 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy to A, at 20% interest p.a. (1 shekel of silver per mina per month). fB pledges part of her dowry, land (zēru) in Kār-Tašmētu. 4 badly preserved witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-nādin-ahi/Bēl-uballiṭ//Egibi).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fB = Amat-Ninlil/Balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 77581

Paraphrase:
Adoption agreement with bequest of promissory notes: B transfers (dagālu) a total of 3 ½ minas 5 shekels of silver in promissory notes, the credit of B in circulation (ina sūqi), to his adoptive son A. After one year A will give (nadānu) 2 kor of barley, 4 vats of fine beer and 1 gulīnu-garment to B (in fulfilment of his duty) as a son (ša mārūti). B is to hand over to A the promissory notes for the 3 ½ minas 5 shekels of silver. B will enjoy the interest on the silver in his lifetime. The promissory notes are the following:
1 mina 10 shekels of silver owed by C1, for which B took (ṣabātu) his house as security, in which B lives;
50 shekels of silver owed by C2;
1/3 mina of silver owed by C3;
15 shekels of silver owed by C4;
15 shekels of silver owed by C5;
10 shekels of silver owed by C6;
½ mina 5 shekels of silver owed by C7, which was drawn up (eˀēlu) in the name of fC8.
4 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Bēl-ušallim//Sîn-tabni). Addendum: each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu; C1 = Bēl-aplu-iddin/Dādia/Rab-banê (cf. VAT51 for filiation); C2 = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi; C3 = Lâbâši; C4 = Kalbāya, the weaver; C5 = Nabû-ušallim; C6 = Iddin-Nabû, the Borsippean(?); C7 = Nabû-šumu-iddin; fC8 = fTappaššar (wife of B; cf. Baker 2004, 32f.)
Title: VAT 116

Paraphrase:
Lease of boat: B leases to A the boat that is at his disposal for captaincy (malāhūtu) from C for a daily rent of 1 shekel of silver, beginning on the 28th day (of Arahsamnu [VIII]). Each party has taken a copy. 3 witnesses, including the cousin of A (Nabû-kuṣuršu/Nādin//Gahal), and the scribe (Nidintu-Marduk//Rab-banê) (brother-in-law of A).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Nergal-iddin/Ardia; C = Nabû-uṣuršu
Title: VAT 375

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 1/3 mina of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. C vouches for the payment of the debt. The tablet further states that from Simānu (III) of the 28th year the capital will increase monthly (ina arhi qaqqadu ir[ab]bi). 6 witnesses and the scribe (Marduk-šumu-iddin/[...]//[S]în-šad[ûnu])
 
A = Kuṣurāya/Šaddinnu//Eppeš-ilī; B = Nergal-uballiṭ/Arad-Gula//Irˀanni; C = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: BM 77446

Paraphrase:
Obligation to produce receipts: B swears to A by Bēl, Nabû and Darius, the king, that he will bring the receipts (giṭṭu) to show them to A by the 2nd Tašrītu (VII). If he does not he is to pay the silver according to his promissory note (uˀiltu). 2 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-bullissu//Rab-banê).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Zababa-iddin[//Arad-Nergal]
Title: VAT 450

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 5 shekels of silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears yearly interest of 12 shekels of silver per mina. A clause excluding a previous promissory note (uˀiltu) for 10 shekels of silver follows. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-nāṣir/Esagil-šadûnu//Sîn-tabni-uṣur).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nādin/Nappāhu
Title: VAT 97

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver (ilku): A receives from B 1/3 mina 8 shekels of white silver as the service obligation (ilku) of C1 and C2 till the end of Ayyāru (II) of the 19th year. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-udammiq//Egibi). Addendum: Each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Arad-Bēl/Gūzānu//Tunāya; C1 = Gūzānu/Bēl-useppe//Bābūtu; C2 = Šulum-ana-Bābili/Bēl-useppe//Bābūtu (brother of C1)
Title: VAT 241

Paraphrase:
Revocation of the purchase of a slave: The chief judge (sartennu) and the judges (dajānu) revoke the purchase of C by A from B for 2 minas 15 shekels of silver. After the purchase the slave was given to the house of a Persian (ša bīt parsāyi) of the household of D, who sent him back (to B?). A receives the 2 minas 15 shekels of silver and its interest and he returns the pertaining documents (uˀiltu) to B. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Marduk-šumu-ibni/Bēl-aplu-iddin//Egibi).
 
A = Habaṣīru/Tabnêa; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; C = Nabû-ittannu; D = Marduk-šāpik-zēri
Title: VAT 127

Paraphrase:
Promissory note(?) for dates (heavily damaged): [x] amount of dates is mentioned in connection with A. [remainder of obv. lost]. No witnesses are legible, the scribe (Iddin-[Bēl/Aqara]//Sippê).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 1944

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B owes to fA [x kor] of dates, [impost (imittu) of the field in K]ār-Nabû-ša-ina-muhhi-nāri-ša-Ahhē-šullim, her preferential share with C. [remainder obv. broken] 4 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-ahu-iddin/[...]//[...]-PAB).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi, wife of Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Nabû-ittannu/[...]; C = Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi (brother of fA)
Title: VAT 322

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B owes to fA1 and fA2 5 kor of dates, impost (imittu) on the harvest of their field. He is to pay in Arahsamnu (VIII) together with 10 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and 10 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu). 2 witnesses and the scribe (Iddin-Bēl//Burāqu). Addendum: the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) [is] un[pa]id.
 
fA1 = fEsagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; fA2 = fGigītu/Balāṭu//Egibi (sister of fA1); B = Iddin-Nabû/Zababa-iddin//Arad-Nergal
Title: VAT 242

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land? (heavily damaged): (most of obv. lost) 10 shekels of silver and a clause of forbearance are legible. 7 witnesses and 1 ina ašābi-witness are legible (Tašmētu-damqat [...]; cf. BM77600?) (remainder of rev. lost).
 
No protagonists legible.
Title: BM 77786

Paraphrase:
Promissory note with house as security: B1 owes to A 2/3 mina of cut silver of 1/8 alloy by Tašrītu (VII). B1’s house in Babylon next to those of C1 and C2 is the security for A. 6 witnesses and the scribe (Ṭāb-ṣilli-Marduk/Rab-banê). Addendum: the sum includes the credit of B2.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B1 = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-bēl-šumāti//Atkuppu; B2 = Nabû-bēl-šumāti//Atkuppu (father of B1); C1 = Līširu/Bazūzu//Bēl-ušumgal; C2 = Bazūzu/[...]//[...]
Title: HSM 1891.11.29

Paraphrase:
Purchase of house: A purchases from B1, B2 and B3 a house of 5 sq. r (c. 61,25 m²) outside the Zababa Gate in the district of Babylon. The house is situated on the upper west side next to the through-street (sūqu āṣû), on the lower west side next to the house of C1, on the upper northern front next to the house of C2, and on the lower southern front next to the house of C3. The agreed price is 13 ½ shekels of silver per sq. r, so A pays 1 mina 7 ½ shekels of silver and additional 2 ½ shekels for the clothing of the mistress of the house (lubāru ša bēlet bīti). B1, B2 and B3 receive 1 mina and 10 shekels of block silver in total. The document closes with the usual final clauses regarding the reception of the money, exclusion of further litigation on part of the seller’s party on pain of paying the price 12 times over and a further clause concerning settlement of excess or lack of sq. r according to the agreed price. 5 witnesses (ina kanāk ṭuppi), including the uncle of B1-3 (Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Mušallim-Marduk//Nappāhu), who took 3 shekels of silver as his gift (qištu), and the scribe (Nabû-ušallim//Miṣirāya). Fingernail impressions of B1, B2 and B3 have been placed instead of seals.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B1 = Bēl-ahhē-erība/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu; B2 = Iqīša-Marduk/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu; B3 = Bēl-ēṭir/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu; C1 = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-ēṭir//Rēmut-ilī; C2 = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Ša,-Nabû-šū//Pahāru; C3 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Mušallim-Marduk//Nappāhu
Title: BM 92796

Paraphrase:
Administrative list concerning the king’s income from prebendary service of the cultic year (partly damaged): 7 ruled sections list (mainly) meat offerings of the royal rations (kurummat šarri) before Išhara throughout the whole year:
1) from 5 baskets (pišannu), of beef there are 5 thighs (pēmu), 5 loin cuts (zibbatu), 5 humps (asqubbītu), 10 short rib cuts (ṣēlu karû), 20 ankle cuts (kursinnu), the fat from between the intestines (lipû ša birit irrī); and of mutton 5 loin cuts, 5 rump cuts (arkatu), 5 fatty tissues, 5 loin cuts of lamb;
2) from the basket of [day x+]1, of beef there are 1 thigh, 1 loin cut, 1 hump, 2(?) short rib cuts, 4 ankle cuts; and of mutton 1 loin cut, [1 rum]p cut, 1 fatty tissue, 1 loin cut of lamb;
3) from the 2 greeting of the temple (šalām bīti) rituals of the 8th of Tašrītu (VII) and the 5th of Kislīmu (IX), of beef there are 2 thighs, 2 [loi]n cuts, 2 humps, [4 sho]rt [rib cuts], 8 ank[le cuts]; and of [mutton] 2 loi[n cuts, 2 rump cuts], 2 fatty tiss[ues, 2 loin cuts] of lamb;
4) the 25th of Ayyāru (II), 4th and 13th day [...], the 11th of Ṭebētu (X), of mutton there are 10 loin cuts, 10 rump cuts, 10 [fatty tissues];
5) [...] of mutton there are 1 loin cut, 1 rump cut, 1 fatty tissue, 1 loin [cut of lamb];
6) from the sa[tukku(?) ...] 5 eššēšu-festivals and 10 bayyatānu-festivals the time periods in Simānu (III) between the 25th and 29th (a total of 5 days) and in Kislīmu (IX) the 11th day [...], and in Ṭebētu (X) the 21st and the 13th(?) day are mentioned;
7) the 21st of Ṭebētu (X) [among others...] is mentioned in connection with 1 pomegranate (nur[mû]) [...].
Title: VAT 488

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver, price of a butcher’s prebend: fA draws up (eˀēlu) against B a promissory note (uˀiltu) over 3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. This silver is the price of her butcher’s prebend in Ešasurra, the temple of Išhara, which C had sold to B for said price in an earlier tablet (scil. BM77478+).  Should a dispute (ragāmu) or claim (paqāru) arise over the prebend fA is to return this promissory note and B is to return the purchase tablet of the prebend. 9 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-bullissu/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Saggilāya).
 
fA = Kabtāya/Damqia; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; C = Ana-Bēl-ereš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk
Title: BM 77521

Paraphrase:
Record of dispute conducted before citizens (mār banê): A and B dispute over the prebend before Bēl-āliya-ša-Šarrabānu. B was not granted rights (šuršû) over the prebend. B says that his prebend is at the disposal of A, so A should give him the 10 shekels of silver that B had paid on his behalf to C. A list of 5 witnesses follows; no scribe. Rubrum: It is a notice (tahsistu) so as to not forget.
 
A = Šākin-šumi/Nadnāya//Nappāhu; B = Balāṭu/Marduk-erība//Nappāhu; C = Zūzāya
Title: VAT 1946

Paraphrase:
Agreement regarding the payment of rations: B will give (nadānu) one jar (šapû) monthly to fA1 out of the rations (kurrummatu) from the 1st day of Tašrītu (VII) that fA1 and A2 agreed upon (magāru). Those rations comprise 3 kor of barley, [x] amount of dates, 5 minas of wool, ½ talent of salt, [x] amount of cress(?) (sahlû), 0;0.3 kor of sesame, 2 shekels of silver. Since A2 made over his assets to him, fTašmētu-rēmīnni will serve fA1 and A2 as compensation, for as long A2 enters into the presence (erēbu, ana pāni erēbu) of fA1. fA1 assumes liability (mahāṣu, pūtu mahāṣu) for A2 and retains the usufruct of her dowry. 7 witnesses, including the brother of fA1 (Bēl-usātu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//Nūr-Sîn), and the scribe (Iqīša-Marduk//Bēl-eṭēri). Addendum: each party has taken a copy.
 
fA1 = fTappaššar/Niqūdu=Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//Nūr-Sîn; A2 = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu
Title: BM 114728

Paraphrase:
Statement at court concerning a dispute over an unpaid debt: B owes 50 shekels of cut silver to A. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel per mina. Concerning this debt note (uˀiltu) A states that C1 drew it up (eˀēlu) in the name of fC2 against (ina muhhi) B and that fC2 confirmes (kânu) this. (Rest of statement is lost) 2 witnesses, a judge (Bēl-supê-muhur//[-]) and an uppadētu-official (Nabû-nādin-ahi//Ēṭiru), and the scribe (Mušēzib-Bēl//Egibi).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu; B = Rēmūtu/Nabû-šumu-līšir/Bēl-aplu-uṣur; C1 = Iddin-Nabû (Iddināya)/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu (father of A); fC2 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu (mother of A)
Title: BM 77476+
Other markings Description: 3 seals on the left, right and upper edges

Paraphrase:
Rescinding of gift of slave: fA took pity (rēmu rašû) on her sons and returns (turru) C. Before, fA had promised C to fB1 along with 0.3.2 kor of planted land in Nabātu (cf. VAT109). Now neither fB1 nor fB2 will have the right of disposal (šalāṭu) over C. But they still have the right to the 1 kor of land of fA. 2 ina ašabi-witnesses, fB1 and fB2, 5 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-iddin/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ//Ea-pattannu). Addendum: each party has taken a copy.
 
fA = fKaššāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu; fB1 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi (elder daughter of fB); fB2 = fAmat-Ninlil/Balāṭu//Egibi (younger daughter of fB);  C = Bēl-silim/fŠeleppūtu (cf. VAT109)
Bibliography: VS 5 45 = VS 5 46; Baker 2004, no. 20; Peiser, BV (1890), 27.
Title: VAT 111
Other markings Description: traces of cuneiform signs and markings(?) on right edge

Paraphrase: "Sed ut perspiciatis unde omnis iste natus error sit voluptatem accusantium doloremque laudantium, totam rem aperiam, eaque ipsa quae ab illo inventore veritatis et quasi architecto beatae vitae dicta sunt explicabo. Nemo enim ipsam voluptatem quia voluptas sit aspernatur aut odit aut fugit, sed quia consequuntur magni dolores eos qui ratione voluptatem sequi nesciunt. Neque porro quisquam est, qui dolorem ipsum quia dolor sit amet, consectetur, adipisci velit, sed quia non numquam eius modi tempora incidunt ut labore et dolore magnam aliquam quaerat voluptatem. Ut enim ad minima veniam, quis nostrum exercitationem ullam corporis suscipit laboriosam, nisi ut aliquid ex ea commodi consequatur? Quis autem vel eum iure reprehenderit qui in ea voluptate velit esse quam nihil molestiae consequatur, vel illum qui dolorem eum fugiat quo voluptas nulla pariatur?"
Transliteration: "Sed ut perspiciatis unde omnis iste natus error sit voluptatem accusantium doloremque laudantium, totam rem aperiam, eaque ipsa quae ab illo inventore veritatis et quasi architecto beatae vitae dicta sunt explicabo. Nemo enim ipsam voluptatem quia voluptas sit aspernatur aut odit aut fugit, sed quia consequuntur magni dolores eos qui ratione voluptatem sequi nesciunt. Neque porro quisquam est, qui dolorem ipsum quia dolor sit amet, consectetur, adipisci velit, sed quia non numquam eius modi tempora incidunt ut labore et dolore magnam aliquam quaerat voluptatem. Ut enim ad minima veniam, quis nostrum exercitationem ullam corporis suscipit laboriosam, nisi ut aliquid ex ea commodi consequatur? Quis autem vel eum iure reprehenderit qui in ea voluptate velit esse quam nihil molestiae consequatur, vel illum qui dolorem eum fugiat quo voluptas nulla pariatur?"
Title: Test Roxanne Wyns 001

Paraphrase:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver. Due from the head of the Egibi family. In addition to silver that had been transferred to the debtor to pay for work (dullu) at a canal.
B should pay 2 minas of white, medium quality of silver which is unmarked and of which 1/8 is alloy, that are due from him to A in Addar (XII) in Babylon. It comes in addition to (adi) the previous debt (u'iltu) of 1 1/2 minas of silver which had been given (nadānu, G Stat.) to pay for the work (dullu) at the King’s Canal to Elam. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Tattannu/Rēmūtu; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 30272

Paraphrase:
Summons to transmit crops from the land of the Treasurer, and to arrange for their proper registration.
Concerns 170 kor of barley, 4 kor of wheat, and 4 kor of cress (sahlû), the harvest (ebūru) of the 11th year from the Treasurer's field (eqlu ša E ganzabaru).
A is held accountable for the proper registration of these products in his (boss') accounts, but something went wrong and the Treasurer's mayordomo (B) did not receive proof of registration. A shifts the blame to the two men whom B sent to him together with the products (C1 and C2). The story is recounted in the present document as follows. It opens with A's declaration (qabû umma) that the Treasurer's mayordomo wanted the products to be registered in his accounts (ina muhhi-ya ušuzzu) saying that he gave them to C1 and C2: they received from him the 170 kor of barley (in-da-har-in-ni [mahāru]), whereas only C2 (ana elat ana PN) was given the 4 kor of wheat and 4 kor of cress (at-ta-din [nadānu]). This is confirmed (kanû D) by the two men in their own testimony (eli ramāni-šunu) as follows (umma): they both took (našû) the barley from B, and only C1 received (mahāru) the wheat and cress from B. The document then stipulates that by the 20th of Ayyar (II) C1 and C2 should transmit?* the barley they received from B before A and give proof of it to B (dagālu Š-nadānu). Similarly, C2 shall register the wheat and cress he received from B in A's account(**) and give proof of it to B (ušuzzu-nadānu). D1 assumes warranty for C1. D2 assumes warranty for C2. Names of 11 witnesses and the scribe.

*L. 13: ú-šá-┌ad┐-[gil-ma]; (**) ina muhhi A for usual itti.

A=Nidintu, (rab bīti) of Iqīša; B=Erībaya/Ša-Nabû-šū, (rab bīti) of E; C1=Arad-Bāba/Mušēzib-Marduk//Ašlāku; C2=Šellibu/Iddin-Nabû; D1=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; D2=Šulum-Bābili/Bēl-ahu-iddin; E=Bagasarū, (ganzabaru)
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 30926

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver from the head of the Egibi family. Payment for rikis qabli.
A, by order of (ina qibi) C, receives payment (mahāru) from B for his rikis qabli duty. The amount, 1/3 mina and 5 shekels of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, is paid for serving in the King's army (ana alāki ana pāni šarri), which means that A will serve instead of B. The sum is in addition to (elat) the previously paid 3 minas of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Bēl-iddin/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Ah-bani; B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C=Murašû/Marduk-šumu-iddin//Ilu-tillatī
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 30451

Paraphrase:
Settlement of a silver debt through the sale of land and slaves to the creditor. Due from the head of the Egibi family. A previous house sale became void after the house had been seized by the Esagil temple.
B sold (ana kaspi nadānu) a plot of land including the house built on it (qanû bīt epšu) in Babylon’s Šu’anna-quarter to A, for 1 talent 4 minas and 14 shekels of silver, but later gave the house to the Esagil temple in order to settle one of his debts (apālu N). Consequently, A needs to be paid back the silver that he paid for the land and house. In the present document A receives (mahāru) 50 minas and 4 2/3 shekels of silver in capital and interest out of the total debt (u'iltu) of more than 1 talent. It is the value in silver of a plot of land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) of 2 kor, land under cultivation (eqlu merēšu) of 4.3.2 kor and 10 slaves (amīlūtu) which B gave (= sold) to A. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 21 witnesses and the scribe. Sealed by the seller.

A=Anu-mukīn-apli/Anu-ahu-iddin//Ea-qâlu-išemme; B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 33935
Place of issue Remark: wr. URU KAR AN BÁR (needs collation)

Paraphrase:
Renting of a boat to the head of the Egibi family.
A1 and A2 rent (ana idi nadānu) a boat to B for 1/3 minas of white, medium quality silver (as rent) and! 0;1.0 kor of flour for the (boat's) maintenance (kurummatu). The boat belongs to C, a slave of [PN], but is at A1's and A2's disposal for boat-service duty (malahūtu). The boat may (or: should?) sail to Bištu-ša-ṣēru’a, but should not pass the fortified settlement (birtu). The text continues with stipulating what happens if the boat passes the fortress, but the pertinent passage is badly preserved.

A1=Niqūdu/mx- x-iá; A2=Kalbi-Bāba/Iddinaya; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Iddin-Bēl, slave of …
Title: BM 31891

Paraphrase:
Receipt of barley by a royal official from the head of the Egibi family. Payment for transport costs. Undertaking to register the receipt in the accounts of the Governor of Babylon.
A, a man from Imbuka (lúim-bu-ku-a-a) courtier/clerk? of the [...]*, receives (mahāru) [3];2.0 kor of barley from B to cover the costs of transporting (gimru) a broken amount of either barley or dates(**). He acts as proxy (našpartu) for C, Governor of Babylon, and should register his receipt in the latter’s account; then he should give proof of it to B (ušuzzu -nadānu). The barley (or dates) that needs to be transported are D’s income from the collection of fixed rent (sūtu). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

*lúS[AG? ...] šá lúšá-di-emeš šálú┌x┐ [(x)]. Or read lúse-pir-ri] šá etc. ?
** 30[+x barley/dates].

A= Rušundāta (or: Rušunpāta), (sepīru?); B= Širiktu/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C= Gūzānu, (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon); D= Bēl-ittannu
Title: BM 31393

Paraphrase:
Undertaking under oath to settle debts to a slave of the Egibi family with his master. Reference to the pledge of income from a prebend to the creditor.
B1 whose second name is Nabû-ittannu declares under oath (tamû) by Bēl, Nabû and Darius to A2 that he will bring him (ana pāni PN abāku) the brothers C1 and C2 by the end of Ab (V) of Darius 26th year. He and the 2 brothers shall then pay (eṭēru) the silver, barley and dates that he and B2, the brothers' father, owe to A1, A2's slave, according to the promissory notes (u'iltu). In addition (elat), there is a previous document (šaṭaru) that concerns the term of payment (adannu) upon which B1 agreed and the income from his ērib bīti-prebend that was taken as pledge (maškanu ṣabatu), namely 1 liter (qû) of bread and 1 liter (qû) of beer. Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe.

A2=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A1=Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of A2; B1=Aplaya/Nergal-iddin, alias Nabû-ittannu; B2=Nabû-ittannu/Nūrea; C1=Nabû-nādin-ahi/Nabû-ittannu; C2=Iddin-d.../Nabû-ittannu
Title: BM 30965

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley. Payment for transport costs due to a courtier from the head of the Egibi family.
B should deliver 24;3.2 kor of barley that are due from him to A, a courtier (ša rēš šarri), to cover the costs for the transport (gimru) of barley. Delivery is due in Abu (V). The document specifies the kind of transport at stake but the passage is fragmentary*. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe. Among the witnesses: a man with the Iranian name Bagadata/Mitrata; the courtier Bēl-ušallim (ša rēš šarri); and Mauzzu/Ṭabia (who has no title here, but cf. BM33112). The scribe is B himself.

* transport of barley [...] which Širku (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi) from (ina qate) [...].

A= Nabû-šumu-ibni, courtier (ša rēš šarri); B=Širku (aka Marduk-nāṣir-apli) (/Iddināya//Egibi).
Title: BM 30591

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 1 mina and 35 shekels of silver to A, slave of C,  to be paid on the 1st of Abu (V). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ušallim/Iqīšāya//Sîn-karābī-išme.

A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of C; B = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Šangû-Gula; C = Iddin-Marduk/Nūr-Sîn
Bibliography: Reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 199; Dandamaev 1984 (Slavery), 367, no. 32; Shiff 1987, no. 128;
Title: BM 30508

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates
B owes a broken amount of dates to A, to be delivered in their full amount (gamru) and in one payment in Arahsamna (VIII) at the Borsippa canal. The debtor is prevented from giving anything to someone else without the creditor's consent (ša lā). Names of 4 witnesses but the scribe's name is broken off.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Tayyālu/Rahiannu
Title: BM 32106

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B1 and B2, sons of C owe 23 1/3 shekels of silver to A, to be paid in full (gamāru D-ma eṭēru) for a one year period (adi ṭuppi ana ṭuppi). In addition, they are previous promissory notes for silver and emmer wheat. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Lâbāši/Kabtia//Egibi.

A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Madān-ēreš, son of Gimillu; B2 = Nabû-iddin, son of Gimillu; C = Gimillu
Title: BM 31171

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates.
B, the royal official appointed over the harbor (bēl piqitti ša kāri) of Bīt-ṭāb-Bēl owes 254;0.0.0 (kor) of dates to A, to be delivered in Kislīm (IX) in Bīt-ṭāb-Bēl. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: .../Nabû-gamil.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Itti-maku-ilī, (bēl piqitti ša kāri)
Title: BM 33128

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver without interest. Pledge of family members.
B owes 1 mina and 5 shekels of silver to A, to be paid without interest in Dûzu (IV). The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor's two daughters (fC1 and fC2), whom he bought for 2 minas of silver from D in the presence of the seller's father (E) who acted as witness. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged persons until the debt is fully repaid. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for 120;0.0.0 kor of dates and 1 mina of silver on which interest is to be paid. Names of one witness and the scribe: Iddin-Nabû/Mušēzib-Bēl (debtor).

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Iddin-Nabû/Mušēzib-Bēl; fC1 = fQudašu, daugther of Iddin-Nabû/Mušēzib-Bēl; fC2 = fBunanitu, daugther of Iddin-Nabû/Mušēzib-Bēl; D = Bānia/Nabû-ile’’i//Sagdidi; E = Nabû-ile’’i
Title: BM 30697

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver and barley without interest.
B owes 1 mina 7 1/2 shekels of silver and 23;0.0.0 kor of barley to A. The silver should be paid in Addar (XII) of the 4th year of Nabonidus in Ālu-ša-Ah-iddin. The barley should be delivered in Ayyār (II) of the 5th year of Nabonidus in the same town. He does not have to pay interest. A also holds a claim (rašûtu) for silver, barley and onions against C, for which B acts as a guarantor.
D's claim (rašûtu) for estimated income from imposts (imittu) ... [broken off] should still be setttled (nadānu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nūrea/Ahunu; C = Sîn-ēṭir; D = Šarrani
Title: BM 30496

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with interest. Pledge of land.
B1 and his mother (fB2) owe 1 mina of silver to A, to be paid with interest in Tašrīt (VII). The debtors' upper field (eqlu elēnu), next to C's plot of land and his lower field (eqlu šupālu), planted with date palms (bīt gišimmarē) and grain (pî šulpi), next to the border of the abarakku's plot of land were pledged to the creditor and remain pledged. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged land until the debt and its interest are fully repaid. Payment will be in dates and for that purpose the harvest will be assessed (emēdu) in Tašrīt (VII) when the dates are still on the trees. The interest is fixed at c. 20% (lit. 0;1 kor per shekel) according to the market value of Šahrinu. The (indebted) silver is what has been paid for rikis qabli of the royal soldiers (ṣāb šarri). Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Šumu-iddin; fB2 = fBāba-eṭrat/Šamaš-ibni, mother of B1; C = Šumu-ukīn/Ša-nāšīšu
Title: BM 30340

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates.
B owes 2.1 kor of dates to A which he should deliver in Arahsamna (VIII) according to the the creditor's. At this point the document is broken off. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Kiribtu*/Bēl-kāṣir//Ṭābiḫu*.

A = Arad-Bēl/Kabtia//Pappāya; B = Bānia/Nabû-bēlšunu//Eppeš-ilī
Title: BM 31207

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver?. Fragmentary.
B owes a broken amount of what seems to be silver to A, to be paid without interest in ... [the name of the month is broken]. A short note at the end points out that previous claims have been annulled. Names of one witness and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Ina-tēšê-ēṭir//Nabāya.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Bēl-iddin/Ina-tēšê-ēṭir//Nabāya
Title: DT 031

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Interest at default.
B owes a broken amount of mina of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be delivered on Simān (III). He will start paying the yearly 20% interest on a monthly basis, if he fails to meet the deadline. Witnesses.

A = Nabû-iddin/Kidu//Sîn-šadûnu; B = Širku (aka Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Iddināya//Egibi
Title: BM 33120

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates
B owes 50 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in Dûzu (IV) in Babylon. Should the debtor fail to do so and the dates ... [broken off], he can pay in Arahsamna (VIII). He does not have to pay interest. Witnesses.

A = Bēl-ile’’i/Nabû-aplu-iddin; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 33970

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B1 and B2, slaves of A2 owe 165 kor of dates to A1 and A2, to be delivered at the canal in Babylon. It is the assessed field rent (imittu) on the arable land located at the new canal. They should deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates(*) they shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, 4 qappatu-baskets, 4 zabbilu-baskets and 4 darīku-containers. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu nukarribi). The above said includes (ina libbi) the 18 kor of dates that are due from D1 and D2, slaves (lamutānu) of A1 and A2. Witnesses.
(*)ll. 7 … 10: ina muhhi 1 gur sur-ru-ú … / it-ti-I inandinû.
 
A1 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; A2 = Nergal-ušallim/Šumu-iddin//Šulāya; B1 = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Zēru-ukīn//Ahu-bāni; B2 = Bēl-ṣullê-šime, slave of A2; D1 = Arabu, slave (lamutānu) of A1 and A2; D2 = Nabû-rīhtu-uṣur, slave lamutānu) of A1 and A2
Title: Liv 012

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 24 kor of dates to A, the assessed field rent (imittu) on land located at (ina muhhi) the New Canal. The full amount of dates (gamru) should be delivered in one instalment according to the creditor’s measure in Tašrīt (VII) at the upper New Canal, together with (itti) spathes (tuhallu), a load of firewood, spadices (gipû), green dates (uhinnu), fibres (mangagu) (and) 2 darīku-containers. In addition, there is barley at B's disposal (ina pāni) that he still (rīhtu) has to deliver in payment of the šibšu-tax on land (šibšu eqli) for Ayyār (II) of the 7th year. Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-ēṭir/Šamaš-šumu-ukīn//Arad-Nergal
Title: BM 32930

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver and onions, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 14 3/8 shekels of silver and 1200 strings (gidlu) of onions to A, to be delivered by the end of Tašrīt (VII). The (indebted) silver amd onions are what C invested in the business partnership. Scribe: Nabû-le'i/Ardia//šigua.
 
A = Zērutu/Bēl-eṭēru//Suhāya; B = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia; C = Bēl-eṭēru
Title: BM 31104

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 1/3 mina of silver to fA, to be paid on the 10th of Dûzu (IV). Witnesses.
 
fA = fBu'ītu/Nergal-uballiṭ//Nūr-Sîn; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 41413

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley(?). Payment from the prebendary income
Promissory note for amounts of some agricultural commodity from prebendary income.
B owes 0;0.4.0 kor to A. He should give 0;0.3.0 out of the 0;0.4.0 kor from (ina) the prebendary income (maššartu) of the months Šabāṭ (XI), Addar (XII) and Nisan (I) (Nisan of the following year), while the remaining 0;0.1.0 kor should come from that of the months Ayyār (II), Simān (III) (and) Dûzu (IV). The previous promissory note is to be considered paid off (hepû). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Ša-pî-kalbi/Arrabi//Šangû-Bābili
Title: BM 31137

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes ½ mina of silver to A, to be delivered in Kislīm (IX). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Muranu/Kabtia//Šuhāya
Title: BM 30485

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Mutual warranty.
B1, his brother (B2) and his wife fB3 owe 24 ½ shekels of silver to A, to be delivered in Kislīm (IX). The debtors assume warranty for each other and the one who has silver available at the due date will pay. Witnesses.
 
A = Šulāya/Zēru-ukīn//Egibi; B1 = Nabû-ahu-iddin/Šamaš-iddin; B2 = Šulāya/Šamaš-iddin; fB3 = fZunnāya, wife of B1; C = Šamaš-iddin, father of B1 and B2
Title: BM 30867

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Interest to be paid in barley and fixation of exchange rate. General pledge.
B owes 10 shekels of silver to A. He should pay 2 sūtu of barley (as interest) per ½ shekel of (indebted) silver. The barley is to be paid according to its market value (mahīru) in Simān (III). All the debtor’s property in the city of U-RU6 are pledged to the creditor.
Witnesses (a.o. Šulāya/Zēru-ukīn//Egibi).
 
A = Līšir/Rēmūt//Pahāru; B = Kudurru/Iqīšāya//Egibi
Title: BM 30240

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes a broken amount of dates to A and his brothers, which is most likely the assessed field rent but the pertinent passage at the beginning of the document is broken off. The full amount (gamru) of dates should be delivered in one instalment according to A’s measure in Šuppātu. Delivery is due in Tašrīt (VII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amount of) spathes (tuhallu), a load of firewood, spadices (gipû) from green dates (uhinnu), (and) fibres (mangagu) and 2 darīku-containers. Payment for the garderner's remuneration (šissinnu) is included in the above (ina libbi). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-nāṣir/Nādin//Bābūtu
Title: BM 30826

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Remainder of a debt.
B still owes 1 mina and 50 shekels out of an original debt (rīhit u'ilti) of 7 minas of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A1 and his brother. He should pay it without interest (qaqqadu) in Abu (V).
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = borther of A1; B = Šellebi/Pallil-uballiṭ
Title: BM 30671

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Interest at default.
B owes ½ mina of medium quality white silver to A, to be delivered without interest in Šabāṭ (XI). From Addar (XII) onwards, he will start paying the usual 20% interest on a monthly basis, if he fails to meet the deadline. Witnesses.
 
A=Aplāya/Bebanu; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 31069

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley and dates.
B owes 3 kor of barley and 4 kor of dates to A. The barley should be delivered in Ayyār (II) and the dates in Tašrīt (VII) on the creditor's land (bītu) in Šahrīnu and according to his measure. A has returned the promissory notes for barley and dates which B owed to his slave (C). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Kāṣir/Šulāya; C=Madānu-bēlu-uṣur (slave of A)
Title: BM 30364

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 4.2 kor of dates to A1, A2, and A3. It is the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) located in Šuppatu: half of this land belongs to A1 and half by his brothers (A2 and A3). The dates should be delivered in one instalment according to the 36 liters measure to the courtyard (haṣāru). Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give a load of firewood, spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangaga) and 1 darīku-container. In addition, he still owes barley from the harvest (ebūr eqli) of the 15th year (i.e. the current year). Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli (son of C?); A2 = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ, son of C; A3 = Nergal-ušēzib, son of C; B = Nabû-nāṣir/Nādin//Bābūtu; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 30502

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates. Payment for a debt.
B1 and B2 owe 75 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in full in one instalment according to the creditor’s measure in Tašrīt (VII) of Cambyses’ 6th year at the Ṭubašu-canal. The two debtors assume warranty for each other. The document continues by referring to a payment in silver (made by A on behalf of the debtors) to C, who is appointed over (ša muhhi ) the (yoke-) teams (ṣindu), for the(ir) obligation to provide military equipment (rikis qabli) in Cambyses' 5th year. In addition, there is an earlier claim (rašûtu) against the same debtors for which their land in Bīt-Ṭabi and (their slave) D have been taken as pledged. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Ibnāya; B2 = Šumu-iddin/Nabû-ahu-iddin; C = Nabû-iddin (or: Ahu-iddin, so Joannès, Achemenet)/Aplāya, ša muhhi ṣindāti; D = Ṣilimu (mṣi-lim-mu?!)
Title: BM 31250

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 8 kor of dates to A, assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) – probably followed by a description of the field's location but the tablet is broken at this point.
