Delivery is secured by the pledge of the debtor's houseborn slaves (F1 and F2) and his field (eqlu) at the Biri canal (pattu GN). No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged salves and land until the debt is fully paid back. Background to the above debt is the payment (by A) to C for performing military service (on B's behalf) (ana madakti alāku).Besides (ittû) the 160 kor of dates, the debtor should deliver 20 loads of firewood.
The two earlier promissory notes for dates and 12 shekels of silver have been annulled (hepû). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-bān-ahi/Apkallu//Ašlāku.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Bēl-šumu-iškun/Bēl-ahhē-iqīša//Sippê(a); C = Mušēzib-Bēl; F1 = Nabû-kuṣranni, slave of B; F2 = Bēl-ṣullê-šemu, slave of B
Title: BM 30990

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with interest.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nergalahu-iddin/Ahhea
Title: BM 31560

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of slaves.
B owes 1 mina and 30 shekels of silver to A, to be paid in Nisan (I). This debt is secured by the pledge of two of the debtor's slaves (C1 and C2). No other creditor shall exercise any rights over them until the creditor has received full repayment of his silver. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-tultabši-līšir/Bēl-zēru-ibni//Nappāhu.
This document is a retroact from Ash.1878.3 (OECT 10 105) and BM30810 (Nbn 392). 

A = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Nādinu; B = Nabû-tultabši-līšir/Bēl-zēru-ibni//Nappāhu; C1 = Ša-pî-kalbi; C2 = Bēl-pitnanni
Title: BM 30807

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Ahu-ittabši/Nabû-malik

Title: BM 30599

The end of the document and the first part of the list of witnesses is broken off. Names of at least 1 witness and the scribe: Nabû-šumu-imbi/Ezida-šumu-ibni//Sagdidi (debtor).

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-šumu-imbi/Ezida-šumu-ibni//Sagdidi
Transliteration: Transliteration available on Achemenet
Title: BM 31429

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Šamaš-kāṣir/Nabû-bēlšunu//Lā-kuppuru; C = Iddināya

Title: BM 30920

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for onions.
B owes 3000 strings (gidlu) of onions to A, slave of C, to be delivered in Ayyār (II). Delivery is due on the creditor's plot of land (or: house) (bītu) in the area between the canals (birīt nārāti).  He should make the onions pass the harbour (etēqu Š), i.e. by paying for the harbour customs. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Gimillu/Nabû-šumu-līšir//Malultu.

A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Nabû-bēlšunu//Lā-kuppuru; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn

Title: BM 30873

A = Nergal-ušēzib/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Kāṣiru/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 30794

In addition, there are 11+x;0.3.0 kor of barley ... (broken off). Scribe: Bēl.../Tabnēa/Gahal. There are two witnesses. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-.../Tabnēa//Gahal.

Title: MOA 4.36 A

Paraphrase:

In addition, there is the (still to be completed) settlement of accounts (epuš nikkassi) with the debtor concerning the imittu of the 1st year. Included are the 5;2.0.0 kor of dates that are the shared income (zittu) of A, C and D. He (= B) has not received (eṭēru) any remuneration for his gardening work (šissinnu). Witnesses.

It should be entirely taken (šalāmu G) from the income from his onion field (šikittu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Zēr-Bābili/Aplāya//Šumu-libši.

Title: BM 31189

Title: BM 30484

Paraphrase:
Receipt of payment for interest, paid in silver.

A = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Arad-Nabû//Bēl-ēṭiru; B  = Uballisu-Gula/Šumu-uṣur//Arad-Nergal; C = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Bēl-ibni//…

Security for debt. Payment due from the head of the Egibi family. Interest and pledge.
B owes 10 1/2 minas and 5 shekels of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy to A. The present document stipulates that from Addar (XII) onwards a yearly interest of 20% should be paid on a monthly basis. We learn that this debt, together with one of (adi) 3 2/3 minas and 5 shekels of silver, are what remains (rīhtu) to be paid (u'iltu) to A for the onions that he sold (mahāru) to B. It concerns the onions of Darius' 11th year, for which probably compare BM30721 (=Dar 315). The debtor's acreage (zēru) in Bīt-Hahhuru, located next to C, is pledged till the full repayment of the capital sum and its interest. Names of 11 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Šaddinnu/Madān-ahhē-iddin//Šigûa; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Arad-Marduk/Nergal-zēru-ibni
Bibliography: Reedition and join of Dar. 453; Wunsch 1993, no. 207.
Title: BM 31423+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver and onions.
B should pay 15 shekels of marked silver of the kind commonly used for purchases and sales (nadānu u mahāru) and 15 bundles of onions that are due from him, to A in Nisan (I). He does not have to pay interest (ina qaqqadi) on the silver. Related to the archive of the Egibi family on prosopographical reasons (cf. BM 30838 [=Dar 318]). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-bēlšunu/Arad-Marduk//Šangû-Ea; B=Iddinnaya/Arad-Bēl
Title: BM 30864

Paraphrase:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver to a courtier. Due from the head of the Egibi family. Pledge of slaves and land.
B, whose second name is Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Iddinaya//Egibi should pay 45 minas of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, that are due from him, to A, a courtier (ša rēš šarri). Payment will be in Simān (III) in Babylon. He does not have to pay interest (ina qaqqadi). Pledged to A (maškanu) are a family of 8 slaves (ameluttu), people belonging to the debtor's household (nīšū bīti): C1, fC2, his wife; C3, C4, C5, C6, his sons; fC7 and fC8, his daughters; and all (gabbu) his fields planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) and grain (pî šulpi) in Šuppātu located next to D1 and D2. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over these until A has received full repayment of his silver. The pledged property will belong to the creditor should the debtor fail to meet the deadline. Names of 14 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Šarru-dūrī/Idrā, (ša rēš šarri); B=Širik, alias Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Iddinaya//Egibi
C1=Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of B; fC2=fNanāya-bēlu-uṣur, wife of C1 (slave); C3=Zababa-iddin, son of C1 (slave); C4=Madān-iddin, son of C1 (slave); C5=Bēl-gabbi-Bēlumma, son of C1 (slave); C6=Ahūšunu, son of C1 (slave); fC7=fHašdayītu, daughter of C1 (slave); fC8=fAhāssunu, daughter of C1 (slave); D1=Nabû-nāṣir/Itti-Nabû-lummir//Basia; D2=Nidintu/Marduk-erība//Egibi
Bibliography: Reedition: Abraham 2004 141; Abraham OLP 28 (1997), 55ff.; Abraham NABU 1997/53, 53; Dandamaev 1984, 96, 97, 148, 352, 353, 356, 360, 406.
Title: Mnb 1130

Paraphrase:
Undertaking to bring along a baker to the head of the Egibi family. Very fragmentary.
The tablet's obverse side and the beginning of its reverse are too fragmentary to understand what the text is about. The part that is better preserved cites the words that were spoken by someone whom we identify as A ("I will bring", abāku), and continues by stipulating that in case he fails to bring along the baker(s) (mubannû) and deliver him to B**, he should give him two other men instead (C1 and C2), as had been agreed in a previous document (šaṭaru). Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe.

** kī lúM[U ...] la [itab]akkamma ana PN [la ittadin]

A=...-Marduk?; B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli (=?Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C1=Iqīša?-Marduk; C2=Nabû-zēru-ibni/Aššur-abu-uṣur
Title: BM 33968

Paraphrase:
Sale of a boat. Warranty by the head of the Egibi family.
A sells his boat to B for 8 minas of white, medium quality silver of which 1/8 is alloy. A third party (C) assumes warranty for the uškûtu of the boat. Nothing is said about the receipt of the purchase price. The boat is new and 7 cubīts wide at its beam (šaburru). Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nabû-zeru-ibni/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Marduk-iqīšanni/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//...; C=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 32883

Paraphrase:
Receipt of an ilku-payment by the head of the Egibi family.
A receives payment (mahāru) from B1 for the ilku-tax till the end of Addar (XII) of the 25th year of Darius, that is due from him, his brother (B2) and two other persons (B3 and B4). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Širiktu/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B1=Aplaya/Bazūzu//Ašlāku; B2=Iddin-Nabû/Bazūzu//Ašlāku; B3= ...-Nabû/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu; B4=Šumu-ukin/Bēl-ēṭir
Title: BM 31533

Paraphrase:
Promissory note to pay a debt of dates to the head of the Egibi family.
B should completely pay off (gamāru-eṭēru* D) the 8.2.3 kor of dates that are due from him to A in Ayyar (II). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe

*Wr. uṭ-ṭar-ar

A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Kīnaya/Atkal-Šamaš?//PN
Title: BM 31058

Paraphrase:
Receipt of the miksu-toll from the head of the Egibi family.
A receives (mahāru) toll (miksu) from B for a boat loaded with onions (from the harvest) of the 10th year. Names of 9 persons (i.e., 8 witnesses and the scribe, uncl.).

A=Nergal-ušallim/Arrabi; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Title: BM 30747

Paraphrase:
Receipt of an ilku-payment (and)? the advance payment on the bow-tax (pānāt qašti) by the head of the Egibi family. Paid on behalf of a third party.
A receives payment (eṭēru) from B for the account of (ana muhhi) C, his brother, for the ilku-tax till the end of Addar (XII) of Darius’ 26th year that is due from the latter and lúṭi-pi-ni-šú*. A short remark at the very end of the obverse, before the witness list, states that he (also?)** receives (eṭēru) an advance payment on the bow-tax (panāt qašti). The exact amounts that are paid are not specified. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

*ṭi-pi-ni-šú probably refers to C's additional men. (cf. BM30589)
**The verb of receipt (ēṭir) occurs twice: once with ilku ša C (ll. 1-6) and once with pānāt qašti (l. 7) as direct object. These could be seen as two different taxes or service obligations, or the latter could be a specification of the more general ilku.

A = Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B = Nabû-ittannu/Bānia//Itinnu; C = Rēmūt-Bēl/Bānia//Itinnu
Title: BM 30261

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates and silver. Pledge renewal.
B owes 22;0.0.0 kor of dates and 6 shekels of silver to A, to be delivered in one payment on the 10th of Ṭebēt (X). Delivery is due on the creditor's plot of land (or: house) (bītu) in Šahrinu. In addition, there are earlier promissory notes. The debtor's field (eqlu) in Bīt-ṭāb-Bēl and house at the Borsippa canal which were pledged to the creditor (maškānu ṣabātu), remain pledged. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//Sagdidi (sag.di.ti).

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Marduk-nāṣir/Šamaš-ahu-iddin
Title: BM 31212

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for onions. Payment for harbor costs. Fragmentary.
B owes x+1500 strings (gidlu) of onions to A, royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri). The onions are "of the royal harbor" (ša kāri ša šarri), meaning that they are part of a onion transport by boat and the costs related to such transports. The rest of the tablet is broken off.
Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-šumu-līšir/Mušēzib-Nabû/Nabû-šeme.

A = Gimillu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Sîn-šadûnu, royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri); B = Nergal-ušallim/Zērutu//Dābibi
Title: BM 31487

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Payment in dates. Renewal of (general) pledge.
B owes 30 shekels of silver to A, to be paid in Arahsamna (VIII) in the form of dates, calculated at the market price of Šahrinu. The dates should be delivered in one instalment by boat(s) at the Borsippa canal. All of the debtor's property in and outside the city that were already pledged to the creditor, including his sluice gates (bābu), remain pledged. In addition, there are earlier promissory notes for silver, barley, dates and onions. The (indebted) silver is what has been paid for the rikis qabli of Dûzu (IV) of Nabonidus' 9th year. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-uballiṭ/Šāpik-zēri//Ile’’i Marduk.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Zēria
Title: BM 30327

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver without interest.
B owes 20 shekels of silver to A, to be paid without interest on the 15th of Simān (III). In addition, there is an earlier promissory note (u'iltu) for silver. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Mušēzib-Marduk/Marduk-ēṭir//Nappāhu.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-edu-uṣur/Rahiannu
Title: BM 30468

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 1 mina of silver to fA, to be paid in ...  [the name of the month is broken off]. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: ...Marduk/.../...-Šamaš.

fA = fNuptāya/Iddin-Marduk//Nūr-Sîn; B = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bān-zēri//Bēl-eṭēru
Title: BM 31335

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with interest.
B owes 1 mina of medium quality silver to A, to be paid by the end of Ulūl (VI) with interest. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ṣillāya//Esagilāya. (This text could be a prolongation of BM31374). 

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Bēl-uballiṭ/Bēl-rēmanni
Title: BM 30476

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver without interest.
B1, his brother (B2) and his wife (fB3) owe 10 minas of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to fA, to be paid in ... [the name of the month is broken off], without interest. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ušallim/Sîn-karābī-išme(?).

fA = fEsagila-rāmat/Zēria//Nabāya; B1 = Kidin-Marduk/Zēria//Šangû-Gula; B2 = Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Zēria//Šangû-Gula; fB3 = fBu’ītu, wife of B1
Title: DT 225

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Interest at default.
B owes 6 minas of silver to A, to be paid at the end of the month (namely, on the 30th of Nisan [I]). He will start paying a yearly interest of 20%, if he fails to meet the deadline. C acts as guarantor for the payment. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi.

A = Kīnāya/Erpetu(?); B = Ibnāya/Nādinu//Kisua; C = Kalbāya/Iddin-Marduk//Buratu
Title: Pitt-river-Museum (Oxford) 48

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver and barley without interest. Pledge of land.
B1 and B2 owe 1 mina and 36 shekels of silver and 180;0.0.0 kor of barley without interest to A. The silver should be paid in Addar (XII) and the barley in Ayyār (II), in Ālu-ša-Ah-iddin. The (indebted) silver is the price that was paid for the purchase of onion seeds in Neriglissar's 1st and 2nd year. The debtors' onion field (šikittu) is pledged to the creditor. The two debtors assume warranty for each other. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Šumu-iddin/Aplāya//Šumu-libši.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Iqīšāya/Bēl-kāṣir//Šangû-parakki; B2 = Marduk-erība/Nādinu
Title: BM 30331

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver and dates.
B1 and his wife (fB2) owe 10 shekels of silver and 20 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in Arahsamna (VIII). The two debtors assume warranty for each other. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi. The first witness is the debtor's son.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Ardia/Bēl-iddin//Rē’û; fB2 = fKassiri, wife of Ardia/Bēl-iddin//Rē’û
Title: BM 30409

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (?). Fragmentary.
The document is only partially readable.
Title: BM 31497

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Interest at default.
B owes 2 1/2 minas of white, medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A1 and A2, to be paid without interest in Ayyār (II) of Darius' 17th year. Delivery is due in Babylon. The debtor will start paying the yearly 20% interest on a monthly basis, if he fails to meet the deadline. The interest rate is partly brok pay 1(?) shekel of silver as interest on a monthly basis. Witnesses.

A1 = Bēl-x/Bēl-iddin//Damqāya; A2 = Marduk-rēmanni/Sūqāya//…; B = Širku (aka Marduk-nāṣir-apli)/Iddināya//Egibi
Title: BM 31806

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 33 kor of dates to A and his brothers, the assessed field rent on land (imitti [eqli]) located at the Zabunu-ditch, next to C’s [plot of land]. He should deliver the dates in one nstalment according to the 36 liters measure to the courtyard (haṣāru). Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give a load of spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû) and fibres (mangagu), 2 darīku-containers and 1 load of firewood. In addition, there is an earlier claim (by the same creditor) against B which is still pending. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = brother of A1; B = Nabû-iddin/Kīnāya;
Title: BM 41446

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver without interest, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu)
B owes 12 shekels of silver to A1 and A2. It is silver that C invested in a business partnership (harrānu) and used for the purchase (šīmu) of a draught animal (a cow) (litti nīri) and its calf. In Addar (XII), he should pay the silver, with an alloy of one-eighth percent, (kaspa ša bitqa). He does not have to pay interest (qaqqadu). The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s onion field (šikittu). Names of two witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Šamaš-šumu-ukīn/Sagdidi. 
 
A1 = Bēl-īpuš/Rāšil//Nappāhu; A2 = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Nabû-šumu-ibni//Pahāru; C = Iddin-Marduk
Title: BM 30442

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver without interest (nishu-loan). Pledge of house. Related to a past deposit of silver from a house sale.
B owes 6 minas of silver to A, to be paid without interest (qaqqadu) in Addar (XII). The debtor's main house in which he is living is pledged to the creditor. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged house until the creditor has received the full repayment of the debt. The loaned silver originates from silver that had been put in a bag (himtu) and entrusted (paqādu) to B's father by the buyer of A's house in the past. On the same day that the present document is issued the chief officials (rabû) and the judges (dayyānu) authorized B to give the bag to A (apparently after B's father died) (cf. MNB1133 = TCL 12, 120). A subsequently lent from this silver to B for expenses (nishu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Ile''i-Marduk/Bēl-upahhir//Eppeš-ilī.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušēzib-Bēl//Ile''i-Marduk; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi, father of B
Bibliography: Krecher 1970, 201; Petschow 1956 (NBPf), 178; Peiser 1898, 29; Bogaert 1966, 111; Meissner and Tallqvist, WZKM 4 (1890), 120
Title: BM 32863

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates. Payment for a debt.
B owes 10 kor of dates to A, slave of C, to be delivered in Arahsamna (VIII) in/at ina šu-ub/p-[...]. Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-uterri, slave of C; B = Bēl-kāṣir/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Egibi; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 31327

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of a house in antichresis. Fragmentary.
B owes 5/6 minas and 5 shekels of silver to A, servant of C. The debtor’s share in a house that is located next to D’s house is pledged to A in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). Thus, the creditor should not pay house rent. This is followed by a fragmentarily preserved passage stating that "yearly […] Nisan […]". The document concludes by pointing out that no other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged house, until A has received the full repayment of his debt. Witnesses.
 
A = Bēl-rēṣūa, servant of C; B = Marduk-erība/Rēmūt//Miṣrāya(?); C = Neriglissar; D = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi
Title: BM 30808

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Very fragmentary.
B owes 2 shekels of silver to A, slave of C. The clause about the terms of repayment is too fragmentarily preserved to understand its details. Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-uterri, slave of C; B = Ahu-edul-amur(?)/[P]N; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 31859

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with interest.
B owes 8 shekels of silver to A on which he has to pay 13,5% interest(*) on a yearly basis. It is what remains to be paid from the 16 shekels of silver that he owed to C. Witnesses.
(*) I.e. 8 shekels interest per 60 shekels of indebted silver.
 
A = Šulāya/Zēru-ukīn//Egibi; B = Nādin/Mušēzib; C = Mušēzib-Bēl
Title: BM 31065

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver without interest.
B (!)(*) owes 10 shekels of silver to A, to be delivered without interest in Nisan (I). Witnesses.
(*)The debtor's name (Bēl-rēmanni) is spelled Nabû-IG-ni.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Marduk-mukīn-apli//Sîn-damiq (SIG15)
Title: BM 31101

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates. Exchange.
B owes 0.1.0.0 kor (c. 36 liters) of dates, in exchange of a certain object (ka-ar-[x]), to A. The dates should be delivered on the 20th of ṭebēt (X) at the canal in the Mušēpišu-ša-hubur street. Witnesses.
 
A = Erībāya/šumu-uṣur; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 41429

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Fixation of interest.
B owes 5 minas of white, medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be paid with interest (hubullu) in Tašrīt (VII). The interest is fixed at 20%, to be paid on a monthly basis. Witnesses.
 
A = Puršû/Marduk-šarru-uṣur; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 31510

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes x+2 kor of dates to A, the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) located at the Zabunu-ditch that extends till [broken off]. It is A's [x-]th share in the income to which he is entitled together with his brothers (C1 and C2). The dates should be delivered to the courtyard according to the 36 liters measure of the creditor. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give a load of spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), and fibres (mangagu), 1 darīku-container and 1 load of firewood. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). In Ayyār (II), he will deliver 1 kor of [broken off]. The document seems to end with an elat-clause but the passage is badly preserved. Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-iddin/[PN]; C1 = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ, brother of A; C2 = Nergal-ušēzib, brother of A
Title: BM 30687

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for pipes and barrels.                  
B owes 150 pipes (mušallû) of 1 royal cubit and 2 fingers in length(*) to A. By the end of Nisan (I) he should finish (gamāru G) and deliver them, together with the barrels (?). In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for 2 one-seah vessels (kupputtu) and 20 […. (broken off)] which is still pending. Witnesses.
(*) CAD M/1, 256 "of one-cubit (length) and two-fingers (width) according to the royal cubit)".
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Arad-Nergal/Nabû-bān-ahi//Pahāru
Title: BM 30992

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of persons (slaves?).
B owes 1 mina and 10 shekels of silver to A, to be paid without interest (qaqqadu) on the 1st of Simān (III), i.e. in another 17 days. The payment is secured by the pledge of two women (most likely slaves): fC1 and fC2, her daughter. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged persons until A has received the full repayment of his debt. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Iqīša/Egibi (sic!)//Rē'i-sisê; fC1 = fNanāya-kilīlu-uṣur (slave?! of B); fC2 = fTabluṭu, daughter of fC1.
Title: BM 30903

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of house with antichresis.
B1 and his wife (fB2) owe 2 minas of silver to A, slave of C. The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtors’ house in the Hubur-street, next to the houses of D and E. According to the current document, the house will serve as antichretic pledge for the silver debt. Thus, the creditor should not pay rent for the house to the debtors because the rent meant to cover the interest which is fixed at 12 shekels of silver per mina on a yearly basis. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the debtors until A has received the full repayment of his debt, namely, 2 minas of silver. The two debtors assume warranty for each other and the one who has silver available at the due date will pay. The document concludes by poining out that debt has accrued interest since the 2nd of Arahsamna (VIII) (i.e., the previous day). Witnesses.

A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of C; B1 = Bēl-tutašlim/Andahar; fB2 = fŠini-banȃ/Ninlil-zēru-tabni, wife of B1; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; D = Nādin/Hanunu; E = [P]N/Nabû-ahhē-iddin/P[N].
Title: Rm 679

Paraphrase:
Promissory note to pay interest for goods deposited in a house.
fB, slave of A owes (ina pāni) 2 minas and 2 shekels of silver to A. It is the total amount that was given to her to purchase the following items: 1 mina of silver, the purchase price for 50 barrels of quality beer (šikaru ṭābu) as well as (adi) a bowl (haṣbātu); 2/3 minas of silver, the purchase price for 60 kor of dates; 1/3 mina and 2 shekels of silver, the purchase price for 2 bronze cooking vessels (mušahhinu) weighing 7 ½ minas of bronze, 7 bronze cups (kasu), 3 bronze dishes (baṭû), and 4 kor of mustard seeds (kasû). These items have been deposited in the house (šakānu). Till ([adi]) the end of Šabāṭ (XI) she has to pay interest (on the deposited goods). In addition, [5] beds, 10 chairs (kussû), 1 cooking vessel (mušahhinu), 1 wooden stand for a large vessel (šiddatu), 1 …. (ingurēnu), 3 razors (sirapu), 1 iron spade (marru parzilli), 1 axe (qulmu), 2 fermenting vat (namzītu), 1 …., 1 jug for fermenting (kankannu ša namzīti), 1 pair of tongs (for picking up coals) (maššānānu). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fB = fIshunnatu, slave of A
Title: BM 30467

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with interest. General pledge.
B1, B2 and B3 owe 12 minas of silver with interest to A. The present document stipulates that from the 1st of Šabāṭ (XI) onwards (i.e., from now on) an interest of 20% should be paid on a monthly basis. The three debtors assume warranty for each other and pledge their entire property in and outside the city. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged objects until the creditor has received the full repayment of the capital amount and its interest. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note but at this point the document is broken off. Furthermore, another promissory note of B1 for 1 mina and 30 shekels of silver is mentioned [broken off] to be paid to/for [broken off] of the king. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Aplāya/M-ušallimMarduk.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšaya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Šumu-iddin/Zēria/Šangû-Gula; B2 = Nergal-uballiṭ/Tabnēa/X; B3 = Kidinnu/Zēria/Šangû-Gula
Title: Liverpool unknown 2 (Strassmaier 1885)

Paraphrase:
Settlement of accounts. Division of income.
The beginning of the text is broken, only the name of A, brother of ... (name broken) is extant. He and his brother agree on the division of income from and expenses for their business with onions and barley in and outside the city (dullu šūmi u uṭṭati ša āli u ṣēri). B, his brother who is a royal soldier (ṣāb šarri), is entitled to a 1/3 share. Maintenance costs (kurummatu) are covered by their father’s estate (ultu bīt abi akālu). They received in total 3 PI-amounts? (uncl.) of food allowances (akālu n.) from their commonly held property (karû). They have taken an oath (nīšu zakāru) by the gods and by the king. Names of 2 witnesses (a.o. Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšaya//Nūr-Sîn) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-nāṣir/Nabû-ahhē-iddin; B = Ṣillā/Nabû-ahhē-iddin (ṣāb šarri), brother of A
Title: Mnb 1860

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver
Concerns 1 mina of white silver of medium quality, of which 1/8 is alloy, which A receives in Šušan on C’s behalf (ana muhhi) from B. A shall enter the silver in the accounts of [C] in Babylon, and he will give proof of it to B (itti PN ušuzzu-nadānu). Names of 4+ witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Liqu-ilu-‘inni/Bulluṭu//Bā’iru; B = Širku/Iddināya//Egibi (= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C = Itti-Bēl-limmir/Bazuzu//Šumu-libši
Title: BM 41441

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver. Payment for a debt secured by antichretic pledge of a slave.  
B1 and fB2, his wife, owe 30 shekels of silver to fA2. In the present document, the creditor’s mother (fA1) receives repayment of this debt from the debtors. The debt was secured by the pledge of a slave (fC) which fB2, one of the debtors, received as security for her claim against D. We assume that this slave was released from pledge upon its repayment. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA1 = fEtellitu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Sîn-šadûnu, mother of fA2; fA2 = fIna-Esagila-bēlet/Nabû-ušallim//Irani; B1 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Ina-tēšê-eṭir/Ēṭiru; fB2 = Bunanītu/Na'id-Marduk/Ṣāhit-ginê, wife of B1; fC = fŠalam-dininni, slave of D; D = Nabû-tultabši-līšir/Bēl-zēru-ibni//Nappāhu
Title: BM 33156

Paraphrase:
Receipt for forced labourers.
A receives (mahāru) 2 forced labourers (urāšu) from B. They are to do the earthwork (dullu epiri) that C, B's son-in-law, is supposed to do (ša C) from Arahsamna (VIII) till the end of Nisan (I) of Nabonidus’ 13thsic?! year. The document is written on the 9th day of Arahsamna (VIII) of Nabonidus’ 12thsic?! year, which means that the labourers will start working only in another year time (unless there is an error in the copy, and they are to start immediately). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Arad-Marduk/Kittia//Šangû-Ea.
 
A =…-ušallim/Apkallu//Mušēzib; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 31567

Paraphrase:
Receipt for stones.
A received 600 (pieces) of limestone(?) (a-bat-tu4) from B. Payment is for half a year:  from last Addar (XII) till the end of Ulūl (VI).
 
A = Nādin/Ina-ṣilli-Bēl; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi
Title: BM 31307

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver.
A receives 1 1/2 shekels of silver, including the 1 shekel of silver that belongs to C, from B. This does not include (elat) payment for his rations (kurummatu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nūr-Šamaš; B = Nergal-rēṣūa; C = Nabû-ayyalu
Title: BM 31136

Paraphrase: Receipt concerning the return of livestock: The Puqudeans return the stolen goods (ultu libbi hubti, lit. “from the robbery”) of 8 livestock animals (mīru) and 10 young livestock animals (būru).
Title: BM 57149

Paraphrase:
Partly broken purchase of a built house: A purchases from B1 and B2 a built house (bītu epšu) for 1 2/3 minas of silver. The sold house is located in Cutha (further details broken) and measures 637 square cubits (147 m2). Its upper side (in the south) borders on the house of C1 and its lower side (in the north) on the house of C2. Its upper front (in the east) borders on the house of C3 and its lower front (in the west) on the house of C4. 4(+) witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller(s).
 
A = Bēl-iddin/Sîn-karābī-išmi; B1 = Sîn-ahu-iddin; B2 = […]u-uṣur/[…]; C1 = Eri[…]; C2 = […]; C3 = Iqīša/Nabû-šumu-iškun; C4 = Ahhē-lūmur; Scribe = Bulluṭ//Šūzubu
Title: A 6741

Paraphrase: Account of sheep: This is an account of sheep relating to the last three years (including the present year) and involving thousands of animals for which the accounts were already drawn up (nikkassu epēšu) at least in part. A certain amount of animals is at the disposal of (ina pāni) Munnabittu.
Title: NBC 1185
Place of issue Remark: no place given, but it must be Uruk

Paraphrase: Delivery note: 5 iron ploughshares (sikkatu) and 1 iron šeleppūtu-implement, in sum weighing 57 ½ minas of silver, are transferred from the ploughed land(?) (bīt mihṣi, mng. uncertain) to the storehouse (bīt karê)
Title: BM 92720

Paraphrase:
Court decision in Babylon: A1 and A2 bring a lawsuit against B before the assembly (puhru) of the citizens of Babylon concerning the prebend (isqu) of the cella (bīt papāhi) of the Šamaš Temple in Sippar which is patrimonial property of B. While they claim that they bought (kî kaspi mahāru) the prebend for 2 minas and 11 shekels of silver, B states that he only received 1 mina and 9 shekels of silver from C and A1. Following the decision of the assembly, B weighed out and paid (hâṭu nadānu) 1 mina and 9 shekels of silver to the claimants. For the remainder of 1 mina and 2 shekels of silver B has to take an oath (tamītu) at a temple (details are broken). Broken witness list and the scribe (name broken).
 
A1 = Bēl-iddin; A2 = Marduk; B = Šumu-iddin//Šangû-Šamaš; C = Murānu
Bibliography: Mentioned in Landsberger 1965: 31 and Nielsen 2011 passim.
Title: BM 74497

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document concerning the purchase of a slave girl (during a period of hardship): B approaches A and asks to lead away (abāku) and keep alive (bulluṭu) his small woman (sinništu ṣahirtu) fC for 6 shekels of silver. A accepts B’s offer and hands over the money. B guarantees (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqirānu) of fC. Witnesses and the scribe.

A = Ninurta-uballiṭ/Bēl-usāti; B = Nergal-ahu-uṣur/Iqīša; fC = Ṣullēa-tašmē
Bibliography: Mentioned by McCown and Haines, OIP 78 (1967), 76.
Title: IM 57913

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 1/3 minas and 2 ½ shekels of silver. As soon as the purchase price in Dûzu (IV), after the barley harvest, is set (uzuzzu) in Babylon, B will give to A 200 kor (3,600 l) of barley. B will pay the remainder (šittu) of the silver which is left (râhu) without interest (qaqqadu) within one year (ina ṭuppi). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šumu-ukīn/Isināya; B = Marduk-šākin-šumi/Mukallim; Scribe = Nummuru//Šigûa
Title: BM 38246

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: 1 mina of silver belonging to A is at the disposal of (ina pāni) B. The house of B is placed as a pledge. 2/3 out of 1 mina of silver is for the right of B to continue to live in his pledged house. The remainder of 1/3 mina of silver bears an interest of 1/5 shekel of silver per 1 shekel (20% p.a.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-zēru-ibni//Bēl-ibni; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Malāhu; Scribe = Šamaš-uballiṭ//Ninurta-iddin
Title: HS 548

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A1 and A2 purchase from B one share (zittu) of hanšû-land belonging to C for 6 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû). Both B and C form part of the Ilūtu-bāni Family. The sold share of land is located in the lower part of the city of Bēl-iqbi. It measures 16 square cubits (28 m2). The transaction was concluded before (ana mahar) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Borsippa (Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Ilia). 4 witnesses (including Nergal-ēṭir, Šāpik-zēri and Nabû-ušabši of the Iddin-Papsukkal Family and Lâbâši of the Ilūtu-bāni Family) and the scribe (of the Iddin-Papsukkal Family), also identified as the writer of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki).
 
A1 = Zākiru//Iddin-Papsukkal; A2 = Bābilāya//Iddin-Papsukkal; B = Nabû-ahu-ēreš//Ilūtu-bāni; C = Iddin-ahu//Ilūta-bāni; Scribe = Bēl-lē’i//Iddin-Papsukkal
Title: HS 455

Paraphrase:
Settlement of a dispute: A accused B to have in use his property. Their case has been brought before and decided by C and the citizens of Dilbat: B has to pay to A 10 shekels of silver. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mannu-kī-šarri; B = Upāqu; C = Bēl-ēpuš; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Sēkiru
Title: AO 5469

Paraphrase:
Retroact of a purchase of a date garden: In Kandalānu 9th year A purchases a date garden for ½ mina and 3 shekels of silver from B who, on his part, has previously purchased the garden from fC2 and her two sons C3 and C4 in Šamaš-šumu-ukīn 20th year. It is the inheritance share (zittu) of C1, deceased husband of fC2, and C2, brother of C1. The garden is located in the meadowland (ugāru) of Dūru-ša-Šulāya, in the district (pīhatu) Al-Kaldu, at the Balāssu Canal (Nāru-ša-Balāssu). It borders on land which A received from D. 8 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šāpik-zēri/Bammāya//Egibi; B = Bēl-iqīša/Šumu-iddin//Rab-banê; C1 = Rāši-ili/Bēl-zēri//Egibi; fC2 = fŠusitu, wife of C1; C3 = Arad-Bēl, son of C1; C4 = Nabû-zēru-ibni, son of C1; C5 = Bābu-iddin/Bēl-zēri//Egibi, brother of C1; D = Nabû-zēru-ušabši/Bābu-iddin; Scribe = Nergal-[…]/Ahu-šubši//Eppēš-ilī
Title: Ash. 1924. 483
Other markings Description: on the lower, left and right edges

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A purchases from the brothers B1 and B2 4 furrows (šer’u) of land for 6 shekels of silver. The sold land is located in the irrigation district (tamirtu) of Mušēzib-Uraš which forms part of the hanšû-land of Balāṭu/Nummuru and borders on the Šatammu Canal (Harru-ša-Šatammi). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Uraš-šumu-iddin; B1 = Ea-bāni//Bā’iru; B2 = Nabû-ahu-ēreš/Bā’iru; Scribe = Kudurru
Title: Ash. 1937.641
Other markings Description: on the upper, left and right edges

Paraphrase:
Agreement concerning the redemption (of debt) by means of the transfer of slaves: In the end of the following month, that is, Nisān (I), B will bring along and give (abāku-nadānu) the people (amīlūtu) to A. In case A agrees and takes them (abāku), B pays 1/3 shekel of silver to A. In case A does not agree and does not take them, B pays 2/3 mina and 5 shekels of silver to A. 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-īpuš; B = Upāqu; Scribe = Bēlšunu//Bēliā’u
Bibliography: BR 8/7, 39 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in  Nielsen 2011: 109, fn. 381. Duplicate MLC 496: BRM 1, 31 (edition).
Title: MLC 597

Paraphrase:
Exchange of fallow land: A and B exchange their fallow fields in Babylon. 10 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Marduk-šāpik-zēri/Bammāya/Egibi; B = Nādinu/Ahhēa/Bēl-ēṭir; Scribe = Nergal-ušēzib/Eppeš-ili
Title: YBC 11387

Paraphrase:
Loan of a woman: C, daughter of B, is at the disposal of (ina pāni) A1 and A2 for a yearly payment of 2 TÚG.UB.RA garments to Ištar of Uruk and Nanāya. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the royal resident (qīpu) of Eanna (Šamaš-ṣillāya). 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Iqīšāya/Marduk-šarrāni; A2 = Ṣillāya/Eanna-ibni; B = Eanna-ibni, father of C; C = Ilat, daughter of B; Scribe = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Šumāya
Title: NCBT 176

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Nanāya for 2 days, from the 9th to the 10th of Abu (IV) of the following year, for 39 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 1 shekel of silver, from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-udammiq) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Gimillu). 7 witnesses  and the scribe. The transaction takes place in a year of "locking of the gate" (edel bābi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Marduk-zēru-ibni/Nabû-zēru-ušabši; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Ahhēa
Title: IM 65076

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: ½ mina and 4 shekels of silver of A are at the disposal (ina pāni) of B for the investment in a business partnership (harrānu). This silver is the replacement (tahhu) of an equal share (ahātu), which is no longer existent. 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim; B = Rēmūtu; Scribe = Nabû-zēru-ibni/[…]
Title: VAT 17904

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a date garden (kirî gišimmari) for 2 ½ minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of one talbultu-garment, from B1. The purchase price corresponds to the claim (rašûtu) towards B2, the father of the seller, and, hence, is in fact not handed over; instead the garden serves as compensation. The transferred garden is located in the district (erṣetu) of the royal canal (nār šarri) in the meadowland (ugāru) of Uruk. Its upper side borders on (the property of) C1, its lower side on (the property of) C2 and its lower front on hanšû-land. Its upper front, which measures 230 cubits (115 m), follows the royal canal (nār šarri). No cardinal directions are given in the record. 17 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller. . The same type of procedure is recorded in BM118982.
 
A = Bēl-ibni/Šamaš-īpuš; B1 = Bēl-ahhē-erība/Ahhē; B2 = Ahhēa/Zabdānu; C1 = Balāṭu/Nabû-nāṣir; C2 = Nabû-lēˀi/Marduk; Scribe = Kidin-Marduk//(Ša)-rēš-ummāni
Title: BM 118977

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house in Uruk: A purchases a ruined house (bītu abtu) for 4 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B1. The sold house is the property of B2 whose relation to B1 remains unclear, and is located in the Eanna district (erṣet Eanna) inside Uruk. Its upper side (in the north) borders on a dead-end street (sūqu lā āṣû) as well as the house of C1 and its lower side (in the south) on the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the god and the king. Its upper front (in the west) borders on the house of C2 and its lower front (in the east) on the house(s) belonging to C1 and C3. No side lengths are given in the record. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Ahhēšāya). 8 witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B1 = Iddin-Marduk//Šumāya; B2 = Dumqāya/Šullumāya; C1 = Huddāya/Kukul; C2 = Kīnāya/Nādin-aplu; C3 = Nabû-šumu-ušarši/Ahhūtu; Scribe = Nabû-zēru-iqīša//Dayyānu
Title: BM 118975

Paraphrase: Siege text.
Title: YBC 11404

Paraphrase: List of offerings, possibly for the Šamaš Temple in Sippar: Pubescent bulls (alpu šuklulu), grown-up sheep (udgallu), young bulls (alpu bīru), yearlings (mār šatti), lambs (puhādu), ducks (paspasu) and TU.KIL-doves are provided for the gods Šamaš, Aya, Marduk, Ṣarpanītu, Bunene, Bēlit-Sippar, Anu, Enlil, Adad, Bēlit-[…], Anunītu and Bēlit-[…].
Title: BM 49185

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document concerning an adoption of a daughter: A1 and fA2, wife of A1, approach B1 and fB2 and ask them to adopt out and give them their daughter fC. B1 grants the request and entrusts fC. A1 voluntarily gives a TÚG.KUR.RA garment and a šir’am-garment, as an additional payment, to B1 and fB2. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Šamaš-uṣur//Ṣillāya; fA2 = fKidinnīti, wife of A1; B1 = Ninurta-iddin; fB2 = fLū-bēlti, wife of B1; fC = fAkkaiti; Scribe = Ahu-lūmur//Bēlšunu
Title: A 33248

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 50 shekels of silver. The debt will bear an interest of 12 shekels per mina (20% p.a.). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šumāya; B = Nabû-šumu-iškun (or: Bēl-šumu-iškun); Scribe = Bēl-iddin
Title: BM 56486

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 1 2/3 minas of silver. B will give the silver at the end of the month Ulūl (VI), that is, within half a year. If he fails to do so, the debt will bear a monthly interest of 2 shekels (40% p.a.). 6 witnesses (including Aššūr-ilāˀī, tašlīšu [third man] and Quqû, sēpiru [alphabetic scribe]) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ahu-iddin; B = Murānu; Scribe = Imbāya//Arkāt-ilāni
Bibliography: Unger 1931: 301, no. 30 (translation); BR 8/7, 51 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Landsberger 1965: 31-32; Nielsen 2011: 82, fn. 266.
Title: BM 30130

Paraphrase:
Redemption of a slave girl (during a period of hardship): A1, A2 and A3 redeem (paṭāru) from B his small woman (sinništu ṣahirtu) fC for the exact price (šīm hariṣ) of 22 shekels of silver. B guarantees (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqirānu) of fC. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Ninurta-uballiṭ /Bēl-usātu; A2 = Arad-Gula; A3 = Danni-Nergal; B = Nabû-ahu-uṣur; fC = fEṭirtu
Bibliography: Mentioned by McCown and Haines, OIP 78 (1967), 76.
Title: IM 57915 (2 NT 295)
BM 51960

Paraphrase:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases wasteland (eqlu kišubbû) for 1 5/6 minas of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from the brothers B1 and B2. The sold land is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Gate of É.LUGAL.GU(D).SI.SÁ inside Nippur. Its upper side (in the north), its lower side (in the south) and its upper front (in the east) border on the houses of C1, C2 and C3. Its lower front (in the west) borders on the street (sūqu). It measures [x] x 25 cubits ([x] x 12.5 m). 38(+) witnesses and the scribe, also identified as the writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Instead of seal impressions (kunukku), fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of B1 and B2.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ahu-ušbši; B1 = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Nabû-ahhē-erība; B2 = Nabû-ahu-iddin/Nabû-ahhē-erība; C1 = Nabû-iqīša//Bēl-iddin; C2 = Bēl-zēri//Zēru-ibni; C3 = Ahhēšāya//Dummuqu; Scribe = Lā-qēpu//Ēa-īpuš
Title: HS 454

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B1 and B2 owe A 10 shekels of silver. This loan is connected to land the creditor leases to the two debtors for cultivation (errešūtu). 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Tabnēa//Aplāya; B1 = […]/Zērūtu; B2 = Ninurta/Zērūtu; Scribe = Kidin-Nanāya/Marduk-šarrani
Title: CBS 2153

Paraphrase:
Administrative document dealing with the redistribution of tax income in the form of emmer beer: In sum 0;1.0.6  kor (42 l) of first quality (rēštu) emmer beer (kunāšu) of tax income (nisihtu) are given out under the supervision of (ša qātē) of A. In detail: 0;0.0.3 kor (3 l) from B1 to the women fC1 and fC2 on the 3rd, 4th and 5th day of Šabāṭ (XI), 0;0.0.24 kor (24 l) from B2 to C3 on the 4th day of Šabāṭ (XI), 0;0.0.3 kor (3 l) from B3 to C4 on the 5th day of Šabāṭ (XI) and 0;0.0.6 kor (6 l) from B1 for drink (ana šatê) to the women of the palace (sinništu ša ekalli) on the 6th day Šabāṭ (XI).
 
A = Akbāru; B1 = Nabû-dīnī-ēpuš; B2 = Bēl-uballiṭ; B3 = Nabû-mukīn-ahi; fC1 = Atkî-ili; fC2 = Išipta’; C3 = Barāqā; C4 = Nabû-ana-kâša-atkal
Bibliography: Thureau-Dangin, RA 6 (1907), 134–136 (copy, transliteration, translation); Moore, NBBAD (1935), no. 3 (transliteration, translation).
Title: AO 4423

Paraphrase:
Promissory note of silver: B owes to A 1 mina and 4 shekels of silver. The debt will bear an interest of 12 shekels of silver per mina (20% p.a). His entire assets are placed as pledge. Broken witness list.

A = Bēl-ēṭir/Iqišāya/Gahal; B = Bēl-ibni/Tappûa//Gahal
Title: Ash. 1924.2301

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A purchases from B 0;0.1.3 square kor (675 m2) garden for 3 shekels of silver. The garden is located along the Lagamal Canal (Harru-ša-Lagamal). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mukīn-zēri//Basia; B = Nabû-šumu-iškun//Bēl-ibni; Scribe = Bēl-ēṭir
Title: Ash. 1924.489

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document about a settlement of a dispute concerning a house: The brothers B1, B2 and B3 approach the brothers A1 and A2 concerning the house of their father which has been destroyed when their father was guarantor for C1. A1 and A2 do not agree and reply that C2, son of C1, has declared the claim for invalid. Instead of a legal proceeding, A1 and A2 agree to pay 7.5 minas of silver to B1, B2 and B3, provided that there is no further claim. Guarantee clauses. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Šumu-ukīn/Kudurru; A2 = Šākin-šumi/Kudurru; B1 = Nādin-ahi/Nabû-šumu-ēreš; B2 = Nabû-ušallim/Nabû-šumu-ēreš; B3 = Nabû-ēṭir/Nabû-šumu-ēreš; C1 = Nabû-zēru-ušabši; C2 = Mušallim-Marduk/Nabû-zēru-ušabši
Bibliography: AO 6820: edited as TCL 12, 14; NBBAD 14 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Nielsen 2011: 232, fn. 33.
Title: YBC 11414

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share of the prebend of the butcher (ṭābihūtu) in Esangila for 2 days in the month Kislīm (IX) for 53 shekels of silver from B. 15 witnesses and the scribe, specified as writer of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki).

A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin; B = Nūrea; Scribe = Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Marduk-ēṭir//Mudammiq-Adad
Bibliography: Mentioned in Nielsen 2011 passim. Bab. 33859: Weidner, AfO 16: 45 (partial transliteration).
Title: YBC 11392

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Nanāya for 3 days, from the 16th to the 18th of Simān (III) of the following year, for 50 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 1 shekel of silver, from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-udammiq) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Gimillu). 4 witnesses  and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šaṭir ṭuppi). The transaction takes place in the 4th year of "locking of the gate" (edel bābi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Ṭubbušu/Bēlšunu; Scribe = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Zākiru
Title: IM 65089

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2/3 mina of silver without interest (qaqqadu) of a business partnership. The debt is free of interest (hubuttūtu) until the midst of Nisān (I) of the following year (Ššu 19). If B fails to pay by then, the amount of silver will be added to the sum A invested in the same business partnership (harrānu). 1 square kor of arable land (zēru) of B, located beneath the Canal (harru) of Ahhē-šullim, as well as 294+ square cubits (c. 73.5 m2) of the house of B are placed as a pledge. 3 witnesses (including Nabû-gāmil and his son Nādinu of the Ṭābihu family) and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B = Bēl-nāṣir//Ṭābihu; Scribe = Nabû-nāṣir/[…]
Title: VAT 17891

Paraphrase: Heavily broken legal document about the payment of a silver amount. Broken witness list on the reverse.
Bibliography: Brinkman, JCS 25: 93, fn. 29 (partial translation, including date).
Title: LB 859

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes ½ mina of silver to A. The debt will bear an interest of 1/5 (hummušu) shekel of silver per shekel (20% p.a). 3 witnesses (including Nergal-nāṣir//Nabû-ahu-ēreš) and the scribe.
 
A = Ahu-umma-aqar//Lā-qīpu; B = Ilāya//Nabû-ahu-ēreš; Scribe = Ninurta-nāṣir//Lā-qīpu
Title: NBC 6143

Paraphrase: Administrative record concerning the expense of wool: 38 minas of kitinnû-cloth for ṣibtu-garments are at the disposal (ina pāni) of Iqīša.
Title: BM 49188

Bibliography: BR 8/7, 1 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Nielsen 2011: 279, fn. 214.
Title: BM 75975

Paraphrase:
Transfer of a slave girl (during a period of hardship): fB voluntarily (ina hūd libbišu) sells the young woman (sinništu ṣahirtu) fC1, in the presence of her mother fC2, to A1, A2 and A3 for the exact price (šīm hariṣ) of 22 shekels of silver. fC1 is handed over – there will be no retracting among them. fB, fC2 and D and guarantee (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) or claimants (pāqirānu) of fC1. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Iddin-Nergal; A2 = Arad-Gula; A3 = Ninurta-uballiṭ; fB = fAhatu; fC1 = fdIM.ZU.AN.NA-en-qit; fC2 = fIna-Nippur-bēlit; D = Iddin-ahu
Bibliography: Mentioned by McCown and Haines, OIP 78 (1967), 76.
Title: IM 57919

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A1 3 ½ minas of silver. The debt is secured by the pledge of the garden of B, which is located between the cities of Kiš and Hursag-kalamma and borders on (the property of) C. Since A2, son of A1, has given the promissory note (uˀiltu) at the expense of (ša muhhi) the debtor B, in replacement of the purchase price of 1 mina and 14 shekels of silver to D, B shall pay the silver to D. 11 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Ahhūtu//Dannēa; A2 = Šumu-iddin/Ahhūtu//Dannēa; B = Bābu-iddin/Ahhē-iddin; C = Mušibši; D = Šarēdu/Bābia; Scribe = Zākiru/Bēl-lēˀu//Irˀanni
Title: BM 40040

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B1 and B2 owe to A 3 kor (540 l) of dates without interest (qaqqadu). They will pay the dates in the month Kislīm (IX). They mutually guarantee (pūtu našû) for the payment of the debt. 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-bēl-ili//Ibni-ili; B1 = Nabû-gāmil//Aqar-Nabû; B2 = Nabû-nāṣir//Naggāru; Scribe = Nabû-mudammiq//Ilūšu-abišu
Title: HS 511

Paraphrase:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases wasteland (eqlu kišubbû) for 10 shekels of silver from B2, who acts on behalf of the wife of the deceased B1. The sold land is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Gate of LUGAL.GU(D).SI.SÁ inside of Nippur. Its upper side (in the north) borders on a house of A and its upper front (in the west) on the house of C. Its lower side (in the south) and its lower front (in the east) border on the plot of land within a measured area (libbū eqli). It measures 31 x 2 cubits (15.5 x 1 m). 13 witnesses and the scribe, also identified as the writer of the tablet (šāṭir ṭuppi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B.
 
A = Bulluṭu//Bēl-rībi; B1 = Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ahu-dannu; B2 = Bulluṭu//Zēria; C = Amāssu-ul-tēnnu//Rēmūtu; Scribe = Naram-Sîn//Nabû-ahhē-iddin
Title: HS 453

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 8 shekels of silver. Beginning with the current day, the debt will bear an interest of 1/5 shekel per shekel (20% p.a.). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ninurta-ahhē-erība//Kināya; B = Ulūlāya//Ibbūtu; Scribe = Sîn-rāˀim-šumu//Marduk-zēru-ibni
Title: CBS 2152

Paraphrase: Administrative document dealing with the expenses of emmer beer: Emūq-Bēl provides the palace women (sinništu ša ekalli) for drink (ana šatê) with 0;0.0.3 kor (3 l) emmer beer (ulušinnu) on both the 20th and the 21st of Ṭebēt (X).
Bibliography: Thureau-Dangin, RA 6 (1907), 134–135 (copy, transliteration, translation); Moore, NBBAD (1935), no. 2 (transliteration, translation).
Title: AO 4424

Paraphrase:
Loan of barley: B owes A 1 kor (360 l) of barley. The debt will bear an interest of 0;1 kor (36 l) per 1 kor of barley (20% p.a.). The barley has to be paid in the warehouse (kalakku). 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A = Nergal-ušallim; B = Bābu-ēreš; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iškun
Title: Ash. 1924.1653

Paraphrase:
Retroact of a purchase of land: A purchases from B land located along the Lagamal Canal (Harru-ša-Lagamal). Details are omitted through hepû-notes. 8 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mukīn-zēri//Basia; B = Nabû-iqīsa; Scribe = Bēl-ēṭir
Title: Ash. 1924.488

Paraphrase: Dialogue document concerning a purchase: Heavily broken dialogue document over the purchase of a house or land.
Title: VAT 17917
Other markings Description: nail impression on the preserved edges

Paraphrase:
Division of land: A1 and A2 receive from B for 15 shekels of silver a share of the land of C which borders on (the property of) D. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-zēru-ibni; A2 = Mušallim-Adad; B = Nabû-nādin-ahi; C = Libluṭ
D = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Bēl-ēṭir = A1?; Scribe = Nabû-upahhir//Ilēˀi-bulluṭ-Asarluhi
Title: YBC 11428

Paraphrase:
Broken dialogue document about a settlement of a dispute concerning small livestock: According to this fragmentary record 38 small livestock animals must be brought to the bishop (šatammu). In case the accused fails to do so, he has to pay 2 minas of silver. 5 witnesses and the scribe, specified as writer of the promissory note (šāṭir u’ilti) and bearing the title “scribe of Eanna.”
 
Scribe = Širikti-Marduk/Ibni-Ištar, scribe of Eanna
Title: YBC 3505

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Nanāya for 3 days, from the 3rd to the 5th of Simān (III) of the following year, for 5/6 mina of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 1 shekel of silver, from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-udammiq) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Gimillu). 2 witnesses  and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šaṭir ṭuppi). The transaction takes place in a year of "locking of the gate" (edel bābi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of the seller.
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Ṭubbušu/Bēlšunu; Scribe = Naˀid-Marduk/Iddin-Nabû
Title: IM 65086

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A ½ mina of silver. Beginning with the month Dûzu (IV), the debt will bear a yearly interest of [x] shekels per mina. C is placed as a pledge. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B = Aqarâ//Hattāya; C = […]; Scribe = Šabāya//Egibi
Title: VAT 17890

Paraphrase:
Settlement of a dispute concerning a pledged house: Law case concerning a house which C2, the guarantor (māhiṣ pūti), has pledged to B1, creditor in an interest-bearing loan (hubullānu) of 2 minas of silver, to C1, the brother of C2. When B2, the son of B1, on the basis of a sealed document (ṭuppu kī kanāku), claims his rights on the said house, A asserts that the house was already pledged to him. Following the decision of the assembly (puhru) of the Babylonians and the governor (šākin ṭēmi), A paid the 2 minas of silver to B2 and in return received a sealed document (kunukku). Now, the house, as a pledge, is only at the disposal of A. 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu/Sîn-nāṣir; B1 = Kunāya//Basia; B2 = Nabû-ēṭir (A)/Kunāya/Basia; C1 = Šulāya//Ṭābia; C2 = Nabû-ēṭir (B)//Ṭābia; Scribe = Marduk-nāṣir//Mudammiq-Adad
Title: BM 118983

Paraphrase:
Manumission of an (temporarily) unfree individual: A redeems (paṭāru) C from B for 1 mina and 4 shekels of silver. B guarantees against transgressors (sēhû) and claimants (pāqirānu). 7 witnesses (including Naṭeru, man from Ru’a) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ahu-iddin; B = Šumāya; C = Ina-ṣilli-Nusku; Scribe = Šamaš-erība
Title: NBC 6142

Paraphrase: Administrative document listing garden plots of different sanctuaries along with their gardeners. The record has been drawn up my Nabû-ušallim//Sîn-leqe-unninnī, who bears the titles lamentation priest (kalû) of Ištar, scribe (ṭupšarru) Eanna and priest (šangû) of Nusku.
Bibliography: Cocquerillat 1968: 107 (partial transliteration). Mentioned in Nielsen 2011 passim.
Title: VAT 8497
Place of issue Remark: no place given, but it must be Uruk

Paraphrase: Label of the female slave Hepāya who is under the supervision (ša qātē) of Sîn-ēreš.
Bibliography: Bezold 1891: 564 (copy of date); KB 4: 166-67 (transliteration, translation); Durand, JA 267, no. 19 (transliteration, in part). Catalogued in Studies Oppenheim: 43, no. 44.2.13.
Title: K 3787

Paraphrase:
Redemption of a slave girl (during a period of hardship): A1, A2 and A3 redeem (paṭāru) from fB her small woman (sinništu ṣahirtu) fC for the exact price (šīm hariṣ) of 22 shekels of silver. fB guarantees (pūtu našû) against transgressors (sēhû) or claimants (pāqirānu) of fC1. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Ninurta-uballiṭ/Bēl-usāti; A2 = Arad-Gula; A3 = Danni-Nergal; fB = Bau-asīti/Šamaš-iddin; fC = Tuqnīti
Bibliography: Mentioned by McCown and Haines, OIP 78 (1967), 76.
Title: IM 57918

Paraphrase:
Dialogue document concerning a self-adoption (during times of siege): The first 5 lines of the tablet are broken. The preserved text starts with the approach of fB towards A, who asks A to feed her and take her as his slave. A grants the request and determines her maintenance costs (kurummatu). In case her husband, her son, her brother or another relative would like to redeem (paṭāru) fB, he has to replace her in equal terms. Curse formula. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Aplāya//Šangû-Sippar; fB = fMaqartu; Scribe = Šākin-šumi//Ša-nāšišu
Title: BM 74652

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: 1 1/2 mina of silver belonging to A are at the disposal of (ina pāni) B. The debtor will pay the capital sum (qaqqudu) of the debt at the opening of the gate (ina petî bābi). 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ninurta-ušallim//Nabû-useppi; B = Ninurta-gāmil//Aplāya; Scribe = Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Rabû-zēru-ibni
Title: HS 486

Paraphrase:
Purchase of wasteland: A purchases wasteland (eqlu kišubbû) for 9 ½ shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B. The sold land is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Gula Gate inside Nippur. Its upper side (in the north), with a street (sūqu) lying inbetween (ina bīrišunu), borders on (the property of) C1 and its lower side (in the south) on (the property of) C2. Its upper front (in the east) borders on the Šalla Canal and its lower front (in the west) on (the property of) the seller B, which is a plot of land within a measured area (libbū eqli). It measures 24 x 6 cubits (12 x 3 m). 7 witnesses and the scribe, also identified as the writer of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki). Also fD is present at the sealing and receives 3 shekels of silver. Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B.
 
A = Enlil-ibni//Nabû-bāna; B = Nabû-ahu-ēreš//Dābibī; C1 = Lâbâši//Katirru; C2 = Šāpiku//Banāya; fD = fŠa-bullat/Šumu-uṣur; Scribe = Nabû-nāˀid//Damiqia
Title: HS 452

Bibliography: Oppenheim, BASOR 91: 37-38 (partial transliteraton and translation); BR 8/7, 44 (transliteration, translation). Mentioned in Hilprecht, ZA 4: 166 (mention of date).
Title: CBS 11633
Other markings Description: on right edge, left edge and upper edge

Paraphrase: This is an administrative document dealing with the redistribution of tax income (nisihtu) in the form of white beer, date beer and dates.
Title: AO 4422

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases 3 square kor (40,500 m2) of garden for 2 minas and 26 shekels of silver, together with an additional payment of 3 kor (540 l) of dates and a TÚG.KUR.RA garment (cover [kuttumu] for women), from B1. The garden is located at the Šamaš Gate of Dilbat and borders on the Lagamal Canal (Harru-ša-Lagamal), the New Wall of Dilbat (dūru eššu ša Dilbat) and the property of C. The silver was given to D, creditor of B2. 9 witnesses and scribe.
 
A = Marduk-šāpik-zēri/Bammāya//Egibi; B1 = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Lâbâši//Basia, son of B2; B2 = Lâbâši//Basia, father of B1; C = Kudurru/Bēl-ēṭir/Šangû-Dilbat; D = Šullumu/Kunāya; Scribe = Etellu/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Egibi
Title: Ash. 1924.482

Paraphrase:
Copy of a purchase of a garden: A purchases from B 0;0.3 square kor (1,350 m2) of garden for 8.5 shekels of silver. The garden is located along the Lagamal Canal (Harru-ša-Lagamal) and forms part of the hanšû-land of C. Curses. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Kalbi/Nūrea; B = Nādin/Lagamal-ēṭir; C = Iddināya/Ēppeš-ili; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iškun//Sēkiru
Title: Ash. 1924.487

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 15 shekels of silver. If B fails to pay by the month of Nisān (I) of the following year, the debt will bear interest of [x] shekel of silver. The remainder of the operative section and the witness list are not preserved.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim// Lēˀêa; B = […]//Šulāya
Title: VAT 17916

Paraphrase:
Exchange of date gardens: A and B exchange their date gardens with each other. B receives 0;1 square kor (2,700 m2) cultivated date garden which is located at the Lagamal Canal and borders on (the property of) C. A receives 0;1.3 square kor (4,050 m2) cultivated date garden. In case of breach of contract, the fine is 2 minas of silver. 8 witnesses and the scribe, also described as writer of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki).
 
A = Ea-ibni/Bēl-lēˀi; B = Ṣillāya/Erība/Šangû-Dilbat; C = Šāpik-zēri/Bammāya/Egibi; Scribe = Lagamal-ušabši/Šangû-Dilbat
Title: YBC 11388

Paraphrase:
Lease of a prebend: B rents out to A [x] days, the remainder ([  b]?-ab-ti) of ten days, of the prebend of the brewer (sirāšūtu). C, brother of B, is guarantor. The debt is secured by a pledge in terms of a share of the prebend of the temple enterer (ērib bītūti) of B and C. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ēṭir/Bānia; B = Ṣillāya/Ir’anni; C = Aplāya/Ir’anni; Scribe = Tabnēa/Balīhu
Title: NBC 4977

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases a share (isqu) of the prebend of the baker (nuhatimmūtu) before Nanāya for half of the 1st day of Simān (III) of the following year for 6 ½ shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of ¼ shekel of silver, from B. The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina ušuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Nabû-udammiq) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Gimillu). 2 witnesses  and the scribe. The transaction takes place in a year of "locking of the gate" (edel bābi). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) (of the seller).
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Bēl-iddin; B = Lâbâši/Gudādû; Scribe = Mukīn-zēri/Kudurru
Title: IM 65085

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A 2/3 mina and 6 shekel of silver. The debt will bear a yearly interest of [x] shekels per mina. The field (eqlu) of B, situated beneath the Canal of the Mulberry (harru ša ṣarbi), is placed as a pledge. 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-ušallim//Lēˀêa; B = Aqarâ//Šangû-Enamtila; Scribe = Marduk-šumu-ibni//Sîn-tabni
Title: VAT 17900

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases an orchard (kirû) for 3 minas and 50 shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû) in pieces (šibirtu), together with an additional payment (atru) of 15 shekels of silver, from B. The sold orchard is the 1/6 (inheritance) share (zittu) which B2, the father of the seller, received from B3, the grandfather of the seller. It is located in the meadowland (ugāru) of Uruk. Its upper side, its lower side and its upper front border on (the properties of) C1, C2 and C3. Its lower front border on the royal canal (nār šarri). Neither cardinal directions nor measures are given for the sides of the plot. 11 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B1. In YBC11413 we learn about two other 1/6 shares of the inheritance of Ahhēa.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu/Sîn-nāṣir; B1 = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Ibnāya/Ṭābia; B2 = Ibnāya/Ahhēa/Ṭābia; B3 = Ahhēa/Aplāya/Ṭābia; C1 = Kudurru//Nabû-naˀid; C2 = Nādinu//Ērešu; C3 = Pirˀu//Bēl-useppi; Scribe = Nabû-ahu-ēreš/Šāpiku/Atkuppu
Title: BM 118980

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a garden: A purchases a half share (ahu) of a date garden (kirî gišimmari) for 2 ½ minas of silver, together with an additional payment (atru) of 5 shekels of silver, from B1 and B2 (B1’s mother). The sold garden belongs to B3 (the [deceased] father of B1) and is located in the district (erṣetu) of the Ninurta Temple inside of Uruk. Its upper side borders on the city wall (dūr āli), its lower side on the house of C1, its upper front on the street (sūqu) and its lower front on (the property of) C2. No cardinal directions are given in the record. Its upper side measures 300 cubits (150 m), its lower side and upper front 240 cubits (120 m) and its lower front 190 cubits (95 m). The plot presumably is the second half of the land bought by A from B1 and B2 one year earlier (BM118979). The transaction is concluded in the presence of (ina uzuzzi) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Uruk (Ahhēšāya) and the bishop (šatammu) of Eanna (Balāṭu). 14 witnesses and the scribe. Fingernail impressions (ṣupru) of sellers.
 
A = Mušēzib-Marduk/Kiribtu; B1 = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Kudurru; B2 = Nasqat; B3 = Kudurru/Nabû-ahu-ēreš; C1 = Zākiru, aškāpu (leatherworker); C2 = Zibāya//Šangû-Ninurta; Scribe = Bēl-īpuš//Šamaš-bāri
Title: BM 118972

Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver payment: A receives from B the entire white silver with stamp-mark (kaspu peṣû ša ginni) according to his promissory note (u’iltu). Remainder of the obverse broken. Witnesses and the scribe. Additional note: A, on behalf of C, received from B 2 ½ shekels of silver with stamp mark.
 
A = Nabû-rēmanni/Nabû-iqīša//Ibni-Adad; B = Ahušunu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddi//Nanāhu; C = Nabû-ittannu; Scribe = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Iqīša//Balāṭu
Title: BM 94721

Paraphrase:
Note of receipt: C receives the rent of the house from B by order of fA. Not witnesses and no scribe.
 
fA =  fHiptāya/Nādinu; B = Nabû-iddin/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi; C = Nabû-iddin/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni
Title: BM 95000

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B1 and his wife fB2 owe A dates, impost (imittu) of the garden on the ditch (harru) of Bīt-Apkallu. They will give the dates at the entrance of the warehouse (bāb kalakki), according to the measure (mašīhu) of A. Kiln-fired bricks (agurru) and a previous claim (rašûtu) are mentioned. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Iddināya//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni, ērib bīt Nabû (enterer of the Nabû Temple); B1 = Nabu-zēru-iddin/Bēlu-usātu//Pahhāru; fB2 = fGugua; Scribe = Ezida-šumu-ibni/Arad-Nabû//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni
Title: YBC 9194

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 45 kor of dates (8,100 l), impost (imittu), harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of [...]. He will pay the dates, together with 3 kor dates, remainder of [...], [...]. Remainder broken. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šumāya//Ilī-bāni, ērib bīt Nabû (enterer of the Nabû Temple); B = Nabû-iddin/Ezida-šumu-ibni//Sippê; Scribe = Nabû-uballiṭ/Nabû-[...]//Ilī-bāni
Title: BM 94743
BM 94610

Paraphrase:
Work contract: B1 and B2 will make (labānu) bricks, equivalent of 2 shekels of silver, and deliver them to A (for firing in the oven [utūnu]?). Witnesses and the scribe. Additional clause referring to a promissory note (u’iltu) concerning dates.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B1 = Nabû-ēṭir/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//Naggāru; B2 = Šamaš-aplu-uṣur/Nabû-nāṣir//Ṣillāya; Scribe = B2
Title: YBC 9187

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A 13 kor (2,340 l) of dates, impost (imittu), harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of the irrigation district (tamirtu) Bāb-surri. He will pay the dates in Arahsamna (VIII), according to the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu. The (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.). This record is linked to the documents BM94507 and BM94548.
 
A = Nidinti-Bēl/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Bēl- eṭēru; B = Sîn-iddin/Talīmu; Scribe = Nā’id-Bēl
Title: BM 94527

Title: BM 94747

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B1 owes A dates, impost (imittu) of the palm grove, at a ratio of 5 measures (mašīhu) for 1 kor. B1 and fB2 will cut (nakāsu) the dates from trees together and divide the profit (utru). Witnesses including Nergal-ašarēdu, brother of A.
 
A = Marduk-šumu-iškun/Puhhuru//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B1 = Marduk-šarrāni/Erība//Dayyān-Papsukkal; fB2 = fKulla
Title: YBC 9186

Paraphrase:
Lease of land: B1 and B2 rent for gardening (ana nukaribbūti ṣabātu) 1;4 square kor (24,300 m2) of arable land (zēru) located at the Oven Gate (bāb kīri) from A. The details of this agreement are broken. 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Puhhuru//Ilūtu-bani; B1 = Nanāya-ēreš; B2 = Nabû-bāni-zēri; Scribe = Bēl-mudammiq//Maštuku
Bibliography: reedition: Joannès 1989, 203; San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 46 (transliteration, translation).
Title: HS 577

Paraphrase: Letter of Balāṭu to Zēr-Bābili about the fact that he has nothing and that Zēr-Bābili shall pay 1 1/4 shekels of silver of the last and the present year to fUbartu who shall bring it (to Balāṭu). The whereabout of fUbartu is known by Mār-bīti-šumu-uṣur.
Title: HS 704

Paraphrase:
Loan of barley: B owes A 1 kor (180 l) of barley, impost (imittu), harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) in the irrigation district (tamirtu) Hallatu. The field’s surface area (qaqqaru) measures 60 cubits. It is the share (pūt zitti, wr. {pūt} pūt zitti) that belongs to A, including the 8th share that belongs to C. He will pay the barley in Arahsamna (VIII) in Borsippa in the house of A. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-ahu-rēmanni/Libluṭ//Rab-tarbāṣi; C = Murašû/Iddin-Marduk//Ilia; Scribe = Mār-bīti-iddin/Šamaš-ahu-iddin
Title: BM 94625

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A [x] amounts of silver. He will pay the silver in Addar (XII). Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Zēr-Bābili/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Eal-ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Naggāru; Scribe = Nabû-šar-[…]/Širik[…]//[…]
Title: BM 94839

Paraphrase:
Lease of land for gardening: The brothers A1 and A2 rent out to B for gardening (nukaribbūtu) the garden located in the hanšû-land of Bīt-Apkallu, which they have received from the son of C. 2+ witnesses (including Šulāya/Arad-Nabû//Ilī-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Aplāya//Ilī-bāni; A2 = Nabû-mušētiq-uddi/Aplāya//Ilī-bāni; B = Bēl-nāṣir//Ša-haṭṭi-ēreš; C = Marduk-zēru-ibni//Gallābu; Scribe = Nabû-dābib-šunu//Ša-haṭṭi-ēreš
Title: YBC 9189

Paraphrase:
Announcement of a redemption: If B pays 1 2/3 minas and 3 shekels of silver for 0;1.4 square kor (4,500 m2) of arable land (zēru) within the present year, he will receive the sealed tablet (kunukku) over the ownership of the land. If B fails to do so, A will be the owner of the field. 6 witnesses and the scribe, also defined as writer of the tablet (šāṭir uˀilti).
 
A = Puhhuru//Ilūtu-bani; B = Šumāya//Ilūtu-bani; Scribe = Nabû-šumu-iškun//Huṣābu
Bibliography: reedition: Joannès 1989, 191; San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 21 (transliteration, translation).
Title: HS 547

Paraphrase: Letter of Zērūtu to Puhhuru, his father, about the fact that Andahar has received the measurements (mašīhu) of dates and barley.
Title: HS 702

Paraphrase:
Broken loan of dates: fB1 and B2 owe A [x];1 kor (36+ l) dates, impost (imittu), harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) of Bāb-surri. A pledge is placed. They will pay the dates in Arahsamna (VIII) in the house of A, according to the measure (mašīhu) of the king. They will also give loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu). The (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.). This is apart from (elat) 1 kūṣayu date palm. Witnesses and the scribe. This record is linked to the documents BM94527 and BM94548.
 
fA1 = name lost; A2 = Nabû-[…], B = Nidinti-Bēl/Šumu-iddin/Bēl-eṭēru; Scribe = […]/Nādinu//Rē’išunu
Title: BM 94507

Paraphrase:
Loan of dates: B owes A [x kor] of barley, harvest of the field (ebūr eqli) from a stretch of land (qaqqaru) with a 100 (cubits) long short side (pūt eqli). B will give the barley in Ayyār (II) in Borsippa. He will also give 3 bundles of straw and 0;0.1 kor (6 l) of cress (sahlû). Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = […]/Nabû-šumu-iškun//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-ahu-iddin/Gimillu; Scribe = Marduk/Nabû-lē’i/Mubannû
Title: BM 94600

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A silver. The female slave fC is placed as a pledge. D has received (verb reconstructed) from E the silver for guaranteeing against the holder of prior claims (uškûtu). 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Širiktu/Nabû-ēṭir//Ea-ilūtu-bāni; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; fC = fAnabītišu; D = Nuhannu; E = Iddin-Nabû; Scribe = Rēmūt-Bēl/Bēl-iddin//Si’aya
Title: NBC 6124

Paraphrase:
Exchange of land: A receives from B 0;2 square kor (5,400 m2) of arable land (zēru) forming part of the hanšû-land of C1. Its upper side and its lower side border on (property already owned by) A. Furthermore, the upper side as well as the upper front border on a plot of land within a measured area (libbū eqli). The lower side also borders on the marsh (raqqatu) of Aṣūnu. In exchange for his land, B receives 20 shares of hanšû-land of C2 located in the irrigation district (tamirtu) Guraˀbi. The transaction is concluded before (ina mahar) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Borsippa (Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Ilia) and the bishop (šatammu) of Ezida (Nabû-nādin-šumi//Nūr-Papsukkal). Though no titles are given along the two individuals, their identification as governor and bishop respectively is clear. 5 witnesses (including Arad-Sutīti, the father of A) and the scribe.
 
A = Puhhuru/Arad-Sutīti//Ilūtu-bāni; B = Marduk-šarrāni//Ilia, šāpir sirāšāni (overseer of the brewers); C1= Bēlšunu//Da[…]; C2 = Supê-Bēl//Ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-šākin-šumi//Arkāt-ilāni-damqāti
Bibliography: reedition: Joannès 1989, 174; San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 42 (transliteration, translation).
Title: HS 467

Paraphrase: Letter of Madān-rabî to Zēr-Bābili out of concern (kî nakutti) about the matter of clothes (muṣiptu) the addressee should buy (ana kaspi našû) and bring.

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: B owes A ½ mina of silver with stamp-mark (kaspu ša ginni), without interest (qaqqadu). He will pay the silver in […] together with interest. Another, broken clause, referring to barley, follows. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Rēmūt-Nabû/Nergal-ēṭir; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/[…]//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Nabû-kāṣir/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Iddin-Papsukkal
Title: BM 94854

Paraphrase:

Title: BM 96362

Paraphrase:
Receipt of work performance: A receives from B the work (dullu) of the water performed by C for a period until the end of the Ayyār (II) of the present year. 2 witnesses (Šamaš-iddin/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni) and the scribe.
 
A = Arad-Bēl/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Itinnu; B = Širiktu; C = Ayalu; Scribe = Arad-Bēl/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Itinnu
Title: NBC 8340

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a share of hanšu-land: (During times of hardship) A purchases one half share (mišli zitti) of hanšu-land belonging to C for 12 shekels of silver in pieces (šibirtu) from B1 and B2. The sold land reaches from the Old Canal to the dyke (kilâtu). The measured area (mišihtu) of its ditch (sūru) beneath (šupālu) the town of Bēl-iqbi is 13 square cubits (22.75 m2). The transaction is concluded in the presence of the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Borsippa (Nabû-bēl-šumāti//Iliya) and the bishop (šatammu) of Ezida (Nabû-nādin-šumi//Nūr-Papsukkal). The main part of the witness list together with the date and other possible text parts are broken. The few names preserved from the witness list are incomplete and described as “broken” (hepû).

A = Arad-Sutīti//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; B1 = Zākiru//Iddin-Papsukkal; B2 = Raši-ili//Iddin-Papsukkal; C = Nādin-ahi//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni
Bibliography: reedition: Joannès 1989, 171; San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 7 (transliteration, translation).
Title: HS 461

Paraphrase: Loan of silver:  B owes A [x] amounts of silver, price for a donkey.
Title: BM 95144

Paraphrase:
Receipt of barley: A receives from B 3 kor of barley according to his promissory note (u’iltu) due from B. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Lâbâši-Marduk/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Balāṭu; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēr-Bābili//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; Scribe = Lâbâši-Marduk/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti
Title: BM 94792

Paraphrase:
Loan of silver: A owes B 2 shekels of silver. He will pay the silver together with interest. Broken additional clause (elat).

Title: BM 94880

Paraphrase:
Purchase of land: A purchases 0;0.0.2 square kor (150 m2) arable land (zēru) for 3 ¾ shekels of white silver (kaspu peṣû) from B. The sold land is located within the (area of the) Old Canal (nāru labīru) at the Oven Gate (bāb kīri) and belongs to the ḫanšû-land of C. Its upper side, its lower side and its upper front border on (property already owned by) the buyer. Its upper front borders on (the property of) D. The transaction is concluded before (ana mahar) the governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Borsippa (Nabû-zēru-līšir//Arkāt-ilāni-damqāti) and the bishop (šatammu) of Ezida (Zēr-Bābili//Nūr-Papsukkal). 5 witnesses (including Nabû-ahhē-iddin, another member of the Ilūtu-bāni Family and Mār-bīti-ili, another member of the Arkāt-ilāni-damqāti Family) and the scribe, also identified as the writer of the sealed tablet (šāṭir kunukki). Instead of a seal impression (kunukku), fingernail impression (ṣupru) of B.
 
A = Puhhuru//Ilūtu-bāni; B = Nabû-lēˀi/Tabnēa/Ilūtu-bāni; C = Illûa//Ilūtu-bāni; D = Balāṭu; Scribe = Nabû-mušēzib//Iddin-Papsukkal
Bibliography: reedition: Joannès 1989, 170; San Nicolò, BR 8/7 (1951), no. 18 (transliteration, translation).

The (service of the) agricultural supervisor (gugallu) is not yet paid (eṭēru Stat.). Witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA1 = fBēlilītu/Nabû-iddin//(Ea-)ilūtu-bāni; fA2 = fAmat-Sutīti/Iddin-Nabû; A3 = fBasia/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Ilia; B = name lost; Scribe = Mušēzib/Ṣillāya//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili
Title: BM 94506
