A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Rēmūtu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni; C = Nabû-iddin
Title: BM 42415

Paraphrase:
Division of prebendary land (very fragmentary): The text concerns palm grove (gišimmare zaqpu) connected to the rab-banê-prebend on king’s land around Sippar. The land or the income is being divided among A, B, C, D and E. 6 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš.
 
A = Nabû-uṣur/...; B = Arad-Bunene/broken names; C = Iqīša-Marduk; D = ...-iddin; E = Iqīšāya
Title: BM 42371

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley: B owes A 40 kor (7200 l) of barley. He is to pay in Šabāṭ (XI) in Sippar. 5 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ibni//Gahal.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-sattukki; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42349

Paraphrase:
Lease of land: fA rents to B the field of her son C in Til-gubbi for a yearly rent of 45 kor (8100 l) of dates, 40 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu), 40 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), and 40 date baskets (gipû). He is to guard, irrigate, cultivate and pay the gardener. fA pays for the works on the dam and dyke [of ...], the payment of the supervisor of the canal, the tithe and the impost of the priest (šangû) of Sippar. [From the ...] of the 14th [year] this land is at B’s disposal, for 8 years. 6 witnesses and the scribe: Šamaš-iddin/Lâbâši//Nannûtu.
 
fA = fInbāya/Nabû-šumu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; C = Nidintu-Marduk/Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Ileˀˀi-Marduk, son of fA
Title: BM 42301

Paraphrase: Fragmentary promissory note for silver. Uncertain whether to be attributable to Šangû-Šamaš A.
Title: BM 43618

Paraphrase: Fragment, perhaps concerning the sale of a prebend
Title: BM 43253

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates (imittu) (damaged): B owes A [x amount of dates]. He is to pay the entire amount of dates at the storage room (haṣāru) in the mašīhu-measure of 1 pānu. Per each kor of dates he is to pay 1 palm-leaf basket (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date-palm fibres (mangagu), a load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu), 3 qappatu-baskets, 2 containers of pressed dates (darīku). Per 100 (kor of dates = c. 18000 l), (he is to pay) 2 ½ shekels (of silver) instead of the fodder made of unripened dates (hābu uhinnu). Witnesses and scribe lost.
 
A = broken name/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Bānītu-ibni/Šadûnu
Title: BM 42558

Paraphrase:
Administrative fragment: A is mentioned in connection with B, the supervisor of [...]. The exact content of this text cannot be ascertained.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni; B = Šumu-iddin
Title: BM 42618

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for wine: B owes A 3 sūtu of good wine from Sūhu. He is to pay in Kislīm (IX). 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Nergal-ina-tēšî-ēṭir.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Mušēzib-Marduk/Niqūdu//Ša-nāšišu
Title: VAt 193

Paraphrase:
Prebendary contract: B owes A 8 days of the brewer’s prebend in the Ebabbar, the temple of Šamaš. C vouches for the performance. The service comprises 2 days in [month x], 2 days in Simān (III), 1 day [in month x, 1 day in month y]. 6 more days are further defined in broken context. A promissory note that might come up in A’s house is to be invalidated. For the barley of C’s performance, B is to give C the brewed beer. A clause concerning failing to perform on pain of 12 shekels of white silver against B follows. 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Aplāya//Šangû-Akkad.
 
A = Šāpik-zēri/Mušēzib-Marduk//Šangû-Ea; B = Iddin-Nabû/Bēl-idddin; C = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42405+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B1 and B2 owe A, slave of C, 8 kor of dates. They are to pay it in Arahsamna (VIII) in Sippar in A’s house according to the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu. They bear responsibility for each other. Whoever is available is to pay. They swear before Bēl and Darius for the payment. D vouches for the payment.  At least 3 witnesses, and the scribe: (broken name/Bēl-...).
 
A = Ahušunu, slave of C; B1 = Lâbâši/Nabû-nāṣir//Nannûtu; B2 = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; C = ...-šarru-uṣur, royal officer; D = Ahhēšāya/Itti-Bēl-immir//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 43545+

Paraphrase:
Gift: B gifts fA f[C1], fC2 and fC3, 3 of his slaves, with a sealed document. They are given in lieu of [x] minas of silver, the dowry of fA, and 1/3 mina of silver from fA’s dowry casket (quppu), which B had used with fA’s approval (ana ṣibûti). 3 qa (3 l)of beer, cuts (pirānu) of meat, makkasu-meat and trimmings from B’s prebend in the Ebabbar before Šamaš are fA’s security for 10 minas of white silver, that B had bequeathed her. Whoever pays fA 10 minas of silver can buy the prebend. A clause stating fA’s right of disposal of the silver and the 3 slaves ends the operative section. 14 witnesses and the scribe: Šūzubu/Zababa-ahu-iddin//Ileˀˀi-Marduk.
 
fA = fĒṭirtu/Aplāya//Balīhû, wife of B ; B = Bēl-uballiṭ/Bēl-mušebši//Balāṭu; fC1 = broken name; fC2 = fItti-Šamaš-lubnu; fC2 = fBēltāya
Title: BM 42348

Paraphrase:
Court protocol concerning prebends: A1 sues B concerning the baker’s prebend in the Ebabbar respectively on the 23rd, 24th, 29th and 30th Nisan (I), Ayyār (II) and Simān (III), the 23rd, 24th and 29th Dûzu (IV), the 29th and 30th Abu (V), Ulūl (VI) and Tašrīt (VII), the 29th and half a day on the 30th Arahsamna (VIII), the 27th and 28th of Kislīm (IX), Ṭebēt (X) and Šabāṭ (XI), and the 27th and half a day on the 28th Addar (XII) He brings suit also with regards to 2 ½ days red baskets (sellu) of the 10th, 11th and half a day on the 12th Nisan (I), 1 ½ day of the 4th? and the morning of the 15th  and [...] of Ayyār (II): prebends before Šamaš, Aya, and Ištar. A1 claims it to have belonged to C, whose inheritance the father of A1 and A2 took. B produces evidence of the purchase from A1 and A2 before the city elders. He wins the dispute, but mercifully pays A1 an additional mina and 5 shekels of white silver. The prebends thus belong to B. 10 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-uballiṭ/Līširu//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili).
 
A1 = Šamaš-ahhē-lurši/Šamaš-kāṣir//Isinnāya; A2 = Nabû-uṣuršu/Šamāš-kāṣir//Isinnāya, brother of A1; B = Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; C = Nidintu/Nabû-uṣuršu//Isinnāya, son of A2
Title: BM 42299

Paraphrase: Fragment concerning the baker's prebend. Uncertain whether to be attributable to Šangû-Šamaš A.
Title: BM 43613

Paraphrase: Fragment
Title: BM 43236
BM 42560

Paraphrase:
Lease of a field: A partly subleases a field located in Bīr-ili for cultivation to B. He had also previously sublet this land, which belongs to D, from C. B is to pay the necessary materials and barley for seeds himself. They equally share the grown products. A third share remains in their communal possession. B vouches for the growth of [the date-palms] and the guarding of the field. Witnesses and scribe lost.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Aplāya/Kalbāya; C = Bēl-ittannu/Ṭābia; D = Lâbâši
Title: BM 43554+
VAT 533

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: A receives from B 13 shekels of stamped silver of 1/8 alloy: this is part of a larger debt (u’iltu) amounting to 1 5/6 mina of silver, which B owes him. Another unspecified amount of silver must have been already delivered, as indicated by a clause which exludes an earlier receipt. Each party hast taken a copy. 2 witnesses and the scribe (= A).
 
A = Rēmūt-Gula/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-parakki; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42441

Paraphrase:
Lease of prebendary duties: A leases to B for 1 year the income of the diviner’s prebend and the sheep inspections, the regular offering (sattukku), guqqû-offering of the new year’s festival and the monthly kiskirru service of Sîn of the Bīt-redûti, including vegetables, date baskets (gipû) and the ordinary worshippers’ (kāribu) offering of sheep. The rent amounts to 5 shekels of white silver. fC receives ½ shekels from B. 6 witnesses and the scribe (= A).
 
A = Nidintu-Marduk/Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; B = Bēl-upahhir/Nādinu//Bāˀiru; fC = fInbāya, mother of A
Title: BM 42408

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B1 and B2 owe A, slave of C, 8 kor of dates. They are to pay it in Arahsamna (VIII) in Sippar in A’s house according to the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu. They bear responsibility for each other. Whoever is available is to pay. They swear before Bēl and Darius for the payment. D vouches for the payment.  At least 3 witnesses, and the scribe: (broken name/Bēl-...).
 
A = Ahušunu, slave of C; B1 = Lâbâši/Nabû-nāṣir//Nannûtu; B2 = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; C = ...-šarru-uṣur, royal officer; D = Ahhēšāya/Itti-Bēl-immir//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42369+

Paraphrase:
Receipt of dates: A1, A2, A3, A4, and A5 receive 10 kor (1800 l) of dates of Cambyses [xth] regnal year from B. The dates are owed for the donkeys of the corvée duty (kanšu) of the temple enterers of Šamaš. 1 witness and the scribe: Šamaš-nāṣir//Šangû-Šamaš.
 
A1 = Šamaš-[iddin]/Bēl-aplu-iddin//Šangû-[...]; A2 = Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-[Marduk]//Šangû-Šamaš; A3 = Šamaš-šumu-līšir/nabû-šumu-iddin//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; A4 = Nabû-kāṣir/Šāpik-zēri//Šangû-Sippar; A5 = Bēl-iddin/Murānu//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Etellu/Itti-Bēl-lummir//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42347

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley: B owes A 32;2.3 kor (5850 l) of barley. He is to pay in SimānuSimān (III) at the quay of Sippar. At least 1 witness and the scribe: (Bēl-iqīša/Gimil-[...]//Maštuku).
 
A = Rēmūt-Gula/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Šangû-parakki; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: 1881-7-1, F 231

Paraphrase: Fragment mentioning Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk
Title: BM 43601

Paraphrase: Fragment
Title: BM 43233

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver (damaged): B1 and B2 owe A 2 minas of white cut unstamped silver of 1/8 alloy, [x]100s+30 kor of dates and 5 kor of barley. The silver debt bears a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20%). The clause concerning the delivery dates of the commodities is broken. 3 kor (c. 540 l) of planted land in Tīl-gubbi, next to those of C1 and C2, measured from the Euphrates shore, are A’s security. Broken clauses concerning the harvest from this land follow. B1 and B2 vouch for one another. 10 witnesses and the scribe: Nidintu/Līšir//Išparu.
 
A = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir/Zēria//Šangû-Šamaš; B1 = Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B2 = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš (brother of B1); C1 = ...-Marduk/Kalbāya; C2 = Bēl-upāqu/Gūzānu
Title: BM 42561+
BM 43690+
VAT 4

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver (damaged): A is owed 1 mina of white cut silver by an unknown party. The debtor’s prebendary 10 days before Šamaš are antichretically pledged as A’s security. At least 3 witnesses, including Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; scribe lost.
 
A = Bunene-ibni/broken name
Title: BM 42484

Paraphrase:
Settlement: Monthly settlements of barley are listed: From Abu (V) of the 20th year till Arahsamna (VIII) of the 20th year: monthly 1 kor of barley from the storage room (kalakku); from Kislīm (IX) of the 20th year till Ayyār (II) of the 21st year: monthly 2 kor (360 l) barley; from Simān (III) of the 21st year till the end of [... remainder of obv. lost]. 9 kor (1620 l) of barley are at A’s disposal. 4 times offerings of emmer per month from Abu of the 20th year till the 22nd year are at the disposal of A. He paid the required amount for its regular offering (sattukku) . [6] months in the 19th year in which B performed the service are excluded, together with and barley, the rest of the regular offerings, dates of the prebendary income and emmer that have not been received by A. Rest broken off.
 
A = Šumu-iddin; B = Bēl-rēmanni
Title: BM 42402

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: A receives from B1 and B2 2 ½ minas of white cut unstamped (?) (la ginnu) silver of 1/8 alloy. This is a partial payment for a promissory note (u’iltu) for 7 ½ minas, that includes both the capital sum and its interest. Each party has taken a copy of the document. 4 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ēṭir/...-Nabû//Rab-....
 
A = Šamšāya/Ninazu-šarru-uṣur; B1 =Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B2 = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš, brother of B1
Title: BM 42368+

Paraphrase:
Purchase of prebend (copy of damaged original): B sells to A his butcher’s prebend for the 8th and 28th day of every month, for 5 minas of white cut silver in pieces (šibirtu) of 1/8 alloy. The income of the prebend comprises beef, mutton, bird and lamb of the regular offerings of the days of the [...] of the gate, of the šešannu-feasts, and the sacrificial sheep of the king and of the ordinary worshippers (kāribu). [Rest of obv. already lost in antiquity] 9 witnesses and the scribe: Uballissu-Marduk/Nergal-zēru-ibni//Šangû-Šamaš.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Nabû-kāṣir/Šāpik-zēri//Šangû-Sippar
Title: BM 42343+

Paraphrase: Fragment
Title: BM 43574

Paraphrase: Fragment
Title: BM 43203
BM 42563

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: A receives from B 20 shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy: this payment was due as established in the promissory note (uˀiltu) of C, charged against D (B’s brother). 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ēṭir/Bēl-uballiṭ//Amīl-Ea.
 
A = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ša-nāšišu; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; C = Balāṭu/Mitrāya; D = Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš, brother of B
Title: VAT 538

Paraphrase:
Receipt for asnû-dates: A, messenger of C1, receives 5 kor of dilmun-dates from the sealand, out of the 6 kor that corresponds to the regular offering (sattukku) of Šamaš of Sippar, which the one responsible for dilmun-dates of Bēl in Babylon gives to Šamaš every year. He receives it from B1, the boatman (mallahu), and B2, messenger of C2. 2 witnesses and the scribe: Šumu-iddin/Nabû-tabni-uṣur//Sîn-karābī-šime. Addendum: Each party hast taken a copy.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš, messenger of C1; B1 = Ah-ilia, seaman of the sealand; B2 = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ, messenger of C2; C1 = Bēl-uballiṭ, šangû of Sippar; C2 = Iqīšāya, the one responsible for dilmun-dates
Title: BM 42446+

Paraphrase:
Receipt for dates: A receives from B 1 kor (180 l) of dates – the yield of the orchard of C. 2 witnesses and the scribe: Balāṭu/Išparu.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Ahhē-līšir/Haddāya C = Nabû-bullissu/Šamaš-iddin//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili
Title: BM 42400

Paraphrase:
Prebendary work contract: B leases to A the 19th and 20th Ulūl (VI) and the 29th and 30th Arahsamna (VIII) of fC’s brewer’s prebend before Šamaš in the Ebabbar, for the carrying out of the service (ana ēpišānūti). A vouches for the continuation of the service, the delivery and quality of the beer. A is to receive 2 kor of barley daily for the regular offering (sattukku) and B receives the rest. 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bē-nāṣir/Nabû-ikṣur//Rēˀi-sīsê.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Nergal-ēṭir/Taqīš-Gula//Šangû-Šamaš; fC = Tūrinnītu/...-uballiṭ//Šumu-libši
Title: BM 42365

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a house: A buys a plot of land in Sippar from B1, B2, B3, B4, B5 for 1 shekel of white silver per cubit (= 7 minas 37 shekels of block silver), and an additional payment of 10 shekels. It measures 150 cubits on the upper side to the north, next to the thoroughfare (mūtaqu) of the [standard?] of the queen of Sippar; 150 cubits on the lower side to the south, next to the houses in ruins of C1; 150 cubits on the upper front to the west, next to the street at the city wall; 150 cubits on the lower front to the east, next to the house in ruins of the sartennu C2 and the house of C3. In total, the land measures 456;0.6 sq. r ( 5596,5 m2). The document closes with the usual final clauses regarding the reception of the money, exclusion of further litigation on behalf of the seller’s party on pain of paying the price 12 times over. 7 witnesses, including 4 temple enterers (ērib bīti) of Šamaš (Zēr-Bābili/Ina/tēšî-ēṭir//Ēdu-ēṭir; Mukkēˀa/Arad-Bēl//Šangû-Šamaš; Šamaš-aplu-uṣur//Ilēˀi-Marduk; Niqūdu//Balāṭu), and the scribe: Balāṭu/Bēl-rēmanni//Sîn-ilī.
 
A = Mušebši-Marduk/Bēl-nādin-apli//Šangû-Šamaš(here Marduk); B1 = Bēl-iddin/Rēmūt-Bēl//Isinnāya; B2 = broken name/Rēmūt-Bēl//Isinnāya; B3 = Iddin-Nabû/Rēmūt-Bēl//Isinnāya; B4 = Bēl-kāṣir/Rēmūt-Bēl//Isinnāya; B5 = Bēl-ēriba/Rēmūt-Bēl//Isinnāya; C1 = Kinnāya//Isinnāya; C2 = Mušēzib-Marduk, sartennu; C3 = Zanziri/Bēl-kāṣir//Šangû-Gula
Title: BM 42340

Paraphrase: Fragment
Title: BM 43511

Paraphrase: Fragment: Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš is mentioned in unclear context together with Ileˀˀi-Marduk and Nabû-mukīn-apli.
Title: BM 43152

Paraphrase: Fragment about prebendary service: The text concerns 3 days of the brewer’s prebend in Tašrīt before Šamaš in the Ebabbar. At least 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-uballiṭ/broken name//Gahal.
Title: BM 42564
BM 43727+

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley: A receives from B 40 kor (7200 l) of barley, payment for C’s debt charged against B. Each party has taken a copy of the document. 3 witnesses and the scribe: Iddin-Nabû/Nergal-ēṭir//Ša-nāšišu.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; C = Bēl-uballiṭ/Iqīšāya//Ṣāhit-ginê, father of A
Title: VAT 47

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B1 and B2 owe A [x+1;1 kor of] dates. The clause concerning the date for the payment is broken. They are also to pay the costs for transport to A’s house. One vouches for the other; whoever is available is to pay. 5 witnesses; scribe lost.
 
A = broken name/broken name//Ea-ibni; B1 = Lâbâši/Nabû-nāṣir//Nannûtu; B2 = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42438

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley: B owes A 4;1.2 kor (768 l) of barley. B is to pay in Arahsamna (VIII) and A is to return the promissory note to B. 4 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Anu-ušēzib//Hunzû.
 
A = Kināya/Iddināya; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42397

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley: A receives from B 28 kor of barley of the debt against B. Each party has taken a copy of the document. 4 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ibni//Gahal.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-sattukki; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42364

Paraphrase:
Receipt for dowry: B gives to A his daughter fC with dowry which comprises 2 minas of silver, the slaves, fD1 and fD2, and household utensils (udê bīti). A receives the silver and the slaves. 4 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-uballiṭ/Nabû-šumu-līšir//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Mušēzib-Marduk/Nabû-nipšari//Balīhû; fC = fAya-hīpat/Mušēzib-Marduk//Balīhû; fD1 = fTerrīnītu; fD2 = fIna-Esagil-pinīnni
Title: BM 42336+

Paraphrase: Fragment
Title: BM 43510

Paraphrase: Fragment: The position of a field seems to be described.
Title: BM 43099

Paraphrase:
Receipt for dates: A receives 6 kor of dates, impost, property (makkūru) of the god Šamaš, for the 36th year at the behest of C. The dates are D’s responsibility, and they are at B’s disposal. At least 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš.
 
A = Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Ribâta/Šamaš-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; C = Ina-tēšî-ēṭir/broken name; D = Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu, the canal inspector
Title: BM 42567

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: A receives from fB 20 shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy, the main part of C’s pasaˀdu-obligation of the 9th year for service in Elam. Each party has taken a copy of the document. 3 witnesses and the scribe: Uballissu-Marduk/Nergal-zēru-ibni//Šangû-Šamaš.
 
A = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Balāṭu, supervisor of C’s bow service; fB = fInbāya/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; C = Nidintu-Marduk/Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Ileˀˀi-Marduk, son of fB
Title: VAT 529

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B owes A1 and fA2 4 kor (c. 720 l) of dates. He is to pay the entire amount in Arahsamna (VIII) in Sippar. 2 witnesses and the scribe: Iddin-Nabû/Marduk-nāṣir//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili.
 
A1 = Šamaš-iddin/Itti-Nabû-gūzu; fA2 = Nūbtāya, A1’s mother; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42436

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for a reed hut: A undertakes to give to B1 and B2 at the end of Ayyār (II) the reed hut that he built at the exit (mūṣû) of B1’s and B2’s land. 3 witnesses and the scribe: Balāṭu/Bēl-rēmanni//Sîn-ilī.
 
A = Šamaš-iddin/...-anni; B1 = Mušebši-Marduk/Bēl-nādin-apli//Šangû-Šamaš; B2 = Taqīš-Gula/Bēl-nādin-apli//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42396

Paraphrase:
Prebendary work contract: B leases to A the 23rd and 26th Šabāṭ (XI) of his brewer’s prebend in the Ebabbar in Sippar for 1 kor of barley, for the carrying out of the service (ana ēpišānūti). A is to receive [x barley] for the regular offering (sattukku) and B will get the barley and dates of the prebendary income (pappasu). A vouches for the continuation of the service and the quality of the beer. Each party has taken a copy of the document. 2 witnesses and the scribe: Iddināya/broken name.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Šamaš-erība/Bēl-iqīša//Isinnāya
Title: BM 42363

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B1 and B2 owe A 130 kor (23400 l) of dates, impost (imittu) of a field in Til-gubbi. They are to pay it all in Arahsamna (VIII) in the mašīhu-measure of 0;1 kor (c. 36 l), in addition to palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû) and loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu). 4 witnesses and the scribe (= B1).
 
A = Nidintu-Marduk/Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; B1 = Nidintu/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Dēkû; B2 = Nabû-rēˀûšunu/Nergal-aplu-iddin
Title: BM 42335

Paraphrase: Fragment
Title: BM 43505
BM 42568

Paraphrase:
Letter order: A1 and A2, two scribes, write to B1, B2, and B3, the supervisors of the bow-service of Šamaš. They are to give C 3;2.3 kor (630 l) of barley for the regular offering (sattukku) of the baker’s prebend [of the Adad-temple] in Šabāṭ (XI) of the 33rd year as well as 2;3 kor of barley, the prebendary income until the end of Addar (XII) of the same year.
 
A1 = Uballissu-Gula, scribe; A2 = Marduk-mukīn-apli, scribe; B1 = Gimil-Šamaš; B2 = Bēlšunu; B3 = Biruqā; C = Bēl-rēmanni
Title: BM 42646+
BM 66212

Paraphrase:
Administrative text: A1 receives 3 shekels of silver for a tunic (širām), 1 shekel for wax and 1 shekel from B; A2 receives 2 shekels from the same man. The text notes 6 ½ shekels of silver in total. No witnesses, no scribe.
 
A1 = Šamaš-nāṣir; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ; B = Aya-hīpat
Title: VAT 196

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 22 shekels of stamped silver and the amount of billetu-beer for 1 day of the brewer’s prebendin the Ebabbar. The debt bears an interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20%). He is to deliver 25 barrels of beer on the 3rd Ṭebēt (X) to A. B vouches for the performance and quality of the beer. 4 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-rēmanni//Šangû-Šamaš. Addendum: He is to pay the interests from the 1st (of Ṭebēt?).
 
A = Šāpik-zēri/Mušēzib-Marduk//Amīl-Ea; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: VAT 540

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: 3 shekels of silver of A are at B’s disposal. B is to register this sum under C’s name and give (a receipt) to A. 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-uballissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê.
 
A = Šamaš-naṣir/Mušebši-Marduk; B = Nidintu-Marduk/Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; C = Ubāru/Bēl-iqīša
Title: BM 42395

Paraphrase:
Work contract on land: A rents out to B1 and B2 land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) that belongs to C, who  pledged it as security to A, for digging work (ana herūtu). B1 and B2 are to dig up what remains, up to 1 kor of land. A clause concerning failure of completion of the task on pain of paying 6 kor of dates follows. They receive their wage in dates (sissinnu) from A. A clause excluding two spades and the promissory note for dates charged against B1 and B2 ends the operative section. 4 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ušallim/Šulāya//Nappāhu. Addendum: He will charge [x] kor of dates per kor of land.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B1 = Habaṣīru/Sîn-ahu-iddin//Erībāya; B2 = Bēl-iddin/Lābāsi; C = Nidintu-Marduk/Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Ileˀˀi-Marduk
= Šamaš-nāṣir; A2 = Bēl-uballiṭ; B = Aya-hīpat
Title: BM 42362+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates and silver: B owes A 60 kor (10800 l) of dates and 55 shekels of unstamped silver. He is to pay in yearly instalments of 20 kor (3600 l) of dates; thus paying it off within 3 years. He is to pay it in Sippar. The silver is to be paid in Ayyār (II). 2 witnesses and the scribe (= B).
 
A = Rēmūtu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: MMA 809

Paraphrase: Fragment of receipt
Title: BM 43491
BM 42572
VAT 205

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 22 shekels of stamped silver and the amount of billetu-beer for 1 day of the brewer’s prebendin the Ebabbar. The debt bears an interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20%). He is to deliver 25 barrels of beer on the 3rd Ṭebēt (X) to A. B vouches for the performance and quality of the beer. 4 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-rēmanni//Šangû-Šamaš. Addendum: He is to pay the interests from the 1st (of Ṭebēt?).
 
A = Šāpik-zēri/Mušēzib-Marduk//Amīl-Ea; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42609+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B owes A 12+ kor (2160+ l) of dates. He is to pay in Arahsamna (VIII) at the storage place (haṣāru) in Til-gubbi, according to the measure (mašīhu) of 1 pānu. C vouches for the payment. 3 witnesses and the scribe: Uballissu-Marduk/Nergal-zēru-ibni//Šangû-Šamaš.
 
A = Šamaš-ēṭir/Nabû-nāṣir//Basia; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; C = Rēmūt-ilī/Silim-Bēl
Title: BM 42390

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates and barley: B owes A 41 kor of dates and 21 kor of barley. He is to pay the dates in Tašrīt (VII) and the barley in Ayyār (II). These goods have been recorded in previous promissory notes (uˀiltu) belonging to A. 4 witnesses, including the scribe’s brother (Bulluṭūˀa/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš) and the scribe (Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš).
 
A = Rēmūtu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42360+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates and silver: B owes A 60 kor (10800 l) of dates and 55 shekels of unstamped silver. He is to pay in yearly instalments of 20 kor (3600 l) of dates; thus paying it off within 3 years. He is to pay it in Sippar. The silver is to be paid in Ayyār (II). 2 witnesses and the scribe (= B).
 
A = Rēmūtu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42334

Paraphrase: Fragmentary promissory note for barley?
Title: BM 43490

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (broken): An unknown commodity is owed. The debt is to be paid in Arahsamna (VIII). 1 witness, and the scribe (Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šāpik-zēri//Šangû-Sippar)
 
(The tablet appears to be a student‘s copy.)
Title: BM 42442

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates (damaged): B1 and B2 owe A 63 kor (11340 l) of dates. They are to pay in Arahsamna (VIII), including the costs of transport to the storage house in Sippar. The purpose for which the dates were given was mentioned in a broken context, where also the name of a female slave appears. C vouches against another unknown party. Remainder of operative section missing. At least 8 witnesses and the scribe: Nidintu/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti.
 
A = Nabû-ikṣur/Iqīšāya//Rēˀi-sisê; B1 = Bazuzu/Ea-kāṣir//Babūtu; B2 = Erībāya/Nabû-uballiṭ//Šangû-Šamaš C = Bēl-rēmanni
Title: BM 42574+

Paraphrase:
Lease of a field: C had leased part of D’s field in Bīr-ili to B, for cultivation. In this document, B gives part of this leased land to A for cultivation. He is to hoe and cultivate it in Tašrīt. A is to pay the barley for seeds and the workload himself. The lessee also vouches for irrigation and guarding of the field. B is to receive half of everything grown – that is the share of the field owner – from A. 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl?-.../Nabû-ittannu//broken name.
 
A = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Arrabi; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; C = Bēl-ittannu/Ṭābia; D = Lâbâši
Title: BM 42547+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 22 shekels of stamped silver and the amount of billetu-beer for 1 day of the brewer’s prebendin the Ebabbar. The debt bears an interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20%). He is to deliver 25 barrels of beer on the 3rd Ṭebēt (X) to A. B vouches for the performance and quality of the beer. 4 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-rēmanni//Šangû-Šamaš. Addendum: He is to pay the interests from the 1st (of Ṭebēt?).
 
A = Šāpik-zēri/Mušēzib-Marduk//Amīl-Ea; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42434

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B1 and fB2 owe A 33 ½ shekels of stamped silver for trading (ša nadāni u mahāri). They are to pay this sum in Ayyār (II) plus interest. Standard clauses excluding earlier promissory notes, stating the responsibility of one for the other and the obligation of payment of whoever is available follow. 6 witnesses and the scribe: Ea-udammiq/Iqīša-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš.
 
A = Guzānu/nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ša-nāšišu; B1 = Nidintu-Marduk/Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; fB2 = Inbāya, mother of B1
Title: BM 42389

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: A receives from B 15 shekels of white silver, according to his promissory note (uˀiltu). A clause excluding an earlier receipt for 25 shekels of white silver follows. 3 witnesses, including Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš, and the scribe: Nabû-ittannu/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi.
 
A = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Šamaš-ahu-iddin; B = Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš.
Title: BM 42357

Paraphrase:
Rent of a field: A rents B a field for 4 years.This land lies below another field located in Til-gubbi in the district of Sippar, which A has leased to B for cultivation. B is to pay A 1 kor (180 l) of barley per kor (13500 m²) of field. They have not settled their accounts (epuš nikkassi qatû) with regards to the dates, A’s impost, and the silver for the bow service: these correspond to a promissory notes charged against A. 5 witnesses, including 1 ina-ašābi-witness, A’s mother (Inbāya), and the scribe: Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Balīhû.
 
A = Nidintu-Marduk/Šamaš-šumu-līšir; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42332+

Paraphrase: Fragmentary promissory note concerning dates.
Title: BM 43810

Paraphrase: Fragment of promissory note with a prebend as security
Title: BM 43466

Paraphrase:
​Receipt for silver: A receives from B [x amount] of white silver, B’s ilku-obligation, on behalf of C. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Iddin-Marduk/Nabû-nāṣir//Dābibī).
 
A = Rēmūt-Šamaš; B = Hahhūru; C = Nidintu-Marduk//Sūqāya
Title: BM 42577

Paraphrase:
Receipt? (fragment): A and B are mentioned in connection with the receiving? of a debt (ina rašutu).
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni; B = Bēl-uballiṭ
Title: BM 43104

Paraphrase:
Date settlements concerning the weir: Several amounts of dates are listed from the 16th to the 21st year on account of A. He will deliver every year 6 kor of dates for the weir, 1;1 kor (216 l) for the canal supervisor and 4;2.3 kor (810 l) for the tithe. 2 kor (c. 360 l) of dates instead of nubazu-dates for the 15th year are assigned to B. No witnesses, no scribe.
 
A = Nidintu-Marduk; B = Basia
Title: BM 42541

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B owes A 3 kor (540 l) of dates. He is to pay in Arahsamna (VIII) in Tīl-gubbi. 5 witnesses and the scribe (Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Balīhû).
 
A = Šullumāya/Nergal-ēṭir//Ša-nāšišu; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42433

Paraphrase:
Administrative text/note (very fragmentary): A, B, C, D [remainder of obv. lost], and E, in total 10 men for 1 bow service (qaštu) of F.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni; B = Šamaš-šumu-iddin, weaver (išparu); C = Bēl-uṣur/Nabû-ikṣur; D = Eribāya/Muš[ebši-Marduk]; E = Bulluṭūa/Rēmūt-[ilī]; F = Bēl-rēmanni (= A?)
Title: BM 42384

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley: On Abu, the [xth], B is to bring and hand over to (našāmu-nadānu) A the promissory note (uˀiltu) that his father, C, issued against him for 40 kor (1800 l) of barley. B receives the barley from A. The debtor shows to B previous receipt documents related to barley that B already received from A. 6 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ahu-ittannu/broken name//Iššakku).
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Bēl-bullissu/Marduk-rēmanni//Ṣāhit-ginê; C = Marduk-rēmanni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Ṣāhit-ginê, father of B
Title: BM 42356+
Join: BM 43115, BM 43251, BM 43497, BM 43562, BM 43626, BM 43697, unnumbered fragment

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A ½ minas of white cut unstamped silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20%). At least 3 witnesses and the scribe: Tattannu/Marduk-nāṣir.
 
A = Balāṭu/Mušēzib-Marduk//Išparu; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42331

Paraphrase: Fragment concerning 14 kor (2520 l) of dates
Title: BM 43794

Paraphrase:
Dowry receipt: fA receives from B an unknown amount of the silver of her dowry, from a promissory note (u’iltu) written in C’s name. A clause excluding 6 ¼ shekels of silver recorded in a previous promissory note follows. 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Arad-Gula//Maštuku.
 
fA = fAnunnītu-ēṭirat/Mušebši-Marduk; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš (brother of fA); C = Arad-Gula/Kidin-Marduk//Maštuk
Title: BM 43433+
BM 42345+

Paraphrase:
Record of a witness: A is a witness to the contract concerning B’s receiving of days of the baker’s prebend in the Ebabbar from C1 and C2. The prebendary service is at B’s disposal from 1st Šabātu. 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ittannu/Nabû-šumu-līšir//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili.
 
A = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Balāṭu//Isinnāya; B = Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; C1 = Nabû-uṣuršu/Šamaš-kāṣir//Isinnāya; C2 = Šamaš-ahhē-luršu/Šamaš-kāṣir//Isinnāya, brother of C1
Title: BM 42578

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for barley and wheat: B owes fA 1;2.3 kor (270 l) of barley and 0;2.2 kor (84 l) of wheat. He is to pay in Ulūl (VI). A final clause excludes an earlier promissory note issued for his work assignment (iškaru).
 
fA = Aya-hīpat/Mušēzib-Marduk//Balīhû; B = Nidintu-Marduk/Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Ileˀˀi-Marduk
Title: BM 42540

Paraphrase:
Administrative text: A performs the bow service for B. 1 bow is at A’s disposal.
 
A = Šamaš-nāṣir/Mušebši-Marduk; B = Nidintu-Marduk/Sūqāya//Ṣāhit-ginê
Title: BM 42432

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes [A1] and A2 1 ½ [minas of silver], for which B’s brewer’s prebend before [Šamaš] in Abu, 12 ½ days of service in the Ebabbar in Sippar, is recorded as a security. B cannot take advantage of any income deriving from this prebend, nor can A1 and A2 claim interests on it. No-one can take over this debt, until the two creditors will be paid in full. A clause excluding 20 barrels of beer of A1 that are at B’s disposal ends the operative section. 5 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-etel-ilāni/Itti-Bēl-lummir//Šangû-Šamaš).
 
A1 = Nabû-ahhē-ušallim/Mušēzib-Marduk//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; A2 = Šamaš-kāṣir/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Isinnāya; B = Šamaš-šumu-līšir/Bēl-kēšir//Ileˀˀi-Marduk
Title: BM 42354

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 25 shekels of white cut unstamped silver of 1/8 alloy. He is to pay in Simān (III). C vouches for the payment. At least 4 witnesses and the scribe: Itti-Šamaš-balāṭu/Šūzubu//Ileˀˀi-Marduk.
 
A = broken name/Mušēzib-Marduk//broken name; B = Nidintu-Marduk/Šamaš-šumu-līšir/Ileˀˀi-Marduk; C = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42330

Paraphrase: Fragment concerning the brewer's prebend
Title: BM 43729

Paraphrase: Fragment mentioning bow-service (qīštu) and silver.
Title: BM 43429

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver: A receives from B the silver of B’s bow service for half a year’s obligation. Each party has taken a copy of the document. 7 witnesses and the scribe: Šamaš-ēṭir/Bēl-uballiṭ.
 
A = Kāṣiru/Kīnāya//Isinnāya; B = Nabû-ahhē-šullim/Mušēzib-Marduk//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili
Title: BM 42548
BM 42591+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note (fragment):  A is mentioned in connection with a silver? debt.
 
A = Nidintu
Title: BM 43128

Paraphrase:
Lease of prebend: A is to perform the service of the brewer’s prebend in the Ebabbar on [day x] in Ṭebēt of the 6th year and give (the brewed beer) to B. A vouches for the quality of the (regular) beer and the billetu-beer. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Nergal-iddin/Nergal-ušallim).
 
A = Iddināya/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Agru; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42525

Paraphrase:
Purchase of prebend: B sells to A various cuts of beef and mutton, the income of the prebend before Bunene for the whole year including the ‘greeting-of-the-temple’ feast for ½ mina and 5 shekels of silver. B receives the silver from A. 4 witnesses and the scribe: Lâbâši/Nabû-nāṣir//Nannûtu.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Rabâšu-ša-Ninurta
Title: BM 42425+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B owes 86 kor (15480 l) of dates to A: such amounts correspond to the rations for the gardu-worker, mages and personell of the bīt harê. He is to pay on the 10th Abu (V) of the 26th year. He swears before Bēl and Darius for the payment. 4 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-uballiṭ/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Itinnu.
 
A = Bēl-ēṭir/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ, alphabetic scribe; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42449

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B owes A 86 kor of dates, the rations of the female flour workers of Babylon, who are under C’s supervision. He is to pay on the 20th Abu of the 26th year in Babylon. Such amount of dates corresponds to the impost (sūtu) that must be paid by D. 7 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-iddin/Iddin-Nabû//Bāˀiru).
 
A = Bēl-ēṭir/Ina-ṣilli-šarri, an alphabetic scribe; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; C = Šumu-ukīn, overseer of the workers (rāb amīlti); D = Nergal-ina-tēšî-ēṭir
Title: MMA 86.11.180+

Paraphrase: Fragment concerning offerings of the baker's prebend
Title: BM 43673

Paraphrase: Fragment, perhaps a novation of a promissory note
Title: BM 43315

Paraphrase:
Settlement of prebendary services: A, at the behest of B, performed monthly 4 days of the baker’s prebend in the Ebabbar from Simān (III) until Tašrīt (VII) of Darius 19th year . He received in payment monthly uppuntu-flour, firewood and (the material for) the muhru-offering. He also received from B 6 kor (1080 l) of barley and 0;2.3 kor (90 l) of emmer for offerings each month. A gave B pahīdu-flour; he did not receive barley [for the regular offering (sattukku)], dates derived from the prebendary income, nor emmer. 6 witnesses and the scribe: Arad-Marduk/Bēl-upahhir//Bāˀiru.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Šumu-iddin/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Isinnāya
Title: BM 42551+

Paraphrase:
​Administrative text (receipt), fragmentary: Beginning of obverse lost. 40 kor of [...]; 30 kor (5400 l) belonging to A are mentioned. 25;2.3 kor (4590 l) [are received] at the behest of B and [...]. 8;2 kor (1512 l) and 2 kor (360 l) are also listed. C receives 105;4.3 kor (c. 19062 l) in total. A is paid. Rest broken off.
 
A = Rēhētu; B = Nabû-rēˀûšunu; C = Bēl-rēmanni
Title: BM 42594

Paraphrase:
Purchase of a prebend: A purchases from B the temple enterer’s prebend, together with half of the baker’s, brewer’s and butcher’s prebends in the Egipar, the temple of Adad and Šala, for 3 1/3 minas of silver. The temple enterer’s prebend includes šugarrû-dates, a lamb, and some other broken items; cattle, sheep, birds for the regular offerings and the royal offering and the meat remains of the sacrificial altar are listed for the other prebendary duties. Standard clauses concerning the receiving of the full price of silver and against further litigation on the part of the seller’s party and kin on pain of paying the price twelvefold end the operative section. At least 9 witnesses, scribe lost.
 
A = Zēria/Bēl-ibni//Šangû-Šamaš; B = Bēl-ahu-ušabši/...-ēṭir//Saggilāya
Title: BM 43146+

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver and dates: B owes A [x] minas of stamped silver for trading and 1;2 kor (252 l) of dates. He is to pay in Tašrīt (VII) in Til-gubbi. Should the debtor fail to pay, his field in Tīl-Bīt-malāhāni will be at A’s disposal as security. A clause denying B’s rights on any income and A’s rights on the interests follows 3 witnesses and the scribe: Kiribtu/Lâbâši.
 
A = Balāṭu/Mušēzib-Marduk//Išparu; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42523+

Paraphrase:
Lease of prebendary service: B gives to A 6 days of the brewer’s prebend in the Ebabbar in Arahsamna (VIII) and 4 days in Šabāṭ (XI), in total 10 days, for the carrying out of the duty for 3(+x) years. A vouches for the performance and the quality of the beer and for the šugarrû-dates of the šangû of Sippar. A is to give to B yearly the prebendary income, 8 kor (1440) of [dates] and 2;2.3 kor (450 l) of barley. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Nabû-nāṣir//Nannûtu). Addendum: Each party has taken a copy of the document. fC receives the 8 kor of dates and 2;2.3 kor (450 l) of barley.
 
A = Lâbâši/Nabû-nāṣir//Nannûtu; B = Nidintu-Marduk/Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; fC = fInbāya
Title: BM 42424

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B owes 86 kor (15480 l) of dates to A: such amounts correspond to the rations for the gardu-worker, mages and personell of the bīt harê. He is to pay on the 10th Abu (V) of the 26th year. He swears before Bēl and Darius for the payment. 4 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-uballiṭ/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Itinnu.
 
A = Bēl-ēṭir/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ, alphabetic scribe; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: BM 42383

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B owes A 86 kor of dates, the rations of the female flour workers of Babylon, who are under C’s supervision. He is to pay on the 10th Abu of the 26th year in Babylon. Such amount of dates corresponds to the impost (sūtu) that must be paid by D. 7 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-iddin/Iddin-Nabû//Bāˀiru).
 
A = Bēl-ēṭir/Ina-ṣilli-šarri, an alphabetic scribe; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; C = Šumu-ukīn, overseer of the workers (rāb amīlti); D = Nergal-ina-tēšî-ēṭir
Title: BM 42353

Paraphrase:
Promissory note for dates: B owes A 18 kor (3240 l) of dates. B will measure out (madādu) this amount of dates from within the palm grove (gišimmaru) in Ulūl (VI), and A will receive full payment (šalāmu). A clause excluding an earlier debt against B, and one of C for which A vouches follows. [D1 and D2 vouch for the payment of the debt. A clause excluding a debt of A against D1 and D2 follows.] B receives from A palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu) and palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) as impost. 6 witnesses and the scribe: Nidintu/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti.
 
A = Rēmūtu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš; C = Nabû-iddin; D1 = Šamaš-kāṣir/Nabû-mukīn-apli; D2 = Nabû-nāṣir/Bēl-iqīša
Title: BM 42329

Paraphrase:
Concerning the witnessing of a prospective prebend sale: In case A passes on (by sale or lease) the prebend in the shrine of Bēl-āliya-ša-Šarbānu for ½ qa of bread, ½ qa of beer, ¼ share in the harmil-joints of oxen and a share in the offerings on the meal table (paššūru) C shall be present (ašābu) as witness. This prebend belonged to C who had adopted A and to whom he bequeathed all his assets in town and country. 4 witnesses, including the brother-in-law of A (Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi), and the scribe (Idin-Nabû/Šūzubu//Kānik-bābi).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Šākin-šumi/Nadnāya//Nappāhu; C = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu
Bibliography: Baker 2004, No. 49b; BV 38; NRV 26; Peiser 1896, 296f.; Graziani 1991: 19
Title: VAT 124

Paraphrase:
Contract for performance of prebendary duties: The share of B1 of the prebend of B1 and B2 before Kāribu of the shrine of Marduk consisting of a monthly instalment of 4 large (rabbû) takkasû-cakes is at the disposal (ina muhhi) of A. Each month A will give the cakes of the rations (kurrummatu) to B1. B1 in return will give one uzāru-cloth to A. 7 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-nāṣir/Mudammiq-Nabû//Rab-banê).
 
A = Damqiya/Marduk-šumu-ibni/Isinnāya; B1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B2 = Šumu-iddin/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu (elder brother of B1);
Bibliography: Baker 2004, No. 39b; BV 70; NRV 594; van Driel 2002: 81
Title: VAT 359

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley: A receives from B 1 kor (180 l) of barley of their debt for barley. A clause excluding earlier receipts (for previous deliveries) follows. Each party has taken a copy of the document. 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-eṭēri/Hahhūru//Arad-Nergal, son of A.
 
A = Hahhūru/Rēmūt-Bēl//Arad-Nergal; B = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš
Title: VAT 28

Paraphrase:
Receipt of cuts of meat: A1 and A2 receive in payment from B the rapaštu-joints and the arkātu-joints of the rations of the weaned lambs (parāsu) from the quqqû-offerings till the end of Simānu (III) of the 28th year (of Darius). God Šamaš is listed as the only witness; the scribe is party to the transaction (A1).
 
A1 = Zumbu/Iddināya; A2 = Bēl-iddin/Damqiya; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu
Title: VAT 454

Paraphrase:
Fixation of interest and pledge of a house as securities for a silver debt.
B1 and his wife (fB2) owe 5 shekels of silver to A. The debt bears a 20% interest (1 shekel per 1 mina) to be paid on a monthly basis. The payment is (also) secured by the pledge of the debtors’ house. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Nādin/Nergal-ēṭir/Bābūtu; fB2 = fNuptaia/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê, wife of B1
Title: Mnb 1823

Paraphrase:
Receipt for interest, paid in silver.
A receives 24 shekels of silver, the interest for two years, from B. Names of 2 witnesses (introduced by ina ušuzzi).
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Balāṭu
Bibliography: reedition: Wunsch 1993, no. 174; Moldenke, CTMMA (1893), no. 19.
Title: MMA 79.7.3

Paraphrase:
Receipt for assessed revenue from land, paid in silver (instead of onions).
Concerns what remains to be paid in onions as assessed revenue (imittu) from the palace scribe’s field (ṭupšar ekalli), income (makkūru) of the Nabû temple for the 11th year of Nabonidus and booked in the accounts (ana muhhi) of D … (*)(uncl.) of the 12th year. It is registered as due from C (e’ēlu), slave of B.  A receives it (maḫāru) in silver (15 shekels) from B. The fragmentary passage that follows may refer to the settlement of the accounts (nikkassu [qatû?]) between a man whose name is broken and B after the latter gave to B or showed him his registration of the payment in the account tablet (lē’u) of the Nabû temple. He will (also) draw up (epēšu) a receipt (giṭṭu)…. [broken off]. Payment for his (= B’s?) gugallutu-impost and [.... have or have not been paid for]. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
(*) e du bad ki.
 
A = Padāya/Ezida-x; B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; C = Arad-Bēl, slave of B; D? = Arad-Bēl
Title: BM 36336

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver. Payment for a debt. Return of promissory note.
Concerns the promissory note for a debt of 2 minas of white, medium quality silver of which one-eighth is alloy, that B owes to A, a slave of D. On the creditor’s order and according to his promissory note C received (eṭēru) the indebted silver and the interest on it from B. He returned (nadānu) the pertinent promissory note from A to the debtor.
 
A = Bēl-gabbi-Nabû/Ina-ṣilli-Bēl, slave of D; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Nabû-ittannu/Iddin-Marduk//Šangû-Bēlet-Bābili; D = Nabu-tabni-uṣur
Title: BM 32880

Paraphrase:
Receipt of payment for interest on a silver debt.
A receives 4 shekels of silver, the interest on a silver debt from B. The debtor will … (i-šal-la-a’) the silver from which (the above sum) has been deducted (nasāhu). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Lūṣi-ana-nūri//Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Sîn-nāṣir
Title: BM 31506

Paraphrase:
Receipt for barley.  Impost on the harvest.
Concerns 3 kor (c. 540 l) of barley, impost (šibšu) on the harvest of a field in Bit-Sin-iddin(?) for Darius’ 21st year, that is booked with C (ina muhhi). A receives it (mahāru) on C’s behalf from B.  He will register his receipt in C’s account and show proof of it to B (ušuzzu – nadānu).
 
A = Kāṣiru/Balāṭu; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Andahar/Haṭṭaya
Title: BM 31233

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver. Payment for debts by guarantor’s wife.
Concerns the claim (rašûtu) for 2 minas of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy, owed by B1 and for the payment of which C2 took over responsibility (našû) in the 18th year. From these 2 minas, A receives (mahāru) 1/2 mina from fC1, C2’s wife, who is paying it on her husband’s behalf. As for the debt (u’iltu) of 4 1/3 minas of silver … [broken off] that was owed by B2 and which he paid off to C2 (ittenṭir [eṭēru]): A, who is C2’s uncle, receives (eṭēru) his share of it (the exact amount not being specified) from fC1, who is paying it on her husband’s behalf.
 
A = Puršu (= Nergal-ušēzib)/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi, uncle of C2; B1 = Nabû-bullissu/Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Lakubburu; B2 = Nabû-ahu-rēmanni/Nergal-ahhē-...; fC1 = fAmat-Bāba, wife of C2; C2 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 31054

Paraphrase:
Receipt for dates. Payment for a debt
Concerns the 18;2.3 kor (c. 3,330 l) of dates that C owes to A. A receives the dates from B, who pays on C’s (his brother’s) behalf.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Bēl-ēṭir//Ir’anni; B = Puršu/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi (= Nergal-ušēzib/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi), brother of C; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Title: BM 30823

Paraphrase:
Receipt for dates. Payment of the remainder of a debt.
C1 and C2 owe 1 mina of silver to A, slave of D. In the present document A receives what remains to be paid of this debt, namely 5 ¾ shekels of silver, from B, slave of D, who pays on behalf of the debtors. The creditor is paid off. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of D; B = Nabû-ayyalu, slave of D; C1 = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Zēru-uṣur; C2 = Nabû-ēreš(?)/...; D = Iddin-Marduk//Nūr-Sîn
Title: BM 30653

Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver in lieu of vessels.
A receives 3 1/3 s of silver from B in payment for 10 empty old vessels that he gave to him.
 
A = Ardāya/Nabû-kēšir//Šangû-Bēlet-Bābili; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi
Title: BM 30376

Paraphrase:
Undertaking to transmit an order to the head of the Egibi family requiring him to pay silver.
B should pay 1/3 minas and 1 shekel of white silver which he helds on contract (ina pāni) to A1 and A2 in Nisan (I). The silver is from either the debt (u'iltu) or salary (idū) that is owed to the two men. Reference to an order (šipirtu) from C which should be brought before B so that he pays the silver (našû-nadānu). Cf. BM30453 (=Dar 573). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe. C's brother (Bēl-erība) is among the witnesses.

A1=Nabû-natan/Šellibi; A2=Aḫušunu/Šamšaya; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Nergal-ēṭir (=?Nergal-ēṭir/Kalbaya//Šumu-libši)
Title: BM 31142
